Reviews.Title: “the new tropicana”
Reviews.Author: hennessy26
Reviews.Content: very nice job. would never had stayed here before the remodel. smaller casino and not as many food options as larger casino. good service. great location. NY NY and MGM Grand across the streets.

Reviews.Title: “Would return”
Reviews.Author: Curler03
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days over Spring Break in March. Overall, I liked the hotel. It felt like a quiet place to return to after the craziness that is the strip. I thought that the room was well appointed and the bed was quite comfy. What I didnt like was the $20 fee for checking in early. In my many travels around the world I have not encountered this. I also didn't like the shower/tub. This appears to be the only area in the room that has not been re- done and boy does it need it. Poor water pressure and the nozzle is sonlow down on the wall i had to bend way down just to get my hair under the water. As for restaurants, it was convenient to have a starbucks in the hotel but there wasn't much choice for casual dining. We did try to go to the beach cafe one day for lunch and they said the wait was 25 minutes to sit outside. I found this interesting as there appeared to be many open seats. We ate at Bacio one night and the food and service was excellent. However, we did find it curious that they leave the tables set with cutlery overnight as part of the restaurant is beside a main walkway in the hotel. I just have visions of people returning after a night of drinking and deciding it would be funny to lick the spoons on the way back to their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Old Style Vegas with Class”
Reviews.Author: jillpowersgolden
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas and I'm so glad we stayed at the Tropicana. It was like a breath of fresh air after the crowded, smoky, people-packed bigger venues. The room was large, nicely decorated and quiet with a great sized bathroom. Very comfy beds and pillows. Because the Tropicana is older and doesn't have all the bling of other hotels and casinos in town, it is a perfect escape from the crowds. The pool and grounds are beautiful, parking is free and the tropical smell really hooked my daughter.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Chr0me_Drag0n
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas for the NASCAR race at LVMS and booked a two week stay at the Tropicana. It seems that two weeks is a VERY long stay, as everyone was amazed were were there that long. The Tropicana is not your typical Las Vegas resort and lacks the glitz and tricks of the newer Caesar Palace, Wynn, or New York, New York, but has everything you might need. The rooms are clean and well appointed. We were amazed how quickly the room was cleaned every day. We stayed in the Club Tower, and although this made for a long walk every time we went to the "Strip", it was a nice quiet room. The Tropicana is at one end of the strip, so it is not ideally located if you want to explore the various casinos, but the location also means that you are away from the crazy crowds and annoying "girly card" flickers and beggers. The location also means that it is quieter when you want quiet. The Tropicana does not have the variety of restaurants you can find in many of the resorts, but the three they do have are good. We ate two meals in the Beach Cafe and enjoyed this little place. The other two higher end restaurants have good reviews and the steak house is reputed to be one of the best in Vegas, but we did not eat there. Staff were always friendly and helpful in all areas. The front desk always took care of any concerns, and the cleaning staff were efficient and friendly. Even the clerks in the little kiosks in the hallways always had a friendly comment as you went by.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Tropicana!”
Reviews.Author: Debra O
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Tropicana for one night this month. Would have liked to stay longer. The location was great for walking on the "strip". Parking was free in a covered garage. The grounds were impecable. We stayed in other hotels on the strip but preferred to stay at the Tropicana. The room decor was a little dated but very clean with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “All new”
Reviews.Author: wolfden
Reviews.Content: What could go wrong with a virtual new hotel. The check in was easy (no line ups), very friendly staff. I stayed in the Club Tower which is a bit of a walk but I never had to wait for an elevator. The rooms were quite nice. Not luxury but clean and new. I was in a non smoking king room that actually smelled fresh. No fridge which is a huge pain if you like cold water. There was a safe in my room which was a nice surprise. The bed and pillows were really comfortable. The bathroom was a bit of a letdown. It was clean but the shower is made for people under 5 feet and the toilet must have been a $49 special from the local hardware store. There was not many choices to eat here so we ate elsewhere. The overall service here was pretty good and I would stay again for sure. Now if they could just get rid of the smokers!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Amanda253
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this newly renovated hotel for 3 nights in March 2012. We rented two rooms in the Club Tower. Front desk staff were friendly and efficient. The rooms were tastefully remodeled. My only criticisms are that there were no mini bar fridges to keep drinks cold, and the bathtubs needed fresh caulking. The beds has very comfortable mattresses and bedding. The pillows were excellent. It was very quiet at night. There was little hallway noise or noise that transferred from the bordering rooms. The hotel had a small feel to it. It is relatively easy to get in and out. The rooms are not luxurious or glamorous, but they are pleasant and comfortable. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “march 28th 5 day stay”
Reviews.Author: l B
Reviews.Content: Things they don't tell you about online: many hotels in Las Vegas pump in scents to all of their public places. The Tropicana is no exception. The smell of sweet fake coconut permeates this hotel. I also didn't realize that smoking is allowed all over Las Vegas, including inside this hotel's public places. Coming from Canada this was a shock. Worst of all, we arrived at 11:30 pm and the hotel charges you when you book, but don't assign the rooms until you arrive. You arrive late and you get the rooms that are left, which in our case was smoking rooms only. Yech!! The alternative was to wait 'hours' for one of the three maids to clean a non-smoking room. Not a good first experience. They were accommodating about changing our room the next day which was good and the staff were very friendly and apologetic as appropriate. Rooms are recently renovated, nice and large.

Reviews.Title: “the new tropicana”
Reviews.Author: marleenkok
Reviews.Content: Our first impression was not great. We got into Las Vegas at around 9 in the morning. We walked all over town and went to the Tropicana to check in at 2.30. We were told there were rooms available, however, it would cost $20 for an early check in. That is on top of the resort fee that they charge here. I am not crazy about resort fees to begin with as they include things like Wi Fi, gym , free newspaper? and use of the pool,( which was closed for maintenance) even if you do not utilize any of these things, you still pay the resort fee. Needless to say we were appalled by the extra $20 charge for a half hour earlier check in. normal check in is at 3 promptly. period. What is next we are wondering? Extra charge for using hairdryers and towels? The rooms are very nice, decor is tropical, beds are comfortable and the sheets were heavenly . most of the people that we encountered that work in this hotel were very friendly. The whole hotel is very bright. Great job on the remodel. However, due to all the extra charges we most likely will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I read and more!!!”
Reviews.Author: debr622
Reviews.Content: I arrived the Las Vegas on March 20 and stayed at the Tropicana. Barabara at the registration desk was great and very helpful. Also no long wait to register. What you see in the pictures and what you got. Decor was very up to date. The food in the snack area was good, especially the hamburgers. Drinks were a little hard to get while playing in the casino, they need more help. The only inconvenience was valet parking was not available the last 2 days we were there because they were repaving the main entrance parking lot. The prior days it was easy in and easy out. Pool area was beautiful, wish it had been warmer. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: Davies4543
Reviews.Content: Nice bright large room only let down by dated bathroom.chips on tiles on floor tiles pealing from wall by toilet.nice casino small and easy to navigate.the only real problem is the 1.8 mile walk to watch the pirate battle at treasure island

Reviews.Title: “My birthday stay turned into a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: jzguru
Reviews.Content: I am currently writing this review from the Cosmopolitan in Las Vegas. The Cosmopolitan was never in my plans for this 2 day birthday trip to Las Vegas. I decided to stay at the Tropicana because of the favorable reviews I read here on Trip Advisor (usually very reliable). Upon my check-in, I was charged an early check in fee (1:30 pm), but I was ok with that. I made the long trek to the Club Tower where there was 0 air conditioning and it felt like a sauna down that walkway. Once i got to the room, the room was absolutely HOT and STUFFY. Even my cousin who usually likes her apartment at 80 degrees commented that it felt hot. So I called front desk to ask them if we could get another room, but they said they'd send an Engineer instead. The engineer did come promptly and first words out of his mouth were "It feels Cool to me". He did end up changing the air filter (dirty) and said he'd make some adjustments in the chiller room, but that helped minimaly. The temp dropped to 70 and never below that (even though the thermostat was set to 60). So we laid down for a nap in this hot stuffy room, and all we could hear was the jackhammer from the pool area. The noise was unbearable. So I called front desk once more AND they told me that ALL double rooms face the construction noise. They acknowledged that these rooms were noisy, BUT FAILED to do so while we were checking in. At this point, I decided just to put up with it AND not let it ruin my birthday. Dinner at Diego at the MGM Grand was fine. Once we got back and went to sleep, I woke up at 4 am in a warm sweat. The room just felt Muggy like a summer day in Houston. At 7:00 am (with the jackhammer outside already blasting), me and my cousin had enough. She said "I feel hot and if I feel hot you must be miserable." So I went to the front desk, and checked out. Worst part is that the front desk agent admitted that the rooms probably wouldn't get much more below 70 degrees. WIsh these same front desk agents would have told me about this and the excessive construction noise before I checked in. SO now im here at the Cosmopolitan. Why the Cosmopolitan? Well I told my cousin Id rather pay a premium than risk spending my actual birthday day in misery here in Las Vegas. I'll review the Cosmopolitan later, but so far it's a complete 180 from the Tropicana. Hopefully the reviews of the Wicked Spoon (favorable) here on Trip Advisor reflect our experience when we go for dinner this afternoon ;)

Reviews.Title: “Blah is the word...No frills, but clean”
Reviews.Author: nycpanther
Reviews.Content: A trip with a girlfriend brought me to the Tropicana. This hotel would definitely *not* be my first choice, but I will try to review without prejudice, based on what the hotel does offer (not much, dear reader). If like me, you clamor for a theme hotel in outlandish Vegas style, or a luxurious experience, move along quickly, as you won't find it here. By 'it' I mean anything extraordinary in any way, in terms of kitsch, elegance, service, amenities or style. If recent renovations and a central South Strip locale are what you're after, then have at it. The good - Centrally located - very convenient and safe parking lot (only dept where The Trop truly excels...a rarity in Vegas) - Newly renovated rooms, everything works - good housekeeping The bad -lax security - nothing good to eat in hotel -Rooms have absolutely zero style (allegedly there's a Tropical theme here, other than a faux coconut air freshener, theme undetected) -no good attractions or shows in hotel - no frills architecture -no front desk to be found late at night...this happened to me several times...unheard of, and I used to tour for a living, so I've stayed in a variety of places from Ritz Carltons to Motel 6s. Basically ....in these rough economic times, Vegas has some fabulous places to stay for very low sums. There's no reason on Earth to stay here, as service and style are nonexistent. Thumbs way down. That said....the housekeeping staff are really efficient, and polite. The other staff I encountered couldn't care less, including security (a man was able to follow me into the restroom in plain sight of literally 10 Nikki Beach bouncers.) That was dreadful.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana - getting old...”
Reviews.Author: SHS2012
Reviews.Content: We picked Tropicana based on price and the quite good reviews on Tripadvisor. However, the hotel did not live up to our expectations. Compared to most of the hotels along the Strip, Tropicana is old-fashioned and worn down. It was difficult to see and feel the upgrade that we read about on the webpages. The room was OK, but the bathroom had an old shower, broken tiles etc. The best with Tropicana is the location at the Strip (and near the airport), the nice pool area and a really great breakfast restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “The newly remodeled Tropicana is well done.”
Reviews.Author: utah81
Reviews.Content: The newly remodeled Tropicana is well done. We highly recommend Bacio Italian restaurant and the Recycled Percussion show. Both exceeded our expectations. Our room was large and the bed was very comfortable. Our only complaint was the smoke in the common areas, but hey, it's Vegas...can't escape it. My wife and I had a great time and will certainly consider Tropicana next time we return. - Ririe, Idaho

Reviews.Title: “A place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SilverCowboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tropicana for several days. Was really pleased with the hotel and and our room. Didn't seem to be a lot of people in the casino, almost empty of them. Most gambling tables were not being played either. And the slot machines were not paying anything worth keeping my attention. It seemed that all the casinos on the strip were really not real busy and slots paying very little. We covered several of them to see. So we went down to old part of town, Golden Nugget, 4 Queens, etc. It was so crowded downtown that you had a hard time finding a slot machine to play. The slots were still not paying downtown either . There were so many people walking outside that sometimes it was hard to get anywhere. A lot of bands and singers playing and singing and people dressed in costumes, was really an enjoyable day and evening. Several other attractions and outside shops were everywhere. So will probably take the next vacation downtown Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Shades1963
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana in Vegas is a nice place to stay. The decor is nice, the staff is courteous, and it is on the end of the strip. The staff was very helpful no matter what was asked of them. I have no real complaints whatsoever. The only things I would say that might be considered negative is that the casino is small. There isn't as much entertainment inside the hotel area as some others that were visited. They have the RPM club where the dance floor is small and the music the night we were in there was kind of techno. If you like techno to dance too the club is for you. There was a Laugh Factory but I didn't see any advertising inside of the Hotel touting a show. So my overall observation of the Tropicana is that it's a great place to stay if you are looking for a clean comfortable room and you plan on being on the go all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Julesandjohn1
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1st to 8th March 2012. Rooms: Stayed in the paradise tower which is the one closest to the reception - best tower to stay in as closer to the strip and the walk ways to Excalibur and MGM. Also handy for the deuce bus stop. Standard room had two double beds, the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. Lovely and clean and modern although the bedside lighting wasn't very bright and made it hard to read when in bed. The windows open so you can get fresh air instead of the noisy air conditioning although the road noise was loud as we had a room strip side room but earplugs soon sorted that out. No coffee maker/kettle just an ice bucket. Huge TV, iron and ironing board. Bathroom was large, towels were thick and fluffy and changed every day. Included toiletries were shampoo, Conditioner, moisturising cream and a bar of soap but no shower gel. All smelt of coconut which I'm not keen on so didn't make use of. Plenty of hot water and a good water pressure. The maids came in every day and did a great job and kept it spotlessly clean. Since it was a reasonably small hotel it didn't take long to get to our room. All in all very satisfied with the room. Check in/out was quick and no queue. Staff friendly Restaurants: we only tried Baccio on the second from last night. Food looked great but the two of us who had the prawn pasta were up all night with sickness and diarroeha the person who had the chicken was ok. We did go back the following morning to tell them that there may be a problem with the prawns and we didn't want anyone else to get sick but found out that they didn't open until 5pm which was no good as it was our last night and we didn't want to have to come all the way back to the hotel. The lady at reception when we checked out said we should have gone to security to make them aware. It would never have occurred to us to go to security to pass on a comment about the restaurant. Did visit nicer restaurants so we wouldn't visit Baccio again, was quite expensive as well. Pool - really disappointed as it was being refurbished when we were there. I'm sure it is wonderful when it is up and running. This was one of the reasons we booked this hotel as it said what a wonderful pool/pool area it had. We thought that since we were staying a week in Vegas we would have a couple of days relaxing around the pool to recharge our batteries from all the walking. We booked last April and there was no mention that the pool closes in the winter. The lady on reception said it states clearly on the website that it is closed until the end of March - yes it does now but it didn't last April when we booked it. It would'nt have been so bad if they had done the same as Caesars Palace and cordoned off the pool but left the sun bed area usable. There were only about 10 beds available for use near Cafe Nikki which were all taken. Resort fees - I don't understand these at all. Pool closed - so one facility not available. Why not do what most hotels throughout the world do, if you want to use Wifi then charge for it. Gyms, pools etc are free to use in virtually all hotels in any country as it is part and parcel of enticements to draw customers. Do feel at $14.99 a night on top of the room rate is very expensive when none of the things included we used or were able to as not in service. Also, when you read on here that the resort fee was waived for some people does make me cross. All in all the Tropicana is a good hotel if you get a good rate. Comfortable and clean rooms, friendly staff, close to the airport. $15 in a taxi. The only reason for not giving it 5 are the pool area being closed and the resort fee. Would go back but would be tempted to try elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Time”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinWizard
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and everything was very nice. Property and rooms are kept well and eveyone was very friendly and helpful ! I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Price, Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: redhead54Flagstaff
Reviews.Content: I booked the Tropicana through a travel site and was extremely pleased. The room was large, furniture modern; view was very pleasing. I was placed on the 17th floor and could see the airport from our room -- very exciting for my husband who is a frustrated pilot! The bed was extremely comfortable and the room was very quiet which was perfect for when we wanted to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Repeat performance”
Reviews.Author: mgiovi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited the New Tropicana March 9th through 15th 2012. This was our 9th Trip to Vegas. We booked this as an anniversary trip, and to attended the NASCAR Race at LVMS. We had stayed at the Tropicana on our first trip to Las Vegas in 1996 and enjoyed ourselves. When researching our trip, we saw that they had done a re-model and decided to try it again. We got a great Air/Hotel Deal through Expedia, and booked a Strip View room. When we arrived, very late Friday night, the room they had for us was on the 3rd floor… not really a view in my opinion. My husband asked if they had any upgrades, or higher floors available, but they said they were booked and would try to offer us something the next day. Being very tired, we said fine. When we got to our room, it was behind the Hotel Sign overlooking the roof with the AC units….They call that a Strip View? The room was ok, not as nice as other hotels we have stayed at in Vegas, but acceptable (with the exception of the Strip View). My husband and I had a little laugh...it was almost like a repeat of our first visit. The reason I mention our first stay at the Tropicana is because my second trip had started out much the same way. On Our first trip, they gave us a room that wasn’t cleaned, had glasses laying everywhere, trash on the floor and, right out the window, a dumpster view. At the time, I was shocked and went right back to check in. Before I could finish explaining, a supervisor got involved, and upgraded us to a tower room. We have stayed in a number of Hotels in Las Vegas, booked through different sites, airlines, even travel agents, but this was the only one that we ever had a “bad” room location and had to ask for an upgrade, or a higher floor. They did find us a room on a the 11th floor the next day and we had a great time (it is Las Vegas). The Hotel is nice, the staff was nice, but having my second stay start out much like the first, a Dumpster view, then the Roof and AC unit view, I am not sure I would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Trop is nicely redone”
Reviews.Author: Vicki A
Reviews.Content: The rooms are so nicely redone in the towers by the convention area. We stayed for most of a week.

Reviews.Title: “Quite, clean and doesn't smell like smoke. Smells like coconuts!!”
Reviews.Author: Winkie100
Reviews.Content: My husband and stayed for three days during Conferance and enjoyed the large rooms, clean floor and bathrooms. The Casio is small but it's nice as well because the smell of smoke isn't over powering like New York New York or the Luxor. It was winter so we didn't get to use the pool but it looked beautiful. We ate breakfast there and it was really good. I will stay there again. Great beds and if staying in the tower you can open the windows.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding and so many surprises - Updated”
Reviews.Author: NYC_wanderer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tropicana for the first time in many visits to Las Vegas. When we booked we expected the newly renovated hotel to be quite nice. But to say that our expectations were greatly exceeded is putting it mildly. So let me say that we would certainly stay here again. And now, here are just some of the fine points and surprises: 1. The Beach Cafe --- for breakfast, a MUST. A great breakfast buffet. Not with the 100 items that we associate with Las Vegas buffets, but a buffet like a 4* hotel in a major city. Lox, omelet station, half dozen cut fresh fruit and ALL Ripe, plus kumquats, kiwi, nuts, figs, apples, oranges, bananas, and of course bacon (thick, tasty and crisp), sausage, and even fresh, ripe avocado. And the price, a steal at $18.99 which included coffee. AND if that isn't good enough, this is located adjacent to a beautiful, tropical-like grass, palm tree and pool area, AWAY from the casino so you hear music (and if you are sitting outside a waterfall) and not the kachinging of slot machines. 2. Now the room. Huge by most standards. One of the largest we have encountered in 6 or so hotels that I've been in during Las Vegas visits. CLEAN. And the room was made up within 2 hours of leaving this morning, without us even asking! 3. The bathroom. Large, bright, good towels. I'd have preferred a walk-in shower, rather than a tub/shower combo, but what's to complain. 4. The staff. So far friendly, helpful, professional. Our Waitress (Wendy) in the Beach Cafe is memorable as one of the most personable servers encountered in a location like Las Vegas where staff is often perfunctorily friendly. Wendy truly is, even to the point of knowing our names and using them appropriately. The Tropicana Experience (2) Above I wrote of Day 1 experiences in glowing terms (above). Now I add a couple of items, also favorable. The POOL area. One of the nicest in my experience. Multiple areas, multiple spas, a lot of grassy areas which are not flat (hilly?), shady areas if you want to avoid sun, waterfalls in many places (even some that are good for a back massage) AND chaise lounges with thick padded cushions at no extra charge. Next, I hate the idea of "RESORT FEES" and the resort fee at the Tropicana is no exception. But for the fee you get an excellent gym (a bit small but otherwise great), in room / in hotel internet service that really works (I used it for realtime stock trading using 2 computers with no problems) and also for Netflix video. The BREAKFAST buffet stood the test of time across multiple days. Excellent food and service as I said initially. Are there any DOWNSIDES to the Tropicana? Well yes. The two bars are basically for the sports lovers only with screens all over, the sound of the TV's and the patrons often at ear splitting levels. So a relaxing place to have a drink is missing. And room service "Forgot" my order on my checkout morning when I had an early flight to catch. So I went to the airport without anything for the commencement of a 5 hour flight. The one "upper end" restaurant (Biscayne) that I ate at was OK, but no cigar, at least for what I had (Prime Rib). The atmosphere was nice, at least until several loud parties descended on the restaurant, but on the whole I'd say that for a nice, relaxing dinner you can do better elsewhere. However, it is away from the casino, with window tables are overlooking the pool area, so the location is a plus. Lastly there is a lot of sound carry between rooms that are adjoining due to no insulation between the adjoining doors. So if you have partying neighbors (which we did for a couple of nights), be prepared to go next door and join their party ... unless they are fighting with each other. This hotel (and all hotels) should really put sound insulation between the adjoining doors. I don't understand why this is so rare. A Problem: How it is handled is the Mark of Excellence Soon after posting a very favorable initial review of the Tropicana, I encountered a problem. The mark of a good hotel is how they handle a problem or incident. Let me say that the handling of the incident was exemplary. Across the course of nearly a week, I dealt with over a dozen managers and supervisors. With only 1 1/2 exceptions, they were all exceptional. Providing assistance that went beyond my expectations. I would overall give the handling of the problem 4 1/2 stars out of 5, the 1/2 being solely due to one manager who I would give a 2. If it would be appropriate, I would list the many 5 star performers, but it is not. If there is one lesson that I take away, it is that if you do not promptly get the assistance with a problem that you feel is appropriate, do not hesitate to contact another manager or supervisor. And keep your cool throughout. I would not hesitate in going back to the Tropicana both because of the quality of the hotel experience and because if, in the unlikely event that a problem arises, the response of the staff and management is outstanding. So, in summary.....do not hesitate to go to the Tropicana. It is close to everything and small enough to not be a factory like some of the other properties.

Reviews.Title: “ADA Accomadations”
Reviews.Author: dellama
Reviews.Content: For all my ADA peeps out there.......DON'T STAY AT TROPICANA!! If you are in a wheelchair and can not stand or need assistance Tropicana is not where you want to stay. The toilets are not ADA height and they expect you to use those extensions, remember those wobbly unsafe donuts you put on a toilet? What year is this? And the sinks.......they aren't wall mounted and have this cabinetry that comes down so you can't roll up under them, again what year is this? Like they don't make enough revenue in a months time just to make a few modifications...SAD!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Simon_Sq
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from the 7-11th March 2012 with my brother. Check-in: There was no queuing which was great but the lady that checked me in was extremely unfriendly. She barely said a word to me, gave me no information and was a very poor advertisement for the hotel. Room: I had selected one of the standard rooms, so nothing too exciting. As expected due to the refurbishment it was clean, relatively modern and comfortable. I had a room with twin beds and they were large and provided a quality night of sleep. I heard very little noise from the surrounding rooms. The bathroom was more dated but was adequate. It had a combined bath/shower, about what I would expect for a mid range hotel, so no complaints. There was no fridge in the room at all which was surprising, even just as a minibar to sell extra to guests. I would love to think that hotels would eventually realise that customers would like some form of storage for the odd bottle of water, soft drink or even some simple food. The room had a large tv with a decent range of channels. WiFi in the room was intermittent; I had to sit by the bedroom door for consistent access. This is most likely due to the thicker walls from the older building. Again not top of the range but perfectly acceptable for this level of hotel. The negatives... I would have liked a coffee machine or at the very least a kettle, a common theme for me in Vegas hotels. As noted above, some form of refrigeration space would have been helpful; I like the odd in room tea or coffee and to store some soft drinks (not always the ones sold in the vending machines). Dining: I didn’t try out any of the high end dining options but made use of the Beach Café and Marketplace. The beach café was very average although reasonable for the price whilst the marketplace offered simple decent quality food for the price. I was pleased to find a Starbucks on site, useful for a morning coffee and some cake. Casino: The casino isn’t the biggest but it had a friendly atmosphere and plenty of people making use of the slots and tables. I liked the environment and would happily visit even if not staying at the hotel. Sports Book: This was old and dated, very American in terms of content, so I had to go elsewhere to catch some UK sports. I think it could do with some expenditure to bring it up to date. Pool: This was my main disappointment with the hotel. I had primarily booked the Tropicana for two main reasons, the newly renovated rooms (leading to excellent reviews) and the pool. As I found upon arrival, the pool was closed, not because of the weather as other reviews had indicated, but because they were still building it! Using a lounger on the grass isn’t quite the same and really did spoil things for me. I raised this complaint with reservations, see below for details. Bars: There seemed to be one main bar which was pretty nice and had a good feel to it. I had a couple of drinks there and was happy to go back. It was a good place to meet friends and have a relaxed drink. Clientele: The Tropicana seemed to have a largely older clientele, more so than most other Vegas hotels I have stayed at. This is not to say though that there weren’t plenty of business and younger customers. I thought there was a good mix and found it a good place to stay. Location: Towards the end of the strip I can see that the location could cause issues for some. For me it was perfectly fine, with easy access to the strip and all the action. If you want to party, I would stay somewhere more central, but otherwise the location was perfectly good. Gym: I did not check out the gym or spa. Other: As noted above, I raised an issue with reservations due to the pool being closed. Whilst unfair to disclose details, I was extremely impressed with the response and action that I received. The gentleman who called me was willing to do whatever was required to make me happy, offering me a huge number of options to make my stay better and compensate for the pool being closed. The service I received showed me that the Tropicana actually values its customers very highly and will really go the extra mile to ensure that they enjoy their stay. The way that the hotel dealt with my complaint was enough to make me go back on its own, not because of how they compensated me, but because they were so professional, understanding and willing to show how much they valued my custom. Overall: As a mid range hotel, I think this is an excellent choice in Vegas. The rooms are comfortable, the hotel is friendly and relaxed, the refurbishment gives it a more modern feel and most importantly, the hotel cares about its customers. If I came back to Vegas, would I come back to the Tropicana? Yes, no doubt about it. Would I recommend to friends? Yes, but it would depend on what type of holiday they wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Great alternative to Massive Hotels”
Reviews.Author: donald m
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was recently renovated and it is a great bargain for the price and amenities. We took the offer to upgrade to the Tower closest to the strip and it was worth it. Less walking/close to the Casino. The Casino is not a massive maze that requires a G.P.S to find your mate, and is light and airy, not a dark dungeon, the only drawback is a lack of more current slot machines. Staff throughout the Hotel was helpful and very accommodating. Pool area was nice, but if they are trying to recreate a South Beach feel - cut out the blaring rock and play Latin/Cuban/Latino music - The gym was basic, but adequate and looks over the pool area. All in all I would definitely return to this Hotel/Casino - Great bargain and a nice comfortable fee. Also Gym was

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: mnicks99
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's cheaper, but there's a reason for that. First of all, location. It's at the southern end of the strip, close to NY, NY and MGM but that's about it. You'll have quite a walk to get to the rest of the casinos and other attractions on the strip. Also, speaking of walking, we were in the club tower and it's a long, and I do mean long, walk from the main entrance. Also, it's right next to the airport. Our room faced the airport so we heard the noise all night and day. Secondly, while our room was relatively clean and spacious, the bathroom was dirty and horribly outdated. There were chipped tiles and grout along with mildew and grim in the edges. The shower head was over an oddly shaped bathtub and was very low. My husband is around 6 feet and had to crouch down to use it. The decor has the "south beach" feel to it but it's cheaply done. The staff weren't particularly friendly or helpful either. We didn't use the pool, but it appears they're doing renovations and attempting to expand the area but I didn't see anyone working on that part of the property while there. Now on to the worst part: the smell. I'm not sure what they're pumping onto the casino floors, but it's like a coconut/tropical scent and it's disgusting. Also, we frequently smelled sewer gas while near the escalators going towards the restaurants and club tower. We were on a nonsmoking floor, but several times our room reeked of cigarette smoke and it seemed to be coming from of the air vent. I wish we had spent the money and stayed elsewhere. We likely shelled out the same as we would have paid for a nicer place cabbing back and forth.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana - Nice!”
Reviews.Author: RVMR
Reviews.Content: We held a meeting at the Tropica the week of March 19th. The catered lunches were amazing for banquet food & probably the best meeting catering we've had in years. Kudos to the banquet chef! Hotel Lobby - very bright & airy, a little heavy on the coconut smell as you enter. The casino area is not large & seems a bit too bright, especially in the evenings. The hotel rooms are all newly redone, very clean, the bed is EXTREMELY comfortable. Shower heads in most of the Club rooms are too low. Depending on how tall you are can be pretty uncomfortable to wash your hair. The location is great - at the end of the strip near the airport, however there is soooo much within a short walk - MGM, Luxor, Excalibur, NY, so no lack of things to do in the area. Another 10 minute walk & you're at Bellagio, Bally's, Caesar's Palace. This is not the hip hot place to be & be seen, however the warmer pool season may be completely different as the pool area is quite large & very nice. The staff is extremely service oriented & goes out of there way to help you. One of our meeting attendees had a slight problem with the overnight manager, but this was not a reflection of 99% of the rest of the staff. Overall, I would definitely stay here again. It's a classic, but all new property, the price is right the staff is great, the food is great. Look forward to coming back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Week!!”
Reviews.Author: Holly N
Reviews.Content: We were reccommended this hotel by our wedding planners 'your vegas wedding' and I must say, we were VERY impressed! We stayed ay the Tropicana for 7 nights in the Club delux room, each night excelled our expectations! The room had plently of space for the two of us, and was immaculate in every single way! We were told that this hotel had the best pool in the world and this is something that we believe lives upto the title! You were able to hire your own cabannas around the pool at a cost price, which made our time around the pool very private, something we enjoyed whilst on our 'wedding break'. The hotel had plenty of outstanding fine dining facilities that also excelled expectations! We found that our favourite restaurant to dine in was the Biscayne steak, spa & wine which reinterprets a 'classic steakhouse'. We could not have asked for better service within this specific restaurant, with waiters and waitresses waiting on our very hand and foot! Thanks to all at 'your vegas wedding'. You made our trip and our special day an amazing experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly very good”
Reviews.Author: Britleo
Reviews.Content: This is a bargain for the price.Impeccable room that was clean and spacious overlooking the Strip. Indeed the whole Casino had a light and airy style with attentive smiling staff that were abundant. The pool area is especially good. I was quite taken aback with surprise, having been used to staying in expensive 5 star hotels, so didn't expect for the money this to be so good but it is good, very good. Would certainly stay here again and suggest it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and affordable!”
Reviews.Author: Laura M
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the renovated tropicana! We were upgraded to a room with an awesome strip view. Had no problems while staying at the tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “Economy rooms...”
Reviews.Author: jeffnshell
Reviews.Content: The rooms were a 2 star....rooms need much renovations like the hotel, maybe they ran out of money....it could of used a bar fridge and a coffee maker...rooms were clean but old. They seemed to be short waitresses when we were visitibg, so when gambling we had a difficult time acquiring drinks...for the amount we spent on slots we should of been pleasantly buzzed. The hotel staff were great, the maids were friendly, the floors were shiny...if I was able to get a discount I would stay there again otherwise I will be staying at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean not Spotless!”
Reviews.Author: Corey S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tropicana in Vegas for a 2 day to just "get away" trip. The place is definately doing a complete renovation. The room we stayed in was in the Paradise Tower (the one facing the Strip". We purchased the booking through a website deal and upgraded when we got to the hotel, it was worth the upgrade. The wesite stated it is a 4-star hotel, but I would consider it a 3-star. The room was recently upgraded and everything seemed clean at first, but if you look deep you can tell this was not a FULL renovation but new carpet,paint, fixtures and soft goods. The furniture is still older but newly re-covered. All-in-all I would say we were satisfied for the price. It is in a GREAT location and the new restaurants (Beach Cafe) have really good food. We had a great time and I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying on a budget during the week.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Very Affordable.”
Reviews.Author: Nevlach
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at the Tropicana. The prices for the rooms were extremely affordable. The pool was great and relaxing. The casino was also pretty good, though not as big as some of the other casinos on the strip but I had a lot of fun there and would go again any day.

Reviews.Title: “BAD ATENTION IN THE FRONT DESK”
Reviews.Author: marcosman
Reviews.Content: i went to the tropicana 15 days ago, and a lady called "LINDA" in the front desk of the hotel was so unfriendly with us, she spoke very fast, gestures towards us as she was tired of explaining things about the hotel (for example where it was our room)... The hotel nice, nice rooms, nice view, nice location, so expensive to dinner or lunch in the hotel. I'll be back, bur please give that woman a course of how to serve customers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Julien T
Reviews.Content: We stayed there last year, just after the hotel had been refurbished. Well, it was amazing. Check in was done in 5 minutes, the room was really spacious with 2 big king size beds. very clean. Staff was very helpful and friendly. The pool was great (go before 11am if you want to get a chair!). Went there every morning. The casino was good too, clean, etc... Location-wise, it is a bit out of the way if you're walking, but not so bad (not as good as, let's say, the Planet Holywood or Paris Las Vegas). Will definitely try to stay there again when we go back to Vegas this year!

Reviews.Title: “Pitiful service apparently comes first!”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: I'm not an experienced Vagas traveler, but the few times I've been there were much better experiences than this one. After waiting more than an hour in line to check in, I was informed that the only rooms available were smoking rooms, even though I had requested a non-smoking room. I was told that there were no other options until the next day, so I accepted the smoking room for one night, and they put notes in "the system" to hold a non-smoking room for me the next day. After about a quarter mile walk (no lie) with my bags to wait behind a hoard of people to get on an elevator, I got to my residential ashtray. It wasn't just smelly, it was filthy. The next day, after a long day in a tradeshow booth, I patiently stood back in the check-in line for about 35 minutes, waiting for a front desk person to wait on me while at least 12-15 people walked past me to be waited on at the "VIP" desk area, making it painfully obvious that "regular" customers aren't valued there. When I got to the front desk, they had no record of my room change in "the system," and the desk clerk had no interest in correcting the problem, until the desk clerk from the pervious day happened to come around the corner, and I asked her if she would please help, which she did. Then I had to walk the quarter mile to my first room, carry my bags all the way back to turn in my key before they would check me into the non-smoking room, and then all the way back again. My non-smoking room was much better, except for the giant (and I mean giant) stain on the floor. And while I was playing their slot machines, an employee came over to me and tried to sell me on a "refunded loss" program, whereby they guaranteed to give me back everything I lost, with certain restrictions. It turned out that was a total scam. As naive Vegas person, perhaps I can take the heat for allowing myself to be scammed, but it didn't help to soften the blow of the entire lousy experience at the Tropicana. I did have two positive things to share. The pool area was very nice, and I had several very good meals at the breakfast cafe (even though the hostess was absolutely clueless and unfriendly to all the patrons, and walked at a snail's pace to seat each person before walking at a snail's pace back to the front, as if she didn't have a care in the world; she was clearly in the wrong line of work). Other than a nice outdoor pool and two nice breakfasts, I would rank this hotel/casino as downright pitiful based on my horrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Smoke_Eater
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay !! This is the second time I have stayed at the Tropicana in Las Vegas. Check in: Very short line up, hard working staff, 5 min wait. I had booked with travelocity. The agent at the front desk was really nice. We had a standard room booked and she offered to upgrade us to a suite for an extra $50 a night. We upgraded and then she even waived the resort fee of $17 a night. Room: 2 large rooms, 1 bedroom with one king sized bed attached to the bathroom. The living room is roughly 500 square feet with a wet bar, fridge, coffee maker, large couch, chairs and table and great view of the strip. Ammenities: Hot tub is open all year round, pool is closed until late march early april. Didn't have a chance to check out the gym. Restaurants: Fast food is over priced and mediocre. Biscayne is really nice and a decent value for what you are getting. Cafe Niki has a cool atmosphere but prices are a little inflated. Nightclubs: RPM is amazing on Friday nights, the best house music and atmosphere I have ever experienced, even better than XS (crown isn't as snobby). RPM on Saturday nights is hip hop and house. Casino: Decent renovation, has a new feel and look to it. Nice but not over the top like other hotels on the strip. Location: South end of the strip across from MGM and Excalibur. Gas station directly to the south has a good selection of beer. Hooters to the east has cheap beer and wings after midnight. Value: For a high end 3 star, the price is extremely low and I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a 3 to 4 star range for a great value.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best! Hands down!”
Reviews.Author: scrappinmad2005
Reviews.Content: My Hubby and I booked our hotel through Priceline.com and got The Tropicana as our hotel. WOW!! We couldn't have been happier! The hotel greeted us with a gentle aroma of something tropical as we walked through the doors. Reception desk was quick, smooth and cheerful. There wasn't a single person in line... and we arrived around noon-thirty! The casino was bright and cheerful with a wide variety of slots... from some classic ones to brand spankin new ones... all scattered through out. We had lunch at "The Beach Cafe'" and the food was sooo YUMMY! The prices weren't bad, either! Our prior to arriving requests were addressed and fulfilled by cheerful staff. The rooms were nice. Clean. Bed was somewhat firm, but with a very very soft overlay, making the bed quite comfortable. The tv was nice and big. Bathroom was well stocked and clean. We were greeted with a smile and hello (and sometimes more) by every single staff member we passed. This WILL be our home away from home in Vegas, from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Stefanoh
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Tropicana! The bartenders were friendly as can be and the casino isn't so big that you have to look for signs to know where you are going. They have 2 great restaurants in house, one of which is TripAdvisors best steak house on the strip. What sealed the deal for me was on our last night there, I twisted my knee to the point that I couldn't put any pressure on my knee. The staff couldn't have been more helpful! They brought a wheelchair to our room and wheeled me to our rental car, They also told us which doc-in-a-box to go to that had the shortest waiting line! They were there when I got back to wheel me to the room and were there the next morning to wheel me out. Through it all they were all gracious and amusing. The only complaint we would have is the room didn't get as cool as we like. But we didn't complain..

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great price.”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen F
Reviews.Content: I recently used an online travel agency to book a room here and was at first worried it would not be that nice. But as soon as I walked in I was impressed. The bright colors and whole ambiance is exaclty how other more expensive hotels are. There were flat screen TV's and an ipod doc. (A necessity for me) The service was great and location great. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “home sweet home”
Reviews.Author: Larry S
Reviews.Content: they was four of us went first week in jan . 2012 was the best rooms ,food and staf just lovely made the trip worth wild i will put my money on them every time now

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Still Excellent”
Reviews.Author: JustACoupleOfUs
Reviews.Content: I was at the Tropicana in Las Vegas last week for a business conference and, once again, found the hotel to be great. There have been more upgrades since my last visit, which make it even better. The staff are all excellent -- friendly, helpful, and smiling. I was up one morning and went down to breakfast earlier than expected and so missed my wakeup call -- when I was back in my room, shortly after when the call had been scheduled, one of the staff showed up to check on whether everything was okay, simply because I had not answered the wakeup call! I have never had this happen at any hotel. Just another sign of their level of caring & service. I especially liked the new fitness centre -- it has a great view and a lot of high-end equipment.

Reviews.Title: “One word -- FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: BeardsleyB
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay at the Tropicana. It was WONDERFUL!!! Check in was a breeze -- no waiting, in and out in no time. Our room was in the Club Tower. Beautiful! The room (and the entire property) was so clean. There was so much space in the room and we really enjoyed the safe in our room. The staff went above and beyond our expectations. They had an answer to every question and were so polite! We loved the casino floor with many options for any level of gambler. It was a little chilly out, or we would have hung out at the pools. Can't wait until summer! Hands down, there is no better value for the Las Vegas Strip -- the Tropicana delivers on every level. Do not gamble when making your reservation -- the NEW Tropicana is the way to go! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice accomodations”
Reviews.Author: World2uring
Reviews.Content: I bid on one of the travel sites and this was the hotel that accepted my price. I wanted something in this area that wasn't too expensive because I was only going to be in Las Vegas for a brief stay. From reading the other reviews, I saw that this one was older. I found no issue with this hotel at all. The room was nice and clean. The staff was helpful when needed and it was quiet in the tower were the rooms were located. Parking was free too. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “$80 double-queen on venere.com, well worth it.”
Reviews.Author: dahlheim
Reviews.Content: The only complaint i might offer is that the casino smelled strongly like cigarette smoke. Since that's something one might expect anyway, I still give it five stars. Very accommodating, very easy to get in and out, very comfortable room which was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana Vegas was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Shane A
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights and it was absolutely fantastic. Super clean rooms and very attractive decor. Clean casino gaming area and a nice change from the dark casino. The tropicana was nice and bright! The walk from the lobby to the room elevators was a bit of a walk but not that bad. Very close to the airport too for leaving town. This casino smelled FAR less smokey as well. I would highly reccomend staying here and we will definitely stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “our second stay”
Reviews.Author: gilli
Reviews.Content: we came and celebrated our wedding anniversary again, we had champagne and the biggest best chocolate dipped strawberries ever! that aside, the tropicana offers fantastic value. the beds, rooms and casino are all extremely comfortable. the staff are incredible friendly and helpful, Nicole Marshall with a room request prior to arrival, Barbara on front dest on arrival, the housekeeping staff on floor 20 in the paradise tower and Cynthia the most cheerful cocktail waitress on the strip, just to mention a few! there have been few negative comments re location posted, but we found with the deuce stopping right ouside, its location was a plus. no problems getting on the bus and you can stay at the southern end and walk everywhere too, especially when the strip is super busy at weekends. thankyou so much for another wonderful holiday, we hope to make it 3 times lucky next year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: llollipoppi1
Reviews.Content: I had a great time in this hotel for 9 days over New Year. My husband had written to Nicole Marshall to try and setup a surprise as it was my birthday and I had several things to celebrate and the hotel was very accomodating. He asked her the price to rent a coffee maker and fridge and she gave us them complimentary! She is such a lovely accomodating person for everything she did for our party. I also recieved a birthday cake from the hotel and two other friends who had birthdays recieved fruit and cheese baskets. It was really nice as we had a long flight. There was a hiccup, we had requested the paradise tower as we had people who had bad knees in our party but we were placed in the club tower. The customer service agents waived our resort fees as a result. This was very nice of them. The club tower is not as far as people make out though and we had excellent views of NYNY and the strip. We were high enough up not to hear the club. Rooms The rooms were lovely and had the most comfortable beds! Miad service was excellent, the power shower was great also I could find no complaint with the rooms. Casino Small but smelled nice and fresh compared to other hotels that smelled of stale smoke. I liked the size of the casino and had some good laughs with some of the croupiers. Club Small but again handy if you couldn't be bothered leaving the hotel. Pool As it was December it was closed - This was disappointing as temperatures were around 20-21 celsius and it would have been nice to just relax by the pool for the day. Overall all staff were friendly and courteous and very helpful with any requests we had. I loved the size of the Tropicana it wasnt as big as MGM etc but that was a positive. Definately stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at The NEW TROP!”
Reviews.Author: dmp0918
Reviews.Content: I went to Vegas last minute to visit a friend who was having a birthday.... I had stayed at the Trop before the remodel. It was okay, now it's amazing. Not only has the hotel been remodeled with new paint, new clean comforting rooms, but also the staff has a welcoming and friendly attitude. When arriving to the hotel, there was an issue with the reservation, while waiting for the issue to resolve one of the staff members offered me and my friend a complimentary drink. The issue was resolved very quickly. When I arrived at the room I was surprised by how nice, and clean the newly remodeled rooms are. I had a great stay at the Trop and will definitely be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “The Tropicana is old and it shows”
Reviews.Author: Steve_from_Tejas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights in March 2012. The first thing we noticed was the mold smell. We had to switch rooms after the first night because the A/C was broken. The toilet immediately overflowed in our second room. Maybe we were just unlucky, but there are much better hotels in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Extremely Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kaitlyn S
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just returned from a 5 night stay at the Tropicana and have nothing but good things to say. The rooms are clean and simple (beds were amazingly comfortable) and the staff (everyone from the hotel manager to the door man) was extremely kind. We stayed in the Club Tower (which is quite a walk from the main entrance and Paradise tower), but we didn't mind getting the exercise. The pool was closed while we were there (they said it would open on 3/17/12) but it looks AMAZING! They have a swim up bar and black jack and and multiple hot tubs and we were extremely bummed we didn't get to use them. The hotel location is on the South end of the strip (about a 1.5 mile walk to Bellagio and 2.5 mile walk to the Wynn/Encore hotels and Fashion Mall), so if you don't like to walk a lot, try purchasing an all-day bus pass. Go to the concierge desk and talk to Walter if you need ideas on what to do while you're there. Walter got us a discount on Cirque tickets as well as TFDU tickets and make great recommendations for restaurants and even put us on the guest list at the clubs we wanted to go to. Overall I'd recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a nice clean Vegas hotel room on the strip for a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Newly Renovated Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: LMCul
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Trop for the second time - our 1st visit was June 2011 and renovations were underway but not complete, although our room, the deluxe plus had been completely re-done. We stayed in the far tower overlooking the not quite finished pool area. The room was amazing, most comfortable beds and sound proof rooms, never heard anyone in the halls, or noise from outside - only downside was the long, long walk to the far tower. Our 2nd stay was Feb, 2012 - renovation now complete, staff was more than happy to upgrade us to the Deluxe City View in the close tower, again beds amazingly comfortable and no noise from outside. I always requested bathrobes, and although not typically offered in this category of room, both stays they happily accomodated this request. I would stay at the Trop again, yes it is at the far end of the strip, but the price reflects this. Staff is friendly, rooms are great and price is fair.

Reviews.Title: “The New Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: Flemming190492
Reviews.Content: In July 2011 I had my first trip to Las Vegas. I ended up staying at Tropicana Las Vegas as I wanted to stay at a hotel on the strip. I must say even though I expected a lot of the hotel I still was amazed. The hotel is so light and newly renovated. The casino is great and so is the pokerroom. I must also say that steak dinners at Biscayne is a must if you love steakdinners that make you feel you're in heaven. The rooms was great I had a room in 19th floor with a strip wiev, awesome! I went to the Bard Garret Comedy Club and had an magnificent night. I didn't have the time to experience the Mob Experience, but that I am gonna check out on my next trip. The good thing with Tropicana is that it's located nearby so many other hotels so it is easy to check out other places while staying at the Tropicana. They also have a nice players card solution, it is a must to have! I am booking my summer holiday this year too at the Tropicana Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: DebiCardiff
Reviews.Content: We visited The Tropicana at the end of February for 4 nights. The hotel was nice enough but I would not rate it as “one of the best hotels in Vegas” The location of the hotel has its pros and cons. The pro’s is it’s nice to get away from the hustle and bustle of the strip, the cons it’s a long strip so being at the end means lots of walking. The other pro is the hotel is not as huge as some of the others so you won’t get lost in it. The rooms were clean and tidy and I will say the beds were really comfortable. All other areas of the hotel were also well kept. However the room we had had an adjoining door to another room, so just when we were settling down for the night the blokes next door decided to up the anti and have a karaoke party and it was like they were in the room with us. In fairness the security guard came and spoke to them and they shut it off straight away but even then when they were just talking we could hear every word so the rooms with adjoining doors are not soundproof. We rang reception and moved rooms to one without an adjoining room. One thing I didn’t like at the hotel was the way the women servers in the casino were dressed, being kind they were mostly way past mid life age and wearing red satin short low cut dresses. I felt sorry for them being degraded into wearing such dreadful tacky uniforms and whilst Vegas itself is known to be tacky, I am sure that those women (in their 60’s) would prefer to wear something a little less tarty. The door men were excellent especially Patrick who went out of his way to help us. Cheers Pat. In summary nice enough hotel and yes I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded, but not quite...”
Reviews.Author: Amalthea7c
Reviews.Content: I had to attend a conference in Las Vegas and the host hotel wanted an exorbitant price for their rooms so I looked at nearby hotels. The Tropicana was convenient but the rates were $95 a night, which I thought was a bit high. I really think that the "resort fee" that so many hotels are tacking on to room rates are ridiculous. If you can't opt out of the fee it should just be included in the price of the room. The Tropicana "only" charged $14.99 compared to the $20.00 and up at other hotels. All I received for the fee was phone service and Wi-Fi. The Wi-Fi did work, I had no issues. Check-in was slow, the clerks are friendly but they need more of them at the counter. I paid extra to have a room in the Paradise Tower but the clerk said they only had a double bedded room, instead of the King I asked for, with just a shower. The lights did not work in the bathroom but I could see that it was a roll in shower, which the clerk did not mention. I called the front desk and this clerk said he would have a room in half an hour and for me to just wait in the room. Luckily, he called back in 10 minutes with a King room. The bellman was very nice and the new room was much better. The room did look like the pictures on the web site, but the bathroom fan was very noisy and had a lot of dust on it. The tub could have stood some refinishing along with the tile floor but the sink and counter were very nice. The bed was comfortable enough and it had king sized pillows not those awful postage stamp pillows that many hotels have. On the hotel's key card envelope it says they are changing everything, so maybe they just haven't done the tubs and floors yet. There was some street noise to be heard even on the 14th floor but closing the shutters helped. I would think that the Club Tower would be quieter because it is away from the Strip. I didn't hear much noise from the hallway and just a bit of noise from the room next door. There was a rather strong perfume smell in the hallway that I could have done without but it didn't come into the room so I survived. I liked that I didn't have to trudge through a big casino to get to the elevators and the parking was much closer than at most Las Vegas hotels. All in all, a good stay, if I have to do things at that end of the Strip I think I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, But a Little Misleading”
Reviews.Author: flyfish66
Reviews.Content: We recently booked into the Tropicana on the "Best in Class" promotion on the web site. We interpreted this to mean we would be offered a room upgrade on a room if available. The truth is you can upgrade your room, but expect to pay dearly for it. We spent 3 nights in one of the renovated rooms. The rooms are generally well done with one exception-The tile in the baths are already showing wear and look dirty. I don't really think they were dirty, but it seemed more a case of a poor choice in flooring. No coffee service in the room, but there is a Starbucks on the property. They get high marks for the check in process-very smooth. We did the four course food & wine pairing dinner at Biscayne. The food was okay, but not great. The wine was great and so was the service. The fitness center is okay(included in resort fee), but you don't have access to steam and sauna-You have to pay extra for that. The fitness center overlooks the pool, which is currently very much under contruction for repairs. Hopefully, they will have the pool back in service by summer, but you might check on that before booking. No real gaming perks unless you lose $200 the first day. This is a great location on the strip and if you get a deal on a room, you will probably be satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “So nice, we didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: Michelle F
Reviews.Content: This was our first holiday to Las Vegas and it was beyond our expectations. The Tropicana is easily one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. Everything was very clean, new, with very nice features. It was noisy if sirens were going by, but aside from that it was quiet and easy to sleep. One thing that helped us sleep through the noise was all the walking we did in Las Vegas, it really takes everything out of you. The location is ok, it is on Las Vegas blvd, but it is a long walk to get to the Casinos that are past the Bellagio. We will come back to Las Vegas at some point and we will probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly2429
Reviews.Content: Great stay and location for the value. Very friendly and accommodating staff that goes the extra mile to make your stay as comfortable as possible. The room was very spacious,clean and up to date.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, calm hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly H
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at The Tropicana and this was our 1st time in Vegas. The staff there were really lovely and very helpful, checking in and out was quick and efficient and we had also been upgraded to a bigger room.Fabulous comfy bed and a nice view. The hotel has a much smaller gambling area than most of the other hotels, which suited us as it wasnt so overwhelming, which you may find with the others. And also no endless designer shops to wander round. We actually booked the hotel for the stunning pool area but to our massive disappointment it was all closed off while we were there as it was being refurbished, apparently this happens this time every year. This was not stated anywhere when we booked and so that was so annoying. The weather was really hot aswell so really could have done with some water to pop the tootsies in! Whilst in Vegas gotta visit The Cheesecake Factory in Caesars Palace! A big fat must! Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Renovation of hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Ivan L
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana has gone through some serious changes. Not only has the hotel been renovated, but their staff is friendlier and more dedicated to you and your needs. I've been staying here for many years since it's been a great bargain for its proximity to other great hotels (MGM to the right, NY NY across the street) and being on the strip is a major plus to get to all of the strip favorites. Now they've added a night club, which was great. Your room key gives you VIP, straight to the front of the line access. Give it a try and you'll be dancing to the beat in no time. The slots have been updated and the gaming areas are accessible to various games, which were lively throughout different times of the day. I have not tried the new pool, yet, but look forward to it soon. Once they renovate their old parking lot, the new TROP will have truly renovated itself and become a contender to the other hotels on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “No reason to stay anywhere else !!”
Reviews.Author: wild00rose
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay !! This is the second time we have stayed at the Tropicana in Las Vegas...The first time they were still working on the renovations, so I didnt think that I would be able to give a fair review, and now everything is complete so here it is. There for 5 of us for this trip, we stayed for a week. I have to say that we will plan to stay at the Tropicana for every future trip to Vegas. We had arranged to have the hotel limo pick us up at the airport, our flight was delayed by three hours due to some weather issues. I was concerned that noone would be there to pick us up, as we came down the escalator there was our driver waiting patiently for us, so that was great !! We had a little glitch with checkin, our reservation was actually for the next day, but in no time that had gotten that straightened out and off to our rooms we went. The rooms were perfectly fine as they were the last time we were there. If you havent been to |Vegas, at night it can be noisy with the traffic , airplanes, helicopters, sirens and people....you learn to expect that your sleeps maybe interupted but I have learnt to accept that. The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. Housekeeping does a fine job.....The rooms do not have coffee pots but you can ask at the front desk and they will gladly supply you with one. The casino its self it alot smaller than others, but it it nice to be able find others that you are travelling with. The drink service is excellent, I think because it is smaller the waitresses are able to make their rounds fairly quickly. A couple of the guys that travel with us spent alot of time at the tables and they were very happy with the dealers and the service they received at the tables. All the staff we encountered were very kind courteous and helpful. There are numerous options for food as well....There are two restaurants up top a steak house and italian restaurant.....we didnt eat that either of these restaurants this trip, but we did the last time and they were both excellent....there is now a Starbucks---which is extremely important to me !!--and well as a little fast food/deli--they offer pizza, sandwiches, soup, fries,orings and breakfast sandwiches and stuff, as well as the naked spoon which is frozen yogurt, with options to make your own smoothies and stuff....There is also the Beach cafe, which has a full menu from breakfast options, salads, fish, burgers, prime rib and steaks.....Lots of options for any type of eaters. There is also the option to sit out of the patio for this restaurant and take in the beautiful garden area. Please note the deli and Starbucks are open 24 hrs.....There is an outdoor pool/pools the entire area is breathtaking, but I believe there were many disappointed guests as the pools dont open until April, so keep that in mind. There is also a fitness center, and also a full service spa....I am unable to comment on either of these, as I didnt use these services, but definately the next trip I will be booking a date at the spa, and then will be able to write a review. We are not clubbers ourselves, but there is one here---RPM-- I can tell you on the weekend that there was quite a line up to get in, so I guess that speaks for itself. As far as the location goes, it is on the end of the strip, I personally dont mind that, its minutes from the airport, the monorail is right across the street at the MGM, and that will get you down the strip. The Excalibur/Luxor/MGM and NewYork are all across the street with easy access, if you choose to walk around. There are also some fast food -Mcdonalds/ Quiznos/DQ and Pizza hut if you are looking for some different options....Overall I feel that there is no reason to stay anywhere else, we are extremely happy with absolutely everything that this hotel offers. I want to send out a BIG thankyou to Julie for helping me arrange everything....And to also thank her for all the little perks, I couldnt of asked for a better host !! So thankyou to you and all of your staff for making this last week a great one and look forward to the next trip !! Hopefully it will only be a couple months away !! :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Remodel for the Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: B26Marauder
Reviews.Content: There have been people that have said that the renovations were like putting lipstick on a pig, while others have complained that it is not on the level of Bellagio or Wynncore. The renovations are a significant improvment over what the property used to be and definately was not putting lipstick on a pig. On the other end of the spectrum, it was not redsigned to compete with the high-end hotels on the Strip. In our opinion, it is more comparable to TI, Monte Carlo, etc. Would we recomend the hotel to others...yes. Would we stay there again...no. The reasons for the no is that are so many other properties we have not yet had the opportunity to visit as well as it was our least favorite hotel of the ones we have visited to date. The room was a Junior/Corner Suite on the 10th floor in the Club Tower. It had a king size bed, desk, and a sitting area; and the bathroom had a one-sink marble vanity and a large soaking tub for two. There was not a minibar, wine opener, or wine glasses. We had reserved a Keurig coffee machine but had to call the desk for it to be in our room once we realized it was not there for us. The room was very quiet and we experienced no noise from neighbors. The room was nice and clean, and the bed was extremely comfortable. The decor in the hallways and rooms were basic reminding my wife of a standard Marriot hotel or less. Everything we saw in the hotel was clean and well maintained. The one issue we did have was that we felt that extra money should have been spent in the bathroom. The vanity had a nice sink and faucet, but the floor and wall tiles were residential grade ceramic, The tub needed caulking in spots where it met the tiles. The look and feel of the bathroom would have been better if there had been at least simple marble tile. The bellmen delivered our bags quickly and the valet was quick. Never had to wait long for our car at all. We did not have any noise issues from the pool and/or clubs. We did have to ask for extra towels and washcloths a couple of times. This was noticed since at other properties, we have never had to ask because there were always plenty. That being said, when we did request them, they were delivered quickly. The outside of the hotel and exterior entry has been updated and is nice. The lobby has not been renovated and in speaking with the lady while checking in, the front desk and lobby will be renovated soon. This area should have been one of the first things renovated since this gives the first impression of the property. However, the property is also adding a spa and is undergoing construction for improvements in the business center area. There has to be a reason why the lobby was yet to be renovated. We just were disappoited to walk in and see the new casino and then go to the unrenovated lobby area. It seemed not to flow well. The gaming area was bright and airy with a very good atmoshpere. We arrived on Monday, and the casino was slow during the day and was busier at night. As the week went on, the casino was definately busier, and by Thursday night it was packed. We checked out of the hotel around 11am on Friday, and the slots were busy with the majority of the tables occupied. The casino is on the smaller side, but this is not a negative but a plus for us. It made the property easier to navigate. There was a good selection of slot and video poker machines and a varity of table games. The chairs in the casio were comfortable. I did spend several hours in the poker room. The dealers were very knowledgable of the game and the players friendly. I really enjoyed playing in this casino. It is a smaller room, but has a good feel to it. The first night there, my table had some new players combined with several experienced players. While on the second night I played, the table was full of good players and a few local grinders. The chairs were comfortable and drink service was good. They have Kruieg coffee makers and bottled water in the room for players and a bar just outside the casino if one has to have cocktails immediately. Drink service was good. The first night it had been a while since we had a cocktail waitress come by and the room supervisor took care of that. The link between the Paradise and Club Towers had the some nicely designed restaurants and shops. Once past this area, the link appeared appeared to be slightly worn (even though it had been recently renovated). We did not use the pool area, but it appeared to be large and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Great Remodel Job”
Reviews.Author: Bucky64
Reviews.Content: The hotel has experienced a $180M remodeling. It has a fresh, clean new look about it which includes new pillow-top beds, a 42” flat screen TV with HD programming and in room Wi-Fi. The bathroom provided an exception to the new look where it appears that the original tile floor and grout has been left in place. The grout had ground in dirt. I also was surprised that they use single-ply toilet paper. Free valet parking or park your own car is available on the grounds which is a definite plus. While I was aware of it, the hotel directly charges an additional $14.99/day “resort fee” that I found as annoying as airlines baggage fees. If your travel period is flexible, I’d suggest that you first consider which shows are there during your planned visit and those that are coming within a short period of time before or after so you are not disappointed when you get there and adjust your travel accordingly. The Tropicana is located near the extreme south end of the strip which increases the already extensive amount of walking you will do while vacationing in Vegas. If I could find a location that is closer to the center of the strip without a dramatic increase in price, I would consider it. If not, I would return to the Tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Glenn P
