Reviews.Content: The Trop is a great value, which means alot to me. The room was clean and the king bed was very comfortable. The staff is very accommodating. My wife and I went with another and the hostess made the extra effort to get us adjoining rooms. The location is fantastic. Easy acess to the monorail. Short walk to the parking garage so the rental car was easly accessible. The casino is small compaired to some of the others but it is well layed out and lots of fun. Pleanty of tables and slots to fit everyone liking. Great Stay!! I will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: shammond46
Reviews.Content: We booked (Hotels.com) 2 rooms for 5 people. We got nice rooms. We had helpful check-in, restaurant and valet staff. BUT....I was informed of a mandatory $13.50 service "fee" at check-in. That's pricing fraud in my mind. If it's mandatory it should be built into the rates or flagged. Second problem: The swimming pools were empty. They said we could use the pool next door at Hooter's hotel. Unfortunately that place was a garbage dump and the pools were unheated. The Tropicana did have a nice "comped" breakfast buffet which helped. But until they get honest about their facilities and pricing I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Meryssa N
Reviews.Content: Finished up our honeymoon for 3 nights in Las Vegas and stayed at the Tropicana. I emailed prior to our arrival to see if they had strip view (Paradise Tower) rooms available and they said we would be upgraded if available upon arrival. There were none available upon arrival so they upgraded us to a bigger room on the 17th floor of the Club Tower. No worries there, it was still a nice room. I have no complaints about the walk from the gaming floor to the Club Tower, just meant a better night's sleep for my husband and I away from all the slot machine noises! As others have mentioned, it's newly remodelled and the decor is very fresh and bright. The bathroom in our suite definitely had not been upgraded yet, so maybe they are still working on finishing those up. The location is good, I personally prefer the other end of the strip better but that really is just a personal preference. It is better for airport shuttle as you will be one of the first to be dropped off! Also pretty close to the outlet malls if you are going to check those out (but I wouldn't, thought it was a waste of half a day and cab fare). We had breakfast buffet vouchers included with our stay, which we took advantage of each morning, one less expensive meal to pay for is a good thing in a place as pricey as Vegas! I honestly wouldn't pay for the buffet given the option, the food just wasn't that good. The resort fee was a little silly, especially given that the pool area is still under construction. Also, wifi should come free with these big hotels. But I guess the resort fee is becoming a standard for many of the strip hotels. I think perhaps they shouldn't be charging as much or at all in the cooler months when you cannot take advantage of the pools. We also had a very nice meal at Biscayne, we purchased a voucher with our show tickets which enabled us 50% off any entree (but not crab or lobster which they dont tell you until after you purchase), and we both really enjoyed our meal. All in all, I think the Tropicana is a good value for your money as long as you don't mind being on that end of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: Ilovevacations5
Reviews.Content: We travelled with our 3 children (11,12,16 years old). We really enjoyed our stay. We had two communicating rooms in the club tower. It was quiet and clean. The staff was helpfull and friendly. The beds are very comfortable and we could open the windows to get some fresh air instead of always having the fan on. It's a good location. We walked the Strip to all the attractions. To make it perfect, I would've liked a mini fridge in the room to store a few snacks and juices but otherwise I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: small2006
Reviews.Content: We only spent one night at the Trop but loved it. Had a great size room overlooking the strip in the Paradise tower, very comfy bed, lovely shower and toiletries. We also liked the location on the strip, right across from the New York New York which has a great pizza place. Would definitely stay again. Good value for money. Don't use the hotel phone though! $14 dollars for less than a minute! Learnt my lesson!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: w0rldtraveller68
Reviews.Content: We visited most of the hotels on the strip and apart from the Bellagio and Caesars Palace (expensive) the Tropicana was the most attractive hotel by miles and great value (we booked via Netflights). If you book this hotel, I doubt you will regret it. Great location - if you want to walk the whole strip (it's a distance!) get the monorail from the MGM (across the road) and travel to the Stratosphere (well very near to) and walk back (make sure you go to the top of the Stratosphere for the views and to watch the brave people jumping off or taking part in the extreme rides). There is also a free tram from the Excalibar (to the side of the Tropicana) to the Luxor and Mandalay (save your feet!). Finally, we had a great meal at Joe's - a treat restaurant (not cheap but fab food) near Caesar's Palace hotel. I had seafood and my partner steak. Both meals were gorgeous and the service was great

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad, and The...”
Reviews.Author: Wamprunner
Reviews.Content: OK, it's actually more like "The Really Good and The Just OK". My wife and I stayed here with another couple from 3/3 to 3/10. As many have mentioned, the TropLV has a very distinct "white" theme going on, which is fine as it gives an open air tropical feeling to the whole place. Everything was clean and new looking with one fairly big exception that I'll get to later. Check in and check out was very fast (5 minutes each) with almost no lines. The people in the hotel were very helpful and friendly. Me and my buddy used the $20 sandwich trick I'd read about and got our rooms slightly upgraded to the "deluxe plus" for free for the entire week. And to tell the truth, I think we may have gotten it without the trick. My room was a 15th floor corner unit in the rear Club tower next to Tropicana Ave. Our friends got the same unit on the 18th floor. I have to admit, since they weren't that crowed when we arrived, I was hoping for a bit more like a small suite, but no dice... oh well, I tried. The view of the strip was limited to the side of the MGM and to the airport. Overall, it was just OK for a free upgrade, but I wouldn't pay any extra for these rooms. I was a bit underwelmed by them overall. The rooms were mostly nice and clean. The beds were very comfortable. The windows open a crack if you want a little fresh air. Nice TV with several useful selections, although who watches TV in Vegas. The WiFi reception was mostly very good in our room. The "exception" I mentioned above had to do with room cleaning. My wife noticed that they didn't clean the floor and sink area in the bathroom all that well. And one time we got a towel with some unidentified stain, that was gross. And the bathrooms, at least in the Club tower, apparently were not part of the overall renovations they did last year. The tile and fixtures were noticably older and worn and didn't match the otherwise bright decor at all. Very disappointing bathrooms for an other wise polished facility. Also, our friends room had a bathroom door that had been kicked in and splintered by someone before they arrived. It took them two days and and several calls to the front desk to get somebody to even come look at it. Then they only removed the door and never replaced it during our friends 1 week stay. You'd think they'd have some extra doors handy... but no. BTW, don't listen to all the whiners that complain about the walk being so long from the rear Club tower. It was no more then 5 easy uncrowded minutes mostly across a bright and scenic passageway over the pool areas from our room to reach the Strip. And our room was about as far from the front as you can get in the hotel. I'll bet we made that trip 40 times during the week stay and it was never a burden at all. It was actually kind of nice. Compare it to the equally long or much longer walks through crowded, dark, noisey casino's, you have to make in any of the other bigger strip hotels, and you start to really appreciate the somewhat lower key Tropicana. Finally, the TropLV's location on the strip is ideal. Again, don't listen to the whiners about it's being to far south on the strip. I swear some people can't walk 10 feet without complaining. It's a short 15-20 minute walk to City Center and several of the major casinos. And if you are physically incapable of walking very far there is good access (5-10 minutes) to 3 of the 4 strip trams and the bus routes are even closer. It's also very close to the airport and just off the major highways if you want to head out of town for a trip to the Grand Canyon or the Hoover Dam. Is the place perfect... heck no... but for the reasonable cost, I think you'll find it hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Nice Remodel”
Reviews.Author: Houstontravellovers
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at the hotel. We had a great experience. Our room was clean, our bed was comfortable, and everything worked well. Parking was free and easy to get in and out of. We played at the tables and slots at the Tropicana but most days we walked or drove to other casinos or attractions. I would request a room at the front tower. We were in the back "club" tower. Each time you walk to your room in the club tower you have to walk an extra couple hundred yards. The only thing we did not like was the wait at the dining buffet. This restaurant was called the beach café. We waited an 10 to 25 minutes to get seated on three different mornings but when we got seated the place was about half full. This happed the three times we ate in the hotel. The food was great though. A good idea is to bring a soft sided cooler. The ice buckets will only hold two beers. Las Vegas has nice places to stay but we were pleasantly surprised with the Tropicana. Good value at 50 dollars a night plus $15 resort fee per night.

Reviews.Title: “The Trop is an amazing value”
Reviews.Author: canuck169
Reviews.Content: I walked though this old school hotel a couple of years ago and thought I should maybe throw out my shoes. Old and dank. Tripadvisor reviews convinced things were very different now, and they were. The staff was all very friendly and helpful and checking in was swift. The casino is bright and beautiful now, with bright marble floors and rich carpets. The walk to the rear hotel tower is a bit of a haul, but manageable. Room was great in all respects, though the bathroom tiles showed some age. Room had a safe and big screen TV with enough channels. I was at the end of the hotel hallway, facing the airport. So no view, but that's not a big deal after 16 visits. I don't gamble so can't say anything useful about that experience, but the place is handy to the strip and across from the MGM and the monorail that runs to the convention center. The pool and gardens area already looked large and good, but they were in the midst of painting or re-tiling the pools. I had passes for the buffet and used it everyday. There was always fresh fruit NOT out of a can, yogurt, smoked salmon, an omelet station and the usual eggs, bacon and other buffet stuff. There is a $15 resort fee but my total bill per day was less than $70/night. Highly recommend the new Trop.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: rsindelar
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels on The Strip, and this hotel is quickly becoming one of the best! Their extensive renovations are wonderful! The room was decorated beautifully. The bed was extremely comfortable. Extremely impressed with all the work they have done here...would definitely recommend The Trop now!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Bay5
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was the best. What a difference the remodeling makes! I love that the casino is smaller than most - we are not walking acres to get anywhere. Not enough restaurant choices for you? Then just go across the street to New York New York and eat your heart out. Every morning my wonderful husband went down to Starbucks to fetch me a coffee and scone - then we were ready for the day. The staff was very friendly. From Linda at check-in to every housekeeper and bartender.Loved our room in the Paradise tower - good location and great view. The lobby also has a rent a car booth. We rented a car for 24 hours right from the Tropicana parking lot. We were able to drive to the Factory Outlets down the strip and then over to Red Rock Canyon to see the beautiful scenery. Our last night we treated ourselves to dinner at the Biscayne. A lovely steak dinner was served in an elegant setting. We will return to the Tropicanan.

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: jasonsportslee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 4 different hotels in Vegs during our Honeymoon in February, while the Wynn Encore was probably the nicest, Tropicana was easily the best value. It was the only place that upgraded our room for us to a corner suite with a view and their renovations were very aparent. We found the room through Hotwire so didn't know it would be Tropicana when we paid. I can honestly say I was somewhat dissappointed to see "Tropicana" would be our place as a 4 star stay, but upon seeing the "INSIDE" of the hotel and our room, I was very pleasantly surprised. Our only regret it that we were there in February and didn't get to take advantage of their beautiful pool setting. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Personalized service”
Reviews.Author: Leah J
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana offered our group everything we needed. Extra towels whenever we needed them. The best part was we were on a marketing trip and the Trop arranged for us to meet with their marketing department and gave us some great insight!

Reviews.Title: “Renovated -- but just a hotel”
Reviews.Author: VanCanucksFan
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews that the place was renovated before I got there....so I booked there. It was clean, but nothing really special. It's located on the southern part of the strip, so getting to the central part is about a half an hour walk. They said checkout was at 11am, but they extended it until noon free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: JC F
Reviews.Content: Had an amazing time at the New Tropicana, as a birthday present to my girlfriend we got one of the suites for her and her family over her birthday weekend. The suite was great, wonderful view, neat, super clean and very comfortable. To follow up, they have the best live entertainment at their launge, great music, dancing and the staff was super friendly. Definately a place to go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice.”
Reviews.Author: markm55555
Reviews.Content: Was very impressed with the room on the 14th floor of the Club Tower. Everything about the room top to bottom, including electrical outlets, furniture, baseboards, wall coverings, everything about the bathroom is completely new. Garden tub/shower was nice. Club Tower is directly over top of the convention center and very convenient for meetings. Casino is not huge, but was bright and not smokey. Only downside of the Club Tower location is that it is a bit of a walk from the registration desk (which is also new and attractive). Closest major casino hotel to the airport, and quick walk to MGM, New York New York, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful suite”
Reviews.Author: shelingas_sis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night in early March 2012 after a trip to Death Valley and before flying home. We got a good deal on a suite so we stayed in a Club Spa Suite and it was wonderful. We had a very large room, with a sitting area with a bar and dining table. The bedroom was large with a whirlpool tub and the bathroom was great with a sauna and steam shower. It was a perfect place to end our trip. The casino was small, but very well ventallated and pleasant to be in. The hotel has been recently renovated and it shows. We ate dinner at Bacio's and it was excellent as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fresh look, clean and Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: lajababu
Reviews.Content: Its really nice after multi million dollar renovation ... although at extreme end of strip .. but still connected ... Casino not top class .. but still nice ...

Reviews.Title: “An oasis at the south end of the Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: GreenTraveler9
Reviews.Content: The infamous Strip is an intentionally overwhelming place, an extravaganza for the senses. The Tropicana is an intermediate choice between the bigger resorts (from the MGM Grand right across the street, all the way north to the Wynn) and hotel only options such as the Westin. It has a casino, nightclub and restaurants, but the scale is smaller and pace a bit slower. It has a lovely pool, very good restaurants and is surprisingly quiet given its proximity to McCarran Airport. I'd happily stay here again while in Vegas. The rooms are comfortable, reasonably well appointed and a good value. No refrigerator or in-room coffee service. If you want classy opulence, go to the Venetian. Alas, the walls are thin so I could overhear activity and conversations in adjoining rooms, but they were otherwise very quiet. The staff was helpful and friendly (arranging for late check out was easier than I expected), but be prepared for a noisy check-in; there is music from the casino blasting away in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, really good price!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cyn802Rod
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tropicana from March 23 - 25, it was my first time in Vegas and i was there for a friends wedding. I searched alot for a good deal at a nice hotel. After looking ove tons of deals at big fancy hotels and small really gross but very cheap hotels i chose the Tropicana. Orbitz quoted this hotel at $144/per night, but i found a great deal at $85/per night!!!! I chose this hotel becasue its located right on the strip and it was newly renovated, all the beds and furniture are brand new. Still for the price i paid i new i wasnt getting 5 star accomodations... but when we arrived i was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is very nice and clean, the rooms are very nice and the bed was very comfortable. We had a great view of the strip. The staff was GREAT!!!! We got great tips on off strip dinning from some of the staff and they were always very helpful when we called for extra towels and cups.

Reviews.Title: “"From inside to outside"”
Reviews.Author: elvis4evr
Reviews.Content: For 18 years I have been attending the Creative Painting Covention, which started out at the Sahara Hotel for about 5 years, then it was held at the OLD Tropicana. Though we liked it.....especially the location, as time went on like old Icon's it was starting to show it's age etc. Many problems arose like water leaks etc. It is now absolutely gorgeous...very airy, pleasing to the eye, wonderful staff and whoever chose the decor did a great job... it now really appeals to a younger crowd, but without the dark, smoky loudness....it's grounds are so exotic....makes you feel like you're really far away...they've kept a lot of it's historicness without complelely tearing it all down. Kudo's to blending the old with the new! I like the new little shops that are near two great restaurant's...a steak house that everyone says is outstanding, and an Italian one that really has family appeal, as well as a special occasion, or just a dinner for two!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent again !”
Reviews.Author: Ian H
Reviews.Content: I had a week in the Tropicana at the end of February 2012. I cannot find any faults, very clean, fresh, friendly staff, great location ... and being an aviation enthusiast, my room on the 17th Floor in the Island Tower gave me a great view of the airport with minimal noise disturbance from the early morning departures. Highly recommended .... see you next year !!!

Reviews.Title: “The Tropicana is much improved and only getting better with all the renovations.”
Reviews.Author: GT1inSoCal
Reviews.Content: The welcome at the front desk was great. The room was very spacious and had a great view. The bar had a great happy hour for guests. Was overall very satisfied with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pluses and Minuses”
Reviews.Author: aeternam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights 6 adults and 2 toddlers celebrating several B-days within our group. I was hesitant at first but decided to give the Trop a try when our much larger with kitchen 1st choice fell through. I did call ahead with several questions regarding some concerns we had...like no fridge in room, location of rooms, and amenities around. Unfortunately after 2 emails I only received replies back after our stay was over...sigh. The re-model looks to be completely finished and the standard was good for the price. As others have mentioned the coconut scent is strong and we did notice remnants in the rooms as well - tolerable but we would of preferred a more subtle scent or none at all. We ended up with 2 connecting rooms and one stand alone room all in the Paradise tower all double queen beds. The rooms were fine and connecting room was particularly convenient for the kids to run back and forth between during the day. As others have mentioned the windows are covered by horizontal wooden shutters but if you turn the shutters up and not down it does block out more light and wasn't a issue for us which we were concerned about with kids. The rooms have no fridge (they quoted us $25 per night extra to have fridge brought up) and no complimentary water but you do have a vending machine down the hall with drinks and the gift shop first level near the exit does carry all the basics...drinks, snacks, small sandwiches, etc.....You can also go the MGM casino floor for slightly larger gift shop with similar items. Otherwise walk further up the strip past MGM about 10 minutes to ABC store/Walgreens. The pizza and other basic items at the food court was fine and reasonable quality and price. We ate at Nikki Cafe for breakfast and did enjoy the buffet breakfast - Not too much variety but quality of what they did have was good and made up for the lack of variety. Location of hotel was convenient and being in Paradise tower was a short stroll the the neighboring properties. We saw 'KA' at the MGM which was also a short walk over. We used the monorail on the first day but ended up taking taxi's rest of our stay which worked out to be much more convenient and not much more in price. The casino at the Trop as the others mentioned was bright and dealers friendly. Although not very full it was probably one of the more fun atmospheres to hit the tables for the casual gambler. Overall there was nothing really exceptional about the hotel or our stay but nothing that was very wrong either. Not sure I would stay here again but probably offers good value for the location and being remodeled.

Reviews.Title: “Wow...the Trop is all new and much improved”
Reviews.Author: BMY2011
Reviews.Content: The last time I stayed at the Tropicana was 10 years ago. It was old, worn out and smelled like cigarettes. Five years ago I walked through the casino on another Vegas trip and it was just depressing. Based on these experiences, I'll admit I was a little disappointed when it came up as a four-star hotel option on Hotwire. I shouldn't have worried. The minute I walked into the new Trop it became clear that it is not the same place. The lobby is white and clean with a hip modern look. I went with a couple of friends and we reserved adjoining rooms in the Club Tower. Both rooms had a view of the Strip, were a good size and had all-new furniture. The beds were clean and comfortable with nice linens and duvet covers. If I have a complaint it's that the renovations to the bathrooms are somewhat superficial. The tub/shower combo and toilet still feel a little cheap and to me that's the real distinguishing feature between the Trop and some of the higher-end hotels in Vegas. That said, as someone who normally stays at the Bellagio but wanted to save a little money on this trip, I could not have been happier with the Trop and would absolutely go back if I was in the market for a nice hotel that's a little cheaper than the five-star options. It was a pleasant surprise in every way. Even if I didn't stay here, I would definitely come back to gamble. The casino is bright, clean and well-lit. The dealers are friendly and pleasant and the crowd is "normal," neither snobby nor trashy. The casino is also much less crowded than some others and has relatively low table limits. We were able to play $10 blackjack (with blackjack paying 3-2) and $5 craps even on Friday and Saturday nights without fighting crowds. There were also plenty of cheap slot and video poker machines. Every time my friends and I ventured out to other casinos on the Strip, we ended up comparing them to the Trop and deciding we'd rather go back there to play. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Better than it looks! Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Vdv12
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights as the second part of our Vegas stay. Our first stay was at a very upmarket hotel at the north end of the strip so at first glance we thought we'd be disappointed with Tropicana. In fact it's very good value, clean, quiet, comfortable and in a great location at the south end of the strip. We stayed in Club Tower which is a bit of a walk from the main entrance, would probably stay in Paradise Tower next time. Like most hotels in Vegas they have a "signature scent" and unfortunately Tropicana's was overwhelmingly coconut but at least not in the rooms. Buffet breakfast good value at $18.99 and good selection to start the day. There is a Starbucks in house but if you want decent coffee go to Illy at The Palazzo Hotel. Overall pleasantly surprised and worth another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Great location”
Reviews.Author: Farahsamir
Reviews.Content: Very clean rooms, very comfortable, nice and friendly staff, haven't tried the food as I booked an offer on a room-only basis. The hotel is pretty huge and its recently renovated. Nice pool. Great location on the famous las vegas strip. A 5 minute walk to a mall on the right side of the hotel in MGM grand's direction, it has fast food like subway, chinese food etc. Got a bargain online for a flight and accommodation for 3 nights from LA to Vegas for $250 per person on bookit.com

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana February 2012”
Reviews.Author: Donald W
Reviews.Content: I got a fam room at theh Tropicana during February. The room was nice and clean. The furnishings and linens were new and comfortable. I liked the safe built into the dresser where you didn't have to stoop really low to use it. The staff were very friendly. I went down to the registration desk two days after I checked in because I left my key in my room and the desk clerk remembered my name. Very impressive. The entire casino area was well lit and didn't smell as badly of cigarette smoke as other casinos in the area. Overall a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great time, excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: dash4g
Reviews.Content: Stayed at MGM for the first 5 nights in Las Vegas, and it was top-notch. I was honestly feeling a little spoiled there, then I came to Tropicana! We had only booked a 5 night stay at MGM, and due to some unforeseen circumstances, we were able to grab a deal at Tropicana for the remainder of our stay in Vegas (another 3 nights). Wow, great amenities and good vibe from the place. They really do go the extra mile to make your stay enjoyable. Everything is top-notch, I understand they did a renovation recently and our room had a 40" LCD TV and a decent view of the strip. I was thrilled at our stay and would recommend it to anyone going to Las Vegas! We will defiantly be back to the Trop'!

Reviews.Title: “Good room in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Marrowboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in the middle of a coach tour. Gobsmacked initially when walking through the casino to get to reception but found the room to be modern, clean and comfortable. The hotel is an excellent base for exploring the strip and very close to the discount tickets for shows which is outside the MGM. May not be right on the strip but very close.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kathy S
Reviews.Content: The housekeeping staff (especially on the 14th floor), as well as all other staff were so friendly and helpful They all went above board. You could be just walking down an isle and there were always big smiles and hellos.

Reviews.Title: “NOT your parents Tropicana.”
Reviews.Author: Helen D
Reviews.Content: I did not stay at the hotel (but wish I did). I just visited, gambled, ate etc. The staff was amazingly nice at every venue. I loved that the casino was bright and not your normal cave like feeling at most casinos. 5 dollar table games were available, which is rare now. The poker room was very nice and I liked that they have sodas, water, coffee available at all times and you don't have to wait for drink service. We ate at the Beach Cafe and the food was delicious and not expensive. It was nice to find some comfort food mixed in the menu. I had visited the Trop years ago before they remodeled and it was horrendous, so this is not your parents tropicana. I will definitely stay here next time I am in town!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteBater
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tropicana for 10 nights in February/March 2012. It was our first visit to Las Vegas, and we expected everything to be fabulous and were definately not dissappointed. After a slight hic-cup at check-in, we were placed in a room which was not the one requested, after going to sort the problem the next morning, there was another hic-cup and so we left our luggage with the bellman and came back later to have it all sorted. And sorted it was, our luggage had been delivered to our new room, which was a Paradise Suite on the 20th floor! The room amenities were great, huge walk in shower, two massive TVs, the worlds biggest and most comfortable bed and two matching sinks. There were also two large waldrobes with lots of hangers and a large chest of drawers with electronic safe. We didnt eat in the hotel resturants, but the food looked nice on other peoples plates! we did have a very big pizza from the deli, which was only $28, not a bad price we thought. We did a little bit of gambling in the hotel, and the slots were always clean and the drinks girls were plenty and efficient. Overall we had a great stay, and many thanks to the Tropicana for making our first Vegas stay one to remember for all the right reasons!

Reviews.Title: “Bright, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: blesleyj
Reviews.Content: We were on a bit of a budget, as this was a little "exrtra" to celebrate our Sapphire Wedding Anniversary. Although I would have liked a more central location on the Strip, the Trop fitted our price range.the staff were lovely, the room was very clean and comfortable and we couldn't have asked for better.

Reviews.Title: “Champagne quality, beer prices”
Reviews.Author: McGeepers
Reviews.Content: Room type; Club Suite : Stats: Beds; comfy large king. Bathroom; Dual Sinks, nice shower and toilet but no bath. Check in; Professional, extra staff joined in when needed. Overall impression; This the first time I've stayed here and its obvious that the recent renovations have been successful. The Club Suite we stayed in was exactly as described and pictured. There was plenty of space, the shutters are nice and a small fridge is provided. Flat screen tvs are also provided. The staff throughout the hotel from check in to the players club are helpful and knowledgeable. The Club Suite also came with a nightly turndown service which I did not expect. This was a nice touch. The only minor whinge I had, was the fact that the room did not have a bath, which was kind of strange for a room this size. That aside, I'd stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant 'budget' choice on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: petejonno
Reviews.Content: I spent hours researching various strip hotels here on Trip advisor before booking the 'Trop', and overall this hotel was the perfect choice for our party of 7, in Vegas for 9 days in September 2011 to celebrate my 30th birthday. I will try to break this review down into sections so people can pluck the information they require from it. Location At one end of the strip, with MGM Grand, Luxor, Mandalay Bay, New York New York's and Excalibur all within 5 to 10 minutes walk. It is only 20 minutes walk to the center of the strip where Caesars Palace, Paris, The Belagio etc are located. A trip up to Circus Circus or The Stratosphere (highly recommended) is a 10/15 minute taxi ride away. The best thing about the location for us was the close proximity to the Hooters Hotel, and not for the reasons you may be thinking! Vegas is a very expensive city to drink in, with most places selling bottles of beer at between $5 and $8. Hooters had bottles of Bud and Bud Light on what looked like a permanent promotion for $1.50. You can appreciate the savings, so we would always start our nights out here. It also has some of the cheapest tables to gamble at, not to mention the 25 cents chicken wings! Word of advice, get yourself an 'owl card', which is free, and you'll get discounts at the restaurant including this one. Rooms For the price we paid for this hotel we could not have asked for more! Huge rooms with comfortable beds, large safe, plenty of storage, massive flat screen TV and nice big bathrooms, all of which were kept very clean by the maids. The bathroom itself was the only bit which had only a partial refurbishment but it was still fine, the rest of the room however was brand new and looked amazing. The air conditioning was a little noisy but worked really well. The view we had from our room was absolutely awesome, straight out over New York New York, MGM and Excalibur, it was a great thing to go to bed and wake up to! Casino The Casino was all brand new and looked great, with a very classy 'light and airy' feel in comparison to some of the larger, older ones which seemed very dark, sometimes even a bit grim. It was however very small compared to most of the larger themed hotels, and lacked the buzz and atmosphere that made others so exciting to be in. Its worth visiting if you have a room at the Trop, but probably not worth a trip if you stay elsewhere. Which leads me onto the last part of my review, the hotel as a whole. Hotel/Resort The Trop is quite different to a lot of the other hotels we visited in terms of there doesn’t seem to be the 'wow' factor get from other strip hotels. Don’t get me wrong, staying here was awesome as it has amazing rooms at a great price, in a great location, with one of the best pool areas in Vegas, however I wouldn’t necessarily visit it as a spectacle as I would others. It just lacks the extravagance and unique features of the other hotels that left me with my jaw on the floor: the fountains at the Belagio, the volcano at the Mirage, pirate show and Treasure Island, the sheer opulence of the Wynn and Encore etc. If you bare this in mind and treat the Trop as an unbeatable value for money base from which to explore the rest of Vegas, with a great pool to chill out if you need some down time, and beautiful modern rooms, you will not be disappointed! I saw every hotel on the strip, and if I return to Vegas I will stay at the Tropicana again, I think that says it all!

Reviews.Title: “Simply superb”
Reviews.Author: nbarnett86
Reviews.Content: As this was our first time to Vegas we did quite a bit of research before booking our holiday. The Tropicana had by far the best reviews for the hotels within our price range and they certainly weren't wrong! We stayed in the Paradise Tower which was great as it was so close (the Club Tower is a bit of a walk from the strip and front desk) and our room had a view of the MGM Grand and up the strip. The rooms were spacious, clean and with the comfiest bed I think we have ever slept in. The casino was light, bright and airy without the smoke smell of other casinos we visited. The staff were all very friendly and we never had to wait more than a few minutes to get a drink whilst in the casino. There are a few dining options ranging from a Starbucks to a steak and seafood restaurant. We only ate at the Tropicana a couple of times at the Cafe Nikki which was lovely, good quality food at a reasonable price. Overall we would definitely return to the Tropicana on future visits to Vegas. It had a friendly and welcoming atmosphere that we didn't see at many other strip hotels. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: SunHol1
Reviews.Content: As first time visitors to Vegas the Tropicana was perfect. It was light, bright and newly renovated. Great value for money and in a good location with easy access to everything. The rooms are very spacious and clean. Ate at the Beach Cafe a few times which looks out onto the pool/grass area with lots of natural light, food was excellent and reasonably priced. Pool area looked amazing but was unfortunatly closed (it was February, so not swimming weather anyway). Our room faced the airport and was surprisingly quiet, also very little noise was heard from other connecting rooms. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OVERALL PLEASANT 3 NIGHT STAY”
Reviews.Author: nALEhead
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at the Tropicana for 3 nights. And the smell of fresh coconuts everywhere is nice! Even the casino floor is void of any typical smoky smells.

Reviews.Title: “First time in vegas, stayed at the Tropicana!”
Reviews.Author: PJ1337
Reviews.Content: For the first time being in vegas, I was thrilled to have gotten such a good deal (used priceline for my flight and hotel booking). The Tropicana was far better than expected, and the location was as convenient as it gets - right next to the airport, and it was right at the beginning of the strip. This actually cuts the walking distance because if I stayed at a hotel in the middle, I'd have to walk all the way to one side of the strip, back to the middle, then all the way to the right side, and back to the middle again. It also saved us the cost of getting a rental. Definitely staying there again next time around, thanks !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Tabatha K
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel during our Vegas vacation. We were a little skeptical about it because we had never been to Vegas, however, once we arrived, we learned that it was an excellent choice. The rooms were super clean, the bed were extremely comfortable, and the hotel alone smelled like fresh coconut. The pool was amazing. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and it was located in an excellent spot on the strip. This was a great choice and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana Las Vegas exceeds expectations”
Reviews.Author: violet794
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Tropicana while attending a conference. I travel all over the US and Canada with my service dog and have never received such excellent attention and service as I did at the Tropicana. I called all of the conference affiliated hotels well ahead of time to check in facilities and areas for my service dog. The front desk put me in contact with security who recommended rooms in close proximity to an exit and relief area. While staying at the conference the entire staff was friendly and helpful beyond my expectations. I will stay there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value & Very Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: Roger L
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for 4 nights while in Vegas for a convention, very pleased with the facility updates. Excellent Room, Very friendly and helpful staff. Very nice atmosphere, enjoyed the Casino and food service options. Would recommend to anyone. Good Value as well.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Tropicana at least once”
Reviews.Author: ESK1M0
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Tropicana Las Vegas. We chose the Tropicana because we heard it was newly renovated and the price was too attractive not to make a reservation. Check-in: It was quick and efficient. We've stayed at other hotels on The Strip and have waited up to 30 minutes just to check-in, but perhaps because the Tropicana is still an unknown gem, our wait was less than five minutes. Our room: Our room was a very large room with two double beds in the Paradise Tower. We found the size comparable to what you would find in the MGM Grand Tower. The room had a flat-screen TV that was relative to the size of the room (it may have been a 42" TV), and unlike other hotels, had channels that played commercial-free music of several genres. The only "low" point was the bathroom. While the room itself appeared to have been renovated, the bathtub enclosure seemed to have the same tiles as when the hotel first opened and the grab-bar was loose and almost fell into the tub. We booked our room without specifically requesting a tower or room. When we checked-in, we requested the Paradise Tower as many TripAdvisor reviews suggested. We were told that it would be $15/night more than our original reservation, on top of the additional $15/night resort fee. We went with it without debate. Our room faced The Strip, but toward the Luxor and Mandalay Bay. It was not a horrible view at all. The Paradise Tower is found at the front of the building, so guests do not have to walk through the casino to get to a room, which was a convenience for us. The location: The Tropicana is directly across the street from the MGM Grand (where we stayed in previous visits), so we were very familiar with the area. There is a transit stop outside of the hotel/casino that heads northward on The Strip. In general, the Tropicana is in a great location and is easy to access by foot and vehicle. The staff: Everyone from the reception desk to the cleaning staff to the 'food court' staff were nothing but pleasant. Our philosophy is that if you are nice and have a smile, people will be nice and smile back. The dealers at the tables were also very pleasant and seemed to enjoy conversations with tourists. Because of our flight, we had to check out around 4am. The Trop Plus rewards desk was closed, but reception was able to find someone quickly so that we can apply any credits we accumulated toward our bill. We found that the comps with Trop Plus were very generous, compared to other hotel/casinos. In our three night stay, we were able to have the additional $15/night Paradise Tower fee and our resort fees comp'd, giving us a $90 savings on our bill. A negative: Some people may not like the overt coconut/vanilla scent of the casino, but it grows on you. Plus, we much preferred the coconut/vanilla scent over the industrial cleaning soap scent that is at the MGM Grand. Also, our room facing The Strip made things a little noisy. We didn't mind, but others might not enjoy the sounds of ambulance sirens at 3am. Overall, give the Tropicana a try. They renovated the hotel and casino and it shows. The prices are good in relation to its location, room size and overall pleasantness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Becky671
Reviews.Content: The first thing I noticed when I opened the door was the fresh smell. There wasn't the smell of smoke that you generally smell at a casino. The hotel staff was so friendly and the rooms were clean and the beds so comfortable. I would highly recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rob2031
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the paradise tower we had a great room with views of the strip. The location was fantastic and the staff were very freindly the only dissapointment was no coffee or tea making facilties in room.The grounds and pool area are one of the best in vegas. overall for our first stay in vegas the tropicana was great!

Reviews.Title: “first visit to Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Marianne B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found the Tropicana outstanding, in great friendly hospitality, the rooms were great and very clean.We found the Tropicana quaint with a nice atmosphere that made us feel very comfortable during our stay. The staff were great, friendly,and so helpful in everyway. We will be back to the Tropicana.The food was awesome with a friendly staff. Joerg and Marianne Berger Grimsby, Ontario, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: sarah2747
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a friend in a room on the 14th floor. It was a good size, clean, with comfortable bed and bedding. We had a room adjoining another and we could hear people talking in the room next door. It would have been great to have warm weather, as the beach club / pool area is very nice. Ate at the steak restaurant - very yummy but sides were sold separately (never seen that before!). Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “South Beach in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: johnecheveste
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana has always occupied one of the top spots on the Strip with one of the best pool areas. But the property was fixed in a 60's funk. Now with the same great location, pool and name, the hotel has been transformed into a South Beach oasis without the sand. This isn't a glossing over of the property, but a complete re-do from top to bottom. The entire property is done up in cool shades of white with modern furniture and fixtures. The room are spacious and attractive, and the staff is attentive and eager to please. The entire hotel is understated in a pleasing, calming way. Restaurants on property are sophisticated and classy. Best of all, the rates are among the best on the Strip. Overall, a great Vegas experience.

Reviews.Title: “Recycled Percussion”
Reviews.Author: littlegypsyau
Reviews.Content: A wonderful show! Apparently they were on America's got talent, or some such show. Great audience interaction. Upon entry you are given a drum stick and get to choose from an array of recycled 'instruments' such as metal dog dishes, plastic buckets, one guy even had an oxygen tank lol. Took my 7yr grand daughter and she absolutely loved it as did I. At the completion of the show, the guys are there to have photographs taken with you and they are warm and friendly, you can also buy different souveniers such as t-shirts, drumsticks, which my grand daughter bought and played on every wall on the way back to our hotel. We were even moved up to a VIP table. Highly recommend for a good fun night out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, wouldn't hesitate to stay again”
Reviews.Author: BethSko
Reviews.Content: We got a good price on our Deluxe Plus room via i4vegas.com (averaged $80/night) with arrival on Friday, check out on Monday. Although we had never stayed there prior to renovations so we've no point of comparison, we thought it looked great. It's very bright and clean. All of the staff was courteous, clean and helpful. The casino isn't terribly large and doesn't have the virtual dealer games but all of the popular games are there and the sports book seemed fine. Check-in was pretty quick and our clerk, Ladonna, was very helpful. Our room was clean, bed comfortable, would've liked some pillow options and softer towels but overall - okay. Wi-fi was disappointing with very spotty service. For food, we really enjoyed dinner at the Biscayne Steak & Seafood - big hint: make your reservation through tix4tonight - http://www.tix4tonight.com/ - prior to dining but you need to do so before the ticket office closes at 5:00 PM! We also enjoyed a late lunch at the Beach Cafe - very tasty, clean and reasonably priced. The Starbucks located adjacent to the casino in the South Beach Marketplace also appeared to be open 24/7- YAY! On Saturday night, there was an awesome band in the casino with an awesome singer! Now the only bad part - my partner's Android tablet "disappeared" from our room on Sunday. Nothing - including 2 ipods and an expensive camera - was disturbed on previous days. We filed a report with Joanna in Hotel Security on Sunday night. She was very courteous and seemed to be genuinely concerned about our loss... but realistically, we'll never see it again. Lesson learned to lock up your valuables. All in all, I would definitely recommend this hotel, just be sure to secure your stuff.

Reviews.Title: “It's getting there”
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Trop. I truly see all of the changes, and I think they are almost there. They still have a few locations that they are working on, and most of the changes are for the better. The rooms are all remodeled, at least in the Paradise Tower. In the rooms, they have placed an adhesive on the outside of all of the windows which looks like little circles. I'm not sure as to why, other than it keeps the all-white color scheme on the outside. This makes it a little hard to see out, especially for those of us who enjoy the views. The casino also appears to have a scent of pina colada throughout. At times it is a bit overwhelming, and makes its way to the lower floors of the hotel. I like the location, across from New York New York, MGM Grand and Excalibur. The pool is fantastic if you are lucky enough to stay during the time of year that it is open. If you don't want to hear sirens all day and night, keep your windows closed. It appears that Tropicana and Las Vegas Boulevard is a main route for emergency vehicles responding to calls with red lights and sirens on.

Reviews.Title: “I miss the old Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: JmichelleM
Reviews.Content: Ive been going to the Tropicana for years its my home away from home. I loved the special attention they always gave and the friendliness. My last trip there was a real eye opener. I couldnt get a hold of a casino host for the first two days and when I finally did they were rude. After arriving home I was still trying to straighten out billing issues and issues with my gold card account with no replies. Its just not the same. After bringing my brothers with me on this trip and bragging up the Tropicana and how amazing it is I left pretty humiliated as that was not the case. We had no hot water to shower during the trip unless we showered at 7pm which seems to be when it was "our turn" for hot water. Day three at 9 am after a long night of gambling and partying there was some kind of god aweful alarm going off in the hallway which is something that normally would have just been a "funny holiday story" if the rest of the trip wasnt so aweful. I felt like the Tropicana is just focused on bringing in a new crowd and the people who have loved it faithfully for years just dont matter anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Club Tower Suite”
Reviews.Author: bez11378
Reviews.Content: The renovations are so amazing and beautiful, and way more affordable than other places on the strip. Great place to stay and play. Very caring and acommodating staff. Much, much more than I was expecting. Would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AHarris73903
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week in the Tropicana on the strip in Vegas and I was really glad we did. The hotel has been through some great renovations, the lobby is very crisp and clean with the white marble flooring, modern furnishings and lighting. We stayed on the 20th floor in the paradise tower and were very pleased with the room, great view, very clean, nice comfy bed and QUIET! The staff were great, friendly and helpful. The casino was very small compared to the other casino's on the strip but it did lend itself to a more cozy, intimate and quiet atmosphere. We felt it was a great place to come "home" too after a long day of sightseeing and we will be staying there again - you can't go wrong with this choice!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room not so great bathroom”
Reviews.Author: SailAwaySanDiego
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in a dozen different 4/5 star hotels on the strip. We really like the decor and the casino. The club suite was nice and big with a refrigerator and coffee pot. The bathroom was really lacking though. No bathtub and an awkward door set up into the bathroom. It felt more like a not so great hilton bathroom. So if there had been a soaking tub we would have been inclined to return. Even with a groupon deal at $149 a night we felt this was a little overpriced considering you can get a room for the same price at The Hotel or The Signature MGM, which are nicer in my opinion. Bacio & Biscayne were nice restaurants on the property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Updated Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: AZ_Hotelier
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely one of the older names left on the strip, but you wouldn't know how old this hotel actually is by the look of the rooms. Very nicely updated! Would definitely come back here again. Not only are the rooms updated, but the Front Desk and Casino area are also much cleaner and nicer looking than in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana is our "Home Away From Home"”
Reviews.Author: Curt M
Reviews.Content: Love it ! ~ Love it ! ~ We were so pleased that most of the renovations are complete, such a beautiful property. The place looks great and so many wonderful new amenities. Love all the new slot machine choices. We played...we had fun! We really enjoyed the show "Reclycled Percussion" with our family from Phoenix. It was a great interactive attraction to share with the grand kids. The performance was amazing. My wife raved about her Salmon entree @ Cafe' Nikki and said it was the best she had ever had (even though she worked @ a fine dining seafood restaurant on the water front in San Diego for 23 years). We had dinner two nights out of three @ Cafe' Nikki, so she could order her salmon again and get her fill. The staff is the best on the strip, always friendly and just make you feel so welcome. You just can not beat the location, service with a smile and comfy accomidations. Tropicana will always be the place for us! Currently saving to come back in a few months! Thanks again to their great staff for a job well done. Sincerely, Curt Mundt

Reviews.Title: “Treated GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: chantesinging
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at the Tropicana...my first impression was "ahh" You were greated by a doorman, & the scent of the tropics ushers you in, the facility is very light and airy with a plantation feel, Its VERY clean, and the staff were ALL FRIENDLY! our room had a view of the stip and was immaculate, and when we had a bit of trouble with the personal "safe" I called the front desk, was greated by name on the phone and someone was up in minutes to fix the safe. The pool was closed for the season but the grounds are still VERY BEAUTIFUL! Tropicana had some resturants, 2 starbucks, cafe style eating and some little shops. Its conviently located across from excalaber(which has a tram that will take you to Mandalay Bay,and Luxor) and new york new york, all worth walking to but much darker and louder establishments, This would be a great place for a romantic get away.

Reviews.Title: “New Las Vegas secret”
Reviews.Author: Balksta
Reviews.Content: Like a beautiful butterfly emerging from a cocoon the Tropicana has evolved into a wonderful new destination on the Las Vegas strip. Ultra clean, bright and fresh, everyday was a joy at the new Trop. Just spent a week there and could not fault a thing. Rooms are large, very clean and well kept, dinning choice and quality excellent, the casino floor is bright and friendly and easy to navigate. The staff were all great and looked after us like we were family. As regular visitors to Las Vegas over the past 16 years we have tried most of the hotels on the strip and the Trop is one we certainly highly recommend. Best wishes, Garry & Helen, Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Good value!”
Reviews.Author: Christine M
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vegas so we thought we would try the Tropicana since it was a well known hotel. We got a very good deal to stay there for 5 nights. The hotel has just undergone renovations and was very nice. Our room was very nice, clean and the bed very comfortable. We were not able to use the pool area, so when we checked out I mentioned that I was disappointed that we could not use the pool and the resort fee was waived. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great trip!”
Reviews.Author: Jami C
Reviews.Content: I had a conference at the MGM but couldn't afford their prices. Stayed at the Tropicana and loved it. Great room, very clean and quiet. The casino does overly smell of coconut, but everyone was friendly and helpful. Easy access to the MGM and I saw one of their rooms, and mine was nicer for half the price! Didn't get to use to pool as it was closed, but looked like a beautiful area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, Great Location and Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: SLC11292
Reviews.Content: We spent a lovely weekend at this wonderful resort in February 2012. The lobby, room and other public locations were nicely designed with a tropical motif. Room and bath were clean; Beds were fantastic! Excellent value! We highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet hotel close to all the action”
Reviews.Author: wparades
Reviews.Content: The Trop was a great place to stay for my short stay in Vegas. The room was large, quiet, and comfortable. Great for getting a few hours of sleep before hitting the strip again. The casino is not that large and there are not many things to draw people staying at other hotels into the Trop, plus it is near the end of the strip. This is actually what makes the Trip a great place to stay. Easy walk to any of the other casinos without having to but up with all the noise and crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Asked to leave pool area. would be charged with Tresspassing if we do not leave”
Reviews.Author: PaulineHenderson
Reviews.Content: Usually love this hotel, been many times. They closed the pool on us and asked us to leave the area. It was a beautiful sunny day. Would not even let us sit in the area!!!!!!.Winter time. Not happy at all. They lost my Birthday basket sent from a friend.,It was sent to a room i was supposed to be in, but was changed at last minute. could not even find the card so i could see who it was from, they sent a replacement and i got a free dinner, but my friend was ANNOYED as it was NOT what she paid for.and i was not told it was replaced by them. The company are not at all happy where it was sent from. They did not charge us the resort fee because we complained.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: WIbadger79
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 6 nights in mid-February for a conference. We didn't try the restaurants. There isn't much around as far as places to grab food but there is a Starbucks and a small cafeteria. The pool wasn't open, so I can't comment on that. We had a strip view, otherwise the view would be the airport. Pros: -Easy walk to MGM, Excalibur, etc -Comfortable, clean bedding -Good TV -Good room security -Non-smoking room didn't smell like smoke -Friendly staff Cons: -No in room fridge -Club Tower is a bit of a hike from main hotel -Casino is very, very warm and has a strong "tropical" smell -Thin walls -If noise bothers you, the nightclub below can be very loud.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: VegasSpecialist
Reviews.Content: A lower level of expectation could be assumed if having just checked out of the Bellagio, a traveler then checked into the Tropicana for two nights. However, I was not only pleasantly surprised by the fresh, clean look of the "new" Tropicana, but I actually loved staying there! It certainly can't be compared to the luxurious 5 star Bellagio, but the crisp smart look of the casino as well as the new plantation-style decor put me at ease the moment I walked into our suite. I reserved a Paradise suite overlooking Las Vega Blvd facing north. The view was fantastic, particularly at night and I loved the fact that I could actually open my windows rather than slide open a small slot in the base of a window frame to allow the cool night air into the room. I was also astonished by the size of the Paradise suite. It was huge! You could throw a party for 15 people and still have room to dance! The parlor area had a credenza that housed a mini refrigerator where I found several complimentary bottles of water. On top of the credenza sat a 42" plasma HD TV (there was another one in the bedroom) as well as a Keurig coffee maker with all supplies necessary to make a fresh brew and get me started in the morning. The credenza also had a built-in mini sink. A second credenza allowed for plenty of storage of whatever you might want to put in there. As to the new decor, the parlor contained a desk and two chairs a very comfortable chaise lounge and ottoman wrapped in antique cream colored, ultra sued. The cardinal colored daybed-style couch was framed by dark amber bamboo which gave it more warmth. The color pallet of the suite consisted of honey and chestnut woods, bamboo, cream colored walls with accents of cardinal red. Though it had a fresh updated look, I decor gave me a sense of being transported back to the hip Rat-Pack era where Frank, Dean and Sammy once gathered to plan their casino heist in "Oceans Eleven," and I liked that very much. As to the staff, 99% of them went over the top in the friendliness and helpful category, almost to the point of being obsequious in the case of one gentleman who delivered a meal to our room. Speaking of room service, the menu is quite limited, but they will try their best to accommodate your requests even if a particular item you crave is not on their menu. Again, this was just another example of how hard they try to make your stay as pleasant as possible. The only complaints I had was with a slightly rude parking valet attendant (though all the others were terrific) and the less than satisfactory room cleaning service I received. The person who "cleaned" our suite didn't dust the nightstand where some talcum powder had landed nor did she empty the ashtray in the parlor. I always clean and tidy my room before I leave it so there is never much for a cleaning person to do and I always leave a tip every day. There's no excuse for missing those things because neither was hard to miss. For anyone who has seen the pool area and the mature tropical landscaping surrounding it, you'll understand what I mean when I call it a tropical paradise. For those who have not seen it, even if you don't plan to go swimming, you HAVE to take a walk along the jaw-dropping trails of the landscaped pool area. Oh and bring your camera with you. As a professional travel consultant, I stayed at the Tropicana principally to do a sight inspection of the new renovation. What I never expected was to find myself so pleased and happy to be staying there. Would I go back again? Oh hell yes, in a New York minute. The only recommendations I would make is for better oversight of the room cleaning staff and an expanded room service menu. Other than that, Tropicana managed to hit one out of the park. Way to go Tropicana and congratulations!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Randy1967
Reviews.Content: Newly remolded with great sports book and friendly staff. Price is right. This is our 4th stay here and like the location and pace.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great value for money, good end of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: EbonyM_11
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at Hotel Tropicana they allowed us to check into our room early which was a nice suprise. Staff were also very helpful at all times with any requests we had. The room itself was newly renovated with an extremely comfy king bed, flat screen TV and great large bathroom. As we paid only $40/night we found it excellent value for money. Also we were expecting to pay a resort fee on top of this (we were told it was mandatory at time of booking with Expedia) but it seemed that it was no longer a mandatory charge when we arrived, we never had to pay it and we still received free wifi in our room! In terms of location the hotel is certainly close to one of the end's of the Strip, but defintely the nicest end. Its right across the road from MGM Grand and New York, New York and within easy walking distance of the most famous casinos (Bellagio, Caesars Palace etc). The only thing I didnt like was the smoking inside the casino (but this was the same of all casinos we went into on the Strip). However, I am happy to say our non-smoking room did not smell of cigarettes at all which was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana Hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: N0rman1234
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful Valentine's celebration in Las Vegas. The rooms were very comfortable and the staff were helpful. On the 14th. we dined at the Baci Italian Rest. and the dinner was exceptional. I can't say enough about the servers and the beautiful young gal that helped me acquire some glasses and Italian bread for our room prior to our dinner engagement. Thank you again.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas 2012 at the Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: russ399
Reviews.Content: This is our 10th trip to Vegas and stayed at the Tropicana this time. I reserved a Paradise view room but when we arrived I was told all similar rooms were booked so we were provided a suite. We started in room 1202 but the fan and AC unit was very loud so they moved us to 1502. This was very nice except the dead-bolt did not work. It was ok since the latch worked good. The beds and pillows were super!. Room decor was a little weak and the bathroom was just ok. But again, a great price!. The view was great looking south but the north view was blocked by a large promo banner. We really like the casino. Very small compared to others. Just a few of each type of tables and a good amount of machines. One was actually very generous. It paided me the largest amount I ever won at one machine. If you play craps, go early and get to know Trudy. She is very nice and helpful! We were not able to eat at the Trop. The Biscayne was dark the days were were in town. Over all the Trop was very clean and would definetly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana April 2011”
Reviews.Author: katatonic4u
Reviews.Content: This was a big birthday week for hubby and there were 2 other couples. The Tropicana was clean, beautiful with a rocking pool. Great bars, central to all the happening. We rented a car but really, we were walking distance to most everything. There is a monorail accross the street that connects to the Bellagio. Cant say anything negative -everything was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Redone?”
Reviews.Author: ctoddy
Reviews.Content: I've never been to the Tropicana before. We picked it because of it's location on the strip and it's cost. The fact that it had just gone through a $150 million renovation helped. I'd like to have seen the place before. For $150 mill I think they could have gone with more than white. It's completely different than I think almost every other hotel on the strip. Very simple. Not that simple is bad, just simple tends to not be Vegas. Rooms were decent. Nothing splendid. I had stayed at the Planet Hollywood last time for the same rate and their rooms were much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, bright and friendly”
Reviews.Author: vgoh
Reviews.Content: The rooms and spacious and the lobby area is bright and friendly, a refreshing change from some of the darker, smokier hotel-casinos. It may not be the most opulent hotel on the Strip, but it's luxurious still, the staff are friendly and the service is good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice renovation but.....”
Reviews.Author: CindyFee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tropicana when we came to Las Vegas to get married. Here is the good and the bad. Staff is friendly and very helpful, rooms are nice, the beds are comfortable. Overall the renovation was done well. Also, you do not have all of the people working for the hotel trying to sell you something, ie-show tickets or another hotel stay for the next year. Here is the bad. If you want a refrigerator or coffee pot or anything else that is not provided, be prepared to pay dearly. Coffee pots in your room are $10 a day and refrigerators are $15 a day. There aren't many choices for food unless you want to go upscale dining, which along with everything else, is expensive. No buffet available which is surprising. Even the Belligio has a buffet. For the money we spent on our room, we expected much much more. Spent most of our time across the street at the Luxor and Excalabur. Will stay at one of those on our next trip to Vegas to save the walk.

Reviews.Title: “4th time to the Trop”
Reviews.Author: chichi62
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my 50th birthday trip, I emailed Nicole and she was so kind to comp my resort fee for my stay, awesome, thanks Nicole. I love staying here for the location, I always rent a car and it is the easiest hotel to park at and to access the freeway. The rooms are always nice and clean and i really appreciate that the windows open slightly. The only improvement I can see is to add a bit more selection to the fast food services. I was also a little dissappointed that my favorite slot, Fireball , is no longer there.Overall, I will stay here again as it never disappoints!

Reviews.Title: “Minimalism”
Reviews.Author: Xorreaux
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference. Had it been for pleasure my ranking would have been lower. I understand this resort hotel had a bad rap and was redesigned. Things did appear to be new and it seems the designer was going for a "white, clean, and neat" theme rather than something grandiose. The minimalist approach unfortunately did not work for me. In leaving the resort today, I have several positives but more negatives to share with readers. The facility is in a prime location, adjacent to the MGM, NY/NY, and Excaliber resorts. It is about a 15 minute taxi ride from the LAS airport. It is very clean and doesn't have a smokey odor. It has two high class restaurants (although I did not eat at either as they are quite expensive). There are shopping kiosks to pick up small gifts, incidentals, and groceries. Room service was prompt, polite, and my calzone was delicious. I asked for a room change and within 20 minutes a bellhop had delivered my new card key. I stayed in two different "deluxe" rooms, both of which were very clean, odor free, and I was not bothered by housekeeping. The first room was on the first floor (actually about 3 stories up). My second was on the 14th floor. I recommend a room with a king bed as it is a bit roomier and has a comfortable ottoman, unlike the double queen room. There was a great large screen HD TV in the room, the beds were ultra comfortable with no shortage of pillows, and the rooms were spacious. Here's what I did not like. The first two nights I had "gansta" neighbors that were so loud and belligerent, that I eventually had to change rooms - not the fault of the hotel. However, I called security, and after 40 minutes, there was no apparent intervention resulting in my room change shortly before midnight. As to the physical aspects of the room, first the windows do not open more than 6 inches so you cannot enjoy the cool dry breeze of southern NV. The windows are also covered with some sort of honeycomb filter that makes it impossible to take a photo of the Las Vegas skyline. On the lower floor I had to listen to the police sirens at night. On the upper floor, I had to listen to the helicopters as early as 7 am. There were minimal other amenities - no fridge, no microwave, and no coffee maker. I can deal with no being able to stock my room with groceries, but not being able to brew a cup of coffee is an unforgivable oversight on the part of the hotel and something I expect to have, even in the cheapest motel. I had to get dressed, take the elevator to the lobby, and then stand in line for 10 minutes to get coffee at a Starbucks stand (largest size 16 oz for $3.50, refills $2). The decor is very plain, geometric, modern-cabana-ish. The beds are all white linen reminiscent of a hospital, but I reiterate very comfortable. Check in and check out were hardly smooth, taking 15 and 10 minutes, respectively, due to a line similar to what I'm used to seeing in a post office -- a big long reception desk capable of housing 15-20 employees, with only 2 stations open, and on each occasion one of the stations was encumbered with lengthly interactions with just one customer the whole time I was in line. I was wondering if the staff were trying to sell a time share it took so long. On check-in the woman was terse. On check-out the gentleman was warm and asked how my stay was, but then excused my complaints as being the norm for Vegas. I don't gamble but the lobby and gambling areas seemed overly lit with low ceilings - kind of cramped and not very cozy. I did not use my laptop because you are charged for wi-fi service in your room. My calzone from room service was $21 plus tip. Overall, I probably would not stay here again, even if the price was lower. The limited aesthetics and lack of reception staff kind of did it for me.

Reviews.Title: “Overall just an average stay...”
Reviews.Author: apsdtravel
Reviews.Content: The trouble I had with the tropicana was how long it took to get to the room. I would not recommend the club tower as it takes about 10 minutes just to get to the elevator for the tower. As far as cleanliness, it was alright. Be sure to check the towels before you use them because in if mine had a stain on it. Other than that they were very kind and the club RPM offers good deals on drinks for girls and is a nice place to have a good time. Tropicana is at the end of the strip so be prepared for a hike or to take a cab if you're planning to go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “First-time Vegas Trip for Birthday”
Reviews.Author: anderguy
Reviews.Content: My stay was from Feb. 9-12. I changed my reservation from The Mirage to to the Tropicana. I did let Nicole Marshall, their Guest Experience Manager, know that I was coming to Las Vegas for the first time and that I'd be celebrating my birthday (one of the bigger ones) before I came. She offered me a special rate, a complimentary upgrade to a Strip view room, a dining credit, late checkout, and other incentives. I did bring all of the emails regarding the booking with me--DEFINITELY DO THIS WHENEVER/WHEREVER YOU TRAVEL!! I was in the Paradise Tower (the one closer to the strip, off the lobby), Room 1823. I had requested a nonsmoking room with a King Bed, higher floor, a little bit away from the elevator and ice & vending machine. When I walked into the room I was pleasantly surprised by a gift basket containing wine, candy, wafer cookies, cracker/cheese. I used my dining credit to get dinner at Biscayne, where I had the tasting menu. Food was pretty good although I wish the service had been a little faster. There were two snafus. About 8 a.m. on Saturday I had woken up briefly to take some medication. The people in the room next door (1825) were quite loud and I could hear them through the walls, there was rap music playing, and there was lots of shouting. I know better than to confront people in this kind of situation, so I called Security. They did send someone up a few minutes later who spoke to them. It got a little quieter, but not by much. I called Security again and the same guy returned. This time it did get quieter, but by then I had decided to shower and go get breakfast. The other incident occurred when checking out. When the clerk handed me the bill I noticed the $40 dining credit had not been applied. I told him this and that the checkin clerk confirmed it was noted on my reservation. His first response was to tell me to pay the excess amount ($51.73 instead of the $11.73 I expected to pay) and to get my reimbursement when I got home. Unacceptable!! This is when I produced the email from Ms. Marshall confirming that I was to receive the credit. He then made some phone calls and the credit was applied. As I mentioned above, this is why you should ALWAYS have paper confirmation of every aspect of your trip! I have to admit I was put-off by all of the smoking in Las Vegas, including many public areas of the hotel. It would be great to see the Tropicana take the lead in offering a non-smoking hotel (in all areas). Sure they might lose some business, but I bet they'd make up for it in attracting nonsmoking guests who would want to spend time in a clean, fresh-smelling surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Brian K
Reviews.Content: Anyone looking for a great hotel with unbelievable service and accommodations, look no further.. Everything from the short ride from the airport, which you couldn't hear, to the great show, Recycled Percussion. We were walking distance to most places and, if not, just a quick walk to "THE DUECE".. Thank you to the wonderful staff from the "elevator nazi" and the great customer relations manager, Nicole. You guys made a quick wedding trip most enjoyable. The rooms were a nice size and very clean. I wished that we would have opted for the suites, but the rooms were great nonetheless. We have found a new home in the Tropicana, and we can't wait until we return. The Tropicana Las Vegas definitely exceeded our expectations. Brian & Kim (newlyweds)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Devon B
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my first trip to Las Vegas and had a great time at the Tropicana. As soon as you walk in you are greeted with a clean, very fresh-looking check-in area. Check-in was a breeze and we were up to our room in no time. The room was as advertised (which is a good thing). The bed was comfortable, the flatscreen TV was great, and everything was very clean. We didn't know what to expect in Las Vegas, but were pleasantly surprised with how clean everything at the Tropicana was, including the room. The room was in Paradise Tower and had a great view of the strip! The casino seemed a bit small compared to other hotels on the strip but it still had everything we needed. I spent most of my time at the blackjack tables while my wife spent her time on the machines. The dealers were all very friendly and extremely helpful. The drink service was better than any of the other hotels we gambled at. We got tickets to see the Recycled Percussion show and it was definitely worth it! Its a high-energy and interactive show that we both really enjoyed. If you are at the Tropicana, definitely go to the show, it was extremely entertaining. The one small downside was that the Tropicana seemed a little lacking in the shops and food places. We didn't eat at any of the onsite restaurants (they looked expensive, but good) and found ourselves making a short walk across the street to have a cheap breakfast or indulge ourselves with a buffet. We really didn't consider it an inconvenience considering how close the shops and other restaurants were. All in all, highly recommended, and will definitely consider staying here again whenever we decide to return to vegas. We are really looking forward to enjoying the awesome pool.
