Reviews.Title: “Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: dancingfool92129
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here over President's Day Weekend. They have recently remodeled and the place looks great. The room was big and comfortable. I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Smells of coconuts!”
Reviews.Author: refractedlight
Reviews.Content: An affordable, friendly and incredibly modern hotel right at the beginning of the strip. Close to everything and has amazing rooms with giant tvs (but to be honest with Vegas outside why do you need a tv?). Only downside is the lengthy walk to the hotel part of the walk, but there is a Starbucks opposite to stimulate you for it! Highly recommended, will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Trop”
Reviews.Author: we3k9
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Tropicana, had room 414 Paradise Tower, facing the strip. Cool view of the Excalibur, kept the blinds open all the time so I could see the castle all lit up. Room was clean, beds super comfy. Front desk staff very nice and accomadating. Everyone we encountered, from the gift shop clerks to the valets, super friendly. No coffee maker in room, but a quick call to the front desk and they sent us up a keurig coffee machine and k-cups plus bottled water to pour in the coffee maker, for an extra charge of $10 a day. a bargain for two people who drink a lot of coffee, we just called and requestd more k-cups and they were sent right up. We enjoyed having coffee in our room and our trip was enhanced by the ongoing promotion of first $200 on us, for new gamblers such as myself, playing slots was a new experience for me. I liked the size and feel of the Trop. We were in paradise tower. easy to get around. I especially loved the smell of the place, like pina colada scent. The front desk printed our airline boarding passes when it was time to go. kudos to the staff at the Tropicana, we will return!

Reviews.Title: “Top notch rooms and service!”
Reviews.Author: annakasper8
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the tropicana was nothing less then wonderful! The hotel has been recently renovated and the decor is done in warm tans, oranges, browns and coral...Cozy and modern all in the same casino roll. You also can detect the light frangrance of coconut and ginger as you walk in the door. There are some great restaurants, and the new poolside club/lounge looks like it's going to be the place to be once spring and summer are here. I would highly reccomend staying at the Tropicana to anyone who is looking for a comfortable, fun, clean and luxurious stay while in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Love, Love, Love the Tropicana LV!”
Reviews.Author: TashaBaby11
Reviews.Content: First of all I would like to apologize for not writing this review sooner!! I became extremely busy here in NYC with back to school and work after we left Vegas. I stayed at the lovely Tropicana LV during January 25-28th 2012 with my boyfriend for his mini birthday getaway (my treat), which is his very first time in Vegas, and I was so excited to show him around. I booked an awesome combined flight (Virgin America) and hotel deal through bookit.com because of their BillMeLater payment plan (so i can pay 6 months later and use the money I had available for activities!) It was our very first time staying at the Tropicana LV and I loved every minute of it! The reason I gave them 5 instead of 4 stars is because of their very attentive friendly staff- hands down outstanding customer service!! From the doorman, to the check in, to the housekeeping, the host and hostess and all the staff we encountered daily at Cafe Nikki was very pleasant, and the staff at the Tropicana Lobby Giftshop next to the entrance was so amazing, especially the Filipina lady and another lady I cannot remember their names but my receipts says Chona and Michelle! I think just about everyone literally everyone we encountered was truly genuine with excellent interpersonal skills and that's really rare in the hospitality industry/ customer service in my opinion, so not only did we have a BLAST on the Strip, we looked forward every time to return back to our hotel. A big thanks to Kimberlee our check in agent, she upgraded us for free to a non smoking king size room in the paradise tower with the view of the strip on the 12th floor, and free daily breakfast buffet, and late check in! Words cannot describe how happy we were, she is just an amazing individual with a great personality as well! I emphasize this a lot because it is rare for us to encounter amazing staff and have good deep intellectual conversations with them such as in the Tropicana. It's funny when our check out agent asked how our stay was I was so speechless because words cannot describe what an excellent stay it was, I managed to mouth out " it was awesome!" and I bet she knew our stay was awesome too judging by the many great reviews. By the way check in and check out was super fast than I expected! I remember Alina our room attendant is such a sweetheart she would always write a note to thank us and showered us with extra bath and body products and towels every time we tipped her since we made a big mess in the room. We were greeted by like everyone of the staff, which was pleasant. You might think I'm crazy but I've stayed at the Trump and the Hilton and other hotels before but I never encountered this kind of experience with the staff members. You would think its a small boutique hotel were you know everyone. I wish we could have tipped everyone we encountered at the hotel but we would've ended up with a big hole in our pocket that's how amazing all the staff at the hotel were, I will bring more money for tips the next time... I forgot to make note of everyone's names, but they all truly made our stay welcoming and we didn't feel out of place (since I think we could have been the youngest guest during our stay- early 20's). I will definitely go back to this hotel and recommend people. The hotel's scenery is very beautiful I think its a perfect place for couples... I love the tropical feel I love the carpet and the smell of the casino I think was this light vanilla scent... usually I'm sensitive to smoke and strong fragrances, but it smelled very pleasant every time we passed by the casino! Also thanks to the staff in Glow to recommending my boyfriend a barber on East Tropicana for his haircut and shape up for an awesome value (we apologize that we couldn't afford the prices in Glow). The staff also recommended us to The Gun Store, which was so much fun! Last but not least, I am thankful for the staff that stopped us as we exited our hotel to go to a club, we walked right back in our hotel because he convinced us to attend the RMP Nightclub with free cover and free vodka open bar for ladies till Midnight!.... the RMP is in the Tropicana, although there were long lines the wait wasn't too bad at all. I had a great time at RMP, yes I did get super wasted I am so glad we stayed there its beautiful, the dj played GREAT music, it was a sorority night so almost everyone was in our age range, free drinks for me, they gave out free glowsticks, and best of all my drunk boyfriend was able to carry me back upstairs to the hotel room cause I was about to pass out!(lol). Oh and the bartender Phil (if Im not mistaken) is incredible, he has so many awesome moves and tricks- he was juggling the bottle and the mixer to make our drinks, BRAVO! He even assisted to take our pics and was very thankful for the tips (in NYC the bartenders are rarely thankful in fact they are stingy thats why I pointed this out). Because phil was so awesome I stayed at the bar after midnight when the free drinks were over and opened up a tab for my bf for his b-day night! Besides the outstanding service we received at the hotel, I just need to mention the other most important things about our stay was the fact that the hotel Jacuzzi was open 365 days of the year. Besides the great reviews that I researched of the hotel (in order to convince me to book) and the amazing affordable price- the fact that the outdoor Jacuzzi was available really nailed it! We took advantage of the Jacuzzi every day after breakfast, after lunch, after dinner, and even at 4am in the morning,lol. The staff provided towels for us- Iove how they are so attentive you may not think they are there, but out they come with towels! =] They have 2 large hot tubs, not everyone in the hotel took advantage of it so we had the place to ourselves most of the time. It may be winter season but by the Jacuzzi being available made our stay at the hotel even better. And the rooms is very spacious I was surprised, I love the whole design, it felt very tropical and romantic it felt like summer vacation for a winter season. Our room must have been renovated because everything was perfect (minus the itty bitty flaws that I noticed that obviously cannot be removed- me being ocd- such as the shower head was too low for my 6ft tall bf but its not the end of the world, he just had to bend his neck down to get his head wet which was uncomfortable since he has neck problems and it looked like there were permanent scratch stain marks on the bathroom floor tiles but its very minor, and I noticed a tiny stain on the shower curtain- like I said its just me being OCD).. besides this everything was spotless. The bathroom was big! And they had a shower pole for grip, and I love how the toilet was separate from the shower and sink! and the shower curtain pole was designed to have more space in the shower, two people can shower together! We had free wifi, and free usage of the safe, which we took advantage of daily. By the way my issue with the safe is that I think anyone can reset it and easily access it, because I found out by accident when I mistakenly pressed the wrong numbers and the reset button. I left the instructions in the safe along with my valuables (because im ocd).. but when you think about it the staff is most definitely trustworthy, so I felt more at ease later on. I absolutely love the closet with the large mirrors and the many hangers it came with!!! I also loved the whole design of the room, everything seemed perfect, it came with an ipod dock speakers so we blasted music, and a large flat screen hd tv!! Besides the AMAZING view of the trip , the best part of the room was the bed it was the most comfortable bed on the planet it was stuffed with many plush bedding's! I slept so good, it was so good that it was so bad when I had to struggle for my bf to wake up in the mornings and after his naps!! I'm not kidding!!! I barely watched a full tv show since I would literally melt away to sleep ;) I forgot to ask the hotel the brand of the bed and bedding's, I must have it! I most absolutely loved all the lamps that each came with an attached electric outlet unit- a must have! I even appreciated the bi tropical plant in our room and the photos. I appreciate every small detail even the ceiling had a nice detail to it. Overall the stay of this hotel was excellent, there were minor cons but it definitely did not overshadow the fact of how excellent our stay at the hotel was! The other cons that I will point out was there was an afternoon when the hot water was not working, it was on the warm too cool feel, and I am used to taking really hot hot showers not warm or cool showers but that quickly changed later by my next shower. There was also a time when we bought a wine bottle and we didn't have a cork and room service said they would charge us just to pop open our bottle, we of course went to the gift shop to buy one for cheap price. But I just want to point out a detail how room service came like in a minute or less after our call! Lighting fast service,lol! I also want to say the soda machine in the 12th floor for some reason wasn't accepting my dollar bills and the coin slot was stuck inside and didn't take my coins- these are all minor flaws that really didn't affect our stay in a negative way. I wish the was like a hot water machine so I can make hot tea or coffee, but its not a big deal. It also would've been nice to have a fridge but then when I thought about it we really did not need it! We had the ice machine on our floor to keep our liquor cool, and we did not order food through room service so we didn't need the fridge. The location of the hotel on the strip was perfect!!! Across from MGM Grand and Hooters and NY NY... and not that far to the Miracle Miles Shop. The location made the cab ride to the airport dirt cheap! =] I want to sincerely apologize for my late review and the fact I wrote an extremely long review, I couldn't help myself. But I hope this review helps!!! By the way this hotel should be ranked up to the top 10 hotels in Vegas because of all the great things I just mentioned that all comes with an an amazing value!!! =]

Reviews.Title: “Club Suite - Sweet”
Reviews.Author: Texassun
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on Expedia and had 4 nights in the Club Suite. YES - it is a long walk - but prob the same as rooms at MGM. Very few rest choices -that is true - but you are a 5 minute walk to several places, Room - loved having two rooms, refrig, free bottle water and coffee. Large shower and toilet in one room and his and her sinks in a dressing area. Two large screen tv's. Room was clean and they even came by 2 nights and gave us more water, clean towels and a choc on the pillow. VIEW was THE BEST - we had at least 6 windows all with a great view of the strips - 20th floor. Pool area looks great - of course not able to use it, did see people wondering around and enjoying the seating area. Bus stop RIGHT in front. I normally stay at Flamingo or Harrahs - so yes - this is a diff location - but very conv to MGM, New York, Excaliber,Luxor and MB - all within 5-8 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Trop!”
Reviews.Author: EllyKay
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Troicana a few years back. It was OK but a little shabby and nothing to write home about. We decided to go to Vegas to celebrate our birthdays and, after reading a lot of reviews, decided to give it another try. We were not diappointed! We got a great price for flights and room on troplv.com. After a quick trip from the airport, we were checked in, upgraded and on the way to our room in less than 10 minutes. The lobby, casino, and hallways were clean and shining. Everyone was friendly and welcoming. The room was spotless with a great view ot the strip. The only complaint was a slow bathtub drain. Although the casino was small, we found some machines we liked (we only play the slots) and even hit some good wins. A few tips to the CW kept the drinks coming! The pool was closed of course, but I spent every morning in the hot tub and every employee that walked by spoke and was friendly. We didn't eat at the Bacio or the Biscayne, but they got great reviews, looked very nice, and seemed crowded when we walked by. All in all, we loved the Trop and will definitly stay there next time we come to Vegas. (Soon we hope!!)

Reviews.Title: “The Tropicana is Back!”
Reviews.Author: M M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the greatest time on our four day stay at the Tropicana..... Check In: The revamped lobby is warm and classy. Check-in is smooth and pleasant. The front desk fast tracked our check in even though it was 10:45am. The customer service is second to none. Our room: We stayed in a suite in the Club Tower. If you have an opportunity to upgrade to a suite, DO IT! The remodeled suites are spacious and luxurious. Our suite had two flat screens, a bar, a mini fridge, a kuerig coffee maker, three hundred thread count sheets, his and her sinks, a marble shower(with excellent water pressure) and an iphone alarm clock. The only small drawback was the location of the Club Tower is a few minute walk from the casino and front desk. We loved the room. The Cleaning Staff: The cleaning staff was on top of it. They accommodated our crazy Vegas schedule and we had white glove clean rooms everyday. Food: Every morning we ate breakfast at the Beach Cafe. There was a wait to get in almost every day for good reason. This place was outstanding from made to order omelettes to smoked salmon. High quality all around. We also went to the Island Buffet which was very nice. Gambling: The new poker room is awesome. Everything was new and clean. They had a fridge stocked with non alcoholic beverages you could grab at any time and attentive cocktail waitresses for drink or two. The dealers and poker room managers are a class act. I even got to play cards with 2006 WSOP Champion Jamie Gold. This completely made my Vegas trip. Others: On my birthday, they sent up a gift basket of fruit, nuts and candies. This literally blew me away. Tips for a better stay: Tip everyone. The Tropicana is filled with hard working, appreciative employees....well placed folding money goes a long way.

Reviews.Title: “Still very good, but not again.”
Reviews.Author: David W
Reviews.Content: This is the 5th time we've stayed at the Tropicana. It's still very good! The rooms are really nice, but I'd advise getting a Tower room as the Garden room is quite a hike! The casino itself is really good now its all finished. Two issues with the place now though, which may be minor to most people. 1. There were not enough cocktail waitresses. unless you were playing on a table game you had to wait for ages for a drink(I was there to drink and gamble!). 2. One of the Floor men at the Black Jack tables was very rude to the dealer in front of us all, and when challenged by others on the table, just brushed the off and walked away.(he was called Earnie if any of the Tropicana management read this!). It's starting to get quite expensive to stay there now, so probably wouldn't go back. Next time I'm probably going to try Monte Carlo!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, good location, the place is not the nicest but it has personality.”
Reviews.Author: cooldan007
Reviews.Content: Right across the street from MGM and NY NY so we ate at all of their restuarants but really enjoyed gambling at Tropicana because it's not so dark inside and the dealers are much more fun. The Beach Club is a great breakfest spot get the buffet w custom made omelets spot on. It was too cold for any pool action but it looks like they have a good set up.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VEGAS EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: Marco P
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the New Improved Tropicana. We have stayed at all ends of the strip and you cant beat the price or the new beautiful remodel of the Trop. Best bang your for your buck!! All staff was very attentive and personnel, made us feel very comfortable from the time we walked tru the doors. Definitly going back soon!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice.....”
Reviews.Author: LuvTravels20
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really nice it was my first time staying there... It was better than I thought.. Our room was great, bathroom was huge.. Pool area looked nice but was closed at the time I stayed.... Price was great....Only issue is that it's at the end of the strip and ended up paying alot in cab rides.. So that is something to consider if u are going to be going to a club or place on the other side of strip...

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Peggy F
Reviews.Content: Tropicana has recently made some major renovations to their hotel. There's no arguing that the carpeting, bedspreads, etc., are new, but they could have spent a bit more time on the bathrooms (still showing some wear and tear), and although we requested Non Smoking rooms, you could tell by the smell that these were once smoking rooms. They were nice enough to comp us for dinner for our anniversary. Would stay there again, nice value for the money but an average hotel. Beds were VERY comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and very clean”
Reviews.Author: WorldsOfFun
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay at the tropicana, the rooms are spotless the staff is wonderful and the hotel is smaller than most in Vegas so it seems so much easier to get to your room. We did have a little bit of a wait checking in, it wasnt lined up, they just took a long time to check people in for some reason. We got a free breakfast buffet with our package and it was one of the best we have ever had. 5 stars on that. We will stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Personal Service”
Reviews.Author: Ellen R
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana looks great having been totally redone. Everything is very nice. However, what I was most impressed with was the staff. Everyone I encountered was so helpful! The front desk staff got me information I needed, set up my reservation for my next visit and reminded me to take advantage of my Trop Club points. The conscierge helped me with a shipping issue I had. If you are going to play in the Casino be sure to join the Trop Club. Looking forward to my return trip.

Reviews.Title: “thrown out of hotel grounds”
Reviews.Author: shirleyharr
Reviews.Content: we are now in our rooms after being told to leave the grounds that we were sun bathing in.... it is lovely and warm and sunny.... I asked the person removing us what would happen if we refused to move, and he said he would have us removed for trespassing, as the pool area is now closed... tropicana known for its beautiful gounds, but we cannot use them. if we want to sunbathe we can lie on the grass...we asked a manager for chairs in the tiny bit of grounds we could use, we were told no, how can a hotel do this.... what are we paying for.... why cant we sunbathe in the grounds of a hotel called the tropicana not good tropicana... must cater for all guests we are on a special birthday holiday that is now totally spoiled.... tropicana told us we can use the next doors pool, but not good enough... really sad

Reviews.Title: “More fun, nicely remodeled”
Reviews.Author: Craig K
Reviews.Content: I love the newly remodeled Tropicana! I have stayed there many times over the years and it is so much better now. The remodel is nice, hotel and rooms are really clean, but the staff is sooooooo much better, All are friendly and make you feel like you want to be there. The prices are still one of the best deals on the strip. The Paradise Suites are worth the little extra!

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: globaldave1
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in February and loved the upgrade. The casino & hotel were updated, open & airy. Front desk staff were very helpful & friendly. We had a regular room and it was clean and nice. We reserved through priceline at a discounted rate and weren't expecting much. Far exceeded our expectations. Great bed and quiet room. Will definately stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday weekend”
Reviews.Author: NinthIsland
Reviews.Content: I decided to play tourist in celebration of my 50th birthday and booked Sat and Sun nights at the Trop. Room was very clean, bed super comfortable, shower nice and hot. I enjoyed a great steak and lobster meal in the steak restaurant which the name eludes me. I had a nice run of good luck at the machines, especially the sports bar poker machines. Overall I enjoyed my stay, just wish they had pai gow tables outside where the action was as opposed to the high limit area because never saw one player there. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at the Tropicana!”
Reviews.Author: DatBoiD
Reviews.Content: Ok, so first of all this review is long overdue. I wanted to write this right after I got back from my trip, but somehow never found the time to do it and eventually forgot about it. Our (my grandma and me) stay at the Tropicana was in June 2011 and my graduation gift. In the preperation process for the trip I contacted Nicole Marshall whether it would be possible to receive a room upgrade, since it was going to be my first time in Las Vegas, which she confirmed after a few days. Thank you very much, Mrs. Marshall! When we arrived at the Tropicana the first inconvenience was the fact that we waited in line for about 50 minutes although there were only 3 other guests in line before us. I think that 2 employees at the check-in desk are just not enough for a hotel with over 1400 rooms. When we finally stood in front of the lady that would check us in, she kept looking for our reservation in the system. It took her another 15 minutes to actually find it. Unfortunately she told us we would have to stay in a smoking room for our first night, because there was no other Strip View Room available at this time. Well, we weren't lucky about that, but there was nothing we could do about it. We were told to come down in the morning again, to check if another Strip View Room is available. The room we got the next day was great and made up for Besides this there was just one other unpleasant incident one day before out check-out. My grandma asked at the Concierge desk, if there was any possibility to weigh our luggage, so we wouldnt have to pay an extra fee at the airport. She was told "Of course, just bring down your suitcase and we will put it on a scale." So, that's what she did... But instead of actually getting a scale, the lady at the Concierge desk apparently couldn't remember that she said that and told my grandma that there was no way to weigh her suitcase. When my grandma told me about that I couldnt believe it, so we both went down there with our luggage and suddenly the lady seemed to remember what she said and it was no problem at all to check the weight of our suitcases. I don't know if this was just a misunderstanding or if employees just like to kid around ?! Nevertheless, apart from this everything was really nice. The renovated rooms are fabulous and the beds are really comfortable! The pool area was a nice place to relax and catch some sun and the Southbeach Marketplace is a pleasant place to get a snack or a tasteful breakfast. I really recommend this hotel, because now, with the renovated rooms I think it really can compete with other big hotels on the Strip. Next time I will be in Vegas, there is a high probability that I will choose the TROPICANA again! PS: Although I am from Germany I decided to write this review in English, because this way there are more people I might be able to help with this. If there are any further questions, feel free to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome pools Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tangles762000
Reviews.Content: My kids and I went to the tropicana for a vacation and stayed in a great economy room for 4 days. The pools there are awesome they have several pools and one pool has a swim up black jack table that you can sit all day at and drink for free. watch out though because as you get drunk you will dehydrate and then all the chlorine will soak into your body and your hangover is going to be toxic. Anyway the rooms were great, comfortable beds. if you bring kids you can keep an eye on them in the same pool as it winds all over the grounds it awesome. You can rent inner tubes for the pool and swim through the water fall. It was just great love it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place To Stay On The Strip”
Reviews.Author: KarenCOttawa
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very nice and the room was great. We were on the 3rd floor of the Club Tower. We were glad that the windows opened in our room though because the smell of smoke would come in intermittently through the air conditioner. It happened a couple of times during our first night and then during the day off and on so we just turned it off and used the windows for fresh air. If it was in the hotter season it would not have worked as well and our stay would have been unpleasant, As well, there were people smoking on the same floor so at times the corridor was filled with the smell of smoke. I really think that the hotel should designate floors as non smoking to make the stay for the non smokers as pleasant as it is for the smokers. Also, if you are not fond of the smell of suntan lotion (coconut and vanilla) you might find the scent a little much as it's pumped into the casino / hotel. Quite unpleasant when mixed with smoke in the casino We found the location ok for us as we had a car. It is convenient to the monorail / tram and to the bus. Would stay again as it was not as busy a location on the strip from a traffic perspective. Very easy to get around and very close to the airport and major freeways

Reviews.Title: “Loved it right from the coconut smell when you walk in!”
Reviews.Author: easty1980
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, looks brilliant with the refurb! Stayed for 4 nights with family and all agreed it was great value and nice place to stay. Not huge, so easy to meet each other and get rooms close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mel M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very reasonably priced for the quality. We stayed in a Tower room and it was super clean, the bed was very comfortable, the shower was great (no backups) and the room was spacious. The 42" tv was a nice touch too. Everyone we encountered at the hotel was friendly and accomodating. The casino at this hotel was one of the least smoky casinos we've ever been to. Just like the hotel, it was very clean. The casino employees were friendly and engaging. The next time we visit Las Vegas, we'll stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “What a Change”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: Having been to the Tropicana many years ago (pre-renovation), I must say that their investment looks to be paying off. The lobby was unrecognizable - very chic, clean and cool. Rooms Clean and large. The beds were also very comfortable. Staff Helpful. We got a free room upgrade when they found out we just got engaged. They also went out of their way and waived the daily booking fees. Casino The casino used to really smell of smoke years ago, but they have vastly improved the air quality in the gaming areas. It smells like summer holidays! Entertainment The rock band in the lounge was amazing and I hope they get a regular gig there. They *should* be signed to a major label...and I am pretty picky about indie bands. I would definitely go back to the Tropicana, especially in the summer time when I can take advantage of the pool and deck.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Jon C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at the Tropicana, and we will definetly be back. The hotel staff was just amazing and our room was better than we imagined. The location was great and they helped make everything perfect. We were there celebrating our 21st wedding anniversary and a big thank you for everyone there to make it a relaxing and memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Beautiful Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: Joan68_10
Reviews.Content: We were able to spend 3 nights in a beautiful casino in Las Vegas. The Tropicana is the place to go and be in the center of everything. It was clean, our room was a beautiful suite and very accommodating for us. The food at the Italian Restaurant was absolutely delicious as was the food at the Beach Restaurant. We highly recommend the Tropicana for your stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Super Bowl Weekend Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Wendi P
Reviews.Content: We were invited for the Super Bowl Weekend and have never been treated more Royally, the rooms were a bit of a walk but well worth it. We got great service everywhere we went, the Steakhouse meal was the best experience and the food out of this world. The staff in every area were so friendly and helpful. VIP checkin and our Casino Host Ron are the best. We have stayed the last year many times at The M and this experience has hooked us on The New Trop

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana Casino”
Reviews.Author: tinangene
Reviews.Content: Loved staying at the new Tropicana. This was my 6th year for the Super Bowl. Hopefully I can make it next year. Thank you Tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Pam B
Reviews.Content: My fiance, who became my husband while there, stayed at the Tropicana. They were courteous. The rooms were very clean. The service was great. We came for a concert and had talked about getting married. We found a chapel and took our vows. The Tropicana found out and sent up a bottle of champagne for us. Our maid was very sweet and wanted to work. We told her we were okay one morning and just needed towels, but she ended up talking with us and cleaning up everything. I will stay at the Tropicana again!

Reviews.Title: “Vegas getaway”
Reviews.Author: annetony1985
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Tropicana in Las Vegas when we were attending a convention in early February. We were pleased with the cost of the room and it's appointments, although I did recommend to them to have a coffee maker in the room. Comfortable, well decorated rooms and comfortable bedding. The courtyard was very nice with it's nice lawn and palm trees. The pool was closed when we were there, but I did enjoy a few cigars in the courtyard while enjoying the mid - 60's temperatures. The gym/fitness center was well appointed, too. We ate at Bacio's two evenings in a row. The food was excellent, try the fixed price menu for $33.00 including a glass of wine. All of the hotel and Bacio staff were very friendly and we'll stay here on our next Vegas getaway. Be aware, though, that there is smoking in the casino portion of the hotel if that is bothersome.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous time at the Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: Emma G
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a girls' weekend at the Tropicana. We didn't know what to expect, as we've only stayed in the MGM Grand, Luxor, and the Bellagio, but we absolutely loved it. In the five years since we've been to Vegas, the Tropicana is truly unrecognizable. It was open, airy, had an upscale tropical feel to it, and was FABULOUS. We had a late check-in (about midnight) and had no wait at all. We were taken care of by the super friendly ladies in front, and were given room 724 in the Paradise Tower. The elevators were close by, and we were immediately put into party mode as we heard the band jamming and saw the cocktail waitress pole dancing in the middle of the gaming tables. :) Our room was huge by Vegas standards and had two queen beds. The furniture was very nice, and the plantation shutters gave us an AMAZING view of the strip. Out of our window, we could see the Luxor, Excalibur, and Mandalay Bay. Most importantly, we were pretty damn lucky in the casino downstairs. We took advantage of their "free play" rewards, and got back $150 to play in casino money. We had a couple of $400 wins as well (this was playing penny slots). We also had the opportunity to eat in the Beach Club for breakfast and we all loved it. Again, the upscale tropical feel was echoed throughout the restaurant. We also ate in the food court, and were pleasantly surprised by the food there as well. Lastly, the pool area is BEAUTIFUL. I can't wait to go back when it's open to try out the water slide. HIGH OH! I would highly recommend to anyone traveling to Vegas on a budget, as the rooms are absolutely STUNNING for the price. Flying on Allegiant, for three people, with three nights in the hotel only ran us about $1000. UNREAL! Can't wait to go back. As they say in Hangover... VEGASSSSS! VEGASSSSSSSSSSSS!

Reviews.Title: “Super Bowl”
Reviews.Author: bkbell
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I had a fantastic time here during the Super Bowl Weekend. The our room, the casino looked great. They gave us a really nice gift basket, Super Bowl Jerseys, caps and we got to meet some St. Louis Rams Cheerleaders. The 50YD Line Super Bowl Party was more than we expected, the service, the food and drinks was just great. We used to go to Reno for Super Bowl and other weekend trips, but not anymore we're coming here!!

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana 02/2012”
Reviews.Author: SharingLifeTJ
Reviews.Content: A trip for 2 to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary. The new Trop has a light, airy feel. It smells wonderful, like Hawaiin Tropics suntan lotion. The staff was excellent and the property clean, updated and welcoming. The restaurant options aren't so great, both are quite expensive but the on property Starbucks is a plus. If you stay in the Club Tower, it is a LONG walk to the parking lot. The Club Tower rooms are large, the bed very comfortable and the soaking tub very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana continues to re-amaze!”
Reviews.Author: Ralphy128
Reviews.Content: Wow! One year after our pleasant surprise of the newly renovated Tropicana, and they've done it again. The entryway has become a gorgeous haven from the strip now. We were welcomed by the bright casino and smell of coconut. It was so refreshing and fun! The rooms again were immaculate and bright. We visited Bacio restaurant for the first time and were absolutely floored by the food. My veal was perfectly cooked with hearty flavors, but paired with a salad to keep it light. We continue to be amazed by Tropicana's commitment to new first-impressions and service.

Reviews.Title: “What a renovation!”
Reviews.Author: chippisl
Reviews.Content: This review is for a room booked thru Priceline as I was not expecting much. Was in LV for the rugby sevens and this hotel was conveniently located for the strip hotel and the Sevens tourney. The hotel now looks very trendy and dare I say boutique - ish. Service was fabulous as the check in lady was very friendly. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it!”
Reviews.Author: GilnJo
Reviews.Content: This is our second time to the Tropicana in 5 months and we are extremely pleased with this hotel. Great location and the staff (front desk, doorman, security, etc), are extremely pleasant. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are clean. We have stayed in both towers and do not notice any difference other than the view. When we return it will be the Tropicana once again.

Reviews.Title: “RECYCLED PERCUSSION - LOUD AND WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: OurTravelingFamily
Reviews.Content: I did not stay at the Tropicana, but this show was just wonderful. We watched the guys when they were on America's Got Talent and really wanted them to win. The show was creative, funny and a real treat. They have the audience participate in the show and that makes it even more fun. The range of entertaiment was quite good. It is not just drumming. Don't go with a headache. It is loud.

Reviews.Title: “Preasently surprised”
Reviews.Author: LovetoGolfMontreal
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night and wished we had booked our hole stay! They did a fabulous job renovating, the rooms are spacious, clean. The bathroom needs a little reno still, they have made a few changes like the sink and lighting but the tub and ceramic are still the same. The bed is very comfortable, slept like a baby!. Their is no drapes in the windows, the windows are covered with wooden chutter's..their is a little light that comes through, for me it was not a problem. Not a sound from next rooms or hallway! Loved that :) Front desk went super well, the clerk was very polite, eager to please :) The walk from the front desk to the room is a little hike..but any hotel in Vegas you always walk, I did not see any problem with that. Its a lovely hotel, very new orleans feel. I would be back in a heart beat! loved this hotel :) They did a great job keeping up wih the other top Hotels on the strip. Congrats! Keep up the good work :) See you soon for sure

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: EJB87
Reviews.Content: Tropicana was ok to stay at, it was value for money and the rooms were really nice. However, I did not like having to walk through the smokey casino to get to the rooms. The restaurant was nice, but the people working at the front desk were impatient. When we asked the concierge to help us, he sent us in the wrong direction. Next time I will pay a bit more money and stay some where else.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Quiet on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Kristen D
Reviews.Content: I travel to Las Vegas for business and have stayed at a variety of hotels and apartment rentals trying to find a perfect match. It was either too far or too loud or too smokey. The trop is great. The remodel was beautiful. It is a relatively peaceful casino. It is not a big party hotel. Everything is light and bright and it has beautiful grounds that are very excessible so you have access to the outdoors more easily. The pool was large and sprawling. There is a 24 hour starbucks, a couple of expensive but delicious restaurants and a well priced one with good food Breakfast through dinner. It is on the strip but at near the end so it is not too crowded but you have access to everything. The most important thing is the beds are comfortable and the rooms are quiet. This will be my go to place from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: anna320
Reviews.Content: We were totally pleased with this hotel! We were impressed with every worker we encountered - they all seemed "happy and upbeat". It began when Jack (valet?) welcomed us; then Linda, who was so friendly at checkin - we felt right at home and realize that this doesn't always happen in large hotels. This high standard continued the entire time. We upgraded to the Paradise Tower, thus when we came "home" we were convenient to the elevator. Our room faced the aiport and mountains - that was a lovely breather from the hectic Strip scene. The hotel was bright and immaculate. We liked that we were close to shops in which we could purchase light snacks, beer and wine, and a nearby Food Court was also handy. The bus easily takes you to the other hotels ($7 for 24-hours). If you drive, use the valet service at the hotels - great deal, just the cost of a tip. We had the breakfast buffet (excellent) and also purchased fresh fruit (by weight) at a little stand near Starbuck's. The pool area is lovely - great for relaxing, even if the pool is closed; check the hot tub - it should be operating. We had a wonderful stay at the Tropicana and we highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Dave_S_P06
Reviews.Content: Went down to Vegas for Super Bowl Weekend and booked the "new" Tropicana. A number of issues came up during the stay. First, on check in it was a bit slow but not bad. We were there a bit early and our room was not ready. The couple we were with did get their room so they said they would put our keys in their room and make it a priority. We came back to the hotel 8 hours later and no key. It was a big hassle to get the key, took a long time for the person to come up to deal with this and this was very frustrating. One day we came back late and there were no towels left in our room after cleaning. Not sure how this possibly gets missed? We also experienced some apparently drunk people trying to gain access to our room around 6:00 a.m. one day. They did leave and were probably in the wrong tower. Rooms are nice but the shades don't work well so it gets light very early. The location is not the best and if you are seeing a show at the Mirage or down in this area you are looking at a $12 cab ride one way or a 30 minute walk. Overall we were disappointed with this hotel and will not go back. We will look for something in the middle like the Aria, which even if it costs more should be saved in cab rides.

Reviews.Title: “Nice remodel”
Reviews.Author: Sparkysan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trop over Superbowl weekend. Really enjoyed it, the remodel they did turned out nicely. Put it back on your list.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE The Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: Doug P
Reviews.Content: Last summer (2011) my partner and I were in Vegas to celebrate my birthday. We stumbled up on The Tropicana quite by accident and went in to check it out. We were blown away with the remodel! We loved everything from the decor (which is hip and fresh) to the casino to the entertainment - saw Gladys Knight perform. Though we weren't staying at The Tropicana on that trip, we ended up spending most of our 3 days there. This January (2012), we went back to Vegas to celebrate my partner's birthday. This trip we stayed at The Tropicana for 2 nights - and LOVED it! The rooms are great, the staff is fantastic, and the casino is still one of the best smaller casinos around. Our favorite thing about this hotel/casino is that it smells great! They must do something special - never smells like cigarette smoke! We love this hotel and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Annual SB Trip”
Reviews.Author: Stephen W
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Trop for the long Super Bowl weekend. Price was fantastic. Casino looks great. Rooms very nice. Only a couple minor issues. Maids failed to show up at all one day and tv remote didnt work. However, lost my cell phone with only 20 mins to get to the airport and Concierge frantically worked the phones to help me find it. This guy was awesome. LaShonda in booking was also amazing and went above and beyond in assisting me. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend at the Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: Rob V
Reviews.Content: Check in was a little slow, but we were given a room in the front tower with a view of the strip, and as this was our first trip to Vegas we loved having the view. We really enjoyed the room, very nice decor, very clean and overall an excellent experience. I thought it was a beautiful hotel. I found the shower a little small (we had the basic room) and was disappointed that there was not a safe in the room, but otherwise was very happy with the accomodations. Casino is smaller than most on the strip, but it was really nice. I took advantage of the food court for some pizza (pretty good) and Starbucks coffee. I can't comment on any of the restaurants, but I may visit them next time I'm there. I would definitely stay at the Tropicana again. The pool area, although too cold to use in February, was quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Like walking ?”
Reviews.Author: LisPtt
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tropicana for 10 days in October got a great deal on the room, I only stayed here due to someone in our party wanting to stay here I've been a few times to Vegas so wasn't that fussed where I stayed what I didn't know was that someone had stayed there before the refurb and just wanted to see what it was like! Not the reason to book a 10 night stay loool. The hotel is clean the rooms are nice pool area ok good if you great a great price. The location is not the best it's seems you have to walk miles even just to get to the lift to go to your room, there's a coffee place and a small snack bar a couple of expensive restaurants no proper shops if you want a hot dog pizza anything fast-food you have to go to another hotel even Buffett you have to go to another hotel. One thing I love about the hotels in vegas are the free toiletries I normal go home with a suitcase full the ones the do supply not worth taking. Casino is small and waitresses well if you can find one you might get a drink in 30 mins by which time you will have to find her go to the MGM or new York new York it will be quicker. It's a shame there's not more shops most of the other hotels all have a mall so I didn't spend much time here. All in all ok if you get a good deal on the room if your here for less than 5 days would stay in a hotel further down to save time and your legs.

Reviews.Title: “All around great Vegas hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tricia t
Reviews.Content: Recent renovations have turned this hotel into a gem along the strip!! With a bright interior, it is a welcome retreat from the typical dark and dingy Vegas hotels. The rooms were nicely decorated, clean and comfortable with good air quality. And the beds were very nice! The entire hotel was exceptionally clean. Restaurants were excellent and amenities top notch. Pool was closed, but pool area appeared large and spectacular!! Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Overall we were more than impressed with the value for our money!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great rates!”
Reviews.Author: K00chi
Reviews.Content: Was my 1st time stay here, and by far the nicest hotel we have stayed in for the $69 rate we got! While not in the center of the strip, it was not at the very end either and easy to get to MGM and NYNY casinos by walkways. Would love to stay here in warmer weather to try out the pool area, it looked very nice

Reviews.Title: “Smells Great!”
Reviews.Author: Vacationaholica
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, you can tell they definitely did a nice renovation. I was all about the hot tub area. My whole point of staying here was the hot tubs. They were kept at a optimum temperature, but neither of the hot tubs did work. We gambled at the casino as well and it was very nice and had plenty of updated machines, the area was not crowded at all either. Nice place!

Reviews.Title: “Better than I anticipated”
Reviews.Author: mrsbeny
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over super bowl weekend. We usually stay at a nearby casino but this was half the price. Beds are comfortable, bathroom is serviceable and the room, overall, is good. We have stayed here before, years ago and I was hesitant to try it again but the renovation seems to have been very successful. That said, I felt that the staff were pushing RPM, the nightclub a little hard. I never went but at first glance the place wasn't exactly bumping. Also the casino staff were cranky at night (though at check in everyone was very pleasant). My opinion is that I would stay here again if the price is right but will continue to choose other casinos that are within walking distance for my entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “You are as good as your Staff”
Reviews.Author: AnnekDessens
Reviews.Content: It is said that you are only as good as your weakest link and at Tropicana, there are no weak links in their staff. What a wonderful experience to be met, greeted and treated by the entire staff your entire stay as a genuine and real person. I stayed there a week and not once was I disappointed by the people working there: from the people at Starbucks to the janitorial team. I highly recommend this newly refurbished hotel and wonderful people that make the place feel like a home-away from-home!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sam B
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed here for a week in early September 2011. We originally had a room in the club tower which was a nice room, the furnishings and decor was indeed tropical, however we kept having issues with our room cards. We were told this could not be fixed until the following morning and they offered us a room swap. We asked if it was possible if we could have a room in the Paradise Tower which they gave us, we now also had a view of the strip which was much better than the view we had previously of pretty much nothing! The pool area was very nice, we always managed to get a lounger even when we didn't get to the pool until late. You do have to reserve the beds however we laid on one that didn't have a reserved sign on it on our first day and no-one said anything! The only downside we felt was that it is very much at one end of the strip and can be quite a walk. However we did discover the strip buses halfway through the week which were really cheap and stopped right outside the Tropicana. Having previously stayed at the Luxor, the Tropicana was much more modern and slightly closer to the centre of the strip! It's also worth going to Club Nikki on a night too, just see the promoters outside the front of the hotel and they give you a free entry for being a hotel guest, whether you are male or female. As the drinks were expensive inside we kept returning to the casino/hotel shop for drinks before returning! All in all, I would recommend the Tropicana however next time may venture further central on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Good payback”
Reviews.Author: Clarabellenh
Reviews.Content: We gambled at this casino while waiting for Recycled Percussion (5 stars in my book) to start. They offered us up to $200 in our losses back to use by midnight so we came back and played our losses after the show. The staff were very nice but the drinks were very slow in coming. I forgot my sweater and it was turned in to lost and found and all were helpful in locating. I recommend the casino, the slot offer and the show!

Reviews.Title: “Great 2 day stay at the Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: Margueritte J
Reviews.Content: Was there for a 2 day stay. Rooms were fresh and clean. Staff were friendly and helpful. Will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: sharon s
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana far exceeded my expectations. The Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Jay B was very welcoming at check in and continued to help us throughout our stay. The hotel and pool are is so much nicer after all the remodeling. The rooms were very clean and bright! I recommend the Tropicana to all my friends who are planning to stay in Las Vegas!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: PatnFrankDallas_Tx
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent room on the 14th floor in the older section overlooking the Habitat, full of beautiful trees and animals . The Habitat tower is also the least expensive but the rooms do not include a coffee maker as in the renovated tower. I asked the Front Desk to replace a missing clock/radio which was delivered within 10 minutes. The same for my wife's request for an extra blanket. The casino's rewards card does not work in the Bills Gambling Casino so you need to re-register. Transportation note: Several years ago we obtained a free senior pass for 50% off bus fares and could buy tickets at convenient bus stops. Now you can only buy the tickets at the new downtown terminal (or at he far south strip terminal) which is about 6 blocks from Tremont St. The regular fares have been increased to $5.00 for a 2 hour ticket (one way ?) or $7.00 for a 24 hour ticket. A group (under 4) would find a taxi fare comparible and much more convenient. They also operate an other bus separate from the Deuce which skips many of the stops.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay at a Harrah's property next year”
Reviews.Author: Bonzer
Reviews.Content: Our 2nd stay in 2 years, this time in the club tower. It is a hike back to the room, but I love to walk. Positive note the front desk and wait staff are pleasant and friendly. Room was nice, everything is fresh and new, we had a wonderful city view as requested. Negative - don't like the restaurant choices, had to go to the MGM for the monorail and food. The resort fee is now $15 per night it was $10 last year, it irks me. The fee is for a pool not open, phone, health club, internet. Because all of the benefits are listed we feel like it cost us $60 to have our boarding passes printed. The hotels need to get smart and just charge more per room up front. The comedy club is closed, and what is up with the Mob experience? It's a deserted gift shop, you go in and look at tee shirts. No one else is there, the lone staff person standing around bored. It was much advertised last year and now it's an underground gift shop, we passed construction and tables and broken items in the hall to get there. We did not take the tour because it was uninviting and strange. Next year we have decided to stay at any Harrah's property none have a resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel For Its Purpose!”
Reviews.Author: D_8989
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed at the Tropicana for a week in Aug 2011. When you are in Vegas, the only thing you care about in your hotel room is a clean, lump-free bed and a clean pool. Who cares about the rest? hello you're in VEGAS!!! I could care less if the carpet is "totally 90s" or the wall colours aren't beautiful enough. I thought the decor was tasteful and had a tropical feel to it. The hotel is right at the end of the strip, which I really liked because then you could start on that end and work your way to the other side. It's a little bit of a walk from the front desk to get to your room, which is a little crappy when it's 4am and you're drunk in heels but it's definitely manageable. The club inside Tropicana (Club Nikki) was really boring. There was no one in the club when we got there the first time. The second time, it was packed but way too small so we could barely move. But no worries, other clubs are just steps away! The pool was very clean. There was a 50/50 chance that we'd get a beach chair. But we were content with laying on our towels when we couldn't get one. I liked that the pool wasn't filled with "overly beautiful people" so we could be ugly and hungover without worrying about everyone around us. The drinks were overpriced but they're overpriced everywhere! Would definitely stay here again :)

Reviews.Title: “First class.”
Reviews.Author: campsbytwo
Reviews.Content: Sorry about the delay writing this review it,s our first one.We have been coming to Vegas every year for the last 12 and as good as all the other hotels where including Venetian, Ceasers etc we just had to put this review in. From start at check in MEL could not have been more helpful,as we allways come to Vegas for 2 weeks(to far to come for less) she gave us a great room ( top floor paradise tower looking down the strip so we could see the fireworks on new years eve ).The chambermaids could not have been any better very helpful. We only play the slots but the cocktail waitresses where allways around supplying us with drinks ( red wine and a corona please ).Nikki cafe for steaks and Pelegrino,s for the best pizza,s in Vegas are a must. Best of all where do they get the beds never slept so well. Have recommended this hotel to all our friends and anyone else who are thinking of coming to Vegas in the near future. One slight hiccup is the resort fee after reading a recent review on what is included in the fee we payed the fee for nothing but htis will not stop us from coming to this great hotel again. Once again thanks to every one at the TROPICANA.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: CrAiGnEggS
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana was just renovated a while ago and the rooms were pretty fresh. I went with a few friends for a bachelor party/wedding trip. So friends and older family members were in our group. It was a great week and I would love to come back here again. Location, Location, Location! You are right across the street from the MGM, New York New York and Excalibur so there you are there. Not much of a casino on the main floor, but the pool is decent and the new sports book is the worst kept secret to date I suppose. Go here before the reputation gets out.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Erin C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tropicana Jan. 3-6. It was my first time staying in their newly remodeled rooms. They are beautiful, modern, large and have lots of sunlight. Check-in was quick and friendly, the housekeepers were amazing and thoughtful, bringing us new cups since they saw we brought our own coffee maker. The Floor managers of the casino were incredibly helpful when we had a problem getting service for beverages. We ate three times at Cafe Nikki. The food was excellent and the service was outstanding. The restaurant manager even comped our meal and wine on the last night. All in all I would recommend this hotel for anyone looking to stay at an amazing rate, with beautiful rooms and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: JohnandJanMinnesota
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights at the Tropicana last week. Booked the hotel based on other reviews and we were happy with the room. The recent upgrade to the hotel rooms and the hotel was very evident. The self-parking is very convienient and the check-in went very smoothly. I had reserved a King Bed Non-Smoking in the Club Tower but did not spend the extra $15 per night for the Vegas Blvd. view. At check-in we were offered a two Queen Beds room with a Vegas Blvd. view on the 15th floor so we took that. Glad we did because I think there may have been more noise on the airport side, but not sure on that. But the view of the MGM, Treasure Island and New York, New York was nice at night. Others have mentioned the walk from the casino to the Club Tower and it is a little distance, but that didn't bother us. If you take a short-cut through the pool area you can get to the parking ramp fairly quickly. The room itself was very nice, great TV, large bath tub with shower, bed was great and we slept very well. Overall we were very happy with it. At check-out there was one issue when the second night came up as higher than the first night. I told the check-out person that the rate should have been the same for both nights. She looked at the reservation and agreed but didn't know what happened. Maybe it was because we were switched to the other room??? She took off the resort fee which put the second night back to the rate it was supposed to be so that was fine with me. We have stayed in other Vegas hotels before, some better and some not, but for the price, we would go back to the Tropicana in the future. If money is no object, then definately go for the Bellagio, Aria, Cosmopolitan or Wynn, but for us, the Tropicana worked out fine.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, great value, right on the strip”
Reviews.Author: subhodeep
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 13 people travelling on holiday and we stayed at the Las Vegas Tropicana. It had just been renovated and the rooms were very nice and comfortable, breakfast had a good spread and the location was great ( had MGM on one side and Luxor right opposite). The Casino was a functional one ( walk over to the MGM which is just an escalator away). Being right on the strip, it was close to all the entertainment and dining. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Big Fan of The Trop!”
Reviews.Author: sbva65
Reviews.Content: Background: I typically go to Vegas between April and Oct when the pools are open, so I usually stay at MGM (before the Tropicana refurb) for the pool and value, but spend a lot of time in the Tropicana casino. Have now stayed at Tropicana 3 nights in 2 different trips. Room Reviews: I have only stayed at the Tropicana twice since the refurb. As long as a room is clean and comfortable, I don't really ask for more from a Vegas hotel. I am not there to hang out in the room, as I can do that at home. I stayed in a comped regular room in the back tower (I forget what it is called). It is a bit of a hike from the front door, but a 3-5 min walk does not really bother me and the elevators are lightening fast and zip you up 18 floors literally in about 10 seconds. The room was bright, clean, comfortable bed, flat screen TV, "free" internet, work desk, etc. It was certainly nice and quiet in the back, with just a parking lot and the airport behind you. I ended up working several hours and had no issues with the internet connection. The desk is a tad high for the chairs, so I would not want to work 8 hrs straight, but comfortable enough for a few hrs at a time. I am not a fan of the scent of the bath amenities (shampoo, etc), but that is one of the last things I care about in a hotel. There is a Starbucks kiosk right at the elevators, so you can pop down for a caffeine fix quickly. My last stay, I was bumped up to a suite in the main tower with a view straight down Las Vegas Blvd. Not sure which suite it was, as it was a comped one night stay and I was not about to ask questions. The suite was huge. Probably 800 sq ft. It had a fridge, flat screen 2 couches, coffee maker, and corner suite so windows on 2 sides of the room. The separate bedroom was nearly as big as many vegas hotel rooms. It had a flat screen TV that matched the one in the suite area, and a very large bathroom. I was only there for about 10 hrs total, so did not get to really spend much time there other than the 5 or so hrs I slept. Very nice room though. Everyone I have dealt with on the Tropicana staff has been extremely friendly/nice and helpful. I can't think of a single interaction that was unpleasant during my stays there or when visiting the casino (which is daily when I stay at MGM). Casino: This is what brought me to the Trop a few yrs ago and made it my favorite. It is smaller than many strip casinos, but has the games I want to play. There are 2 craps tables and usually 5 or 6 BJ tables going. They have other table games (roulette, let it ride, etc), but I don't play those. The refurbished casino looks great. Everything is new and shiny. The main reason I like the Trop Casino is the staff, from the pit bosses to the dealers. Very relaxed, fun, and personable. You actually enjoy conversing with most of them while playing. They usually have a $5 craps table and at least a few $5 BJ tables, though there were more $10 tables than $5 tables during the weekend the last time I was there. Yes, many of the cocktail waitresses are over 40 and look it, but all are as friendly as can be. I don't go there to ogle the cocktail waitresses ... I go to gamble. (Note: If you want a pleasure pit type environment and crappy BJ rules, hit up NYNY next door). The drink service is usually quite good at the tables, though there is an occasional 20 min or so lull where they are scarce for a bit. I can usually get drinks as fast as I can put 'em down. Hotel Restaurants: I must say I don't eat here much, other than a quick late night bite at the deli/pizza place. They do have mostly higher end restaurants from what I have seen. Plenty of fast food type places at NYNY and MGM, both of which are a 5 min walk from Tropicana. Pool: Went to the pool one afternoon last year, and I think additional refurb has been done since then. No complaints about it. Not as large as the MGM pool area, but plenty of chairs and not too crowded. It was late september, so not really prime party season (it was as lively as the MGM pool, which I also went to). Overall, for a mid-tier hotel, the Trop is one of my first choices in Vegas. I typically go there to gamble quite a bit whether I am staying there or not.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !”
Reviews.Author: carpor
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with large rooms, amazing pool, friendly staff and a very good price. Great location ! We will return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at the Tropicana Hotel - Little Quirky”
Reviews.Author: wemjam
Reviews.Content: Just got back yesterday from a five night stay at the Tropicana. Got a good deal on Priceline so decided to give this hotel a try. Location is good, close to several restaurants and other hotels/casinos. However, it is at one end of the strip, so not real close to mid strip...which means a lot of walking. (Food court with Wendy's, Sabaro, Del Taco, Subway, and a couple other places real close for resonable food), also a La Salsa (great breakfast special for $3.95), and a Denny's close for other resonable food. Had a two queen bed 18th floor room (had confirmed a King a two weeks before arrival, but upon check in was told they didn't have one). Had a nice view of the far south end of the strip, Excalibur, Luxor, Mandalay Bay. If you want a view up the strip the other way...those rooms cost a little more. Room was more than adaquate in size, but did not have any "extras" (coffee maker, fridge, etc.). Decor is vibrant and refreshing, beds/pillows very confortable. Only main issue with the room was housekeeping. The room was clean - when they cleaned it...but had a hard time getting them in there to do it. So, here's the story... 2nd full day there went out all day and came back at 3:30-3:45pm to an unclean room.. a bit late in the day for the room not to be clean. Wanted a nap so called room service and said they'd send someone right up....waited an hour and still noone. Finally chased down a room service cart in the hall and gave them our dirty towels for soime clean ones, and told them not to worry about the rest of it. Not a good display, but figured OK, it's Saturday and they are busy. So next day, out all day again (and walked past the cart cleaning the room next to ours when we left first thing in the morning), came back again between 3 and 4 and room not cleaned. Hubby walked two doors down across the hall and asked the housekeeper there if she could do our room next, and she said wasn't her room and she'd have to call her supervisor. Didn't want to wait an hour for noone to show up again, so decided to ask front desk if they could expedite some service. To their credit, the front desk manager was very apologetic and said this is not a normal "service" level for them. He even comped us a dinner for our trouble and got the room taken care of right away.........here's the kicker though. That night (or actually next morning) at 3:45am! we were woken up by the door slaming in the room right next to ours and the vacuum going in the room, and out into the hall in front of our door. So, we go out all day for two days and can't get our room taken care of, and then at 3:45am their cleaning the room next to ours and making all kinds of noise when guests are sleeping. I have never stayed anywhere with such crazy housekeeping service. The rest of the staff was very nice, the Niki's Cafe restaurant was good, and the casino was alright (a little small, but OK). Guest Services Manager Nicole was outstanding and answered all our questions before and during our trip. There is a stop for the Duece bus right at the hotel so makes getting around easy. Taxi service is $11-$15 or so, same or less than a shuttle and direct service. All in all, for the price we payed it was well worth it...for full price at over $100 a night, probably wouldn't say here again (too many other choices at that price point).

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lynne42england
Reviews.Content: we visited this hotel in January 2012. it is undergoing a lot of updating. The rooms are lovely and large!!! Very nice indeed. It is at the bottom of the strip near the Luxor..Las vegas is amazing, we went to see celine dion at ceasers palace. wow....and also we done a ranch trip and flew over the canyon..A well worth trip, it cost about 350 dollars. but hey its worth it..take comfortable shoes as we walked 15miles in 4 days..fab hotels..enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but not a 4* hotel, resort fee makes poor value”
Reviews.Author: zracoon
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel, clean and recently renovated but it didn't match my expectations for a four star hotel. The check-in experience was about as friendly and welcoming as a late night Wal Mart run. We got it for a great price through priceline until we added the $15 resort fee which made it on par with the other nicer 4* hotels in Vegas. The resort fee was for things that other hotels tend to offer anyway like a fitness center and wifi. If you can get it for $15 less than a good three star hotel go for it, otherwise I'd select one of the other four star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Bruce M
Reviews.Content: We had a two night stay at the Tropicana in Jan. Everything about the place was great. Really enjoyed the room, the view, the bed, and the entertainment. There was a free burlesque show in the lounge called I Candy that we couldn't pass up. The dancers and singer were outstanding. Judy and Bruce from the great NW

Reviews.Title: “Great overall experience at the Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: zazarya
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tropicana in mid January for 3 nights. I chose the hotel because of the good reviews and the reasonable prices (I was able to get a special 24hr sale - it's worth it to suscribe to their newsletter if you plan on booking a room there). Check in was very fast, friendly and efficient. They gave us a 2-queens bed room, in the closest tower, facing towards Tropicana blvd (we had booked a Strip view room), with a view of the MGM Grand, on the 12th floor. The room itself was bigger than we expected! I liked the look, and it was very clean. Good bathroom, good beds. The wireless internet worked perfectly and I used it a lot. When we arrived, there was a problem with the in-room safe (the door couldn't close because there was some kind of metal thing sticking out). I called the reception and 5 minutes later, someone was there to fix it. We had some poor timing with the maid services after our 2nd night, so the room was only done once. However we went to the front desk the day before leaving and they were able to accomodate us with a late check-out (free of charge, at 1 PM). We tried two of the restaurants, Bacio and Café Nikki. Bacio was superb, and excellent value with the prix fixe meal for early birds (jetlag helped us on that one!). Café Nikki was more standard, with ok food and service being slow. We couldn't try the pool as it was closed in January. The hot tub was open but we didn't get the chance to try it. I liked the Casino's atmosphere (and smell!); it was not too dark or crowded, even on the week-end. Our room and hotel felt like a safe haven after walking all through the Strip. The location was ok, farther from the heart of the Strip than bigger hotels, but still next to a bus stop and right by the airport. Proximity to the MGM was also a big plus. My mom went to the Mirage last year and she preferred the Tropicana overall even though the Mirage had a higher star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable 6 Day Stay at Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: David W
Reviews.Content: Check in/out: It was a Breeze, from the airport to the room everyone was very friendly. Rooms: We stayed in the Penthouse Loft and a 2 bed connector. The rooms were recently remodeled and very spacious. Clean enough that i felt comfortable walking barefoot on the carpeting in the room. The view was amazing, All different parts of the strip. The penthouse loft had a spacious living area, dry bar with built in fridge, a downstairs bathroom, an eight person jacuzzi that we used every night. then up the spiral stair case with a very nice size bathroom with another jacuzzi, stand in shower, toilet area and a big double vanity and even the bathroom has a nice view of the strip. The connector was a standard two bed room but it was also set up very nicely. Casino: some might consider the casino table game area small but i think it's more personal that way. I like to get to know the dealers for a better stay. Eats: Though it might not have many selections i enjoy eating at Biscayne and Bacio. We also had visited the Nikki Cafe. Room Service was above par from what they usually would offer. I enjoy the "Market Place" for a late night snack or something on the go. Service. Guest Services accommodated every request i had. Even when i need 20 towels for the hot tub cause we had a few friends over. Everyone was very helpful from valet to concierge and everyone in between, such as where to go for good eats or shows to see or activities to do. A few occasion through-out the stay we arrange for the limo to travel in style, well worth the small fee. Summary: We travel to Las Vegas every January and i can tell you with certainty that i'm only staying at Tropicana from now on. And a special thanks to our host, Tyson, Joe and Armand for making the stay Unbelievable and Unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: kweber6
Reviews.Content: This hotel and staff are "FANTASTIC!!!" The hotel was spotlessly clean! The rooms are fantastic! The staff went above and beyond! Our room was upgraded to a "Strip View" in the Paradise Tower. We were given coupons for the buffet breakfast, and much more! We could not have had a more wonderful stay. Even the table boss was patient and understanding with us just trying to learn to play a game!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THE TROPICANA!”
Reviews.Author: PeterJulieAUS
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Trop many, many times over the past 10 years and enjoyed the hotel immensely! It’s just a short trip from the airport approximately 15 minutes by taxi and is on the strip itself. The hotel is great value, is in a great location, has staff that give great service with a smile and the renovations have made this place even better! Love the hotel pool which has grass area's and tree's that give it a tropical and lush feel. Restaurants are very nice but I enjoy Pellegrino's Pizza & Deli, particularly the BLT sandwiches! I would recommend the Trop to anyone travelling to Vegas and have done so on many occasions without any disappointment! I cannot wait to get back there! LOVE THE TROP!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay - Great Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: Jen F
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tropicana from Jan 20 - Jan 24 2012 and what a great experience!! All of the staff from check in to renting a car were amazing, friendly, and helpful and made us feel genuinely welcome. Room was great, beds comfy, view was wonderful - only downside as with all Vegas hotels, no in room coffee lol We have visited Vegas a few times, different hotel each time but we will definitely be back at the Tropicana, its a great home away from home ! :)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing value compared with other hotels on the Vegas strip”
Reviews.Author: gone2explore
Reviews.Content: The rooms are recently updated, so I found mine comfortable and clean. However, it was in the secondary tower, which was a fairly long walk from the main casino and the strip. My room would have had a decent view of the strip, but the windows are designed to look like a screen - a pattern of small dots on the glass, which made me a bit dizzy when I tried to look outside. The internet was not working in my hotel room. It was a frustrating waste of my time trying to get someone to fix it. They sent an electrician who eventually got it working, but I did not appreciate having to babysit the room while waiting for him to show up (I was told that I needed to be there for him to enter). Since the weather was near freezing and there were high wind advisories during most of my stay, I was not able to enjoy any of their pool amenities which were all outdoors. Nonetheless, they stuck me with a daily 'resort fee' so that I still had to pay extra for the broken internet and the useless 'resort' features. Without that fee, I would have said that their pricing was fair for quality of the rooms, but by the time that fee was added, I would have been happier staying elsewhere and feeling like I was getting my money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Luv it here !!!”
Reviews.Author: thefool
Reviews.Content: We have had nothing but the best experience at the Tropicana !!! We luv the hotel , we luv the people who work there !!! Usually stay in the Paradise Tower, have had no complaints. And yes, coming back in May !!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Julie L
Reviews.Content: Loved staying at the Tropicana! Very modern, clean and friendly environment. Check-in was so fast. The parking is easy to get to and not a far walk (and yes, plenty of parking for those with rental cars!). I was very happy about that. There are plenty of choices for food....the pizza was good, the gelato is FANTASTIC, Nikki's breakfast was great! The pool area is pretty (closed in January of course), but the hot tubs were open (2). Wi-fi worked fantastic -easy to get onto. Beds and linens all spotless and comfy! Everything was clean! The only downsides: the elevator music was somewhat annoying! (ha!)....and the cigarette smoke - when will they ban smoking in the casinos??? We had a great time in Vegas and the Tropicana was a great place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Breathe taking!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cervantes19
Reviews.Content: Probably one of the best hotels on the strip!! Tropicana is always my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: bijouxmesa
