Reviews.Content: Just checked in and it is beautiful. Very nice front desk. Great rate from Priceline. Looking forward to the rest of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Shari I
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at Silverton Hotel off the strip and decided to book with a Strip Hotel. We ended up with Tropicana. At first we were a little scared being the hotel is an older one. But were we in for a pleasant surprise! It was very nicely remodeled. And the service was excellent. The first person to great us was the bell man.He was so helpful and courteous. Then on to the front desk and she was so friendly and accommodated us to our satisfaction. Then the bell man brought our bags up in record time and explained everything in the room to us. We had a blast playing craps with the dealers. The casino people walking around were very helpful as well, helping us when we looked lost. Maid service was very good and friendly as well. I recommended this hotel to all our family coming up in the next few months.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, awesome hospitality, amazing staff!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AwesomeFashionista
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tropicana Thursday through Sunday...Jan 12-15 and it was absolutely amazing... When we arrived Check it was easy and no problems at all. They even let us upgrade our room without any issues. When we arrived in our room which was on the 12th floor our view was amazing!!! And so was our room... Big large comfortable bed, gigantic mirrors on the closet, nice big flat screen, I pod raidio charger. Our room was in great distance of everything and the room was cleaned daily!!! Whenever I return to Vegas this is my #1 pick... Staff was Sooooo welcoming with high energy!!!! I loved everything about the Tropicana!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: EllyN_08
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paradise Suite for 3 nights, and the room was spacious and loved the uplift done to the place! But I did find the bathroom amenities provided was quite basic. Would prefer if there's a separate shower rather than just a bath tub. There's free Wifi, so that's a plus. The bed was comfortable and they have good channel selection on TV, but hey, it's Vegas, you don't really stay in! Another comment, there was an espresso machine in our room, but it lack quality. The coffee was very very weak. But, all in all, it was a pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “i was there”
Reviews.Author: steve m
Reviews.Content: on person at the check in desk at 7pm on coffie maker in room as said on web site

Reviews.Title: “"Awesome Stay"”
Reviews.Author: MargaritaL1
Reviews.Content: I was there for the CES and the location was excellent! Shuttle services was provided with no extra fees. So close to the airport and right by the strip!! The room was so clean I really enjoyed that! The bed was very comfortable. I loved the view! The only problem I encountered was the vending machine was out of service, but no problem I went down one floor and purchased my water. The only thing that will make this room complete would be a small refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Tropicana!”
Reviews.Author: Mike G
Reviews.Content: The staff was excellent! My wife left for her meeting and I put the kids in daycare, then I ordered a private massage in my room and was pleasantly happy with the prompt and professional service. ;)

Reviews.Title: “Any positive reviews you read are so true.”
Reviews.Author: ladybugSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: Yes the rooms are really great. The staff are the nicest in this town. No kidding genuine hospitality. The beds are top notch. Stayed here with friends on a vacation package, I usually stay at the Mandarin or Trump, Encore and for the rates here the Tropicana will see me again. Didn't eat at any restaurants here but the room service coffee Is good thanks to Tony from room service. Ps. The windows open, so nice to get fresh air. Thanks Tropicana. The casino is just the right size too. Not like Mandalay Bay where you get lost in their maze.

Reviews.Title: “Renovations coming along nicely”
Reviews.Author: CKBlack007
Reviews.Content: I used to just meet friends in the Tropicana, but since the renovations, I have come to stay there with each visit. Rooms are clean and the staff is very friendly. I stayed during a convention in January so I did not get to experience the new lagoon, but the spa was nice and the food in the restaurant was always good. I recommend it to visitors. This is a "right-sized" strip casino for me with "old Vegas" overtones and modern convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mindfixation
Reviews.Content: We reserved it via Hotwire. It was at the end of the strip, which let us walk the strip and enjoy the sights. Free parking was great! The only downside would be the resort fee of 14.99$ that you had to pay on top of your stay - but that was better than the 20$ most hotels charge on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: roseyork
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas and the Tropicana did not dissapoint. The room was clean, bathroom spacious. The hotel staff was very friendly, I heard the hotel was recently renovated...well it looked beautiful. There is a resort fee, however, but this will be hard to avoid if you want a hotel on the strip. The Tropicana is located on the south strip, but there is a bus stop right in front that will take you anywhere along the strip you'd care to go.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome one day trip!”
Reviews.Author: Michael G
Reviews.Content: I recently took a trip to vegas and chose to stay at tropicana. I have stayed here many times in the past even the OLD tropicana which was... well... a real dump. The new decor is AMAZING. The retheaming of the place to a beach style is refreshing. Extremely comfortable. I stayed in the minimum room and was super comfortable. Very comfortable beds... EXTREMELY important in my opinion. I look for the 'bang for your buck factor" and the hotel and casino definitely offer a great value at a convenient location on the strip. Ihome for party tunes too in the room :) I am a Video Poker player and the video poker section with bar for comped drinks is a hop skip and a jump away from the elevator. Great for when you are returning to your room at 5:00AM... the casino is large but very easy to navigate. I will DEFINATLY stay here again. Some people where talking about construction in the past, but this weekend It looked like a completed resort with no construction or hard hats going on :) The staff: OK, this is a BIG thing for me too. Everyone was SO POLITE!!! Seriously though I had a positive experience with every single one of the tropicana empolyees I ran in to! This is often not spoken about, but feeling appreciated by the resort employees goes a LONG way.\ Also, Be sure to eat at Biscayne... Great aged steak and the seafood pasta is out of this world. Again.. A 10 out of 10 on service. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “My Recent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Don F
Reviews.Content: I booked thru the CES Special and received great rates, stayed in the Paradise Tower (previous stays were in the old Island Tower) excellent room and I loved the flatscreen HDTV with actual HD programming. Bathroom was nice with the full tub and I like the overhaul of everything at the "new" Tropicana. Staff is very friendly and helpful, the only thing I miss was the buffet which is now a spa.

Reviews.Title: “Like I was staying @ a friends house.”
Reviews.Author: Shara1
Reviews.Content: The room was marvelous & comfortable & clean!! Everything I needed was there. The whole staff I encountered was more than friendly. Did not make me feel as if I was a bother when I asked about something. The casino was just the right size & not smoke filled, I could actually see across the room. Reasonable rate & i was not charged athe resort fee which was nice as I did not use any of the facilities included.

Reviews.Title: “Semi-old Vegas With A New Look”
Reviews.Author: SuperBear
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tropicana years ago-in the 80's. It has changed in a good way. Vegas hotels have become too over the top with everyone trying to keep up with the Jones. If you want a very reasonable hotel with a touch of old Vegas, this is the place for you. The good things-location. Closest to airport. Price. Hotel upgrade. Good location on the strip. The staff bends over backwards for you and really cares. I like businesses that appreciate their customers and try to make you happy. Give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - wonderful refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: nickss1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Trop at the end of a road trip in NV and AZ in Oct 2011. I remember staying at the hotel about 15 yrs around, and boy what an awesome upgrade. Following on from various reviews, I decided to stay here and what a stella choice. Spent four days here. I turned up at noon, but the room wasnt ready (check-in was at 3, so I was trying my luck a bit). No problem as went for something to eat. Room was ready upon return. It was in club tower - which is quite a walk from reception, which could be a problem to some. (paradise tower is closer). Great room, large and very clean. Very comfortable bed. HD TV. The 10$ resort fee includes wifi, which worked excellent in room and at pool. Pool was awesome. A great stay, and I will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana in Nov/Dec”
Reviews.Author: SciFi_Seeker
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the newly remodeled Tropicana in November 2011 It looked great everything was bright and clean, the staff was friendly, the room was a very nice size. The onsite casino was very small, The Las Vegas Mob Experience was half shutdown and all the pools were closed for the season. They charge a $15.00 resort fee (most hotels in Vegas do, consider it the vig) but provide no resort amenities. The onsite restaurant(s) were a little too high class and high price for me, consider this fair warning you will spend a lot more on food than you will expect to.The tub drains slowly, The toilet has some turbo flush thing that scared the crap out of me the first time I flushed it. Overall I spent most of my time in other locations because there was nothing to do at the Tropicana. I paid $49 a night for the room which was an average price for that time of year. November/ December in Vegas is COLD!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel on the strip - very friendly”
Reviews.Author: MrEcosse
Reviews.Content: Been coming to Vegas for 10 years. First time staying in the Tropicana, but it won't be our last. If like us you remember the old tired Tropicana from a few years ago you are going to be pleasantly surprised by the renovations. We stayed here for the CES convention having got a reasonable rate via the convention. Have to say everything from start to finish was very impressive. We had to make a few changes to dates on both rooms we booked. Noriel in reservations was quick to respond to us and very helpful. Check-in was via their temporary check in area (the new one will be open now). This was efficient and friendly. This something that was characteristic of all of the staff at the Tropicana. Maybe it's because it's not one of the big monoliths on the strip that it allows them to provide this friendly service. But it's probably about hiring good people and keeping them well motivated. The room was clean and fresh. Nice contemporary muted colors and the all important comfy bed. Nothing to complain about here. Good TV with proper HD too (we are geeks – these things are important). Bathroom had been refreshed too but nice to see they had retained a full size bath tub. Although it was in the Paradise (Tiffany) Tower facing the airport there was no noise. Aircon was quiet too - sometimes that can be real clanky in Vegas for some reason. We ate in both Biscayne (Steak) and Bacio (Italian) both very good an reviewed separately. The Ambhar lounge was a good 'watering hole' especially when the iCandy girls were performing (don't tell me that was their last night? Bring 'em back!). By the third evening the cocktail waitress knew exactly what we were all drinking – try getting that kind of service in one of the soulless mega resorts. And no we weren't drinking bottles of Champagne and throwing around 100 dollar bills. We aren't the gambling kind so can't let you know about the tables and slots. But if you've never been to the Tropicana since its revamp I'd say this is one bet that's bound to come good. We'll be back next year or sooner if we can find a 'business' reason to visit town.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: stsheila
Reviews.Content: Read great reviews of the Tropicana, so decided to give it a try, last time being over 20 years ago. We were placed in a room in the far tower, by the pool. Since the pool was closed, it was not near anything...and a LOOOONG walk to casino. They offered to move us the next day, when room opened up, which was great! Much preferred tower by casino. Rooms in both towers were fine! No complaints about hotel, valet, etc....all good! My only dislike, that would prevent me from staying again, is the casino is very small. Very few table choices, and had hard even finding slot I wanted to play. I like to stay where I enjoy playing, so when with group, easy for some to just go up to their room when done. So while I liked hotel, hotel staff, and all it had to offer, would not stay here again because did not like the Casino....also, we were there to celebrate my daughter's 21st, and they did not acknowledge in any way...thought some little perk would have been nice, to make her feel special.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay Better Than The First”
Reviews.Author: neesb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trop for the second time this month. We stayed in January 2010 because of all the buzz about the newly remodeled hotel and it did not disappoint us at all. The rooms are all remodeled and so clean, the staff never ceases to amaze us and we both love the smaller casino. When we left there last year we knew we would look no further on our next trip to Vegas. Once again the Trop did not disappoint us. The staff never ceases to amaze me--always asking if there is anything they can do for you and they always have a smile when they see you. When I saw the gentleman in a suit and tie stoop down to pick up a piece of trash and throw it away I realized this must be why the staff is so great-it starts at the top. The addition of the food court was a very welcome change for the both of us. A 24 hour Starbucks and deli and we got some great use out of them both. I commented to one of the employees how nice it was to have a small deli and he said--just wait until you come back-there is more coming. We go to Vegas ever year and we have no need to look any further for a hotel. As long as the Tropicana keeps doing what they are doing we will be staying there. After all--I cannot wait to see what they do next!

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana was a great place for first visit to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Julie925
Reviews.Content: Read reviews and felt the most positive about choosing to stay at the Tropicana and was not disappointed. The room was clean, sun woke us up too early so the staff changed us to room on other side, no issue. We ate at both the restaurants in the Tropicana and we're pleased with both service and food. The location was perfect for exploring and is a clean safe area. Would have liked it if there was a food court at the Tropicana for quick bites when rushing to shows etc. as we headed to the MGM for that. Loved the pool and spent alot of time there. Very happy with the Tropicana and have recommended it to others.

Reviews.Title: “I'm not Sure”
Reviews.Author: cbestard
Reviews.Content: about these Las Vegas ratings on hotels.I've relied very heavily on Tripdavisor ranking in the past and found them generally honest. But something is stinky about Las Vegas ratings. I stayed at the #14 rated Tropicana this weekend--due primarily to it's location--and was underwhelmed. To say the Tropicana is rated above the Venetian, or Palazzo, or Aria is preposterous. True, it's remodeled and generally clean, but it's still a third tier hotel and no hiding it's 50+ year old structure. For a little more ( I paid 90/night, plus a ridiculous $15 resort fee), you can stay at a MUCH nicer place. Tripdavisor, I'd really start to parse these Las Vegas ratings for honesty, I can't help but think they are manipulated in Las Vegas..

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: VeredMBS
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at the tropicana hotel for 3 nights in January 2012. It was a great stay, the rooms were clean and the staff was very friendly. it is a bit far from the main events on the boulevard and not alot of options to eat... Great value for our money, we will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Always a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: VegasHappy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tropicana the first week of January. My husband and I go to Vegas 3-4 times per year. We always spend at least a few days at the Tropicana. The renos are great. We visited the Mob Experience and while the interactive part isn't available yet, the exhibit is excellent! We will definately go back for that. The service is always top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay at the Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: rgc1600
Reviews.Content: With all the choices in Vegas, I had a hard time balancing location and value when making my hotel choice. I attended a conference at Caesar's Palace, and I wanted to stay somewhere close by. But the prices for all mid-level hotels in that section of the Strip were too high, and Tropicana had both good rates and good reviews here on TripAdvisor. While it was a bit inconvenient ($9 taxi rides each way), I think I made a good choice. Most of the Tropicana has been recently renovated, and it's updated and clean. My room, a "Deluxe" room, was more than adequate. Comfortable bed, large HDTV, quiet. I stayed in the closer Paradise Tower, which I highly recommend. The casino was a good size, not as large as others I visited, but more than adequate. The dealers were friendly, and while I played some blackjack and slots, I'll leave the gambling reviews to those more experienced and qualified. My one quibble with the Tropicana is its dining options. I traveled alone, and didn't have an interest in the more upscale hotel restaurants. They probably wouldn't have been my choice even if traveling with my wife. But in a moderate scale hotel like this, there should be a lot more casual dining choices. There's a Starbucks, a pizza/sandwich shop, and a yogurt store. This is a weakness the hotel really should have addressed in its remodeling. Still, a good experience. The next trip to Vegas, I'll definitely give the Tropicana full consideration. Not a "wow," but still, quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation and location.”
Reviews.Author: Darlene G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tropicana for 4 nights in January and had a great time..We had stayed there previously in April and were so impressed we came back to stay again. Both times the service has been excellent, the rooms have been thoroughly renovated and look like brand new. Tropicana is a quieter smaller casino with lots of slot choices and unlike most casinos is very bright and airy. The pool area is second to none and even though it was too cool to enjoy it in January, we will be back to use it. We love the Tropicana and plan on returning within the next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: IdeasForDownload
Reviews.Content: When Hotwire said the hotel I was getting was four star, I was sure it was going to be Mandalay Bay. When I found out it was Tropicana, I thought to myself, "There is no way - that hotel has been there forever!" I've stayed at almost every hotel on the strip, but this was the first time at Tropicana and I was pleasantly surprised. The room was large, clean and updated. They've remodeled every area of the hotel including the hallways. Parking was easy as well. A smaller casino means you won't feel like you are doing a 5K to get outside or to the parking lot. Overall, a great stay and I'd recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay at The Tropicana contained more magic than a bag full of children's laughter.”
Reviews.Author: Designisgo
Reviews.Content: I was thoroughly pleased with our stay at The Tropicana. From the front desk staff to the wait staff at Club Nikki, everyone went out of their way to make our stay great. We even used a discount travel site to book our room, and that didn't affect how we were treated in any way negatively (which has happened at other establishments). Thank you for a wonderful stay, Tropicana! We will be visiting again!

Reviews.Title: “Super stay at 'The Trop'”
Reviews.Author: Is-It-Ishi
Reviews.Content: We experienced a superb seven day stay at the Tropicana (30 Dec 2011 - 6 Jan 2012). We have visited Vegas many times but hadn't stayed at the Tropicana before. We found the hotel excellent - the refurbished room was superior to other properties in the same class that we have stayed at; hence we will be recommending the 'Trop' to friends and family. The bedroom furniture/ bed/ TV etc were all new and provided a bright and airy environment. The bathroom appears to be part re-furbished, we found the shower-head a little low! From reading other reviews it sounds as though bathrooms are being worked on so when we return this won't be a problem. We found the staff who we spoke to over the course of the week were a credit to the organisation - friendly, professional and very much wanting to help us enjoy our stay. This was noticeably different to some of the other properties that we have stayed at previously. The daily resort fee includes wireless internet connection but we found the service intermittent. We needed to access emails on a daily basis and struggled on some occasions to get good connectivity. We also used the new gym (now located in Glow Spa and not as indicated in the room guide), all new machines and overlooking the pool area, a good environment for your workout. Overall a super stay, we certainly plan to return and look forward to enjoying the Tropicana again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room with a nice tropical decor”
Reviews.Author: Deandrea B
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a great January stay at the Tropicana. The hotel has been completely transformed. Everything is new. There is a new Starbucks in the casino. The rooms have been completely remodeled with a great tropical decor. The mattresses are new and the beds are comfortable. I have been stayed at the Tropicana numerous times and my room has always been very clean. The Trop is a great location on the Vegas strip too.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience at the new Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: PATravelers15401
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Tropicana as part of a promotion offered by the hotel management. Although not completed, the hotel and casino has undergone a major transformation. We were pleasantly surprised by the decor and comfort of our spacious room. The bedroom and bath were very clean. The casino layout was not cramped and easy to navigate and clean. We enjoyed the scope and variety of slots offered. The major casino restaurants were not open during our visit. However, we did eat at the "Niki Cafe". The cafe was clean, the service excellent and the food above average. The one measure of a very good casino/hotel is the quality of its staff. Every employee that we had occasion to interact with was pleasant, courteous and helpful. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: lcarvill
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay at the Tropicana. Rooms are great and the staff is excellent, a great variety of machines and the casino is just the right size. We travel to Las Vegas approximately 2 to 3 times a year and for the past 2 years have stayed only at the Trop. We find the service more personal, staff actually remember who you are and it make's one feel good. Food is good both at Niki's as well as the Deli. We have recommended this hotel to other family members traveling to Las \vegas as well. Also the location, at the four corners of the larger casinos, able to get out and walk around to see some sights, close to airport. Will be visiting the Trop again in the spring. Also excellent comps. The only place we stay.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana is great place that doesn't overwhelm”
Reviews.Author: Bruce F
Reviews.Content: Just completed a stay at the Tropicana. At checkin I was upgraded to a suite with a beautiful view of the strip. The room was spotless, bed was very comfortable and towels and linens were top notch. The room must have recently been remodled. Had dinner in the Nikki cafe, the prime rib was delicious and medium rare as I asked for. The casino was small, but had a wide selection of slots. It was not at all smokie. I actually hit a jackpot, too. The only issue is the front desk is being remodled, but when it is finished, it should be nice. I was surprised to find the Tropicana so up to date since it has been around for years. If you are like me, I am happy to trade the wow factor of some resorts for an emphasis on the things that matter.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: islandhoppers
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, the service was ok, but we were disappointed by the room. So, sincwether weren't busy we asked to see more rooms - and they accomodated us. In the end we saw three rooms. But, I will start with the good.... Hallways pleasant Furniture nice in rooms Flooring / carpet nice Wallpaper, crown moldings nice. Lots of hangers Window shutters nice.  Don't absorb smells like drapes Television over the top in terms of the size, but ours didn't work. Then when help came he pushed the power plug in further and then lingered formal tip. I tip,regularly, but did not feel I should bentippingn for this service.... No resort fee Internet service good - though Blackberry browser would not open terms so could not use it ( to International users this is more important) While they have renovated this hotel - they have not fixed up the bathrooms - and they should. Not so good: Glasses dirty in rooms.  What else is? Common problem.  Give me a plastic cup any day. Tub / showers lacking - otherwise bathrooms are only ok. Shower height in back tower was too low for my 5'6" wife.  I am 6'3"! Casino smells of coconut - like the cheaper hotels. It is basically at one end of the strip - next time I will pay more tone more central, and get nicer bathroom. At least it is on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room but the Club Tower is not close to the rest of the hotal.”
Reviews.Author: c5coupe
Reviews.Content: I would give this 5 stars but rooms in the Club Tower are a long walk from the casino and the front desk. I stayed here because it was close to the airport but from the club tower it is not so easy to drag your bags if you are in a hurry. I would stay here again but reserve a room closer to the front desk. PS: Bacio restaurant has good food and great service

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Ruth G
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful transformation from the old Tropicana. The decor is light, bright and fresh. My room was large and gave that feel of being in a tropical paradise. The Casino floor is clean, easy to get around and a massive change from the old days. My stay prior to Christmas was extremely pleasurable, with every staff member helpful and friendly. Although a much smaller hotel than most on the strip, I think in many ways much better. I never got lost and knew my way around the entire place very quickly. I cannot comment on the restaurants on the second floor as they were not open during my visit but the Cafe offered a great selection with very friendly staff members. The entire hotel experience was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Best Christmas ever”
Reviews.Author: lisburnguy23
Reviews.Content: Really really good time, staff very helpful and the hotel was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet, clean partially renovated hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leesa2009
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Tropicana. It was nice that it wasn't so busy. The ceiling is quite low so if you are really tall beware... It is still being refurbished so soon everything will be looking new. Comfy beds and helpful staff :)

Reviews.Title: “recent stay at Tropicana Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: sandra b
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent three nights at your hotel. We found the remodel to be very nice. Our room was bright and clean and the casino was very nice and up to date also. We will be happy to stay there in the future. sandra barnes

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love Trop LV!”
Reviews.Author: LuvMichigan
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas in November for a conference my husband was attending at the Mandalay Bay. It was either staying at the Trop or Mandalay Bay - so glad we chose the Trop!! We spent time at both Trop and Mandalay Bay due to my husband's conference being at MB. We will chose Trop again and again, hands down - there was no contest in my book. We stayed at Trop for a week, and the hotel is absolutely fantastic. The first thing I have to say about Trop LV is that the customer service is absolutely outstanding. Every single person that we encountered in the hotel, at every level, throughout our stay was helpful and accommodating but never intrusive or over the top. We were always asked how we were enjoying our stay and whether there was anything the person could do for us - even when we just ran into someone in the elevator. They are clearly focusing on customer service, and in an era where the concept doesn't exist in many places, it was so nice. Additionally, when we returned home and I had a question about something relating to the newly opened spa, I received an email directly from the VP of Hotel Operations and he continued to correspond with my until my questions were fully resolved. The rooms are fantastic - beautifully decorated, extremely comfortable and spotless. I am extremely picky about hotels, particularly the beds and pillows (we have a Tempurpedic bed at home, and it's had to sleep on anything else) and will therefore only stay in certain hotels. I'm happy to say that Trop was a fantastic home away from home for a week - probably the most comfortable bed second to my own I've slept in. Bathrooms were great and beautifully decorated; the shower was hot with plenty of water pressure. We loved the size of the hotel, casino, etc. The hotel has two towers - one closer to Nikki Beach and one directly above the casino. We didn't spend any time at Nikki Beach - weather was too cold for it, but it looked beautiful. We requested a non-smoking room on a high floor in the Paradise tower above the casino and it was perfect - close to the hotel entrance, easy in and out and quiet. One night we did have a small problem when a family with small kids moved in next door and the kids were screaming and loud at 6 am. We called down to the front desk and it was immediately taken care of - no more problems the rest of the week with noise (again, great service!). Location of Trop is great - free shuttle to Excalibur, Luxor and Mandalay Bay right there and getting around is very easy. Loved the 24-hour Starbucks in the lobby - common in Vegas hotels, but still fantastic and a definite perk for me! Thanks Trop LV for the best Vegas stay ever - we won't even look at other Vegas hotels anymore - we are definitely staying at Trop when we are back! If you're considering Trop, just go. You'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to start the new year!”
Reviews.Author: vegasjunky25
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana Las Vegas is a bright,clean and comfortable casino and hotel. I will recommend staying there to friends and family with confidence. Their staff was always helpful and friendly and Nikki resteraunt is always satisfying and delicious.

Reviews.Title: “A Living Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: mervin83
Reviews.Content: After walking through a smokey casino I checked in at a makeshift counter as they are renovating their reception. I was assaulted with $15 a day resort fees but was told at least I would have 24 access to their pools and saunas - except that the pools are closed and as I would soon find out, the saunas are anything but free. The room was about a 3.5* with awkward shutters (no blackout shades) and tv channels that sometimes didn't work. When the time came for sleep I noticed there were no feather pillows and called the front desk which never once picked up right away. I was told "no one has feather pillows here" with the suggestion that why should I be so special. Well, I reminded them that they purport to be a 4 star hotel so how could they not have feather pillows (and only lumpy foam)? I was put on hold and then told housekeeping would look into it. Well 5 minutes later two maids brought me comfy feather pillows. It's way long to get to and from your room and all the food there like the rest of the strip is overpriced. A cup of Starbucks coffee is at least double and one night a Starbucks guy asked me for ID when I bought a 54 cent cup of hot water....ridiculous. On my final day I checked into their swanky new spa/gym as I did the first day but this time was jolted by a pushy woman claiming to be the manager. She asked me to sign in similar to my first visit with another employee, however, insisted I wear a pink bracelet - a first in any hotel gym I have visited. I felt like I was being branded in WW2 Germany. Did she have an armband for me too? When I reached for it she said "No - you will wear this or I'll call security." I looked around and there were exactly two other people - both women - in the gym. Little did I know that wasn't the end of her security threats. When I went to the change room to change (like I did the first time without incident) the hyper lady actually came in to the mens change room and began to yell at me "what did I tell you you have to pay more or leave!" Apparently the change room and steam room is not free contrary to what I had been told at check in and contrary to my first spa visit. I told her "no, I'm not leaving take it up with the front desk." She stormed out and made threat number two about calling security. This is all before I have even had coffee for the day. When I complained directly to her that I've had it at this hotel with the lies and the overcharging she said she could have upgraded me but since I was rude now she wasn't going to. She then called security while I had enough of this harassment and told her to tack the fee onto my hotel bill and continued on the treadmill. When two security people arrived I explained the situation then returned to the treadmill and magically was "upgraded" after hyper/pushy lady apparently gave an embellished story about me "reaching over the desk." After this nonsense I was left alone - and the problem? A whole $18.00. She already had my room number and should have just added it to my hotel bill if she was worried about it. This hotel has some qualities of a four star hotel but overall is a disjointed, unprofessional, money-obsessed crass pathetic holding cell. However, if you are blind and deaf with no olfactory function and love to be harassed and disappointed then this is the place for you! I cannot believe this is 18th out of all the hotels in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Monica A
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of this hotel. For a hotel on the strip I think it offers great value. I wish they did not have resort fees though. I think the hotel did some great renovations. Our room was nice and spacious. When we first walked in it did smell like smoke. I loved the huge tub that is in the bath. The room also had a pretty big television. There was leftover trash and other items in various locations in our room. The bathroom had a few urine stains near the toilet and some hair on the floor. Our ice bucket had left over liquids in it from previous drinks. I think the housekeepers just need to pay a litte more attention when they are cleaning. The eateries in the hotel are decent a bit pricey though.

Reviews.Title: “The most pleasant visit”
Reviews.Author: Ginne123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tropicana for 5 nights during New Years week end. This was my 4th trip to Vegas and have stayed on and off the strip. This turned out to be the best hotel/casino I visited. Recently re-done, the rooms are large and elegant. But the staff was the highlight of the stay. They went above and beyond to meet any and all needs. The casino was wonderful, nicely laid out, very clean and every worker pleasant and helpful. I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, really nice, hotel with a smoky casino”
Reviews.Author: pterbd
Reviews.Content: On a Firday my wife and I decided to runn off to Vegas. We planned to leave on Sunday so we wondered about finding an inexpesive but nice place to stay for a beyond reasonable cost. It was, afterall, New Year's Day. We selected the Tropicana and go tthe room for 5 nights for about $220 including taxes! I was very happy and the reviews on TA seemed to support this choice although I was concerned about the number of smoking comments...off we wnet with fabreze in hand! We arrived to a beautiful hotel outside. The bobbies were attractive and very "South Beach." This is their motif and it wworks. They pipe in a tropical fragrance that works. However when you walk all the way in you are hit with the cigarette smell. It is pretty strong but as we discovered once you leave the gaming area it is no longer a problem. The registration desk was in the last throes of being overhauled when we were there so our registration desk was a small area outside the Poker room and Sports Bet. This is due to be completed near the end of January, in time for the Super Bowl. We were checked in by competent and helpful staff. Make sure they know what is a priority for you. The front tower will allow you quick access to the casino and dump you out on the strip with little walking. The back tower is nearer the pools and convention areas but is in the far corner of the property from the strip. If you have a car parking is easy to both towers so I would choose the back tower next time...we were in the Paradise Tower (close to the strip) Once you ar ein the elevator all of the smoke issues dissappear. The interior is warmly decorated maintaining the South Beach feel and the coconut air fragrance. Our room had wonderful quality sheets and a huge number of pilllows. The TV is beautiful but just a clunky and horrible as all TV channel selections usually are with all of the hotel junk and oddly placed channels (you know...different from home) but you arenore to watch TV, right? There is free Wi-Fi but I did not attempt to use it. I did not study the alarm clock, so it may have had a dimmer but holy Bat-Light was this thing bright. I put a pillow over it. The outside of the ENTIRE casino is white. The windows are covered with a "wrap" like you will see on busses. This is a while vinyl that has thousands of micro holes in it so you can see out from the inside. I am sure this keeps the heat down and preserves the white outside they are trying to achieve. It is very difficult to look outside if you are close to thewindows. The windows open about 4 inches but if one were to bring a torx screwdriver this could be remedied! The shower really was wonderful with aquality head and really plentiful towels. Now, they had the same "save water" signs that all hotles do but no matter what we did we had new towels everyday. I even put the sign ON my towel one day and it was new that afternoon....or folded to appear to be a new towel. However it did not seem to be an old towel even a folded one..you know, you can just tell. One day, late in our stay we encountered a baby moving in next door. We have kids so we understand but after 45 minutes of non-stop screaming I called security. (I should have knocked on the door but I thought maybe they would move one of us, an option I could not offer). Anyway security showed up, the baby was quiet and for some reason housekeeping brought us a bag of shampoo, conditioner and lotions!?!? I thought they had moved them but I heard the baby the next morning, maybe they just thought the child could not be heard...I kind of felt bad for not talking to them. We tried all of the restaurants but Biscayne and all were good (find reviews). Starvbucks is open 24-hours which is good because there is no in room coffee and a room service carafe is $12 (plus 18% gratuity plus a delivery fee...a $9 cup of coffee all told). Parking is easy and free, access is easy if you are arriving but you must plan you departures because you will only leave in one direction since this corner is soo busy. The tram on the west side of the Strip is avaialble across the street at Excalibur and the Monorail is across the street at MGM to get you all the way north past the Las Vegas Hotel (nee Las Vegas Hilton which was renamed on January 3rd at the end of their franchise with Hilton hotels). Everybody we spoke to was friendly and professional and we had a very nice stay at the Trop and will gladly do it again.

Reviews.Title: “nicehotel”
Reviews.Author: canadiangirl947
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed a week at the Tropicana as part of a Westjet package. It was a pleasant stay and service was quite good. We ate at two of it 's restaurants and the food was very good. The breakfast buffet at Nikis was delightful with many healthy choices, service was outstanding and reasonable in cost. The casino is smaller than most on the strip but that can be a plus. They are still renovating but it didn't interfere with service. Overall it is a very good hotel with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Expected”
Reviews.Author: GEFisher
Reviews.Content: For our first trip to Vegas, my wife and I thought we'd try the Tropicana. Although she reserved a room in the Paradise Tower, our room was in the Club Tower. Our room was noisy (overlooked the airport) and was closer to Hooters than the rest of the Tropicana. We walked a lot in the hotel and would have rather spent the time walking the strip. It was suggested that our room was renovated recently; however the carpet looked worn and the tiling around the bathtub looked liked it was ready for another reno. The large LCD TV was nice with a digital feed, and the hotel had no problems with setting us up with a fridge at no extra cost. Staff members that we interacted with were nice but overall for the price we found better value elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Location was Great!”
Reviews.Author: LuckyLooVerm
Reviews.Content: Renovations were very bright and had a "tropical" feel. Got a great price on-line, check in was easy, rooms were comfortable and had a partial view of the strip. Would have liked to have had a coffee maker in room though. The pool area looked fabulous! Cafe Nikki had a very good breakfast buffet and great atmosphere, the only downfall was the very low ceilings on the route to the cafe. The room we were in was a bit of a hike to get to, but it is the same everywhere in Vegas. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and elegant”
Reviews.Author: Okiya
Reviews.Content: We were in Las Vegas for New Year's Eve, staying in another hotel. Since our departure flight was change, we had to stay one more night and we found a good special for this hotel, which is also in a convenient position either for airport access and walk to the Strip. It takes just a few minutes to get to the best part of the Strip and if you get a taxi you can be at airport in less than 10 minutes. The hotel is nice and elegant, with a casino on ground floor (like in almost all the Hotels in that area) and many shops and restaurants inside. You can basically find whatever you are looking for. We booked online and it was saying internet was included, but we had to pay for it. The room was ok, not too big and not too small, with a clean and well furnished bathroom. Staff was always very friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not impressed”
Reviews.Author: nieceyeffbaby
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas 10 times over the past 2 years almost 3 and I have stayed at hotels from Tuscany, Sahara, and Homewood to the Signature, Grandview, and Southpoint so I have some idea of what to expect. Let me start by saying that I did not stay at the Tropicana before the renovations so I really don't have a way to make a comparison of the improvement. However, I can just go by the service that I received. My boyfriend and I were first off given a double bed room when I requested a king bed. Ok, mistakes happen; but I made sure to tell them that they would have to deliver the keys to the new room because I was exhausted carrying heavy bags to the far journey of the club tower (the walk get easier and easier as time went on lol). We stayed there for 4 nights and we chose not to use housekeeping services to clean our room. I called for towels and toilet paper, but no one ever came. EVER. We tried to rent a movie on the TV, but you have to call the front desk to do so. I did and was told that the movies ranged from $12 to $30 and a $200 deposit is required. No thanks. After paying for the hotel for 4 nights on top of $67 "resort fee" in which I have no idea the purpose of it was, I was done. We stayed in Henderson for 2 days before the Trop, and I was so much more impressed with their customer service and amenities. I am not at all trying to bash the hotel because it is a nice hotel, but after reading all these 5 star and outstanding reviews I was expecting something....well....outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jenreyes02
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night in Dec - wish we had stayed here longer though. Except for the smell of smoke coming from the room next door (which i would have complained about but we were only there for 1 night) eveything else was ok. Check in was fine but like most Vegas hotels you do need to go through the casino floor (with the smell of smoke). With a 4 year old in tow that was quite interesting! Room was very modern and stylish and very clean. Location was excellent - right on the Strip! short walk to Dennys, M&M world, Roz, Walmart etc. The price was also very good for such a modern and clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay at the newly renovated Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: D1andonlyDman
Reviews.Content: I just got back from 3 nights in Vegas. I was originally planning to stay at another hotel on the strip, but I just got a great promo on a flash sale at the Tropicana, and after seeing the great reviews, I changed my plans. My only minor negative issue was that I had booked a fully pre-paid stay and the front desk had my reservation, but not the fact that it was fully pre-paid including taxes and resort fee. I had to spend 10 minutes on the phone with the booking agent while I was checking in, for the Hotel and the agent to get it all straightened out, which, they finally did. But once the registration snafu was ironed out, really, I couldn't be happier with the place, especially at the great rate I got. I think most resort fees are a rip-off, but the fact is, even with the resort fee included in the total rate I paid the Trop was clearly a better deal than where I had been considering staying. I did at least make extensive use of the wi-fi that the resort fee got me. As for the hotel facilities, I was really impressed with how well they have been spruced up since I had seen the place 5 years ago. I only wish it had been warm enough to take full advantage of the really nice pool area. The Casino was also quite nice - really light and airy, which is a big change of pace from most Vegas Casinos, which are dark and smoky. Too bad I only broke even at the tables. The rooms were good sized and well furnished, wiand the bed was very comfy. A couple of minor nit - the bathroom fan was a bit noisy, and there is no fridge or coffee maker in the room, but if that's the biggest complaint I can come up with, all in all a good showing. On the plus side - NO mini-bar - I hate them, as they are invariably rip-offs.

Reviews.Title: “I still can't believe how cheap the rooms were.”
Reviews.Author: eyebehold
Reviews.Content: I was surprised with tickets to the Maaco Bowl in Las Vegas this December and decided to stay a few nights. Being a last minute ticket on a busy weekend, I was expecting high rates, and limited selection. After a few minutes of searching I came across Tropicana where I have never stayed before and noticed the rates were lower than most of the Buffet's in town. I decided to give it a try since it was a trip with the guys and I knew not one of them would complain about the rooms. Upon arrival, I was pleased with how easy it was to find parking near the front entrance. Something I couldn't find at any of the nicer hotels I've stay at in Las Vegas. Rooms were spacious and clean with nice decor. Everyone who came with me liked the rooms and the flat screen TV's. My one downside was that the bathrooms could use a make over. They were clean, which is a plus, but they still could use an updating. All in all for less than what it costs to eat a meal on the strip for two rooms with double beds, I can't complain. Best part of the trip was meeting "Dean", a roulette dealer who was a very polite man who can carry a conversation. I'd return to the Tropicana just to sit a few more hours chatting with him and winning a little money. thumbs up for a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: nibrahim
Reviews.Content: As I didnt stay here because of its amenities, Tropicana was average. There were no amenities to use (December) except for the gym, so the hotel fees didn't add up. The hotel is newly upgraded except for the bathroom which looked 20 years old. Although the room was re-done...it looked a little cheap to me, but it was nice looking on the surface. The "casino" was small so it sucks in comparison to the others within walking distance. Overall, because I was there over the holidays, the price was decent.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana hotel and resort”
Reviews.Author: Paul H
Reviews.Content: this is a very handy hotel right on the corner of the strip, great pools, sun there untill 530ish, very relaxed, a warm welcoming hotel with very clean rooms and again a great service, staff polite freindly and will visit again..

Reviews.Title: “Trop. - Great place”
Reviews.Author: RTKWPBFL
Reviews.Content: Stayed there twice last year, summer and late fall. Great times. The place has really turned around from the old days. Rooms are super, great dining and all the staff is great( great casino host). Will be back there soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location and value for money.”
Reviews.Author: mr.whitey!!!
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a 13 night stay in the Trop, spanning the holiday period, we just wanted to say thank you to everybody at the Hotel for making it a memorable time, and thank you Nicole for your personal attention to our booking. We loved this hotel as we felt it offered you everything, there's the obligatory casino, but it doesn't strike you like a dungeon like so many others, which we found quite refreshing, nice light colourings and newly refurbed as well. Cannot comment on the restaurants as we decided to eat out. The staff are fantastic and really make this resort, always obliging and always with a smile. But Tropicana, it is with sadness that you have earnt a negative comment from us on your festive decorations, or should I say lack off? As guests, choosing to spend Christmas away from home it would have need nice to have seen a Christmas tree in the hotel, let alone any other decorations. Every other hotel we visited had beautiful decorations, following in the tradition of christmas glamour in the American style, why therefore was our hotel lacking? We never did get to the reason for the lack of decorations, but speaking as customers we were saddened and dissapointed that no decorations were on display for both guests and staff to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “A good deal at the south end of the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: aliciaclare
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Christmas 2011 and had an enjoyable stay. We had read widely about the refurbishment of the Tropicana and the rooms were clean and spacious. The hotel is a lot smaller than the other larger strip casinos and as such lacks the variety of cafes/restaurants but it is so close to the MGM, NY NY, Luxor & Mandalay this does not really matter. There is a Starbucks in the casino which tends to have long queues but they move quickly and Cafe Nicki has a breakfast buffet for $18 or breakfast menu. We did not try Bacio or Biscayne as they were shut most of the Christmas period. The only negatives I can give are the overpowering vanilla scent they pump through the casino (far too overpowering and really quite unpleasant) and the fact that one day we did not have any hot water in the morning (although this was corrected by lunch time and 2 days of resort fee waived by helpful reception staff). The other issue for me was the resort fee of $14.99 per night which as far as I can see is extremely expensive wifi. However, overall the hotel was excellent value and I would recommend it as a value hotel in Las Vegas. Personally I rate the Flamingo slightly more for position on the strip but I would not hesitate to stay at the Trop in the future if it was an inexpensive option.

Reviews.Title: “Smaller is Better!!”
Reviews.Author: Robert V
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Trop since 1976. The new ownership has done a fantastic job of renovation. Our Casino host is the best and always takes outstanding care of his guests. Reasonable room rates, two great fine dining restaurants, friendly casino and hotel staff, easy parking, new Sports Book, new Spa (tremendous), very comfortable rooms, GREAT LOCATION ON THE STRIP (and near to the Airport), very attractive pool area, new RPM nightclub (missed the opening on New Year's eve with Mary J Blige), Rick Thomas Magic show, etc, etc. Lets just say the Trop is the perfect size. The mega casinos on the strip are, for my wife and I, just too big and impersonal. The Trop is roomy but has a nice home feel to it! You get to know a lot of the staff and everyone we met on this last trip (6 days) was extremely friendly and helpful. One waiter, who also works at a Sushi Bar in Caesar's, recommended we try it and he notified the manager we would be coming and we received a comp dessert. The Valet staff was very helpful in providing healthy and interesting information on day trips within a few hours of Vegas (Valley of Fire was awesome). Due to our past play, our Casino Host comped us 4 nights and charged us the casino rate for 2 nights. When we checked out the bill showed a slightly higher rate for the 2 nights that were not comped. I asked our Casino Host about the mistake and he ended up comping us those 2 nights also, and comped all of our food costs during the stay!! All we can say is check it out. It really has a niche for the Strip in that it is what I would call a quaint "boutique" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value & quality”
Reviews.Author: Christopher K
Reviews.Content: Stayed here between Xmas and New Years - can't beat the location. I'd stayed here years ago for a friend's wedding. The remodel put the property in a new class. Subdued, tasteful and simple remodel shines, especially the newly landscaped pool and gardens (though closed for the season, it open to stroll and soak up the sunshine). Excellent service from registration, bell desk and house keeper during stay. Upon entry after cab ride from airport, we smelled vanilla instead of smoke - a Vegas miracle. Also, very quiet room in Club Tower (next time, would ask for a view). Great little Starbucks with short lines in the morning. All in all, a true gem on the south strip. Easy walking to close neighbors (NY NY, MGM, Excal, Luxor) and 15 min stroll up to City Center; monorail and Deuce bus offer quick access to points further afield. The Trop is a great place to stay in Vegas right now!

Reviews.Title: “Safety may be a issue, but something else is very good”
Reviews.Author: YanpingGuelph
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 4 nights with two rooms booked for our family for the New Year. The hotel is nice and clean, just newly renovated. The rooms are cleam and spacious. We were stayed in Club tower and facing airport, less noise which is good. I don't like the smoking environment in casino area and hall way in every hotel because smoking is allowed in casino areas and restaurants. This bothers me a lot. Biggest fear during our stay in this hotel is somebody broken in my room in early morning on Dec. 31, 2011. Fortunately, nothing was stolen and nobody got hurt. The situation is on Dec 31 about 5:50am, I was waked by trying to open door noise. somebody tried to open our room door for about a couple minutes, he/she didn't make to open. Then, I heard trying to open next room door, and I heard the door open and close. I thought perhaps somebody mistakes my room for his/her. I was kind of relief. But, a few minutes later, somebody tried to open my door again and this time he/she did make it open. I can see the door open in the mirror from my bed and the light was turned on. Somebody tried to get in. I shout out "who is that?". He/she left without a word. The door was closed after him/her. My husband and I had a pause. After about 30 seconds, my husband opened the door and look around the hallway and didn't see anybody. I called front desk to report this incident. A lady from front desk said she will call security rightaway, but we waited 50 minutes, nobody came. I called front desk again, a gentleman said "I'll call security right now". After about 15 minutes, nobody showed up. I was so worried about our safety and I went to front desk to have my room keys re-programed and told the story again to the gentlemant at front desk, he said the same words " I'll call the security and check the system to see who used what kind of key opened the door". However, nobody came to my room and nobody tell me the result of the investigation. On the New Year eve day, the hotel was very busy to get organized for New Year eve big party, maybe they don't have time for my issue. Anyway, since nobody got hurt and nothing was stolen. I didn't ask them again for this incident.

Reviews.Title: “We Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kris P
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Tropicana at the last minute over the Christmas weekend. We requested the front tower because we knew we would be doing a lot of walking and wanted a room closer to the strip. Our request was honored. Our room was clean and updated, the casino and hotel were bright and the air pleasantly scented, and the employees were helpful and nice. We had a small issue with the WiFi, but within an hour of calling, they had somebody from Cox Cable looking into the problem which is impressive over a holiday weekend. We wouldn't get that quick of service if we were home! The problem was resolved quickly and satisfactorily. It was a pleasure returning to the Tropicana after our day walking the strip. It may be little out of the center of action, but that's exactly why we liked it. The only criticism I would have is the resort fee - I think it's time they nix the resort fee since Harrahs has. Would that keep me from returning? No - I thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “First time & definitely not my last”
Reviews.Author: S_Diegogirl
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Tropicana and after reading all the reviews and worrying that the hotel wouldn't be as good as the others I've stayed at, I was very pleased! The parking was very easy and a short walk to the casino, there was no line for check-in, and everything was very clean! I especially liked the public restroom in the casino next to starbucks- it was very clean and spacious and their soap smelled great! (I kinda have a thing for nice bathrooms...) We had a corner suite with a great view of the strip in the Paradise Tower however I did notice some street noise at night. So if you need it to be really quiet when you sleep, maybe the club tower would be better. Our room was very very clean, no stains on the carpet, nice TVs, nice ventilation, and comfy beds!!! The bathroom was also decent sized with new sink and vanity. My 5'10 boyfriend didn't have any complaints about the shower head being too low either like we read in other reviews. Over all, this isn't as luxurious as maybe PH or the MGM but for the price we paid it was very comfortable and clean and I wouldn't hesitate staying here again. If I hadn't heard before, I wouldn't have even noticed that the hotel had been remodeled! p.s. you should contact the VP of customer affairs Nicole Marshall. She's awesome and will try her best to accommodate any special requests/needs! She's a sweetheart! Thanks Tropicana!

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana Christmas Present”
Reviews.Author: Bill R
Reviews.Content: We have visited the tropicana for the pools and play during the summers and this winter were very surprised by the improvements. I took my two daughters and wife to see their favorite shows and selected the Tropicana for it's convenent location and my history of good service. Our expectations were exceeded when we arrived and were greeted through the size and amenities in the room. When the renovations are complete this will only make our stay more pleasurable. Thanks for the value, the friendliness and modern spacious rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great time had by all!”
Reviews.Author: kb68_77
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day stay with extended family of 8. We picked this hotel based on the great room rates and positive reviews. The hotel did not disappoint. The front desk and concierge are under construction so it is a bit tricky finding where to check in. (in the casino by the sports book). The staff was helpful and accommodating. We had three rooms in the Paradise Tower which was a great location as it opens right into the casino. The casino is smaller then many of the other hotels on the strip, however it was very manageable for my elderly mother. The hotel and casino are attractive and bright, unlike the darker casinos of neighboring hotels. The rooms are clean and comfortable and we never had to wait for an elevator. Our rooms faced Las Vegas Blvd and the Excalibur, which was a beautiful view, but kept some of our party up at night due to the frequent ambulances that ran up and down the strip during the night. Only experienced one rude bartender when we accidentally walked out of the elevators the wrong way into the High Rollers area with kids where she instructed us to "keep walking". The food at the hotel was very good, although limited in choice. However, this was not a problem as it is a relatively short walk to New York New York and the MGM buffet, which we enjoyed. Went to see the Rick Thomas magic show and my 11 yr old son said it was the best show he ever saw. It was entertaining and also a great value. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to book, even for others!”
Reviews.Author: claud09
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my parents as an early Christmas gift. We had stayed last March and enjoyed it, and at the rates that were being offered the weekend my parents could go, I couldn't pass it up. Since I wasn't going to be present at check-in and wanted everything for my parents to be really easy, I made a phone call reservation and requested a credit card authorization. They were quick in emailing me the forms and confirmation. When my parents arrived, they said it was so easy and they were happy they didn't have to provide any payment cards. Another thing to note: I had checked rates on kayak.com and when I got the phone quote for the price, I asked if they could honor the kayak prices ($20 less per night), and they were able to! That was excellent! My parents loved their room, as they said it was clean, everything looked new, and huge! Thanks Tropicana, for providing them with a much needed weekend away from the stresses of everyday life!

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana Las Vegas - Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: TexasGal512
Reviews.Content: I have never experienced the feeling from another hotel as I do when I walk through the beautiful glass doors of the Tropicana. First, I am greated by a heavenly aroma when between the glass doors . . . it's so pleasant and inviting. Also, every time I walk through the doors, often held open by a valet, I feel as if I'm coming home and can hear "welcome home" being whispered as I step through the doors. The front tower (Paradise Tower) is very convenient - just a short elevator ride to your room floor. However, I recommend trying to get a room in the back tower (Club Tower). It's a longer walk to get there but the view of the strip is superior in every way and you don't get the traffic noise that you will hear if in the front tower. The corridors are surprisingly quiet for a casino hotel. The rooms might not be as fancy as some of the other high dollar hotels, but they are very clean and extremely comfortable. I'd love to take one of their mattresses home with me. In the casiono our waitress was quick and courteous. Just when our drinks were almost empty she would appear to ask if we needed another, and she had them waiting for us on her tray. It was the best drink service we received during our entire visit. When at other casinos we often had to chase down a waitress or couldn't find one at all. Not so at the Trop. We always were greated in a friendly manner by an efficient waitress. I'm always surprised the casino at the Trop isn't filled with patrons. The casino is neat and clean, there is a great variety of games to select from, and the slots give back as much if not more than they take, making for a pleasant gaming experience. Also, the choice of slots is a perfect mix of older favorites that are hard to find and the newest on the market. Bottom line is I feel like the Tropicana is one of the best kept secrets in Las Vegas. It is a perfect mix of classy sophistication with the intimate feel of the smaller casinos from years gone by. It is by far my favorite hotel and casino on the strip. I might not be a high roller but the hospitality I experienced at the Trop made me feel like one.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: cmaxwell082711
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have recently stayed at tropicana. It was great. Good location, bars and gambling. I would definitily recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Chill”
Reviews.Author: kimberlymv
Reviews.Content: I will absolutely be staying here each time I go to Vegas. Perfect location, the most friendly staff and so chill. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Ron H
Reviews.Content: My softball team stayed at the Tropicana in Oct. 2011, everything was new and clean. Nicole hooked us up with a great deal and all of the employees were friendly. Kimberly at check-in was the greatest. She is so friendly and accommodating. The dealers were really cool and the free drinks came faster than we could drink them. We had a great time and hope to back in Oct. 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tinkhardt
Reviews.Content: Would stay again! Convienent, Starbucks inside casino. Free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel for first-time Vegas travellers!”
Reviews.Author: Vik_travel
Reviews.Content: Most of the positive reviews for this hotel are right on the mark - this is a fantastic, high-value hotel which should be on the short list for anyone planning to visit Vegas. As it was my first time going, it was a bit overwhelming choosing from all of the hotels along the strip. Needless to say, the Tropicana doesn't really have the same "WOW" factor as many of the other hotels on the strip, but really, you get over that pretty quickly (besides, how much time does someone spend in their room in Vegas?) My only few suggestions would be: a) Yes, the $20 trick works here (found this out afterwards...oops!), so don't hestiate to try. That being said, even the basic rooms are super clean and spacious, so you'll be fine either way b) If you're nice to the front desk, they usually have extra coupons to give you for free drinks, discounts/free food at their restauraunts and so forth. c) The resort fee can be waived if you (again) ask politely at the end of your trip - otherwise, the $10 is still pretty decent value. All things considered, I would highly suggest the Tropicana for anyone visiting Vegas...save your $$ for the casinos and other fun stuff instead. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pink-princess-1981
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in june, we had room 2011 which had a good view of the stip towards the mgm. Rooms modern bright and airy, beds were very comfortable. we had asked for a fridge and coffee maker which was bought up within minutes of asking. Bathroom was fine and everything was very clean. The hotel has a small casino compared to the others but thats what i liked about it, the pool area was clean and i think the pool temp was fine, i read some people moaned about it being cold but i found this quite refreshing to sit in when it was so hot. Nikki beach was great too, pool was quite small but this wasnt a problem, sunbeds were ace and music was good, drinks can be very expensive in there. Didnt eat at any of the restaurants but meals did look nice of what we saw. All the staff we meet from check in, waiters housekeeping etc all very nice and very helpfull. Would love to go back i had a brilliant time. Location was good too right next to MGM and across the strip from Luxor, New York New York, excaulibur, so we did most sighseeing etc in the day at the top end of the strip and worked our way down so in the evening we hung around the above hotels as it wasnt far to walk back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value!”
Reviews.Author: Merv_Eleazar
Reviews.Content: This is actually the first time I stayed at the Tropicana and I've probaby stayed at just about all the popular hotels on the strip since the beginning of the 80's. They are still in the process of renovating the place, but it's still a nice place to stay at while the changes take place. It's not as luxurious as the newer hotels like The Wynn or Aria, but the Tropicana still has that "Old Vegas" feel that Vegas should never get rid of. The employees I dealt with were friendly and helpful. We were in town for my sister's wedding at the Tropicana and everyone had a blast!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room”
Reviews.Author: imcoming
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Tropicana Las Vegas during a family vacation in Dec, 2011. We're not disappointed. Room is big, clean and nicely decorated. Parking is close. The problem with those casino hotel is the front desk is very small and buried in those slot machines so it took me a while to find the registration desk. We were there in winter so didn't use their pool or other outdoor facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas 2011 in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: TandT7
Reviews.Content: Had a comfortable stay at the Tropicana. We paid $65 a night (including resort fee) so was a good value for the price. Hotel room was comfortable, beds were super comfy and we slept well without noise from other rooms (guess that depends who you are next too though). We didn't have any unreasonable expectations of grandeur so were not disappointed. You spend so little time in your room when in Vegas that as long as it's clean, quiet and comfortable bed why spend more than you have too. Found the casino smokey, but that said found pretty much all of the casinos along the strip and in Fremont street too smokey. Enjoyed Fremont street so much that we went there twice during our week stay. Fremont street offered street entertainment such as bands and a fabulous sax player, light show and had great food and drink specials. Fremont street was less crowded than the strip, pedestrian only on strip and none of the annoying guys trying to hawk girls like on the strip. We got a two for one coupon from the front desk (ask them if they have any coupons) and we attended the Rick Thomas magic show. Enjoyed it very much and found him to be such a warm and genuinely kind person. Show was very good and at $52 for both of us (with coupon) thought it was good value.Was not impressed with the breakfast we had at the Nikki cafe but had a very good meal at the Baccio Italian restaurant on our last night (with our comps). Get your comps from your players card the last day or two, we got $150 in comps between us and we were not playing large amounts on the slots and they still added up during the week.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Short Break at The Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: alwHerts
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned (1st Dec to 4th Dec) with nine business colleagues from a short and very hectic trip to Las Vegas staying at the Tropicana. I used Trip Advisor to give our travel company a list of possible hotels. Tropicana came out well via the comments posted and I would agree with the general views. Our rooms and beds were comfy and the buffet breakfast of good quality. We were hoping for some sun and Nikki beach looked excellent but unfortunately the weather was in the 50's and 0 at night so definitely not sun bathing weather. If I compare the cost against the likes of the MGM, Planet Hollywood, Aria, Excalibur it is very good value well located for the lower part of the strip, in easy walking distance to New York, MGM, mono rail and a bus stop practically at the door if you needed it. The staff were very helpful and friendly, we would happily use again for such a trip though if I was travelling with my wife on a quiet get away at a similar time of year (Las Vegas is empty early Dec) I would probably stay at the Aria which is more upmarket but more expensive. I would compare the Tropicana to a good upmarket Holiday Inn (4 star) and very very adequate for a bunch of people spending very limited amount of time at the hotel but seeking a good sleep when required. I can imagine Nikki Beach getting very busy but unfortunately it was not open when we visited.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to stay at”
Reviews.Author: Grateful_Kelly
Reviews.Content: Hotel is really big, easy to get lost in. There was construction when we were there so that possibly complicated things, but overall we would stay again. It is right at one of the major intersections so at a good proximity to other big, popular hotels and across the street from the tram that takes you south to the luxor, mandalay bay and attractions. Our next stay we would like to book something closer to the "middle" of the strip, maybe Bellagio or go budget with the Imperial.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: thepermanentnomad
Reviews.Content: Our room was nice- we had a junior suite. Bed was comfortable. Pool is great. Nikki beach was fun. The exercise room exceeded expectations. However, it seems to attract a strange crowd. Us young newlyweds felt a little out of place. The in-house restaurants were good. But the hallway carpets were stained a bit, the artificial coconut smell gave me a headache, and with all the white and orange, it just felt cheap. It was an ok experience, but I don't think I'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Rockos5150
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the Tropicana... Thank you nicole for stepping out and stepping up to great customer service… Thanks to you we had a spectacular time, you help make memories that will last a lifetime. You are the best!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Remodel”
Reviews.Author: uniqueliving
Reviews.Content: We stopped by the Trop Casino our last visit to Las Vegas and were amazed with the remodel they have done, really nice ! We used to go to the Trop 20-30 years ago, but stopped because it was not kept up well at all and wasn't even clean as the old downtown Las Vegas Casinos. But...NO MORE ! It looks really great now !!! However, we did not stay at the hotel so we can't comment on the rooms, room service, or other hotel ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS: be careful.”
Reviews.Author: Angel N
Reviews.Content: I usually don't write reviews but I need to do it this time. We just got back from vegas 2 days ago and I learned that my 2 yr old baby got bed bugs bites on her stomach and leg. I'm so unhappy about it. I trusted the reviews and paid more to stay at Tropicana but it turned out I'm so disappointed. The staffs were nice on the phone, the room were spacious, the beds were adequately comfortable but that was about it, As soon as we got there, I checked the pillows and I found out 3 out of 8 pillows had dirt/hair on them. I called the front desk and house keeping brought me 2 pillow cases. Well, I brought some of my own so I used my pillow cases. Then the sink, I could see there were stain or finger print on the handle and the floor I could see dirt/stain. Not too much and it was too late so I let it go. On the way home my baby complained her stomach hurt. I had to check during rest time and learned of two red circles (about 1/4 to 1/2 of an inch) on her stomach and upper thigh (in a straight line) with a small white/yellowish bump in the middle of each. I have never seen this kind of rash in my life. So today I did my searched and learned that those were consistent with BED BUGS bites. My baby still complains of pain and discomfort even though the spots seem to get less red. I feel terrible for her. We were only at the hotel and the car, Of a couple dozens of hotels we have been to, we have never had bed bug bites. I'm so disappointed. And also I feel stupid. I though we paid more for the hotel to get comfort and cleaniness but we got the opposite. I want everyone to know so they can be aware. And be careful of the catch of the Trop Plus member "your first 200 bucks on us". We put in 220 total but the next morning we only saw 40 bucks back in our card (as opposed to 100 bucks that they were supposed to give us back). Anyway, We will never come back to Tropicana again. You guys do some research before booking hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay during the NFR”
Reviews.Author: Mtrancher
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tropicana for the last week of the NFR… December 7 through the 14th. My 1st thoughts are what a terrific place! Since I have season tickets to the NFR I go every year and I have always gotten a suite at the MGM. This year I thought I would try the Tropicana. Not in the least bit disappointed. Location -- The hotel is in an ideal location on the strip. You can walk across the street to the Excalibur and MGM, the MGM has monorail access going north on the strip and the Excalibur has the monorail to the Monterrey. And if you want a cab, the line is never long. Rooms – I booked a Paradise Suite. Great room and terrific layout. Large living room area with plenty of seating, fantastic view of the strip, refrigerator, coffee maker and 42” flat screen TV. The bedroom had a king sized bed, large closet, safe and sitting table, with plenty of room for luggage. The bathroom was very functional, maybe a little light on shower water pressure, but nothing to complain about. It came equipped with sundries, plenty of towels and a hairdryer.
