The Paradise Suite is located in the Paradise Tower which is closest to the front of the property, so it was just a short one minute walk to get outside; extremely convenient. Gaming/Restaurants – It’s a full service casino complete with a very nice sports book. I must admit I never got drawn into the craps table which is what I usually play, but I like to be with loud groups and it never seemed to be going that direction when I was in the casino. The dealers and staff all were very friendly and I did end up winning some on the slots. I only got a chance to eat in Café Nikki but did so a number of times and was never disappointed. If the NFR schedule allowed I would have certainly dined their Italian restaurant as I hear it is quite good. Bars/Entertainment – I always come to the Trop during the NFR and take in the comedy club. This year I was fortunate enough to get to the 2nd to last performance as apparently the club is closing at the Trop and reopening at the MGM. Too bad, I always love the Trop’s venue. Not sure what they are putting in its place, the comedians joked about a restaurant/bar/swimming pool… guessing not! The main lobby bar has live entertainment and while I was there it was titled “Eye Candy.” Yes it was. Great dancers, sexy music and very fun. The drinks aren’t bad, the staff is relatively attentive and it’s a pretty inexpensive way to enjoy part of your evening. Don’t waste your money on Crazy Horse or Jubilee, just go to the Trop and enjoy a drink and the show. Staff – The 1st people you meet are the Bell Hops, and they do their job well and with a smile. The gentleman who brought the luggage to the room was even so nice as to offer to go get ice so the party could start. Our maid was phenomenal. I don’t know how she cleaned the other rooms after being so through in ours. She noticed the coffee was all used and offered to leave more than the usual supply, we were never without bottled water, towels, clean sheets, clean everything. The front desk staff was courteous and friendly. The only complaint regarding the staff would be the IT personnel. Our room had the wireless router for a couple other rooms, and it quit working. After having people in the room to fix it, it still was not functioning so upon calling down to the desk they connected me with IT. The young man at the other end of the phone did not have much experience with Iphones and their Wi-Fi properties, which he proceeded to tell me each time he tried to get it to hook up. Of course I’m not going to be mad he doesn’t have a lot of experience but when he gets frustrated and wants to vent to me I have to say call me back when you figure something out. He never did. What did happen is since the other rooms were still having problems they sent an electrician up, who was very friendly and he contact COX who provides the service and they fixed it. Finally I can’t talk about the staff without mentioning Nicole Marshall. Originally when I booked I couldn’t reserve the Paradise Suite for the final night of our stay. When I contacted Nicole to see what she could offer she was very quick to provide solutions utilizing other suites. She also said she would stay on top of it and if possible try and keep us in the same room, which ultimately is what happened Nicole took very good care of us. So in summation, if you are looking for a clean, comfortable room in a casino where service does count than you won’t be unhappy at the Tropicana. True it won’t have the crowds of the mega casinos but if you want that, just go hang out at one, why stay there? Prices are great, the location is ideal and all the staff wants to do is make your stay enjoyable. It’s a win at the Tropicana!

Reviews.Title: “Completly Met Expectations”
Reviews.Author: MRJKY
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I returned from a 3 night Christmas stay at the Tropicana and it absolutely met my expectations. Traveling on a budget, the Tropicana offered the best opportunity to stay in a very nice hotel/casino with enough to do within a reasonable walking distance and at $50/night I could not have had a better experience. The rooms have been "refreshed", to say they have been newly renovated I think would be overstating it a bit. While it was a nice room there was some older features such as the bathroom tile and some fixtures but clean. All in all it was very nice and certainly well worth the money. If I could offer one exception it would be that houskeeping did not come until very late. We hiked at the Trial of Fire one afternoon, we left at 10am, returned at 3pm and still the room had not been serviced. That was the second day, so we just decided we would do without being that our stay was so short. We did order room service one night and it was exceptional. Granted, we did not order filet but our sandwiches were well prepared and savory. I have often heard via tripadvisor post that the room service is expensive in Vegas. Room service is typically expensive anywhere you go whether it be Vegas or Atlanta. I would say the room service prices were not out of the norm for any other place that I have stayed. While there are some attractions on location many were closed for the holiday. However, Recycled Percussion was playing on Christmas day and it was incredible!! Wherever you stay in Vegas, you should absolutely go see this show. We did not gamble much in the casino, mainly when we had a drink at the bar we played video poker. The casino and other common areas were decorated to look like that old South Beach hotel. Everything looks to have been updated and is in very good condition. That being said, if you are looking for gigantic themed casinos then go elsewhere; that is certainly not the Tropicana. The Tropicana is an excellent getaway especially if you set the appropriate expectations. If you want to an easy walk to the Paris and Caesars Palace you may want to stay closer to the center of the strip (and if you want to pay double what we paid). Can you walk it from the Tropicana? Sure, it just depends how much you are willing to walk. We walked as far as Paris and that was a hike, we opted for a cab ride back. The Trop is connected by walkway to the MGM, Excalibur and New York New York. From the Excalibur you can catch a tram that runs to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay. Also, if you are looking to do a lot of off strip excursions the Tropicana offers easy access to the highway at the south end of town. It was a very nice stay and if we travel on a budget again we will definitely stay at the Tropicana. Travel Safely!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: fluoro
Reviews.Content: I stayed over the Xmas holidays with my mother in law and thoroughly enjoyed the rooms / atmosphere of the Tropicana. The newly renovated rooms were beautiful and the beds extremely comfortable. I liked the fact that it's at the end of the strip and not too big as to be overwhelming. Ask for a room in the Paradise Tower as it's at the front and a shorter walk to get outside. All of the staff from the front desk (thanks Gerard) to the dining staff / bartenders were incredible. Well worth the trip. And Nicole Marshall you were a delight to deal with ahead of time. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless”
Reviews.Author: nickp68
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for 3 nights and I wish I could of stayed here longer.The rooms were of a good size with a good view of the strip and just a short stroll you're in amongst all the hustle and bustle of Vegas.I have been to Vegas 4 times now but it was the my first visit to the Tropicana,I'm definitely coming back to Vegas and would stay in the Tropicana again

Reviews.Title: “Best Player Card Promo.”
Reviews.Author: Cassandra H
Reviews.Content: I came out to Las Vegas, NV. in August of 2011 and stayed at one of the other hotels/casinos on the strip. I walked down to the Tropicana hotel and signed up for the promotion, "even the odds" for new players. When I got home the Tropicana invited me back to stay as a guest at the hotel. This was a comp. on the player's card from being out there in August. They did the even the odds and also included a four night stay on them to check out New Tropicana. I came back in December 2011 to take them up on the free hotel stay. I was amazed on how nice the rooms are. I had a great time and when I come back to Vegas and will stay at the Tropicana again. All the staff was excellent at the Tropicana. Do check out the Excellent Mob exhibit at the hotel. Cassandra.

Reviews.Title: “The Tropicana is outdated and has lost touch with the pulse of today's Vegas traveler”
Reviews.Author: dinondlbc
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place to sleep and stay in your room then the Tropicana would suffice. The vast majority of people who go to Vegas do so for the excitement, gaming, shows and all around feel good atmosphere of the action packed city. The rooms have been updated and have a 42" tv, safe, ironing board and blow dryer. They have WiFi for a cost that is charged along with their added room fees. The room was quiet but that had alot to do with the fact that the place was a ghosttown. My wife and I checked in Friday morning and stuck around for a few hours in the casino and noticed that there were less than 50 people walking around the gaming area. Now if you like the older slot machines, penny slots and very,very little people around you then you will like this place. Also, if you are "NOT" into blackjack, roulette or craps then this is the place for you. They have very few tables to play on but it seems to be the perfect amount for their empty casino. I really cannot see how they keep their head above water with all these other casinos nearby within walking distance. Well I guess it could be their new promotion where they give you back $200 of your initial slot losses. The catch is they give you $100 free play on certain slots and you cannot cash out until you use the entire amount once. The other $100 is credited to you account for a future visit( LOL). The machines are outright tight and this seems to be a shady gimmick. I went to the MGM grand across the street that night and returned twice to my room at the Tropicana and it was dead in the casino. The MGM Grand, New York,New York and even the Excalibur were far better places to play, be in, eat or just walk around and hang out. If you like excitement, action and all that Vegas has to offer then the Tropicana is not the place to be. If you are reading this and are elderly and like places that are quiet and are thinking about staying here beware. Unless you specifically request a room in the main casino tower, the walk from the casino to the rooms is very, very far and I noticed some people having problems and complaints with the hike. All in all I was very disappointed with the Tropicana. I stayed Friday night through Tuesday but played in the other forementioned casinos instead and received buffet comps from the MGM Grand my entire stay. Going to Vegas the week before Christmas turned out to be good time of year to visit, weather was nice and there were plenty of sports to bet on.

Reviews.Title: “First Time in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Terpatt
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and all the staff was quite courteous. We had breakfast and lunch at the hotel and enjoyed the meals. The coconut fragarance carried through to the shampoo and lotion provided in the room. Make sure to explore all the areas of the hotel, inside and outside. We liked the 2 for 1 drinks at happy hour from 4-6 p.m. I guess ex-smokers (me) must be the worst because I thought the casino was smokey and I could have sworn some of the smoke came in through the ventilation system of our room. We were in the paradise tower which I highly recommend for the convenience to the strip and casino. The large flat screen tv was great. We made sure we requested a coffee machine for our room. That's all you need to do. The bathroom was roomy and clean even if it hadn't been remodeled like the room itself. I could see the room had already taken a beating though where there was a tear in the carpet and the mattress leaned to the side nearest the nightstand. The bedding was comfy though.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive!!”
Reviews.Author: Salitini
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel in a month long holiday in the US, and this was the best hotel we stayed in. The rooms are newly renovated, and extremely luxurious. Everything was immaculately clean. The bathroom had a huge bath with shower included - a little tricky to understand how to turn the shower on. The bed was incredibly comfy. We booked more than three months in advance and received a great discount on the room price because of this. The hotel was on one end of The Strip, however it was a quick walk to the middle of The Strip. There is a walkway bridge from The Tropicana to the MGM, which was handy due to the extreme heat and lots of traffic. We were extremely impressed by the hotel and will most definitely stay there again. Only one negative thing- we had to wait for quite a while to check in and check out- there was a long line at the check-in counters. The staff were very friendly and helpful, would have been good to have another person on the desk though.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend at Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: haragama
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Tropicana December 3rd to 5th. We were in the section of the hotel that was at the very front. i.e. above the casino. This was an excellent location as it was about ten steps from the front door to the elevator. We rented a car and used valet parking. This was also very convienent. We did not eat at any of the restaurants so I can't comment on the food. We used the walking overpass to the MGM a few times. It was less than a five minute walk. The casino is small and accommodating. The casino smells like vanilla which is better than smelling of smoke but rather sickening after a few hours. Overall, we would stay here again because of the price as well as the smaller size which makes it very easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service while check-in”
Reviews.Author: Timetravell
Reviews.Content: The guy Joaquin at the check-in counter was so arrogant. He made us wait for 5 min first to attend to us and then we had a pre paid reservation and I called them a week ago and was told that my room is in the paradise tower. Now joaquin wants to put us in the club tower and says there are only handicapped or non smoking rooms available in paradise tower. But I heard another receptionist telling people in front of us there are many rooms available in paradise tower. The rooms didnt even have coffee although they looked upgraded but we were very disappointed by the check-in experience and wouldn't recommend it. The casino is a smoke chamber

Reviews.Title: “First class amenities, middle class cost”
Reviews.Author: letsbehonestin08
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Las Vegas for 7 days from Dec 15-22nd and stayed at the completely renovated Tropicana. This place is gorgeous. From the moment you walk in you are greyed with the aroma of coconut...to give you that tropical experience. The casino has the most comfort and cleanliness of ANY casino I've ever visited. The tables and slots have creme colored leather bucket seats...luxury car quality. The air filtration system is one if the best. No smoke smells from cigars or cigarettes. The public restrooms are Saks Fifth Avenue quality. The decor is bright and uplifting. As for the guest rooms, they are large and offer great views to the west of the Excalibur and Mandalay Bay resorts, and to the north agreat view of MGM Grand resort. You are situated diagonal from New York New York and have breathtaking views of the roller coaster ride atop New York New York. Back to the rooms, mine had a king sized bed, desk chair and ottoman, bar, huge bath, flat screen tv, jet tub and most of all was very clean and comfortable. Room service was quick and polite. All employees I encountered were polite as well. This is a 5 star resort at 3 star prices. I would revisit this resort without hesitation again and I'm sure you will be blown away the moment you walk in. No expense was spared. See it to believe it!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: Frank_Slegers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tropicana for the second time last October. Again, we had a wonderful stay. Our room was clean and we had a great Strip view. Staff was friendly as ever. Check-in went smooth and the people working at the pool bar were great fun. Special thank you to Nicole Marshall but helping us with our reservation again. In our opinion, the Trop is one of the best choices out there at this moment. Prices are reasonable and you're staying in a beautiful, completely renovated property. If your wondering about staying at the Tropicana: just to it. I'm sure you're going to love it! Tropicana, see you again in a couple of months!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, tidy, Fun”
Reviews.Author: MrBenjamin
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at the Tropicana for a stag party, 22 of us !! |The rooms are basic but clean and tidy, exactly what we needed. The resort has a great selection of bars and restaurants, anything from Starbucks through to luxury Italian. The hotel was very helpful with checking us all in, and no one had any complaints. The bonus of the Tropicana is its positioning right at the top of the strip, it is close enough to the action but just far enough away as to not be in your face 24/7. A thoroughly good stay at the Tropicana and cant recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay on the Strip!!!”
Reviews.Author: TonyJudge
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Tropicana, arriving from Hawaii and just jumped a taxi to the hotel as far easier than getting the bus which drops off. Even though we were there after midnight the staff were very friendly and chatty and made us feel very welcome. We requested a Strip view room upon check-in, and got this for our second night as none were avilable first night. It is very clean and tidy and rooms were excellent. We had an issue with our shower the first morning but this was quickly resolved by the plumber. We were able to check into our new room straight away without any problems which was very useful. We booked through Hotwire as a secret hotel and was very pleased with their choice!! Especially as it cost us less than 35 pounds per night!! Didint eat in the Tropicana, but did get a coffee from Starbucks every morning!! Location is directly opposite the MGM Grand, New York New York and Excalibur so great location. Would definitely recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Lisa b
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tropicana in October. It was for business. The hotel was amazing. I use to stay there 15 years ago and boy how it's changed. The rooms were great, bed extremely comfortable. The location was perfect close walk to Lexor, and MGM. Food was good and the pool was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: Sweetguy36
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at almost every hotel on the strip, I can say not one has a staff that is so friendly and helpful as the Tropicana! From the maids to the dealers to the pool staff, they all made me feel like a high roller! Not to mention the clean, new decor of each room! It was so nice, I didnt want to set my soda from In-N-Out burger on the nightstand without a coaster. Not to mention the tables and poker room all had good limits and didnt raise them out of the blue collar price range once the sun goes down. This was a BIG plus to keep me on property gambling.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Margaret G
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Vegas for years and have stayed at many hotels and Casinos. I think for the last 2 years I only stay at the Tropicana. All the staff is so nice and helpful. The resturants are great and good prices. I like the small feel of old Vegas. If you want to go to the strip, you can walk. The Tropicana is in such a good location, that when we get there, we don't even drive. We took some girls that are doing a foreign exchange program, they were so impressed by the beautiful room and confortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotle”
Reviews.Author: TEberly
Reviews.Content: We booked a night at the Trop in July and really enjoyed the hotel. We are staying there for four nights over New Years Eve. If you want a nice, newly renovated place for a good price, try the Trop.

Reviews.Title: “Clean!”
Reviews.Author: Chris W
Reviews.Content: Wow! Spent four days at the Tropicana for a convention. Everything was so clean (including the air) and staff was very friendly. I cant say enough about my experience. All the remodeling and upgrades are great! I will definately stay there. Chris

Reviews.Title: “Business & pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Tanya A
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the Tropicana Las Vegas was fabulous! My family and I arrived on 12-2; our daughter married on 12-3; family left on 12-6 and the rest of my time was with a business convention. I am so glad we stayed at the Tropicana (and not the convention hotel)! the staff, the rooms, everything was absolutely outstanding! Ps...loved the rooms; they were so clean and comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place and good value”
Reviews.Author: boresaver
Reviews.Content: The refurbished rooms are nice and great value. It was winter when we were there so didn't use any of the resort facilities. Easy walk to MGM and New York with a good range of shops close by. I preferred this place to the Hilton and the Hampton Inn...and did I mention the free internet, good stuff and saves money. We will be back again next year and look forward to staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value with newly renovated rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jordan B
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed there this past weekend and were pleasantly surprised with how nice the rooms were. They were very recently renovated and very clean. The price was good and so we felt this was the best value we had experienced staying on the Strip in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: mperez48180
Reviews.Content: I went to Vegas for my 40th birthday and stayed at the Tropicana Las Vegas. We arrived early morning (checking was at 4pm) however, they had a room ready and we were able to check in at around 9am. The room was absolutely beautiful and very comfortable. The decor was amazing. Everyone was great and very polite. I would definitely stay at the Tropicana Las Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: wilbert T
Reviews.Content: I arrived early like 8:00am and thought i was gonna have to wait at least till 1:00pm she gave me my room early, i was so happy. I love staying at the Tropicana every time i'm in vegas

Reviews.Title: “Good value on the strip”
Reviews.Author: bellmeister
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. It is great value for money, we payed $200 + tax and resort fee for 3 nights. Whilst it is on the strip, it is at the very southern end so its a 10-15 minute walk to the centre of the strip. I would have preferred to be up near the bellagio and aria hotels, but they cost twice as much so its a bit of a trade off. The rooms were clean, I had a suite which was large but unfortunately had airport views. If you don't mind being slightly away from the action then this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “What a deal”
Reviews.Author: Ahmedam
Reviews.Content: I go to vegas a fair amount but this was my first stay at the remodeled tropicana. For the rate I paid ($30/nt on weeknights + the $15 resort fee) I think this is the best value I've had in vegas. The remodeled rooms are nice, esp. the bed. I'm a little surprised they seem to have cut some corners in spending on the bathrooms but its not a big deal. Even the pool area looked really nice and because its not surrounded by towers seems to get a lot of sun. Its got a decent location on the corner of the strip and tropicana blvd. You can cross the skybridge into MGM. 5min walk to NY/NY and 15min walk to City Center if you cut through Monte Carlo (Aria, etc.) Resort fee a bit disproportional to the rate I was paying but it includes internet and gym so if you use those things you get your money's worth on that also. Only downside is not much in the way of food options but given proximity to MGM this hardly matters. The outdoor patio at Nikki cafe looked very appealing if the weather was a little warmer. Would definitely stay here again if I could get a similar deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but still needs work”
Reviews.Author: raidergirl
Reviews.Content: We were there mid-December 2011 and stayed 4 nights. We chose it mainly based on price and location. The room was $89 a night, on the 17th floor in the Paradise tower. It was listed as a city view room and I guess technically it was but I had hoped to see more of the actual strip and not mainly the Luxor/Excalibur. Also there is a overlay on the outside of the windows that leaves a pattern of small circles on the glass, making it pretty hard to see anything clearly anyway. It's like looking through a really dark screen. Taking pictures is ruled completely out due to it. And as already mentioned the room stays very bright due to the window coverings which are wooden slat shutters. No matter which way you face them, up or down, the room stays really bright. Check in was super slow. 2 lines of people (Regular check in and Breeze check in) with only 2 people working the lines. The Breeze check in line (Booking via the Trops website affords you Breeze check in) was stalled due to a problem of some sort with the couple already up there. We waited 20 minutes without either line moving before someone (A guest checking in who was tired of the wait) went and had them get a manager who opened up 1 more window. After that check in was easy although far from friendly. As a side note, while there is a luggage ramp outside to roll your cases along there is not one inside so be prepared to lift your bags up about 7-8 steps to get to the front desk area. Also be prepared to watch the bell hop stand at his desk, next to these same stairs, chatting with another employee while he eyes you making two trips to get your bags up the stairs but does not offer to help. We actually ended up helping an elderly couple get their bags up as well while he watched. The room was clean and nice. The bed very comfy. As already mentioned the room is very bright, even at night and especially in the AM due to the shutters and no way to truly shut out the light from outside. The bathroom was clean and new looking as well. The adjustable shower head (Rain, jet, massage) was fantastic, great water pressure and perfect height. The towels are thin and see through in some spots and some had black stains that have probably been there a while. The provided glasses are super small and when we called down to request wine glasses we waited 30 minutes for them and were then given 4 more teeny water glasses instead. Housekeeping skipped us entirely one day as well and we were out of the room by 12:30 that day so not all that late. The casino is standard, nothing that makes it really stand out from any other one. The atmosphere smell that is piped in stinks. I think it is supposed to be vanilla but instead smells like a day old cigar. It's also in the hallways leading to the rooms. We did not eat there so I cannot comment at all on the restaurants. The outside staff is far friendlier then the inside staff. The location is fantastic for getting around. You can get the Deuce and Express Deuce right out front. And monorail access is located next door at the MGM which you can get to easily by the overhead bridge between the 2 hotels. I'd strongly suggest getting a 3 day Deuce pass versus the monorail. The monorail is great but it costs more and you will pretty much always end up walking the equivalent of a few blocks inside the casinos to get from the monorail drop off behind the hotels to the strip. Where as the Deuce runs along the strip and you get off directly in front of whatever casino you are aiming for. So much easier! And it's a great way to see the strip and whats on it as wella s people watch. Plus if you are wanting to get to Freemont street you will need the Deuce anyway since the monorail is for the strip only and the Deuce drops you right off at the Freemont street experience. Forget taxis unless you have too much cash and want a quick way to get rid of some. So in closing, the Trop has cleaned up nicely, the location is handy for a lot of things, the rooms are decent and clean but it still has some work to do as far as customer service goes and the windows/window coverings need re-thinking.

Reviews.Title: “good rooms and price, bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: may0529
Reviews.Content: I loved the room i checked into and for only 30 a night it was a steal (room 1581)!!!However the front desk girl who checked me in, Rose, was rather rude and unkind. I didn't like how she was busy talking to another guest whom she wasn't even checking in. Then seemed to have an attitude when I asked for a room with two queen beds. When I got to my room, I had trouble pulling the faucet for the shower and called front desk, this time i got edith, even ruder then the lady before. She made me feel like an idiot. I would rather stay at the other nearby hotels if i'm just going to be treated rudely.if tropicana got rid of their rude associates i would be back.not sure if i'll return to spend money to be treated unfairly

Reviews.Title: “Mr. Grinch?”
Reviews.Author: Anna S
Reviews.Content: What's up with the Tropicana not having any Holiday decorations around the hotel??? Not one Pointsettia, not one wreath, not one jingle bell .... nada, zip, zilch. Not even Holiday music playing! If not for Starbucks, one would think the Tropicana doesn't "believe" :( I thought for sure that being the "new" Tropicana the owners would go all out. I'm terribly disappointed and apparently many of the workers are as well. When I asked an employee why no decorations anywhere, I got a shoulder shrug with an "I don't know". Shame, shame, shame on the owner/management. You turned the building pink for the entire Breast Cancer Awareness Month, maybe you should now turn it green ..... Mr. Grinch! Your customers and employees deserve to celebrate ..... just sayin!

Reviews.Title: “Remodeled and doing a great job!”
Reviews.Author: traveler51
Reviews.Content: Stayed with the family for a birthday celebration ...long weekend begining of November. Was SO surprised at the remodel...pictures were true to form and hotel was spotless... Restaurants were excellent had wine pairing at the Biscayne and price fixed menu at Boccia was a treat....Morning buffet was pricey but when service was slow were comped a meal...thanks Trop!(Didn't even ask or complain...) Unfortunately, spa was not open that weekend due to some delay but when we did mention it at check out we were comped the resort fee...Had a blast at the tables...our pit boss Manny was a riot and our dealer made the night go by so fast no one got up from the table...And their penny slots were LOOSE! We all won at one machine or another...Guest Services on the casino floor went out of the way to please....After staying at the pricey Venetian in August...it was a pleasant surprise to see what Trop was out to offer! On the whole a great weekend for a great price....We'll definitely be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable.”
Reviews.Author: HappyKampersToo
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 1AM, and the self-parking was a moderately long doutdoors walk with luggage back into the building. Certainly shorter than some of the mega-big properties with massive parking garages. Once inside we found a small but 'typical' casino atmosphere. Smoke, people, and noise were average for a small casino, and we say many families while there. The redecorating indeed makes the interrior look nearly new in most places. This isn't one of the five star properties on the strip, but it is tasteful and appealing to the eye with reasonable value fo the money. There was one of three check-in clerks working despite the people waiting. The line wait was about 20 minutes, and the clerk was efficent but strictly business. I attempted to upgrade our room and ended up with a view of the neighboring buildings airconditioning ducts for my trouble and tip. The room was neat, and we verified no evidence of bedbugs were present. There were some large orange/red stains on the carpet and furniture from a previous spill. The stains detracted from a sense of cleanliness, and I have to wonder why they give that room out if others are available. The next morning we found hairs from prior occupants in the bath and elsewhere. Due to a long line at checkout, we used the express checkout box and forgot to tell the desk clerk about the hairs. A trip for ice and drinks from the machines turned into a visit to three floors before success. I ran into an employee on the elevator and reported the failures. I got a shrug and, 'Yeah, they're always broken.' Overall it wasn't a bad experience, and our stay is about what I expected for the price. We switched to a non-casino/gaming hotel for the next few nights and planned to come back for a second try later in the week. In the end we decided not to return to the Tropicana due out of convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for us”
Reviews.Author: 1947res
Reviews.Content: Stayed for nearly a week. Clean, comfy rooms. Good beds, flat screen TV. Club Tower a walk from casino. Tower has some airport noise, but not too intrusive. No fridge in rooms, so you've go not way to buy bulk and keep cold goodies. All food in Vegas to my mind is sticker shock, never having been here before. Casino could use better hvac. Too hot and smoky to be comfortable for me, but not for most I guess. They could turn down the background music in halls and common areas, but maybe I'm not their demographic, but certainly would stay there again. Cafe Nikki and food court were good food to our relatively pedestrian tastes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay for the money”
Reviews.Author: radiohokie
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana is not the flashiest on the Strip, but we had a nice 3 night stay here for a modest price. Staff was helpful and the room was nice. Not extravagant or exceptional in any area, but good value and we really enjoyed the location (we enjoy walking). The pools looked amazing, but obviously we could not enjoy them in the December.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay ever!”
Reviews.Author: Candy W
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic experience at the Tropicana - I have stayed in many casinos on the strip and the Tropicana can not be beat for their customer service!!! They have recently remodeled and the hotel is very clean. The Tequila bar and show is the best! Also check out the mob experieince - definitely worth seeing!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 4 stars, Casino 2 stars, employees 5 stars...”
Reviews.Author: paulala
Reviews.Content: We decided, at the last minute, to go to Vegas for the NFR (rodeo) and had to pick from the remaining hotels available. This hotel was relatively cheap and the pictures looked good so we booked it. Walking in I was struck by how much white paint was everywhere. The place definitely lacked atmosphere, in fact, it reminded me more of an Indian Casino than a Vegas one. I was greeted at the front desk by a very friendly clerk, indeed every one of the employees here were exceptionally nice and accommodating. The check-in went very fast and easy and he pointed me to the Paradise elevators. After seeing the lobby I wasn't really expecting the room to look as good as the pictures on their web site but I was wrong. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. There is a resort fee of $14.99 which includes Internet and local calls. Dining: We went to dinner twice at Bacio and loved it both times! My husband ordered the New York steak and it was huge and tasty. I had the pasta with clams and ate every bit of it! There is also a little deli called Pellegrino's that had such great customer service. The first day there I ordered a BLT and the next day I went back the kind woman remembered my order from before. How many places can you say that about? There is also a Starbucks, a prerequisite for my husband and I LOL! Would I go back here? Yes, if I couldn't get into the Golden Nugget, but it would not be my first choice. There is a new show in an intimate bar there called Eye Candy and it was a lot of fun to watch. Sexy show but no nudity. Parking is a cinch and free. The best things about this hotel, comfy beds, wonderful staff and price.

Reviews.Title: “best value for money Ive found on the strip”
Reviews.Author: KarenB_007
Reviews.Content: where to stay in vegas is always a tough one ... what shows do you want to go to ? are you a gambler ? do want to be walking everywhere or driving? .... well - if you are looking at shows at M.Bay, Luxor, Excalibur, NY NY, MGM, etc - you are an easy quick walk away and that is worth its weight in logistical gold. Having said that - its very easy to self park at most hotels so at worst - grab a $12/day rental from the airport (but not FOX - they may be cheaper but they take you an extra 30 minutes to get to their office compared to all other airport rentals)... and then self park for free all up and down the strip. Im not a big gambler so to be able to go from my room to out on the strip in less than 3 minutes was AWESOME.. (must stay at the paradise tower to do that though)..if I was a big gambler - probably wouldnt stay here as the loyalty programs elsewhere are quite good. The rooms were big and clean just wish they had a coffee maker but starbucks is easily accessible on ground level. Only negative I had was the concierge. They are affiliated with expedia and although very nice, swore up and down that tickets through them would be same or cheaper then box office and I found in all three tickets I bought - that wasnt the case.. about $20-30 cheaper for each one at the box office...and I wont even mention the prices at the 1/2 price same day ticket places... moral - check with the box office first before using.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Spinny4
Reviews.Content: Check in: We waited about 30 minutes to check in but there was a lady bringing us free water and apologising for the wait. Room: Our room was in the club tower which was quite a walk from the main casino. However, it was very quiet there and the room was good. The beds were really comfy and there was a large flat screen tv. We couldnt open our safe on the 1st day so we called down and someone promptly came up to sort out the problem. The only small thing was that there was some mould in the corner of the bathroom and the shower head was half hanging out of the wall but it still worked fine. The room was clean every day and plenty of shampoo and conditioner. Casino: The casino is small is comparison to other hotels but meant it was only a short walk through which was good in my opinion. It was really really smoky which meant we didnt spend much time there. Bar: The bar was expensive so we didnt actually drink there but the music was pretty decent. Only annoying thing to us was that they kept putting sports and the rodeo on the tv but i suppose that is what Americans like best. Cafe Nicki: Ate there the first morning for breakfast. Felt it was pretty pricy and they were playing horrible dance music at 7.15am?! However, the food was lovely although i was a bit bemused that the server did not know what an English muffin was made of. Also when i asked if they did free range eggs he said 'We can cook the eggs any way you like' :) Overall, the hotel has been done up to an excellent standard and we would stay here again if returning. There isnt too much of a walk from the hotel to MGM or New York New York.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana once again great..”
Reviews.Author: herminator
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the "new" Tropicana several times the past couple years and was there again the first week of December. I was in town for the marathon and because of the location made it a good place to stay. Once again the staff was great from check in, casino, sports book, servers, etc. Steven, who is in the maintenance department, insisted that if something wasnt up to standard to let them know and they would take care of it. However the room was great as always so there was no need to call them but I did appreciate his concern. I recommend it to all who ask for an opinion on where to stay. I will be back to LV several times in 2012 and will once again stay at the Trop.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: bruce l
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Las Vegas so we didn't know what to expect!!! We stayed at the Tropicana in Paradise Tower on the 19 floor. The view of the strip was amazing!!! Our room looked exactly like the pictures on the website. Very clean and confortable!!! When you are inside, it feels very bright and friendly, unlike some other hotel that are darker and have mazes of slot machines. We spend a few hours gambling in their casino, having fun with other guests and Gilbert (one of the attendants for the slots). Thanks Gilbert for your kindness and good service!!! We wil be going back to Vegas with friends and the Tropicana will be our 1st choice. LOVED IT !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: tea-babe
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas, traveling with a group of girlfriends. We had rooms in the Paradise Tower overlooking the strip, including one suite with a living room where we could all hang out. The Trop is not the most fabulous amazing place on the strip but I think it IS an excellent place to make your home base. It was very affordable, the rooms were clean and spacious and totally well-outfitted (like a good Hyatt or Marriott) and the location was fantastic. I enjoyed looking at all the other hotels and casinos but I was very happy at the end of the day to come back to the Trop. Every service person we met was lovely and helpful. We had brunch at Cafe Nikki and thought it was pretty fantastic. I would definitely stay at the Trop if I ever return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “What A GREAT Place”
Reviews.Author: Mary Ellen W
Reviews.Content: Over Thanksgiving this year I stayed at the Tropicana Hotel and I have to say it was wonderful. The rooms have been updated and were bright and most important Clean. The staff at the hotel was friendly and upbeat. From check in to maids I met in the hallway everyone smiled and greeted me. I also ate at the Italian Restaurant at the property and the food was Fantastic. Chef Carla visited with us and told us her cooking secrets in making her dishes healthy and less fattening. If you stay at the hotel plan on dining there. All in all I had a great experience and enjoyed my stay. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Refurbished Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lindsey M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks last month and was delighted with a free upgrade to the Paradise Tower with a Strip view. The room was bright, fresh, clean and very comfortable. This tower is right next to the casion exit which is very handy if you are not interested in the ususal trapse through the casino maze taking 20 mins to find the way out (I am taking about you MGM Grand! I also want to highlight the new beds too. They are so comfortable and the best nights sleep I have ever had in Vegas. This was our 8th stay in Vegas and we would recommend the Trop before any other hotel we have stayed at. We will be back and will be staying at the Trop.

Reviews.Title: “A nice size hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: lovesvegaslongtime
Reviews.Content: We visited the week of Sept. 25th. This was our first time staying at the Tropicana. The hotel recently underwent major renovations. The Trop is a nice, medium sized hotel. The casino has everything you need without being overwhelming; easy to get around. I also happen to think that the location is perfect; you can walk to the Excalibur, Luxor, N.Y. N.Y., MGM Grand, and the Monte Carlo within a few minutes. The pool was very nice, the rooms very spacious, and the staff was friendly. I only had two minor complaints. First, the bed was too soft for my liking; if you lay near the edge you roll right out of bed. The second was Nikki's (restaurant). It was not busy yet we had to wait almost 25 minutes just for someone to get our drink order. Those two things aside, I liked the convenience and size of the Tropicana and would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room unfortunately food not as good”
Reviews.Author: tstcuk
Reviews.Content: The check-in process was easy and quick. Got moved to the quiet side of the hotel which was some way from the casino and quite a walk from the strip. Room looked as if it had been recently decorated in a light neutral colour so unlike many hotels did not feel like a badly lit crypt with the room lights turned on. Excellent view of the green MGM and New York New York resorts so all though set back from the strip still felt a part of it. No worries that cleaning teeth, showering feet can all be done whilst sitting on the toilet as the bathroom was huge and fitted with a big corner bath that could accommodate two people. The only problems experienced whilst at the hotel were trying to find the box office to book the very funny Brad Garrett show (Brad Garrett hilarious and most politically incorrect show I have heard since seeing the Manchester master Bernard Manning.) and the food at Cafe Nikki. The service was slow in the evening and people were hidden at tables between great wooden pillars so the waiting staff could not clearly see when to clear the table and/or provide top up drinks. The following day because it was easy went to Cafe Nikki for lunch and the food and service were even worse. It seems all though Wendy, our server, did not mention it or give us any options the beef burgers are served raw in the middle. Sending the first one back and asking for a cooked burger was no better as the second was still raw. So all though McDonald's, Wendys, A&W, etc. all believe that a burger should be cooked it would seem the Cafe Nikki kitchen does not share their successful burger cooking formula. Wendy failed to provide the endless Pepsi product as advertised on the menu. All in all and as Brad Garrett mentioned during his show (many a true word spoken in jest) the food at the Tropicana was not very good. Therefore go to the Tropicana for the room, utilize the bus stop outside the hotel on the strip to get to other hotels and restaurants for meals.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vegas "Small" Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: bearabc
Reviews.Content: If you hate those Vegas hotels where you walk a mile just to get to your room then check out the Tropicana. We were lucky enough to get upgraded to a strip-view room in the Paradise tower. The elevators are just a few steps from the front door or the casino floor - perfect for a few quick hands on the tables or heading out to the Strip. Even our friends who stayed in the other tower found their journey to their room a short trip compared to biggies like the Luxor, Venetian, or MGM. Recent renos are great. Rooms looked pretty good in both towers and beds were fantastic. Food services certainly comparable with similar sized hotels on the Strip. Pool area was closed but new Club Nikki looks really cool. 2 cautions: First - If you want a non-smoking room, phone around 12-1PM the day you check in. Non-smoking rooms are just a suggestion, and although we did phone the day before and the day of our check-in, there were still no non-smoking rooms available. Hate to be a whiner, but it did get us a nice upgrade from the manager. Our friends were not so lucky because they didn't phone ahead. Second - bring ear plugs and a blindfold. This is a really busy part of the strip, and it is at heart an older hotel. Even on the 21st floor, the traffic noise was pretty substantial, and the new shutters on the windows don't block a lot of light. Everything considered, I would stay at the Trop again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: happytrip4us
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay at The Tropicana Hotel in Las Vegas. The hotel has a classy, modern look. We were so impressed. We were treated with nothing but the best customer service. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Recycled Percussion Show at the Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: kes1639
Reviews.Content: What a great show. Saw these guys on America's Got Talent. They don't disappoint. Bought our tickets through the 1/2 price ticket office for VIP tickets (you get a reserved seat up front -- but the theater is small so no seat is bad). Each person is handled a recycled item and a drumstick to participate. This is a great show to bring the kids and let them bang out their excessive energy. The performers are very enthusiastic and obviously enjoy what they do but are also humble by their recent success. Reminds me of an early Blue Man Group. Well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Great for meetings”
Reviews.Author: Joseph B
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, no elevator waits, very near the meeting rooms. Good food friendly staff and good minimums on the tables. Five minutes from the airport. Perfect for good business with a little fun mixed in for good luck. Definitely will be back!

Reviews.Title: “My opinion is it is the best Hotel on the Strip and certainly convenient to everything!”
Reviews.Author: Harl70
Reviews.Content: We absolutely love the Tropicana in Las Vegas! It is extremely convenient and the price is extremely affordable, compared to the other 3 corners! It is a 1st Class Hotel in my opinion, and I plan on going there in either Jan. or Feb. of 2012. We usually go twice a year and our trips are always just for pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BirminghamUKSandra
Reviews.Content: We went to the Tropicana for 7 nights at the end of October - I really liked this hotel it was nice a light and airy in comparisson to a lot of the other hotels that seem to be rather dark and dingy inside. This hotel is at the end of the strip and overlooks the airport but there is no noise from the airport. Good for taxi rides from airport too as was about $10 as so close. Although its at the end of the strip i found the location to be good as its the "quieter end" of the strip more likely to get a bit of sleep as vegas doesnt stop even throughout the night. You have good acces to the mgm grand which then takes you straight on to the strip or you can go over the bridge right outside which takes you right into excalibur and from there you can get to new york new york which has great burger joints. Or get the tram from excalibur to the luxor and mandalay bay. The rooms are clean and rather spacious although i would say book the paradise tower as thats the one right at the front the other tower is like a 10 min walk through the hotel not long but long enough after a day walking the strip. Staff wa friendly and when we had any questions/ problems they were very polite and helpful couldnt fault them. I will def stay here next time im in vegas

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to relax and recharge while in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ElyseFLkeys
Reviews.Content: This was the first trip to Vegas for my hubby and I (we actually got married while we were there!) I wasn't expecting too much from the Trop, as the rate we got was one of the more affordable on the strip. I also have high expectations, as I've worked as a Front Desk Agent at some very nice properties. But we were pleasantly surprised how nice it was! Upon walking in it was bright and clean. We arrived at 9:30 AM knowing it was way to early to check-in, but we thought we'd store our bags and have them call us when our room was ready. Maria, at the Front Desk, was so nice and helpful. She gave us a few options and upgraded us to a Junior Suite for it being our wedding, and promised that we would get a call as soon as it was ready. We got a call at noon that our room was ready, and when we got to our room I thought "Ahhhhhh." So fresh and clean and classy! It was on the 15th floor on the corner with lots of windows. The junior suite is a good size, but they could probably replace one of the 3 armchairs with a loveseat and a little bar. There was ALOT of empty space, but it was just fine for 2 ppl, well even 3 or 4 as I had a couple of guests as I got ready for our big day. Sunset was a great time for pictures in our room, with views of the Luxor and mountains behind us. It was very quiet in our room, we felt like we were the only people in that part of the hotel! It was a perfect place to recharge after the cacophony of Vegas. At check out Yolanda offered to print out our boarding passes for us, and made easy for us with our departure. Some cons: No bathrobe in the rooms (you can request them, but I didn't realize that at the time). Also, the shampoo,conditioner, and lotion seemed kind of cheap. Wouldn't mind a bit of luxury there! Also none of the little soaps were face soaps, usually hotels put a bar of facial soap in the rooms. Also no mini-bar or in room coffee. And it's quit a walk to the Club Tower, making it annoying for coffee/drink runs, or when we forgot something in the room. Also it's at the South end of the strip, making it a bit inconvenient, especially if you want to check out Fremont. Also, this was one of my favorite casinos, as it wasn't dark and smoky. And I liked the coconut smell :) Overall, I would love to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Nicksparkle
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, friendly staff, 1st time in Vegas from the uk and would certainly recommend to everyone. Little food on site a bit expensive but I expected this.

Reviews.Title: “exellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lillie P
Reviews.Content: I advise anyone going to las vegas you wont find a better place to stay the service was great

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dan K
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the 2011 National Finals Rodeo because the rate for two nights was less then one night at most of the other hotels on the strip. Check in was quick and easy, the only thing was I did not receive my 2011 NFR program that was supposed to come with my hotel package, went to the hotel desk the next day and was given one right away. They said they just renovated the hotel, but the bathroom looked old and just sad for a renovation. Read some reviews on here about how you had walk a long way through the casino to get to Starbucks. Well it took me all of 30 seconds to walk there from the elevators, not sure what people were talking about. While this was not one of the mega hotels on the strip I would stay here again. Staff was friendly during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice remodeled facility”
Reviews.Author: OverlandMT
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights here while celebrating my birthday in Vegas. After browsing online for several months, the Tropicana seemed to provide the best value this weekend (NFR rodeo and LV Marathon). I've stayed here several times before, but it's been 10+ years. Things have really improved! The south strip location worked well for us. Each of us arrived/departed at different times. The Tropicana is convenient to the airport (approx. $15 cab ride). The MGM Grand, NYNY, and the Excaliber are right across the street and provide quick access to additional dining and entertainment options. Three adults stayed in a Club tower room - non-smoking with two queen beds. The Club tower requires walking a good distance to access - not a problem for us, but something to consider if you mind a long walk back and forth to your room. The hallways and common areas were clean and well maintained. Everything really has a new, updated look. There are plenty of elevators - never a wait. The room was clean throughout. New carpet. The beds were comfortable with nice bedding. New flatscreen TV (with broken remote). Good climate control that actually maintained a comfortable temp. No coffee maker. Plenty of available outlets for phone chargers, laptops, etc. Ipod compatible clock radio. Windows are covered with shutters to block the light. The shutters swing open allowing each window to slide open a few inches. Our room had a view of the pool area(closed), NYNY, and the MGM Grand. We didn't try the WiFi access. We commented several times on how quiet the room was - no noise from the surrounding rooms, outside traffic, people in the hallway, or airplanes. The bathroom was fine, but apparently not fully remodeled - several cracked tiles on floor, odd corner tub/shower with a crusty old shower head, trim falling off tub faucet, toilet that often required multiple flushes. Towels were clean, but no "fluff". Vanity, sink, faucets looked to be new. We didn't dine, gamble, or see any shows at the Tropicana. We had drinks at the Ambhar lounge. Fred (bartender) was a funny guy that provided great service. When I booked my reservation online, I requested an additional roll away bed for the first two nights. Due to "fire code" regulations, they would not put a roll away in a room with two queens. I tried to book a second room at check in, but they had limited availability and wouldn't come close to matching the rate we had for our reserved room. The room was plenty large, so we made do. At check out, we paid $15 per night in mandatory resort fees, even though we didn't use or benefit from any of the "resort" services. The free parking garage was convenient to the front door. It seemed safe and secure. All three of us would gladly stay here again. Thanks to the Tropicana!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Canadian Hoping to Soon be a Las Vegas Local
Reviews.Title: “Old Casino, New Look”
Reviews.Author: lv_local_wannabe
Reviews.Content: Tropicana is one of the oldest casinos on the Strip still standing (original property built in 1957). Since the recent change in ownership (now Canadian-owned), there have been over 100 million dollars in updates and renovations. Most of the rooms have now been renovated in the two taller towers, along with much of the casino floor. Cafe Nikki is stunning in appearance and ambiance, and the food is pretty good too :) The irritating coconut smell has finally been toned down (perhaps part of the intention of that was to help give the entire facility a 'new' smell), and apart from check in (which still is reminiscent of the old Landmark hotel, or the California Club downtown), and the mezzanine level, the facility appears clean and new. Definitely worth taking a second look if your impression of the Tropicana is rooted in its appearance pre-2009.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: larry p
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tropicana after the renovations were completed, we were very impressed with the facility, the service, the friendliness of the staff, and especially the beautiful room. I love Tropicana because of its location, its size (can walk through the casino without getting lost), its cheerfulness, the quality of the restaurants, and everything else. The next trip to Vegas for us will definitely be a stay at Tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING CUSTOMER SERVICE at TROPICANA LV GLOW SPA!”
Reviews.Author: joelysmom
Reviews.Content: I am COMPLETELY impressed with the Staff at the brand new GLOW SPA. I was a customer on opening day 11/11/11 and had a massage with Andrew. The reception people were absolutely fantastic. The spa is GORGEOUS!. Andrew made me feel like a million bucks and Yolanda, the locker room attendant, is a beautiful and helpful person. I felt so happy and relaxed with my treatment! So relaxed that I forgot my diamond loop earrings in my locker.... Several days later I realized I had forgotten them. I was literally devasted. I called the Spa immediately and spoke with Sara. To my complete relief, my earrings had been found and tucked away in the spa safe. I was thrilled! Sara was gracious, supportive and made me feel comfortable that I would receive them. To cap off my AMAZING experience, Gianni Valentino sent me my earrings in a package with a couple Mandara body wash gifts. He called me to let me know progress when the earrings were sent to me FedEx also. I am stunned, impressed and grateful for this incredible service and experience. I will ALWAYS stay at the Tropicana now for the rest of my life! Their impeccable service created a loyal and thankful customer.

Reviews.Title: “Started slow. Finished strong.”
Reviews.Author: dball213
Reviews.Content: We flew out the day after Thanksgiving. Having done the research online, we decided to reserve a non-smoking king room in the Paradise Tower. That's the one that is right off the casino floor. Upon arriving, we were told that that tower didn't have a non-smoking room and we would have to take a room in the Club Tower. They told us we could come by between 1-3pm the next day to request a new room in the correct tower. Not thrilled, we went to the room. If you've ever seen the Trop from the outside, you see just how far away the Club Tower is. After the long walk, we made it into our room. The room looked pretty nice. New LG TV on the wall. But when I went into the bathroom, it was pretty dirty--especially the tub. Not a little dusty. It looked like the faucet was rusted. But it was just dirt. So I called down to housekeeping and let them know. They said they would send someone up to clean it. A little unhappy about the combo of wrong tower and dirty bathroom I went to blow off some steam by tweeting about it. Well, by the time we got back from eating (HOT DOGS AT PINKS IN PLANET HOLLYWOOD!!!), they had gotten back to me on twitter. The manager on duty called my room. She personally apologized and even offered us a food credit for our trouble. Even though there was public pressure (my tweet had been retweeted by a few Vegas people), I appreciated the personal attention and gesture. The next day we still wanted to switch towers. Not thrilled about having to be around in the middle of the afternoon to do this, we packed our stuff and left it at the bell desk. I went to the check-in desk and let them know I wanted the new room. Again she told me I had to come back between 1-3pm so they could do a room switch. When I told her I brought my own bags down, she said that she could then block out a new room for us anytime. I wish they had told me that. If I hadn't taken the initiative, I would have been sitting around waiting to switch rooms instead of enjoying Vegas. I gave them a call later just to make sure we got the room. And we did. No problem. The new room was even nicer than the old one. Definitely cleaner. And a much shorter walk. The casino there is pretty nice. The dealers seemed friendly. We ate a few breakfasts at Starbucks and had a late supper at Cafe Nikki. Steak and Eggs at 11pm is awesome. The food was great. Overall the staff was wonderful. The bellman was from NJ, so we had some hometown chat while we stowed our bags. I'm not thrilled by the location. We hung out at MGM and NY NY while we were down there, but we usually find ourselves more north. But since we were going to be spending a few nights at the Cosmo, I didn't mind being farther south than usual. We even took a walk down to the Welcome to Las Vegas sign.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT TIMES!!!”
Reviews.Author: LULAJSCMAI
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time staying at the newly remodelled Tropicana Hotel and Casino in Las Vegaz. The room we stayed had been resently remodelled. It was nice and fresh, almost like staying in a new hotel. The casino was also great. There was still a lot of remodelling that needed to be finished when we were there, but the parts that were done were fantastic!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Trop!!”
Reviews.Author: nebraskabecky
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Tropicana from Nov. 28 to Dec 2. My top priority in a hotel is it's got to be clean. Everything, and I mean everything was clean. Rooms, casino, public restrooms, dining areas, elevators, there was even a woman outside cleaning the escalator to the walkway to MGM. Our room was very spacious with a nice view. The beds are amazing. All of the staff we dealt with was very friendly. Nicole took care of us before we even arrived and Felicia at the Roulette table was very personable and took the time to teach us the game. We even won a little! The cocktail waitresses were quick with the drinks. Tip those ladies......they deserve it. Slot selection was very comparable to the other casinos on the strip. We also caught the Recycled Percussion show. WOW! That was the best show we saw all week. Even more entertaining than the Blue Man Group! On our next trip to Vegas we will most certainly be staying at the Tropicana again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: LeeODonnell
Reviews.Content: Had the most amazing time at the new Tropicana. Stayed for 7 nights in total from Novemer 13th - 20th, and from the second i got there I knew we'd have a ball, when the taxi pulled up the guy at the front door nearly died when he spotted me trying to take our own luggage up the steps to reception, helped us with all out bags, with such a smile! :-) Check in was quick and painless. From the moment you walk in the front door of the trop you'll notice their scent is pushed in though the air con system, a tropical blend of coconuts and pineapple, lovely. The rooms are nice and spacious, HD TV with HD channels was a nice touch, the beds are simply one of the most comfortable beds I've ever had the pleasure of sleeping on. I simply cannot recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Jan Thanksgiving holiday”
Reviews.Author: cheaptraveler_11
Reviews.Content: My two sisters and I went to Vegas for the first time and stayed at the Tropicana. We LOVED it there. There is not one negative thing we can say about it. The room, although not luxurious was lovely and the best beds and pillows. Extremely clean, room service everyday even though we said it wasn't necessary. The casino was light and bright and gave off a happy feeling instead of dark and depressing like almost every other casino. Not a huge choice in food but what we ate was excellent. The breakfast buffet was good and a late night meal was also good. We never came across any staff that was grumpy, they were all nice and helpful. The tropicana fit our lifestyle perfectly, small enough to easily get around. We loved staying there so much that we are planning another trip in April. Just for fun I looked at other places to stay and there really is no place else we would rather stay. I highly recommend the Tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana needs attention to housekeeping.”
Reviews.Author: RandiRA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently booked two rooms at the Tropicana for a one night outing to see the Cirque "O" show, for my mother and ourselves. We chose the Tropicana based on location, website photos, off-season price and TA reviews. From the time we arrived all staff from valet parking, bell desk, registration and restaurant service were wonderful. Everyone was friendly, informative and helpful. Upon first glance, the updated rooms were great. We liked the modern "Miami Beach" decor, but it quickly became evident that the Tropicana declarations of a newly "renovated" property actually meant newly "decorated." The bathroom floor tile was very old 4", outdated, chipped and scuffed. The stone threshold between the bathroom and bedroom appeared either very dirty or permanently stained. The bathtub had numerous, large chips in the enamel. The housekeeping, or lack of, was quite surprising. Our bathtub had standing water in it, hair (not ours) in the sink and the carpet, particularly in front of the dresser, had many stains. The carpet appeared fairly new so part of the re-decorating, but obviously not regularly cleaned. My Mom's room had the same stained carpet and her bathroom sink actually was sprinkled with dirt particles, as though a broom or mop had been shaken out in it. There was long, dark hair on the bathroom counter, also not her's. A housekeeper was doing the room across the hall from us so I told her about our bathrooms. Her response was to simply open the bathtub plug and let the water drain out. I had to ask her to "please clean it." There was a memo in each room alerting guests to a hotel water test on Nov. 28th that would require turning the water off completely between 1:00am-5:00am. We were there on the 30th so fortunately it didn't apply to us (the memos should have been thrown away) but I can't imagine checking into a LV hotel with the idea of gambling, eating and drinking the night away only to discover, upon check-in, that I wouldn't be able to flush the toilet or have any water in my room during the night. It was surprising that the room service menu was limited to pizza and strombolis from their Italian food court cafe. In a 24 hr. town I would always expect a breakfast, lunch and dinner selection. We don't gamble so the only other hotel amenity that we used was the Cafe Nikki for breakfast. Again, we loved the updated decor and table with a pretty view of the tropical, palm tree surrounded pool & patio. Our server was great. On the negative, the prices were high for basic breakfast in an older, average Las Vegas hotel. Coffee was $4, bacon and eggs $12, pancakes $9 and the breakfast buffet was almost $19 per person. We've done a lot traveling in many states and countries and aren't opposed to indulging in good dining, but that was extravagant for an average property, at low season, during a negative economy, in a resort town where business is off 40% and there is a lot of competition. That one experience would certainly deter us from trying any of their other restaurants when there are so many excellent choices in Las Vegas. Others here have had very positive stays at the Tropicana so perhaps the bad housekeeping in our two rooms was the exception, but managements policy to cut corners by not replacing the worn out tile and tubs and not regularly shampoo the room carpeting will send us elsewhere. With so many good $50 a night rooms in LV right now I doubt that we'd stay at the Tropicana again as room cleanliness is high on our priority list.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel without the glitz!”
Reviews.Author: MarkBTID
Reviews.Content: Visited the Tropicana for my 30th birthday with my wife in November and had a lovely stay. 1st impressions are of a really clean, fresh and modern looking hotel and these don't go away throughout your stay. The smell of coconut as you enter is a nice one and not overpowering. Check in was pretty quick and we had been upgraded to a City View room due to my tweeting of the hotel which was an unexpected but very nice surprise. The room itself was excellent. Very large, big king sized bed which was the most comfortable I have slept in. Huge TV on a nice big unit with safe, 4 big drawers and a desk with chair. Also in the room is a chaise lounge, a palm tree style plant, 2 bedside cabinets and an i-pod dock which is great to plug your own i-pod into and listen to your own tunes when you feel like it. The view from our window was onto the MGM Grand and down the strip, looking down on the bridge between Trop and MGM. When lying on my bed I could see the MGM, Planet Hollywood, Paris and Wynn. Very nice. The bathrooms were fine, it did look like they hadn't been upgraded as much as the main room but they still clean and well functional. Decent sized sink and unit, bath tub with a shower that had a very powerful head and a toilet more secluded in a boxed off section of the room. The only slight issue is that we had an adjoining room and you could hear the guests in that room. Luckily we had quiet neighbours but this could be an issue if you had a noisy neighbour. Casino itself is small for Vegas standards and there is no distinct theme like NY NY, Paris etc but it is spotlessly clean. It has a bright airy feel and there is always someone cleaning. All staff were friendly and talkative from check in to dealers to waitresses. The pool area was very nice, nice gardens and the pool was spacious and clean. Food options are limited compared to the bigger hotels but still more than adequate.. Cafe Nikki was the only one we sampled but the meal here was gorgeous. Overall it was a lovely stay, I would have no problems in recommending The Trop to anyone. Thanks to all at The Trop!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Satya S
Reviews.Content: Affordable place to stay, very clean & spacious hotel. It was newly remodeled.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mariah M
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Vegas. We came for a two day rock festival, and we could not have picked a better hotel for our trip! Our room was on a corner and we had views of the strip, the pool, and the festival grounds! Our room was beautiful, big, quiet and extremely comfortable. We had been told several things about Vegas in general (mostly negative) but The Tropicana was nothing like what people said. The whole place smelled great, even the casino area. Everything was clean and all of the staff were very friendly and helpful! We went into every hotel on the strip during our 8 day stay, and for the money Tropicana was hands down the best that we saw. We will definitely stay here next year. Thanks for giving us a great first time to Vegas trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Zoidfarb
Reviews.Content: We had an incredible suite with an incredible view. The other hotels could learn a lesson from Tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Time”
Reviews.Author: Gildah
Reviews.Content: omg!!!! the best time anyone could have is at the tropicana. let me start by tell you the night we check in I hit a royal flush. than up to the room omg!! beautifully room and I slept like a bady thank You we will be back. We alway stay at the new hotel but this time it feel like the new tropicana . I spent my wedding night here it was nice than better now thank you again.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving Weekend 2011”
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: I recently spent Thanksgiving weekend at the newly remodeled Tropicana. What a GREAT weekend! Between the Hotel Suite and Casino amenities to the Fine dining and overall hospitality; my stay was way more than I expected. I truely look forward to coming back and have shared my experience with my friends. Fantastic Fantastic Time and Experience! Can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Penthouse quite nice!”
Reviews.Author: davis237
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights again at the Trop after 2 nights at Skylofts (just like last trip). I was offered through a host 2 comp nights in the club spa suite, with my bro getting 2 nights in a regular room. I gotta say that although i love the new decor, they really must do something with their check-in process. I was there at noon (early, yes) and understood that something might not be ready by then and had no prob with it. However, after being told numerous times that i would be called, i had to go back at 5pm with still no call. I think they could tell that i was beyond perturbed, and the nice desk clerk went into the back and apparently called someone because i all of a sudden had a room ready. Well, lo and behold, when i got to the room it was one of their gorgeous penthouses! Don't know if the clerk called my host (which admittedly i should have done in the first place), but man was that nice! Don't recall having a hot tub with a shallow end....I was there the last day before they announced the Nikki Beach split, which was interesting. Kind of liked their little restaurant by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful remodel”
Reviews.Author: tom1954sea
Reviews.Content: from the time you walk in the trop.its just beautiful.. white floors glistening,everything spotless its eye candy..the rooms when you walk in are inviting gorgeous colors that are very well coordinated. Casino busy but not over crowded, Cafe NIKKI over rated!!

Reviews.Title: “We'd stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: kyslota
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Vegas for a friend's wedding. They were already booked to stay at the Tropicana, so we checked out the pricing and location and thought we would give it a shot. I'm so glad we did because the hotel was truly amazing and we had a fabulous time! Room - Very spacious, clean, comfortable bed, good view of the Strip. Didn't hear any street noise. Large bathroom. Casino - We didn't go to gamble so I can't really comment. Location - I thought we were in the perfect spot. We walked everywhere! The hotel smells of suntan lotion, which is really neat. I'm pretty sure we stayed in Paradise Tower. Check-in was smooth. When we checked out the computers were down (they were even down at the airport), so I'm sure check-out is normally pretty fast as well.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully Remodeled Hotel, Great Bargain!”
Reviews.Author: kramerica21
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Tropicana knowing it was newly remodeled. Great job to Tropicana! The pool was closed which was a disappointment seeing as we paid almost a $20 resort fee for no resort. The casino was very small and empty. The room was awesome, except for the bathroom which didn't look like it was part of the remodel. I'm only 5'5'' and I could barely fit under the shower head. If you're tall, this is not the place to take a shower. My 6'1'' boyfriend basically had to sit to take a shower. The room was a smoking room and did not smell of smoke. Great big TV, great views, and comfortable memory foam bed! I would recommend this hotel to my shorty friends. You tall ones might want to find other accommodations if showering is important to you.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay !!”
Reviews.Author: nats-dk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tropicana this month for a week to get married. We had 22 guests and the value for money was absolutely fantastic. Nicole Marshall gave a great deal. The rooms were fab and we got a free suite upgrade. Good size, nice bathroom and great views. The casino was not as crowed as some of others, and it whole place had a nice bright and clean feel. All our guests absolutely loved it, and will stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Radar, clean-kitsch-Vegas Casino/Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeanne654
Reviews.Content: THis was my husband and my favorite place to gamble on the strip. We stayed at Luxor, but preferred the Tropicana. And, we were immediately attracted to it's outside appearance when we stopped by via the shuttle from the airport. It was very clean and they had really good circulation inside so it didn't feel musty in the inside. This casino seemed like a perfect kitsch-Vegas Experience but still being really clean at the same time. Next time I go back, I will book at the Tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “They are "Changing Everything"”
Reviews.Author: BackinNY
Reviews.Content: When I think of the Trop in Vegas, I think of one old hotel. But I needed something close to the airport and on the strip, so I followed TA reviews and stayed here for a quick one-night stay. They really are changing everything and the price was right. Rooms are huge compared to newer hotels but they have been completely redone. Other than an old door knob on the bathroom door, it was hard to tell this was an old room. The decor of the hotel is somewhat "clean/spartan" so if you're looking for glitz, this is not for you. We ate in the hotel's Italian restaurant, which was OK, not great.
