But we were tired and wanted something quick.

Reviews.Title: “The Trop is the Top!”
Reviews.Author: KLBill
Reviews.Content: After reading the previous reviews on Trip Advisor, I contacted Nicole Marshall to book a room for Veteran's Day Weekend. Nicole Marshall made sure we had a top notch room for an unbeatable rate-and we even were able to check in early! We were excited to discover the reviews were accurate! We loved our newly remodeled, modern room with the view of the Strip. It is clear that CUSTOMER SERVICE is a priority at the Trop- everyone we encountered or asked for assistance met our needs with a genuine smile on their face. What I loved most about the Trop is the intimacy of the setting-it is a relatively small resort that is bright and clean as a whistle. What I found refreshing was it appeared that they are loyal to their longtime employees as many of the beautiful cocktail servers were my age- what some might call "mature"- a nod to the value of experience and constancy. My only concern during our stay was our room had a shared adjoining door- and I could clearly hear the gentleman next door coughing. Next time I would request a non-adjoining room. We have already spread the word about our stay to friends and family. Even though there are many lovely hotels on the Strip, we will definitely schedule our next LV stay at the Trop!

Reviews.Title: “tropical paradise”
Reviews.Author: cassimocoatbridge
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in the Tropicana, and we were very impressed. The hotel is very bright and airy, with a lovely smell of coconut throughout.Our room was fantastic. Large and bright with modern and tastefull decor. Beds very comfortable. We were in the building at back of pool area, so it was quite a walk to get to front of hotel, however there was some shops to see on the way, and a couple of restaurants, so it didn't seem so bad. The pool and gardens are beautiful, with lots of sunbeds. We never had time to relax there as we only had 3 days to see all of Vegas.! All in all, after looking at the other hotels nearby, I think the Tropicana beats them all. So many were dull and dreary, with the exception of all the very big ones of course(Venetian, Bellagio etc..).We loved going back to our oasis, and would recommend it .

Reviews.Title: “Newly remodeled, now a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel074
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Tropicana for 3 nights. We wanted to be at that end of the strip (it is near MGM, NY NY, Excalibur) because we were going to the Las Vegas Invitational Bball tournament at the Orleans (cheaper cab). I was hesitant to book at 1st because the price was so low compared to other hotels in the same location but after reading a few reviews on TA, we booked. Although the ceiling in the casino is low, which is odd after going to other casinos, the entire area has been redone and looks great. I can't compare to the old but my husband said it was a definite improvement. Check in was a breeze and off to our room we went. We were on the 8th floor and were able to get a king bed, which is what I wanted. Although I asked if the room had a view and was told the double bed rooms have the view, king bed rooms look at airport. Ok, no big deal about the view since we wouldn't be in the room too much anyway. Our room was clean and nice. Flat screen tv, desk area, plantation shutters. The bathroom was ok. Seemed they may have skimped or skipped redoing the bathroom, but again it was clean. We had a non-smoking room and it seemed to be a real non-smoking room. We did have a view of the airport but never heard any noise (we even had the windows cracked). All in all, a great hidden gem especially for the price. I would consider staying at this hotel again. The bad: the a/c was terrible. We had it down to 60 and still had to open the windows as it seemed very stuffy and warm in our room. I didn't call b/c w/the window open it was tolerable. I did, however, mention to the front desk at check out and I am pretty certain the information went no further. The bathroom, as I mentioned didn't seem it was updated. The tub/shower is weird. It is at an angle and every time one of us showered there was water on the floor no matter how the shower curtain was placed. Although they have plantation type shutters, the room wasn't the typical pitch black room that I have stayed in while in Vegas. The sun was peaking thru the shutters no matter the directions we put them. To consider: as with most hotel rooms in Vegas, it seems they are miles from the front desk and this is no exception. Although we don't mind walking, it was long walk from the front desk. The good: price, clean, never had to wait for an elevator, quiet, Starbucks

Reviews.Title: “A second home in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: marie_delaroche
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an exciting hotel, filled with exquisite restaurants and great shows, this hotel IS NOT for you. However, the Tropicana was, for my boyfriend and I, just like a second home in the city of Las Vegas. The small gambling area and the lack of entertainment inside the hotel make it a much quieter place, perfect if you are just looking for a place to sleep! The room was very nice and clean and the bed was so comfortable! We had the best nights of sleep! And a very comforting smell of vanilla floats all around the hotel. The staff was always very professional. There are porters 24/7, which gives it a VIP touch. Located right on the strip, you cannot find a best bang for your buck!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel and location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Andy G
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Las Vegas and stayed at the Tropicana in late October. I had been to Las Vegas several times but it was my wife's first visit. The Tropicana was the perfect choice for us. The hotel is on the south portion of the Strip, close enough to the action to far away enough from the mid-Strip to escape. The hotel itself is bright and airy, not dark and smoky like other Vegas hotels and casinos. The room itself is beautiful, with the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in. We had a strip view room with a great view of the MGM Grand and New York New York hotels. There was even a small palm tree in the room, which was important to my wife because for her palm trees mean vacation!! The service at the Trop was fantastic, starting with the way Nicole Marshall took care of us before we even arrived. The staff was attentive, accommodating and friendly from the moment we arrived until the moment of our departure. When we return to Las Vegas, we will absolutely return to the Trop. It gets five stars from us!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel looks brand new”
Reviews.Author: Flyguy05
Reviews.Content: First time staying at the Tropicana since its remodel. I had friends stay here before and was told that the rooms were really nice. The only place i had seen before was the Casino floor (which is relatively small), walked thru the pool area (and it was amazing(i never did go in though since it was closed this time around)). Lets' see, arrived at around 130ish-2pm, tried to check in but rooms weren't available, left my cell number and got a call about 20minutes later. 2nd room still wasn't available but took first room to drop off items(room wasn't what was requested got a King bed instead of 2 queens/double). Returned to check-in counter and was moved down two floors to the 3rd floor (not much to view from the 3rd floor, but i didn't care for it). Tropicana has a tub so perfect for those looking to have a bath, TV was a plasma with a very good amount of channels (unlike other Hotel/Casino rooms). Casino level although small (like i mentioned) it was had a great vibe to it, music, cocktail waitress coming quite often (at tables) dealers hmm... not the most cheerful, but i didn't bother, I liked just being there playing... All in all, Tropicana although expensive VERY WELL WORTH IT!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice after redecorating”
Reviews.Author: JDJ2050
Reviews.Content: we stayed the last part of our holiday on the top floor. The jacuzzi in the bedroom was awesome and the service outstanding. They really listen and act on that.

Reviews.Title: “Non-smokers look elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: macgrej68
Reviews.Content: I read lots of reviews before picking this hotel, but didn't see any mention of the smoking. They have a smoking floor as well as all the smoke from the casino area, and our room on the 4th floor was not far enough away to breathe clean air. We were moved to the 14th floor when I asked them to clean the heater and bathroom filters to try to make it better- a definite improvement. The rooms were much more basic than any hotel I have stayed in; I really appreciated the Holiday Inn I stayed at a few days later! Not even a coffee pot in the room! The computers for guest use were not working, also. A resident of Las Vegas said she heard they were having financial problems. The staff, however, were helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Robert S
Reviews.Content: This hotel was Awsome! The Tropicana has Great new rooms, Great shops and restaurants, a Cool Casino, Fantastic pool and hot tubs, Great Guest Services and more! Located right at the beginning of the Vegas Strip, this hotel was right where we wanted to be! Not to crazzy and noisy, we were able to see and do everything and get everywhere right from our hotel. And because we booked our trip a few months in advance we were able to get an outstanding deal on the price! I dont think there is a better place to stay in Vegas. We had so much fun! and Can't wait to return! :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Paju19
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at the Tropicana. The staff were all friendly, no queues at check in or check out and small issue with room safe resolved within 10 minutes of call to housekeeping. An adjustment was made to our final bill re the resort fee without any hassle as when we booked the resort fee was quoted at $9.99 but the charge on the bill was for the current rate of $14.99. For those like us that are unfamiliar with USA style showers we could not get it to work and all we needed to do was to pull out the control handle away from the wall. The location of the hotel worked well being on the strip and near several other larger hotels and near the start of the monorail. The casino whilst small had all we needed including 2 bars, restaurants and a good selection of slots and tables. We will definitely be booking again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Trop!!”
Reviews.Author: bhoysRus
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed here in early September '11. We had spent ages picking out our hotel for our first trip to Vegas. I work for a major hotel chain so I am always really picky when it comes to hotels. We wanted a reasonably priced, nice hotel. We didn't want to spend a fortune on a hotel, as it would give us more spending money on the casino floors! We got exactly that, and so much more. The hotel is literally minutes from the airport, so after almost 28 hours travelling (thanks to hurricane Irene) we were thankful of such a short journey. Arriving at the Trop, we were greeted by the amazing smell they pump through the AC. Whenever I smell coconut now, I am reminded about the great time in Vegas. Check in was a breeze, and as we booked direct with the hotel we were able to use the VIP line. Then the room! OMG! It was amazing. I had a paradise suite on the 22nd (I think) floor. It was a corner suite, with stunning views on three sides of the hotel. The room was massive!!! It had a huge living area with big flatscreen Tv, fridge and coffee maker. The separate bedroom area had another huge flatscreen and quite possibly the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in! Truly couldn't wait to get in at the end of the day and didn't want to get out in the morning! We gambled some on the casino floor, I lost loads but other members of the party were a good bit richer by the end of the trip. We didn't eat in any of the restaurants but had pizza at the small diner place on the ground floor, great value and fed us well. Pool area was nice, had a look but didn't stay long as we weren't in Vegas to lounge by a pool! Location was good. It is at the south end of the strip and most places could be walked to, however the monorail at MGM just across the street is always handy. Every member of staff we spoke to all were great. We also contacted Nicole Marshall prior to our arrival and she went out her way to make sure our stay was as great as possible. She even sorted out some comp tickets for Brad Garret as we were celebrating an occasion while in the hotel. It was an amazing night. We also went to the Mob Experience. I had doubts about this but thoroughly enjoyed it! Great fun and the ending was a good laugh! We stayed for 5 nights and it genuinely made our Vegas experience even better. I would not hesitate to go back to the Tropicana. Truly a beautiful oasis in the middle of the madness of Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price, right on the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: RockDoc666
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine for those who are passing through Vegas, and don't fancy a branded or themed holiday. Five minutes walk to New York New York and the MGM and the themed attractions there, and convenient for attractions on the south end of the Strip. The decor is up to date, rooms are clean and comfortable, and staff are helpful. Dining options in the hotel are limited - a small deli, ice cream place, Starbucks and a couple of small restaurants - but the latter were closed on the evenings we were there. Starbucks is fine for grabbing a breakfast snack, more hefty breakfasts can be found at adjacent hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice stay !!!”
Reviews.Author: Rickster99
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect, people are friendly. I had water on the floor from the air conditioning and the offer me comp for the inconvenient. very nice pool, music is very load from the other side (the private club) Have fun !!

Reviews.Title: “It may seem cold at first but wonderful rooms and restaurants!”
Reviews.Author: felix1098
Reviews.Content: We had a late night flight and decided to book at room for the day so we could have a home base..(hate those late night flights!). We attended the comedy show a few nights before and were not impressed with the casino area...it seemed lacking in warmth as far as the ambiance was concerned. On our last day we spent about 8 hours there and we were delighted with the rooms...beautifully decorated in almost a euro/tropical style...the mattresses were high quality Serta, space roomy and bathrooms well appointed...we had dinner at the steakhouse and it was excellent...all in all i would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and it will certainly be our choice on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay, the all new Tropicana in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Allipete
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Tropicana Hotel in Las Vegas twice within the last year, what a great place to stay. The hotel was recently remodeled and the beds were very comfy. The hotel staff was very nice, the hotel itself was very, very clean and I love the smell of coconut in the air. The air conditioner in the casino was very cold which was great and the bar service and staff were excellent. I look forward to my next stay at the Tropicana which will be within the next 6 months!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely clean hotel for 1st trip to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: gigidygigidygoo
Reviews.Content: Lovely room on the 7th floor. We had breakfast room service which was lovely. Nice big comfy bed. No tea/coffee facilities in room though but to be expected. Next to MGM. Booked on a flash deal on hotels.com @ £20 per night so can't complain! Free parking ! Would book this hotel again next time we come to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel that over met my expection”
Reviews.Author: ArielUndertheSea
Reviews.Content: I was very amazed how nice and beautiful this hotel transformed into. We stayed at a delux room at the Paradise Tower and I was pleased on the decor of this place, it's got a Bahama feel to it. The bedding is very comfortable and I enjoyed the look of the white window shutters, instead of the usual curtains. The tree in the room adds a nice tropical touch.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but little frills”
Reviews.Author: Flint5oh
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Tropicana Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas, NV. The hotel has had a recent remodel (about 2 years ago) and the result is a nice, clean asain style hotel and casino. Our room was clean and simply decorated, which we liked. The bathroom was nice but the lighting was not that great. The light switch was also located in an odd area, making you have to walk almost all the way into the bathroom before you could turn the light on. Other than that the room was pretty nice. The casino was clean and well lighted. There was not a lot of scratching or wear and tear in the elevators or the casino area. Most important to us, the ventelation system was pretty good and we didn't have to smell the cigerette smoke from all the smokers. There was two places to eat in the hotel. A nice steak and seafood place with somewhat higher prices and a beach style cafe with a decent selection and decent prices. We were used to hotels with lots of places to eat and lots to do and we simply didn't experience that at Tropicana. We found ourselves leaving the hotel for a couple meals just for a better selection.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana for comfort!”
Reviews.Author: jphcmt
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at this newly renovated hotel and are so pleased that we chose it. Comfort for the guests seems to have been very high on the agenda when remodelling and the beds are really top notch. You don't get to sleep a whole lot in Vegas so when you do finally 'hit the hay' you need to make the most of it! The position on the Strip is so central for getting around to visit all the themed hotels and shows and the service was excellent. All in all we are delighted we opted for the Tropicana and would definitely stay again. Only regret is that there is no kettle or coffee machine in the rooms but that is probably the norm in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: bassoon1
Reviews.Content: Had a good stay except for the issue with noise. We asked for a quiet room, and we got a room in the Paradise tower-which is right on the strip and not at all quiet. We asked for another "quiet" room and the gave us a room in the back tower. We got a room facing the strip and the views were great but much more quiet. A 5 minute walk, but it was worth the walk to get a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: HD83
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel to stay and play at .We were lucky enough to win a trip to Vegas and stayed at the Tropicana in Las Vegas .The staff were great this hotel has just gone through a renovation and they did a great job .Staff great asked for a room change got it right away no problem .Lots of places in the hotel to spend your money nice pool area ,Fancy places to eat in the hotel but a little steep for me ,pizza was good .This hotel is on the Vegas strip and in the heart of Vegas .Try this place you just might enjoy your self city is 24 hours a day open .

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Enjoy Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: VancouverRay
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Tropicana twice this year. The first time was over New Years and then at the end of May for the opening of the Nikki Beach Club. The hotel/casino has been transformed, the rooms are brand new and the city view is tough to beat. The buffet at Nikki Beach café is reasonably priced with a good variety. Dinner at Biscayne provided good service and food at prices better than many of the other steak houses on the strip. Dinner at Bacio was also very good. What stood out the most about both trips was the service. Staff was very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: nexttrip5
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by very picky friends. It's bright, airy, spacious & clean (which is very important to me). The staff were cleaning constantly - rugs, floors, glass, slot machines, bathrooms, etc. It has a nice smell when you walk in. I found the atmosphere refreshing; most of the hotels are dark, smoky, and oppressive. Our room was very spacious with a nice view of the pool and strip. The pool is amazing! The staff was very friendly and attentive. One lady coming in off her break even ran back to open the door for us. We asked for more towels and they were delivered within 10 minutes. You never have to wait for an elevator. The restaurants are very nice. We stayed last year at one of the mega resorts mid-strip and our stay here was much nicer. Good job Tropicana; we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “its the best”
Reviews.Author: cas j
Reviews.Content: stayed at the trop for three nights,and considering i could have paid £100 each to upgrade for me and my wife to stay at treasure island,the trop was brilliant.everything was perfect,including the pool!rooms were first class,bathrooms lovely.staff excellent.best wishes to denise,who kept us in booze while we gambled.we have no problems giving this hotel top marks

Reviews.Title: “Improved casino but disappointing trip”
Reviews.Author: davnic36
Reviews.Content: The casino, although small has been nicely rennovated. We stayed in the Grand Tower and although the bedroom had been renovated, i don't think the bathroom had been, we were missing a light fitting (more on that later) and it looked tired. The pool area was nice but many of the sun loungers were damaged in one way or another. Check in was efficient and rates were reasonable but beware of the resort fee $14.99 per day. Now back to that light fitting, when I returned home I was charged $140 for the missing light fitting plus a chair that I have since worked out was never in my room to begin with. After a week of emails and complaining I have been reimbursed for the items but have not recieved any form of apology from the Tropicana. I would have probably rated the hotel higher if it had not been for this inconvenience when I got home. Moral of the story, carry out an inventory of what is in your room when you arrive, or they might just charge you for it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 10Ian
Reviews.Content: I think this is one of the nicest hotels to stay in Vegas, friendly staff, newly renovated and very comfortable. The hotel was very clean and rooms were of a high standard. Foodn in the Nikki cafe was of a high standard and reasonably priced. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “ANNIVERSARY TRIP 23/10/2011”
Reviews.Author: PAULGOLUS
Reviews.Content: our stay at the tropicana hotel was fantastic ,the rooms were big and clean and the bed was so comfortable, in the hotel and corridors you always have this smell of coconut in the air,the staff were so freindly and cheerful, the hotel is in the right place on the strip to get to other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “BEST NEW CASINO IN VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: TREVI36
Reviews.Content: The old Famous Tropicana is Brand New. Completely remodeled and very tastefully done. Not gaudy or weird like ARIA. The Tropicana lightened up the casino by putting a lot of white which stops that old dark Mafia feeling you used to get in casinos. The Staff cannot be any nicer from the cocktail waitresses to the check in staff to the baggage handlers to the restaurant staff. (Unlike Mandalay Bay which couldn't have been any more rude) Speaking of restaurant, Cafe Nikki has EXCELLENT food. It's a quiet place at night and it paid out in slots consistantly more than any of the other 12 casinos we were in. Rooms are nice and large, prices are good and no smoke smell (my favorite part). It's near many other casinos on the strip with easy access to escalators and elevators and a walkway to MGM. No matter which casino we went to in this part of town, we ended up spending more time back in Tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “A Good experience”
Reviews.Author: TTZulu
Reviews.Content: Neat Rooms, Good ambience, Friendly staff. Reasonably priced - and if lucky, you can get great deals on Expedia. Only downside is if you are staying in the Club tower, its a LONG walk to your room. Its on the south side of the Strip - but u can use the Deuce buses to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy C
Reviews.Content: I think that this is the best hotel for the money in Las Vegas! It has been renovated and the rooms were lovely, clean, comfortable and nice size. The staff was very friendly, always pleasant and willing to help you at all times. I have stayed in much more expensive hotels and not had service this good. We ate at Nikki Cafe - the food was excellent and price was very reasonable - especially the morning breakfast buffet. You can not beat it for the money or the service! We were there for five days and our server actually recognized us and was ready with my juice as soon as I sat down. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend!

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: Richard M
Reviews.Content: Our stay at theTropicana was excellent. The Tropicana just has a very comfortable feeling as soon as you walk in the lobby. The hotel staff were great. There is a rental car service on the property which is perfect for getting out a while. We have stayed at several different hotels on the strip over time, but after staying at the Tropicana, we do not see ourselves staying anyplace else.

Reviews.Title: “First time Vegas traveler”
Reviews.Author: stressedoutMichigan
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel that has been nicely renovated. They have a great ventilation system, always smells like vanilla! Hotel is very bright and airy. Hotel staff is wonderful, along with the ladies bringing our drinks on the casino floor. I would suggest bringing your own bath and shampoo/conditioner. The hotel could use a real upgrade in this area. After 4 days, my hair was like straw and skin was so itchy and dry due to poor quality in this area. I didn't bring mine from home as most nicer hotels have better quality product for their guests. Takes up too much room and weight in my suitcase. My other complaint is there is no in room coffee. Have to go down stairs to Starbucks, wait in line with all the people attending conferences in the large banquet rooms. Sorry, I was in my jammies. Also, it doesn't open until 7:00, I walked thru the casino floor in my jammies to get to the other Starbucks that is open 24 hours. Come on! I realize they want us out of our rooms and gambling, but it's coffee! Hotel is located near the end of the strip, did a lot of walking, but it was fun! Never ate at the hotel, too many interesting places to go. Had a great time, but next trip we are staying on Freemont Street!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Gary H
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrrived to the moment we left we were treated exceptionally well. We were greeted on arrival and check in was swift. Our room was amazing with a city view. The staff were more than friendly and made the stay a pleasure. The total refurb WORKED We are currently looking at returning to our "TROP" next year to enjoy more fun and games :) Gary and Carol

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Lesley30040
Reviews.Content: We were shocked by the amazing value of this hotel. The room was huge and offered every amenity possible. The location is directly on the Strip; the rooms were spotless and the beds were comfortable! We couldn't ask for anything more.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Spidertravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Tropicana for 5 days and it was outstanding value! We stayed in the Paradise Tower and the room was very spacious. The hotel had all the facilities that anyone going to Vegas will need - restaurants, coffee shop, gym, lounges, room was always clean, staff was friendly, etc. The pool area is probably one of the best in Vegas and is worth spending time at - it is a big area with a large pool area and is very beautifull. The hotel is on the strip and if you look on a map it might look as if it is far to walk up the strip. Maps are deceiving as we never used our car and easily walked to Treasure Island and back. Will definately stay here again! Note: we found it not worthwile taking the monorials (only used it once!) as it was at the back of the hotels and it did not save any time. Only usefull if you want to miss the tourists walking on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: #1METSFAN
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Tropicana. The hotel has had a transformation from when I was there 2 years ago. If you remember the dingy,old, and ugly tropicana from a few years ago; Forget it because that hotel has been replaced by a beautiful 4 to 5 star resort. he customer service is second to none,in my opinion,and it is overall the best hotel I have stayed in in Las vegas. Check-in was speedy and they even checked us in early and gave us an upgraded strip view room in the Club tower. Every staff member that we encountered was so nice. Special thanks to car valet Billy Gillbride, who was so knowledgable about Vegas and helped us with valuable info. Another thanks goes to the drink hostess in the Sports Book named Nicole. How she is able to stay so pleasant after what seemed like a 10 hour shift,is beyond me.She was there in the sportsbook all day Sunday for football and her pleasant attitude and service was great. Finally I need to thank Nicole Marshall for filling my requests upon arrival. She is a great customer service manager and an asset.The only drawback was due to the weather (60-70 degrees)the pool is closed. It looks fabulous and would have been great to use it. In closing, if you choose the tropicana for your next vacation,you will not be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Optometry Conference well worth it!!”
Reviews.Author: Amy K
Reviews.Content: We had our conference at the Tropicana for an entire week and I did not have any problems with the hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was always clean and neat each day. We had hundreds of doctors sitting in on lectures and the rooms were great. Other than being chilly, which was adjusted later at the end of the week, I have no complaints. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Mau151
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my wife and brother to attend SEMA Expo. The room and hotel were very nice, quiet and had great view of MGM and New York New York. Just in the beginning of The Strip. The Casino is OK, but really I am not interested in gaming. Good hotel for staying in Las Vegas. Beds and pillows were very good, repairing after 5 days walking at the Expos.

Reviews.Title: “Newly remodeled rooms a nice surprise”
Reviews.Content: We hadn't stayed in the Tropicana for years, so were pleasantly surprised by the comfort and style of our standard room in the Club Tower. The modern/tropical furnishings were complemented by tasteful dark red and tan decor. The room wasn't large, but was quiet and comfortable. Furniture felt sturdy. The flat screen TV had a great picture. The bed was comfortable and had quality bedding. The room was quiet. We never had to wait for the elevator. There was a free small safe. The radio/clock had an iPod dock. The bathroom had a nice sink and large tub/shower. There was no refrigerator, microwave, or coffee maker. The only negative was that the carpet had a couple stains and could have benefited from a shampoo. While not in the same league as the luxury hotels in Vegas, it was a good value and we had a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the "Trop"”
Reviews.Author: Steve E
Reviews.Content: Booked our room (a Suite) over the phone, took about 5 minutes and that was after a lot of questions from me. Arrived at the hotel and was immediately taken care of by the check in staff. We even arrived a little before noon and our room was ready and waiting. First time staying in a suite and it was wonderful!! The room was clean and very inviting. We can't say enough about the remodeling, VERY nice!! The staff is top notch. Called down for an extra blanket and within 5 minutes they were at our door. Gambling at the "Trop" is so much nicer than other casinos! It is brighter, cleaner and the dealers are friendlier!! We played mostly craps and every person working was friendly, funny and helpful! We will definitely be going back to the Tropicana again!!!

Reviews.Title: “So much fun!”
Reviews.Author: Graciela N
Reviews.Content: There were 6 of us traveling this trip. I had stayed at the Tropicana in 1994 and had not returned until this year. From the minute we walked in the lobby doors to the wonderful aroma we were not let down. We were so excited about the bright new ambiance in the hotel and the beautiful rooms that we had. The service from Valet, Check in and through out our one week stay was over the top! The staff was friendly, helpful and always available. The rooms were clean and the food was good. We travel to Vegas about 6 times a year, and this year the Tropicana was our favorite casino and hotel. See you in January! G. from Denver

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas !”
Reviews.Author: Robert B
Reviews.Content: One of the better casinos and hotels in the city of lost wages. Staff is very attentive, and the comps unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: spsch
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay here based on reasonable rates and good reviews. We asked for a location away from the casino, based on other reviews, not realizing there are 2 towers with the second one a bit of a walk from the casino and the strip, so not so convenient. But the room was nice and quiet. The staff were friendly and helpful and the bacio restaurant really good (will review that separately). I do wish they had a smoke-free area in the casino; if there was one, we didn't see it and if you sit down to play and someone starts smoking, there's nothing you can do but get up and leave.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, the toilet could swallow a dead horse!”
Reviews.Author: hanleyster
Reviews.Content: Location: A+, close to the airport, terminal of the monorail, right on the strip. Took a 5 minute limo ride from the airport for 10$ a head ($80) total for our group. Check in: Went fairly quickly, we couldn't all get the same floor but who cares. We couldnt check in yet since it was too early so they just called us when our room was ready. Room: No big complains with the room, pretty standard but with a tropical feel to it. Things that we didnt like were the lack of coffee/tea/fridge in the room. They don't like people being independent of restaurants in this city. Bed was super comfy, TV is a 40" LG with inputs. There is a nice couch thing to sit on. Great view if you open your window, otherwise its hard to see out of the window because it has a screen on it sort of like a microwave. The bathroom was a good size. Normal tub, good water pressure, toilet could swallow a dead horse. You wont be in the room much, but when you do it will be comfy, quiet and relaxing. Casino: Again, great for your first trip. Pretty quiet, large enough to play any type of game. Didn't fee like you would waste anyone's time learning how to play a game. Low ceiling so its pretty smokey though.. Club Nikki: Cool club, very uh.. "urban" the night we went. Saw a free MJ actor though so that was sweet. The bouncer denied a girl that wanted to get in without an ID, and he said "Yeah well you look like your 50 but you still need an ID" when she said she was 35. The general store by the front doors sells 24oz cans of beer for 4$ which was a great deal considering the bar around the corner sells a 12oz bottle for $7 and you can drink either anywhere. Leaving the hotel is easy, there are bridges to walk over to Excalibur, mgm, ny ny, luxor etc. We rented a Camaro SS for $110 which was an awesome way to see the city. All in all I would probably stay next time at NY NY just because its so cool inside and out, but this was a great "Vegas 101" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: ReneeHB
Reviews.Content: Excellent value and ideal location, heart of the strip. Tropicana is well on their way to a fully remodeled hotel. While curb appeal is classic Vegas, You will be pleasantly surprised with the clean updated, nicely decorated rooms. Two new dining venues, outstanding! I had a blast at Club Nikki, The club layout is perfect, great DJ, we had two surprise guests the night I was there, sweet!!! Club Management and servers very accommodating, we reserved a table and it was VIP all the way. And yes, they do have a full service Starbucks!

Reviews.Title: “disappointment of an old friend”
Reviews.Author: ROCKO01
Reviews.Content: have always stayed at this hotel, we go to Vegas every year, we were there in march and I complained because the electrical problem with the bedside lamp, it did not work, after the renovations. I was asked by the hotel what they could do to make my next trip better. All I asked for was a coffee pot in my room, as we were coming back in October, was told this would be waiting for me in my room. Needless to say was disappointed again I had to ask for a coffee pot to be brought to the room. We have always had excellent service at this hotel, by the staff and they were great again, we barely got to the room and the coffee pot was brought in. we like the front tower "Paradise" as it brings you right to the front of the hotel, onto the casino floor and right beside the lobby. Easy access to the strip. The renovations are nice and completed now, but not worth double the price.

Reviews.Title: “not your Dads Trop”
Reviews.Author: douglas b
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tropicana for first time and was so surprised. Not only did we have a great time but the hotel has improved so much the rooms are great. All have been remodeled. the service was incredible. everyone in the hotel was super friendly and the niteclub when they get done with name change will be one of the hotspots. We also ate at the Italian restaraunt and it was excellent and not overpriced. And if you are going to a concert at the MGM the Trop is perfect to stay at. Dont think I will stay anywhere else

Reviews.Title: “Nicely remodeled Property”
Reviews.Author: Tates001
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Trop in Oct. for a long weekend and was really suprise on how they have upgraded their property. The rooms were really nice. We stayed in the Paradise Tower and was much bigger than expected. They were very clean and roomy. The people on the casino floor and all service personal were really pleasant and helpful. Really enjoyed my stay and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Problem with room key”
Reviews.Author: matrixgord
Reviews.Content: I took my husband to Las Vegas for 3 days to celebrate for his birthday. Checking in was easy, staff was helpful - one problem...our room key did not work..we went down, got new keys - they worked. After going out, we returned to find our door was unlocked. They immediately send up a locksmith to fix it. But, the problem persisted. On the last night, the security who came up to check on our call , got on the phone asking the Front Desk to do something for our trouble. They offered a Suite for the rest of our stay-nice- but we were leaving in the morning so they comped our stay to half price. The key problem was a nuisance, but the Tropicana staff always reacted quickly to our request to fix it. I liked that...plus, the Tropicana Casino always paid out better for us, than at any other Hotel Casino. If we go back to Las Vegas, we'll most likely stay at the Tropicana again as it was very clean, nice rooms, nice staff, good location, great pool, and good paying slots.

Reviews.Title: “return to vegas 2011”
Reviews.Author: natural1966
Reviews.Content: well we were excited about returning to the tropicana despite such a hassle booking it,the reservation staff made it so much more complicated than it was.Nicole the customer service manager actually stepped in after a rather irate phone call from me and sorted everything out. We arrived and were waved straight over to breeze check-in as we were booked under that. The check-in lady (I forget her name now) was very abrupt,and downright rude when we were told we still owed money on the 3 rooms we had booked,(despite us showing her an email that the account was settled in full),after me getting a bit annoyed she rolled her eyes at the manager and he took over and very quickly realised it was a reservations error not ours. He was very polite and apologised,but the lady just stood there..arms folded and looked like she had chewed a wasp. After all the hassle we were given our rooms and they were fabulous,nicole had looked after us and given us rooms with a lovely view and in the paradise tower. we were told we would have a fridge delivered later that day,but it never materialised and I really didnt want to hassle Nicole so we went the whole stay without one(10 days). it was so lovely smelling the coconut again and most of the staff were very friendly.housekeeping were great,the valets especially thomas were superb and we always got our car promptly,(maybe because we tipped well!!!). the pool was FREEZING!!!!.even colder than the year before and it was ok after a while but please heat it. the chairs were in very poor condition but ive noticed from previous reviews they have been replaced. club nikkis music was way too loud and drowned out the great music by the regular pool,please be considerate to guests that want to relax and not be deafened by the constant thump thump thump. we are planning to return next year to renew our wedding vows and are hoping that we get much better service at the front desk than last time as we will be needing more rooms and a faultless wedding ceremony etc.... Im sure Nicole does her best to appease everyone but the front desk people certainly need to have some more lessons in politeness and customer care P.S...we did deal with another lady at the check in desks and she was lovely,so they arent all bad.

Reviews.Title: “Whats with all the scents?”
Reviews.Author: Falling_Ken
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights in Las Vegas at the Tropicana. . The renovations are a nice update as I remember the old Tropicana from a prior visit to town. If your scent sensitive, or have asthma issues, you will probably want to avoid most of Vegas. Seems everywhere we went, there was some strong air freshener scents always wafting through the air. Probably to try and cover the smell of all the old cigarette smoke. Check in went well, quickly accomplished and on our way to our room. we were oh the 14th floor of the club tower with a great view of the airport. Great because I like to watch the planes. Would be nice if the windows either opened more or they got rid of the white screening applied to the windows. would be nice to be able to really stop the light too, the slatted shutters are pretty, but they don't really stop enough light. Some good blinds would have been nice. The club tower was a bit of a problem with me too, as I have 2 rather bad knees and there is quite a hike to get to your room. The beds are great. Very comfortable. Wireless internet in the room was good but there were some issues with the television picture shredding while watching shows, but then again, who watches TV in Vegas The room was very quiet and clean and comfortable. The headroom is limited in the bathroom and the big corner shower tub. The shower head is mounted very low, making it a challenge for me to wash my hair. I managed to smack my head on the shower head 2 of the 3 mornings because I had to bend over to wash the shampoo out. The breakfast buffet in cafe Nikki was great. The fresh made while you wait omelets were excellent and well done, Definitely the highlight in an otherwise bland and flavorless dining experience for for all the other meals I ate in the other hotels buffets. If I come back to Vegas, I may stay here again, but there are other places to stay too. I my be back, but I may not. Guess time will tell

Reviews.Title: “Big improvement”
Reviews.Author: KenNY717
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Trop. The rooms have been updated with new carpet, beds, wallpaper. The bathrooms have been partially redone with some of the old fixtures still in use but OK. The common areas have also been done over and are fine. The casino is small and there are few $ 5 tables. The pool area has been redone also but there are many broken lounge chairs and the painted concrete around the pool is wearing off and appears dirty. The restaurants are great and reasonable if you get the discounts at the Tix booth. The price of $ 127/day plus $10 resort fee was fair becausse we were staying at the height of the season.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Las Vegas!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CorkBale
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tropicana for 3 nights between 30th October and 2nd November. Brilliant Hotel with friendly staff, beautiful rooms with gorgeous beds and view!! Great Location within walking distance of all the best attractions in Las Vegas. We checked out all the other hotels and casinos and both agreed that the Tropicana was the nicest and friendliest of them all!! The pool is also great and had no shortage of pool chairs while we were there!! Will definitely be staying in the Tropicana again and recommending it to all my friends and family and anyone else who asks! Six star rating.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT! Beds are fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: crileyteach
Reviews.Content: My very favorite beds to get a good nights sleep in. Cozy, lush sheets & pillows. Very roomy & love the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Egh. So so. Will stay else where next time.”
Reviews.Author: breezy34
Reviews.Content: My first interaction was over the phone. I had booked a groupon special with Tropicana. VERY friendly phone operators. They went above and beyond trying to help. However, my friend booked the same exact deal as I did. They linked her two two night stays together without a problem. My two night stays were not linked for some reason. After multiple calls, I was still never able to get them linked and had to deal with it the whole time. POSITIVES- clean, crisp rooms and linens. Very clean feeling. Good pool area. Lots of sun all day. They said it was remodeled from when I stayed 6 years ago, but it looked the same to me. Location on the strip is good. Easy access to the MGM, and nice view down the strip. NEGATIVES- Check in was the worst I have ever experienced. We stood in line after a long flight for over 45 minutes just to get to front desk. Yikes! At least offer a drink to all the people waiting patiently to make the time pass a little faster. Why only 2 desk agents when there is a HUGE line? Once we finally got to front, we never received an explanation or apology for the long wait. We never even got a smile. It was all buisness. Not a very welcoming feeling AT ALL. Bathrooms were NOT nice at all. Tub always looked dirty, and there were lots of broken tile every where. Not appealing for a newly remodeled place. The tub was super short. I'm only 5'6". I had to duck down to wash my hair all the way. Not sure how anyone taller does it?! Last of all, no black out curtains. Shutters looked nice, but they were not function able at all. The sun poured in all day. I will find another special to do next time, and will not be returning here. Mostly due to the unfriendly service we received.

Reviews.Title: “renovated trop a good deal”
Reviews.Author: clscott
Reviews.Content: I had a business meeting at this hotel and stayed for over a week. The rooms are completely redone-I was in a small suite and it was very spacious. The bathroom had a walk in shower and two separate sinks which is nice if you are sharing. The bed was great-very comfortable. I had a mini-fridge and a coffee pot, but no microwave and you couldn't even get one to rent. Too bad since I had leftovers and no way to heat them up. Nice flat screen TVs. The rate was great and the hotel staff was very friendly. It has a small casino and I did not try the restaurants there. The spa had not yet opened, but is slated to open this month and looked nice.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: Sandy B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Vegas 5 times and this was our 1st stay at the Tropicana,, but it won't be our last s tay here. Everything was great here. The rooms are spacous and clean. The restaurants in the hotel are all good (delicous). The casino is on the smaller side, but makes you feel you are playing at a Tropical Resort. The whole hotel is nicely decorated and the whole staff is very friendly and helpful.. The hotel has a great smell throughout of coconut. We are already looking forward to our trip next yr. Halloween is a great time to be in Vegas!! Hope you enjoy your stay as much as we did!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Fun Stay at the Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: franciss
Reviews.Content: My wife and a few friends were going to Havasupi and decided to stay in Vegas for a Night. We found the best priced room for a hotel on the strip was the tropicana resort. My wife and her friend picked the Hotel because of the price and they liked how the room looked on the web site. We were not disappointed. Our room was in the tower and had an incredible view overlooking the strip. The room was clean and the staff was very kind. The entire atmosphere seemed clean which is hard to come by in casinos. The pool was a another selling point that our wives looked foreword too but it was a little disappointing. It was very cold. They were happy with the lounging area however. The Gym was a little underwhelming but overall a great place to stay in vegas if you like feel clean and not bust the bank.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: HardCoreMom
Reviews.Content: Our trip was to the Grand Canyon, Sedona, Prescott, etc. and we only stayed here one night to catch a flight out of Vegas. We are not gamblers and don't really like the glitz of Vegas but wanted a comfortable room our last night of vacation. The rooms are nice and big, the bed is fabulously comfortable. The decor is classy tropical. The location is great, right on the strip by all of the big, goddy hotels and shopping if that is what you like to do. There were a lot of restaurants to choose from. I would definitely stay here again if I was into the Vegas stuff, or needed a place to stay to fly in and out of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Things better than our first time”
Reviews.Author: eke_brown
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year and the renovation wasn't complete. We stayed here again this year and the renovation was complete and things were really nice. We had a room on the 3rd floor and even though our view wasn't great (looked right out onto the roof of the Gladys Knight Theater), the room itself was fine. It was clean, quite, and met our needs perfectly. All the people who worked there were very helpful. It was a good deal for the money. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price.”
Reviews.Author: akakathleen
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a 5 star hotel, don't stay here. If you're looking for a good value for a nice room, this is it. Small casino but what I liked was the low minimum bets. Although none of us won any money in the casino. The Nikki cafe has good food and good prices for a casino restaurant. I didn't try the more expensive options in the casino. One complaint.....my sisters got there a day earlier than me and told the front desk that we were celebrating my 50th birthday and could they do something special? They said they would have strawberries and champagn in my room. I never saw either. When I checked out I mentioned it to the desk clerk and she was uninterested; she didn't even say "sorry."

Reviews.Title: “The "Trop" is back and better then ever!”
Reviews.Author: littleshellie
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to drop a line to tell you what a fabulous time I had at the Tropicana on my last visit (10/29 -11/02/11). My husband and I have been staying at the Trop. for at least the last 8-9 years, a couple of times per year, so have endured some of the inconvienences during their renovations. But I must say, they are back and better then ever! The room was comfortable and quiet, and the bed was so comfortable I almost did not want to get out of it (but had to since they brought back some of my favorite machines, that had been removed during the renovation). Housekeeping staff and people from the gift shop, all the way to the restaurants , were warm and friendly, and the desk staff were helpful as well. The waitress' are also pleasant, friendly, and timely (say hello to Kristen and Jonetta). So if you are ever in Vegas Baby, consider a stay at the Tropicana!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room for the Price”
Reviews.Author: JennDC28
Reviews.Content: Tropicana has been remodeled and the rooms are perfect! They don't have all the flash of the Wynn or Bellagio but they have everything you need in a hotel with room to spare. I stayed there for business but with their rates being as low as they are I would stay there for fun as well. The main part of the casino still leaves something to be desired which is why this rating isn't a full 5 but if you're going to go around the strip any way I highly suggest getting a great room for a greta price at the Tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean”
Reviews.Author: Cat_Stevens41
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on November 4 & 5. Front desk check in was extremely quick, and room was ready when we got there around 3 pm. The deluxe room I stayed in was big, clean and the bed was very comfortable. The TV was a nice larger size flat screen as well. I stayed in the Club Tower, and the room looked down at the Nikki Beach pool area. Nice view, but at night there are large lights pointed up at the towers to light them up, and I had to shut the blinds to be able to sleep. The casino floor is small but lively, and the sports book was great. That's where I made my money on the trip, so it was naturally my favorite part of the Tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “Just back from Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: punky1933
Reviews.Content: I met my son and is wife from Chicago to celebrate his 55th birthday over the past weekend....We have all stayed at many of the nice hotels on the strip and decided to try the Tropicana this time..We really have no complaints, except maybe the loud music in the casino at all times...Wish it had been a little softer and not blaring all the time...Maybe I'm showing my age...We arrived at about 2:00pm Friday and had an easy check-in, thanks to nice "MEL" and also Nicole Marshall whom I had contacted earlier...They were both so pleasant and made sure my son/wife were in a suite in honor of his birthday and their 30th Anniversary....I had a regular room and we were both in the Paradise Tower so it was handy. Nothing wrong with my room...It was clean and airy and the furniture was in good shape..I certainly have no complaints with the room or amenities of the hotel..We will certainly plan to stay there again on our next trip to Las Veas. The casino is small but you have the option to go to the larger casinos right around ...I didn't chose to, but my kids did and came back liking the smaller casino best. I would not hesitate to recommend this to anyone...Just give it a try and realize you are getting "alot of bang for your buck"....ENJOY.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Nicole S
Reviews.Content: We came to Vegas for the first time ever for our 10th Wedding anniversary, we did some research into hotels and were very excited to see what people said about the Tropicana online and that it was rated #16 out of 281 hotels, either the Tropicana are paying employees to go on and add these comments or people really have low expectations of what a good hotel is. #1. Check in took us around 20 minutes in line as they had one person on the desk, this person was not at all friendly, we were so excited to be there and felt disheartened when the lady gave us attitude. #2. When we got to our room, there was no hot water in the bathroom so we called to the front desk muliple times and did not get any answer. The bathroom we had in room 1559 was BADLY in need of a cleaning, there was mould in the grout the floor tiles were all cracked the filters in the ceiling and wall was very dirty and the toliet would barely flush. #3. The room has very bad circulation, if you took a shower the whole room got damp and would feel damp unless we opened the windows. #4. There is a very very long walk from the Club tower to the exit of the hotel with not a lot going on inbetween, we felt that we had to go out most of the time to eat because there is very LITTLE selection in places to eat. or thing to do, the shows are not the greatest and the hotel is very far south on the strip. After going into other hotels I would NEVER again stay at the Tropicana, it should not be rated #16 on here and I am not a very picky person at all. # 5. The cable kept coming and going after a long day out we are not partiers we would come back to relax and we couldn't even count on watching a show without it beng interupted. As I said before, my husband and I are not picky people and have stayed in much worse hotels than the Tropicana but have had better customer service than this. For those of you out there that would like an honest answer...the Tropicana should be rated somewhere in the 150 range, in my opinion. A few good things about our room, the beds were comfortable and the sheets were very nice. The hotel was quite and we were able to get good rest in the beds.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: divebunnyLondon
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here to celebrate my birthday and I have to say we had a wonderful time. The staff are superb ! The ones that really stood out for us were Terry from the front desk and David and Matthew from the Concierge desk. They realy are an asset to this hotel where nothing was too much trouble for them and they offered great, informative, friendly advise. The hotel location is perfect and the rooms are a good size, clean and comfortable (especially the beds !) In fact I cannot praise this hotel enough and will definitely be staying here next time I come to Vegas ! Hayley and Sarah, London

Reviews.Title: “South end of Strip”
Reviews.Author: Beaver25
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large and airy and although being at an intersection are quiet. The hotel has a lovely large pool although cafe, restaurant on site is a little expensive. It is sited right at the bottom of the stip but other casino's, hotels are easily reached by foot, bus or monorail. To the right of hotel there is Hooters which is very good value for meals and if you keep walking a few more minutes you come to the all American diner / bakery called Coco's which is excellent for breakfast. Only complaint there was no tea / coffee making facilities in room.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Overrated”
Reviews.Author: juhoney76
Reviews.Content: Based on numerous positive reviews I found on Tripadvisor and other online review sites, I decided to celebrate my wife's birthday at Tropicana. It was our first night out in almost three years - we have a 2 1/2 old twin daughters. So, we were really excited about our trip. Overall, the hotel wasn't so bad. However, the positive reviews I've been reading seem overrated. I stayed at room 1123 at Paradise Tower during the first week of November. The wait line at the check-in was ridiculous. When I arrived (4 p.m.), there were three people in front of me, and yet it took 30 minutes for someone to help me with check in. Anyways, we checked in to room 1123, located on the 11th floor overlooking south side of MGM Grand. The room did not feel spacious. The room was clean with simple tropical-themed decorations. Nothing special. I upgraded to City View room for $25 more but the view overlooking MGM was not spectacular. Of all the things that were renovated, the bathroom tiles were not remodeled. It looked dirty with lots of old stains. The bed was comfortable; however, two things kept us waking up at night - the noisy heater and lack of black out curtains. The plantation shutters looked nice but they kept letting mornight sunrays through our room. The heater, every time it would turn on, would make such a loud noise that it would wake us up. The hotel staff were not all that friendly as many reviewers said. They were not rude, but I didn't find them particularly friendly or nice. There were just doing their business. In addition, the hotel ceiling on the northern portion by a snack shop and a restroom (leading to 2-story motel structure) was so low that I felt claustophobic (and I'm 5-7). The ceiling was probably 6 foot and 2 inches high and anyone who's taller than that could not have made it. In addition, the hotel has a very small, I mean VERY SMALL casino! For the size of the hotel, the casino should have been at least three times bigge than its current size. I didn't want to play there. Other people probably thought the same - the casino was virtually empty on Sunday evening. One crap table - no players, one roulette table - no players. Four or five blackjack tables - some action there. Only about 20 people seemed to be playing the slots. The hotel guests appeared to be much older compared to other hotels in Vegas (average of 65-75 years old). Consequently, the cocktail waitresses were also older (60-70) wearing awkwardly revealing uniforms. I didn't want to see cleavage of someone who is older than my mom. I understand millions of dollars were spent on renovation. I seriously think that was a bad mistake. The hotel should have been demolished and rebuilt. There were many issues with the old hotel that could not have been resolved with renovations. I even joined Trop Players Card and participated in even the odds program. (I lost $70 and got $35 back) But I don't think I will come back to Tropicana. It's just not worth it. Even if I get a free room, I would pay and stay at other newer hotels. Overall, the hotel isn't terrible but I just wanted to inform people that if you are going to stay at Tropicana, significantly lower your expectations. It's just an old man wearing a brand new clothing made in China.

Reviews.Title: “Great All Around!”
Reviews.Author: Lara A
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Tropicana for three nights and had so much fun! We loved everything about the resort. It is on the south end of the Strip and it is very easy to access all of the amenities that the strip has to offer. No matter where you stay you will have to walk so I recommend wearing comfortable shoes. The check in process was good. A bit of a line but the guest service agents were super friendly and willing to help with any and every question. We also got a complimentary upgrade to a mini suite which was great! We had a view of the south end of the strip and we were not bothered by any noise whatsoever. The room was large and clean. A fridge would have been nice but other than that I can't complain. We went to numerous casinos during our stay and we agreed that the Tropicana was the one that most suited us. Not too busy and not dark and gloomy like most. The servers came around often enough with beverages which was not the case at any of the other resort casinos (I ended up spending 40$ at the MGM Grand for a bottle of MGD and a double rum and coke due to lack of service there.) The pool looked awesome and it was not very busy but we never got around to enjoying it. Cafe Nikki was perfect! The food was amazing, the prices are extremely reasonable, and the service was superb! I can't wait to go back for more! All around this resort gets 5 stars from me! I didn't want to leave! Thank you Tropicana staff for a great stay! I look forward to next time!

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana updated”
Reviews.Author: bingo3
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana was very nice. I had a King room and it was spacious. I liked the desk/table set-up, room for two people. There was a nice flat screen TV in the room. Hairdryer in bath. There was no coffee pot in room, want you to use their coffee spots downstairs I guess! I don't drink it, so didnt' care, but I know some people like to get up and make coffee. A friend of mine said she brought a 10.00 perculator type thing from Walmart and took it, made her own and said you can even just leave it there if no room to take it home in luggage, because is cheaper than buying the coffee in the shops, even if you leave it! The bathroom was spacious and the tub was a garden size. The shower head was low or weird or something. I am 5'2'' and it just did hit my head. I think a tall person would have issues and have to scrunch up under it. Not sure what the problem is, but the water was hot all the time and immediately when turned on. I liked the curved shower curtain most now have as well. The room was quiet, I never heard neighbors, etc. The bed was very comfortable. There was a digital clock with iPod dock. I don't care for the "resort fee", I know many of the hotels charge this, but it is basically just adding to the room rate and I'd rather they just include it, since it is mandatory anyway, it is part of the rate, we are not stupid. I am not too sure what the fee covers, maybe the "free wireless", which is not free when you pay $14.99 a day to use it! Just include it all in the rate and be done with it. The only thing I did not care about at the Tropicana was the shutters on the windows. They were pretty, but a lot of light filters in through them at night and I like it dark. I tried shutting them in both directions and still got a lot of light in the room. I would prefer curtains, but the shutters are probably easier to deal with by the staff. I was in the club towers, which is a tower at the back of the complex. From the outside, it looked like it was a great distance, but inside walking it was no more than 5 minutes from registation to elevators, unless you walk real slow. I do tend to be a fast walker! The pool area looked nice, but it was too cold for that this trip, weather in low 60's and 50's. I never found the business center, though I saw signs directing to the area. They did have some internet kiosks near the elevator for the Club tower and you can print boarding passes free there. There is a deli, food seems to come from Cafe Nikki and appeared to be the same food on their menu, you just order at the counter at the deli whereas Cafe Nikki is sit down. There was no room service menu, but an abbreviated room service flier in the room. Plenty of food options at the hotels in the area, NY NY, Excalibur, Luxor, MGM, etc. I did not eat at either of the other two restaurants in Tropicana, one was Italian and one more a steakhouse I guess. Casino never seemed to be very full, even at night or weekends. I do not gamble so can't comment on anything there. My money went to the resort fee! LOL!! All of the staff I encountered were very friendly and helpful. We rented a car right at the hotel one day to go to Hoover dam and it was convenient, inexpensive and they were helpful. I had no problems at check-in and was even able to get in my room at about 12:30 pm. overall, it was a very nice hotel, very comfortable and quiet. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trueam
Reviews.Content: We had two connecting rooms here in the Club Tower for four nights, the rooms are a good size, the bathroom was OK but the shower is not very good if you are tall. The hotel is in a good position at the end of The Strip. The pool area is very nice but the music was rather loud and you couldn't get away from it if you wanted to chill out and relax. Our rooms had no tea or coffee making facilities but there is a Starbucks in the lobby of the Club Tower thats open in the mornings but the prices varied from day to day, but thats not the hotels fault. Would recomend The Tropicana as its so nice and bright not like some of the other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Tropicana!”
Reviews.Author: jane c
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our 1st trip to Las Vegas. We stayed at Tropicana 11/3 to 11/6 and we were very impressed and happy with our choice to stay here. Our room was great...clean and spacious. Employees/service were very nice and helpful. Check in was quick and the hotel/casino itself is very bright and welcoming. The size of the place is just right...not too big & crowded! I would highly recommend this hotel! Very close to the airport and strip and several other hotels/casinos. I will not hesitate to go back to this hotel again! Thanks Tropicana for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!~”
Reviews.Author: Jerome E
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana is now my new place to stay when I go to Vegas. Rooms were clean. Service was excellent. Casino was clean. The renovation is very nice. There is tram access to other venues which made it nice to go meet up with friends who were staying at different properties. Rate was good. Definitely my new Vegas place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “I love the new look”
Reviews.Author: Fabulous55
Reviews.Content: I had been staying for over 20 years and had worried about the need for a facelift - I was pleasantly surprised to see how much they had done and how beautiful everything looked. The staff is fabulous, the rooms are quite comfortable and the casino has a fresh clean look - the pool is amazing and overall it is a GREATdeal - if you prefer a comfortable, clean not loud, not smoky; you will not be disappointed. I hope to keep coming for another 20 years.

Reviews.Title: “poor view”
Reviews.Author: romagerry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in the month of October. We had a room in the tower furthest from the the strip so it was a bit of a walk from the reception. We were on the 15th floor so we thought we would have a great view. We opened the wooden shutters and the windows were covered with a netting so you could not get any pictures from the windows and if you stand close to them your eyes would go funny!. The room itself was bright and roomy,with good housekeeping service. It is placed at the top of the strip so you are in a quiet area. The pool area is not as big as you would think from the pictures and the spaces are few when it is busy.

Reviews.Title: “well worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: gary006
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 6 days in Vegas at the Tropicana hotel.Not as busy as some of the others which is nice because after visiting the big ones it's nice to come back to smaller one,i say a smaller one but it still has 1600 rooms.Clean bright and nice rooms with 2 queen size beds,the only small moan would be that there is no tea or coffee facilities but i take my own so no big thing.What can i say about Vegas, well it's a adults play ground fantastic just like you see on TV but what did surprise me was how clean it was it was spotless and the shopping malls so clean the floors sparkled.A visit to the grand canyon is a must and also you have just got to go in the Venetian hotel,luxurious amazing with gondolas threw out the place with lovely ceilings.Another thing is the shows,you must see a show or two they are great to see.The only down side would be that the prices of drinks in the hotels are expensive but it is Vegas.To cap it all it is a place that you have to visit once in a lifetime,amazing.

Reviews.Title: “The Trop was the perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: lotsoslots
Reviews.Content: I usually stay on the north end of the strip (Mirage, Encore, Etc,) I wanted something on the south end this time since people I had to meet up with were at Mandalay Bay. I had heard that the Trop had been remodeled and decided to give it a try after getting a great internet price. It was well worth it. The whole experience was great from check in through check out. I was able to get a free upgrade to a small suite from a deluxe room. I did have to stay in the Club Tower which is a bit of a walk but not a problem as it is so bright with lots of windows overlooking the pool along the walkway. Right from the front entrance to the room everything is either white marble or orange, red and brown carpeting. I for one did not feel that the coconut scent in the casinos and public areas was overwhelming. It was a refreshing break from the usually smokey casinos I have encountered. The casino is not as large as some others but is easier to navigate without getting lost. I mostly play slots but there seemed to be a lot of action at the tables during the 5 days that I was there. I really liked the slot area that was off by itself between the two escalators, the ceilings were higher and it was cooler in that area. The cocktail waitresses were for the most part very attentive, efficient and friendly. I did not get to experience the restaurants as all of my meals were covered by other people at other hotels but the menus and the food looked delicious. The room was very nice with a corner view of part of the strip and the MGM Grand. I could also view part of the airports take offs and landings but the sound didn't seem to be an issue. If you want ultra fancy then this hotel may not be for you but I have done it both ways and the Trop makes you feel comfortable and welcome I will be staying here again as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: kidgeeridge
Reviews.Content: I sent my mum from Australia and her best friend for a 9 night stay. They report that the room was absolutley beautiful and far beyond their expectations. Plantation shutters, very spacious overlooking the garden and pool. The staff could not have been more helpful and obliging going out of their way to ensure that two older ladies were having a nice time and all was good. Beyond this, on the day they were due to depart, they were caught in a traffic jam and missed the return flight to Australia. The Manager took control of the situation and arranged for them to board the next available Virgin flight which was not available for another two days. The Management made certain that they were looked after at no extra cost during the extended stay, absolutely wonderful service. Well done Tropicana Management and staff. Take a bow! We will be over in the near future and we would not consider staying anywhere else. Many thanks, Vicki White Australia

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with some great service”
Reviews.Author: realistic5
Reviews.Content: The best check in experience with Jan who was wonderful. A great room on the 20th floor in the Club Tower but it was under the conference 'hospitality suite' so you could hear every conversation from above in the middle of the night including what those optometrists should not have been doing with their bosses! The room was perfectly clean. Housekeeping did not visit until after 4pm each day and sometimes it was as late as 8pm and one day not at all. It did mean you were lacking towels, water, coffee refills. The views were great and it was fairly quiet. The bed was very comfy! The pool was nice though the lifeguards not doing their job - just hanging out in the pool with friends. A floating Band-Aid in the pool was not pleasant. One reason we booked this hotel was the swim-up black jack table but it was never staffed in our 7 days. Bacio was a great restaurant but Nikki not so - food or service wise.

Reviews.Title: “non-flashy hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: nreyesok
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference for 4 nights. The lobby is nothing like the other hotels - which can be good or bad depending on what you're here for. Absolutely nothing to look at. Service was ok, not especially friendly, at the front desk. But I got a great rate over the phone - even better than the conference rate. So the value was very good. And I also talked to a couple of the concierges before my arrival, and they were helpful with suggestions, dinner, and show reservations. Glad I took care of this because in person there were sometimes long lines for the concierge (who also took care of our Hoover Dam excursion). The room: comfortable and clean. Beds were ok, pillows were ok. I didn't think they were incredibly comfy but then I slept really well all 4 nights! Plenty of room. Had 2 double beds. Quiet. Renovated. The bathrooms had apparently not been renovated - old cracked tiles, small bath/shower, thin towels, minimal amenities (ie no shower cap or shower gel) Enjoyed Nikki's Club for breakfast - huge portions, yummy oatmeal, yogurt and fruit, etc. There were a couple other options in the hotel - a Starbucks and another cafe/frozen yogurt spot for a quick bite. Did not eat at the hotel for lunch or dinner. (Across the street at the MGM was our favorite lunch at Wolfgang Puck's Grill!) Pool was spacious, comfy chairs, very loud music. I found it hard to find a quiet spot anywhere in the whole hotel - I like to read and relax when not in meetings, and the room had terrible lighting for reading. Unfortunately there wasn't really any other place to sit quietly either. The casino was not crowded like a lot of hotels, but like all of them the area was incredibly smoky. Coming from a state with no smoking laws this was very irritating - not to this hotel specifically. (My friend woke up one night thinking something was on fire and it was her hair and pillow that reeked with smoke!). Our eyes and throats bothered us the whole time. Location was ok - not in the "thick of things" near Bellagio, Venetian, Mirage, etc. But the MGM across the street had a monorail station to other hotels, it's a quick and cheap cab ride to other hotels, and the location at the Tropicana was definitely less crowded and quieter than the other places as well, which I think is a good thing. This hotel does not have free entertainment like the other hotels either - ie Bellagio's conservatory and fountains, Treasure Island's siren show, Mirage's volcano, etc. Again, this could be a good or bad thing depending on what you're expecting. It's a good value hotel, with clean spacious rooms, quieter and a little south on the strip compared to the action. No flash or action.

Reviews.Title: “Great Changes Still Ahead for the Tropicana Hotel in Las Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: nybd40
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana Hotel in Las Vegas has transformed into a great hotel. I haven't been in Las Vegas in four years and was really impressed with the new changes in this hotel. The hotel is easy to get around and the hotel and casino layout is spacious and cheerful. The rooms are newly renovated and very comfortable. The price and resort fee is very reasonable! Looking forward to visiting this hotel agin in the near future! This loaction is at the end of the strip with many walkways/overpasses connecting to the strip. I was impressed with the bus stop in walking distance taking you down the strip. Also, very close to the sirport!

Reviews.Title: “South Beach without the pretentiousness”
Reviews.Author: Reddy45
Reviews.Content: I have no idea what the Tropicana was like before the remodel but it is really quite nice now. I stayed here one night as a personal extension to a business trip to Vegas.
