I'll spare the boring review points and hit on the interesting stuff since I am writing this review from my mobile phone at McCarran. The casino smells like coconut, but in a rather overwhelming way. It reminds me of the smell from a cheap car air freshener. It does seem to cover up the smell of smoke, though. Everything is brightly lit and clean. Much better than the dark and dirty of some older Vegas properties. The in room dining is actually priced at "hotel" prices and not "Vegas tourist" prices. I ordered the 10oz NY Strip and it was delicious. The service was top notch, too. The location is alright if you like south strip properties. I am more of a mid strip person so the walk was rather long. Would I stay here again? Sure, for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience at the Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: Cudiva
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the renovations at the hotel. I had booked a standard room and was upgraded to a suite. The suites have two rooms one with a bar and couch with a TV then another with the bedroom and bathroom (there was only a shower). It was a good sized suite and had double vanities outside outside the bathroom that made it easy to get ready. The King bed was comfortable and the bedding was fresh. There were robes available but they were not very plush, didn't make me want to use them more than once. If you get the airport side you can hear some noise if you are a light sleeper. The one complaint I would have is that they have wooden shutters and not black out curtains. I was there for a conference but I was traveling for fun and sleeping in the day this may be a problem. Nikkis cafe had a good breakfast would definitively recommend. The location is good across from New York New York and MGM. If you are looking for a fancy hotel this is not it, but if you are looking for a middle of the road hotel that's clean and bit more low key this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “only 3 days at the Trop!”
Reviews.Author: Linda S
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel and it's not the first time that we have stayed here! The first time we came to the Tropicana we did not have reservations but we wandered around the grounds and fell in love with the atmosphere here! The people were really friendly and we loved the fact that at that time it reminded us a bit of old time Vegas of back in the days! The Tropicana has been made over and what a beautiful hotel it truly is. We just had a wonderful stay again and we would recommend this hotel to anyone. The rooms are fabulous and the beds are so comfy! They have one of the best steak houses ever and an awesome Italian restaurant! The staff is is excellent, we only wish we could have stayed longer! BUT WE WILL BE BACK!!! Thank you Tropicana!

Reviews.Title: “You won't go wrong w/ the Tropicana!”
Reviews.Author: OhioSharky
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from the Tropicana, Las Vegas. What a nice hotel. Quiet rooms, comfortable beds, clean, and the concierge, M Hunt, was very accommodating. He went out of his way to make this a memorable vacation. The only downfall that I could comment on was the shower. If you are 4 ft tall, then there won't be a problem. Would we book the Trop again? Absolutely! We were on the 11th floor with a great view. If you get a chance, tour the Grand Canyon by helicopter-Maverick. Wow! Try to take in Gladys Knight, as well. She does a great show. They say that 3 days is plenty here in this city, but 5 sure wasn't enough to take in the entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana was an OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: goneagain_11
Reviews.Content: We thought we would try the newly renovated tropicana. We were not disapointed but not impressed either. First the good points. The hotel is really nice very clean and do mean spotless casino and other areas were very clean and everybody is very nice. Now the not so great. We got there very early around 9:30 am and checked in was told that when are rooms were ready they would call us on our cell phone after walking the strip for 6 hours and no call we went back to the trop. and our rooms were ready but not in the paradise towers but in the way back club towers a long walk. We are not happy now. Rooms were nice not great beds were comfy. But the room only has shutters over the windows no curtains and with the lights below shining on the building there was no such thing as a dark room at night. I could almost have read a book with all the light coming in. We stayed on the 8th floor overlooking the airport. There was not much selection on places to eat. we ate at the club Nikki one night and the food was great but $12.00 for a reueben sandwich ? We ending up walking across the street every day and eating at the MGM. Food was good but cheaper. Next time in vegas I will try another place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Holiday Stay EVER”
Reviews.Author: leicstraveller87
Reviews.Content: I do not have the words to describe my experience at the Tropicana Las Vegas. Even before we arrived at the hotel, the service we received from host Nicole was simply like nothing I had ever received before. It felt like we were cared about before we arrived and it certainly felt like we were cared for during our stay. The casino was light and airy. Our suite was clean, fresh and the bed quite simply the most comfortable I have ever slept in. Many say you can't beat your own bed after a holiday. I felt the opposite - I just wanted to get back into my Tropicana bed. There is not enough room here to explain how thrilled I was with my stay but it was undoubtedly the best holiday stay I have ever had, made all the more special by a special occasion which occurred whilst staying at the Trop. In fact, I loved my stay so much I have set up a Tropicana Fan Site to help other guests enjoy the experience as much as I did. The site has been designed to allow guests to share their tips, comments and advice on the Tropicana to hopefully allow everyone to make the most of their stay! The tips and comments are broken down into a wide number of categories, so whether you want to advice on the dining options or the casino, it should be easy to find - it's more tips and advice based than review based like Tripadvisor. The site is only what the fans make it, so be sure to visit www.tropicanadreamin.com today and get involved :) Thanks. Aron.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation ! Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jodyw89
Reviews.Content: Pool - The pool is great! Its big and lots of room for all the hotel guests. The only complaint is that the water was soooo cold. Everyone in the pool was commenting on the temperature of the pool. There weren't more than 10 people in the pool on a hot August day because it was freezing in the pool. The Room - the room was really nice. Very comfortable bed. Flat Screen television with a few good channels. The view was really nice except I wish the windows weren't covered in the material that they are. Its basically a bunch of tiny circles on the window. The bathroom was nice and roomy. The Casino - kind of refreshing that it didn't have a huge casino. I kind of liked the smaller setting. Pros - pool, room, casino Cons - location The location on the strip was a little further down from the action, but as long as you take the bus or the monorail it was easy to get to the more popular hotels. Also the walk from the reception to my room was a little lengthier than I would have liked. The fitness center is not completed so basically its only a few machines and weights right next to the pool, which was adequate, Im sure however that when the fitness center is completed that it will be nice. Overall, great hotel and atmosphere. The pool is probably one of the best on the strip. The hotel is really affordable and a great place to vacation. As for attractions I would recommend for visitors to go to Freemont Street, the grand canyon (daily bus tours), the pirate show at Treasure Island, The venetian and a lot of the hotels in the center. Again overall, would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Halloween!”
Reviews.Author: m t
Reviews.Content: Since the rebirth of the Tropicana, I have spent many wonderful nights there. The rooms are pleasant, the mattresses and pillows superb, the tub is big enough to relax in and the blinds hide the morning sun light just right! The food at Nikki's Cafe has been excellent each time I've eaten there and sitting on the deck overlooking the lush landscape is just the perfect beginning to your day or end to your evening. The pool, which has always been the best of all pools in Vegas for relaxing and swimming, continues to claim that title. White cabanas surround the pool making it a very appealing setting. The employees are VERY accommodating. It took almost 5 minutes to get the luggage brought to the room! That was just enough time to turn on the lights and check the arrangement out! As always, the tables were alive with energy and the slots were great fun. The bars and the employees attending them were just as efficient and welcoming as they have been for all the years I spent time there. For a great time, good food, terrific sleeping quarters, and convience of location, the Trop is the place I return to over and over!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lori1010
Reviews.Content: We chose the Tropicana because of a great deal we got! The room and bed we very comfy and clean, housekeeping did a great job! The casino was hot and stuffy, so we went elsewhere to play slots. Not a big deal for us, we don't gamble that much! Nikki Cafe, seemed understaffed and lineups were long. Most of our dining, was done along the strip at various places. Overall staff was very friendly, which made our stay very pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “Did a great job with the renovation”
Reviews.Author: Mario E
Reviews.Content: I was there four four days, had a very nice time. all the renovations are really great. the last time we were there was before they had started the up grades, and boy was it a mess. But we are really happy with it now and plan to stay again

Reviews.Title: “Employees make the stay better”
Reviews.Author: Fred B
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Las Vegas, and for a convention at the Trop. The room was decent and comfortable. The restaurants were great, but my favorite was the brunch at the Nikki. The best part of the Hotel was the people. They were ALL friendly and extremely helpful. I believe that the employees made my whole stay worth while, the front desk, bell hops, waiters, concierge, store clerks, pool personell, business center, etc. (Did not spend much time in the casino, so I cannot rate them - but it was smokey!) I will stay there again when the family comes with me for our next vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time at the TropLV !!!”
Reviews.Author: jeanne l
Reviews.Content: I went to Las Vegas for the first time a week ago. The TropLV is awesome. I had an amazing time and the service is A+ I cant wait to return. Beautiful rooms, excellent food, best pool ever, and our host, Jessica Senter, was the BEST!!!!

Reviews.Title: “BEST STAY IN VEGAS EVER”
Reviews.Author: dcarrillo2000
Reviews.Content: I can t say enough about my weekend at the Trop. the staff the food the gaming the dealers wer all just AMAZING, I mean the room was great it was clean well stocked and quiet and comfortable when I needed it to be. The food I cant stop thinking about it I want to drive back from Los Angeles just for dinner. But my best time was at the Craps table I mean the excitment and the people especially the dealers were amazing. Im going back as soon as I can. It didnt hurt that I came home with more money then when I arrived either. thank you Trop I will be back. danny

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Pebbles-Advisor
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel, clean, nice rooms, excellent service, nice pool. what more can I say.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay again”
Reviews.Author: AG10619
Reviews.Content: Room was very noisy even on 15th Floor. Very expensive drink in the bar a glass of wine $10. Not many choices to eat

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annelies V
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Tropicana Las Vegas for 2 nights. The hotel was recently updated and the rooms were nice and clean. There wasn't anything spectacular about the room it was just your basic hotel room. We had a view of the strip, not worth paying extra for because your view is mainly of the MGM Grand. The walls in the hotel room are pretty thin. We could hear our neighbors talking the first night, so we bought ear plugs for the second night. We spent an afternoon at the pool, which was lovely. Lots of comfortable chairs. The pool temp. was perfect. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants mainly because we wanted to venture out on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas First Timer”
Reviews.Author: WelshWayne
Reviews.Content: Booked the Trop after reading reviews on Tripadvisor and not disappointed. Stayed there for 6 nights with my son and we had a great time. We stayed from 14th to 20th and although obviously over weekend we never experienced any problems with lift and check in/out were very quick (and we were not VIPs). Pool area very nice (spent a couple of hours each day there soaking up the sun) although drinks a little bit expensive. Room not the best I have stayed in but more than adequate - beds comfortable, clean, big TV (but hey you don't go to Vegas to watch TV) and fab views of strip - MGM, NYNY, Excalibur and Luxor could all be seen from 15th floor room. Excellent location at southern end of Strip. You really don't need a car because bus stop right outside if you want to go up the strip or to downtown. Very convenient for airport, probably about 1 - 2 miles but little/no aircraft noise at night. Casino was nothing special and definately nicer places to blow your bucks - quite liked NYNY casino. Reception staff, in particular very friendly and helpful. Would I go back - to Vegas yes, to the Trop possibly, not because of anything wrong with hotel but would probably try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing trip.”
Reviews.Author: Dano44
Reviews.Content: We had been to visit the Trop back in march couldnt believe the improvements. We ended up gambling there quite a bit. So in August I believe we got a offer of 4 free nights for the fall. We had never stayed there but it was a great deal so i booked for september. Work got in the way so we had to change the dates no problem reservations was very helpfull. We arrived oct 9th checkin was so easy no line we didnt try to upgrade. I wanted to see what the regular room looked like. Very nice with a view of MGM bed was comfy. So easy to get around the casino very nice atmosphere. The staff was very friendly from the chambermaids to drink girls to casino staff to poker room staff. Helped a first time live poker player I even won $100. Thee wife loved it she even managed to win some money she has a new fav penny machine. As a young guy that I played blackjack with said Im so stupid I must have walked past this place 3 times and never came in. Its nice in here and im staying at hooters we all laughed.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it's hyped up to be”
Reviews.Author: thegasgod_slcut
Reviews.Content: We love Vegas! We travel to Vegas at least once per year. This is our first stay at the Trop and were quite excited to see the recent changes made. I will start by saying that every employee we came in contact with was more than friendly, they truly go out of their way and kill you with kindness. Other than that, we were not impressed. They are trying to be/offer a Mandalay Bay experience and falling short of what they are selling. I reserved the room almost a year ago, we received an excellent rate of $129.00 per night, I had requested an upgrade to a "Strip View Room". They agreed and said it would be an additional $25.00, great deal. Ever heard the saying "You get what you pay for"? We waited in line for about 25 minutes checking in. There were 2 employees at the desk. However the VIP Line had I believe 4 employees there with no one waiting in the VIP Line it was only after waiting the 25 minutes that these employees decided to help us common folk. Then we got to our room, 1225. The view was of the back side of the MGM and off to the East side of Vegas, oh, it also included a beautiful view of the rooftop of the main Casino. There are very few "in room" amenities. No fridge, coffee, water, etc. They want you spending your money downstairs. There is a blow dryer and an iron.The carpet in the room was stained throughout with bright red blotches and the bathroom floor was streaked with black marks. Not a lot of attention to detail in the cleaning process. I wore flip flops around the room. The beds were comfy. The A/C was a small 12x12 hole in the wall that blew directly into another wall inside this little cove area of the room, not out in to the room. We had it set at 68 and could not get the room to cool down. We finally opened the windows to get a little bit of a breeze into the room and stayed awake the rest of the night listening to the loud music played througout the parking area and sirens. On our fist day we went to Nikko the "Cafe" type restaurant. Food was way over priced and not great. Service was very slow, but employees were very apologetic and nice. The hotel is conveniently located for events at Thomas & Mack, we walked back to the hotel each night. Oh yes, the Elevators, on Friday and Saturday night we waited at least 10 minutes for an elevator down to the Lobby. I can't imagine we will be going back to the Tropicana on our next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “top hotel”
Reviews.Author: clairet222
Reviews.Content: Just got back from week long holiday in vegas and was not dissapointed in our stay at the Tropicana .this hotel is by far the most personable hotel on the strip its relaxing and a nice break form the mayhem off the strip the buffet breakfast at nicki beach is just enough unlike some of the other hotels were the buffet is way to much...this is clean and feels healthy.The pool is such a haven from a mad day and the luxury beds at the pool are fab they had resevre placks on but we just helped ourselves and no one said anything.We stayed in the club tower with a fantastic view of the strip and yes it is a few mins walk from reception but a nice one,the beds are big and extra comfy...am coming back next year and will be staying here as it is one of the best...book it you will not be disapointed.and the staff are all so helpful:}

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana- not over crowded, a relief from the crowds!”
Reviews.Author: Holidayerr
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff. Smaller casino which was great because we are not big gamblers. Nice smaller hotel was a welcome sight after in the crowds all day.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK, not really great as such”
Reviews.Author: TripsiloveTotake
Reviews.Content: The reviews were too great for Mob experience, it was great; but not worth of the ticket dollars for sure. Our flight was late and we wanted to kill time; we also had Las Vegas discount card, which gave us a deal for 2 for 1. So we paid for 2 adult prices for 2 adults and 2 kids and killed time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: KrisHunnisett
Reviews.Content: Lovely laid back atmosphere. Nice rooms airy feel to the hotel which is a lovely contrast to the other smoke filled Vegas hotels. Great location. Right on the strip. Cafe great for breakfast on the terrace. So pleased we booked it. Would book again

Reviews.Title: “All pool areas not always open”
Reviews.Author: dnickley
Reviews.Content: This newly remodeled old hotel was def worth it. Eventhough it was at the end of the strip it was still close enough to other great attractions (and close to airport). We wanted to stay here because we had heard it was remodeled and they had a great pool. However all the reviews and their website failed to mention that not all of the pool is open everyday. We were there for 4 days and on the 4th day as we were leaving the NIKI beach FINALLY opened up. We were EXTREAMLY disapointed because we had read about the swim up bar and so we were stoked to try it out. But nope we didnt get to use it :( We also thought it was lame that the pools and hot tubs closed at 7. We were hopeing to do some evening swimming since it was so hot out by that time. The sun does not hit the pool till late afternoon so it was really cold swimming in the morning. I peeked through the fence and it looked like Nikki beach was in morning sun. Another reason we were really really disappointed. it was an okay stay but i think i'll stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than expected but still needs work”
Reviews.Author: travelgirlEJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tropicana because I was accompanying my husband to a conference that was taking place at the hotel. I am experienced Las Vegas traveler, and I was looking forward to seeing the Trop's recent renovations. Note I did not have any experience with check-in, because my husband was already checked in when I arrived. Bottom line: If you are considering the Flamingo, NY-NY, Luxor, etc., then you should definitely consider the Trop, too. It is nicely appointed, decently located and not as overwhelmingly huge as some of the other resorts. The price is right, too. And the pool is beautiful. Do not stay here expecting the luxury of City Center, the Wynn or even Caesar's. But by saving money at the Trop, you will have a lot more money to spend while you're in Vegas!! Read on for more specifics: The king-sized room was clean, bright and a nice size. It overlooked the airport but was not loud. We were in the club tower, which is a hike from the main entrance. You might try to stay closer to the front, but we never heard one minute of night club music, even on the 12th floor. The best thing about the Trop? The bed. **The bed is probably the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in.** The bathroom was a nice size with a big tub. There were mildew and paint splotches in the shower, which I did not expect considering the renovations were so recent. One day, housekeeping made up our room and left us with 1 towel, which we did not know until after midnight when we got back to our room. That was annoying. The casino ventilation has not been upgraded and is not even close to that found in the newer properties. The smell of smoke as you approach the casino is overwhelming. The "South Beach Marketplace" is a 24-hour Starbucks (yay!) & a couple of quick service eateries. Nothing great. The breakfast buffet at Cafe Nikki is $18.95 and hardly worth it. Food was good but not worth that price. The bell staff and valet staff were wonderful. I never had to wait more than a couple of minutes for my car, and the bell staff was responsive and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on what you want”
Reviews.Author: RoverVic
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here recently. I have to say, because we were there primarily for sun and not gambling, we were happy. As an older establishment which was not built to house a casino, but strictly as a resort, the rooms are quite spacious and the pool is very large, gets lots of sun and has plenty of lounge chairs. It represents a great base of operations if you just want to get out and see the town. Kitty corner to New York, New York, and across the street from the MGM and Excalibur, it gets you away from the heart of luncacy but with quick access to it if you want. A couple of shortcomings: Cafe Nikki appears to have lots of tables but it looks like they are short both kitchen staff and servers. Long waits for breakfast when tables sitting empty. No coffee pots in rooms was expected due to another reviewer's input, but still disappoining considering the cost. Overall, would definitely stay here again. Close to airport, free valet, and easy access to othe parts of the area for road trips.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Victor F
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is fantastic. Its newly-remodeled and ownership looked at every detail. The new restaurants and of course, Nikki Beach were great. Saturday at Nikki Beach was the coolest - I never thought I'd be dancing in and by poolside. Great mixed crowd of people. The staff from check-in to check-out were helpful, friendly and tended to every need. Shopping - they gave great directions and even offered a car to drop us. No doubt we are going back to the Tropicana!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: doogie211
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Paradise tower which is located just off the strip. Our check in and check out was very fast and very efficient. The staff was more than happy to help us and answer any questions we had. The rooms are very clean and bright. We needed some supplies from housekeeping and they were at the room with 15 minutes with a smile. We were next to the ice machine and elevator and we didn't hear any noise. We spent an afternoon at the pool which was great. The grounds are very nice and the staff at the pool bar were very friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel. I would definitely stay here again! Koodos to all the staff there.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: grouchob
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana is just VEGAS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! It represents everything you expect of Vegas from the entrance scented with vanilla that hits you 100 metres before you even enter the hotel, to the 60 foot high illuminated photo of David Copperfield projected on an adjacent building throughout the evenings. Perfect location just on the end of the strip. Rooms fit for a film star. Not bad for a budget coach tour-thank you Archers Direct!!!!!! To a poor valley's boy like me, this was sheer unadulterated luxury. Beats me how anyone could give less than 5 stars!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Would love to come back one day

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: nwaynesworld
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana is an older hotel, which has been renovated. The Tropicana is not as flashy as the newer hotels along the strip. However, the Tropicana is well located and offers modern/clean accommodations. In addition, the Tropicana is not a large as some of the new hotels. It is easy to get around the hotel and you will not get lost! The Tropicana is an affordable hotel, offering good value. We will return to the Tropicana Hotel. See Our You Tube Video Channel: nwaynesworld

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: Jenny P
Reviews.Content: When my boyfriend initially booked the Tropicana, it was so reasonably priced i thought that there would be a catch............. but there definately wasn't. We stayed in the club tower which is a pretty long trek from reception but aren't all the hotels? If you don't like walking, don't go to Las Vegas!!!! This was my first trip to Las Vegas so i wasn't sure what to expect but in my opinion we were definately at the best end of the strip. It's soooo easy to get around by using the elevators and bridges, or the monorail from the MGM. We didn't have any problems at all. For those that say it's far away from everything......well everything in Vegas is far away. It all seems so close but don't be deceived, it is a hell of a long walk to get to the other end of the strip. I found the staff at the Tropicna very nice, our room was lovely and cleaned beautifully everyday. Our bed was amazing and we both slept extremely well despite some noise from Nikki beach, but this was only for one night. I would absolutely recommend this to anyone, i honestly don't know what people find to complain about. It is so light wnd welcoming which i couldn't say i found in any of the bigger hotels. Overall, Tropicana amazing and Las Vegas amazing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and easy parking on The Strip!”
Reviews.Author: CleopatraBunny
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group last weekend. Usually, I don't like staying at casino hotels since the check-in process can take forever (why is that???), but the Tropicana was efficient in every way. Five minutes and done. The elevator to the room also was close by check-in so I didn't have to wander for days through the casino to locate the lift. The strip view room I had was clean and had a comfy bed - no complaints at all about the lodgings. There is a resort fee (typical of most Vegas rooms on the Strip from what I understand) but was worth it for me to get fast Internet/wi-fi in my room. I don't drink coffee but noted the Starbucks down one of the halls with a short line. And the self-parking right next to the hotel was plentiful and easy to use. None of the confusing maze and multi-story compounds much larger properties have. Our group ate lunch in the Cafe Nikki, and everyone enjoyed their burgers, salads, mac n cheese poppers, and the fries were rated the best we'd ever had (large cut with just the right amount of crunchy outside and soft inside). Sure, this place isn't a 5-star posh property with mega-celebrities gracing its pool, but for regular folks like me who don't fit the uber-cool mold, it was comfortable, customer service was genuinely caring, and it felt like a good value. They keep renovating and upgrading (front desk is next up) so expect some changes if you've stayed here before. The tired property is finally getting its facelift!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl103
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tropicana 2 nights Oct. 7-9. Loved the newly remodeled rooms, and overall hotel resort. Everything is open, bright, and airy. Has a Miami Vibe too it. Clean and uncluttered. Check in was quick and was given a room right away (got there around 9:00 in the morning) and was even upgraded to a corner room with a cute tiangle sitting area. The room was very nice with modern decor, flat screen t.v. and loved the plantation shutters on the windows. I stayed on the 19th floor in the Paradise Tower. There is a bit of a walk from the lobby but liked the boutique gift shops along the way. There's a coffee stand in the open area just before you reach the elevators which is quick to grap a cup of coffee in the morning. Pool area is nice, didn't visit Nikki Beach as it wasn't open. Ate at the coffee shop next to the pool, alittle pricey (but what isn't in Vegas), food was good. The higher end restaurants looked good, but didn't try. Everyone from the checkin, valet, and maids, were friendly and helpful. A very nice smaller resort hotel, less frantic and crazy then the bigger ones next door. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Quiet Accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: Joline04240
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel on the quieter side and the Tropicana fit the bill! The room was pleasantly decorated and the bed and pillows were so comfortable--just what we needed after walking all day on the strip. I would recommend requesting a room in the back facing the mountains and the airport--quieter than facing the pool/strip. Our room was in the Club Tower. We ate at the Nikki Cafe which was very pleasant, the food was good, but we were a little disappointed to be charged $8 for a bowl of fruit we did not order. It was delicious, so we ate it and paid the charge. Just be careful if you order the delicious French Toast with Fruit! All in all, we enjoyed our 5-night stay at the Tropicana and would recommend it if you're looking for a quieter spot on the Las Vegas strip.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Stay - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Ian H
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week from the 8th October ... I was on the 17th Floor in the Club Tower, an excellent view of the airport, which was my preference. Nice clean room The hotel/casino was very clean, smelt very fresh and the staff were all very friendly and approachable. Not far to walk to the strip or across the road into MGM to get the monorail. All in all, the Tropicana is well situated as a base to enjoy a holiday in Las Vegas .. Will I go back ?? Yes, I will ... and yes, I am In Feb next year.

Reviews.Title: “newly renovated means newly decorated”
Reviews.Author: Dave M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tropicana "club tower" for 4 nights in late Oct. I was not impressed with the room, which I thought was newly renovated. They simply put in new furniture. The bathroom tile was old, chipped, cracked and dirty. The silicone around the tub was coming off and going black, It was obviously leaking,not sure how it wasn't running into the room below. I went to the front desk" 2 mile walk" to ask for a new room, girl was not happy about this like she took personaly or something. She gave us a new room one floor below and it was worse. This hotel is just plain unintresting, we kept leaving to go to anywhere else. There's a big list of hotels that are so much cooler. Good bed, but that was it, had better rooms at the Days Inn and it wasn't even all that cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent except for one minor blemish”
Reviews.Author: dipex
Reviews.Content: I liked the Tropicana. Well situated at the crossroads of Las Vegas Boulevard (the Strip) and Tropicana Avenue and facing the MGM Grand, Excalibur and New York New York hotels. Very easy to reach from the airport. The Tropicana is not as large as many of the themed hotels, with under 1500 rooms - small for this town. It feels more of an hotel and less like an airport terminal. The decoration throughout is fresh and relaxing, with a Miami South Beach meets Caribbean plantation theme. My room was spacious and beautifully furnished with a chez longue, plantation shutters and 42"-50" TV (all HD) and good quality bathroom toiletries. The best thing about the room however was the luxurious bed. Quite simply, this was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in, with a superb (Serta?) mattress and high quality cotton sheeting. The AC worked well and I found the room quiet and restful. This hotel easily deserves 4 stars following its complete remodelling. Even the perfumed public areas were pleasant and not in any way overwhelming. Presumably, this 'freshener' is cycled through the air conditioning. My only gripe, is that there are some steps from the parking garage to one of the hotel entrances so not ideal for the disabled or someone with heavy luggage. I didn't like the service I received at breakfast in Nikki cafe. The server appeared disinterested and perhaps tired from the night before? The reception staff were extremely helpful when I tried to complete an airline check-in and they went out of their way to assist. Finally, there is a very pleasant and extensive landscaped pool and garden area, which made one feel they were actually in Miami South Beach. This is an hotel I would certainly consider again if I should ever return to this town.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on where you stay”
Reviews.Author: ArtMaven
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the newly remodeled Tropicana for a reunion and would probably not book there again, at least not in the million miles away Club tower. There is a Starbucks satellite station in the Club Tower but is has only a small selection compared to the larger full Starbucks down in the main hotel. Cafe Nikki had good food, although everything else I ate in the hotel was terrible, particularly the small cafe near the yogurt shop. The room was certainly serviceable and had the much desired in-room safe. The registration area is just plain stupid. Stairs and luggage are not compatible. Yeah, there is a ramp...waaaayyy off to the side. The Trop just remodeled and they didn't fix this? Apparently this remodel was engineered by people who've never traveled to the hotel and tried to check in or out of it. It wasn't too bad a walk over to the MGM to grab the monorail, but I still can't see any reason why you wouldn't just book at the MGM and have the monorail right there. I like being able to get around the strip quickly and monorail access is key for doing so. Although, if you are needing to get to the Luxor or Mandalay, the tram is right across from the Trop, so that is more convenient. All-in-all, I wasn't blown away by the Trop. It wasn't bad, it was just sorta "meh."

Reviews.Title: “first time, very impressed”
Reviews.Author: TopEndShortStays
Reviews.Content: First time in Vegas, and on arrival I looked over at the MGM Grand and thought - I wish I had booked there, but after a day walking down the strip - I really appreciate the somber nature of this place. Very impressed with the layout, the room and the bed (best ever!). Highly recommended...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent improvement”
Reviews.Author: neilthestooge
Reviews.Content: Really glad we opted to go to the newly renovated Tropicana (based on reviews from this website and some great prices being offered). Great staff, service and atmosphere and with a new "lick of paint" looking and (most importantly for some of the older hotels) smelling clean! If anyone is in 2 minds, trust me you won't be disappointed. The reason for 4 not 5 is the lack of "real" room service (would of liked to have ordered breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “Another marvelous time at the Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: Bruce K
Reviews.Content: Just returned from another great trip to Vegas! Our stay at the Tropicana was fabulous. Rooms were very nice! Meals at resturants were the best and the Brad Garrett show was the funniest I have seen in awhile. Waitresses were very nice and prompt and keeping my hand full of drinks! Plan to go back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Completly OK”
Reviews.Author: Emphy
Reviews.Content: This is a late review (sorry) I have stayed at the Tropicana with a friend from januari 23 to februari 15 2011. We reserved 2 rooms. The Check in was so OK! After landing on the airport we went to wallmart and did a lot of shopping. We picked up our rental car and droove to the Trop. We were welcomed by the bellmen who droove our suitcases and shoppings to our rooms. while i was at the check inn desk. We were checked in smootly within 5 minutes due Barbara! We took the elevator to floor 19 and got rooms 1923 and 1925. Enetering the rooms we were overwhelmed! Everything what we seen on the picture's was in the rooms we were Silenced! We knew the rooms looked nice on Internet but in reality it was MUCH MUCH more nice! Very quickly the bell boy ringed at our doors bringing our things! 4 minute's ? So wooo we were in las Vegas !!! We got rooms with city view ( view on the strip MGM , Paris , Paris ) 2 rooms! the rooms had connecting doors from the inside!... So no walking in the hallway to knock nock... The rooms even were better as all the pictures i have seen on internet! Happy Happy Happy But :-> after a few hours i woke up due Beep Beep Beep sounds.. it was the digging machine's digging and preparing the Nikki Pool area,, i tried to silence my ears... I tried pillows on my ears,,,, But nothing helped.. I kept hearing the BEEP BEEP BEEP it sounded exactly like my alarm wake up clock... I phoned to the Front Desk explaining my problem... happily they understood!! we were then transferred from city view BEEP BEEP rooms to the other site of the tower with a view on Excalibur, Mandala and Luxor. That was a great sight also! still on floor 19 The sun did shine in that room! so i lowered the shutters and slept long. next Morning Miss Nicole Marshall phoned to my room asking if all was OK .. yes it was beside i had a bad cold and was couging.. In the aftrenoone we droove to red rock canyon. after arriving back to our rooms from Red Rock i had a message from the Front desk asking me to report in......So i was worried if the complained we made was to much. So i went to the front desk verry worried what would happen...BUT There was a Yellow Gift bag for me there, Containing tea , Honey sweeties and other things with a little note: get well soon.. Regards : Nicole. I Consider that as very very very special! Ok we stayed 8 nights and then went to the Grand C and from there to Page. From Page we went back to Las Vegas. We checked in at the Golden Nugget and beeing in the Golden Nugget room we both were dissapointed wishing to be back at Tropicana, But OK we slept at the Nugget but i did set my alarm clock at 10,00 I woke up and called the Trop ( Nicole) I Told here we were downtown at the Nugget but we want to be back again in the Trop.. is there a room for us? YES it was !! beeing in Page and checking my email i got a message from the trop giving me 20% off so i mentioned that and got the answer... OK i can do better as that and i got 30% and resort fees waived!!! We checked out of the Golden Nugget , went to the Trop.. But we were told ok rooms not ready yet.. Come back after 15.00 So we went back at the car and droove up to NMount Charleston.. we had a great time. We returned back at tropicana about 18.00.. The rooms were ready! 2 rooms again on floor 20 with inner connecting doors and a view on the strip! We wanted to stay in thoose rooms 7 days more :) But then in the middle of the night i heard ( at 04.30) Tick Tick Tick I Just returned from a long walk on the LV Strip Tick Tick Tick I looked up to the ceiling and WHOO there was a big wet place leaking water... tick tick .. I Phoned the front desk : Telling Hey there is a poblem in my room! Water is dripping true the ceilings... Nlothing happened.. and it was getting worse... not only tick tick tick.. but almost a little river off water was dropping from the ceiling in my room! I put plastic cans , cofee makers and a lot more on the floor to catch the leaking water, and i phoned again to the front desk saying: HEY SENT SOMEONE TO MY ROOM! There is a major Problem! After 10 minutes a maintain men arrived with some tools.. he looked in my room and said! Pjew i have to get someone else! and he left 15 Minutes later an invasion came :) Security, maintainance and a lot more ppl.. They all together in a meeting decided that the water that was coming in my room came from the upper floor! So all thoose ppl left my room and went 1 floor up. I dont know what was gooing on there .. i heard a jacuzzie was overflooding... the real rea\son what happened above my head was never told... anyway the dripping ( Tick Tick Tick) stopped slowly so i went a sleep about 06.30 maybe 07.00 Ours later i woke up... i looked at the ceilings and oh men it was terrible! the wallpaper also. I Called Front Desk and told sent someome over to look at the damage..... Well they did sent someone.. He looked and said Ow No...and left 2 hours later front Desk Called me telling me we had to moove from the damaged rooms telling me to report at the front desk. So i went to the front desk ..But hey at the front desk they wanted my ID (passport) wich was crazy! They Phoned me! to report in! So i was sent up back to the water room to get my passport and went back to front desk. There i got the keys to 2 rooms below us and was told to change from the water leaking rooms to floor 19.. So i did. (My friend was walking on the strip) so i mooved all we had from floor 20 to 19 :) I was very aware if i have not warned the Trop on the leaking damage it would have gone from floor 20 -> 19_> 18-> 17->16 and more So i was very aware that i saved the Trop Hotel some damage money. OK we installed ourselfes on floor 19 .. but nobody contacted us.. We talked about it and concluded that is strange. Next Morning i went to thye Front Desk Telling the story... The ladies at the front desk already knew about the water problem... 1 off them I cant give the name said Hey GO Complain! You dont have to take that! So i asked for a manager and i got one.. He heard my story.. asked me why didnt you complain earlier.... saw the pics i took.... and then asked me : Will you be OK with 4 free nights for both rooms to undo the trouble you had. YES i agreed. Tropicana! now is wonderfull! I have mailed again and made a reservation from januari 22 2012 to januari 30 and from februari 12 to februari 17 2012 Tropicana! Here i come again!

Reviews.Title: “The "new" Tropicana has won me over...”
Reviews.Author: Kev R
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to Vegas several times over the years and i have never had a better experience than the one i had at the trop. From the wonderful help I received at check in (thanks Romi) to the great housekeeping this hotel has definitely won me over and gained my business................... The pool area was beautiful and well kept, our rooms were spacious and had a great view of the strip... even from our 6th floor room, and the overall vibe of the hotel was relaxed and inviting... a definite departure from the tourist chaos that many other hotels seem to have. This for me was great as after a long day walking on the strip or hanging out on fremont it was great to come back to this atmosphere and lay by the pool, play some roulette or even just relax in our room. I also love how close it is to the airport as it was just a short $12 taxi ride in the morning to it so we got to sleep in a little. I want to thank the staff for making our stay great and we will definitely be back.. ........although i would have rather not left as when we got back to Canada it was only 5c ,,, 41f

Reviews.Title: “Easy, hassle-free stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: lanagold
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a business meeting at Tropicana and was pleasantly surprised by all the new changes. The service was top-notch, particularly compared to a lot of the larger hotels on the strip where I find the service to be indifferent. We were in the Club Tower, which is toward the back of the property, but still easy to get to from the check-in desk, without getting overwhelmed by the casino "maze." My room was well appointed, spotless, and very spacious. The popcorn ceiling was the only reminder of Tropicana's past iteration. Our meeting was held in one of the penthouse suites, which was absolutely gorgeous. Tropicana is easy to access, easy to get around, and a great deal for the price. Even the blackjack dealers were sweet and friendly. The only aspect that I did not like was the strong scent of coconut throughout the property. It's a nice touch when you first walk in, but gets old quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: MrsCoach19
Reviews.Content: The remodeled Tropicana is a wonderful value. Our group of 6 spent two nights in two Paradise Tower suites. The Tropicana was very accomodating, we were able to check in upon arrive, which was 10AM, and our suites were across the hall from each other. The hotel has a retro vibe thanks to the remodel, which suited us perfectly, as we are a bit "retro" ourselves. Loved that the Paradise Tower elevators are very close to the front door. In most hotel/casinos on the Strip you can typically plan on a 1/2 mile walk to your room, when you come back tired from a long day shopping, gambling and seeing the sites. The suites are huge and beds very comfortable. The pool, more like a "lazy river" is terrific, one of the best I've experienced and the water was warm, so enjoyable. Employees up and down the line were very friendly, knowledgable and helpful. The concierge even arranged for a limo for us, at a very very nice price. And as our group are not huge gamblers, there were just enough slots and tables for us to enjoy without being overwhelmed. Would have loved to have stayed one or two more nights. It was a real treat.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: Brent P
Reviews.Content: Loved the remodel.. great prices and a great hotel. The food in the hotel is great and they have a very upscale menu. Love the outdoor seating and the South Beach theme. Couldn't have been happier with our week stay. Cafe Nikki is the best! Thanks Trop and Staff

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Suite - Might have become spoiled.”
Reviews.Author: Marblefireman
Reviews.Content: We booked our Paradise Suite room at the Tropicana back in April when they were having a $99.00 special. We arrived at the Trop and had a little wait in the "breeze" check-in and the lady at the front desk was surprised when she saw what we were paying for the room and she also noted that the resort fees were waived by Nicole Marshall. It was an easy check-in and we were put in room 1101 and was asked at least three times if we needed help with our bags. Room amenities: The suite has two very spacious rooms. The "living area" has two sets of windows, one looks out towards MGM/NYNY and the other looked out towards the Excaliur. We could not see the Excal as there was a large advertising banner blocking our view but the view from the other window was spectacular. Included in the room was; a couch with two end tables and foot table, a sitting chair, a writing table and chairs, a large flat screen TV, a Keurig coffee maker, and a refrigerator. The bedroom included; a king size bed with end tables, a sitting chair with foot stool, another large flat screen TV, and a chest of drawers which contained the safe. the closet had plenty of room and had two bathrobes in it that you could take home for $100.00 each. The bathroom was average but very clean. Minor Issues: We had a couple of issues during our stay which did not hamper our stay in any way. There was a small leak in the supply line for the toilet which a pool of water on the floor but maintenace fixed it immediately after we reported it to the front desk. Another issue was that we did not get maid service one day which was no big deal as we just called the front desk and had fresh towels and addtional coffee sent to our room. The last incident happened late one night when we got back to the room there was a food cart that had a large bowl filled with snacks and fruit along with a bottle of crown royal. it was obviously delivered to the wrong room by mistake so we reported the error and they sent an individual up to bring it to the correct room. It was unfortunate that the mob experience tour was closed as we would have enjoyed that but it sounded like there was some possible financial backing for the exhibit and hopefully it will be back up and running in the near future. I do have to comment that if anyone has questions regarding the Tropicana you need to send an e-mail to Nicole Marshall. She helped with our questions from the time we decided to stay at the Trop. She had our resort fee waived, and also sent us follow up e-mails after our stay when we completed their survey. She is definately very customer service orientated and a pleasure to work with. It is going to be hard to go back to a "regular" room in Vegas again after staying at the Paradise Suite. Maybe I will have to see if Nicole can let us know when they are having specials on the paradise suite because I would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Tropicana!”
Reviews.Author: MissT1981
Reviews.Content: Lovely spacious room. The hotel appears to have been re-vamped recently. It is one of the smaller hotels on the strip but I liked this. That said it was still a good five-ten minute walk from the entrance to our room! We visited Nikki Beach on our first day for breakfast and the service was amazing as was the food. The Tropicana was opposite New York New York where we visited regularly via a walkway and Excalibur which has a complimentary tram shuttle to Luxor & Mandalay Bay so the location of Tropicana is perfect. Our room was on the 17th floor and very quiet. Wouldn't think twice about booking this hotel again, it hasn't got the glitz of some of the larger hotels but I really don't see this as a bad thing at all!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Trop”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuy72
Reviews.Content: We couldn't find a good price on the Strip, so we tried Priceline name-your-own for $115 and got the Trop. I'm not sure what their usual rate is, but we were very happy with the hotel. I read the reviews here and requested a double in the Paradise Tower. The woman I talked to couldn't have been nicer. We arrived at the hotel at about 6pm and walked right up to the counter where we were helped by a really nice woman named Evie. The room was really nice--very clean, spacious, etc. I have absolutely nothing to complain about regarding the room, though the bed was a bit soft for my taste (but slept fine due to vegas exhaustion!). A/C worked just fine, basic toiletries, hair dryer, etc. I agree with the other reviewers that the Paradise Tower is the way to go, since the other one is so far and seems to get noise from "Club Nikki." The casino was fine, though we didn't do any table games there, only slots. It seemed that slots paid out a fair amount and we won a fair amount. The Wheel of Fortune slots seemed to pay out nicely. The pool was nice, though the water was frigid (Oct). There weren't enough chairs/chairs were broken, but we seemed to get lucky enough to get chairs together. Pool service was nice, though drinks are pretty expensive. There is a $11/day resort fee, though this is par for the course. There is a Starbucks, a deli/pizza place, and a frozen yogourt place, all of which were good and reasonably priced. People were nice, though service was fairly "no frills." If you're looking to be fawned over, this isn't the place, but the people were all very nice. No complaints whatsoever. Maybe I'm tacky, but I loved the coconut smell being pumped all through the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise sweet!”
Reviews.Author: vegasjunkymn
Reviews.Content: Parsdise Suite was sweet. We were on the 11th floor with a great view of MGM and NYNY. Loved having a two room suite! Would be a great room if you were meeting people. Had seating for eight in the living room, and a regular door to shut it off from the bedroom. The bath still has an older shower but a nice new vanity. It was fine with us, good fan too. The hotel staff were nice, no problem there. Did have a couple issues which they corrected as soon as possible. The hotel does not have many dining choices, so we didn't eat there. Not foodies. The casino is clean and bright, like the rest of the hotel, but lacked CS. The service was good during the day but not in the evening. The pool area looked lovely!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: avgjoe1
Reviews.Content: On far south end of strip, so plan for lots of walking and sore feet even with bus passes. Rooms were clean enough, although we caught our housekeeper stealing after the 1st night and opted not to have our room cleaned after that...$67 hidden resort fee for pool use, wifi, etc....Mob Experience attraction was closed down but they're still advertising and trying to sell you tickets for it. Nice pool area and bar.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Treacle9
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in mid October 2011. I travelled with a girfriend and both of us were Vegas Virgins. We shared a twin room which was quite large with 2 very comfy beds. Personally I thought that the lighting in the room was a bit gloomy, although the lighting in the bathroom was a lot brighter. Trouble being that I prefer to sit down when doing hair and makeup and the only mirror with a chair was in the bedroom. We opted for a higher floor room, but had to take a smoking one. You could smell the smoke when you first entered but we didn't think it was to overpowering, The pool area was busy, but then again we were there over a weekend, I would imagine that during the week it would be a great deal quieter and the water was not at all cold. I did not notice any sunbeds that were broken, and whilst it was a bit of a tight squeeze we did manage to get 2 beds on each of the days. Personally I would prefer there to be no music around the pool, but it wasn't overly loud. Although on the Saturday and Sunday Nikki Beach held their pool party and the music from it was rather booming, lots of bass. We did go into Nikki Beach, but only for about an hour as we found it to be full of a younger crowd, and we couldn't really understand the rules on where we could sit or not. The beds and Cabanas can be hired for the day, but at huge cost. We asked one of the waitress about this and was given a price of $500!!!!!! and I think that was cheap, as it was the last party of the season. We took breakfast and lunch in Nikki Cafe and found the food to be of a very high quality and the staff were very efficiant and friendly. Likewise the Biscayne restaurant where we ate on our first night. Neither of us are gamblers, but we had a go and came out evens. The casino, is, in comparision to some of the other hotels rather small, but then again the hotel itself is on the smaller side. Which I prefer. We did go and see a number of the larger establishments, and they are massive. You could easily spend an entire week in some of them and still not have drank in every bar or eaten in every restaurant. We took a trip to The Grand Canyon with Sundance Helicopters which was fantastic, quite breath taking. And we went to The Gun Store, which was also breath taking, but in a totally different way!!!!! An excellent expreience. We also went to Fremont Street, but we didn't like it at all, it felt down at heel and a bit scumy. I would have no problems in recommending a stay at The Trop, it is clean, comfy, well run and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Awful - how come all the good reviews?”
Reviews.Author: CocoAvrile
Reviews.Content: Chose this based on the tripadvisor reviews - BUT my experience was way less than positive. We were offered no help with our large bags - not from the taxi to check in (and there's no ramp, only steps) or from registation to the room itself. This means wheeling your bags all the way through the casino and on and on and on to the elevator at the back. I'd asked for a non-smoking room and even though it was on a non-smoking floor, the room stank of stale smoke. When I rang to complain the employee's response was 'we can't stop people smoking in non-smoking rooms'. She offered to spray it, but cheap room spray over stale smoke doesn't exactly work in my experience. The bath was skanky, the lotions smell like stale malibu, and the bed was old. At night the boom boom boom of music went on til the early hours. Bottom line, it was a hell-ish stay and I was glad to get out of there the following morning.

Reviews.Title: “Best reasonably priced resort on strip”
Reviews.Author: tluvbear
Reviews.Content: This property was recently renovated with a $180 million dollar upgrade. It was beautiful! The pool, rooms, and common areas have dramatic changes. It has a resort feel instead of a hotel/casino feel. We were really impressed with the staff at the front desk. The front desk was very accommodating, friendly, and efficient. We found the hotel was busy but not overcrowded. The rooms are spacious and very nicely decorated. The only improvement possible for this hotel is to have a buffet restaurant for breakfast. There is a restaurant that serves breakfast but we prefer a buffet. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The pool sucks!”
Reviews.Author: mlucero78
Reviews.Content: The newly remodeled rooms are very nice, but the pool sucks! It is small, shaded until at least 10 or 11am and almost all of the chairs are broken. You have to sit up in the grass to get any sun at all in the morning, but you have to constantely move to stay in it. We were very dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Second stay this year - awesome place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Want2gobackagin
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip this year to Vegas and both times we have stayed at the Tropicana. We recently stayed Oct 17-21. The rooms are awesome and the staff are amazingly friendly. I also have to give special thanks to Nicole Marshall who has been awesome with respect to accomodating us both of our stays - thanks Nicole!!!!! People that complain about things on this site have to realize no one hotel is perfect and if you do not like something then try to do something about it! Yeesh. Another special thanks to the desk staff for assisting me with printing off boarding passes as the lobby CPU's would not work correctly yet they were more than willing to attempt to print them off for me! The maids are very polite also and do an awesome job. The casino staff and waitresses are also excellent and one night we almost had to ask them to stop serving us LOL. So again, thanks Tropicana for giving us 'specials' and we will continue to stay there when we come as it is a great place to stay...sad thing is more people will stay with reviews like this. I strongly recommend a suite in the towers as they give you soooo much room and extra amenities...however the standard rooms or strip views are also well equipped and more than comfortable. My only complaint and it is a 'me' thing is I am not fond of adjoining rooms - unless of course you know who is in it as they can be a bit noisy at times....but that again is a 'me' thing and is not against the Tropicana! Thanks again for the awesome stay...the winning at the slots was an added bonus :)

Reviews.Title: “tropicana las vegas”
Reviews.Author: derbyengland
Reviews.Content: i stayed here after my five night stay in new york with my partner after a lot of reading i booked the trop due to the great reviews ,,and i must say the rooms pool food all very good ..i dont gamble that much so not to sure about the casino but all in all a very nice stay

Reviews.Title: “It was good”
Reviews.Author: Paul D
Reviews.Content: Hotel looks fabulous after all the renovations, no problems there. Customer service is top notch, the restaurants are also top notch, breakfast buffet was great and priced fairly for Las Vegas. Pool looks amazing but unfortunately the water was very cold and drinks are very pricey, welcome to Vegas. The casino is very small but don't worry, you'll lose your money just as fast as any other casino. The rooms were fantastic, very clean, updated and LARGE! Nice flat screen HD tv, free internet which is rare for Vegas, very nice tub and washroom. We only had 2 slight negatives for the room, one was the curtains, or lack there of. They use these plastic panels that look great but unfortunately don't keep the light out, so plan on being up early if you can't stand sunlight in the morning. Two is that your room is very very far from the main entrance and casino area, plan on walking a LOT! The hotel location is also very south and far from the center, if that's an issue. We always stay at a different hotel when we visit so we wouldn't go back because of that but it was a very nice stay with no regrets. We recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated hotel and pool.”
Reviews.Author: mdsimon80
Reviews.Content: Stayed for only 3 nights. Lobby, hallways, pool, and rooms have been recently renovated. The pool was heated and lounge chairs are comfortable. The rooms wifi, and the 42inch TV all worked great. Over the street walkways make the Tropicana easy to get to bus stops, Monorail or anywhere you need to go. I found the pool to be my favorite part of my Las Vegas Vacation. I found lasvegashotels.com to have a lower price than the hotel web sight but after calling the hotel the phone attendant met their price.

Reviews.Title: “We'll never stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: pinkcanuck
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Tropicana October 18 to 22nd, 2011. We loved it....can't say enough about how pleased we were with everything. If you know Vegas at all, you know that the big hotels make you schlepp it through acres of casino just to get to the registration desk, usually followed by another 10 minute trek to the nearest elevator. Not so at the Trop! The lobby is right off the strip, registration is immediately to your left and and the elevators to Paradise Tower are directly to the right. Check-in time was less than 4 minutes, in our room on the 14th floor after 2 more minutes...it just doesn't get any better than that. The Tropicana is light, airy, comfortable, friendly. And the entire hotel is coconut scented, such a delight compared to the other strip hotels. Our room, the entire hotel in fact, was tastefully appointed and the beds were wonderful, high quality sheets, duvets, almost too comfortable to leave! Once in our room, we never heard our neighbours, the elevators nor the ice/vending machines outside our door. We couldn't hear the casino noise or pool/club music either, these rooms are well sound-proofed. We ate at Cafe Niki twice, good food, comparable prices. We dined at the hotel's Itialian restaurant "Bacio" one evening where we very much enjoyed the rissotto, the profiterole and the charming waiters. We loved that the Tropicana was connected to MGM Grand and the concierge arranged our tickets to KA at the MGM. If you do nothing else in Vegas, be sure to see any Cirque de Soleil performance, it was a definite highlight and the concierge desk made it so quick and easy. The staff at the Tropicana were always friendly and efficient, I would recommend this hotel to the most discerning traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Travebug38
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed at the Tropicana Hotel in Las Vegas October 6 - 10th. The location is very close to the airport (a $ 15.00 cab ride) and at one end of the strip (the less busy end). The staff was great, they are helpful and allowed us to check in early. The rooms were a good size and had everything we needed (including a hair dryer). The free WiFi allowed us to keep in touch with family on the laptop. The pool was well maintained and there were plenty of lounge chairs and towels for everyone. This hotel is clean, comfortable and I recommend it if you don't like line ups, we never had to wait for a cab !! Unlike the 200 people plus line ups at the busier hotels further up the strip. This hotel is located between the Excalibur and the MGM.

Reviews.Title: “refreshing”
Reviews.Author: Phil G
Reviews.Content: Another great stay at the Trop. The improvements are great. Cafe Nikki is always a pleasure to eat at. Club Nikki is an excellent spot. All staff are always smiling and seem to enjoy working there.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Room for our 30th Anniversary.”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaTraveller2020
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Vegas to celebrate 30 years together. I researched lots and the Tropicana was given great reviews everywhere I looked. The location was at the south end of t.he strip so it was a bit more walking but when you go to Vegas you should expect to walk. I called to ask about a coffee maker in the room and was told there was a charge but when I mentioned our anniversay they gave us one for free. It was one of those Kuerig machines and my husband loved it. The room had a daybed in it which was great to sit or lay on and enjoy the view from our 18th floor room. The room was great. Looked fairly recently redone and had a kingsize bed. We enjoyed the pool a few times although drink prices at the pool were high. Everything was clean. Service was great. Would definitely recommend it for others.

Reviews.Title: “definitely a nice place to stay - great value”
Reviews.Author: Jay B
Reviews.Content: Didn't know what to expect. Though I have not stayed here before, the rooms were light and airy and in good shape. I recently stayed at another hotel on the strip and paid way more for a room that was well below the quality of the Tropicana room. The lobby area was fine and the overall feel was friendly and casual.... folks seemed down to earth and not stuffy. What really impressed me, however, was how friendly the hotel staff was. Check in was smooth and as I made my way to the room, employees in different sections would greet me. I think the icing on the cake was when the engineer in the elevator greeted me and upon leaving the elevator, told me to enjoy my stay. Wow! That's good training and I hope they can keep it up. My stay at the Tropicana was very good and I felt welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: marydragan
Reviews.Content: In a day when customer service at most places seems to be at an all time low this clean, bright casino and motel withe a fabulous pool was a delight! I had stayed there a few times several years ago, loved the pool, and decided to give it another chance! When my daughter and son-in-law checked in and told them it was their first anniverary there was complimentary champagne and strawberried in their room! The staff was super friendly, the rooms and public place immaculate! Would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you again Tropicana!!”
Reviews.Author: LoveMKE
Reviews.Content: For many years we have been guests and the Tropicana and every time it gets better and better! The staff is always curious to know if we are enjoying our stay and if we need anything to make it better. On our last visit, our airline overbooked our flight home. We had the option of going to the hotel of the airlines choice, but instead we called the Tropicana and asked if we could get our room back. In about 2 minutes we had our room back at the Tropicana and we were able to enjoy one more day at the beautiful pool, relaxing bar and updated casino. Unlike the mega hotels on the strip, at the Tropicana you feel like a guest and not a tourist. My only fear about the Tropicana is the more that know about this jewel, the harder it will be to book a room in the future because they will be sold out!

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday but beware of the walk”
Reviews.Author: Amanda W
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel, very clean, room request granted and nice to be at a hotel that does not have a thoroughfare of people through it day and night! All the staff were very friendly, it was a great location to walk to the lower end of the strip and there was a bus stop beside the hotel for The Strip bus which was $7 for 24 hours and took you anywhere along the strip you wanted and then to Downtown and the Outlets as well. Slight disadvantage that a room in the Club Tower involved quite a walk from reception and the restaurants are not open particularly late if you have been on a trip but generally thought the hotel was great and would absolutely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Tower Rooms”
Reviews.Author: sleekpeek
Reviews.Content: Stayed as part of cosmos/archers direct tour in the paradise tower. Had a lovely room very clean, shutters on the window. Hotel is clean and chic since the re modelling. Overlooked MGM. Not such a maze of a hotel like the others. shame about the ice machine being out of order. Good location at the beginning of the strip good views from the walkway.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicanaaaah!”
Reviews.Author: Sharon B
Reviews.Content: We (my 18 year old son, 15 year old daughter and I) stayed at the Tropicana at the end of August/beginning of September to attend the wedding of my daughter and her fiance. We were part of a party of 15 but were the only ones staying at the Tropicana - the rest were at various hotels along the strip, all of which we visited during our stay. This was our first trip to Vegas (in fact to America) and we were a little apprehensive when we arrrived at the airport but we needn't have worried. In our opinion the hotel was a breath of fresh air compared to some of the other hotels along the strip because of its bright, airy public areas making feel that you were indeed at the beach rather than in an oppressive casino atmosphere. The rooms were clean, of a good size and the maid service was regular and thorough. Beds were very comfortable and of typical American size - large and very comfortable! Unlike neighbouring properties such as New York New York and the Excalibur there was not a wide choice of places to eat within the hotel, but the restaurant and fast food options were of very good quality. Location is great. It is one of the closest hotels to the airport. The hotel did not seem well populated at night time and this resulted in a lack of atmosphere in the casino and bar areas, compared to other hotels we visited. This was a shame because the barman who served my family was very obliging. The quietness could however be considered a bonus if you are looking for somewhere to chill out after the business of the strip. The pool area had ample sunbeds with towels provided but even though it is landscaped it did feel a little bit like a concrete jungle, maybe because it had just been completed. The reception staff were well informed and helpful. Baggage collection on departure was a bit of a shambles though and the porters did not seem to have much of an idea about prioritisation. This was just a minor irritation. We were very happy with our stay at the Tropicana and some of the other wedding guests commented on how they preferred it to where they were staying. We would go back again tomorrow - just got to win the lottery now!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer M
Reviews.Content: We recently celebrated out 10yr anniversary in Vegas (family of four). We booked a paradise suite very early and got an unbeatable deal. Everything about the hotel was perfect. The suite was great and the view of the strip was remarkable. We loved the pool area and the casino was very nice as well. It really is the best location on the strip... We highly recommend the Tropicana and hope to come across a deal like that again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn kind of nice”
Reviews.Author: Roland K
Reviews.Content: First I will say that its a vast improvement over what we experienced walking through it two years ago. It is still a struggle make your way to check in if you have your bags, stairs! We checked in early and and was told our room would be ready at 3pm (not a problem), went and checked our bag. Returned before 3pm and was told Housekeeping (HK) was running late and it would be later than 3pm. I explained we had early dinner reservations downtown at Hugo Cellars (excellent) and needed to get in our room ASAP. She said they would put a rush on it. HK didn't show up to the room until 2:55pm to do a 40 minute cleanup. When I complained of the service (3pm is check in time) they claimed I had made a special request and that caused the issue (I asked for a room w/ a view who doesn't). When we got to our room at 3:40pm we found the floor in the bathroom still dirty and the carpet sandy and an old piece of gum stuck to the side of the chaise lounge! The room windows are on the small side for Vegas standard with heat film over the glass that was an obstruction to the view, which was of the MGM and some of the strip. Another issue was at pool side where the majority of the plastic lounge chair backs were broken so you could not sit up in them. Even the pool-boy suggested we complain to management. While we enjoyed some of the restaurants in the hotel The Trop is no more than a motel at best. We booked based on this sites reviews of good service, we experienced excuses and defensiveness especially from the front desk and housekeeping. My wife and I are Vegas veterans and had been in the hospitality business for over 15 years. The Nikki Cafe staff was great

Reviews.Title: “a great refurb!”
Reviews.Author: F1ossy
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a great stay at the Trop. Fancied a change from the Luxor which was looking tired when we last visited. The refurb has been done to a high standard-the room we had in the club tower was a good size, clean, well decorated and the bed was sooo comfortable. The mattress topper and quality of the sheets was the best we had ever had. The view was also good overlooking the pool and the strip. The only slight negatives with the room was the noise from Club/Cafe Nikki which drifted upwards but having read other reviews was something we were prepared for. The room was quite stuffy at times as for some reason the air con would not go below 16 degrees c.The bathroom was also a good size with a large corner bath. The only part of the room not completely refurbished was part of the bathroom with the wall and floor tiling and bath/shower. Be warned if you are tall-ie over 5'6 in my case, as you will have to stoop under the shower head as it is fixed. Bit of shame to cut corners in the bathroom when everything else had been refurbed. The towels were also poor quality. It would be great if tea/coffee facilities were in the room as we really missed this. I appreciate having read other reviews now that the management can arrange this on request, but to be honest I assumed that if this was possible they would already have been provided-the same with the lack of fridge-not something i would think of asking for at reception! The staff were all really helpful at the hotel-but we felt sorry for the hostesses who had the worst uniform going-an unflattering and old fashioned skimpy outfit that you would expect to see in a different occupation! Thank goodness for Starbucks as the choice for the food and drink establishments was a real let down considering how nice the rest of the hotel was if you were after casual dining. We ate once at Cafe Nikki and the music was that loud it was like eating in a nightclub. On another day we had a drink outside and again the awful music was blaring-I asked the bartender if he could change the music-bless him he smiled and said he has to listen to it all day and there was nothing he could do.The hotel really lacks a decent bar to sit at and enjoy drinks/bar meals-we went to different hotels for this. Loved the scent being pumped through the casino-but be warned if you are a non-smoker, the smell of cigarettes is really thick and strong-but this is the same in all the casinos! We used Virgin holidays-watch out for their transfer bus on arrival-despite the Trop being 15 mins around the corner, we sat on a transfer bus for 2 hours!!! They took us to the far end of the strip driving down all the back streets for a bunch of hotels. This is something we complained about to the rep. I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Ichiriffic
Reviews.Content: We booked here because of a seemingly great price and many great reviews. The Tropicana was as advertised! The coconut scent, ever present through the A/C, quickly made the place feel like home. Ladonna, at check-in, kindly and professionally assigned us a room on the 19th floor in the Paradise Tower with a view of the strip. The room was large, clean and well appointed. Housekeeping was friendly and efficient each day. I didn't enjoy our first experience at Cafe Nikki (slow service and average food), but tried them again and things were much better. The Casino Floor, although small by some standards, offered anything and everything we were looking for. Look into their "Even the Odds" promotion through their Players Club to possibly be reimbursed up to $200 from slot play. I will return and recommend the Tropicana to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel On The Strip!”
Reviews.Author: Roadiboy
Reviews.Content: We came into Vegas to do the 100 mile charity bike ride. We got a great deal through Groupon 50.00 bucks a night per person (2) plus two free bottles of Ciroc vodka. What a deal! The booze is worth 50.00 alone. The room was really nice everything was like brand new since they completed the renovations this summer. Had a great view of the strip from the club tower. The lights were awesome. The staff were excellant all around, with a pleasant "good morning" everyday heading to the breakfast buffet (11 floor, thanks!) Don't miss the breakfast buffet, it may seem a little pricey (18.00) but believe me it's worth every penny. When was the last time you had strawberry crapes (sp-1)lol...and an omelette made to order? The Starbucks will come in handy after a night of gambling and fun..believe me!
