Oh yea, thanks to the valets who stored our bicycles and luggage while our room was being cleaned(we were 3 hours early). It was a very busy Friday afternoon they took care of everything...no problem... If your looking for a great hotel close to everything for a great value...stay here...If your looking for fighting pirates, dueling pianos, dancing fountains stay elsewhere...or hell stay here and walk to all that stuff...lol..

Reviews.Title: “Nice renovation, great value”
Reviews.Author: EvilBob
Reviews.Content: They really did a nice job redoing the Tropicana. It may not be the biggest or flashiest place on the strip (e.g., no exploding volcanoes or battling pirate ships), but they also don't make you pay for all that overhead. I look for clean, quiet, and comfortable rooms, and that is exactly what we got and then some. We were in probably the lowest grade of room they offer, yet it was spacious and had THE most comfortable bed I've ever experienced in any other hotel -- including those for which I've paid triple the price (e.g., Westin). The Tropicana may not have been much to look at only a couple years ago, but people really should give the new Trop a serious look.

Reviews.Title: “Light, airy, welcoming. Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Barrington55
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time here. Don't really rate the pool as you are chasing the sun all day. If you prefer drinking to gambling go next door to Hooters where a beer is $1.75c. We had breakfast there on the Restaurant by the pool and it was great with copious amounts of coffee. We saw a reply from Buckle Marshall to a review and sent her an e-mail. She replied which gave us that real personal touch so we decided to book and arrived on Oct 1st. You need a suite to get a Real strip view but I saw the MGM the airport, Hooters and David Copperfields face every night Special mention to Dave the concierge who booked our Canyon helicopter trip and to our favourite member of staff Pat who tended bar. She was a kind, lively, helpful and informative person. Thank you Tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “My stay in vegas”
Reviews.Author: linda c
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Tropicana was an excellent experience. The casino and Nikki's Cafe were clean and bright. The smell of smoke was almost non exitence. To me that is very important. The staff through out the facility were very helpful. We never left the corner. Everything we wanted was right there. We will be coming back real soon. Thanks for changing an old casino into a new and modern one!

Reviews.Title: “Coconut anyone?”
Reviews.Author: yorkspuds
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel in Las Vegas for its pool complex, hoping for a chance to relax after our 1500 mile road trip. Check-in was swift and efficient and we paid extra to retain our room until 3pm on our last day, and then up to floor 16 in the Paradise Tower. The room (a deluxe) was large, spotlessly clean, tastefully decorated, with 2 huge beds, beautiful linens, and a large bathroom with lots of good towels. There was a hairdryer, iron and ironing board, along with a large safety deposit box and free wifi. It also sports a massive television, should you feel inclined to watch US television. No fridge in the room, which we would have liked for a variety of reasons including the storing of the doggie bag! (Large US portions!) We noticed a fridge in the corridor on our last day from a room that had been vacated, and realized we could have rented one for our stay – we wish this had been pointed out to us, but maybe we just should have asked. The Tropicana is next to the airport, but the window glazing is excellent as we can honestly say that we were never troubled by aircraft noise. In addition, the Trop casino area is mostly light and bright (and we would say ‘airy’, but they do allow smoking as in all casinos in Vegas), and not as massive as some. It took us until day 2 to realize that to get into the pool complex – Nikki Beach - that you do not need to be a resident in the hotel (well, we never saw anyone checking whether people were resident, so anyone can make use of it). Needless to say, the pool area really does fill up, so it pays to stake your claim early. We also found that a huge number of the sun-beds were broken and no-one seemed to check them take them off site to get them fixed. There is an abundance of fresh towels and the pool is large and fairly warm too – note there is no ‘deep end’ – the depth ranges from 3ft to 4/5ft only. We have to comment that Nikki beach is EXTREMELY noisy thanks to the OTT loud music. The speakers around the pool churn out music constantly which was fine by us, but Club Nikki (at least, that’s what we think it was), suddenly comes to life around mid-day and the music thumps out at an ever increasing decibel level, competing with the music coming from the pool speakers – nightmare! We therefore retreated to the far end of the grass banking, which made it tolerable. Some people, we guess, must just enjoy the racket! Anther thing to point out about the Tropicana is the over-powering ‘scent’ of coconut air-freshener, which is pumped out 24/7 from the air-conditioning – it really stinks and we are at a loss as to why they do it. Thankfully, no such aroma pervades the rooms! Overall though, we thought the Tropicana was good value for money with superb bedrooms and as long as loud music and coconut aromas don’t put you off, we can recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel... but away from the action”
Reviews.Author: annieandnick
Reviews.Content: Check in (2pm) was fairly quick and we were given a room then which was an hour before check in... though it over looked the airport when we were expecting a ‘strip view’. (We were in the Club Tower). The room was big, and clean & tidy. And we had no issue with noise. We did have to call at 5.45pm one night to get housekeeping in. Cafe Nikki was great for lunch – food was good and the service – particularly from Emanuel – was excellent. Matthew on the front desk was helpful and friendly. We didn’t go to the pool or Club Nikki (seemed to be targeted for those younger than us..) Next time we would probably chose a hotel further up the strip and with a bigger casino and a greater range of facilities but had no issue with service and quality of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LuisCp_07
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed this hotel; hotel facilities are beyond expectation when comparing prices with other hotels at the Strip. We spent a week with no issues at all. Staff is very courteous, check-in/out process is incredible fast (I didn't have to wait in the line and we checked in & out on a Friday!). Room was spacious, with large screen HDTV (although they don't offer premium movie channels but... who needs to watch TV in Vegas!). Bathroom really clean and big enough so I didn't have to fight for my space! If you get a room in the Club Tower, get ready for a long walk to your room from the Casino; but, if you're thinking that walking in Vegas is not required then change your destination. We'll definitively come back to Tropicana for our next visit to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: redwoodsbay
Reviews.Content: Went to the Tropicana after reading reviews on trip advisor and seeing alot of talk about the reno's that had been done. It was much better than expected and way better than the last time I walked through the casino a few years back. THe room was spacious and very comfortable, the casino itself was a good size with a variety of tables and games(though I would like to see a few more blackjack tables). The sports book was a good size with plenty of seating and small tv's in each seat to watch the game of your choice. There were 2 good lounges and Club Nikki was really fun!! All in al the staff was very friendly and I had no complaints which is really all you can ask for when leaving home! As always good times in Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait Until next Year”
Reviews.Author: Giggreen8
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, they did a great job on all of the renovations. Had a great time hanging out at the pool. Looking forward to next year.

Reviews.Title: “Happy happy happy...”
Reviews.Author: macdan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tropicana from 22nd until 27th September. We booked 2 deluxe rooms for our family. We requested a double room, and a room with 2 beds. The rooms allocated were as requested. We were very pleased with the rooms, though they were a bit of a walk from reception. The beds were extremely comfortable. Our boys managed to maintain contact with the UK thanks to the complimentary internet in the bedroom. Overall we found the hotel to be a great choice. The reception staff were very helpful, the casino was bright and modern looking. The pool area provided a great place to relax before hiting the strip, because the weather was hot hot hot. . Our boys attended the pool party at Nikki beach and thoroughly enjoyed it. They were refused entry to the night club as they were only wearing shorts, and long trousers were required. We ate at Nikki Cafe and found the food to be very good. The hotel is positioned at the south end of the strip on the junction which also has the MGM, New York New York, and the Excaliber. Its handy for the Deuce and the Express bus. We chose the hotel with price a key factor and were not disappointed. We would happily return. The only negative comment I would make is that a number of the beds around the pool were damaged. The back rest/reclining bit that enables you to sit up did not work as the brackets were missing.

Reviews.Title: “The New Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: Theresa A
Reviews.Content: In September of this year (2011) We stayed at the New Tropicana Hotel and Casino and we had a great time. The rooms were really really nice and the employees from the front desk to the to the bell hops were very friendly and accomodating to our every need. I will plan on staying there in all future vacations there. It is nice to see it finally reborn to a top place to stay. The pool was great but I do miss the adult pool and I wish they had more casual dining places but what they do have is adaquate. Theresa from Upstate New York

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: iamtrey
Reviews.Content: I had pretty high expectations when I booked a couple of rooms at the remodeled Tropicana for a weekend of cards, football gambling and sun with some of my friends. And the results were even better than I hoped. Let's start with the rooms: They are clean, comfortable (one notoriously difficult sleeper said it was the most comfortable hotel bed he had ever slept on) and feature a pleasant décor. The sportsbook: This was a big one for my group - our entire Saturday was dedicated to watching and gambling on college football. And we couldn't have been happier with the room. There were tons of huge HD projectors to dart our eyes between, comfortable chairs and some cool nooks with big HD TVs on the wall. Before the trip someone recommended we do out football watching at Caesars Palace. We checked it out, but the bright lights from Pure washed out the images on the wall. At the Trop, they keep the lighting perfect - the picture really pops. We loved it. The service: I've been to Vegas about 10 times, and the service has been pretty good no matter where I stayed. My experience at the Trop was even better, though. Nothing crazy, just a lot of employees willing to actually interact rather than just address my immediate need. My group had great conversations with a hostess, two bartenders and two blackjack dealers. It was cool to feel like a person, not just an object to satisfy. The food: We didn't eat a lot of different food at the Trop, but we had several meals at Cafe Nikki. (One member of the group wanted to have every meal there, but the rest of us insisted on seeking a little variety.) The breakfast buffet was very good - make sure to pour yourself some real apple juice and get a custom omelet. The lunch and dinner options feature a lot of great sports bar food, and it's all well-made and reasonably priced. Other great things: The pool, plenty of card tables, fun poker dealers and one of the highlights of my trip - they serve Victoria cerveza at Cafe Nikki and throughout the casino. Thank god, a casino that serves a Mexican beer other than Corona! My only complaint is the Casino's music selection - it was really soulless. I'm talking Ricky Martin "Shake Your Bon Bon" played several times over the course of the weekend. Luckily, they don't play the music too loud (if the songs were better, I would encourage them to crank it up a bit more). I brought this point up in a questionnaire after my stay, and the hotel's VP of Hotel Operations was nice enough to email me to let me know that they're making changes. Sweet! I'll definitely be coming back to the Trop on my next Vegas excursion.

Reviews.Title: “A touch of retro always makes me happy.”
Reviews.Author: Sarah2636
Reviews.Content: The renovated Tropicana has successfully emerged as a gem on the Vegas strip! I was so impressed with the design and "feel" of the resort. The breezy, tropical touches are fabulous and the hint of retro makes me feel like Dean Martin might be lurking in the shadows. Very cool! The service was excellent and -- shock! -- the food was great. With a "beach" on one side and a lush pool area on the other side, imagine our joy when we discovered a cafe overlooking this with waterfalls, a deck and a cool breeze: Cafe Nikki served the best fried chicken I have had in years and the best breakfast. The hotel provides excellent service and all of the employees were courteous and helpful. The design of the casino areas was impressive as well. Apparently someone discovered that a tourist can thrive in light and still gamble. This is a good thing. I look forward to returning soon!

Reviews.Title: “Summer Vacation”
Reviews.Author: sherylandwayne
Reviews.Content: If you are a couple who enjoys a good nights rest I would suggest staying away from the Paradise Tower...Nikki Beach is very loud and the music goes until 3am. We asked to be moved to the main tower facing the strip and were accomodated that same day. The rooms are very clean and spacious. The owners and staff have done a terrific job cleaning up the casino and I would not hesitate to stay there again or tell my friends about it.

Reviews.Title: “An old Vegas hotel that is new again.”
Reviews.Author: Ready4FunNow
Reviews.Content: Was going to a concert at the MGM, so wanted a hotel that I would not have to fight the traffic after the concert. Read the reviews of the remodel, and thought we would give it a try. My wife and I were very pleased. Check-in was quick. Very speedy compared to other strip properties. Our room was not ready at check-in, but about 20 minutes later it was. Hmmm....where to wait. I guess the casino. Seemed like a ploy, but was surprisingly profitable. The room faced northeast. So a partial strip view. It was very clean, and the remodel was very thorough. Furniture, beds, hallways. All very attractive and clean. The pool is good. Not like some of the megaresorts, but an abundance of shade and lounge chairs. The personnel from front desk, valet, pool attendants were all very attentive and helpful. The valets were the friendliest I have experienced. A great location. Decent rates. A good facility. Definitely worth checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Trop is the place to stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Eric T
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have finally found a great Hotel after numerous stays in Vegas. This hotel will be our Hotel of choice every time we come to Vegas! You will not find another place in Vegas who has better staff and service then the Trop from the Vallet Parking, to the Front Desk Clerks, to the Maids and, last but not least the Trop Host has been the best we ever had for Hotels in Vegas! The rooms are great and very comfortable! Cannot wait till we stay here again! We recommend this hotel 100%!!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Not The Newest Hotel in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: jamespa28
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Tropicana twice in the past year and have been equaly as happy with the place on both occasions. For me the most important part of a hotel choice in Vegas is location, and being at the South end of the strip you have immediate access to all of the main resorts and activities in Vegas, which personally I'm happy to walk to. I spend a minimal amount of time at a Vegas hotel as I'm out all night and most of the day, yet I'd specifically choose Tropicana if I was offered a better priced nearby hotel - I can't fault it! Somehow they still manage to find time to clean the room around my sleep patterns. As it's been recently refurbished it feels like a brand new hotel and the rooms feel almost unused. The general feel and look of the resort is fresh and luxurious, the casino is never too busy to find a seat at your favorite table and the staff in all areas are more than helpful. Overall it's great value for money and I couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “a big thankyou”
Reviews.Author: alan l
Reviews.Content: we have been to vegas 5 times this beening number 6 and we must say from the time we arrived to the time we left,it was the best hotel we had stayed in from all the staff [cleaning to the check-in] thankyou for a great stay.xxx

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Hulkamaniac1981
Reviews.Content: The hotel was undergoing reovations at the time which I stayed there. What drew me was the price. Unfortunately due to renos I won't be staying there again as prices have rose significantly. The location was excellent. Close to airport and among many other big hotels and attractions. It was very clean and the parking was close to the doors. The one problem I found (like many other hotels in Vegas) is the distance you have to walk to get to your room. After walking miles upon miles everyday the last thing you wanna do is walk more miled to your room other than that it is fantastic. Word of advice.. buy a $7 dollar a day bus pass good for 24 hours from time of purchase. You can board the deuce, the express, or any other bus in town. If you stay in your room and like brand new and modernized hotels, check this out, you will not be dissappointed. Retro on the outside modern inside. Don't forget to tip for everything because they expect it there. If you don't, you're room is not cleaned. Trust me. Sometimes you forget and come back to a room in the same condition and that is how it stayed for the last couple nights. I did however end up stealing many toiletteries off the cart. That was more fun than tipping anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Tower”
Reviews.Author: Webster702
Reviews.Content: I lived in Vegas for over 30+ years and they did a great improvement on the rooms,up to date looks and feels, great services from check-in thru check-out, and it was best discussion for stay those nights for my birthday. Thanks to people who work there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Firechief_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tropicana this time in Vegas, it has been renovated and it looks fabulous, loved the casino area, food was excellent and the people were above service. This will be my new destination next time.

Reviews.Title: “Newly remodeled, ask for Paradise tower!”
Reviews.Author: jd3000
Reviews.Content: We were attending a conference at the Mandalay Bay, and the Tropicana was perfectly sited for it. Newly remodeled, the rooms were fairly large and comfortable. The first room we got, however, was at the first floor of the Club tower and had no view and no wifi. This was upsetting as we were still paying the full resort fee. It took them 2 days and multiple returns to the front desk (disrupting our conference) before we were finally shifted to the Paradise tower. After the shift though, the stay was quite ideal. Only complaint we had was the lack of a hot water flask, which meant your only option for a hot beverage was the 24 hr starbucks at the lobby. Service staff were always friendly though, even when they weren't able to help us out. If not for the fact that our first room was wifi-less and we had to return to the front desk repeatedly to sort out the room change, this would have been a 5-star stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality and service”
Reviews.Author: SJS0077
Reviews.Content: Front desk was so kind and generous. Service was polite and always smiled. Overall wonderful time and experience.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana made our 20th anniversary special!”
Reviews.Author: DivaE636
Reviews.Content: From the moment of check-in we knew our stay was going to be great. The check-in process was fast & easy. Because it was our 20th wedding anniversary, our representative Gerard upgraded our room to a mini-suite & waived our hotel fees. What a wonderful gift! The room was spacious, very clean, & amazingly quiet. The plantation shutters on the windows blocked out the lights. The bed was the best, most comfortable we have ever had in a hotel. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Stop looking, book your trip at the Tropicana.”
Reviews.Author: Steve F
Reviews.Content: The newly remodeled Tropicana has no equal. I base this on the level of comfort, atmosphere, table games, food, and entertainment. But the real differentiator is the friendliness of the staff. The dealers and pit bosses are personable and professional. Honestly, in all the times I've been to Vegas, I've never experienced such a home away from home feeling. When I did venture out to other casinos, I quickly found myself returning to the Tropicana. Perfectly located on the Vegas strip, it is truly like fresh, ice cold water in the middle of a parched land. Oh.. and lest I forget.. the pool was amazing. Beautiful scenery... the trees were nice too I suppose.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl L
Reviews.Content: Last time we were in Vegas we dropped by the Trop after noticing the changes to exterior. We were impressed with the changed inside too so we decided to check out the rooms on our next stay. We had a great time! Beautiful casino changes and the rooms have all been upgraded. Loved our room and the furnishings. Wireless Internet is very important to us and we're always surprised when a hotel doesn't offer it or the service is poor. NOT the case at the Trop - no extra charge and great connection. Staff was efficient and so friendly and helpful! We will definitely stay at the Tropicana again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay 10.10 - 14.10”
Reviews.Author: Elmerfudpucker
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Vegas for many years. Most recently having stayed at Caesars, Encore & Wynn. Read about recent renovations @ the Trop & having never stayed at that end of the Strip, decided to give it a shot. I contacted Nicole Marshall prior to arrival with some room requests & was answered promptly by her. Taxi from airport took about 10 minutes. Check in went very quickly and we were assigned rooms in the Paradise Tower exactly as requested. Hotel is one of the few that is set up with the room elevators right at the entrance - in other words, you don't have to walk through the entire place to get to your room in the Paradise Tower. The Club Tower seemed a bit of a walk past the pool. Our room was bright and clean and everything worked. We ate at Cafe Nikki several times - decent food & good value. Casino is not huge and is bright and airy with friendly dealers. We were there mid week and table minimums were $5 most times which was great for us low rollers. Pool has lotsa chaises and despite what was mentioned here by other posters, we never found any broken chaises...lol. There is also lots of natural shade. No problems at checkout. Bottom line is that The Trop is excellent value in a city that pushes excesses.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel with everything at your fingertips”
Reviews.Author: Bubba P
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 7 nights at the Tropicana while attending an Army Reunion and was very impressed with the quality of comfort, rooms that were very large and seemed almost sound proof, the staff from housecleaning to management were very helpful and accommodating. One drawback is that it's an extremely long walk from the lobby of the Hotel to the elevator to get to your room but it's the same for all the major hotels on the strip. I would most definitely stay at the Tropicana again if I ever get out to Las Vegas in the future. VERY, VERY IMPRESSED!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel by far”
Reviews.Author: nicole b
Reviews.Content: We loved the Tropicana. The hotel is very clean and our room was great. We didn't know anything about blackjack and found this one dealer named Ned that was willing to teach us about the game. He was great. There were some dealers like Michelle and Simmon that made you feel like you were bothering them. They were rude and not very friendly, but everyone else including Linda from house keeping were fantastic.We would stay there again. I loved the music that they were playing in the lobbies and around the pool. It was very close to the airport and coat us about $8.00 by taxi. We would recomend that you take a cab especially if your two or more people because the shuttle is $7.00 each. We were the first stop so it wasn't so bad but it is cheaper to go by cab. We also found that the bus pass is great. We found a great place close by called La Salsa Cantina, which is right by the M&M's store. They had a great breakfast for $3.99. Great service and very freindly people.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Hesitate to book the Tropicana!”
Reviews.Author: Tony R
Reviews.Content: Arrived on the morning of Oct 6. stayed 7 nights. Walked right in, no lines to check in! They had a room for me but was a double so i waited a bit for a King. No problem, only waited about an hour and was in the room by noon! The room was as pictured on their web site, very clean and comfortable! The shades on the windows are nice, but if you like to sleep in, maybe bring some kind of blind fold as it does get a little bright. You can also actually open the windows for some fresh air! Maid service was great. Casino floor is very clean, bright and airy..not dark like other casinos. Not a ton of table games but enough black jack, 3 card, let it ride etc. to accommodate my desires. Pai Gow was not always open, but why open it if no ones playing right? Slots as usual, 1 cent to high limit. Poker room has about 6 tables, sometimes no cash games going, sometimes 2 tables, tournaments a few times a day and depending on the times 1 to 2 tables. Poker room staff friendly and knowledgeable. The location is awesome. Walk ways take you to the MGM in about 2 mins, NYNY in 5, Excalibur and Luxor in 5 and Mandalay in 10. And as mentioned in other reviews, the dining options are few but the easy access to other locations makes it not a problem. So if your looking for a Nice, Clean, Convenient location Dont pass the Trop! Would def recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Bright, clean & good service”
Reviews.Author: Philspain22
Reviews.Content: Third time to Las Vegas but first at this hotel. We really enjoyed its "bright" interior both in the rooms and public areas. All the staff were really helpful and friendly. The pool area is fantastic with plenty of space (unlike many other hotel pools. If you stay in the "Club" tower then it can be noisy at the weekend on the Nikki Beach side but its no problem. The hotel is right at the south end of the stip but all the major attractions can be reached by walking (if you´re fit!). If there is one slightly negative it is the lack of food options. We would be back without question.

Reviews.Title: “Waitress problem in Tropicana .....”
Reviews.Author: Gracie M
Reviews.Content: *We got to Tropicana and our rooms should have been ready to walk in ... (but they were still cleaning).... so we had to leave our luggage with the Bell hop, so we can get our Marriage license. Got back.... the room still wasn't quite ready, so we had to play the slot machine for awhile (no problem/we got a members card and started playing).... *While playing slot machines.... We waited for a cocktail waitress to come by, every time one did, she would say "Ok, just a minute", few mins later another one, same response.... it was well OVER 1 hour & 20 mins... being shrugged by the waitresses with attitudes .... We complained to the manager (after 3 different waitress walked by/ 2 of them walked by us several times...completely ignoring us)....and he even watched for quite some time before the (actual) waitress for our area showed up .... (which shows ... they need more waitresses.... in ALL AREAS). I can understand maybe during the day...(which DID happen).... but this was at night.... and hey, I was in Vegas, and I wanted to DRINK !!! Other than that.... The casino is in a great location to walk to other casinos.... the rooms were VERY clean, the bed was very comfortable, bell hops were helpful and friendly. I guess my greatest complaint was the under staffing of waitresses ! So If you are wanting to drink while gambling .... DON'T GO TO TROPICANA ! *I'll put that under Service: POOR *Overall: AVERAGE

Reviews.Title: “Great place on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: feetpeet
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Vegas and the stay was great. The rooms and bathrooms are newly renovated, quite spacious and the beds are comfy. We were in a room on the strip with a great view of the Luxor and Excelsior. The only thing the room was missing was a small fridge, it's nice to be able to keep cold water available. The hotel is near the end of the strip but only a short walk away from most of the main hotels on the strip, if you are going to the Fashion Show Mall, Wynn or any hotels up that way you can hop on the bus as there is a stop right outside the hotel. Front desk staff was helpful, check-in and out only took moments and the ladies we spoke with would answer any questions we had. We didn't try any of the restaurants in the hotel but we did use the pool which was in good condition, Nikki Beach was closed though.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was up to Scratch,"Superb"”
Reviews.Author: SCRATCHCABSYEAH
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana was first class,anybody that has a complaint about this hotel is being very picky.The room was excellent as was the bed(a fridge would have been the icing)the bathroom was great,no.problems.The facilities were second to none,the outdoor pool was excellent with plenty of towels supplied free of charge and with two young ladies keeping the refreshments flowing.The casino was all that was to be expected with friendly and helpful staff who were both polite and inviting.Iplayed "Texas" a few times and with the antes at $1 and $2 even the smaller gamblers had a place at the table,overall very happy and wouldnt hesitate to recomend the Tropicana to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice View”
Reviews.Author: nogreater
Reviews.Content: hhotel was very beautiful. My room was on club side. Make sure to bring your walking shoes because it is a nice walk from the front desk to your room. Was told that the spa area would be open by September & it wasn't well at least not by the middle of the month when I was there. I stayed for 4 nights& got lucky at the slots :-) The hotel is pretty much at the start of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: vivallasvegas
Reviews.Content: First time at the Tropicana and would recommened it, especially if you like to be outside around the pool. The refurb was much needed and has made this hotel a great choice. The resort fee is a bit steep and I may look at Harrahs (no resort fee) Group for my next visit. javing said that. the overall cost would be a deciding factor. Todd, one of the poker teachers is really good, take advantage of the free lesson. The bed was comfortable and the room was spacious.The steaks at Biscayne were excellent. Can't fault the hotel at all. Pool was great, better then Caesars which has too much shade form the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Bill R
Reviews.Content: Recently I spent a week in Las Vegas, I stayed 3 nights at the Tropicana, 1 night at the Fitzgerald and 3 nights at the Bellago. I played at all 3. Of the 3, I enjoyed the play at the Tropicana the most. I felt more comfortable at the Tropicana, because of the atmosphere, the dealers were the friendliest and I felt at home. I play at the card tables, I am not an experienced player and I found the dealers ready to help me in my play. I do not like to run from casino to casino. I just like to sit and play at one casino. The MGM, Bellago and the other big casinos are too busy for me. The dealers are not friendly or helpful. The Fitzgerald was not what I wanted, because some of the games were quite different from those on the strip. When I go to Las Vegas, I will return to the Tropicana. I found a home in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Return to Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: Vegascane
Reviews.Content: We vacation in Las Vegas two to three times a year. We had been primarily going to MGM Grand, however, based on excellent reviews we switched to the Trop last June. Our stay was outstanding (see previous review). As a result we returned to the Tropicana for a seven day vacation late September. Once again we were very pleased with the hotel. Every staff member we came in contact with went out of their way to make our stay a comfortable one. A special thank you for outstanding service must go to Kimberlee and Mel on the front desk and lifeguards David, Samantha, Tristan and Cody. The only poolside negative was the lack of workable chaise lounges. I would estimate 25% of them did not have back supports. How the hotel allowed this to deteriorate to that level is beyond me. Only other negative is there are not enough fast food establishments on premises. I frequent the sports book daily for a lengthy period of time and had to go across the street to the MGM for a lite meal at the Stage Deli or at their food court. The sports book is outstanding. State of the art screens, comfortable seating and helpful personnel. Only other negative is Alhambra Lounge only had live entertainment one night during our entire stay, and that band was pretty poor! Had to go to Excalibur, Gold Coast and Orleans lounges to catch some great cover bands that flourish in Vegas. Still, I highly recommend the Trop as the place to stay in Vegas for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the renovations!”
Reviews.Author: BeardsleyB
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Tropicana many times over the past 10 years. I've always returned because of the fantastic location, warm and friendly staff, great slots and tables, comfortable rooms and all for a great price! This last trip to the Tropicana proved to be the best so far. The renovations were fantastic! I was blown away with the amount of work and detail that went into the remodel. The same great feel was there (and the same great staff!). I was also pleased to find a Starbucks just steps from the casino floor. Well done. I WILL be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Trop!”
Reviews.Author: airhughes
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. It has been spiffed up to a very nice level. The employees are wonderful, friendly, and very accommodating. I will plan on staying here on every trip to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Good, friendly base in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: Beryl W
Reviews.Content: I stayed here before and after a Canyonlands tour for 5 nights in total. I found all the staff to be friendly and helpful and the hotel was in a good position to enable guests to enjoy all that the "Strip" has to offer, without being too over the top and loud. The people at the Concierge desk were brilliant, especially Matthew. They could arrange anything [legal!] that was available in the area. I would have found a fridge and coffee-making facilities in the room useful but there were places within the hotel where you could buy drinks and snacks. The bedrooms were large and clean and my bed was really comfortable. The whole place had a happy, relaxed atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - but lacks in some areas”
Reviews.Author: travellingmetis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the tropicana for three nights over Columbus Day weekend - our first time in Vegas. The price was gray and our travel agent said that there were lots of renovations done. We got to the desk and they didn't have our strip view request in file, so the front desk moved our room, no questions asked. When we got to our "better" room, we realized it was next tithe elevator and coke machine and had foam on the floor and two giant red stains in the carpet. On our way to the room, we also passed cleaner mopping up something from the floor across the hall wearing a full visor. The floor wasn't good, but the beds were great and so was the bathroom. The pool was great and overall the service wavpretty good. Other then the dirty floor (which made us a little uneasy about the cleanliness), the whole hotel just felt old. It seemed like the people Staying there were mostly over 40, the waitresses were wearing old uniforms and the decor seemed old. Next time we come to Vegas, we won't BR staying t the tropicana. There are just too many hotels to choose from to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: cpearson001
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of the other great reviews about the Tropicana on tripadvisor. They were right, we had a great time. The hotel and room were both clean. If you are looking for the party spot at your hotel, then not the right place. But, if you are looking for a great home base, this is the spot. Good location at the south end of the strip, so you have a great starting point. We would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tradervicky
Reviews.Content: This is an OK Hotel, recently renovated, OK motel like rooms; lots of tour groups were there. This is not a luxury Hotel by any means, middle of the road. Good pillows and comfortable beds--had to call the front desk at 6:15 in the evening to tell them my room had not yet been cleaned and they didn't seem the least bit shocked. Food at small restaurant was OK, pool OK, had a poolside Cabana, it too was OK. Casino was smallish but the machines gave reasonable pay-back which was good. In all fairness, I usually stay at the Bellagio but was in Vegas for a family reunion and some of the group could not afford to stay there so the Tropicana was selected, could have been a lot worse but pales in comparison to Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Twice as nice at Trop”
Reviews.Author: hoel
Reviews.Content: After a fantastic first visit to the Tropicana following its renovation, we decided to go back a couple of months later. We once again got a great room in the Paradise Tower overlooking the Strip. Once again we had an incredibly comfortable bed and plenty of room to move around in. From Nicole in Guest Services to Adam at Nikki Beach, the staff continues to impress. Excellent customer service with a smile. We spent an afternoon lounging at the pool at Nikki Beach and returned late that night to take in the sights of Club Nikki when it turns into a great dance club. You really can't beat the location, comfort, vibe and energy at the new Trop. As you can tell from other reviews, the word is spreading fast!

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsBAM
Reviews.Content: Our first time to Vegas is a memorable one thanks to the Tropicana. My husband and I were celebrating our 10th anniversary during our stay Oct. 5-9. When we checked in around 10 pm, Sonie really rolled out the red carpet for us. She upgraded our deluxe king room to a club deluxe king room and waived our resort fee for the entire stay. If that wasn't enough already, Sonie went above and beyond when she had complimentary champagne and chocolate covered strawberries delivered to our room. It was an amazing beginning to our trip. Thank you so much, Sonie!!!! All the Tropicana staff is excellent. My husband would like to thank Lynn also. She made playing at the black jack table an exciting and fun expierience. Go by the non-smoking black jack table and tell her hello during the night shift. Our room was always clean and tidy. I loved the lotion and wish I could buy some more. The room was really large as well as the bathroom. The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable (a big plus since my husband likes a lot of pillows). It's location was excellent for seeing the Strip for the first time. I can't say enough about the Tropicana. We highly recommend this hotel to all visitors, especially first timers.

Reviews.Title: “Long (VERY LONG) overdue review!!!”
Reviews.Author: deanvalens
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tropicana a while ago (like January 2011) and after my experience I meant to write a review.. better late than never, right? So here goes... I moved from the East Coast to AZ early this year and before I started my new job I decided I would treat myself to a long weekend in Vegas. After some elaborate room searching I was able to get a great deal for my stay (I booked 2 consecutive reservations; one for the weekdays and one for the weekend and ended up with a great price!!). Now when I got to the hotel I was exhausted (I had clocked about 14 hours of travel due to delays and a missed flight). The bellman was immediately offering assistance and got me over to the front desk right away... Small wait at check in but nothing out of the ordinary... and then... The front desk set the tone for my stay.. The front desk agent was being polite and doing that small talk thing that they have all been taught to do (you know what I am talking about) but the difference? She was actually listening... She asked me to wait a moment and stepped away, when she came back she said "I imagine you are tired after such a long day. I've gone ahead and upgraded you to a nice quiet room so that you can relax". She set up my reservations so that I could stay in the same room straight through the weekend and made me feel like she actually cared... I get escorted to my room by the bellman and he points out all the renovations along the way. Now, I remember my first trip to Vegas about 10 years ago when the Trop seemed to be going in the same downward spiral as all the other Vegas classic hotels (the Sands, Sahara, Frontier... etc). I can only say one thing after walking the renovated "These people know what they are doing and are bringing the gem back!!" The hotel was clean as a whistle, the hallways felt plush as you walked and they smelled awesome. All along the way the bellman made recommendations according to what I said I liked to do... he mentioned some great restaurants, 'must see' Vegas attractions and gave me the 411 on how to get around Vegas and enjoy myself... PERFECT! Now the best part... The room!!! They did it right... The linens and bed were just what the doctor ordered, the room was massive and had a decent view (it was a view Eastward so none of the casino lights were visible from my room... i.e. I got a full on black out that was perfect for sleeping. VEGAS NAP A SUCCESS). Plenty of storage in the room too! The bathroom was decent and the amenities were great... was it the best bathroom ever? No. But it was all I needed for this stay. Housekeeping during my stay was more than I expected... The room was immaculately clean each day and when I ran into a room attendant in the hallways they would always smile, greet me and ask if I needed anything (ohh yeah, when I asked for anything, they actually followed thru and delivered). The casino staff was cordial and polite. I always had a drink within a few minutes of sitting down to gamble and there was regular presence on the floor. The selection on the casino floor was pretty decent FYI, for the Vegas/gambling novice the Monopoly Big Event machine all the way in the back is a lot of fun if you have a group of friends with you.. play the "invaders from the planet moolah" machine in the middle.. even if you lose it is a hoot and a half.. yes I am easily entertained by some slot machines. Everything during my stay was smooth and comfortable... I am so glad that this Las Vegas gem is coming back! Check out the Trop!!! I heard that the rest of the renovations are almost completed and that it is even better!! (Ohh yeah, you'd better believe that I will write a review after I check them out again)

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hayleyann1986
Reviews.Content: I booked the Tropicana after a recommendation and also the reviews on TripAdvisor. I emailed Nicole Marshall initially to request a paradise tower room which was granted on arrival - a fabulous strip view room - thanks Nicole!! We visited for a week in August. Could not fault the hotel, very friendly, lovely tropical setting and the beds in the room were the comfiest I've ever experienced - both of them! (There was just me & my partner!) Very large bathroom and just cannot fault the room at all! Very spacious and clean. The pool area was very busy but we weren't very early so might be more available earlier in the day. We only went by the pool once. Gorgeous gardens and lovely pool if small! Slightly strange to be asked for ID for a soft drink however at the bar pool?! The casino area is small but friendly. We're not a gambling couple so cannot comment more. The hotel location is on the strip and connected to MGM and Excalibur. Very convenient, however, it is not central. Walking the length of the strip can be done but the walk back is tiring! (Your feet will be very sore if you walk everyday like we did!) Cannot comment on Club Nikki as we did not go due to a very long queue! The club also seemed very 'pretentious' as did many of the clubs in Vegas, but I may have been wrong! Also didn't eat in the hotel as were tempted away to the buffets and restaurants in the other hotels. Overall, very happy with the price paid for this hotel and can see it going from strength to strength. I wouldn't stay again, but not due to the hotel; I'd like to experience a different hotel next time as you cannot visit Vegas once - amazing place!!

Reviews.Title: “Good but the pool area needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: LexyC
Reviews.Content: Firstly, if I was a first time visitor to Las Vegas (and I LOVE Las Vegas!) I'd give this 5 stars. But I'm giving it 3 stars. I want to focus on the good things first, because it has many great points. It's a great hotel, there's no doubt about that, it's in a fantastic location - on the junction with New York New York, Excalibur and MGM Grand - it's light and airy in the casino (and not too large), the staff are amazingly friendly and the price is good for where it is situated. It's recently been refurbished and they've done mostly a great job. We had a room on the 17th floor in the Club Tower (there's no 13th floor!!) and the view was of the south end of the strip and the pool. Wonderful. The rooms are clean with good amenities, lovely lovely housekeeping staff and a decent size. Why I've given it 3 stars? Well if it's not your first time in Vegas, you'll no doubt be aware that it's **exhausting** to wander round all day. So you'll want to sunbathe by the pool. The pool is freezing. It was 95 degrees outside, but the pool was soooo cold. Most of the sunloungers were broken. The functional sunloungers were all taken by about 9.30am. Please Tropicana management sort out the sunloungers!! And then to the music. The music piped through to the normal pool area is fab, a mix of good popular stuff, appealing to everyone.... then at 12 noon the music from Nikki Beach starts (the part of Tropicana where you have to be 'beautiful' to lounge in a cabana, and pay to get in - hence it's never full) - now I'm no pensioner - I'm 35 - but the music is SO LOUD it's disgraceful. A thumping bass line of dance music all day from lunchtime that overrides everything else - I had noise cancelling earphones in and could still feel it thumping against my (broken) sunlounger. I really hope someone from Tropicana reads this. It's awful. Everyone around me thought it was awful. Please make it stop. Once the pool area is sorted or if you don't intend to relax at any point, then go for this hotel. Otherwise, don't expect to relax even for an hour!!

Reviews.Title: “Fresh n clean Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Travelallaround
Reviews.Content: On arrival there are porters there to greet you and take your bags inside which was nice. Checked in straightaway, lovely fresh smell of coconuts. Room was spotless with 42" flat screen tv and large extremely comfy beds, BOSE radio & i pod docking station. View of the airport which we changed rooms the next day for a view of the strip. The customer relations manager Nicole gave us a fridge free of charge to keep my partners meds in which was nice of her, if you`ve got any queries she will be happy to help.Drinks at the pool excellent..Mohito`s were made by them crushing the lime with the mint 1st for maximum flavour but unfortunately at the inside bar the bartender was new and didnt know how to make them so he got his colleague to make them and he just put sliced lime and mint leaves into the glass, it cost $24 for 2 Mohito`s at the bar and they tasted like a glass of soda with no alchohol in and no flavour. So excellent cocktail makers at the pool , so tasty..thankyou. Be careful of taxi drivers, one charged $28 from Freemont to our hotel (should be $20) , they go onto the Freeway if you dont tell them. Wanted to go and spend a lot of money on the last night on the Roulette table but there was only two which were too busy so had to leave it and do it in the morning which wasnt as much fun as was rushed. No Happy Hour by the pool or in the hotel which was unusual. Didnt venture into Club Nikki as wasnt given any tickets by the hotel, until the last night they were giving free tickets to there on the streets on the strip. I refused to go in as didnt want to be used to make up numbers.Im sure its lovely in there. All in all its a wonderful hotel with friendly staff .

Reviews.Title: “Birthday trip”
Reviews.Author: Mattias_K_1980
Reviews.Content: This was my second second Columbus Day Weekend trip to Tropica. Tropicana has to be the best value hotel on the strip. The service is excellent and the rooms and the casino are are really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: palmtree2122
Reviews.Content: Compared to the competing hotels in the price point, the Tropicana is clean, comfortable and the service was friendly. The guest rooms have been recently redone and include wooden shutters, and large flatscreen TVs. Our room, in the club tower, was clean and had two queen beds with feather duvets - great to crash into after a long day and night of exploring the Strip. Like most large Vegas hotels, guests have to enter via the casino floor. The Tropicana casino was fairly small, quiet and bright and clean. Our check in was pleasant and the receptionist was friendly and helpful. We didn't use many of the hotel facilities - too busy running around the city - but the pool was clean and warm and the service in the Starbucks was great. As a note, if you have a sensitivity to smells or perfumes, this might not be the right hotel for you. The scent of the air freshener the hotel uses to mask cigarette smoke in the casino is really overpowering and travels throughout all of the hotel's common areas.

Reviews.Title: “Bargaign chances & recently renovated”
Reviews.Author: the_oslo_gooner
Reviews.Content: As most hotels in Vegas, the reception was actually quite hard to find, as you have to navigate through some gaming machines and black jack tables in order to get there. Check in was not the smoothest I've ever encountered, and when arriving apparently only smoking rooms were available. A bit of a bummer - and I did not feel that the reception staff went the extra mile to accomodate this. Apart from this poor start to our stay, the rest of our stay lived up to the expectations. As several other have mentioned, the hotel is recently renovated. Our room was large/huge and clean. Pool area was really nice, and had a good casual vibe. The restaurants on the premises (both the Biscayne and Bacio) are one of the VERY few places in Vegas which is actually not noisy, and a nice retreat from the hustle and bustle of Vegas. Food is good also. We paid next to nothing for our rooms (midweek), and good rates are still quite easy to come by.

Reviews.Title: “First time in this underated gem! Will not be the last”
Reviews.Author: Solobay
Reviews.Content: Spent 12 nights here and could not have been happier. Got amazing deal on a Paradise Suite by booking early. Check in was around 9pm on a Monday night - no queue, great staff no issues in room 10 minutes later with luggage following 5 mins after a call. Room was well above expctations with coffee maker, fridge, water(restocked every day), resort fee covered stuff like free wireless access to internet, two huge TVs. View was slightly obscurred by advertising on outside of building but most seem to have these. On entry safe was locked but security had it opened 10 mins after call. ps large safe enough for 17" laptop. Room maid service was awesome, Place was spotless and restocked every day, plenty towels and great bedding that was changed a few times. Ate at Biscayne Bay and Nikki qualityfood, reasonable prices, good service. Well stocked shop in foyer. Taxis always available. All staff we spoke to were very courteous and efficient. Ordered some room flowers via Conceirge in advance of arriving and delivered as ordered (and with more style than I would have done them - bloke thing) Spoke with the now famous Nicole re room facilities and possibility of higher floor and quick responses and extremely helpful. Would recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “One of the brightest hotels on 'The Strip'!”
Reviews.Author: underpaid
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Club Tower from 27th Sep to 6th Oct. The rooms are a really good size, beds very comfy and there is a huge TV, iron/board and a room safe large enough to take a 15" laptop! The bathroom had a good range of towels, an enormous bath with shower, which is fixed so had limited adjustment. Shampoo, conditioner, lotion and soap are supplied. We ate in the hotel at Bacio and Nikki Beach, food good and reasonably priced. Be warned though that the Club Tower is right at the back of the hotel and a long walk to the entrance/reception area! The Trop is situated at the southern end of The Strip on one corner of Tropicana Avenue. Excalibur, New York, New York and the MGM Grand are arranged on the other three. We found the bus service to be the most efficient and cost effective way of travelling up and down, $5 for a multi-use ticket lasting 2 hours and $7 for one lasting 24 hours. The monorail is expensive, difficult to access and stops a fair distance from The Strip, at the back of the hotels. Whatever you do, take comfortable shoes because Vegas involves a lot of walking. If not, the hotel will hire out a motorised wheelchair by the day! My daughter got married on the 3rd Oct, stretch limo, service, licence, flowers, photos, DVD and internet viewing all for approx £600! Try doing that at home? It all went beautifully and we had a wonderful meal at Maggiano's afterwards! Would definitely recommend! We are all glad we chose the Tropicana and would recommend it to anyone as a good base for exploring all Vegas has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “New and Fresh”
Reviews.Author: Nim P
Reviews.Content: Located at one end of the strip this hotel is nice, clean and recently renovated and you can tell. We first booked a strip view room but upon entering the room we found the toilet was broken called house keeping and got a call back from reception telling us they cannot move us, had to tell the lady i'm not looking for a upgrade or anything just want the toilet working 20 mins later a guy came up and said he was going to replace the inside bits then got a call telling us that it cant be fixed and they will have to move us to a room with no view. I wasn't really fussed but it ment lugging our bags back down to reception and then across the hotel to a room on the opposite side of the hotel. finally got to our new room and found the mini safe was locked out but couldn't be bothered to complain as we wanted to go out and explore. Hotel is pretty nice, rooms were clean and well appointed, loved the radio with the iPod dock as it chaged my iPhone though the night. Staff were generally nice apart from when they thought i was trying to blag an upgrade. nice to see a security guard patrolling the car park. I would stay here again if i had to but would try some of the other hotels first.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: KoganSteve01
Reviews.Content: Wow, completely re-done. Great job! Checkin was a breeze. The new pool was beautiful. I was pleased to see that they kept the original Tiffany ceiling over the casino. The rooms are really comfortable and apointed nicely. I had a suite with an awesome view. Really nice when your staying for a few days. Its location works out great as its close to everything I wanted to do. Went to their newer attraction they call "The Mob". Interactive and fun, my group had a great time. I was pleased at how freindly thier team members were too. Lots of places to stay in Vegas but Tropicana will get my business again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, fresh, and good value”
Reviews.Author: ems1714
Reviews.Content: Just spent three nights at the Tropicana and was very impressed with the new, clean rooms. The whole place is newly remodeled and I didn't have any complaints. I asked for a quiet room because I had to do some studying/writing while I was here and the reception lady happy obliged. The bed was so comfortable - I look forward to getting back to the room each night to crawl into it! It certainly is not Aria or the Cosmopolitan, but it has a good, classic, light and airy feel when you walk in the front entrance. The staff were very pleasant and helped me to extend my reservation for an extra night. I don't think you can beat the value for money. Stay here and enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Patrick Ireland 7th Oct. 2011”
Reviews.Author: GemmaCo_
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 10 nights stay in Tropicana. It was our first time to Vegas and we had a very pleasant stay. We were on 21st floor in Paridise tower and room was very comfortable and clean. On arrival, the checkin desk was so welcoming and took on board our request for quiet room. Situated at the southern end of strip, it is very convenient to public transport which is very efficient. Very close to the airport, but taxi driver on arrival decided to take the "long route" to the hotel making it expensive. Request direct route.!! We loved dining in Nicky's restaurant, breakfast buffet very good and evening dinner lovely to come back to. Staff happy to fulfill all requests. Pool was lovely and plenty of loungers but unfortunately most were broken but we understand they are due to be replaced. The small size of casino was preferable to the huge casinos in other hotels. The staff are so friendly and welcoming they made our stay a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY LOOKED BRAND NEW!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kathrine1985
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Tropicana in September 2011, we were there for a two week holiday, and it was the cheaper ones that we could afford. It didnt take long at all to get to the airport, it took about 10 minutes, which was great. Arriving in las vegas though we paid $20 in a taxi and when coming home we paid $10, so think they ripped us off when arriving, it is a bit of a difference. When arriving at the tropicana it did stand out, it looked very white, and new. It was a very slow check in though, the woman did not seem to know what she was doing, so after a very long flight it took her about 20 minutes too check us in and i just wanted to get to the room. The hotel is spotless inside, its just had a renovation, was really nice. Its not as big as some of the hotels, think its because its one of the first that was built, its no were near as big as the bellagio, mgm, mirage etc. The casino was a nice size though, not too big that you wont get lost, and the croupiers were good fun we had a laugh with them. Because it was not as big as other hotels sometimes the tables were full all the time, so we had to wait sometimes. The drinks are free though as long as you gambling, i was happy as i could have champagne cocktails. There is a small takeaway restaurant in the hotel, they do a sandwich called the reuben and it was the nicest sandwich ive ever had. The pool area was nice, relaxing, vegas can be tiring so it was nice to lie in the sun some days. You do have to get down to the pool early though, the sunbeds go very quickly, the ones that are left are usually broken. Our room was lovely, nice decor, quite spacious. We had a great view from our hotel, we overlooked the strip and was next door to the mgm. The bed was very comfortable, and big. The staff were nice at the tropicana, we got on with them very well, they were friendly. We would stay at the hotel again, it was not a hectic hotel which felt nice when being in vegas just to get away from the crowds sometimes, it felt like a break.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: Janet2158
Reviews.Content: The rooms were large, very clean and comfortable. We only stayed for 4 nights, so didn't really have time to use any of the hotel's amenities, but the pool area looked very inviting and the casino was clean and bright compared to most of the others we saw. The staff were efficient and courteous. We ate at the restaurant in Hooter's Casino several times (just a few minutes walk from the Tropicana). The breakfasts and dinners were brilliant, and very reasonably priced. Even though we bought 24-hour access passes for the buses, we ended up walking most of the time because the buses were full and we couldn't get on. They obviously need to have buses running more frequently. The hightlight of our trip was seeing Rod Stewart in concert at Caesar's Palace - what a fabulous show!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: floweringviolet
Reviews.Content: First of all, what do they spray at the front entrance to make it smell so good? Well, like many have mentioned on here, this hotel has recently been remodeled. You can definitely tell where they put the money and where they didn't. Casino area looks a little run down & the carpet in that area is a bit worn. The rooms are super nice, clean, and "fresh" looking with flat screen tv's & pretty much look just like how they look as Tropicana advertises them on their website. The bad thing in our room was that the ventilation wasn't that great. Our room was on the hot side and we had to call someone to fix our AC unit because the temperature wouldn't go down. The other part of the hotel that is not so great are the showers. The shower head is really low (annoying if you're tall like me) & the knob was so old and hard to turn that I literally thought the whole thing was going to fall out of the wall when I was yanking on it to get the shower to turn on. Overall, I was pleased with the hotel, but wouldn't rate it 5 stars, which I guess makes sense since this is not a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great bang for the buck!”
Reviews.Author: Justin_502
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel rooms, they did a great job on the remodel. I would book there again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel,good location”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_MumSydney
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel close to all the attractions of the las vegas strip - it is more up at the one end of the strip rather than in the middle area. I immediately noticed each time we entered the hotel the strong, sweetish deodarised smell of the public areas - unpleasant. i'm not sure what is being used but someone is being overgenerous with it Our room was a good size and nice and quiet for sleeping. Only complaint was the shower tap was very stiff and i struggled to pull it out to get any water. we stayed in the back tower which is a good 5 minute walk to the front lobby so if that is a problem to anyone they need to request a room in the front section of the hotel. the hotel swimming pool and garden area was very attractive and inviting. On checking out we discovered we had to pay " a resort fee" something we were unaware we were going to have to pay and which we found annoying. Still not sure what it was for and why we were billed it..

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Yolanda50
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at the Tropicana, stayed at the TI last time which was also great. The staff was very accomodating when I expressed my concern about being in the club tower as I had read reviews about the noise and they then put us in the paradise tower. It was a little noisy as we were on the north side right by Las Vegas Blvd. which is very busy, but not too bad. I love the smell of coconuts whenever we were in the hallways. Our room was nice, the beds super comfortable and the bath clean. We didn't have time to try out the pool, but it looked like a lot of fun. I would definitely stay here again, but would also like to try out the other hotels on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, average quality”
Reviews.Author: WyEm
Reviews.Content: We stayed her from September 27-30, 2011 in one of the new upgraded "City View" rooms. The rooms are nice, clean and good sized. The "city view" was not much. We had a view of the pool and the airport. Not so nice. The casino is one of the smallest on the the strip which was very surprising, although table minimums were low mid-week. The pool was decent, but not great. However, the staff were all very pleasant and helpful. Frankly, there are better resorts on the strip for the same money with much better and more varied amenities. We enjoyed our stay, but probably will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great service”
Reviews.Author: Mitchesh
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana is situatd at the southern end of the Strip, close to the airport so your in your room before you know it. Recently refurbished, the casino is much brighter and welcoming now and the staff are happy to help. The pool is welcoming although rather cold for my liking :) but there are plenty of sunbeds.There are monorails close by south to the Mandalay Bay and North to Harrars and beyond. Cabs are affordable if you ask them to avoid the Strip and make sure the driver repeasts back your destination, one tried to take us to the Trump even thougth we told him twice we wanted the Tropicana. For the price the trop is excellent value and well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: Amy180911
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon trip around the USA. Rooms are really generously sized, nice decor and the hotel is at the bottom of the LV strip but in the lively area just by MGM. The staff were pleasant, hotel very clean and nice cheap taxi ride from the airport. Highly recommend the Purple Reign show just next door at Hooters too :) Good wifi connectivity from your room too great for keeping in touch with home.

Reviews.Title: “6 nights at Tropicana last week”
Reviews.Author: momtwinsmm
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 6 nights at Tropicana. First 4 nights were in the Club Tower. My husband contacted Nicole before we arrived and told her it was my bd & our anniversary and she had a huge surprise for us when we arrived. We were put in a Club Spa suite and boy were we excited--arrived at 1 am. Shortly after we got in the room the phone rang and we were told that there was going to be a delivery to our room and within a few minutes chocolate cake & champagne arrived. So at 1 am after being up almost 24 hours we were enjoying our goodies. The suite was beautiful and very spacious with a coffee maker, refrigerator, spa tub, sauna, and a huge shower. The bed was comfortable and they even gave us masks to keep the light out. It was fantastic and the room was beautiful, clean & well cared for--we felt like royalty. We had to move the second night and I told my hubby to be prepared to come back to reality for the next three nights as we were leaving the suite but much to our surprise the deluxe plus room we have we also wonderful. The bed was again great, the tub large although not a spa tub we great and the room was neat, clean and spacious. I loved the bright colorful furnishings--they were refreshing. We then left the hotel for two nights in AZ and returned for our final two nights in Vegas and were booked in a Deluxe Room in the Paradise tower. This room although not as big as the plus room was nicely furnished and well taken care. It was clean and the the bed was comfy as the other two. Check-in was efficient--no line, the valet parking was well staffed and efficient and everyone working was very friendly and it looked like the employees enjoyed working there. I loved the brightness of the casino it was a welcomed break from the dark dingy casinos. We did not eat at either of the full service restaurants but had great pizza at the South Beach Market place one day and several times enjoyed the gellato at the Naked Spoon. Because of the layout of the property we missed Cafe Nikki completely--just never realized that is was separate from Club Nikki--so I can't comment on it. Will stay there again next time in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Another Amazing Visit at the Trop!”
Reviews.Author: Joshua G
Reviews.Content: This was second stay at the trop we stayed in June of 2011 and just again now the last week of September, and our second visit even exceeded our great experience we had before. The resort has been beautifully renovated we stayed in an awesome suite with a bar area and living spaces and an awesome bathroom area designed perfectly for multiple people needing to get ready to go out and hit the strip. The pool is so comfortable and relaxing and is not overly crowded which is very nice not to have to wake up extra early on vacation in order to save a spot at the pool. I am a member of the Tropican Rewards Program and earned $55 worth of resort credits which I was able to use at the resort convenient store or at any of the restaurants, we chose to eat at Nikki Beach Cafe and enjoyed a delicious lunch for FREE! We were traveling with a large group totaling 20 people in 8 seperate rooms, they staff was so friendly and accommodating they were able to have all of our guests on the same floor which was so convenient for us! What truly sets the Tropican apart from the rest of the strip is the staff and service you can tell that the people their are proud of their resort and take pride in their work. I would highly reccomend the Trop to anyone heading to Vegas you will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, not fancy, but good”
Reviews.Author: oldways
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana is one of the last of the original Strip resorts not to have been torn down and replaced with a mega-resort. The rooms are clean, comfortable, and affordable. I like the Tropicana for what it is. However, if you are a Vegas snob who must stay at only the finest places, then this place is not for you. It is old and dated. I like it for that reason, but many don't. Go while you still can.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent priced, very clean and great staff a all round great base for a stay in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: Dizzy0n
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Vegas and we were very well looked after by Nicole and the team at the Tropicana. We stayed in the Club Tower so we didn't have any street noise and minimal noise from Niki club but then you don't come to Vegas for peace and quiet!! The room was spacious clean and well furnished. All in all can't find anything negative to say a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “1st - but not last visit to The Trop!”
Reviews.Author: Maureen W
Reviews.Content: Have been to Vegas 11 times, and because of the make-over this was 1st time at the "Trop" and certainly wont be our last! The make-over was very chic, clean and ALL staff very friendly, nothing was too much trouble! ( Hello Gerard! ) Unlike most of the other hotels we got a hello from every table every time we passed by n the casino which was a nice toutch! The only drawback was the condition of sun-chairs (but if you were down at the pool area early enough you could find some non-broken ones!) which was a shame as this lets your otherwise perfect hotel down!

Reviews.Title: “Great way to celebrate wedding anniversary.”
Reviews.Author: Araglinpoppy
Reviews.Content: We had a super time at the Tropicana during our 17 night stay to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Secured a good deal on the city view room in Paradise Tower by dealing directly with Nicole Marshall. Check in was super fast which was greatly appreciated after a long flight. Each and every day housekeeping was carried out with any complaints from us. We both loved the size of the casino as it meant you got used to different slots and were able to find them again with ease. This helped me manage a win of over $800 on a 1cent machine, a great start to our holiday.The pool area was fantastic other than having to spend too much time seeking out a sun lounger that wasn't broken, I would guess that over 50% of them fall into that category. One of our holiday highlights was seeing the Gladys Knight show which was truly memorable. I was not impressed with the car rental company as the staff were quite ignorant and the prices were very poor value. To make a car rental reservation I used the internet in my room and booked with Avis who have a desk and collection point in Excalibur saving over $200 on a 4 day rental.To all the reviewers who complain about the location may I suggest they look at a location map prior to booking and if you don't want to be so far South on the Strip go elsewhere. Our holiday finished with check out by probably the most helpful desk operator,Gwen, we have encountered. We will be back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana was Great!”
Reviews.Author: Nisa D
Reviews.Content: I switched hotel through my travel agent at the last minute and he offered us the Tropicana because it was in the same price range...great choice. The hotel was clean, the bed was comfortable and the staff was great. The food was at Cafe Nikki was good as well; I believe we ate there 3 times. There was a small hike to our room but after the first 2 times it didnt seem that bad. The only real issue I had was the pool area. The day we decided to go to the pool all the chairs were broken so we went over MGM's pool instead. The pool area seemed nice so it would have been nice to relax out there for a bit. Overall it was a good experience

Reviews.Title: “Ok, not great”
Reviews.Author: DavesGirl2005
Reviews.Content: We have been to Vegas a few times and like to try new hotels on the strip each time. So I booked 2 rooms at the Tropicana based on the many excellent reviews on Trip Advisor. When we got to the lobby for check in I had a feeling that the Tropicana was not going to live up to my expectations. The casino felt like an 80's flashback. We booked our stay through Allegiant Air, so our rooms were paid in advance. However, we had to pay the 9.99 per day resort fee when we checked in. I asked to have the fee removed when we left, as we did not use any of the services the resort fee includes, but they would not do so. The rooms were updated, but ours seemed a little worn already. There were a couple chips in the counter top and dresser and a stain in the carpet. The room seemed clean, but the water ring from a glass sitting on bathroom sink was there when we checked in and it was still there when we left 3 days later. The other reason we booked the Tropicana was for the pool. The pool area is nice, but the water was cold! So that was a disappointment for us. Overall, it was an ok stay, the staff was polite. But we will not be visiting the Tropicana again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: CaptAdam1
Reviews.Content: They really know how to take care of their players!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not brilliant”
Reviews.Author: gjwkdy
Reviews.Content: spent 5 nights here in Aug 2011, Check in only took a couple of minutes. Room in Paradise Tower had a view Towards MGM Grand and New York New York. Room was comfortable enough with 1 king bed but did hear noise from next room due to adjoining door. Bathroom a bit of a disappointment due to not being refurbished along with the room. Maid service was very late most days, not ideal when you have been out all day. A really good value hotel for the price paid, maybe just a bit too far from my preferred area on the strip. $9.99 + tax resort fee per day. Better than most

Reviews.Title: “Not as clean as the reviews stated”
Reviews.Author: KrnAndJoe
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend in Vegas to watch Frozen Fury at the MGM. The Tropicana is across the street and the glowing reviews on it's remodel and cleanliness sold me. We got 2 rooms in the club tower on the 4th floor. They were relatively quiet though you do hear music from the pool during the day. The furnishings are nice looking but the mattress was really worn out. The bathroom had spittle on the mirror and small curly hairs in and around the tub. The sink had green mucous on the side of it..pretty gross. It was late when we checked in with our two kids so my husband cleaned the bathroom himself as to not wake the kids with housekeeping. I alerted housekeeping of the situation but the cleaning was no better the next day. We will stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “LUV this place !!!”
Reviews.Author: thefool
Reviews.Content: We have been to the Trop several times now and rave about it each time. The staff are awesome to deal with / our bookings go nice and smooth / we are treated like VIP's. Usually stay in the Paradise tower but this last time we went to Club tower. Club tower is great if you are there for a convention / using the pool or gym as the elevator goes right there ! The Paradise tower is better as it is closer when you come in the front doors - so if you are not doing any of the above this is the one I would recommend. WE like this hotel as we don't get lost in there like the other 'massive' ones. Anyone that asks about LV we always highly recommend the TROP LV

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: Robert F
Reviews.Content: The make over of the Tropicana is great. The staff is very pleasent and helpful. The rooms are fresh, clean and up to date. I don't know how anyone could ask for better accommodations. The casino is small but nicely redone. Enjoyed our trip and look forward to being able to return to the Tropicana soon. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Old people like to have fun also.”
Reviews.Author: Edward G
Reviews.Content: Our recent 4 day stay at the "Tropicana" was great. The staff from the front desk onward were very helpful with any and all requests despite our being a couple of old foogies. The Italian restaurant was delightful and the swimming pool beautiful even though I was a bit itimidated by all the nice looking young people that gathered there. I highly recommend this hotel as the best value we have encountered in a long time and we are always traveling. Graff's of Naples, Florida

Reviews.Title: “Loved the trop”
Reviews.Author: Thomas N
