Reviews.Content: Third time the year we stayed at the new Tropicana. This was just a last minute get away for a little R&R, Called a casino host and he gave us great rates.... Ate at both fine dinner places, Italian Friday night and Steak on Saturday. never left the resort the whole time we were there.. The staff treated us like VIP's, we'll be back soon

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Sue R
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Tropicana three times over the last year. Every time I go, something has been renovated and improved. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms very comfortable and all the staff are extremely helpful and friendly. Personal notice is taken when feedback is sent, which is unusual for a big hotel. The casino is bright, the stained glass over the tables gives it an old world, elegant atmosphere. I love the Trop, It was the first hotel I stayed at and it will continue to be my hotel of choice whenever I'm in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “wish i had more money!!!”
Reviews.Author: longhaulin
Reviews.Content: 2nd visit to vegas, last time 8 years ago and we were surprised at how it has built up,and how food and drink prices have risen. Tropicana hotel has a great retro-new feel about it, we picked this one mainly due to the pool area,location and price. Very happy with the room and pool for the price. The casino/restaurants are much smaller than some of the other vast resorts such as mgm, not a bad thing! Pool has a bit of a class system going on - club nikki behind closed doors for the rich Reserved areas for those with money to chuck about British huddled on grass banking, smuggling cheap drinks in joking aside we were happy with the hotel,our advice is to plan your trip to vegas well if on a budget, as prices vary from low to very high for the same product. Can you tell i am a Yorkshireman?

Reviews.Title: “Very nice since upgrade”
Reviews.Author: njoimi
Reviews.Content: I stayed here. Most people told me it was cheap but they haven't been in since the renovation. It was very nice. The staff was nice. The food was not that great. Club Nikki , they say, is new but it was wack so let them give you free passes to get in. They really need to put refrigerators in the room and microwaves...even cheap hotels have them. Go to CVS and buy water and alcohol if you are on a budget. 1 bottle of water is $2.79 at least in Tropicana. CVS will give you 6 bottles for $2.49

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: JillKeats
Reviews.Content: First off, I want to address two negative things I'm reading in reviews - noise and fragrance. This is LAS VEGAS, there WILL BE NOISE. Bring ear plugs! Most of the hotels are quiet but a lot goes on at the strip. You will hear the fire alarm in case there's a problem, trust me on that as the alarm went off during our stay. Second, almost ALL the hotels have a fragrance pumped in at the main floor level. At Mirage and TI, it's pina colada, at the Trump it is rose petals, etc. Please realize this and don't be a Vegas newb! :-) My friends, their mom and I stayed at the Trop at the end of September. At first there were some check-in problems because the suite plus connector we wanted was not available. We had to change rooms a couple of times at the beginning. We did get what we wanted though. Thanks to Doug and Mr. Gerard at the front desk who provided excellent service in this regard. Other than that, it was an excellent stay. The rooms were spacious, comfortable and clean. The beds were soft and came with a variety of pillows. All the rooms have been recently renovated. The Trop staff is very friendly. Steve the valet helped us find our tour bus and went above and beyond to do so. Bell boys Alex and Joey helped us move rooms with cheer and enthusiasm. Randy and Stephanie at Cafe Nikki provided us with a good time. We really enjoyed Cafe Nikki's boutique buffet. It seems like a lot of people are having a hard time with the concept. If your idea of brunch is to shovel as much food into your face while sitting elbow to elbow with other guests and getting a bare minimum of service, by all means hop on over to Mandalay Bay. But if your idea of brunch buffet is sitting out on a lovely deck, enjoying the sun and fresh fruit, pastries and eggs, Cafe Nikki will be quite preferable.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dvdqueen0825
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the tropicana for our 21st anniversary, they upgraded us to the 19th floor and gave us a room with the strip view of the mgm it was so amazing with extended our stay another day. we met amazing people, the staff were all super friendly snd very helpful. the pool was beautiful and packed every day but we still found a place to lay out and the servers wore the cutest white bathing suit. i will definitely be staying there again and recommend it to evryone i know.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect room, very comfortable bed.”
Reviews.Author: mdebellefeuille
Reviews.Content: This is my second time in vegas and i was there for my girlfriend birthday. Booked trough expedia, and sent an email to Nicole Marshall to handle special request. When i checked-in, Gwen take care of us and read the special note from Nicole about my request. Everything was perfect, i've got all request i ask, i love when hotels are flexible. Bed was very comfortable, very goos services. nikki cafe is a little expensive but taste soo good. i would like to say thanks you to Nicole and Gwen for their excellent services. See you for the CES trop!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price”
Reviews.Author: KraftyKelly
Reviews.Content: We received Las Vegas Advisor "Gold" rate of $41.00 a night/$90 for Sat & Sun. So for this price it was "okay" (we also got $91 off of hotel due to our comps). We did not get 3 rooms together as booked (and paid for) which is typical of Las Vegas -- at first they were going to give us smoking rooms but due to all members of our group being non-smoking, two of which were asmatic we were given non-smoking rooms, not all of together and not in same towers for first night. The next day they moved one room to our tower (at back) on same floor, the other room we left as it was in same tower but different floor. The staff did not offer to find us alternate rooms at beginning, we had to insist that they find us rooms. If they could not have given us non-smoking rooms I am not sure how much fuss we would have had to make to get what we already paid for. I believe the least a hotel in Vegas should do is hold "non-smoking" rooms for people that reserve non-smoking 6 mos in advance. We had an incident with a member of our group - she was going up stairs at Nikki Cafe where art work is on a wall but part of that artwork involves a "sandbox" for better lack of term that actually juts out 1 foot beyond the wall. She did not see the curb of the sandbox and tripped and fell into the artwork and was scraped on the hands (trying to break her fall) and wrenched her neck and back. Staff did not assist her, customers did. Then staff came and offered bandaids for her scrapes. We were told to make an incident report which we did to the security officer in the casino. The casino security officer did NOT take her to a private location (like an office) but took her back to the restaurant to view the site of the fall -- had her sit in visible view to all patrons and took photos of her injuries (this is just NOT acceptable way of treating a guest). While doing this two other restaurant patrons tripped and fell as well. Security said that this was not the first time someone fell. They gave her a small icepack (that is all they had, no tensor bandage for her sprained ankle) and sent her on her way. Not one person from the hotel offered an apology -- in most hotels you would hear from Management who would at the very least offer you some sort of comp for the inconvenience. This was most disappointing treatment by hotel staff. The pool staff were very lazy -- compared to Palazzo staff. [Palazzo staff hand you your towels and offer to assist you in seating (moving chairs etc) and they have maintenance staff that come around every half hour cleaning up the glasses and garbage people leave. The Pool Staff go along and pick up all towels left on chairs that are unoccupied.] The Trop staff did none of this. You have to actually reach into the towel cabanna and pick up your own towels, the staff do not assist you in moving the "plastic" chairs which are 80% broken (they cannot be set to recline only lie down) nor do they or anyone else clean up the pool area (garbage or towels). made us wonder if anyone even bothers to clean the pool and hot tubs! The decibel of music coming from Nikki Beach is unbearable (as is the selection of music) at the pool and overpowers the beautiful music from the Pool area itself. The area of the pool by Nikki Beach smells of sewer (very unpleasant) so reccomend you sit as far from Nikki Beach area as possible. The only "nice" things about the hotel is the comfort of the beds and the back tower's proximity to pool. The room (1773) we had was dirty, the carpet had a burn hole by the door and on the desk (this was a non-smoking room ?) and a red stain on carpet (likely from a drink spilled). The shutters on the windows are okay - providing you do not want to sleep during day as they do let light through. Loud music from Nikki Beach makes sleeping in afternoon impossible. Also at night you cannot sleep until it shuts down. The rooms are nothing to write home about - did not even take photos of. I will say that the photos on the website are NOT what you get, deceiving in size and what is included in your rooml. We were in back tower and had a comfortable armchair but I wanted the couch which is what we booked in the Paradise Tower but did not get.

Reviews.Title: “Just got back..it was GREAT...”
Reviews.Author: SteveD74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tropicana late Sept for one week. Overall the place was great. The staff was very friendly always saying Hello, Good morning etc. Check-in was simple and quick. Our room was very nice not facing the strip but that was my choice as I wanted to be away from the pool. Room was clean and beds were great. We had room service one morning for breakfast and it was very good. We found unlike other Hotels on the strip that we walked around the Tropicana was not as busy which we found great. If you wanted busy all you had to do was walk outside for five minutes. The little café downstairs was perfect for a quick breakfast or snack and the prices were very fair. We didn’t gamble much so I can’t say much on that. We did take in the comedy show at the hotel. My wife really didn’t want to go because she is not into comedy shows but after it was over she said it was good and she was glad she went. The valet guys are good, always ask you if you need directions and they don’t look at tip you just gave them, they just place it in pocket and thank you for it. It appeared as if they didn’t expect the tip but it was bonus. I would recommended to my friends to stay here and if returning to Vegas I would have no problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “The renovated Trop is excellent”
Reviews.Author: DGM1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Trop for a 4 day vacation and it was really very good. The rooms were spacious. clean and modern. The Italian Restaurant Bacio had simply great food. The resort fee included the WIFI so I did not mind paying for it. The staff was courteous and professional. Really a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “1st timer at the Trop”
Reviews.Author: Sherry67
Reviews.Content: We just got back last night from a week in Vegas. We stayed the first 3 at the Mirage and then moved over to the Tropicana for 4 nights. The room was very nice, clean, and convenient. All the staff from check in, to valet, to dealers, to wait staff, were very nice.We agree with a prior reviewer that the music at breakfast was a little loud and not relaxing music. We ate at the Biscayne and it was absolutely wonderful! I have to eat gluten free and Pavillo (spelling?) was extremely accomodating and quite knowledgeable about my needs. That was the 2nd time we had eaten in this restaurant and were equally satisfied both times. Our ONLY disappointment at the Tropicana is that the one and only "Let it Ride" table, which is our game of choice, doesn't open at all until 8 PM. We even asked the pit boss if it could be opened, and he stated that he didn't have the staff for it. We ended up spending most of our gambling time in other casinos for that reason. Considering there were at least 3 dealers just standing at other tables with no players, we found that to be unacceptable. We play the game daily for hours at a time, and we had played there on prior trips during the day, so this really was a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “I found a new home in LV!”
Reviews.Author: Johnlogie
Reviews.Content: Been to LV many times BU had never stayed at the Trop before as I always thought it looked a bit sad and dull. When planning this trip the reviews were great and explained that the hotel has been completely renovated. I want a great pool area to top up my tan so chose the Trop and got a great rate on it's web site for a king club deluxe I was staying in Fremont street the first night so hit the bus up to the Excaliber and crossed over to the Trop. I arrived just after noon so was prepared to check my bags with the Bell service but was really happy to be welcomed at check in who was really engaging (my Scottish accent helps too I think). I asked for a quiet room and he offered me a new king room in the club tower on the 14th floor looking towards the airport and hills which was just fine for me although I think he would've tried hard to find me a strip view if I'd asked. Very efficient and friendly plus he took the time to talk me through the resort map and explained how to get the the gym, pool and my room. The Trop has a $10 a night resort fee. I actually this it's was great value as it included wifi by the pool and in the room plus gym access and pool towels. Other realist charge you for everything so I think it was very reasonable. Walking through the hotel I was very impressed with the decor, it's very light and airy with everything clad cream leather with gold trimmings. Felt very upscale but also laid back at the same time. A great feel to the place so it was a very good first impression. The club tower is a bit of a walk from the reception, yo need to walk through the casino, up an escalator and then walk over the pool overpass to get to the club tower. Not that bad a walk but some may find it hard going. The good thing is that there is a Starbucks near the elevators in the tower so you can grab a dose of caffeine to get you the final stretch to your room :) There are 5 or 6 elevators so I never waited long for one. Also, I really liked that when you pushed a call button, the sign for the elevator that was coming to you lit up meaning you didn't have to guess and run for it when it got there, nice simp touch that I haven't seen much. The good thing about staying in the club tower is that you have direct access to the gym and pool area from the elevators. My room was fantastic, definitely best in class compared to any of the others I've stayed in and amazing value. Real nice touches like lots of drawer space, shutters on the windows which can be opened along with the window which is a rare feature. The TV was huge and had may too many channels for me to be bothered hoping my way through The bathroom is well appointed with a corner bath with shower and lots of towels. All in all I was really impressed with the room. The Nikki Beach pool area is fabulous! Exactly what I was looking for. The only gripe was the lack of fully functioning beds. They obviously purchase the plastic frames very cheaply as the hinge on the back to prop it up to a sitting position was broken on many. That said I managed to find a good one every day and they are all fitted with thick mattresses so are extremely comfortable. The pool are is very cool indeed, I was really impressed by it. The pool bar is well staffed and not as expensive as I though it might be. There is also waitress service for food which again is pretty reasonable, decent quality and plentiful if a bit lacking in choice. I never went to the club but it looked amazing and will definitely visit next time when Im not travelling alone. There was no loud music from the club that I could hear at the pool, just soft rock/pop which was fine. The casino was surpassingly compact but I loved it. The staff told me it was almost doubling in size soon but I didn't find it lacked anything. I played the tables and slots and loved the atmosphere of the smaller casino. The only thing it did lack was waitresses who were hard to find sometimes. I never ate at the hotel as I like walking the strip at night. There are two main restaurants plus a few others for snacks and a 24 hour Starbucks. If I'm honest, the lack of food choice was disappointing but as you can easily get to Excaliber and it's free monorail to Luxor and Mandalay bay or cross the road to either MGM or NY NY so choices are massive all around you. I'm defiantly a huge fan of the Trop. Il be a regular here in future for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel with amazing pool for value prices.”
Reviews.Author: Heapy18
Reviews.Content: We felt instantly at home in the hotel. The staff we're very friendly and always willing to help- which is typical in las Vegas! The hotel was almost totally revamped when we stayed there and there was some building works but if I'm honest, this never bothered us. The food in the restaurants was excellent and varied in price which meant we could spend as much and as little as we liked. The pool was a Little haven and really pretty with lovely gardens and beautiful beach side beds. It had a hip vibe and played loud music which for us was great but I wouldn't suggest it for young children. My room was lovely, large and comfortable. My view wasn't great but as I spent 90% of out of the room this was fine. My friend had a non smoking room with an adjoining door to a smoking room and her room really smelt incredibly strongly of smoke which was v.unpleasant however my room was fine. We had a great stay and found the location was ideal for all we wanted and would not hesitate to go back once again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun few days”
Reviews.Author: voltech250
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a trade show in Vegas.. stayed at the Tropicana and loved it! Love how light it is compaired to the other places in Vegas.. Room was clean and bright but could sleep late by closing the shutters. Staff were friendly and were ready to help all the time! The only problem we had was that the music at breakfast and dinner was way too loud. Also, the breakfast buffet was just ok...we had a better selection for the same price at MGM. The monoral worked perfectly getting to the convention center and back as walking alone at the convention center was enough for us. WIll be back to the Trop!

Reviews.Title: “Great value after renovations”
Reviews.Author: Mike B
Reviews.Content: Picked the Tropicana because it was right next to the MGM and I was attending the Mayweather vs Ortiz fight there. The price was excellent and I had heard positive things after the renovations. I was not disappointed. The hotel and room were both very clean and the casino was clean and bright. The staff was helpful and service was fast. On my next trip to Vegas, I will certainly consider the Trop as one of my first choices

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: 535Jan
Reviews.Content: Went to Las Vegas for the first time and stayed at the Tropicana. Hotel staff were friendly. Hotel was clean and the casino wasn't to smoky. The bed was very comfortable...especially after walking for hours! Thought it would be noisy as hotel is by the airport, but our room was great we never heard planes or other hotel guests. Would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel with BIG Hospitality!!!”
Reviews.Author: savinodiane
Reviews.Content: Had the best time at this not so extravegent hotel, but prime location and the nicest pool and staff!!! Will go there and alwyas gamble there!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean place in a good area”
Reviews.Author: Steve112975
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great time in Vegas. The Tropicana was very nice and clean and the service was great. The only complaint I'd have is the maid service wasn't very reliable. Never sure when they were coming and they seemed to take an extremely long time cleaning the room. Other than that our stay was great. Definitely recommend the place.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: Brian1970_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights. Rooms are large,beds are comfy,staff is friendly. If you like to be near the casino and have an easy exit out onto the strip stay in the Paradise tower. If you like to be near the pool stay in the Club tower. This is a resort thats exceeds expectations. My wife and I were there for our anniversary. If there is an issue the hotel is wiiling to make amends.For hotels in this price range it is definitely the best. Keep up the good work,Trop.We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: dani81016
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth stay in Vegas and usually I have some sort of small complaint about the hotel, even though they're all nice. But I don't have a single bad thing to say about the Trop! The decor of the hotel is beautiful, very relaxing. The bar next to the sports book has happy hour from 4-6 everyday where all drinks are half price, which was really convenient. The bed was by far the best bed I've ever encountered in my life. We were in the Club Tower but didn't find the walk to be a problem at all. Nice little walkway that leads to MGM which was another great aspect. Also, Yarmile at the front desk sent champagne and strawberries to our room for our anniversary, which we happened to mention at check-in. Really great trip.

Reviews.Title: “DID NOT START WELL BUT ENDED GREAT”
Reviews.Author: GilnJo
Reviews.Content: We were booked for 4 nights but on the night we arrived we were told they were overbooked and they sent us to the nearby Polo Towers. Once back at the Trop we were happy we picked this hotel. All of the staff were extremely pleasant and helpful and the hotel more than made up for the night we had to stay at a different hotel. When we return to Vegas we will definitely be staying at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: d_feeney13
Reviews.Content: Overall my experience of the Tropicana was an excellent one. The rooms were spacious, very clean and had incredibly comfy beds which added up to a good nights sleep. The hotel itself does lack a major attraction apart from the slot machines, the mob experience didn't appeal to me in anyway whatsoever but each to their own. The main reason I didn't give it 5 stars is the long walk to the tower rom the front of reception (that alone is short compared to most vegas hotels but annoying just the same) and the practising of a samba band at Club Nikki at 2am for an hour on Friday 16th September which was fun unless your trying to sleep and the fight after party hosted by a warbling shouting lil wayne till 3 or 4am the following night. Both far too loud considering we were on the 15th floor and could hear this as if it was in the next room. The only real negative of an otherwise enjoyable stay. But these were very specific to the time of our stay so don't let that put you off.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price....”
Reviews.Author: OregonChickie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the The Tropicana in March of 2011 and it had just gone through a renevation. I really liked the new color sceme and "theme" (Carribean-ish). This hotel has a much smaller casino area then other hotel's casinos on the strip. Depending on what you're into, this maybe a good or bad thing. Our room was nicely decorated but rather small. Since I don't go to Vegas to stay in the hotel room, this didn't really bother me. You may also want to be aware that it is located at about the end of the N side of the strip. There is a bus stop near by but this can be an issue because of all the walking you do in Vegas. There's a pasta resturant on the 2nd floor (can't remember the name) that totally snubed us so that turned us off from eating anywhere at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the Vegas sun and...moon”
Reviews.Author: Heather H
Reviews.Content: So as everyone knows they have redone the Tropicana. Since we never stayed there prior to the renovations we cannot really compare it to the previous state. However with all that said its a great place to pitch a tent when in Vegas. Prime location to other hotels and great Vegas shows. We saw KA at the MGM grand. The walk was not too far and that was with heels on. So ladies it is accessible. When entering the casino it smells like coconuts but later we referred to it as smokeanuts a mix of cigarettes and coconuts. THe smell is not as bad as some casinos. The casino is much brighter than other casinos so watch your cash as time fly's when gambling and you think its still day light! The bed sleeps well and the bathroom is nice with good towel service. Not too rough or scratchy. They have a flat panel tv and window shutters. The picture on the website does do the room justice. Enjoy your stay here its a great hotel and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorites”
Reviews.Author: BethanyD775
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here for work and for fun, and both times were wonderful. The rooms are very nice, and the whole hotel feels very open and airy, even in the casino! The pool is beautiful and has a very friendly, non-pretentious vibe to it. I like staying here for work because it's easy to get in and out of - you don't have to park two miles from the entrance and then traipse another mile through the casino. The service was the best part of staying here. The check-in clerk was exceptionally friendly both times I stayed, and everyone from bellmen to bartenders was helpful and friendly. I also love the location of the Tropicana (close to the airport for a hotel on the Strip, and still walkable to the rest of the resorts on the Strip).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sasha011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights whilst on a tour. Nice big hotel with all the fruit machines in it as all hotels in Vegas have. Is pratically on the main strip so is near all the attractions and the airport is just around the corner so well located. It is not as special as most hotels in Vegas but then it is only a place to sleep so that is fine, and you dont have many people walking around as you do in all the other hotels in Vegas. The only downside was there were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room, however we did received free wi-fi in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Tropicana!”
Reviews.Author: AstridCB
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent 6 nights at the Tropicana on 12th September and had an amazing time. Nicole Marshall was superb in making our stay even more special (we were celebrating my big 50 birthday!) and her help and suggestions by email before our stay really added to the whole holiday. Plus she surprised us with a birthday gift of two tickets to see Gladys Knight in the hotel theatre which was amazing. Our intial room was not available on arrival and the only hiccup to our stay was that when we arrived at 9pm at night we were put in a smoking room in the Club Tower which still wasn't cleaned!! This meant us having to hang around for half an hour in the Starbucks coffee shop, a bit of a pain, but when we did get into our room we were surprised with two mini bottles of champagne and two enormous chocolate covered strawberries as a birthday treat! The room (18th floor) we had for our first night was lovely, but we did notice the smell of cigarette smoke in the corridor (not in our room though). The view was amazing, it had a large bathroom and two queen beds. The walk to the Club Tower wasn't bad at all, take any other reviews that moan about the 'long' walk with a pinch of salt. An extra 5 minutes walk along an internal corridor that has small shops either side and a coffee shop at the end and you're there! Nothing to complain about, some of the hotels we visited during our stay (MGM for example) were so HUGE you must have to walk for miles to reach your room! On our second day we moved to room 1826 on the 18th floor of the Paradise Tower. Another fabulous view - over the south end of the strip towards Excalibur, Luxor, Mandalay Bay. A huge room with a large king size bed, great flat screen tv, great toiletries in the large bathroom, loads of storage space and we also arranged for a coffee maker in our room which was lovely. The staff at the Tropicana were all incredibly helpful, polite and friendly, from check-in to concierge to maid service and everyone else in between. We ate at Biscayne at the hotel which was superb and I would strongly recommend, we also had breakfast twice in the small cafe there (whose name escapes me) but that was very good value. We played on the slots a fair bit and joined the players club which gave us some cash back with Tropicana's promotion at the moment. We were very low rollers but we had some fun gambling a little - I tried the roulette table once and my partner spent some time in the Sports Book and also managed to watch a couple of Manchester Utd games while there!! We didn't try out the pool but did have a walk around the area and it looked fun with space for everyone. We didn't try out Club Nikki or the Nikki Restaurant but they both looked pretty buzzing. I'm trying to think of any downsides to our stay, but the only one I can think of is really petty .... ie. the shower water pressure wasn't as good as I'd like but nonetheless I had a good shower every morning!! For the price we paid the Tropicana was fantastic! It isn't a huge themed Las Vegas hotel with an enormous casino and loads of restaurants and theatres to chose from, but that's what we loved about it. It's smaller, friendly and even though towards the end of the strip near enough to the hustle bustle to only be 10 minutes walk to the centre of the action, but far enough away to escape the crowds and manic fun of the Strip!! We loved our stay and if the opportunity arises again for us to go to Las Vegas we will definitely stay here again. Many thanks to Nicole and all the lovely staff there who made our trip so fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Daisy-may4071
Reviews.Content: After a very long journey from the uk it was so great to have such great service on arrival to vegas. Very quick and easy checking in and all staff were so helpful and couldnt do enough for us. First impressions of the trop were very good. A very light, bright, clean and modern hotel, and unlike some of the other hotels on the strip not dark and dingy. The room was fantastic. We only had the basic smaller room but it was plenty big enough, with two big very comfy double beds and everything you need to make your stay comfortable. And how nice to have fresh towels every day. While the trop may not have the novelty factor that some of the other hotels on the strip have, it makes up for it with quality and service. I cant recommend the trop enough, and if you find fault then you are obviously very difficult to please. We will definately be back.Thanks for an awesome stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time - Highly Reccommend!”
Reviews.Author: donamariek
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned our yearly vacation in Las Vegas this year. It was our 3rd time, but it was our first time chosing the Tropicana. I've heard a lot of nice things about all the updates, etc. and from the past I knew I liked their winding pool which had some shady areas for those not wanting to me in the hot sun 100% of the time. Upon arrival I was a little disappointed as there were 2 clerks at the check in desk but soon two more arrived and the line moved along. Our resevations were for a king nonsmoking and it was not available. When I stated that was what we "reserved", I was told that is only a request, not a guarantee. At first we were told we could have a queen - nonsmoking and then the next day could be moved so we agreed upon this when the clerk tells us to wait a sec- he would check with the manager. He came back and not only provided us with a king, nonsmoking but gave us $30 a night off the internet rate that I had booked it at. Wow, talk about putting a smile on our faces. We stayed four nights on the 11th floor. Being school probably just started, there were virtually no children around and the whole floor was very quiet. Our room had a view of the pool. Bed was extremely comfortable with extra pillows in the closet if need be. Furnishings were nice and room was very clean and flat screen was awesome. The bathroom, while nice, did not have an exhaust fan but that didn't really matter. In room safe, hair dryer & clothes iron & board were included. No fridge or coffee maker. The pool was very nice, a little chilly but the hot tub warmed you right up. It was big and roomy (I believe held 18) and we enjoyed that a lot. Didn't win on the slots but the points we racked up, we were able to deduct from our hotel bill so that was an added bonus to the reduced rate. Restaurant & drink prices are a little high but then if you drink while gambling, drinks are free. I'd definately stay here again. I think you will find it clean and comfortable.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: yorkshire lass in sunderland, tyne & wear, england
Reviews.Title: “This is absolutely the one - we 100% made the best choice!!”
Reviews.Author: elise252
Reviews.Content: Do not forget the rating of this hotel when passing judgment upon it, it is NOT a 5 star establishment it is a meagre 3.5 star accomodation and should be viewed as such. Expectations are often unrealistic and even ridiculous in my experience, especially in the States where people travel so frequently and as a consequence are exceptionally picky, critical and easily dis-satisfied. Bearing this in mind, the Tropicana is MIND BLOWING!!!! We had sooooo much fun there and it far exceeded all of our expectations!! Reviewing the place on its' own merits should be enought to convince anyone to stay here but one cannot help additionally comparing it to the surrounding hotels on the doorstep, where the Trop comes out on top, mostly. It is so much lighter, brighter, airy and more colourful & modern than the NY NY, MGM Grand and Excalibur, which, although much bigger than the Trop, all look strikingly dark and dingy and stuck in a late 80s/ early 90s weird cheesy time warp. Anyway it was our first time in Vegas and I'd read loads of reviews with conflicting 'tips' and recommendations for the 'best' rooms. It cost us $13 in a taxi from the airport (it is practically next door to the airport.) I'd asked for a room in the Paradise Tower, fearing the supposedly horrendous noise from the Club Tower. However our room wasn't ready upon check-in so they upgraded us to a junior suite in the Club Tower and we never heard a whisper of a peep of a hint of a noise! (6th floor facing the airport/ Luxor/ Mandalay.) The room was beautiful, lovely bright colours, very spacious, great TV, excellent quality i-pod dock, super-comfy bed. I mentioned a fridge at check-in and they brought one to the room straight away, and it was free of charge. There's a tip for ya! I could see that the bath didn't quite fit in with the rest of the room as it looked quite old-fashioned but it was clean and big enough for 2 people with a ledge to sit on so you could have a beer in the bath! The pool was fabulous. Although it's always packed you can always find a bed and it's really big. It was 100 degrees when we were there and we loved the super-cool temperature of the water. We arrived on Tuesday and there was music playing but it was at a nice volume, and it was sing-alongy & up-beat, new stuff and older songs too. But come Thursday, the dreaded Nikki Beach opened it's doors and it IS pretty annoying I must concede , especially since it seemed so totally unappealing to us, a teeny weeny little pool too small to swim in surrounded by loungers and beds where posers pout into their $20 cocktails, and yes it was ridiculously loud monotonous heavy-bass painfully cool 'non-music' that drowned out the 'normal' music. But it didn't spoil our time around the pool it was just slightly irritating. The casino looked massive to our naive eyes when we checked in but actually it is a lot smaller than the others. But it's still really big - how many slot machines do you need?? We don't play at the tables (we were there for a wedding, not to gamble, athough we had a go on the slot machines for a laugh) but everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves. Gladys Knight plays there, Brad Garrett has a comedy club there and the restaurants always looked busy. We looked around quite a few of the other hotels and despite their more impressive sizes and greater choice of bars and clubs and restaurants compared with the Trop, I would choose the Tropicana hands down if I went back to Vegas. We got a really good price with Expedia, it's in an excellent location (wherever you stay on the strip whether north south or in the middle you will end up pounding the pavement anyway to get from one hotel/casino to another), the decor is sooooo pleasant and bright, the room was absolutely wonderful and the staff were very personable and efficient. Apparently the pool is the best in the price range soon. I think it is the best choice, no doubt. We loved it. Thanks, Tropicana!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY - I WILL BE BACK!!”
Reviews.Author: kevin h
Reviews.Content: I last stayed at the tropicana 10 years ago - so i was looking forward to all the changes, - i wasnt disappointed!!!. check in was smooth and quick.The room had been remodeled,light and airy, white shutters in the windows, flat screen tv, beds were very comfortable.However, the only disappointment was the bathroom, - the vanity area and been updated and remodeled, but the bath and shower had not - looked very old and tired!!!!. The pool area was great - does get crowded, so get there early. Also take ear plugs with you as the "music" from the new Nikki Beach Club is loud!!! - (Thursday to Sunday). The Trop staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a good location and good value for money - I will be back!!!.

Reviews.Title: “great week”
Reviews.Author: TallT50
Reviews.Content: we have always stayed at an MGM resort when we go yearly to vegas. this experience was by far way better. we didn't feel that anyone was trying to control our stay or what we did like we felt at montecarlo.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: trich22
Reviews.Content: Planned to stay here for 5 nights however ill health caused me to cut the stay short. The hotel was very helpful whilst I was ill. Firstly they were able to point me in the direction of a doctor who came to the hotel to see me and provide me with medication. Secondly room service was able to provide me with food that was not on the room service menu. Thirdly we only paid a half day rate on the evening that we checked out instead of having to pay for a full night. Other than that the rooms were clean and spacious, the concierge was able to book shows and trips, and considering that the hotel is on "the strip" the room rate was much cheaper than others. I hope to return to Las Vegas in the future and would consider staying at the Tropicana again.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked and Unprofessional”
Reviews.Author: gibson_mel
Reviews.Content: They overbooked, but I could understand that, having worked with the hospitality industry. However, when discussing how to rectify the situation, they stated I had booked with a booking firm where I paid "significantly less." EXCUSE me - Tropicana, along with all other hotels, use these discount booking firms all the time to keep their vacancy rate low. To bring that up is unprofessional - once the room is paid for, it doesn't made how the reservation was made, as long as the channel was a proper one. The manager was quite rude, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: cprzybyl
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Vegas and I had the best time! This hotel was clean, newly remodeled, and I felt classier that the surrounding ones. I liked our casino, dealers, amenities inside the hotel, and the kind and generous staff. The general age was a little older than me (28) to older, which I preferred. We had great beds (which we only slept 3 hours per night in) and the room had plenty of space for us. It was a smoking room and you couldn't even tell (we don't smoke). We were near a lot of things, so it was just a short walk to more entertainment, which we didn't need often. I'd recommend this place to anyone and certainly go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Sunday upgrade”
Reviews.Author: saskff
Reviews.Content: Initally we were placed in a room on a smoking floor. We got there Saturday night and when we asked to be moved, we were upgraded to a suite! It was nice to have a Starbucks in the hotel. The casino was small, but enough tables for my liking. The pool was really nice in the afternoon, although it does take until noon for the sun to hit the free pool. While at one end of the strip, it's only a walk over the street to Excalibur, MGM Grand, and New York New York. I recommend the Tropicana for it's price and service.

Reviews.Title: “Old Style Hotel With Alot of Effort”
Reviews.Author: BDG6610
Reviews.Content: Went to a conference there and had a good time. The rates can not be beat. We stayed in a mini suite which is a larger room. Very comfortable but it does show it;s age. Serious effort is given to update the hotel and those efforts do make a difference. The casino was possibly the most fun that I have had while gambling. Dealers that were personable, Vicki, Skip, thanks.The pool was fun, though the service a little slow. Prepare to do a bit of walking if you stay in the club tower. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “You can do whatever you want- It's the Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: lynzi042084
Reviews.Content: Nothing special here as far as accomadations. The hotels rooms are clean and cheap. The drinks are plentiful in the casino and Simeon at the other gal he bartends with at the pool are some of the greatest people you will ever meet. I dont care if I stay at the Bellagio I am always going to go gamble and hang out at the Tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linny_1975
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights to check out Las Vegas. There was a line at the check-in around 3:30pm, we had to wait about half an hour before we could check in. Our room was in the club tower, and that's the other building of the Tropicana Hotel. The buildings are connected, but the walk is a reasonable one! The Tropicana hotel is on the end (or the beginning?) of the Strip, so if you want to walk to the Stratosphere tower it's a long walk! Room was perfect, spacious and clean! It is however very noisy (street sounds, helicopters and airplanes).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: hailo51
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid to stay here a week, including airfare, this was a steal. We came during March, while renovations were still happening so we didn't get to see the final changes. Location of Tropicana is great - on the strip and not too far away from everything. Service here was very good - especially the lady who helped us with the car rental. There was a heavy smoke smell in the casino area (I guess they don't mask it as well as some of the other hotels). Our suite was large but the toilet could have been cleaned better and towels could have been of better quality. But as for value, it's pretty good compared with other hotels on the Strip

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: mamarama65
Reviews.Content: We stayed Friday to Monday and just loved the location. I've stayed in the MGM before and liked being at one end of the strip but I hated the MGM because it was just too big and didn't like the rooms. The view from the Tropicana was INCREDIBLE!! We were looking right at the MGM, NY and Excalibur and had a great view of the strip. I loved the tropical scent that was piped throughout the hotel, I could have sworn it was in the pool as well. The pizza/cafe in the hotel had fantastic food and for a reasonable price. Plus there was a Denny's nearby. I like laying by the pool so I did a lot of research to find a nice pool and this one didn't disappoint. Having said that, the area is nowhere near the size of the pool area of the MGM so when they start blaring the music from Club Nikki, mixed in with the music at the main pool (that I LOVED) plus a third section going, it sounded just awful and was not relaxing in the least. The only two "big" complaints I had was that, because we stayed the weekend, we didn't realize just how loud the music at Club Nikki would be, though the lady at check-in said that being on the 15th floor we should be all right. With the windows open it was like having the music right there in your room. With the windows closed you could still hear it very clearly, until 3 a.m. both nights. I know that you don't go to Vegas to sleep, but 3 a.m. is a bit late for me to be listening to blaring music. The second complaint was that when we finally made it to the pool I was happy to see how many available lounge chairs there were. Well, there was a reason they were available - they were all broken!! Having undergone a big reno, couldn't they have sprung for new chairs? I gave up after the 9th chair and just collected 3 lounge pillows which I used to prop up my chair. Not a big deal in the end, I was just glad to soak up some sun. :) Would I stay here again - yes! But not on a weekend. Maybe the sound was better in the other tower. It was a very clean, bright and airy hotel, not dark and dingey like most of the other hotels close by. It's very close to the airport so it's a cheap taxi ride.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel but don't bank on getting your booked room!”
Reviews.Author: syl188
Reviews.Content: arrived at hotel at 2pm we were advised check in at 3pm onward only, fine went for something to eat and returned to wait in line for 45 minutes with only 3 people on check-in 2 dealing with vip only, at 4pm we were told there were no rooms ready for non smoking but they'd lock the room and it would be cleaned within the hour, at 5pm we were told the room was not cleaned and come back at 6pm, we said not happy about that and were told the only way we could have a room was to take a smoking room, which was not acceptable to us. we asked to speak to the manager, only then were we giving a non smoking room. my inlaws arrived later that evening after a long haul flight from the uk, they were told they HAD to take a smoking room that night as there were no none smoking left----both our bookings had been made months in advance and whereas only 1 night had been taking in advance for our booking, the inlaws had paid for 2 weeks in advance. the hotel waivered the resort fee of $10 per night on our booking, but having to hang around in the lobby when you've got tickets to a show and would like to washed and change isn't much fun. the check-in staff couldn't be bothered. i have to say the room was lovely and the bed very comfy but i know i'd never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!!! First time in vegas all the way from England!”
Reviews.Author: shanahan_18
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tropicana for a week in september 2011 with my boyfriend, for are first time in Vegas. I was so happy with the price when booking the hotel and found it was one of the cheapest hotels on the Vegas strip! When we arrived at the hotel around 8 pm on a saturday we found the location of hotel was right in the heart of everything which was perfect, no taxis needed a walk way away from the MGM and New York New York hotel. The hotel had a really great buzz about it and as soon as we got inside we seen the casio which was really busy and everyone looked like they were having a great time. We couldnt wait to throw are bags in and join in the fun! Check in was very quick when arriving at are room we were so happy! The room was a very good size, smelt amazing, super clean, really comfortable bed, clean bathroom and there was no noise at all. Cafe nikki's food was really tasty and we ate breakfast in there a number of times throughout the week which offered a wide range of foods and the prices were also very good, cheaper than most of the hotels we ate at on the strip. Nikki Beach was amazing and was very cool and everything looked so new and clean! They offer sun beds and sun tents which were very affordable and we also found the drinks were also very affordable again cheaper than most of the other hotels! The Nikki beach pool party was really fun and busy and the D.J also played great music, such a good relaxing fun day. Nikki club was also very good and always busy and entry is free to people staying at the hotel which was great! The casio was great fun and we also won abit of cash on the roulette tables which is always a good thing, always got free drinks when betting and found we got more free drinks here than any or hotel on the strip! Staff were really helpful and friendly! So glad we chose the Tropicana and would recommed this hotel to anyone. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “three days was enough from las vegas”
Reviews.Author: jorge r
Reviews.Content: the hotel is good, all kind of people can to coexist. maybe not to have a fridge, a cofee maker would be the only complaint . you come from streets and want a cold beverage or a cofee, not to wait a roomservices or have to walk a mile for it.

Reviews.Title: “Overall pretty good experience”
Reviews.Author: BigBadBrad
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I was staying in Vegas on business, so I wasn't too concerned with the quality of the hotel I was staying at. Still, based on the many positive reviews since the Trop underwent its renovation, I was expecting a pretty decent stay. Checkout was quick and easy, although I was disappointed that they were not able/willing to comp me an upgraded room. I ended up in a basic room on the second floor overlooking Mandalay Bay and Excalibur (Albeit a partially obstructed view). Room was larger than average and clean, but nothing special. I did notice and enjoy the tropical scent piped through the ventilation however. Bed was VERY comfortable (too bad I spent hardly any time sleeping!) The casino was right outside the elevators which made me very happy. Nice casino with a good vibe in the evenings and plenty of low minimum gaming tables. I found the pool to be better than I expected and Club Nikki was very cool! Other than the small cafe they had there, I didn't have any meals at the hotel, but the food at the cafe was very good. Basically, I would stay here again if traveling on business or I was on a last minute weekend getaway with my wife, but probably would prefer something a bit more upscale such as Bellagio or Mandalay Bay if I was planning a longer stay. Overall though, for the price, Tropicana is well worth consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely appointed rooms”
Reviews.Author: Polkaholic
Reviews.Content: The renovation to the guest rooms last year are wonderful. They no longer look worn. The bedding is super soft, while the large bathroom was well appointed. Each room has a safe and a flatscreen tv. The window treatments (white shutters) make it look like a resort in the Carolinas. They maintained the fact that you can still open the windows (albeit 2 inches)which is rare in Vegas. Nice to 'hear' the Strip. Don't understand the logic behind no $5 BJ tables at 7AM when two dealers and a pitboss are sitting idle. Drop the $10 minimum and take us for something :). Pool area was large and clean. Able to 'rent' (must order at least $75-$100 in food and beverage while at the pool) a cabana or mattress by speaking with a bartender. Only had breakfast at Club Nikki. Simple, well presented.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana-stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: BarbC123
Reviews.Content: After a long day of travel we checked into our room to find that the bathroom had been in use by someone else, evidenced by the fact that someone's nasty razor and body wash was sitting in plain sight in the bathtub. The ironing board was out and set up. So we hiked back to the registration desk to advise them, and they acted like we were lying. We were assigned a new room but they didn't make any offer or gesture to help us move our luggage. So we had to hike all the way back to our old room, and move our luggage and belongings to another room. The staff was not overly friendly or helpful, and often were no where to be found. Definitely will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel with amazing staff and amenities.”
Reviews.Author: Meghan M
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana Las Vegas was amazing! An old college friend works in Vegas and recommended "The Trop," so my friend and I took his advice and stayed for our first trip to Vegas. We couldn't have been happier. The concierge was extremely helpful and had a good sense of humor. The room was ready for us when we arrived (and we arrived extremely early) and was very clean. All of the hotel staff said hello and asked how we were doing when we saw them. It was extremely bright, welcoming, and cheerful. The pool is awesome! I think that is where we spent most of our time. Both Club Nikki and Nikki Beach are a must see while there. The restuarants have delicious food and a great drink selection. We did some gambling and the cocktail waitresses were readily available to take our drink orders as soon as we sat down. Which is always a big plus! All in all, this is a great place, and I will definitely recommend it to anyone looking to book a trip!

Reviews.Title: “Wished I could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: Stopstick
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were on an organised coach trip which called in for 3 nights at the Tropicana. It was our first visit to Las Vegas. Loved the hotel and was delighted with our suite. Beautifully appointed and with a tropical scent that was as welcoming as the staff. Never heard a thing from our room inside the hotel, no banging doors or noisy neighbours which is so unusual but welcomed.Used room service once - a great breakfast although a little pricey - not unexpected. Even Club Nikki was not too noisy too late - however we left on Friday! One day we will return and hopefully will still be able to afford another suite and more time to enjoy the pool and casino which looked fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Totally FAB !!”
Reviews.Author: Princess_Peach
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights as the grand finale to our amazing road trip. We were not disappointed. What a fabulous hotel, with staff to match! Our upgraded room on 21st floor of the Paradise Tower was breathtaking. Rooms so spacious, fresh and comfortable, beds comfiest I have ever slept in. Didn't eat here as found restaurants a bit pricey, but loved having a starbucks on site :-) This was our first trip to Vegas (check out clerk called us Vegas Virgins!!). It will certainly not be our last! Loved the fresh bright casino too in comparison to all the smoky dull ones on the strip. Must say we felt like VIP's ! Thanks everyone for making our stay so awesome xx WE WILL BE BACK !!

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana Las Vegas and suggestions.”
Reviews.Author: happynewport
Reviews.Content: Tropicana hotel and casino Las Vegas. Excellent hotel recently refurbished, one of the best sport books on the strip,lacks ordinary food outlets, but central for all hotels at the top end of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: Pavan G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tropicana two two nights over the long weekend. We got a room overlooking the pool, the room is clean and had that new hotel feel. The view is a bit obstructed by the screens on window glass. Club tower is a bit far from Casino, I have traveled with kids and the club tower worked for us well. The great thing I noticed is the courtesy of the Hotel/Casino staff unlike other casinos on the strip. They are very friendly and made our stay memorable. I would recommend Tropicana to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “friendly”
Reviews.Author: jim12sar
Reviews.Content: what a great hotel staff are very friendly,all the staff at the tables help with the gambling as we dont gamble much. the hotel is bright and welcoming staff open doors as you walk up,whent to all the other hotels and ww were happy to get back to the trop,the beds are so comfy did not want to get out in the morning.we had a fantastic trip to vegas made even better by staying at the trop!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “1st Time guest, 1st Time in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: SingMeASong
Reviews.Content: I'm a southern-belle from Atlanta, GA! Tropicana Las Vegas is one of the well talked about hotel/casino resorts on the fabulous Las Vegas Strip! It was my first trip to Vegas and of course my first time staying at the Tropicana. I chose this hotel because of the attractive decor. The warm color schemes and they had great deals for employees like myself through my job(Delta Airlines). From check in to check out, the front desk agents were welcoming and polite. They all were calm, and easy to talk to. They were very knowledgeable of their position, the hotel and could pretty much answer all of my many first timer questions. I felt so revived at the Tropicana, and so alive. Once I got to my room, it was like my own piece of heaven. It looked like a little beach cabana (lol) very clean, very cozy, very sexy. I honestly forgot I was in Vegas for a sec. The thing that stole my breath was the POOL! I have never seen such a beautiful pool side like the pools at the Tropicana. For some reason I believe that their signature color is white (the hotel building white too)! In the sun that pool looks electrifying, I'm talking blinded from its beauty. I read that it has the best pool in Vegas lol...I don't know how true that statement is but I'd like to see others try and compete. Key word TRY! Club Nikki...I honestly don't need to say anything else...but to words "LOVE IT"!!!! I didn't dine there however, but I did take a peak in the restaurants and if the food taste as good and the restaurants look, then you better believe you are in for a taste divine treat! The dealers at the casino were awesome. It was my first time at a "BlackJack" table and they weren't to busy to answer my questions. I felt like a big winner...and a big spender....Hey ya gotta play to win right lol....comfortable seats, even the tables had cushioning for your elbows...Drinks anyone? Cocktail drinks were delicious, and well served. The overall service was excellent beyond EXCELLENT (what are u training your employees over there)! I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else but the Tropicana Las Vegas! Though the moto is "What happens in Vegas stays in Vegas" I couldn't keep this one to myself, I had to tell the world! Hope ur experience is just as great! Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but would not stay again.”
Reviews.Author: cslewis16
Reviews.Content: Location okay, close to airport. Pool area is only thing going for hotel. Renovations have been done.....but still very outdated. Casino not nice and hardly any places to eat at. Entire place smells like coconut tanning oil. Front desk lady was rudecwhen trying to get cab in morning to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Staff”
Reviews.Author: Rafael G
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Tropicana the week of September 12th, 2011. We could not have been more surprised at the great staff, from the room attendants to the casino dealers. Everyone was very friendly and helpfull. Cafe Niki staff were excellent. This is the last of the great original hotels on the strip. Doesn't have all the glitz that the other places have, but the others don't have the admosphere and the staff to compare with the Tropicana. Niki Beach was hopping on Saturday afternoon. The rooms were very well appointed and exceptionally clean. Couldn't have been happier. We have stayed at other places for a lot more per night, but when we go back we will be staying at the Tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: LynIRL
Reviews.Content: I booked into the Tropicana from 7th - 14th September 2011. The staff were great from the beginning. Our bags were taken at the door and delivered to our room. Very quick check in by friendly staff. My partner and I had informed Nicole that we were celebrating our 10 year anniversary (before arriving via email) and she upgraded our room with no extra cost. We stayed in the Paradise Tower which is very convenient as the lifts are just to the right of the lobby. The rooms were spacious and clean. Maid Service every day, Hair Dryer in the bathroom. Iron and Board in the wardrobe. IPOD docking Station, 40 inch LCD TV, Ice and Vending machine in the corridor. Beds were very comfortable and there were extra pillows in the wardrobe if needed. We had a view of the strip. The Casino was very airy, bright and clean - not dark and dreary like some of the other Casinos we visited. Having never visited Vegas before I thought I might be intimidated in the casino but the dealers in the Tropicana were friendly and willing to teach you how to play. And the waitresses were quick back with your drink unlike other Casinos. The pool area had plenty of beds and a great pool. There was a bar there also. I didn't attend Club Nikki as I thought it might be for the younger trendier crowd and the music was kinda loud and not my scene, but for younger visitors this might be ideal as i heard it is a great experience there also and they usually have celebrity guests. We only ate in the Pelligrino near the Pool as we were out for dinner most nights and the food and staff there were great. The location of the Tropicana is perfect, it is at the top of the Strip across from the MGM and New York New York, it is very easy to get around and there is always cabs at the door, and the walk ways are near. We walked around most of the hotels on the strip and I was always happy to come back to the Tropicana it has a great atmosphere and great people working there. I have seen some bad reviews for this hotel and I can't understand why, if you have a problem the staff will look after you, so don't be afraid to ask for assistance if you need it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: DJBreeze
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Tropicana on our last visit to Las Vegas (Labor Day Weekend) This was our third stay at the Trop and each time it has gotten better The staff is excellent and very friendly and helpful, from the front desk staff all the way to the valet attendants. Everything was clean and attended to. You won't go wrong if you decide to stay at this hotel. The price is great and the hotel itself is great, one of our favorites in Vegas now. The only drawback I can think of is that they no longer have a 24 hour cafe, but that is something I am sure they will add in the future. BTW, the beds are awesome comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fresh and Clean”
Reviews.Author: ironfamilyNewZealand
Reviews.Content: Our family icluding 13 and 17year old children, stayed at the Tropicana from 12-16th September. It was great. The rooms were very clean. The whole place has an open fresh feel to it. It even smells great. The casino was a lot less smoky than many of the other casinos we walked through. it was smaller and much easier to navigate our way round. The beds were very comfortable. The only downside being we had requested a rollaway but were told at checkin this wasnt possible due to 2 beds in the room already. It would have been helpfull if the website had of explaind this. The children did share ok. The pool was excellent, very large and clean. it did get busy but we managed to get loungers each day. The cocktails and music gave is a real party feel. Not great if you want some peace and quiet(though not really the reason to go to Vegas) The tropicana is right beside the MGM, but much quieter than staying there. Our room was very quiet at night apart from the wednesday when club Nicki's thumping music started up until early hours of the morning(ear plugs needed). The Nicki beach breakfast buffet and menu was excellent and good value. The other restaurants were too pricy for us with the children. Overall, a great place to stay on the Strip, will definately go back. Will ask for a room away from night club next time.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Trip”
Reviews.Author: Ginagar01
Reviews.Content: We had such a great time! The staff was great from the Bell stand, check-in, and concierge, housekeeping, everyone was there to help and guide you. Lost money in the Casino - but that was not Tropicanas fault - just kidding.... Great restaurants and perfect location on the Vegas Strip. We will be back this year. Gina Ft. Lauderdale

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the Pool and Botanical Garden Surroundings!!!”
Reviews.Author: Margaret E
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent and the staff even better. The hotel is a quantum leap from where it was a few years ago. Requested room service was prompt, courteous and enjoyable way beyond our expectation. The mornings in the pool area for that first cup of coffee topped off our enjoyment. We shared a connecting room with other family members and this was a definite plus. We only had to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: waterdogooder
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay with 6 girlfriends for my 40th birthday. Everyone loved the new updates and said they would return to the Tropicana. Although it is smaller than many of the other properties that is what we liked about it. If you can stay in the paradise tower it is easy to get out to the strip or to the pool. No walking forever or getting lost. The food leaves something to be desired but just go somewhere else. We loved the pool and as guest we got free entry into Nikki Beach. Using the walk overs you can get to MGM or NY NY in 10 minutes or less. The tram to Mandalay Bay was fast, free and easy. Being close to the airport made it a quick cheap taxi ride and we never had to wait very long to get a cab to where ever we wanted to go. Upon arrive the front desk sent champagne to the room for my birthday. Other than lack of food choices I can't think of any reason why we wouldn't return.

Reviews.Title: “Winning”
Reviews.Author: kimbertoronto
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our second stay at this remodeled hotel. The staff, rooms and gambling are excellent. The rooms are newly remodeled, clean and comfortable with the impressive california shutters. The staff is friendly and ever ready to assist you. The gambling is great fun especially with Le at three card poker and Iris, our hostess, ensured we were treated as valued guests. Thanks to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Bright and welcoming!”
Reviews.Author: bs1623
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana is bright and welcoming as soon as you walk in, unlike the nearby hotels/casinos which were dark and dreary. It has a warm and cozy feel. I stayed in the Club Tower which requires a little bit of walking from the entrance, but the walkway between the two towers is bright and has large windows overlooking the pool area. It's actually a nice walk. The standard room I stayed in was very clean and pretty! It had a large closet, large flat-screen TV, and two very comfortable beds with soft bedding and nice big pillows. The bathroom was also very clean and new looking. It had a large corner tub/shower. The counter had a couple of cubbie holes where towels and a blow dryer is kept. I kept my bathroom stuff in one of the cubbies, which help kept the counter clutter free. I stayed on the 9th floor facing the strip (MGM, New York New York) and Club Nikki. You might want to ask for the mountain/airport view if you like to go to bed early. One night, Club Nikki stayed open almost all night long with music. It didn't bother me on the 9th floor, though. The pool area was very clean also, and calm and relaxing. It wasn't crowded. This was a business trip, and I don't gamble. It was nice staying in a hotel that felt like a hotel rather than a casino. I highly recommend the Tropicana. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Grand time”
Reviews.Author: CaBobNM
Reviews.Content: Popped into Vegas on a whim and decided to stay the night. No reservations, but the Tropicana had rooms. Checkin was smooth and quick, with lots of information available on the casino and the shows. Room was clean, good sized, and quiet. Looks like it has been recently upgraded. The staff was fantastic. From checkin, housekeeping, restaruants, casino floor - Everyone was happy, helpful, and friendly. I Loved the feel of history at the Tropicana, with the upgraded & modern facilities. The real Las Vegas of days gone past. Not too glitzy, but fancy enough, comfortable. Just the right amount of everything. All that, and right on the strip, close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Tropifabulous is right! Great Hotel and Services”
Reviews.Author: Sincerely H
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Vegas before, one week at the Bellagio and another partial week at the Venetian, but the Tropicana is my new favorite place. The service was amazing. I stayed for a week and ordered room service twice, the food was fresh and delicious and arrived quickly. The staff was informed and helpful. I asked questions about directions, buffets, casinos- they assisted as if each were a personal conceirge, the Concierge by the way was a show unto himself- really informative funny and helpful. The pool and pool area was relaxing, warm and clean- the drinks were awesome! I have already told my family we are headed back for the New Year holiday!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL AND AMAZING STAFF!! PERFECT HOLIDAY”
Reviews.Author: xangix
Reviews.Content: As soon as I arrived at the hotel Tropicana, everyone was so friendly. A doorman politely insisted that he help me carry my luggage bag to the check in desk as it was very heavy! I could tell already that me and my boyfriend had picked a great hotel to stay at! Check in was very quick - we arrived in our room which was very nice indeed!! We had a lovely corner room so was very big and wasn't expecting it to be so spacious just for a deluxe room. It was perfect for me and my boyfriend! Everything was so clean including the bathroom, and oh my god... the bed is the comfiest bed I have ever laid on! Our room was cleaned everyday and we left the maid a few dollars tip each time - we had a note left in our room saying "'Thanks for the tip. Have a lovely rest of the day" which I thought was nice and friendly. :) The pool and poolside was very tropical, we loved it, it is very big and surrounded by pretty gardens and a waterfall! The hotel played nice music by the pool and there are plenty of sunbeds so I didn't feel like I had to rush for one. The casino is very nice! The air in the hotel is very well ventilated so you always feel fresh and cool. The tropicana also have a coconut scent ventilated around their hotel and pool - I wanted to buy a bottle of the fragrance so I could take it home! If there are any bad reviews on this hotel, they must be written by people who are very very VERY hard to please because I can't fault the hotel Tropicana at all. Please ignore the bad reviews!! The staff made us feel very welcomed and we felt valued which made our stay even better. I really think the Tropicana deserve a much MUCH higher rating than 15th hotel in Vegas.. but saying that, they have only just been renovated and had a big makeover, so watch this space.. !! I am definitely going to be planning my next stay again! Thanks to the hotel and all the staff for making our holiday the best we've experienced. :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, even better people!”
Reviews.Author: ryansd33
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at Tropicana for the first time over Labor Day Weekend. We had heard that the Tropicana had been remodeled...but wasen't sure just how nice it was. Needless to say, we were very pleased when we arrived! It looks awesome, rooms are great, decor is nice, pool is very fun. On top of that, the manager Thomas took care of our accommodations SO well. He made us feel at home, and got us a very nice room to help celebrate our recent engagement. Jay at Nikki Beach was awesome as well, and made our experience there top notch. Thanks Trop! We will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite place on the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: Curt M
Reviews.Content: We call The Tropicana "Our Home away from Home"! The best part of the experience here @ The Tropicana is the fact that the employees are valued by the management , and it shows...the trickle down effect is long time employees with personal hands on service that far exceeds any other hotels on the strip that we have stayed. The new beds are the best and the transformation was magical. Very friendly staff and we love telling everyone about our good times there. We have chosen this property time and again and will continue as long as we see the familiar faces with great service and smiles. The staff are genuinely friendly and always helpful. Unfortunately, great Guest service like this is hard to find in todays world. Thank you always and hope to see you all soon. Sincerely C & V Mundt

Reviews.Title: “"Roll the Dice"”
Reviews.Author: Lori A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tropicana over Labor Day Weekend. Had a great time - Bacio - Biscayne and Cafe Nikki are great places to eat. The Mob Experience was really good - we spend 2 hours there! Our room was very nice and keep very clean. The pool and pool area is very nice - even on 105 degree days! We had the best time at the craps tables - the dealers and pit bosses were wonderful to play with and look forward to coming back and playing craps again with them!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tony M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Tropicana from September 10-September 15. And, we will NEVER return!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Starting day 1, there was no hot water, and I mean NO hot water for five days. One morning, I even got up at 5:30 am, thinking that there might be a drop of hot water, NO hot water. It was at best lukewarm, and it went right to cold very quickly. It is ridiculous that there is no hot water, and when I called the front desk, they said that they would tend to it immediately, but this never happened. I would not recommend anyone staying here, when there isn't even hot water. The staff at the front desk, and in general, was friendly. But, when a basic service, such as hot water, is not available, and cannot be restored, then management needs to take notice. And, another issue that was problematic, was how the rooms were not cleaned until late afternoon, when my wife and I were getting ready to go out for the evening. I also brought this to the attention of the front desk, but nothing changed. It was very inconvenient when we were trying to get ready, and maid service arrived to clean the room---inexcusable. Hot water and room cleaning are two basic necessities for a quality visit, and we didn't experience either one. We will never return!

Reviews.Title: “A Reasonable Size”
Reviews.Author: nmsouthwest
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my week at the Tropicana. What a nice change from the Mega-Hotels - it was so easy to get up to the room. Everything was neat and clean; loved the shutters on the windows. Nice white bedding. The pool was attractive. Dining was expensive but very good.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds with a good South Strip location.”
Reviews.Author: karmill_8
Reviews.Content: Although I didn't find this hotel as beautiful as some of the other reviewers did, I did enjoy our stay. The rooms were large and comfortable, with a large flatscreen and one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in. Yes, the've been remodeled, but the wall paper and tile floor in the bathroom weren't new and were a bit tired. The casino, although not as large and flashy as some others, was bright and lively. I like my coffee while I'm getting ready in the morning, but like many hotels in the big cities, a coffee maker isn't a standard amenity (hate that!). I inquired upon checkin and found that one is available for a fee - I think it was $10 per day. I decided to get ready first and wait in line at Starbucks. We walked over to New York New York to eat a couple times - ate at Gonzalez Y Gonzalez and the Burger Bar. Both were very good and affordable. I was in Vegas for a conference at Mandalay Bay, and the free shuttle across the street at Excalibur got me there in about five minutes, but it doesn't run early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “This place is amazing”
Reviews.Author: MrJRKnight
Reviews.Content: Ok well I was very optimistic on booking this hotel as I love vagas and normally stay at planet Hollywood were I stayed for the first 3 nights of my holiday before my road trip and on my return I tried here for a change. All I can say is wow this place is amazing it's perfect the rooms are spotless the staff are so friendly and helpful the casino is bright and clean, the room as out of this world, I checked in at 12 and checkin didn't open till 3pm yet they ms eyed me out with a amazing room and was helpful all the way. This hotel has so much and believe me I won't be looking anywhere else and I'm sorry but this place is loads better then planet Hollywood, in every way rooms, pool, staff, and especially coast of alcohol. I love vagas to bits and have been here a fair few times and have stayed at numerous places Inc mgm and more and tropicana tops them all by far, Anyone who moans about this place must be crazy I stayed in the towers at the back of the resort and yes it's a 5 min walk but omg it's worth it. And the bell boys will even deliver your lounge so what's there to moan aboutni stayed on the 4th floor and it's amazing. I will defiantly be coming again without any question. My partner agrees 1000% and she's a massive ofmplanet holly wood. Imeven writing this review with the free wireless connection avoidable in all rooms while staying at tropicana. I know I rated this hotel 4 for location but at the same time it is one of the oldest hotels on the strip and I would not change it formthe world. Niki beach is also a place to keep your eye on a I can see this as the day club to be next year as it's loads better then wet republic and Tao beach.

Reviews.Title: “The greatest vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Mrsevans0531
Reviews.Content: It was a great hotel! There wasn't a lot of attractions there which meant less foot traffic so it was perfect for me. We got married there too! The wedding was beautiful and the wedding staff was wonderful! The breakfast buffet was overpriced but the brunch on saturday was good. Overall it was a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “vibrant and spectacular tropicana hotel”
Reviews.Author: edward r
