Reviews.Content: everybody must stay at the vibrant new tropicana las vegas !!! what a fantastic birthday celebration spot or for any occasion ! from the beginning we were treated like royalty. exceptional customer service in every venue. classy and elegant from the moment you step thru the front door . beautiful luxurious room ! relaxing and fun day lounging at the newly renovated pool and gardens ,with lovely ladies delivering cocktails at our every whim. mouth-watering food at carla pelligrinos bacio restaurant . the gladys knight show was more than we could have hoped for . ms knight was incredible ! our seats were fabulous . her energy and beauty cannot be surpassed . our entire stay really was stupendous . everybody must go experience the new tropicana las vegas for all its elegance , 5 star customer service , and phenominal ambiance !!! cant praise it enough !!

Reviews.Title: “What a change!”
Reviews.Author: Current5
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tropicana a few years ago before the remodel. It was ok then for the price (well, it was worse then ok, it was awful). But now, it is the BEST deal on the Strip. They have poured mega bucks into this new Tropicana, and it shows. Everything is clean and bright, the employees are happy and it totally shows. Check-in was easy and painless (unlike some Vegas properties). Our room was 1203 in the Paradise Tower...had a view of the Strip. Room was SPOTLESSLY CLEAN, and each day we came back to the room it was perfect. The beds are very comfortable and we had lots of pillows....there were even two extra pillows in the closet. The coconut smell in the casino and hotel was very refreshing, so much nicer then the musty/wet carpet smell I smelled in other casinos (hello New York, New York!) Last time I stayed at the Trop, the waitresses bringing drinks in the Casino were non-existent, this time, every time I turned around, one of those nice women were asking me if I wanted a drink. Found some great loose slot machines. The new pool is the best, but my only complaint about is that while sitting out at the regular pool, I could hear the music from the pool over at Club Nikki. Two different songs going at the same time....very distracting. I would suggest they coordinate the music between the two pools. They now have a Starbucks, so nice to be able to get coffee early in the AM. One complaint about the store by the front entrance that sells essentials....although it is nice to have the store there...is it REALLY necessary to charge $9.00 for a pack of cigarettes? I know it is Vegas, but that was a bit over the top. All in all, I ADORE the new Tropicana, and I will stay there the next time I travel to Las Vegas. Kudos to the Tropicana management and to all of the employees there, thanks so much for a wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: HowardBenjamin
Reviews.Content: I was very satisfied with my stay at the Tropicana. It is one of the older hotels on the strip so even though it recently had a renovation it's still not at the level of a Palazzo or the Aria. It's a good 3 1/2 to 4 star hotel. Rooms are clean, bright and have all the amenities you will need. The pool area is actually larger than some of the newer resorts. The casino is smaller as well. The service was excellent. It's at the south end of the strip near the airport and right across from the MGM. The price was right as well. Book as far in advance as you can. I booked 90 days in advance and got an amazing rate for each of the three nights I stayed. There is a $9.99 daily resort fee which cover's wifi in the room plus some food and drink incentives. The fee is better that some other resorts on the strip. Check out the 1/2 price ticket and food kiosks on the street. Great deals on shows and food. I paid $3.00 and received a 50% discount on a steak dinner at another hotel. Again the Tropicana is a nice hotel, it's not a 5 star resort so don't expect 5 star amenities. It's clean, bright and a perfectly fine hotel to stay while in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: terri3089
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so good! Just got back from 5 day stay, was a relaxing hotel to come back to after a busy day of walking up and down the strip. The bed and pillows were AMAZING, wish i could have brought them home with me. Rooms were really clean, super quiet and spacious. The pool area was nice and clean, I recommend getting down there for 9am to get a choice of sunloungers though. Overall it was very worthwhile! The cheap rates and great location on the strip made it even better! Loved the whole stay, can't wait to go back again

Reviews.Title: “First class in every area”
Reviews.Author: Phil B
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vegas and the tropicana turned out to be an excellent choice, all staff where very helpful all the time and the maid Irene who was on the 5th floor was like a mum to us, always asking where we had been,looking to go, and just having a general interest in what we had planned(worth her weight in gold). While in Vegas we got married and the food at the hotels Biscane restaurant was the best meal in our two week stay and like most people we eat all over. All areas of the hotel where very clean and a great location on the strip, the only draw back for us was nikki beach which on four days of the week they had thumping music playing through the day, but if you where out seeing the sights it was all over on your return. After looking around at the other hotels we WOULD return to the tropicana as everybody made us feel very welcome and nothing was too much trouble. Keep up the good work Tropicana and see you in the future.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK.”
Reviews.Author: BeckChristiansburgVA
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Tropicana from 9-10-11 through 9-16-11. This hotel has its pros and cons. The check in line was not busy, we were the only people in line. We arrived at the hotel about 1:15 p.m. and checked to see if our room was ready and it wasn't. We knew that check in was 3 p.m., sometimes we have been able to check in early at other Vegas hotels. We were told to check back at 3 p.m., we did and our room was still not ready. It was ready after 4 p.m. We were told that housekeeping was the delay. The resort fees were waived since it was their fault our room was not ready. The hotel did not appear busy, but housekeeping was slow. On two consecutive days, our room was not ready until after 2 p.m. The room was clean, conveniently located to the elevators and the bed was comfortable. We will not stay at the Tropicana again because of its location. We were aware of its location, but thought we would give it a try because it was recently remodeled. However, with the monorail being next door at the MGM Grand, it made traveling the strip easy.

Reviews.Title: “Make the switch to the Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: Irishmouse24
Reviews.Content: We had in the past stayed at the Monte Carlo (several times) and hesitated to switch to the Tropicana. Based on reviews we read about the "New Tropicana", we decided to give it a try. From the moment we arrived, we were thrilled with the redone hotel. The staff was engaging and friendly throughout the hotel. All public areas of the hotel are clean and inviting. The pool area is beautiful, the layout of the casino area is done so that it does not feel overwhelming as it does in some of the other hotels, and the restaurant food was great. The spacious room was very nicely decorated with the most comfortable hotel bed I can ever remember. I can't think of a single thing that was not top-notch at the Tropicana. We will stay here on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of Calm”
Reviews.Author: 986LesleyM986
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at this hotel. The decor is well appointed and refreshing. It is a calm, serene and beautiful respite from the busyness of Vegas. The rooms are spacious and meticulously clean and quiet. The pool area is lovely and the restaurant food excellent. Very good value on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “First time to Vegas was a HUGE hit for hubby and I!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa T
Reviews.Content: I have read a lot of reviews on this website, most good, some not so great...Well, this is not one of the rude and not so great ones, because honestly I have nothing bad to say about the tropicana! my hubby and I had a great stay there. when we arrived the front desk gave us a complimentary dinner at the biscayne steak house for $150 dollars and put us in a room with a view. Gwen was super accomodating and very polite. check in for us was a breeze. The room was excellent for what we needed it for...lets face it people, you're in Vegas to do other things than just sit in your hotel room all day. Even though there isn't much of a selection of restaurants at the tropicana, we were totally okay with that, we were out touring lots anyways...we did however have dinner on my hubby's birthday at the steak house and the food was simply amazing. the staff were knowlegable and very attentive. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to people that are looking to stay on the strip, but not right in the heart of it. It was great to tour around during the day and have a quiet place to lay my head down at night after all that walking! OH and the beds are super comfy! This isn't a "party party" hotel with drunk stupid people running around. So if that's what you're looking for then this isn't the place for you. I was completely satisfied with all things about the tropicana. :)

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: TerrenceY
Reviews.Content: From the moment I checked in with Megan and met Thomas/Hotel Manager, the service was incredible. No one I saw looked like they were in a bad mood my whole stay. Everyone had a smile on their faces, you could tell they enjoyed their jobs. I stayed years ago before they did the renovations. It doesnt even look like the same hotel. From the big rooms and comfy beds, to the great pools and Cafe Nikki, they did a great job. I will be staying here everytime I go back to Vegas, which is usally a few times a year.

Reviews.Title: “Overhyped”
Reviews.Author: Raquel3183
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here as he had a work conference here. We made our reservations in May for a king deluxe room non smoking. Upon arrival, they were out of those rooms and offered him twin beds smoking. That wasn't going to work so he was able to get queen beds nonsmoking.  When I arrived a few days later, I stood in check in for 20 min to pick up my key. There were only 2 people working so it took forever. We were in the club tower and it is a hike to get to your room. However, there are cute shops on the way and one that includes snacks and beer for a much lower price than bars. The room is really nice. Comfortable beds, nice tv (except the remote didn't work well at all). The bathroom: it needs some work. The tub is cheap and the shower head was coming off of the wall. The floor is awful and looked like it was missed during the updating process.  The room keys are very sensitive. We got locked out one night and were told that it was because we kept them to close to our cell phones. Security was there within 5 min, though, to let us in.  The hotel does not leave much for a choice of places to eat. Two really expensive restaurants and two average ( for Vegas). So we mostly ate at New York New York or MGM grand. This hotel is not convenient for being on the strip. Get ready to do tons of walking or to take taxis to other locations.  The casino is small, which is fine for us as we don't gamble much.  Overall, the advertised renovating was way overhyped. Don't get me wrong, the hotel is decent but I think it's a hotel that you sleep at and pretty much do everything else at other places.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the atmosphere and quality of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nancy H
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Tropicana recently. I wasn't quite sure what to expect since their rate was more reasonable than other hotels along the strip, but we were pleasantly surprised. We were able to check in as soon as we arrived and were welcomed by a professional hotel staff. We had a great room that was large, airy, comfortable and extremely clean. I don't know that I've ever stayed in such a clean room, even at four star hotels. The hotel's atmosphere was very pleasant, it had a bright and upbeat feeling to it. We also dined in the restaurant which had a good breakfast buffet with a lot of fresh choices. Lastly, we had a car with us and found the parking garage to be very convienent for coming and going. I'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Greeted upon arrival by taxi”
Reviews.Author: Ben N
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly greeted by "Jake" upon arrival. He opened the taxi door and took our baggage and assisted with getting us to the check-in. That personal touch was just what we needed after a cramped flight into town. His demeanor set the stage for a great stay !!

Reviews.Title: “The best!”
Reviews.Author: sandrine o
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the newly re-designed Tropicana Hotel for a business trip and absolutely found my new favorite place to stay in Las Vegas. I cannot say enough great things about this place: yes it's not the flashiest on the strip, but that's what makes me love it even more, because it focuses on the things a hotel should focus on. The service is client driven, the prices for the rooms more than fair, the atmosphere is casual upscale, the dealers in the casino were fun to play with, the bartenders knew their craft, the pool has been rated the best on the strip and every part of the hotel from the rooms to the public bathrooms was pristine clean (which is more than I can say for the bigger hotels). I can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “ALWAYS LOVE OUR STAY”
Reviews.Author: anachile76
Reviews.Content: We have been returning visitors for years. The staff is awesome. We have never had a bad experience at the Tropicana. We will continue to return for as long as we can...Our most recent stay was in Aug 2011. I forgot to remove the "do not distrub" sign and when we got back to our room late at night our bed was not made and we had no fresh towels--it was our fault for leaving the sign out. It was 2am and i called the desk and they ans immed with "good morning Ms. Serrano" which i thought was nice and asked what we needed. Within 10 mins or less we had housekeeping at our door with fresh towels and the offer to change our bed! wow talk about excellend service. The only thing is we wish they would bring back the buffet that was upstairs--we do miss it! other than that excellent place to stay at and reasonable!!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: letsgoskating
Reviews.Content: I was unsure about staying at the Tropicana due to it being one of the older hotels on the strip, but the renovated hotel was a great choice. The rooms are clean, large and quite comfortable. The pool was plenty big so you weren't crowded. And, the restaturant, Cafe Nikki had a nice breakfast buffet. Also, it was nice that there were RTC Transit stops right outside the hotel on both sides of the street and an Express Transit outside MGM. Would gladly recommend this hotel to a friend and also stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Suite - definitely a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: KentGal56
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my visit to Tropicana Hotel. I would definitely stay there again. The 1-bedroom suite was fantastic - large and roomy. The hotel charged $10 for "resort fee", but it did include the internet. So it seemed reasonable - as far as resort fees go. The bed was comfortable, the suite had two HD televisions, the furniture wasn't the most comfortable to sit on, but who sits around all day in Vegas anyway? The casino was light and airy, not the dark smoky interiors of some casinos. And it did smell refreshing - I liked it. My only complaint was with the restaurant selections. They had two high-end type of restaurants, and a snack bar where you order at the counter and sit down in uncomfortable chairs with a number, while they bring it to you. The food was pricey for that type of service ($11 for a club sandwich - no chips, or anything served with it). The music was blaring the whole time we sat there - a loud, raucous sound, you couldn't talk or even think. Ugh, I got a headache after eating there. The other less formal restaurant was good, I really enjoyed their brunch. Why not just a regular coffee shop? You know, where you can go inside, sit down, get served in a nice somewhat quiet place and be able to talk to your companion? But with all that said - there are a million places to eat in Vegas, so of course you can always just walk across the street to MGM and eat there! But I would definitely stay at The Tropicana again. I loved the suite and the price was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for your Money”
Reviews.Author: Frank L
Reviews.Content: I'm going to give this place four stars because I really think Tropicana deserves it after such a great renovation process. When I first visited Tropicana, it was over two years, and I swear that I stepped into a time warp zone. I should have been wearing platforms and bell bottoms. It was right out of the seventies with mirrors on the walls and ceilings, gaudy carpeting, stale stogie smell and odd colors. In the present day, I was very impressed. Now, there are huge flat-screen TVs in the rooms and everything looks clean, nice and new--while still keeping with the TROPIC-ana motif. The casino floor looks renovated, with the exception of the gaudy carpet. But, who cares about the carpet, drunktards end up spilling their drinks anyway. The service is still somewhat the same. It's good service, but it will probably never be what you pay for at the Wynn. But, that's ok, you're paying less and getting more, so something has to give. Overall, yay for being able to stay at Vegas in style but with very little money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place at the end of the strip”
Reviews.Author: Esqbaby
Reviews.Content: Just spent a long weekend over labor day weekend with an old friend. We had a great time, the pool was big enough so it didn't feel crowded - I recommend renting a lounge bed for the day - great investment. Cafe Nikki was great for breakfast and lunch. If you go to Club Nikki say HI to Don at the blackjack tables outside - he was great. At the very end of the strip but you can take the monorail to get to other places....

Reviews.Title: “Ist Vegas stay- good hotel choice”
Reviews.Author: KatieLincolnshie
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms are clean, large and comfortable. We are not gamblers but found the casino light and pleasant to look around. The pool area is lovely. We were ungraded on arrival to a delux room and the resort fee was waivered without us asking. All staff were very friendly. We didn't eat at the hotel although it looked nice. We found vegas very expensive to eat out, but bought discount vouchers from discount stall on strip. Hotel location is at the top end of the strip, close to the monorail and bus stops,

Reviews.Title: “Smell The Lotion”
Reviews.Author: TheRitman
Reviews.Content: The re-done Trop is a terrific value if you like a low-key Vegas hotel experience. I think they pump coconut oil through the vents - it hits you as soon as you pull up. This adds to the overall beach club atmosphere. The rooms are very nice and the casino is on the small side but well run and more fun than many of the high-end joints. I'll return.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana Great Fun! Great Service! Great Manager!”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine2558
Reviews.Content: Recently visited Las Vegas and stayed for 5 days at the Tropicana. Here we were, 5 ladies from Canada - had 2 adjoining rooms and were treated with excellance! The staff were great and friendly. The doorman friendly, funny, and so accomodating! The rooms were clean and housekeeping provided us with towels, coffee, water, etc. and just couldn't of been more generous with everything we needed. The bright, white casino was a great feature compared to so many other casinos on the strip that are so dark and gloomy. The food at the Nikki Cafe is exquisite! You must visit the yogurt bar on the main level - fresh fruit awesome..We have nothing but great things to say about our stay at the Tropicana - poolside is nice but you have to get their early to find a chair - they do run out. Drinks are expensive there, beer is the cheapest. The best thing about the Tropicana is the Manager, Thomas!!!!!! He is so kind, friendly, funny and an amazing guy! He went out of his way to accomodate us and always had a huge, bright smile on his face. For a hotel manager to take the time for 5 women was spectacular......he made time for everyone and on our last day he got 5 big hugs from us. Thomas we miss you :) We would definitely recommend the Tropicana..with it's great location..you can walk and walk and walk everywhere....we are definitley going back to the TROPICANA!

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana oh my GOD !!!”
Reviews.Author: ian j
Reviews.Content: Recently visited Vegas for the 4th time and decided to stay at the Tropicana. Oh my god, am I glad to have made that decision. Recently re-furbished the Tropicana is light, airy, and welcoming. The staff were so attentive and our room in the Club tower was immaculate. Friends of ours were staying in the Luxor and were so jealous of our room that they offered to swap, NO CHANCE!!!. If you go to Vegas pick the Tropicana every time. Location excellent, and the best rooms in town.

Reviews.Title: “The refurbishment did not dissapoint”
Reviews.Author: OMGastrobel
Reviews.Content: When I booked my stay at the Trop last year I was expecting to find a clean fresh room and common areas, not much more than that. Well, they did a brilliant job and at my arrival the property felt like a million dollars. Rooms are tastefully decorated and beds very comfy, the receptionist who checked me in was the friendliest I've ever encountered in Vegas ( really friendly and professional, not your typical super fake friendly dying for a tip ).Also, the cleaners do a great job and both the rooms and corridors are kept spotless. Since it was November I did not venture much into the pool area but that's supposed to be another hit in this property. What I cannot comment on are the eating options. They seem quite limited to be honest ( as expected in a property of its size ) although from the outside they seem nice enough. When in Vegas I'm always on the go anyway and I recommend anyone not to stick to whatever they serve where they are staying and try other places. I hope you enjoy your stay at the Trop as much as I did.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing pool”
Reviews.Author: alexandra s
Reviews.Content: Not the best hotel I've stayed in in Vegas. The casino was very nice, bright, modern and not too big. The room was nice but thats about standard for Vegas now so I wasn't overly impressed. We stayed in the far tower which was a long walk to get to from the hotel entrance, food court, casino and pool. I was not impressed with the pool. It was quite nice but there is a massive amount of concrete in view. The Nikki beach area was lovely but the only time it was open they played really loud dance music so we never used the area. The music could also be heard from the main pool along with the pool side music so you could always hear two lots of music which was very annoying! From some places by the pool the music was so loud that we couldn't talk to each other. The waitress service by the pool wasn't very good either. You had to wait for a long time before you saw a waitress and i think that there were only 2 working the whole pool area. The worst problem with the pool was broken sun loungers. There were so many broken ones that every day we would struggle to find one where the back worked. Most days we wouldn't be able to get one and had to try to prop up the back of a broken one with a table. We did go in September which is the end of the pool season and I'm sure they will be replacing the loungers by next season. I probably wouldn't stay here again purely due to the location on the strip, next time we will go for somewhere more central

Reviews.Title: “Great, Newly Renovated Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: AnjaEm
Reviews.Content: When we stayed here they were still renovating some parts of the hotel but it did not bother us. The room was newly renovated...clean, spacious and beautiful! The only downside of our stay was it is at the very far side of the strip near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Special Surprise”
Reviews.Author: BDHBBQ
Reviews.Content: A "sweet" suite in the Paradise Tower, The room service was excellent, and the staff as well. The location is good for entertainment, however, keep your walking shoes with you when you check in/out or visiting the strip. When/if you decide on going to the casino you will almost always find several open seats in the first week of August.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation are done very well.”
Reviews.Author: Harroldp
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very nice after the renovation and the property looks very nice. The renovations to the swimming pool where not yet done so i cannot comment on that. I however do think that they upped their table limits a bit too much. I think they would do much better in this area of the srip with lower table limits. With the current table limits the casion is not crowded at all.

Reviews.Title: “great room but stay away from the Paradise towers”
Reviews.Author: zeroinc
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I thought they would tear down the Tropicana so I stayed there, but they are building onto the hotel. The room was clean and nice. The only problem was getting the Paradise tower is a loooooooooooong walk, but I would probably stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Didn't tick all the boxes!”
Reviews.Author: bonbon928
Reviews.Content: Not the best hotel we have stayed in whilst in Vegas. Had a room in the Paradise Tower, lovely and clean, the only downside to that was you could hear everything through the walls. Only ate in the hotel once and that was for breakfast, which was expensive, not enough choice on the buffet and cold. The casino was light and airy but downright boring! no atmosphere! consequently didn't play there much. The pool area was very nice. Location is very good, giving you easy access to the strip and surounding hotels. I have to say that even though we enjoyed ourselves very much on this trip, maybe we were expecting more due to the amount of excellent reviews we had read. Would we rush back to stay there again - I don't think so!

Reviews.Title: “Great catering”
Reviews.Author: Jim74127
Reviews.Content: I'm attending a conference here and am very impressed with the catering services. Things are set up on time and the staff is excellent. Kudos to Velma, Carla, John, Marina, and Sergio, all helpful and friendly. The facility is clean and neat. This is NOT the Tropicana I remember from previous years. Their motto says "We're Changing Everything" and it is right. I understand that the management has changed in the last couple of years, and the changes I see are all for the better. If you're looking for a good conference location, Tropicana Las Vegas deserves a good look.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed this hotel visit”
Reviews.Author: nsIreland
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in a lot of hotels but never been to Las Vegas before, I dont really know what I was expecting. Myself and my partner travelled to LV for 3 nights in July 2011. We were joining a group of people who were staying in this hotel, so we didn't need to look elsewhere on the strip for alternatives. We booked through lasvegas.com and got a rate of $60 per night (although the $15 resort fee/per night/per room was additional to the $60 as is standard with all of the LV strip hotels I believe). The first thing that hits you as you approach this hotel is the smell of coconut; somehow the fact that the hotel pumps this tropical scent throughout the aircon had failed to register with me prior to our arrival. After a few days we just became accustomed to it. The rooms were not overly luxurious; the bathroom was quite basic. But the beds were comfortable and the hotel had all we could ask for, at what I still think was a decent overnight rate. The breakfast buffet was about $20 per person, which also seems standard enough in Las Vegas hotels. The hotel concierage desk helped my organise a helicopter trip to the Grand Canyon prior to our arrival, we secured a rate which saved us more than $200; we flew with Maverick and I have to say although it was pricey it was well worth it. There is a starbucks inside the hotel, and it is within walking distance of CVS pharmacy and Ross etc on the strip. The outlet malls are well worth the visit, I went to the one south of the strip which was about a $15 taxi ride, although I do believe there are buses you can take which are much cheaper. Overall I was very happy and would certainly stay here again, but if you want to be more "in the thick of it" I would suggest staying further up the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Newly renovated rooms”
Reviews.Author: Dawn B
Reviews.Content: The rooms in the Tropicana have been remodeled into a South Beach theme. Very nice, shutters on the windows, big round tub, Stone floor in the bathroom. Like most Las Vegas Hotels, the rooms are far from the entrance, you have to go through the Casino first, and in this case also over a glassed in bridge with a few shops. There are 3 very good restaurants, a food court, and a Java Jave over on the Club Room side. Brad Garret is playing there, as well as a gangter-themed customer involved production. If you see anything wrong with your room report it right away and they will fix whatever it is. Nice pool area, the other pool is only open in connection with Nikki Beach, and only at certain times, but this is not posted anywhere. There are big drink menus displayed on the walls on the way out to the pool, but apparently they still remain from some club that no longer exists there. The workout area has just about everything that you could need. The hotel tries very hard to make sure that your stay is good. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants, they were expensive, we ate next door mostly at the Mad Onion at Hooters where they have $9.95 Prime Rib or Chicken and Ribs.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and comfort in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Smallz82
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 days. I must say that they have excellent, plushy beds - I really did not want to leave the room on some days. Their rooms were also clean and had pretty spacious bathrooms. Staff upon checkin was friendly and accomodating. Chill ambiance, quick elevator with lounge music, cheap mini mart on casino level, and a has a 24 hr pizza place and a Starbucks! Would definitely stay here again. Only downside would be there were no coffee makers in the rooms for people that do not feel like spending over 4 dollars in their coffee. Still, a nice hotel with an extremely convenient location to the strip and the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great upgraded hotel and excellent location but long walk to the room”
Reviews.Author: Einey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple nights for business. This hotel is quite old and as such, has the stigma of being old and shabby. It's not - it's recently had a huge renovation done and the rooms are very nice and clean. I recommend this hotel to anyone who doesn't mind longer walking distances from the lobby to your room. Also, while it is still a very nice and comfortable hotel to stay in, I wouldn't count on it to impress on a honeymoon or important business engagement. It's walking distance to all the great places on the South strip (like Bellagio and MGM) and that's a good thing because the casino at the Tropicana (if that's why you're coming here) is not top notch - it's mediocre. Make sure to keep your windows closed and check your room as I found a BAT (yes, the flying kind) on my room's wall/ceiling in the morning - that explained the tapping sound I heard in the room as I was falling asleep (it was the bat flying around the room). Hotel staff were shocked and this is obviously not a common occurence but they were very nice and promised me two free night stays. Nice, comfortable, good value. If this is your first time in Vegas and you're visiting with wife/girlfriend and you want the full experience, stay at the Bellagio, MGM, Mirage, or Treasure Island. If it's business or you're here for the 2nd, 3rd .. time and want a comfortable sleep in the right part of town - on the strip, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: Virginia_Roaddog
Reviews.Content: Loved the remodeled Paradise Suite! Huge room, clean casino, and great service. View was amazing! Definitely our favorite SOuth Strip place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Freshly Renovated Rooms, Great Staff, and Some of the Best "Rooms with a View in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: BigBrion
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the recently renovated Trop for three nights in a Club Tower One-Bedroom Suite. The suite was very tastefully decorated Vegas hotels. The Tropicana consists of the Paradise Tower that is nearer to Las Vegas Blvd., AKA, the Strip, and the Club Tower sits farther back. Some readers have complained of the "walk" from the Club Tower, but because the Trop is a more intimate property, it really is nothing compared to the walk one would have to your room from many main towers of the other hotels in town. Also, if you book a Club Suite that faces the Strip, the panoramic views of the Strip from your suite are some of the best in Vegas. I would avoid the rooms facing the back of the Club Tower because these face the airport-although I suppose that because the rooms themselves are so nice, it would not matter to many people. The staff is excellent. Although everyone there was great, the front desk supervisor Gerard was gracious and understanding and our server Ryan at Nikki Cafe was wonderful. Nikki Cafe is one of the restaurants on the property and we enjoyed breakfast there every morning. The interior design of the Cafe is gorgeous from the bamboo ceilings to the lacquered wooden tables, to the Maori-inspired accents. It could easily be found in an Amanresort. There were several small nits with the Trop--most related to the music that they play. The music is too loud, espcially in Nikki Beach and by the Pool. Another issue is that the outside "club" called Nikki Beach plays different music than the rest of the pool area, creating a crazy cacocophony that detracts from house nice the pool area is. The music should be toned down and coodinated between Nikki Beach and the rest of the pool area. I love all kinds of music ( rock, metal, blues, jazz) and do not mind a good amount of volume but the volume here was over the top. All in all though, I recommend the Tropicana for its freshly renovated rooms, great staff, and for some of the other design features such as Nikki Beach. The Trop offers an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great option if you don't like the bigger casinos.”
Reviews.Author: DJ1971
Reviews.Content: Not being a gambler or a fan of the bigger casinos in Vegas, the Tropicana proved to be an ideal option for a business trip. Great pool, huge rooms and well equipped gym. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I hope you like the smell of coconut”
Reviews.Author: Formulaonefans
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, rooms good, we got upgraded because it's our 25 th wedding anniversary to a suite. Very nice. Pool good though nikki beach private area spoiled it, their music in constant opposition to normal pool music, but in general good time had by all. But pumping coconut smell out all over the hotel is not good, gets a bit cloying and sticks to your clothes, hotel take note

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLANT HOTEL FOR THE PRICE”
Reviews.Author: playboy1950
Reviews.Content: Stayed 9/4-9/9/11. Hotel has recently been renovated. Hotel and rooms are nice and clean, staff was helpful and friendly. We did have a problem with the room a/c being a little noisy; but, we reported it to the front desk, and it was taken care of within the hour. There are four restaurants on the property, but they are a little expensive, and the casino is rather small. The property sits on one of four corners across from The MGM, NY,NY, and The Excalibur. There are over the street crosswalks to each of the other hotels. We ate most of our meals at the Excalibur. It has a food court with several fast food restaurants reasonably priced, and an excellent grand buffet ($20 / person for dinner) For what I paid, I consider the Tropicana to be a very good value

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: IrelandDeeDee
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel but no I wouldn't say it was amazing, I think if Im honest though its that it has been really hyped up on this forum and on their facebook page so I expected it to be amazing but instead it was just good - this does not mean there is anything major wrong, I just shouldnt have set my expectations so high as it was our first time in Vegas (which I loved!!). Pro's Loved the location as we could walk up along the strip and also easy access to the airport which is great. It was beside New York , New York which has so much to do in it - must visit the piano bar. Best casino for me as it was smaller and not as dark as the others we saw and we went into every hotel. Room was newish - bed most comfortable we have slept in and big TV Loved the smell around the hotel !! very fresh and a nice change from the musty smell in alot of the hotels we walked around Check out - friendly staff member and was smooth but I had already gone down and sorted out our bill the night before which took a while as they hadn't followed notes added to the system for us. Cons Bathroom in rooms, still looks outdated and actually strange in room, as it makes room not fit together ie.old with new Check in - lady who checked us in was not friendly, didnt tell us anything about the hotel, she just said 'Oh you have spoken to Nicole' - she then had our refridgerator delivered but I kind of felt she turned her nose up! Its not much to ask a staff member to say Welcome to Las Vegas - its not like they were that busy! Long walk to the tower we were in so I would say ask to be in the Paradise tower if you can! Not many restaurants - we ate at the steak restaurant but it was expensive for what we got! Now I have to say I was in contact with Nicole in advance and she was very friendly but her staff didnt follow what she had added to our booking and I had to sort that out myself. If Im being honest I expected a little more but at the same time I was happy to stay there and for the price we paid it was great value! If I was staying in Las Vegas again I would probably spend more and stay in The Venetian as this was the nicest hotel we saw when walking in and out - but of course Tropicana doesn't claim to be one of the fancier hotels so as they are in different price ranges this would just be my preference. Overall I would recommend Tropicana if you are on a budget but there are better hotels in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great value at the Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: knowRtravel
Reviews.Content: We were really impressed with this hotel. We've stayed at the Monte Carlo, Caesars Palace and the MGM in the past and we weren't disappointed with the Tropicana. I like the smaller hotels so the Tropicana was great. They've done a nice renovation to the Tropicana but they've managed to maintain a feeling of "Las Vegas of yesteryear." The rooms were fresh and clean - what more could you ask for? The absolute only downside to this resort is that it is on the far south end of the strip. As a result we did end up exploring the Imperial Palace, the Luxor and Mandalay Bay more than we ever have in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Peace in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: nordicwalker
Reviews.Content: Our visit to Las Vegas was not to loose money in the casinos but to celebrate our daughter's wedding so the Tropicana was a perfect choice. The hotel has obviously been re-furbished throughout and our 'de-luxe' room was huge with a comfortable day- bed to lounge on and look out over Excalibur (so pretty at night). Oh so comfortable king-size bed, nice linen and generous bathroom. The pool and garden were a delight with plenty of loungers and shade if you are not a sun worshipper. The whole atmosphere was calm - a welcome oasis after visiting the noisier casino hotels.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time”
Reviews.Author: Holly K
Reviews.Content: My wife and I live here in vegas and stayed one night with out of town freinds. Room was super clean, huge shower, room safe, fridge. Bacio's Italian was unbelieveable (Rissotto Yummy). Staff was freindly and overly helpful. (and I assume glad to have a job) Will definetly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Place!”
Reviews.Author: scoobyju1
Reviews.Content: Recently back from my trip to Las Vegas where we stayed at the Tropicana. On arrival, we were greeted at the front doors & then made our way through check in. There was a small queue but we were checked in promptly by Rose who was lovely. She was very friendly & even gave us some tips on the best way to see the Grand Canyon. Our rooms were amazing (thankyou Nicole Marshall!). Each room had a fab view of the strip with New York New York, the MGM Grand & Excalibur within view. We each had 2 very comfortable double beds, a flat screen hd tv & an iPod dock. A good size wardrobe aswell. The room was huge by US standards & the bathroom was a good size with a shower & bath tub. I will say that there was a bit of grime around the seal of the bath, certainly not enough to put you off though. We didn't experience any noise which conisdering the pool was directly below us was good. I think the opening times for the pool were good (9am-7pm) as it meant there were no issues with noise whilst you were asleep. The wifi was also very fast. We used the casino occasionally, it was much brighter than other places & nowhere near as busy (which was good!) The waitresses were friendly & the drinks came promptly & free!! We didn't use the pool but it looked very clean & well kept. We also didn't go to Club Nikki although the pool parties at the weekends looked really fun! Check out was a breeze, took less than 5 minutes & they store luggage if you have a late flight. Couple of points to note: When I got to my room, there was a 5 cent coin & a few black hairs on the floor, under the bathroom sink. So I don't think housekeeping was all that. (they also failed to remove empty coffee cups from the room) However, beds were made daily & they did mop the floor when I had an accident with the shower! We had 3 or 4 pizza house menus pushed under the door at night. Something I felt a bit uneasy about. The shower was good but difficult to use at first. You have to pull the handle out & twist! Overall though, I loved it here & would definately stay again. The staff were really friendly & if you get a room facing the strip, you'll have some amazing views.

Reviews.Title: “Overall our stay at Tropicana was really enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: nikki082
Reviews.Content: A group of 8 of us stayed at the Tropicana at the beginning of May this year hotel was still undergoing renovations but seemed as most was completed by this point love that the hotel was on the smaller side we have been twice before and stayed at MGM and Monte Carlo our best overall stay was at the Tropicana rooms were very clean and comfortable for all 4 of the rooms we had the pool wasn't fully completed but we were happy making use of it each day the casino was fun to gamble in perfect size for me could have been more selection of places to eat but the asian food was amazing..... Major downfall is my laptop was taken from our hotel rool when we moved rooms because we needed a smoking room and nobody seemed to concerned security took a statement and nothing came of it so at the trop I won $1000 but lost a laptop.... Overall you will enjoy your stay and if your looking to save bucks on your room this place will not dissapoint! Free parking for our rental car free internet all nice perks as well and we love this end of the strip so we were all happy!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: gmhalstead
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana in Atlantic City is more comfortable/ user friendly. The 'city view' room was a view of the end of Las Vegas Blvd, rather than up the main street. During each night, it seemed the air conditioning had a problem, as the room would warm up. Then, chill again during the day... Of course, the room was MUCH smaller than the view on their website made it seem. Not much to do, not many shops, and as with the rest of the casinos in Las Vegas- not a big return on the $$$ spent in gambling.... I would not recommend this hotel, as there are many more in Vegas to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “We were impressed”
Reviews.Author: handtoGod
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3-night stay at the Tropicana and loved it. I traveled with my 20-something son so we needed a room with two beds. Last year we stayed at the Nugget and when I requested a room with two beds I had to pay for VIP service to ensure I got the room. At the Tropicana when I asked for two beds there was no problem and no extra charge. I also asked for a strip view on an upper floor and got those also, with no additional charge. We arrived four hours before check-in but since there was a room available, which met all of our requirements, they let us check in early--again no charge. On the day of our departure we asked for a late check-out, which they gave us and again no charge. After all of this they asked at check-out if they could have done anything else to make our stay more pleasant. This is great customer service!!! The room was on the 12th floor and overlooked the pool and part of the strip. I was a little concerned because I had read in some reviews that the pool could be pretty loud, although we heard nothing. That may have been because we were not there during a weekend. The pool area is great with plenty of room to move away from the crowd near the pool and find some trees for shade. Our room was clean and well appointed. When we were checking in a lady was pushing a rug cleaner past our door and asked if we wanted the rug cleaned. It looked great to us so we passed. The only problem with the room was the shower head; it was okay for me because I'm pretty short, but my 6' tall son wasn't so happy with it, but it's nothing that would make much of a difference for us whether to stay. The beds and pillows were comfy, the room clean and quiet. The cafe' is good and reasonably priced. The casino is clean and really well lit, which we both like. Some of the casinos are so dark I have a hard time staying in them when I know it's so nice and bright outside. The slots were good to us plus when you sign up for the players club they will credit you half of your losses up to a certain dollar amount on the first day you sign up. I really can't think of anything negative to say about The Trop, we had a great time and were treated very well.

Reviews.Title: “could'nt have been better”
Reviews.Author: peter p
Reviews.Content: this hotel was more than we than ever expected . from start to the end it was fantastic. the staff was great and front desk was the best . If your looking for a grand experience then this is the place. will be our choice again,and again. thanks tropicana for making our trip to vagas wonderful. pete and kathy.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it”
Reviews.Author: wendl23
Reviews.Content: Very inviting entrance, great location, friendly staff, fast elevators, great pool, clean and large rooms. we were on the 7th floor and had a good view of the strip. Staff was always friendly and helpful. Our room was always cleaned early and well. I recommend staying at the tropicana!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a fantasic City”
Reviews.Author: monstermuppetdog
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th trip to Las vegas but the first time we have actually stayed at the Tropicana, and we were really impressed with the face lift that this hotel has undergone. We have always loved the Tropicana since our first visit to Las Vegas in 2004, and managed to get this hotel at an excellent rate for 10 nights. We booked 2 paradise rooms and were not disappointed with them. Both rooms had a king size bed with one looking at the strip and the other overlooking the pool area (including Nikki Beach). The rooms were very clean, the beds extremely comfortable and for 2 people the rooms were huge. One of the things that was great about the hotel is that we didnt have to walk miles back to the room, or walk throught the casino when returning to the room which is really refreshing for a Las Vegas Hotel. Rooms - Spacious, clean and well maintained. Shutters were at the window instead of curtains which was great and the bathrooms were large and well equipped. The shower had multiple settings which was great to wake you up in a morning. Hotel Amenities - Good selection of food options, with both lower and higher end of catering options available. We used Pellegrinos quite a few times and the pizza and sandwiches were huge and well priced. Some shopping options available which were convenient but if you are looking for clothes bouitques you need to go other hotels or shopping centres. Everything clearly signposted except for the toilets over by Nikki Beach nightclub entrance which were very confusing, and resulted in more than one lady going into the gents toilets! This needs to be looked at and would recommend seperate signs indicating which toilet is for which sex. Pool - This was lovely with music played each day around the area. Nikki beach can be a little loud (we were there for the Labour Day celebrations but it didnt disturb our sunbathing) but the pool is large and so quite spots can be found. Towels were plentiful as were the sun loungers, and were able to get a sunlounger at anytime in the day. Pool was ice cold but certainly cooled you down from the 107c temperatures that they were having whilst we stayed there. We were able to take our own food and drink around the pool although a pool bar was available if you decided to purchase there. Location - Ideally located on the strip with NYNY, Luxor, Mandalay Bay, Excalibur, MGM and Monte Carlo all within walking distance. Also the hotel is located at the begining of the Deuce bus route ensuring that travellers are able to get a seat, although be aware that express buses do not stop here which was a little frustrating. Special mention needs to go to both Nicole Marshall and Joseph Phillips who both helped to make our trip even better by providing assistance in advance of us arriving. Overall this hotel exceeded our expectations, and was the ideal base for our Las Vegas Trip. We will definately be returning back to this hotel and would highly recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the newly refurbished Tropicana Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cudds
Reviews.Content: This was a joint family birthday holiday (my 50th and my daughters 21st). We were given an excellent clean room with great views of the New York New York and MGM Hotels aswell as the lovely Nikki beach pool. On check in, the hotel staff suprised us with a fruit hamper and a bottle of wine, which was a generous suprise. The casinos aren't as grand as the other hotels on the strip and at the weekend the private nikki beach clubs music is quite loud and overpowers the pool side music. But apart from thode minor negative points, the hotel is nicely located, well kept, friendly staff and we would definately stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good base camp but small compared to other Vegas Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Averagejo2020
Reviews.Content: It was out first time in Vegas so I booked this hotel because it was cheap and near some hotels I recognised (New york, New york and MGM). Hotel is clean casino is small but good, the big problem I found was there wasn't really much choice for eating out, either a very formal restaurant at night or pizza from the takeaway I think this could be improved as after walking around the other hotels it's clear there is a lot more to offer! Another negative was the bathroom in the room, it was dated and tired, they say they've just had a refit but did the bathrooms get missed? My final problem is with nikki beach, you have to pay into this pool/bar, I think this should be free the residents of the hotel and also it is only only open on some days meaning half of the week it is sat there empty whilst everyone is crammed into the other pool, I can't really understand the logic behind this? In conclusion if you fancy a cheap stay then this place is fine, just head out to one of the other strip hotels for food. It is very clean, staff were nice beds were great but there are far better hotels in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: wckdtrix
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really nice after the renovations. We had a corner room on the 18th floor overlooking the strip on one side, and the airport on the other side. We reserved a regular room, but upon check in we politely asked if there was anything better available, and they put us here. It was a very nice and very clean room. Nice big comfy bed, wonderful view, flat screen tv, nice big bathroom....only thing was, the air conditioner never made it cold in the room. There was time where it was warm in the room, despite the window blinds being closed and the a/c turned all the way down. It was over a hundred degrees outside during the days though, so that might have had a lot to do with it. Also, during the days, you could hear the bass from the Pool Music in the room. Wasnt a problem unless you wanted to sleep or something during the day. The Casino is small, but nice. The only thing I didnt like was the time share people in the casino near the front door. The hotel is in a good location with MGM, Excalibur, New York New York, all right across a street.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: xxxxmiaxxxx
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 7 night stay at the tropicana and would definitely return,perfect location,lovely rooms and lovely staff. We had a city view room that was perfect,hotel had a lovely smell when you walked in. Staff were so nice and very pleasant. Decor was so much nicer compared to other hotel,the Excalibur was so old. Hopefully returning to Vegas in 2012 and will definitely be staying here again. Can't recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value for this coconut hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Danielle W
Reviews.Content: We honeymooned in Las Vegas this August and chose the Tropicana. We scored a 20% off promotion from their website, so we got an amazing price for this freshly reno-ed property. A coconut smell greets you when you walk in, which is kind of cute, and as another poster mentioned, better than the smell of smoke! We had a Deluxe City View room with a view of the Luxor, and it was perfectly clean with a great bed and lots of room. The one thing it lacked was a bar fridge. We spent several afternoons loafing around the pool, which was nicely laid out with lots of deck chairs. The $16 price tag on the sippy-cup margaritas and mojitos at the pool bar is a bit steep, but in true Vegas tradition, they do pour about 4-5 oz of booze in each one. Also, the pool had a pretty noticeable scum ring on the tiles the first day we got there (a Wednesday), but after that it was cleaned. The music (played throughout the property) was oddly pedestrian - I heard maybe three songs I hadn't heard before in the entire week we were there? The fitness center is pretty tiny, but I guess you're meant to get more exercise walking the strip? I liked the diversity of the crowd at the Trop - a good mix of kids, older folks, and young people meant that no one felt out of place. Everywhere we went in Vegas, we received very friendly and flexible service, and the Tropicana staff was no exception!

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana Las Vegas and Suggestions”
Reviews.Author: Paul P
Reviews.Content: I recently spent my 40th birthday in Las Vegas with my girl friend and my best friend and his girl friend. We stayed at the Tropicana and we were impressed with the hotel room overall. The bed was great, super comfortable. The room safe was a great touch being I brought my lap top, it was large enough for my camera and my 15" computer with room to spare. The T.V. was a good size flat screen, 42" from the look of it, even though I only turned in on once. The only part of the room that I didn't like was the bathroom, the bathtub and shower are combined and the shower head is rather low. My girl friend didn't have much of an issue but any one over 5'10'' would have to duck down to get their head under the water. The pool was great, I can see why it was rated the best in Vegas, nicely away from the Strip I didn't even hear any traffic. The fitness centre was decent, with a ten or so workout machines, some free weights and cardio machines. The casino was smaller than some other casinos but nice and not too smokey. The casino was very clean, a lot of effort was put into making sure it was a welcoming place to stay. We stayed in the Club Tower it was nice but walking to the far side of the hotel each time was annoying, especially after a long day walking the Strip. If I was to stay again I would pay the extra move to the front tower. The staff was good, we were able to check in early around 12:30 which we really appreciated and they were helpful in finding places on the Strip. We took a trip to the Grand Canyon to the South Rim, we got a good deal along the strip for $115 each. I first thought of going to the West Rim to see the Sky Walk but one of the tour sellers that sold both tours informed me that you can't take pictures on the walk way and you have to pay extra to walk it anyway. The views from the South Rim will amazing and we got to see two different vantage points on our tour. It was a long day, eight hours, but I couldn't recommend it more. Freemont Street in the old casino district was my second favourite spot after the Grand Canyon, try and go early in your trip, we wanted to return again but ran out of time. The Light Show is really cool, the have a Zip Line you can ride and we went to the Golden Nugget casino and I won $100 when I signed up for a players card, but most only win $5. Get the bus pass for 24 hours to travel back and forth, it too far to walk, we tried! There is a great custom burger place in the restaurant section of the New York, New York, try the onion rings they were great. The buffet at the Excalibur and the Luxor were really good and affordable but I think the MGM had the best buffet I have ever been, my girl friend is a Chef and she was really impressed but it cost more than the other ones. The walk along the MGM, Paris, Planet Hollywood side of the strip is much faster than the NY/NY, Beligio, Treasure Island side of the strip. The MGM side you can walk across the street at most crossings but on the NY/NY you have to walk across sky walks and it is a lot of up and down stairs. I had a great time and I hope this review helps. Paul

Reviews.Title: “One of my best stays in vegas!!!”
Reviews.Author: mjlv2396
Reviews.Content: The new Tropicana is overall fantastic!!!! I loved the coconut smell when you walk into the casino instead of the smoke smell at other hotels on the strip. I stayed in the paradise tower with a deluxe city room and it was very nice. Their beds are probably the best beds I've ever slpet in! They were sooo comfortable!! The rooms are also very spacious. Doesn't have a wide variety of restaurants but I would have to say Cafe Nikki is the best choice. Great decor and great breakfast buffet for $18. The employees are very professional and friendly. They make you feel right at home. I have stayed at Wynn, Mandalay Bay, and Trump International whcih were the best hotels I've stayed in but now I would need to add the Tropicana to my best hotels list. I will definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Taste of South Beach in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: WriterzBlok
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a 2 Queen Bed room at the recently renovated Tropicana with my brother. We had 2 nights there, and could have stayed much longer. The hotel is bright, spacious and has a laid-back beach vibe. The guest rooms are sizeable and clean with Mediterranean colours. We had an LG flatscreen TV in our room. Cafe Nikki offers buffet breakfast at a very reasonable price. The omelette station is a must - freshly made in a few minutes while you wait; absolutely delicious. Once the breakfast has gone down, stroll out to Nikki Beach with its lovely waterfall and palm trees. The poolside bar offers cocktails, beers, anything you like. If the temperature wasn't 106 degrees, my brother and me would have lounged there the whole day! The staff are uniformly well-trained and very friendly and approachable: the lovely lady who looked after me when I checked out asked me: "was there anything we could have done to make your stay more wonderful?" What fabulous service. I said "no", of course. Stay here and you will not be disappopinted. See you again very soon, Trop!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: HOLIDAYoholic
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to the US, but first trip to Las Vegas which is unlike anywhere else on the planet!! A must see for all!! I loved it, and the staff in this hotel and most other hotels made us Brits feel extremely welcome. The Tropicana Hotel where we decidede to stay is clean and airy, you may notice due to all the white decor it is actually not as overwhelming as some of the other hotels, which we liked, because it meant we felt more relaxed when we arrived back at our hotel in the evening. We didn't unfortunately try any of the restaurants in the evening simply because there was so much choice out on the strip when we were out exploring, however me & my partner did try the breakfast buffet at Nikki Cafe for $18 approx each, this was very nice, though you can find breakfast buffets on the strip for quite a bit cheaper, however we found a lot of the more popular buffets had very long queues, and at nikki cafe we were always seated straight away. We went to the Nikki Beach pool party on Sunday 28th August which was great fun, I would strongly recommend anyone go who is over 21 and likes lounging/swimming with table service (there was a minimum spend of $100 between the two of us for our choosen bed) and live DJ. There was a great atmosphere, and everyone including the staff were friendly. The casino isn't as big as some of the others, but as first time holidaymakers in Las Vegas, this just made the tables more approachable to us (We are not big gamblers). We were very pleased with our stay at the Tropicana, and have no regrets booking with this hotel since it was excelent value when we compared its standards (comparable with the other large hotels) against the price you need to pay to stay at some of the other hotels on the strip, however where ever you finally choose to book, it is difficult to get poor service in Las Vegas anywhere (maybe just avoid Imperial Palace which looks like it could do with a renovation).

Reviews.Title: “Made our Anniversary Very Special”
Reviews.Author: PhxFan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a combination business/vacation trip which happened to fall over our 10th anniversary. The front desk staff was very willing to make our stay special, and when we arrived at the room there was a happy anniversary cake and chocolate covered strawberries waiting for us (they didn't even charge us for that!) They also helped coordinate a flower delivery to the room. They made me look good :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, kind of far from everything though”
Reviews.Author: ludaalou
Reviews.Content: Paid less than 80 a night and stayed 4 nights... best price anywhere on the strip for a suite. It waa far from the larger hotels with shop, so I'd probably stay somewhere closer to the middle of the strip next time. Great value though and super nicely remodeled buildings. We said we were on our honeymoon at the front desk when we checked in and got an upgrade!

Reviews.Title: “Miss the old Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: vickyrn
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at thr Tropicana many times over the past 8 years. I was so looking forward to the New Tropicana and Niki Beach theme, although I wasn't sure what that was. We used to enjoy the Adults only swimming area (now Niki Beach) . Well what a disappointment. It has loud pumping musci on the weekends that make it difficult to enjoy the other pool. There is nowhere to get a reasonable priced meal in the whiole place. What happened to the way things used to be? We'll go back to the Orleans, I think.. While we love the staff at Tropicana we have decided to say good bye..

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Donna M
Reviews.Content: Customer service exceptional!!! Every time I asked a question the staff was available and willing and helpful and polite! The room was large, more than adequate and clean!

Reviews.Title: “Impressed by the Renovations”
Reviews.Author: L2Connelly
Reviews.Content: I had always heard that the Tropicana was old and run down, and I knew that they had been in bankruptcy for a while. I had heard that they had new owners that completely renovated it and it was supposed to be nice. Despite all I heard, I had no interest in staying here. However, I was attending a film festival that was being held at the Tropicana so I thought I would give it a try. I am so glad I did. The hotel is really nice. I had a room with a king size bed. The rooms are really spacious, with a lot of drawers and closet space to unpack. The bathroom is very large too--plenty of space to unpack toiletries, which for a female is a perk. The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable. Probably one of the best beds I have slept in. I usually do not enjoy buffets in Vegas because I feel so sluggish and sick afterwards. But the buffet at Cafe Nikki at the Tropicana was incredible. High quality food that didn't leave me feeling bloated and disgusting at all. Salad bar, fresh fruit bar, omelette station, smoked salmon, lean cuts of meats, carving station, pastas. The pool is really nice. Very large and lots of places to find sun and shade, depending on your preference. Club Nikki recently opened at the Tropicana too. Crazy fun party atmosphere by the pool at night, with places to dance and outdoor beds to lounge in.. Worth checking out and free to hotel guests. Oh, and free self parking and free internet. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not much fun”
Reviews.Author: jomama7
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana was very nice, clean, bright, and service was good. However, the floor in the bathroom was not clean...black hairs all over the place. The bed was very comfortable. I wish I would've paid more attention to reviews I'd read prior to our stay saying the rooms were too far from the entrance. We were in the Club Tower and it was a serious journey from our room to exit the hotel. The pools were packed the entire 4 days of our stay and we didn't want to fight for a lounge chair, so we didn't swim. It really is more of a 'posing' kind of place than a fun place. The restaurants were tre' spendy.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service with outstanding management!”
Reviews.Author: Frankyeg
Reviews.Content: Wow!Great new look!I had a great time at Nikki beach which has some of the best dj's in Vegas Dj kidfunk, Dj Ricardo Giron!The beach scene was great as was the atmosphere. Great music and not to mention lOCATION!!! Easy access to everything in Las Vegas. Make sure to also check out the poker room which has great dealers like Hany. Great time spent at Trop! Hope you enjoy your stay as I did. Hope to see y'all on September 17th!

Reviews.Title: “We`ll be back!”
Reviews.Author: 0410Marie-Luise
Reviews.Content: The whole staff was very kind, and the helped us, whenever help was needet. They gave us good tips, for things to do outside the hotel. Many thank to all!!! Marie-Luise und Franz Maruschko - Vorarlberg/Austria

Reviews.Title: “I've never stayed here before...but I will again”
Reviews.Author: dapado
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana is the perfect hotel for those that don't care for the hustle and bustle of the larger resorts. Newly renovated, the rooms were extremely clean and well designed, with very comfortable beds. Your right in the middle of all the action and can walk anywhere. We went to the NIkki Beach opening and it's was amazing...if I were only 3 months younger...lol. If you're staying more than two days I would recommend renting a car and seeing the city. We took in a 51's baseball game that was well worth an afternoon. We also went to Pawn Stars silver and gold pawn shop. Don't go expecting to see anyone from the show, I think they only show up now for filming...they've gone Hollywood!! At least I got a Chumley T-shirt.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Tropicana!”
Reviews.Author: sj7
Reviews.Content: we really loved this resort, the pool was great, lots of shaded areas which was great as it was 110 plus the weekend we were there. The room was clean, bright and loved the lounger chair in the room, it was very comfy. The bed was very comfortable. That is all I ask for! We enjoyed the casino, dont know why people complain about the smell, it is not strong at all, and I already miss it, I loved the tropical smell! There is not alot of choices for a quick coffee as we are not Starbucks people and that is all the coffee that is served there other than the coffee they served in the casino when gambling. We did not eat at any of the restaurants other than the deli and the french toast with nutella sauce is the best!

Reviews.Title: “Great - light & bright with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Lou_Mike
Reviews.Content: Loved the Tropicana. Light & bright decor throughout and very nice rooms with lots of space. We'd booked 2 standard rooms and were upgraded in one to a Junior Suite when we told them it was our anniversary. Staff throughout were very helpful and there were excellent restaurant choices. Loved the pool area, only minor moan was that they need to sort out the music around the pool - in a few spots there was either speakers really blaring out the Djs choices of the day, or we found ourselves between 2 competing sets of music, both being played by the hotel. However, this really is a minor issue and didn't detract from our enjoyment. Casino is well lit and doesn't feel as oppressive as some of those in other hotels we visited on the strip. It's at the airport end (south) of the strip. Be aware you'll need taxis to get out and about unless you are fit and brave the heat! Finally, very helpful to us when we were delayed by a day due to Hurricane Irene and had to stay another night. Gave us a very competitive rate and a lot of sympathy.

Reviews.Title: “The most awesome time of our lives!”
Reviews.Author: Shareefah M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been together 11 years, married 8, with two daughters 7 and 3. We didn't have a honeymoon and had never been on a trip before. So, I decided to book a trip to Vegas. I went through Southwest and got a great package deal. I found Tropicana on the Southwest sight and was immediately impressed with the facility and its amenities. Everything was exactly what it looked like on the website. When we entered the hotel we were awed! It was gorgeous. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We had the most awesome time of our lives! We will definitely be back because the price is reasonable and the hotel is luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Great time spent , am bringing family back next year”
Reviews.Author: tylee63
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the Tropicana, all the staff where very friendly and helpful when needed. The rooms where large and clean, the bed was so comfy if i could ship it home with me i would .

Reviews.Title: “Well done Tropicana!”
Reviews.Author: Ian D
Reviews.Content: As a couple travelling with nearly 600 other New Zealanders into LV on two 747s put on by Air NZ to celebrate a milestone for our national airline, we were amazed and delighted by the way the Tropicana handled this number of guests in one party. The hotel has been re-modelled superbly and surely has to represent the best "value for money" accommodation in Las Vegas. We had a problem with our first room which hotel management sorted as soon as it could and comped us appropriately, so 10 out of 10 Tropicana! We wouldn't stay anywhere else in LV and we hope to be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay. Best value in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Abster_travels
Reviews.Content: Newly refurbished, non smokey, whitewashed Ibiza style glam! Perfect location. Excellent value. Best pool in Vegas! Brilliant. We will definately return to Trop LV !

Reviews.Title: “The friendliest staff!”
Reviews.Author: Tribecamom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tropicana with our 5-year old. We were in a standard room for the first night and then upgraded to a suite for the other 3 nights. The hotel had been recently refurbished, and the furniture looked very new but the standard room was just a step up from Motel 6. The bathroom did not look redone, toilet was old and gave off a bad smell, even though it looked clean. The door is not at all soundproof, and you can hear people talking in the hallway all night. The suite that we upgraded to on the 19th floor was very spacious and had a terrific view of the strip. The bed was very comfortable and the door being away from the bedroom area made it much quieter than a regular room. The bathroom was redone, with two vanities situated in a hallway that leads into a shower area and toilet. There was no bathtub, only a shower. I thought that was an awkward design. The area around the vanities is carpeted, which is not great for an area that is going to have water splashed on it pretty much daily. The best part of the hotel was not the facilities but the staff. Everyone was helpful and the wait staff at Nikki's Cafe were friendly and on top of things without being intrusive. The service from the pool staff was just amazing!! I have never had such great service anywhere. A big thank you to Jess, Emmariz and Stacie for making our pool time so relaxing and fun. The hotel is just average but we would definitely stay there again because of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: timmy71
Reviews.Content: Check in is a bit slow but otherwise an excellent highly recommendable hotel. Would defiantly go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room for the price”
Reviews.Author: Da-Raz
Reviews.Content: The remodel of the hotel and rooms was very well done and up to date. We had a suite for right around $100 a night and it was well worth it. Very comfortable bed and spacious rooms. We only had 2 complaints about the room and they were pretty minor. A shower only was a disappointment and the walls were a bit thin as is common for hotels of this original age. The staff (hotel and casino) were friendly and the rooms very clean and comfortable. The pool was very nice and well laid out. The addition of Club Niki was a point of contention with us as it drew a crowd we were not that comfortable with, mostly Jersey Shore want-a-be younger folks with typical blustery bravado and rudeness, but that seems to becoming pretty typical for the town in general these days and what's a middle aged couple to do? ;)

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Celebration at the Trop”
Reviews.Author: Sandra K
Reviews.Content: Celebrated my birthday at the Trop. Hotel facilities were excellent. Dinner at the Steak House was delicious. Relaxed at the Pool-- enjoyed the drinks and gelato at poolside. Tropicana has returned to be the "Diamond of the Strip" it used to be. It is brighter and more elegant than I remember it to be. Thank you for a great celebrationl. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Really Impressed with Customer service and attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: kwatts1
Reviews.Content: A great few days spent at the Tropicana. Clean, non-smokey and brights surroundings with very good staff staff who are willing to help out if a problem is encountered. I locked myself out my room. Security attended within a few minutes to assist. I also had to stay an extra night last minute and was helped by reservation staff. The pool is great but is very busy especially at weekends. I had to sunbathe on the grass as there were not enough sun-beds! However, the surroundings were great. The bedrooms are spacious and modern and most importantly, clean. Noise from adjoining rooms was a problem during one of the nights but nothing major. A great hotel and a great stay that offers great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good times, great value”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaRobbo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the trop with my wife and 2 friends for 4 nights and must say I thought it was great value. The rooms are in good condition - nothing overly 5 star but the beds are fantastically comfortable with 2 big pillows each so you can get a good nights rest after a hard nights partying. The TV in the room is a flat-screen 40" inch that works well with its remote control - a bug bear for me if I cant change the channels or turn the tv on/off easily. Shower was adequate though the bathroom tiling in our room was a little dated. the free wifi worked very well and free local phone calls was handy for bookings etc. A small refrigerator in the room would have been a nice extra but not a must. Room service was very speedy, food was just ok - could do with improvement. The poolside was ok, but you really have to be in Nikki beach to have a good time, the music is very loud and the pool crew is all 18 to 25, very much like a nightclub and looked like everyone was an awesome time, I felt a bit old going in there (I'm 31). The casino was nice, Trop has 2 craps tables and the craps dealers were friendly, the waitresses were also very friendly and quick with the free drinks (just make sure you tip them a couple of bucks! All in all I would definitely stay at the Tropicana again as it is a good base to do things from and very good value. it is a fair way down the strip so using a taxi is a good idea if you want to be in the middle of the action. we used our hire car a fair bit, valet was very speedy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Brian S
Reviews.Content: I was in Las Vegas for business and stayed at one of the other Vegas hotels; due to the price there we moved to the Tropicana when my wife joined me for a long weekend. We made the right choice, the room was spacious, clean, and recently updated! The staff at registration were friendly and helpful. The Nikki Beach/Club Nikki caters to a younger crowd, but has its own entrance. We were curious so came in and out of that entrance a few times.

Reviews.Title: “Lock your Valueable's”
Reviews.Author: Jewildasin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I been here to Vegas 5x's, and this time thought we would bring our 4 kids, and we gotten 2 rooms, room 771 for the wife and 2 girls age 20 and 18, and room 779 for myself and 2 boys age 20 and 16. They were as excited as could be and couldn't wait for the fun. Check in was quick, 10 minutes and off to our rooms, they were clean at first glance and very nice.
