But I found a penny and a few broken potatoe chips, against the foot board on the one bed and wondered how long it's been there and how long it would stay. Guessing the vacuum doesn't get used much, if there's nothing obvious laying on the floor. Beds were great, towels and basic's were just what we needed. Room view was over looking Nikki Beach, loud thumping music all day, but hey I can live with it. Went site seeing the first night son #1 bought a water at casino store when we got back and on our way to the room($2.50) we watch tv and call it a nite. Friday morning, I hit Starbucks @ 6:30am, call family down at 8:30 and hit Sugar Factory for breakfast, come back to get a few things to go to Factory Outlets to go shopping, but #1 son left his 350 dollars and I.D in a white bank enevelope on the dresser, but when we return for his money, it's no where to be found (cleaning service hasn't been here yet OR SO WE THOUGHT) turns out the pre-inspection lady makes rounds first and enters rooms to schedule room cleaning !!!!!! So she was the only one in our room, admittely, ut that means nothing, they tell us !! Never heard of this, but thats how they do it. So we tear this room up-side-down, no money, no I.D., no envelope. Find tons of place's they dont clean though !! Call security, because there's absolutely no doubt where it was, and where it isn't. But you may as well, throw it all on black and take a chance with roulette instead, because they could care less that it's gone. I didnt expect them to call in the FBI, but give me more then 2 minutes and at least act like you care, because security was really in a hurry to get back to the casino to watch all the honey's walk in and out the pool area. So they had me fill out paper work describing it, because they really could care less, and they'll let us know if something turns up. So fault one: stupid son's stop being so trusting hide your money, fault two: use room safe, up to this point, I didnt even know we had one, but I learned, fault three: just make my own bed (and dont worry about vacuuming, their not doing it anyway) and let a message on door do not disturb and leave old towels outside door, and have them put new towels in a bag outside door. I learned to let no one in that acts like they cant speak English. Any how, very few people are in the pool, when we stayed at the Flamingo, everyone was in the pool. But with the temps at about 105 it's too hot not to get in, but the pool water is shockingly cold, and if you watch everyone get in, they are surprised and really dont stay in the water very long. I'm not sure what the water temp is but It must be colded through some refrigent system, the water temp has to be in the 70's and it is almost to cold and no one stays in, Didnt hit club Nikki, had to be 21 to go in there and act like your something. Drinks were probably double the price in there, I paid $7.00 dollars for a Bud Lime, $12.00 dollars for a icy slushy rum drink for my wife and $8.00 dollars each for 4 no alch-drinks. Water was $6.00, but they'll give you 2 glasses of water free, but ONLY 2. So yeah we're talking $47.00 dollars for one round, me I'm thinking it's crazy, and appariently so did other's, because most people I saw had mugs that they took to their rooms to re-fill, thank good-ness I couldnt get my kids into Club Nikki It would have probably been much higher. Almost forgot, when daughter went with me to buy the drinks, the guy from behind the counter asked if she was 21, I said no! so he says she has to get away from the bar, which doesnt look like a bar, it's looks like a mini-pizza, restaturant, soda-beer stand. Well she didnt move quit fast enough for him so he YELLED, GET AWAY FROM THE BAR !!!!!!!!!! Litterally SCREAMED IT, I said relax dude! there's no sign that says this is a bar, and nothing painted on the ground to say stay behind. Very Low Class, I wasnt impressed with the a-hole and lack of respect for people, but most are tourist, and he could really care less. So as a test I had my kids stand at the craps table's to see how long it would be before security made us leave because they were under 21, and after watching for 25 minutes and security standing 20 feet away,,,,,,,,,no one ever said a word....I thought this was funny. So U have to go to the BAR to get your under 21 adult a soda, they can not go for it ! Anyhow, seen alot of people go in there (Club-Nikki Gate) and alot come out, it's geared to the youngings, not the gambler types that these place's were built on, very few of these kids going in there were in the casino, but then again Tropicana probably made alot on their drinks. Basic small coffee at starbucks 3.50, scoon's were same 3.50. Besides that didnt eat here, they could actually use more restaturants. Be prepared for a country hike to park your vehicle, walk to the front door, thru the casino, across the cat walk (over the pools) to the elevator's, and to your rooms. Ok, it's not bad, but if you do it a few times, you'll learn to hate it. (I'm not opposed to excerise, I run everyday......ran my first 26.2 mile marathon May1,2001) But do the walk a few times, gotta be better enterance to Club Towers, but not according to security. Over-all, nice place. Nicer then it's was previous years, but nothing special. Being from the east coast and only getting here once a year, I would stay somewhere else to just check the place's out. But so far Tropicana is in the middle of the road of place's I'd stay. Also 5 dollars craps during the week, 10 dollars on weekends,,,,,,,,left ahead for a change !!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Ann F
Reviews.Content: Overall stay was very nice. Clean rooms, helpful staff. Convenience to conference center awesome. Pool area neat and compact. Slight dissappointment as far as selections in the "food court" area. Would definitly return.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! This Resort Has Changed!”
Reviews.Author: Josh R
Reviews.Content: Wow! This place has changed! I have not visited this property in five years. It is a whole new place! The rooms were great. They were clean and the very current. The beds were very nice. I asked for a late check out and they were very nice about it. The casino has great play back and was very updated and clean. The service in the casino was impressive. I never waited for anything. The know what they are doing in this place. The pool was nice. This property is only going to get busier. It is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us.”
Reviews.Author: j042
Reviews.Content: For our first time to Las Vegas my family and I couldn't have been more pleased. We loved thep ool area where we could have breakfast in the shade. More intimate feel than the other places that we looked at. We would definitely stay there again. Beds we perfect and we loved our view.

Reviews.Title: “Super place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DublinLimoman
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled in to opting For the big brand names when this super well placed hotel is here.very friendly staff kimberlee on reception outstanding great pool,food,and very well placed will only stay there when in Vegas again

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: rosemaryswade
Reviews.Content: My family and I hosted a retirement party for my father at the Tropicana this summer. We hosted a banquet for 120 people many of which stayed at the Tropicana for several nights. The accommodations, food, service, assistance and support at the Tropicana was exceptional. I worked with Richard Day, Ron Kacir and Martha Cornwell (assisted by the lovely Susan) all of whom were most accommodating, patient and helpful. I took a trip with one of my sisters to the Tropicana in April to see the remodeled hotel and to be sure the Tropicana was the right location for our event. I was completely confident we choose well after meeting Richard Day and seeing the grounds and banquet room. The beautiful location, Richard's experience and "know how" let me know the Tropicana was in the right place to honor our father in style. I can not recommend the Tropicana more highly. We all had a wonderful time and the folks mentioned above were a big part of our wonderful experience. We will definitely come back to the Tropicana, the new decor is just beautiful and the suites are exquisite. Sincerely, RS

Reviews.Title: “Awful will not go back again”
Reviews.Author: eddie p
Reviews.Content: 2 day stay although the only thing that was nice was the room decor we had water pressure problems, desk checkin was a long wait line all the way back to the enterance because attendents arrived late to checkin desk. dirty pool, no buffet

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: bryvancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trop on the recommendations and reviews we read. The hotel did live up to the reviews--nicely remodeled rooms, pleasant smells throughout, good pool. Our only criticisms are: when they remodeled the rooms, they should have replaced the tub/shower fixtures as well. Also, as others have mentioned, the room was not ready when we arrived a 4:30pm, which was surprising as we had booked the VIP check in which allows you to check in at 11:00am. The hotel was accommodating though, they offered to waive the ANNOYING resort fee that they charge on top of the room rate, which was good and also a $30 food and beverage credit. All in all, we had a great stay, we would return. I would choose this hotel for the following reasons: Comfy bed!!, Great, friendly staff, nice pool--no searches!!! and very laid back staff, made you feel relaxed. Lots of shade around pool in the heat. We were in the tower next to the pool, so no need to cut through the casino in your swimsuit. Good location and restaurants. Overall a really nice stay

Reviews.Title: “Great value, service and pool!”
Reviews.Author: WanderingPaul
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with some friends for a weekend of pleasure and then some weekday days for a business trip. The check-in was quick and staff very friendly. The room was clean, definitely renovated and very comfortable. The bathroom seemed a bit dated with old tile on the walls and floor and an older tub. Just an observance, not a complaint. The pillows however, were very plump and all of the occupants felt a bit of neck pain in the mornings. I retrospect I guess we could have asked for slimmer pillows. The pool area is awesome, great energy, very helpful service staff and a great atmosphere in general. Spent a saturday at Club Nikki Beach (a separate pool area) and had a blast! Would definitely recommend this hotel. If you go by the gym area during the day there were peope giving out free Club Nikki passes for the day! Saved some money that way!

Reviews.Title: “AGAIN AND AGAIN, A GREAT STAY!!”
Reviews.Author: amberj17
Reviews.Content: Look, this has been our 7th or 8th stay here since the renovations. I wanted to write a 3rd time because I happen to download some pictures from our stay onto our computer and feel I need to share! The rooms are outstanding!! THE MOST comfortable beds I have EVER stayed in!! Staff is always nice and friendly!! The gym is in a different location but the treadmills still have working belts which is great and the weights and cable machines still work..... all that matters!! We gambled a little more here than usual, and the slots paid out some!! Fun times!! The waitresses were on top of it, so I am sure that helped with our continuing to gamble here. The pool was our favorite!!! Two of the bartenders were so cool to us and made our drinks very strong which we were pleased with!! The chairs were pleantiflul and the waterfalls were cool! I like that they have volley balls or whatever to play with! We got alot of kids involved in a volley ball match which was so fun!! If you want an awesome pool, awesome room, and great service, go here!!! I only wish they were pet friendly, but that would be a heck of a travel for us and our canine companion:) We will ALWAYS stay here when we come here!!

Reviews.Title: “great time at the new trop”
Reviews.Author: LuckysMatt
Reviews.Content: rooms pool and all public areas are like new, make sure to sign up for the slot club. the $200 in free play is for real! (my wife and i earned $230 between us. you get your money over two visits) going back in a couple of weeks, gonna check out the new Carla Pelligreno rest.

Reviews.Title: “What a transformation”
Reviews.Author: thoroughbredmule
Reviews.Content: This was not the same Tropicana I saw 5 years ago! As per the reviews, this Tropicana is something to brag about. We do not especially like the huge resorts and the Tropicana had almost everything we needed --- large/clean rooms, moderate crowds, excellent service, and great location at a very impressive price. The cost of the breakfast buffet was a little steep for our needs, but it gave us a chance to sample other restaurants recommended on Trip Advisor. If you like LOUD, try New York New York or MGM. If you like the above qualities, try the new and improved Tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing experience thanks to Mr. Thomas Martinez”
Reviews.Author: Nancy M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Tropicana Hotel the weekend before my birthday. We only stayed for one night but I have to say, I was very impressed with the cleanliness of the room, and the services we were given. The king sized bed and the pillows in our room was incredibly comfortable and their bathroom was exceptionally clean. Their bathtubs are quite nice as well as they are very large. I also noticed little details such as the shading that had been put onto their windows to help with the amount of sun that comes into the room. It neared 110 degrees when I was there so the shading really did help with keeping the room cool while having the blinds open. Overall, I am completely satisfied with the room we stayed in. Upon checkout, we were cheerfully greeted by the hotel manager, Thomas Martinez. He is friendly, personable, and he made us feel as though we'd known him forever. He greeted me with cheerful birthday wishes and surprised us at the end of our checkout with a complimentary brunch at Cafe Nikki (also inside their casino) as a birthday gift. How thoughtful, and amazing is that? I have never felt so taken care of and I couldn't be more grateful to have met Mr. Martinez. It was honestly the best Vegas trip I've made and will probably be the most memorable. I would definitely recommend staying at Tropicana. You can never go wrong with a hotel that offers nice rooms and reasonable prices. The wonderful customer service and good cafe food is just icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: HMGal
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Vegas June 30 - July 3. First time at Tropicana. Was great. Nice and clean. Smells like coconut. Nikki Beach was awesome. Felt like a celebrity. The rooms were cleaned by 11am each day. The hotel doesn't have a lot of resturants but there are tons of great places to choose from in Vegas. There is a younger crowd in the hotel and the casino isn't as busy so you don't have the constant slot machine ringing in your ears the whole trip. Also, hotel not ask smokey as the others I've stayed at which is nice. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “in the middle of where it all happens”
Reviews.Author: Petervanberkel
Reviews.Content: modern rooms, great view on the strip. The beds were good. We have had here a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool!”
Reviews.Author: Theresa F
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Trop this week. The hotel itself is nice and rooms are clean. Room service is a rip off and the portions are tiny! Not many restaurants in the hotel. No upgrade available when we got there which I was really hoping for. The best part of the Tropicana is the pool, its AWESOME!! I enjoyed my stay but probably would stay somewhere closer to the middle of the strip where there are more dining options.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Peter853
Reviews.Content: It may be one of the original Vegas hotels but it has recently been completely refurbished and is lovely and bright and fresh from the casino to the rooms. We stayed in a suite which was easily big enough for the four of us (We have a 12 and 13 year old boys who had to share a bed but it was so large they didn't care!). Our room faced out onto the strip but was very well sound proofed and the blinds kept out all the neon light so a good nights sleep was had by all. It is situated at the bottom of the strip oposite the MGM Grand but most of the big hotels are within easy walking distance or if you want to you can nip into the MGM and pick up the monorail.

Reviews.Title: “Good locale for convention center exhibitor”
Reviews.Author: dallasiteonbusiness
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Sunday through Wednesday, the hotel rates in August are really inexpensive, we were here for a trade show at the Mandalay Bay Convention Center. I have also stayed at the Mandalay Bay and paid a lot more for the proximity to the show, however, I walked farther within the MB to get to their convention center location than I did while staying at the Tropicana because the show or the hotel (not sure which), provided a free shuttle bus to and from the show site. It was so helpful! the rooms were large and the beds comfortable, good a/c, the hotel wasn't smoky and even the casino wasn't that smoky, it was clean. the pool was great and the drinks were pricey at the pool but I guess that's to be expected. The check in line was long but if you walk to the VIP check in lane they are just as willing to help you, which probably saved me a half hour wait in line. The bell man bring the luggage to your room which is nice also, the staff was all very courteous. Aside from their being dried blood on one of our towels in the bathroom and blood on the inside of the toilet paper dispenser (disgusting), the stay was fine and i'd for sure come back. The Mandalay Bay was a lot more expensive and I didn't think it was any better than the tropicana, so I highly recommend this hotel. It was just fine for what I needed, lots of families here too. OH! wi-fi was easy and effortless, I heard many horror stories from 3 friends who stayed at Luxor which is connected to Mandalay Bay and they all had terrible stories about the Luxor.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best!”
Reviews.Author: 61Nina
Reviews.Content: If you want value, cleanliness, and just overall a great place to stay; Tropicana is it!! I liked the fact that we didn't have to walk across the casino to get to the pool. They had a Starbucks cart on the main floor just as you stepped off the elevator with hardly a wait at all. It's not as glitzy as the other hotels or in the center of all the excitement, but someone described it best as being a "classy" hotel. I highly recommend it if you want less of a crowd. We rented a car since it's at the end of the strip and parking is free at all the hotels. By the time you add up cab fare that you would have paid, it pays for the car rental. I would definitely stay here again. The renovation really made a difference to the comfort of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous spot from which to enjoy Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Albees
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable room, great food, excellent ambience and superb service from the housekeeping out to the doormen.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Suprised”
Reviews.Author: Steve C
Reviews.Content: Ive lived in Las Vegas for 30 years. We stayed a night at the Trop on a comp. This hotel always had a reputation as being the typical middle class no frills hotel . It was just totally remodeled and what a nice hotel. The rooms while certainly not the Wynn or Bellagio were excellent, the pool was super nice, and the Biscayne restaurant was top notch. I would recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a good bang for the buck.

Reviews.Title: “NICE VIBE”
Reviews.Author: DANDEEEEEEEEEEEE
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the TROP in early August. The service was good The room was clean. The pool was nice and the clean. The staff were helpful. Overall i would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely remodeled, Very Clean.. Nice Stay!”
Reviews.Author: RabbitHockey
Reviews.Content: We had an early fight in to Vegas so we got to the Hotel fairly early in the morning. We didnt have any expections our room would be ready, so it was no problem when they said they would just call us when our room got ready. We recieved the call around 1130 AM, which was much sooner than expected. The check in was quick and easy, no long lines but like most of the hotels in Vegas its usaully comes down to timing. The Hotel itself was very nicely remodeled from the way it use to be. There was always someone cleaning throughout the enitre hotel/casino. Its not nearly as busy as most of the other properties along the strip. which was just fine, quick walk to MGM or NY for so more action. Our Room, was nice, clean, and modern. Didnt have the greatest veiw (parking lot and airport) but didnt mind, weren't the room all that much. One of the main factors for us staying at the Trop was the Pool. To echo most of the reviews the Pool and Nikki Beach area is very nice, we really enjoyed it. The pool itself is absolutely freezing cold, but I took the polar plunge anyway, the girlfriend did not. Pools is Vegas are definitely a personal preference, Trop's pool was nice, but not my favorite Enjoyed Vodoo at Rio and Ceasars a little better. There's not a lot of dining options in the Trop, but your such a close walk to any of the other properties it really wasnt a issue for us. In summing up the review, I guess I'll say Ive been to Vegas close to 20 times, some for work so for fun.So a lot of where you decide to stay comes down to your preference. Overall our stay was really good, I would stay again if the price was right, just not sure if it would be on the top of my list of places to stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kwatts1
Reviews.Content: It is so much brighter and more modern than others on the strip.Servicewas excellent and so were the rooms. Pool was very busy over the weekend and not enough pool-side beds were available.But it's obvious that they have upgraded it recently and it shows. Definately worth going to.

Reviews.Title: “Absoutely LOVED Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: robyn m
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the tropicana LV, I've stayed in high-end las vegas hotels on the strip, and the tropicana is officially my favorite. The place is just a very clean, classy, overall great place to stay. I love that is smells like coconuts everywhere you go, to give it that true tropical feel. I stayed here on my birthday and choose to stay in thier spa suite, which was an incredible room! Check-in was quick and easy, the service was great. Loved everything about it. Cant wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DebbyEdwards
Reviews.Content: Staff was super nice. Upgraded our room to a suite for our honeymoon, The GM is hilarious! Only thing is it's right by the airport. I had a wonderful view of the Strip though. Was told by another patron of the hotel that all they could see is the airport. So be wary of what room you stay in. But there wasn't a price list of the stuff in the mini-kitchen, so we didn't use any of it. LOL. Buy your waters from a street vendor. I'm sure it's cheaper! That's what we did. And Starbucks was only $3 for a cup of coffee! Beds were AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice on our first visit to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: lotzasmiles
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Vegas, and based on the reviews of this hotel, it seemed like a good choice and good price for a last-minute vacation. Our club room (2 Queens) had a nice set-back view of the strip. Our club room (1 King) had a worse view of the airport, but also mountains in the distance. I slept soundly at night because the beds were comfortable and the rooms were surprisingly very quiet. I appreciated the IPOD alarm clock. It would have been nice to have a mini fridge and coffee maker, but there is a Starbucks near the elevators. The walk from the lobby to our Club Tower room was quite long, but I think that's to be expected at any strip resort. Unfortunately the escalators were broke a few times, which made our walks even longer. The rooms are decorated very tropical and pretty, but the bathrooms aren't so great. We had problems with the toilet and the floors were cracked so they appeared to be dirty. Showers were miserable because the shower head was so so so low! After a long day/night of walking down the strip, I was so uncomfortable having to bend down to wash my hair. If you are short, than this isn't a problem, but at 5'10, I could only comfortably wash my stomach while standing up straight. Hopefully they do bathroom/shower updates to this hotel soon! Customer service was great and very understanding, no complaints there. We didn't try any of the restaurants because they looked too expensive, but they were decorated nicely. The pool area is really nice, with good landscaping and plenty of space. Also, Nikki Beach (which has a cover) keeps the rowdy partying crowd separate from the more low-key relaxing main pool. Everything seemed to be very clean. I liked the location of the hotel. Across the streets from MGM, Excaliber and New York. It's near the beginning (south side) of the strip but still close to all the action and walking distance to many places. We were able to walk to the Mirage in nearly no time at all and bought a bus pass ($7/day) to get to the outlets and fremount street at night. To be honest, I'd probably stay somewhere else next time I go to Vegas, either splurge for a 4 or 5 star, or visit one of the more extravagantly-themed hotels on the strip (cesar's palace was so beautiful!). But this is definately a nice place that I'd recommend, especially for a good price. One last tip, I realized after we booked that the Tropicana Facebook group offers 25% off your next stay if you book on thier website. That's a pretty good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Blow away--perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Jane P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tropicana for our wedding & we also had our reception there. From the minute we walked in, the service was amazing. The lady at the front desk helped us switch our room to be closer to the reception area, the bellman helped us with our cart bursting with luggage while telling us what we could see & do in the area. The room was very nice & clean. But for us, it was the people in the banquet area that really made our stay. They took care of everything--and I mean everything. At one point during our reception, the cake topper was leaning, and they had the baker come up to the fix it. I didn't even know there was an issue until my husband told me the next day. The food was delicious, the waiters were constantly serving drinks....I just cannot say enough to thank everyone at the Tropicana for a perfect wedding reception and stay!! Please keep in mind that I planned my reception through e-mails with the coordinator, and had never seen the rooms or tasted the food. I just showed up. What more could you ask for?!?

Reviews.Title: “Won't Do That Again”
Reviews.Author: Pour_Sport
Reviews.Content: I'm not a hard guy to please. Usually, I'll roll with the flow. This trip [Oct 14-17, 2010] was disappointing on numerous levels. CONSTRUCTION - I know they were updating the Trop. New pool coming in, etc. It was an inconvenience but I could have worked around it. Not that big of a problem. SPORTS BOOK - Hopefully they have one, now. Again, I worked with it and just went to Ballys. THE PARTY NEXT DOOR - We had 2 rooms. 1 room was the g/f and daughter. I'm in the other room. Same tower but different floors. Turns out they rented the room next door to someone who was having a birthday. I'm assuming, since the party was in the room, the birthday was not #21 or they would have been having it in the bar area. Have you ever pulled up next to a car that has the bass turned up so loud that it vibrates your own car? Well, that's what was on the other side of the wall from my bed. I figure "hey! its Vegas ... they can have a little fun". So, I put up with the yelling, screaming and loud music til midnight. Called the front desk and asked them to have things settle down. Which it did ... for 20 minutes til the alcohol took over again. At 2:00 AM, I demanded a different room which they provided on the opposite side of the hotel. So, about 3:00 AM, after dragging my stuff through the lobby to the other tower, I get settled into a handicap room. After a few hours of sleep, I ask to be put back into my old room [since it is closer to my g/f's room]. They tell me they can't do that because it hasn't been cleaned yet. I explain that I'm well aware of that fact since I'm the one who has been staying in it. That logic was lost on them. Now, I've stayed at the Rio a couple of times, the Imperial, even the Westward Ho way back in the day and this was by far the worst place I've stayed. And its all because they didn't take care of a problem in their hotel when asked to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Christinet09
Reviews.Content: The room was nicely decorated, light and airy and it was good value for the rate that we paid. Everything felt clean and fresh. The pool area was great and the breakfasts at Nikki Beach were wonderful! I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay again in a heartbeat were we ever to go back to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Meticuously clean with a wonderful island decor and best pool in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SalemMaRinaldo
Reviews.Content: From the front desk personnel to housekeeping, they make you feel special. As a Tropicana regular for twenty-five years, I spent my 49th anniversary last week, and my wife and I were treated like royalty. We are well traveled and have stayed in luxurious settings in Europe, Mexico, the Carribean, and The Canadian Rockies. Our penthouse suite at the Trop was beautiful, only matched by its staff. The transformation of this hotel is masterful. We will be back again and again!!!!!! Ron L

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: Riverjig
Reviews.Content: Thomas did an amazing service making sure we were situated and taken care of. I can say for certain I had top notch service from beginning to end. A trip that I will never forget thanks to him!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic redesigned rooms and Nikki Beach - great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Hermit58
Reviews.Content: The entire place has been re-done inside and out. New sports betting room, new restaurants, Nikki Beach, and a 24 hour eatery. Yogurt and gelato at Naked Spoon. Starbucks, Pellegrino has good pizza and burgers. Gladys Knight concert was a real treat. Brad Garrett's Comedy Club was extremely funny. Ambhar Lounge has lots of premium tequilas. The interactive Las Vegas Mob Experience was real fun. All-in-all this place knows how to have fun. It might not be the fanciest, or the richest, or have the tallest towers, but overall, the value is unbeatable. Biscayne restaurant is fantastic, and reasonable prices for a high-end place. The rooms are spacious, clean, comfortable, and very affordable. Use your Trop Plus Players Club card to get room comps and freeplay. The Paradise Suite is huge - enough room for a 15 - 20 person party. The Club Tower Spa Suites are nothing short of luxurious and huge. Even the Deluxe rooms are large, elegant and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: galici
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night on the start of a grand canyon trip. Got a good rate on the room. The room was larger and cleaner than expected. I'd recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely refurbished and good value for money but beware the thin walls!!”
Reviews.Author: JEHSskibumsuk
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on Tripadvisor we decided to end our 5 week tour of southwest USA at the Tropicana - the idea was to have some rest and relaxation after a hectic four weeks on the road sightseeing. Despite having to wait about 20 minutes in a queue for check-in, we were impressed that we were able to access our room immediately (we arrived at the hotel earlier than expected at 11.30am). This enabled us to get straight out to the pool which is a nice area, with a good mixture of sunny and shady spots for relaxing and catching a few rays. There are plenty of sun loungers which are allocated on a 'first come, first served' basis. If you're willing to run up a big bar/food bill you can reserve one of the comfy 'double beds', some right by the pool (they expect you to spend $100 which isn't too difficult if there's two of you and if you're intending to stay all day it is worth doing - we really enjoyed it). The pool area gets very busy, particularly over the weekend. The rooms at the Tropicana have been nicely refurbished with some pleasant touches like an alarm clock with an ipod dock. The air conditioning is really quiet so you can keep it on all the time without it disturbing you. There's no fridge or coffee making facilities, so if you want a coffee in the morning you have to trek down to Starbucks. No big deal but it wouldn't hurt to have a coffee maker in the room. The beds are really comfortable and the room itself is spacious with a well designed bathroom area. We asked for a quiet room, away from elevators and ice making machines, and we were very happy with the allocation. The only downside is that the walls are thin which means you hear a lot of what is going on next door!!!! That said, we liked the Tropicana. It is unpretentious and good value for money. It is close to the MGM which was convenient as we booked tickets to see Josh Groban at the Arena. We found the staff helpful and friendly and we would happily stay here again when back in LV.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay on the strip”
Reviews.Author: CinciMike767
Reviews.Content: The whole complex has been upgraded to top property Vegas strip standards. Rooms were modern, newly refurbished, clean, and spacious. Staff was outstanding. Pool area is top notch. Awesome value for the money. Great location on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “We live in Vegas and stayed at the Trop”
Reviews.Author: Angela L
Reviews.Content: We always stayed at The Trop prior to moving to Las Vegas,now that we live here we could have chosen any place to stay, but I could not pass up the wonderful deal we booked on TROPLV.COM. The place looks amazing. It is so worth the trip. I had read the reviews that people had written and I would like to make a comment. There was one review that mentioned that the light came through the plantation shutters on the windows, that is so not true. Please book your next vacation at The Trop, you will be so happy you did.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana, stepping up to the Plate!”
Reviews.Author: Eric P
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay recently at the Tropicana. My son and I did a little trip to Vegas, The Tropicana is conveniently located near everything. The hotel itself has really stepped up to the plate. The rooms are VERY clean, the food and atmosphere in the Nikki Cafe for the morning buffet was UNBELIEVABLE!! I will be returning during the holiday season. Eric Southern California

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice ...”
Reviews.Author: RLUK
Reviews.Content: A birthday getaway and what a great time was had from start to finish. Due to bad weather in Florida our flight was delayed so we arrived late pass the midnight hour and to our dismay our Deluxe King had gone and we ended up with 2 beds : ( But the next morning a very charming and extremely helpful lady by the name of Jan took care of moving us to our original room request and what a room it was ... and the view Breathtaking ! Renovations are fabulous ... Simplicity at its best ... spacious, extremely clean with fresh colours and the most comfortable bed ever (and l love my king at home) ... it was hard to get up :) As we continued thru our stay we decided to take a trip to the Grand Canyon which we booked thru the hotel concierge Matt and he also was delightful ... breakfast at Nikki Beach was a good start to the day and we also had a birthday dinner at Bacio .... pleasant staff ... excellent food/wine list and the owner greets you at your table .. a very nice touch .... Overall a wonderful stay ... but l have to say Vegas is not all about gambling because there is so much to do and see with a little slot machine exercise in between.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than The Old Trop But Disappointed After The Hype”
Reviews.Author: TCBinKC
Reviews.Content: We were so excited. It was my wife's birthday and we decided on the the Trop to see the new face lift. The rate was about average for this type of proerty on the Strip. We could have stayed at several others on the Strip for the same rate. We saw the reviews about the service and how stealler it was. We did not experience this. We experienced typical LV service. They have signage demanding checking your baggage. We did this nly to turn right around and have to tip the guy and get our one piece of luggage back after checking in. Checking in: There as no wait which was perfect. The gal that checked us in was not pleasant. She wasn't very accomodating. We informed her that we would NOT be using the pool, the WifI, the phone or fax and certainly not utilizing "2 for 1" over priced drink coupons. We were there to gamble and that's it so we did not see any merit in paying the "resort fee". She advised that EVERYONE pays it regardless. This simply is not true. There are many on Tripadvisor and other travel blogs that state they were forgiven on the resort fee. I also asked her about an upgrade since this was my wife's birthday. She said the ONLY rooms that face the Strip had two double beds not a King. We thought that made no sense and again was probably not true. Then she did not put us in the Paradise Tower. Not a real big deal but it would have been nice to not have to walk so far to our room. The hotel/casino did not seem to be all that busy so I doubt they were "booked". Their casino is not very big and we did not do very well there. The promotion they run is basically advertising that you will lose. It is not a very attracative promotion. A promotion is supposed offer a few bucks in free play to get you interested and gambling. The facelift to the property was pretty nice, much better than it was previously. The room was okay, clean enough but we had to ask for a box of tissue and towels, which we received with no issue. The bathrooms were only halfway upgraded. The shower was ample but old and hard to turn on. not to mention it seemed to have a shower head height designed for people shorter than 5 feet tall. I am under 6 feet and had to duck under it to take a shower, rather strange. The bathroom amenties (shampoo and soap) was generic and didn't smell very good. It stayed pretty quiet during our stay so we give that a thumbs up. They have a Starbucks kiosk at the elevator of the tower we stayed in so that was convenient. Cafe Pelligrino we thought was very good, their prices are about average for Vegas as well. We thought the pizza by the slice was awesome as were their breakfast items. The service at the counter was very pleasant. The food we had was fresh. We did not try any of the other restaurants on the property. We did like the location however, South Strip is not bad at all. Plenty of other casinos adjacent. We did well at Bally's and the Wynn when it came to winning money. Overall we think the Trop LV is about average. We would probably ot stay here again for the rate we paid and due to the lack of customer service by the check in desk. We hope their scalping of $22.00 in resort fees is worth losing repeat customers. Had they not forced us to payf or something we did not care to use, we might consider staying again and giving recommendations. Attitude is a big deal to us and we tought the gal at the front desk did not show much in terms of customer service or hospitality. All she had to do to win us over is smile, be nice and not make us pay for the bogus resort fees.

Reviews.Title: “Top place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Gayleen36
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a large group of Kiwis (New Zealanders) and we had a great time. The staff helped to make our stay extra special, the rooms were comfortable and spacious and our party at Club Nikki was the highlight of our trip. Highly recommended. Thanks to all the staff for the wonderful service. Gayleen & Bryce

Reviews.Title: “A Stress Free Wedding”
Reviews.Author: Meghan H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to get married at the Tropicana and had about 20 guests that would be joining us. We had been cordinating with their wedding staff and they took care of everything. Not only were their packages the most reasonable, they through in a lot of extras. When we got their, Victoria our wedding cordinator checked us in and up-graded our room. She also suprised us with a congratulations and our names on the giant jumbotron screen on the strip. All of the wedding staff were extremely attentive and added the little extra details that we didn't ask for but made our experience that much more enjoyable. The grounds were absolutely beautiful and have the most picture perfect wedding alblums.

Reviews.Title: “Such a steal!”
Reviews.Author: CT88
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. Check-in was a breeze, with an easy self-park area. The coconut smell wasn't overpowering at all, it was very nice and refreshing. We had a Strip View room looking towards the MGM, and it also had a great mountain view. The room was extremely clean and seemed a lot bigger than normal hotel rooms. The hallways and elevators were beautiful. The South Beach theme is really working. We ate the Breakfast Buffet at Cafe Nikki one morning, a little steep ($20p/p) for what they offer compared to other bigger buffets, but the food was of great quality. The pool was fine, nothing great or bad. We went to Club Nikki and had a really relaxing, fun time. The pool is really small, but the music played is great and its a nice time for the under 30 crowd. Just be warned, there is little seating if you're not on one of the day beds, and those cost $100 food/drink credit, with 18% gratuity and $9 service charge. But with chips and salsa costing $30, tiny Fiji waters for $6 and pitchers of drinks for $68, you will spend more than $100, trust me. The casino was great. I've seen a lot of reviews complaining about it being too small, but it was so refreshing compared to the dingy casinos in every other resort. It was like a breath of fresh air, and I thought it was great. The service was impeccable, every staff member seemed to genuinely enjoy what they were doing, and were always willing to go the extra step. Overall this hotel well exceeded my expectations, and for the price is was almost too good to be true. I think that as people see for themselves that the Trop has shed its old dumpy image (a la Flamingo) this place will be packed. Amazing trip!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT and will definately be back”
Reviews.Author: Lisa M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for the Sin City Rumble Karate tournament. The rooms were great, the bed was comfortable, the staff was more than friendly. From checking-in with Linda who made us feel so at home and welcome. The hotel is very "lit" too unlike some casino hotels were you feel like you are in a cave. Great location too, right at the beginning of the strip. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most pleasant hotels I've ever stayed in in the US.”
Reviews.Author: Luucarvalho
Reviews.Content: Overall I really have nothing to complain. Hotel is extremely well situated along the Las Vegas strip: you'll be close to a wallgreens, an outback, a dennys and right accross the street from the new york new York hotel, which has many clubs and bars. The Tropicana itself has a great club, called Nikki beach, which is very nice and luxurious. If you're looking for entertainment Tropicana is definitely the place to stay at! And also, the cost benefit ratio is amazing!! Will recommend this hotel to everyone I know that's going to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “No thanks!”
Reviews.Author: Mombits
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and stood in line to check in. We were first in line and there were five people at the check in desk but they ignored us for at least 15 minutes. They chatted with each other and studiously ignored us. Finally one of them checked us in and was at least nice to us face to face. Later we went to get our players card and the women working in this area were quite rude and acted as if we were imposing on them by asking them to explain their policy to us. Our room was nice and clean but had NO extras. No coffee maker, no microwave and no refrigerator. There was a hairdryer that barely worked and an iron that we didn't use. Oddly, the second day of our stay, a refrigerator magically appeared under the desk but it was in an odd position and made it hard to use the desk chair. The other REALLY bad thing was that the toilet wouldn't flush. Since we didn't spend much time in the room and when we were in the room, it was quite late, we just dumped a bucket of water into the toilet to get it to flush and that worked. When we checked out, we told the man at the front desk about the toilet and he did refund our resort fee. As far as the location, it is at the end of the strip so there is a LOT of walking or taxis. Another thing was that there are very limited options for dining late at night. For a city that stays up all night, you'd better not get hungry. We ate at the small cafeteria and it was horrible. One the positive side, one thing that I really enjoyed at the hotel was that when we entered or exited, there was a delightful scent of coconut and really made it feel tropical. All in all, I'll look for another hotel next time we go.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Tropicana in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Vicki T
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend in Las Vegas with friends. We were celebrating birthdays and friendships and loved the "new" Tropicana. It is so NICE! loved Nikki Beach and the pool area. Rooms were bright and cheery. We had a fabulous time and will return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: zhen5
Reviews.Content: The appeal is that it is not a mega-resort. Not crowded. Check-in was a breeze and the path to the room elevators wasn't too far. Our room was on a high floor looking over the Strip and pool. Pool is good and plenty of lounge chairs and towels. Average, decent, comfortable, and clean room. 42-inch flat panel TV. We didn't watch it to much. The safe worked and was large enough to store a laptop. We really liked the location because getting in and out of the parking garage is easy. There is an ARCO AM/PM gas station conveniently located across the street. It is cheaper to buy bigger water bottles there than the hotel. Played the slots and came out ahead. We liked the walkways leading from Tropicana to MGM and Excalibur. Again, the Tropicana is in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the new look and we will be back again soon.”
Reviews.Author: debnic1
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed staying at the Tropicana. New look is great, rooms were wonderful, staff was very helpful. We can hardly wait to get back for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel - it worked for us!”
Reviews.Author: ellives
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Paradise Suite and it was a good call. Loads of space for 4 of us. Terrific strip view on the tenth floor - really amazing at night. The Nikki Cafe was really good - I definitely recommend this place for a great buffet ('til 3pm). The swimming pool was great too. The Trop is in a really good location, south of the strip. For what it's worth, we were a family of 4 with 2 boys aged 9 and 12. As a result, it did seem pretty adult to us (obviously), but not too off-putting. The south end of the strip is more family friendly I reckon and might be a good tip for other families going to Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Looking good, pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: carmo12
Reviews.Content: I read some poor reviews before hand but went there anyway. The room was very nice and the common area was new and fresh. Did not use the pool but it looked good and always had people there. And I won $200 playing blackjack!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: LostLand
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Tropicana and were VERY happy. Nicole Marshall gave us a great deal on a king room on the 17th floor - with a view of the Strip! Good sized room, very spacious bathroom, no complaints whatsoever. If you would like a coffeepot in your room, just ask and they'll deliver free of charge. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Trop is on its way!”
Reviews.Author: Travelgigie79
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay here for a solo trip. I have been to Vegas several times with friends but never stayed at this end of the strip or at the Tropicana. I have always stayed at the Mirage and booked the Tropicana with a hotel/air package through Jetblue getaways. I heard about all the work they did to the Trop and got a great deal with the package so I gave it a try. The Tropicana has clean rooms(as much time as you spend there). The casino is not large but is not overly smoky like some of the other hotels. The pool area was clean and there were plenty of chairs to lounge in . There is a poolside bar and Club Nikki looks cool(did not get to visit). They have done a great job with renovating the interior and exterior. The Trop has been around since before I was born and when I visited it(casino only) in previous years it was very tired looking. I think they have come a long way and are going in the right direction. There are still some renovations underway and I am anxious to visit again to see what it will look like when they are finished. There are only a few choices to eat in the hotel. Bacio is great :). I just wish they had a few more restaurants in the hotel. Got to check out the comedy club and Brad Garrett was in town during my stay. Show was great! The MGM Grand, Mandalay Bay, and New York, New York are nearby. You also can walk to a nearby Deuce/Express bus stop that will take you up and down the strip and to downtown/outlet centers($7 for a 24 hr pass). Enjoyed my stay and would return with friends!

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Sevice”
Reviews.Author: Larry M
Reviews.Content: Just spent the last week in July at the Tropicana for a conference. The staff was very friendly and accomatating. And the shows were gr8t, Brad Garretts Comedy Club and Gladys Knight were money well spent. I only wish I could say the same for the machines(lol) . But besides that my stay was enjoyable and location gr8t. .

Reviews.Title: “Room not ready until 5 P.M.”
Reviews.Author: rick c
Reviews.Content: We came in on Saturday the 13th at 3:30P.M. We reserved a suite. On arrival, the front desk lady tells us that our room is not ready. So I asked when it will be ready. She then tells us that they do not know. After our long car ride from California, we would like to wash up and get ready. So I ask her is there at least an approximate time. She then gets defensive and tells me that how should she know. And that they will call when they are ready. At this point I am fairly shocked. I ask her fine, can she please give us passes to Nikki beach so we can wait it out there. She disappears and comes back with ONE pass. I ask her what am I supposed to do with one pass. (We rented a Suite) She said I only put one guest on my online registration. I told her no that is a mistake I put 4 guests. She gives me a look and say well if you want 4 tickets, we will charge you $25 for each additional guest..... This is the type of service you would find at a motel 6. This is not something you would expect at a Las Vegas Casino. So I gave our luggage to the bell boy and use the public restroom to change into shorts to go to the pool. When I get to nikki beach, I find out it's free to all hotel guests anyways..... The pool is pretty nice. The pool staff are friendly. We finally were able to check in past 5pm The walk to the club towers is a hike in of itself. Up a floor using escalators and then a long walk to the elevators. The suite was decent. We went elsewhere for the rest of our stay there. Checked out NIkki CLub at night. The venue was nice. The crowd was a little ghetto. On our checkout, I asked for late checkout. I was denied. That should have been expected from this hotel. I will never stay here again. My friends booked this hotel for a vegas trip in September. But now they canceled their stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel. Loved the refurb.”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel4448
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Tropicana for our very first visit to Vegas. We loved the hotel and the city. We booked a helicopter tour with Virgin direct and they couldn't of been more helpful. Big thumbs up for them. Nicole is a HUGE asset to this hotel but ALL the staff we had contact with were fab and I would like to say thank you to them all for helping make our trip wonderful. We had a great time and we will return again. The only downside is that we encountered noisy neighbours on a couple of nights so ask for a room without interconnecting doors if you don't want this to happen to you. The pool area is great and you don't need your own towel! Also don't get stung by a taxi fare, take the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: srarakawa
Reviews.Content: I was actually looking forward to staying on "The Strip", since I usually stay off strip or downtown. I also associated Trop with the "old school" hotels, but it has lost its luster. We went to the Tropicana, this time, because of a promotional deal, but we ended up not even getting it... definitely a "bait and switch", because of all kinds of hidden fees and charges. Not very nice of them... Parking took a while and was not very convenient and check-in took forever (over 50 minutes). After taking a "hike" to the rooms, we finally got settled into a nice room, with a view of the construction (blah - not that we spend huge amounts of time looking out windows while on vacation, but jeez). Anyway, bathrooms were clean, beds were nice with no bedbugs, etc... The tv was like 33" or so. Wifi was free - nice! We had issues with the eating places down in the food court. They gave us bad information regarding hours of operation; like it was all new to them. The food at the restaurants was nothing special, especially for the wait time, even though we had reservations. The casino was "dead" everytime I went there. There was no "excitement or action." We probably should have tried a show, but they were overpriced for non-headliner lounge shows. Nothing was really bad, just nothing was very good (price issues aside).

Reviews.Title: “Thank You Tropicana for a Very Happy 50th Birthday!”
Reviews.Author: breanna501
Reviews.Content: Nicole Marshall, Guest Experience Manager, was so helpful and made the arrangements for the accommodations of our guests coming to Vegas to celebrate my 50th Birthday. Nicole and the staff at The Tropicana exemplify customer service excellence! Thank you so much for making this milestone birthday a very happy one! After a stay in December 2010, I was very comfortable in selecting The Tropicana as the hotel for our guests because of our wonderful first experience. My husband and I stayed in a Paradise Suite in the Paradise Tower, just steps from the strip and all the action of the Casino. The room was spacious for entertaining (complete with mini fridge and coffee maker) and the bed was extremely comfortable. Thomas at check-in set the tone for a fantastic trip with his friendliness, humor and helpfulness. He advised we'd been upgraded to a Paradise Suite and wished me a Happy Birthday. The staff at the Tropicana go above and beyond to make the guests of the hotel feel special and appreciated. Every single encounter we, or our friends, had with staff was a pleasant experience. Everyone commented on how impressed they were with the Trop’s team and how friendly and happy all the staff seemed to be. Another staff member we really enjoyed is Thomas the bartender. He makes an excellent mojito and remembers what everyone drinks. We always had a blast playing a little video poker while enjoying a drink and chatting with Thomas. He’s friendly and hard-working. When the bar got busy, Thomas moved with lightning speed and put a smile on everyone’s face! I was happy to see that the word is getting out there; the Casino was lively and busy during our stay and we had a blast at both the table games and slots. Drink service in the Casino was excellent! We were able to enjoy many of the hotels amenities this trip and just loved the pool. Stacie was wonderful and got us set up for a relaxing day in a cabana by the pool, a must-do for future trips! We enjoyed breakfast at Nikki Beach several days and had a wonderful dinner at Biscayne. It's pretty rare that in a group of 10 everyone raves about their meal, but that was definitely the case at Biscayne and once again, the service was excellent! A friend & I both had our hair done at The Tropicana's Salon......once again very friendly service and we loved the results! I feel badly that I've forgotten the name of the lovely lady that did our hair, but I was in a bit of a frenzy getting ready for the party; she worked the afternoon of August 7th. Our group also took in the Las Vegas MOB Experience and had a blast. This is a must-do for anyone with an interest in that part of Vegas' history. Kudos to the Tropicana Team!!! We look forward to a return visit soon and hope to check out the spa suite on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic great location will be back”
Reviews.Author: NOELs2011
Reviews.Content: Great location- across the room from MGM and other hotels on the strip – fantastic pool complex – staff were great with advise and service – rooms all neat and clean with good room service – in the heart of all the action – easy to get to any venue via foot or taxi – most taxi trips were max $15us some suggest the $7 bus great value but very slow – well done Tropicana and staff

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ARLEENH123
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Tropicana start of August 2011 , 7 ladies all the way from Scotland to celebrate my Mums 70th & Sister 40th birthdays. First of all , special thanks must be given to Nicole Marshall , who made our trip extra special. We were given adjoining rooms in the Paradise Tower, beautiful rooms with view of the Excalibur & Luxor with the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in a hotel & the added benifit of mini fridge !! Gifts were left at reception for my Mum & sister & a birthday cake was sent up on mums birthday. The Tropicana is smaller in comparison to the themed hotels but we loved this fact as the size of the other hotels is very daunting & easy to lose each other in whereas the Tropicana has everything close to hand & the pool is wonderful ! Nikki Beach is only open at wkends, not really my scene but looked really beautiful but can be noisey during the day if you sit too close to it but all you need to do is sit at the other side of the pool , problem solved !! Never went to the Nikki beach nightclub but a couple from our party did & they really enjoyed it, free champagne for ladies up till 12am !! Cant comment much on the restaurants as we only ate the buffet b/fast there once which although nice , was very small in comparison to the buffet at the Excalibur where you can get all day pass for $27 which allows you to eat there or the Luxor. Strabucks is open 24/7 which is great & the food at the deli was lovely if you wanted quick bite to eat. If your a steak lover you must try Gallaghers at New York New York !! The pool area is lovely , never any problem getting a bed , water is cold when you first go in but I think thats more to do with you going in from 110 degree heat !! There is a pool bar where you can also order food & you can also be served at your beds if you cant be bothered walking to the bar. Casino is lovely & bright , never had any problems getting drinks while gambling. The Amber lounge has a Happy Hour btw 4-6pm , excellent for half price cocktails :-) All staff are excellent and go out of there way to help you , best service I have had anywhere in the world. Overall the Tropicana is the best hotel I had ever stayed at & all members of our party agreed this is the only hotel they would like to stay at when visiting Vegas !!

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about the Tropicana and I'm already planning my return”
Reviews.Author: Mary M
Reviews.Content: From Evie at the front desk to Stacy the pool manager, everyone at Tropicana was wonderful and went out of their way to make sure we had a great time. The standard room I reserved wasn't available so we were upgraded to a King room and wasn't charged the Resort Fee. I've stayed at a lot of different hotels in Vegas but this one had the best pool ever. Check out with Terry (native of MN) was a breeze! No lines and that is a plus. I will definately be back to stay at Tropicana Las Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “Jewelry Stolen From Room!”
Reviews.Author: LikenItHot
Reviews.Content: Diamond earnings were stolen from our room. Hotel said their investigation revealed no unauthorized entry - only people in our room were authorized hotel staff, no way they could have taken them, right! The Tropicana has refused to replace them.

Reviews.Title: “rocked”
Reviews.Author: Lynn M
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Trop for the 8th year in a row and was better than ever! Nicole from customer service hooked us up with a great deal on a suite and it exceeded our expectations. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “It was Great and we will return”
Reviews.Author: PattyMauser
Reviews.Content: The New Tropicana was really great! Rooms were tastefuly redone and were very comfortable. The casino is spacious and well laid out. The staff were very courteous and informative. We really enjoyed our stay and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Our 25th Anniversary Stay at the Tropicana Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Katie P
Reviews.Content: My wife and I would like to thank the Tropicana for the most wonderful 25th Anniversary imaginable. When we were married 25 years ago we stayed at the Tropicana so for our 25th anniversary we requested the same room we stayed in, room 2025, and were told that the hotel had been remodeled and that room was not the same, so we asked for a regular room with a view of the Strip. When we arrived at the Tropicana they upgraded us to the Spa Suite. The service was second to none, from the Valet to the Dealers; to everyone we came in contract with! Everyone was so pleasant and helpful and made our anniversary trip fantastic!! We had not been back to the Tropicana for 25 years but plan to stay there every time we visit Las Vegas! Thank you Tropicana for the wonderful stay and the memories we will cherish always!

Reviews.Title: “Average at Best”
Reviews.Author: Fender57
Reviews.Content: Don't understand all the talk about the renovation. The rooms were average at best and the shower head was low, OK if you were under 5 feet tall. The pool area was crowded and you had to put up with an indifferent pool staff and gangsta types smoking their hookahs poolside, Meanwhile their much touted Club Nikki sat empty during the day. The meal choices were limited and we ate elsewhere for every meal. The only good thing about this place was the casino area was small and easy to navigate, making it easy to get back to your room after visiting all the other casinos on the Strip. A better value can be had at nearby hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service was 2nd to none!!!”
Reviews.Author: marni k
Reviews.Content: Let's start by saying that getting to Las Vegas was a less than pleasant experience. Needless to say, we were quite grumpy when we finally arrived Saturday night. We were greeted by Shelia, who was ok but was not clear with directions to our hotel room. After trying to located the escalator to our tower, we were greeted by Kennon (apparently, the Customer Service Manager) who was simply AMAZING. He took the time to ask if we were finding everything ok, helped us with our luggage and escorted us to our room. He was even so gracious as to meet us downstairs, personally walked us to the bar and set us up with a cocktail. Kennon's committment to excellence and customer satisfaction continued until our last day, on Tuesday. I was really expecting "old Tropicana" and with the remodel and new staff the "new Tropicana" totally exceeded my expectations. Nikki Beach was also a must do, the staff is very professional, helpful and beautiful. Gigi, Omar and the dancers were hands down some of the most down-to-earth people I've met in Las Vegas. I would absolutely recommend staying at the Tropicana. Thank you again to Kennon and the Tropicana staff...

Reviews.Title: “Nothing was too much trouble”
Reviews.Author: PercyNZ
Reviews.Content: Was part of a large group who stayed here. Hotel staff arranged check-in procedures to suit a group of our size (500-600) and nothing was too much trouble. Every fine detail was taken care of with a smile. At the tables staff openly talked about the best strategies and tried to assist gamblers to improve their game. The rooms were comfortable and featured large television screens - not that we used them. Nikki beach and club Nikki provided great venues for our functions. The only negative was the lack of food options.

Reviews.Title: “Great after the remodel. We would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: Lionel R
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tropicana a looong time ago, in the early 90s. When I heard that they remodeled it, I was interested to see the changes. I think they did a great job. It's not as swanky as the Cosmopolitan or Wynn, but its nowhere near as expensive either. It was modern and clean, and the place actually smelled a little like coconuts when we first walked in. The rooms were nice - nothing to complain about. We tried the Nikki-branded restaurant, club, and pool. The restaurant, Cafe Nikki, was quiet when we were there, but we had excellent service. In keeping with the rest of the hotel, it wasn't super swanky, and our fellow diners ranged from casual tourist types to clubgoers dressed to the nines. The club was on the smaller side, and we had fun, but I'm not a big clubgoer so its better for someone else to review that. The newly remodeled pool is defintely the star of the hotel. It was beautiful, and we had a blast - great music and friendly people. Not as crazy as some other places, as I understand it, but good fun for a couple on a weekend getaway. Overall, we had a great time and we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “its located right in the middle of the srip!!”
Reviews.Author: nahum_10
Reviews.Content: great hotel, the casino is nice, big rooms with cables, and all the attractions las vegas can offer are very near

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff and Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CorgiLover6
Reviews.Content: The customer service at this hotel is the worst of any hotel I have ever stayed at. The entire place smells like smoke and the rooms are falling apart.

Reviews.Title: “Old people central”
Reviews.Author: DAREKC
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, but its not for the young. if you want some nightlife dont go to tropicana. The can paint the walls but they can not kick the old folks out. same hotel different color walls. also do not waste your money at their buffet. terrible selection very small and still super expensive. go to other buffets you will get way more for your money. rooms were nice, casino was ok(small) over all just ok. The pool was nice. i have stayed in vegas at about 10 hotels and i would not stay here again. there are good bargains all over the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: haley119ann
Reviews.Content: The renovations of this casino are remarkable. The Tropicana had a negative reputation in the past as it became outdated and sub par to new, elaborate developments- but now the casino is among the best. The room was lovely, perfect tropical decor and updated furniture and fixtures. The staff was super friendly and accommodating as well. We felt very comfortable throughout our stay. During this trip, we stayed a few nights at Tropicana and then checked into another resort- rated the top in Vegas. I must say the experience at Tropicana was far better, and we wished the entire time we could cancel our reservation at the expensive joint with rude staff and head back to the Trop!

Reviews.Title: “Revived and Renewed”
Reviews.Author: Putnay
Reviews.Content: We chose the Tropicana as it had just refurbished rooms in the front tower. The room we had was spacious and well appointed , bed was fantastic and room had a great view of strip. . Being a smaller hotel and booking in front tower didnt mean a 20 minute walk to room which was great. Rate was very reasonable for the quality of room. Tropicana close to monorail and a good place to explore rest of Vegas from. The casino was great, not smoky, or crowded, and very light and bright.

Reviews.Title: “More glam than we expected, but prices to match”
Reviews.Author: Jediraider
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before starting a tour of Utah and California. We weren't really bothered about Vegas, it was just a good starting point to fly to. I was a bit worried that the hotel was not one the 'known' landmarks, but in fact it was well positioned and quite smart - I gather it is one of the old landmarks. Nice room, but rather scruffy bathroom. Great pool, but shocked to pay $30 for a cocktail and 3 soft drinks! Main quibble was the 9.99 resort charge which was added, that was not mentioned in Virgin's brochure

Reviews.Title: “Not as big as some”
Reviews.Author: ClowseyMelb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tropicana with a group of seven friends for a week in June . After researching on the net we decided to choose Tropicana as it had just had a refurb of rooms in front tower . The room we had was spacious and well appointed , bed was fantastic and room had a great view of strip. Loved that windows could open to get some air into room. Being a smaller hotel and booking in front tower didnt mean a 20 minute walk to room which was great. Must try italian restaurant in hotel , meal and service was superb , chef even came out for a chat (nice). Rate was very reasonable for the quality of room. Tropicana close to monorail and a good place to explore rest of vegas from.

Reviews.Title: “It such a pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: Lulusummer
Reviews.Content: i had a wonderful stay at this hotel and what made the difference was the helpful staff. Love my suite n nikki beach.

Reviews.Title: “An unusually GREAT experience in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Dean H
Reviews.Content: Returning after perhaps 10 or more years, I was reluctant to visit Tropicana, but discovered a renovated and revitalized Tropicana. Most outstanding -- the attitude and response of the staff ensures continued return visits. Every staff member, valet parking, front desk, restaurant and casino personnel, and on, was anxious to be of help without intruding or overplaying it. The look, feel and comfort of the accommodations was excellent. While most casinos are oppressive and dark, Tropicana is open and light which to me, encourages playing and staying. I recommend use of the pool area and the restaurants -- great food! Too bad they discontinued swim-up blackjack -- would have enjoyed that.

Reviews.Title: “We could not have asked for a better experience!!”
Reviews.Author: seashll59
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was wonderful. Close to the airport and not nearly as busy as the other end of the strip. Also conveniently located near the monorail which was a blessing in July! The hotel is absolutely beautiful! The attention to detail and immaculate condition of the hotel is a testament to the staff. The staff made us feel that they were there to provide for our every need. After going through many of the other properties, we truly appreciated the environment that the Tropicana offered. Rather than feeling like we were staying in a casino, we felt like we were staying in a resort that just happened to have a casino. We could not have asked for a better experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: TheMandola
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trop with 30 of our closest friends and family when we got married. It was a weekend filled with fun and relaxation! The entire staff was great! My wedding planner, Victoria, catered to my every wish and we couldn't have asked for a better wedding day!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing trip”
Reviews.Author: Janette110659
Reviews.Content: Have been to Vegas many times but had never stayed at the Tropicana before.It was a wonderful experience and the reno's are great. The rooms were very spacious and the staff were extremely helpful and friendly.Highly recommend this hotel, in fact, we are going back to Vegas again in November and have already booked at the Tropicana for 5 days.Reasonable rates,great pool-why stay anywhere else. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Luv the Trop!”
Reviews.Author: Keith R
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and location! The remodel has made this a much improved hotel. We have stayed at the Trop for many years and call it our Home next to Home when we visit Las Vegas. So, it is good to see them take care of it. The staff are so super friendly and would recommend this hotel to anyone. The pool is awesome! Rooms are comfortable too. It is also a great location!

Reviews.Title: “We had a fabulous time!!!”
Reviews.Author: cstockford
Reviews.Content: We had such an amazing time staying at the Tropicana. Not only was it beautiful, clean, and modern, the staff were absolutely wonderful to us! We had been informed that the Tropicana had undergone some renovations and updates and when we arrived it was obvious they had put alot of money into updating. It was absolutely gorgeous!! And the whole hotel smelled like a tropical breeze! If I knew how they did it, my home would smell the same way. We would absolutely stay at the Tropicana again if we return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great time!!”
Reviews.Author: Mike H
Reviews.Content: Been to Vegas many times and will be back to Tropicana!! Friendly staff gave you that "small Hotel" feeling.

Reviews.Title: “We had a fantastic time can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: AKALIMA
Reviews.Content: All I can say Is that we were super lucky that we picked this hotel for our first trip to Vegas. First off the hotel staff were great. Check in was a breeze and the bell boys were fantastic. Our room was great no complaints, in fact the whole hotel gave you that feel of the cool odl Vegas. Dont get me wrong the whole hotel is redone but its not the overwhelming super hotel feel. Everything is easy to find and the hotel has everything you could want. Another thing we both loved was the location it couldnt be beat. The new pool is also very nice. We toured around Vegas everyday but we couldn't wait to get back to the Tropicana. It always felt like we were coming home and the hint of coconut in the air told us we were there. Gambling was a breeze the table dealers were eager to teach and help out. I never felt like they were trying to take my money. Thumbs up all around. Thanks Tropicana!!!

Reviews.Title: “great time.....clean rooms...great price”
Reviews.Author: magda38836
Reviews.Content: WOW! Just stayed for two nights but could not have been more pleased. The pool is sparkling, the room was great ( did not know we would get a strip view)and the whole atmosphere was wonderful! We will stay at The Trop again when we return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Trip, relaxing stay, awesome pool”
Reviews.Author: Tyson B
Reviews.Content: This was a "get away" trip for my wife and I. The Hotel staff were pleasant and accomodating. We arrived way early and they not only put us in a room it was a huge room, upgraded from what we reserved. The pool is great, not many places really look and feel the way they are portrayed in ads, but the Tropicana was dead on!

Reviews.Title: “Only okay. Not what you'd expect on the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: nin77
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the “Vegas Hotel Experience”, then think twice before booking the Tropicana. While there is nothing wrong per se with the Tropicana, you may be disappointed when you walk around the other hotels on the Strip and see what you could have had for an extra few quid! We stayed in the hotel for four nights over the Easter weekend and it was my first time in Las Vegas. The hotel has apparently been refurbished very recently but our rooms seemed a little tired already. The bathrooms had definitely not been refurbished and could do with a bit of a makeover. The rooms were however clean and spacious and had a comfortable big bed. The pool area is really nice and was a mixture of families, older people and young people. The sun loungers and towels were free of charge with the room booking and there were plenty to go around. The pool area was clean with nice gardens around it. The pool bar had good service. The hotel has a couple of options for food which varied in price and quality but there was something to suit everybody. There are two Starbucks in the hotel and a couple of small souvenir and newsagent type shops. Check in was quick enough and we used express check out, so that only took a couple of minutes. The casino is bright, airy and scented with coconut, which was a nice change from the darker, smokier casinos. We played a lot of slots over that weekend and the machines at the Tropicana seemed the unluckiest for our group and also had the least attentive waitresses. I only managed to get one drink in the Tropicana over the whole weekend! Beware of the hotel telling you that you have free boarding pass printing. I had to go through a major rigmarole with the front desk to get passes printed despite requesting this a day before and emailing the pass to the desk. As I said at the beginning of this review, there isn’t really anything wrong with the hotel, but don’t expect to be blown away by splendour. It is also worth taking some of the reviews oohing and ahhhing about how great this hotel is with a pinch of salt, unless I stayed in a different Tropicana! It really is just a basic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The new Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: Billmrvegas
Reviews.Content: My wife and i just completed our 25th visit to Las Vegas and we had heard about changes to the Tropicana Hotel in Las Vegas. The place had been run down and we skipped going to their location for the past two years. We stopped by for a visit this past May and were blown away by the remodeling of the place. Everything has been done in white throughout the casino. There are even loads of new slot machines. They even have somone opening the front door when you enter the establishment. My wife and i hung around almost the enitre evening to check out the new Nikki Beach and the permanent new show of GLadys Knight. Her vocals today and every bit as good as when she began if not better,. You will hear all the hits and then some. She shook hands with everyone in the front row.
