A real class act since we were honored to be sitting in the front row. I picked up a t-shirt from theTropicanan logo ship and they are true to size and are one of the better quality shirts. I am experineced in this area having collected over 100 t-shirts and over 100 sweatshirts from my stays in Las Vegas. When we got home we called the Tropicana for a couple more t-shirts for myself and one for my brother. We completed the transaction via phone and the merchandise arrived at our steps in a matter of days. We are not getting anything from the hotel to completed this review. We honestly felt that for anyone going on a Las Vegas trip to make sure they catch the Gladys Knight show and at the least check out the all new Tropicana. The place can now compete with anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: bjo2010
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at Tropicana due to its location and onsite amenities. Our stay was nothing short of fabulous and the staff were all very helpful and respectful! The property was very clean and the rooms were very nice. Well done on the recent remodel! We were also able to experience Club Nikki on Friday night, which was an awesome experience as well - great service and great music! Hands down the best service I have experienced in a club to-date! I will definitely be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “The new Trop Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: KJF1298
Reviews.Content: I celebrated my birthday this past weekend at the newly renovated Tropicana and it was amazing. The hotel was completely renovated and has a clean updated look combined with the old Vegas glamour the Tropicana was once known for. Nikki Beach and Club Nikki are great additions to the Vegas Strip especially if you are looking for something a little different that the rest of the clubs and lounges on the strip. They have a south beach relaxed feel and the pool is beautiful. The casino was packed nightly and you could feel the fun in the air. The hotel and it's staff have great energy and genuinely want their guests to have a great time. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone that is going to Las Vegas. I won't stay anywhere else from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana is the Las Vegas tradition”
Reviews.Author: Marty60933
Reviews.Content: Thanks folks you all have done a great job! with the renovation of the Tropicana without losing the traditional ambiance and history of Las Vegas. Your staff was great and very helpful. My wife and I celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary during our stay there. We had the opportunity to stay in one of your Paradise Tower suites, Very nice!. The pool area was great and relaxing. When we go back you will always be our first choice. Thank you Marty Martinez

Reviews.Title: “Best Dealer ever!”
Reviews.Author: UberDinkyProtoGirl
Reviews.Content: The newly remodeled hotel looks amazing! My room was wonderful. The staff was very professional and friendly. Had the best luck in the casino and my dealer, Ronnie, was a riot! He was full of smiles, jokes and wonderful memories. People may have alternate memories of this place, but for the buck, it was an incredible value!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mags204
Reviews.Content: The new Tropicana was perfect! The pool staff was beyond attentive and the prices for the day beds were very affordable, I would recommend the Tropicana to everyone looking for a great time in Vegas!! The rooms were very well done and the entire hotel staff was friendly, helpful and very accomodating!! We will be back next summer for sure!

Reviews.Title: “pros and cons for Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: scouper13
Reviews.Content: Spent five days in Las Vegas and decided to give Tropicana a chance due to all of the good reviews. We go to Vegas a couple of times a year and wanted to try a different hotel. First impressions were very good, it's a clean, modern hotel...not so big that you spend hours wandering around lost. The rooms are simple, but clean and modern. Having the ipod dock in your room is a nice bonus, but half the TV stations don't comi e in, not that you're in Vegas to watch tv. Upon checking in we got pulled into the VIP line and the lady who checked us in wasn't overly friendly. She confirmed that we asked for a non-smoking, king sized bed. We went up to our room and I could smell cigarette smoke...thought it might just be leftover because it's an old hotel. By morning I couldn't stand the smell anymore, so went downstairs to ask to switch rooms and was informed that we had been put in a smoking room. not good. I asked for an upgrade or something to compensate for the fact that I was stuffed up from the smoke and we had to change rooms after unpacking, was told that the hotel was full and we could switch to a non smoking room at 3:00. Not a great start to the trip. Other than that, the staff were great, very happy to serve. The pool was smaller than I expected, but nice enough. Considering the hotel was full, there were still plenty of chairs if you got down there before noon. Didn't try the Nikki beach restaurant, or go to the club Nikki. The bar in the hotel has amazing cocktails, so for sure check out happy hour. The location is much better than Luxor or Mandalay Bay, it's only a two minute walk into the MGM, which is good. and there's a bus stop right outside the hotel, so if you get sick of walking around, it's nice to just hop on. The bus stop will also take you to the outlet mall. Overall, I'm not sure if I'll stay here again. The price is good, but then they add on the $9.99 plus tax resort fee every day, so it adds up quickly. Could have stayed somewhere more in the middle of the strip with no resort fee for that price. you don't really get enough for that money to justify it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: wvvolleymom
Reviews.Content: Resort is very nice. Wonderful, helpful staff. Rooms and public areas very clean-love the scent infused air-not overwhelming. Close to the excitement of the strip and close to airport/rental car return.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas & Tropicana, Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Culture-Shocked
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from a 5 day stay in Las Vegas at the Tropicana Hotel. This hotel has just completed at major face lift. It was very bright, clean, and welcoming. We loved the grounds and property. The front desk staff are very friendly and helpful, as well as everyone else we came in contact with during our stay. This was our 4th time in Vegas and we enjoyed the smaller hotel feel as we found it faster and simpler to get around in. The Tropicana Hotel is in a great location, right on the strip, where the action is. This is our favorite end of the strip, we love it here. While we loved staying at the Tropicana, we also like to pop over to the Luxor, Excalibur, and New York, New York Hotels as well. Staying at the Tropicana makes it easy to do this as it is right across the street, and next to the MGM as well. I would definitely recommend this hotel to stay at. As an added tip to your Vegas stay, we really love the meals at the Pyramid Cafe at the Luxor Hotel across the street. We find the prices to be very reasonable here as well as great home cooking. This was our 4th year visiting the Pyramid Cafe as well. Don't forget about the shows in Vegas. If you want to conserve your money go to the 1/2 price ticket boothes at 10am for tickets that did not sell out for shows that coming evening. You will find a booth at the front of the M&M's store and one down at the Fashion Show Mall. Also make sure to visit Fremont Street, you'll be glad you did. The canopy light show on the world's biggest TV screen, plus the live entertainment, and everything else that goes on down there, is totally awesome. Not to mention also Fremont East with its old neon signs and Vegas's famous Gold and Silver Pawn Shop from the TV show Pawn Stars being just around the corner. This area is a must to go to. This year, while in Vegas, we did the Scoot City Tour to Red Rock Canyon. We had a great day. Our tour guides were fantastic, the day was fun, and the scoot city scooter cars were awesome. I heard it said that you will look like a bunch of Skittles getting down the road, and that we did.. way cool! We really enjoy Vegas, it is a must to do at least once in a life-time. Where else would you see sidewalks polished with buffers, and the most beautiful palm trees.

Reviews.Title: “Well Done Tropicana!”
Reviews.Author: RReynofam
Reviews.Content: I just can't say enough about the upgrades to the Trop... we have always loved it and been loyal to it, but it has so vastly improved over this last year, that if you haven't been... you really need to go! The beds are the most comfy I have ever had in a hotel, we LOVE the pool, and Cafe Nikki was pretty darn good too! If you visit the Abhar (?) Lounge (used to be the Celebration bar)... be SURE to ask for Fred... he is the best bartender EVER... he treated us the way people should be treated in Vegas... surprised he is not working in the top echelon of hotels!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will be back”
Reviews.Author: iriskozak
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying at this hotel.Our experience was a very pleasant one,the staff are friendly,good value for the room rate,the service in the restraurant was great,staff very friendly in answering touristy questions,the greeting by the front desk on registering made us feel like we were very valued guests.Our reservation was for a regular room but we were very pleased that we were upgraded to a corner suite at no extra charge.We have recommended this hotel to our friends and certainly will be staying here again on our next trip to Vegas.They certainly exceeded our expectations.Great job Tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: rosanneyoung
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful,clean and bright place ,the remodel is amazing.The staff was very friendly,the only thing that was alittle upseting ,there are too many fancy resturants,and not enough average places just for a lite snack or just a inexpensive cup of coffee.I think most of the hotels have went to cater too the upperclass of people and are forgeting about the middleclass.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Aawharris77
Reviews.Content: What more can i say...this place is amazing now. The overhaul it has had in the last couple of years has made it one of the best value for money hotels in Vegas. All of the staff are so friendly and helpful and a massive thanks goes to Lyra Hynie for everything she has done for us. Our room was upgraded to a city view room which was huge! The pool area is lovely now and in general the improvements here are top class. Mr Yemenidjian should be VERY proud of all his staff and his amazing hotel. Would stay here again in a heartbeat

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, new room furnishings but no in-room amenities...”
Reviews.Author: tc-AYP
Reviews.Content: Located across from Excalibur and across from the MGM that has a monorail stop, the Tropicana has a new, updated, fresh look and feel. Bell staff are helpful in getting stuff to your room and check-in is a breeze. The room is spacius and the beds comfortable. But simple amenities in the room are lacking--no coffee maker, no micro, no fridge. Bare minimum freebies and no offering of more if you forget things. It's clear they want you to use the Starbucks downstairs. I would try to stay at the Cosmopolitan next time. It's located closer to food courts and other casinos. The monorail is pricey and doesn't take you to all hotels. It's HOT during the day in the summer. Free parking at the casino garages make the car a better option in the summer. The Italian restaurant at the Venetian was EXCELLENT and Jersey Boys was an outstanding show. The line to visit the "Pawn Stars" pawn shop was around the building, so we gave up on that!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Pool”
Reviews.Author: manycats
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights my son loved the pool, I found it to be very quiet and the only problem I had was we had to do alot of walking to get to the middle of the strip. Also they add on resort fees which add up after 5 nights

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and did rebook for next year.”
Reviews.Author: Sande9
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very accomodating, efficient, and friendly. The new remodelled rooms were very nice. The restaurants food is excellent with good service. I would recommend the hotel. In addition, give positive feedback to the staff. It is appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jenscotland
Reviews.Content: After reading so many positive reviews re this hotel, I booked this hotel on the strenghth of them---it did not dissapoint! It is extremely good value for money, and unlike other hotels the whole place is bright and airy The rooms are spacious and as loads of people have remared---the beds are brill! It is also in a good location as it is near the airport, so at the end of our stay, we could relax here knowing that we did not have to 'build in' extra time to get within distance of the airport. the main reason I would stay here agin is that it is obvious that the staff are seriously out to please the customer. We had a couple of small issues that were resolved instantly---Nicole, the general manager clearly takes customer satisfaction seriously! Would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: bosco8988
Reviews.Content: Had a problem with our rooms when we checked in they were suppose to be adjoining and they weren't so we were upgraded to 2 suites instead. Hotel is going through a complete makeover great family hotel. Only downfall was alck of shops and restaurants almost always had to go off site.

Reviews.Title: “Can't believe the changes!”
Reviews.Author: Stanman1803
Reviews.Content: We haven't stayed at the Tropicana Las Vegas in years and can't believe the incredable changes. The staff are pleasent and helpful. The lobby is all new with brass & marble. But the best part is the all new room decor, furniture ans amminities. Go to the website and see what I mean. We were in Room #1801 and couldn't have been happier. Flat Screen TVs, sleek & contemporary furniture, nice new carpet and walls. This is a brand new hotel! We could see east & west on Tropicana Blve and North & South on Las Vegas Blvd. The view at night was stunning! We're going back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fanastic Renvoation - Best Deal on the Strip but very stingy gambling rules”
Reviews.Author: manhattanspace
Reviews.Content: I read every review out there before booking into the Trop for the 4th July weekend. They have done a fantastic job of renovating the place - the lobby is lovely and bright, friendly check in staff (no line at all), the hallways are really nicely decorated in a South American theme and the rooms are excellent - 10/10 (and I never give a 10!) Everything is and felt new - brand new carpets, furniture, bed, bathrooms - everything. Large screen TV, lots of hangers in the closet, a good hairdryer. There was no fridge- but I knew that going in and no coffee machine, but its no big deal. The buffet was great and is the only Vegas buffet that I know of that has an outside deck so you can watch over the pool and the waterfall whilst you eat. The staff could not do enough for us - some of the best I have ever dealt with they made us feel like we were staying in a 5 star resort. 2 things I did not like: 1. Pool. Now - the pictures are of the pool that you see all over the internet and one-third of it does look just like that - but those seats under the palm trees are never available. Turn around and the other 2/3rds of the pool is pretty much all concrete and row upon row upon row of tightly packed lounge chairs. I understand, its a large hotel, you need to have a lot of seats but this was like a school auditorium full of chairs - and don't forget - you can smoke anywhere in Vegas and we couldn't find vacant chairs not next to smokers. Also, the pool bar is just a pool kiosk (like at a post office) we were hopeing (since we didn't like our chairs) to seat at the bar for a bit until something else opened up - that was not possible. The swim up blackjack was closed all weekend (and this was 4th July) The adult pool is very expensive to get in, and when I peeked in, I saw the smallest square pool I have ever seen and a large bar, and chairs that are available to rent at very high prices. 2. The gambling. You cannot surrender, split more than once nor double down after splitting. Deals all hit on soft 17's. Basically, every player advantage that all the other casino offer (well, the 5 I went to on my trip) allow you to do that, so there were not many winners nor many smiley gamblers which was a bummer. Overall - I would go back for sure - I would gamble at a neighboring hotel and get to the pool really early to get a palm tree lounger! Hope this helps :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- rooms are nice, pool is awesome and price can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: merdmb
Reviews.Content: We had a group of people going for a long weekend and the hotel was great! The Penthouse suites are awesome for the price- we also got the three rooms that were joined for friends/family and it was perfect. The manager Jeff was awesome in the booking process and checked back with me several times to make sure everything was good and if we needed anything. Casino isn't as big as others- but MGM is a 5 mintue walk. Location is great as everything on strip is within walking distance. The hotel pool was big and perfect cold temperature! A/C in the room was an issue the first night- but we called and they immediately sent someone up- they changed the filers and then it was nice and cold in the room! Only negative about the bar in the suite is no sink- that would have been a great addition. The master bathroom is HUGE and gorgeous views- the whole room did! Only thing I didn't like was the stairs- the carpet and going round and round made you a little sick but that might not be all their fault!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Service!!”
Reviews.Author: stine808
Reviews.Content: I was extremely impressed with the Tropicana. I had booked my boyfriend and I one of their less expensive rooms and was hoping for the best. But, when we got there and checked in, the man helping us noticed I was on crutches and moved us to a room that was more centralized. The perk of this move was we were moved to one of their newly renovated rooms that were just fabulous!! The reason I chose Tropicana was because I had read the reviews on this site and liked that their management team got involved to handle negative and even positive reviews. I could really tell they cared about their patrons. Upon arriving at Tropicana, this was confirmed. I didn't get the name of the person who upgraded us but am grateful for his attentiveness. I'll always look back fondly on this Vegas vacation.

Reviews.Title: “we loved the tropicana”
Reviews.Author: mel08_10
Reviews.Content: we had a wonderful time at the tropicana. staff was very friendly, service was great. check in and out was great. we will be back again

Reviews.Title: “great service,great rooms, great food!!”
Reviews.Author: carbomb4290
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Tropicana last week and ended up extending my stay an extra night because it was so relaxing. It doesn't have that raunchy cig smell like the other casinos and the floor isn't completely congested with sloppy drunk people all day and night. every single person from the front desk to the cleaning ladies were so friendly and helpful...not to mention the beds were so comfy i stayed in bed an extra 4 hours than usual!! as far as the new restaurants...i thought Biscayne was the best meal i'd ever had until i ate at Baccio, and now it is definitely a tie. Gourmet tasting food for prices we could actually afford?? WELL DONE TROPICANA!!

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana: They Get It”
Reviews.Author: CJC1636
Reviews.Content: In Las Vegas, we would not consider staying anywhere else but the Tropicana. I wish all establishments placed this much attention on customer service and its business practices. Each employee–from the front counter representatives to the housekeepers, those in the restaurants to those operating the floor–makes you feel like you are their only focus. Service, responsiveness, and attention-to-detail are consistent throughout the hotel and casino. Rooms are clean and very comfortable, and it is fresh throughout the whole building. During this stay–our third in the past fifteen months–we ate at Biscayne, Bacio, and Café Nikki. Each offered large portions, and the service was second-to-none. We ate at Gallagher's Steakhouse at New York - New York one night. While Gallagher's and Biscayne both offered comparable meals (both excellent), our meal at Biscayne in the Tropicana was more personable and more romantic–the waiter and others concerned themselves with every detail of our meal. We “stumbled” on the Tropicana in April 2010, with no recommendations to go by. I recommend staying at the Tropicana one time; you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana how we love thee!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jinkz
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the Trop!!! Paradise suites are huge, clean, and offer a great view of the strip. Not to mention, you do not have to pay an arm and a leg to stay at the Trop!!! I was surprised that they barely had any tables up and running but if you want to gamble extensively, just stay at the Trop and hit up other hotels that do offer lots of tables. Trop see you for New Years!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Almost there”
Reviews.Author: editzz
Reviews.Content: When I heard that I would be staying at the Tropicana, man was I bummed. I mean there are so many beautiful hotels on the strip and i get stuck at the old Tropicana.... Well guess what, they have sunk 180 million dollard into renos and the place shows it. I loved my stays (two nights in june, two nights in July) at the Tropicana. The rooms were very comfortable. The views from the 18th floor spectacular. The beds were very comfortable, and the Casino, although small, was great. I also like the relaxed atmosphere of the lobby bar. So why not 5 stars...the bathroom. With all of the money spent, the wow factor quickly dissapears when one takes a shower. The old tub and faucets really don't do the rest of the place justice. Come on Trop, spend a bit more and update the bathrooms.... That said, I would definately recommend this place to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: AmeriExpat
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review by saying that we paid $50 per night for a room. That being said, we were thrilled. I looked around at other similarly priced hotels and we definitely seemed to have come out winners. The hotel had been redone when we arrived. The beds are comfy, the furniture is appropriately kitschy, and if you want to watch TV, it's gigantic. The bathrooms had not been re-tiled, but it wasn't a big deal. We even got the "crummy" airport view room in the less desirable tower, but didn't care because we used our room for sleeping. Moreover, that tower has elevators that take you straight to the pool area! While we were there, part of the pool area was still under construction and Nikki Beach wasn't open yet -- I am sure that this helped on the room rate. But, the garden area was quite beautiful and the pool was nice. We had the breakfast buffet at the hotel the morning of our departure. Our server was quite pleasant, the food was good. We were able to dine leisurely and take it easy before we had to get to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Much better than since the renovation”
Reviews.Author: diamonddave_ca
Reviews.Content: This hotel has recently been upgraded. The rooms are nice and well decorated. The gambling tables are the same anywhere in Vegas but the dealers here actually talk to you and smile. It was a nice change from the stuffy dealers at some of the more expensive casinos. It gets smokey because it is an older hotel and the ceilings are low. All in all, this is a nice place for the price but you should find other places to eat. The selection is not much and the food is expensive. Come on $17.00 for a strawberry margarita at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “7 Nights at Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: LovesVegas7
Reviews.Content: We haven't considered the Trop as a vacation destination for many years, but decided to give it a shot this year. We all know why...the much talked about renovations. There were a few disappointments but over all we had a great time. We stayed in the Paradise Tower in a Paradise Suite with a connecting 2 queen deluxe room. The location of the Paradise Tower was perfect. Easy access from the room to the casino, to the bridges leading to Excalibur and MGM. You'll enjoy this easy access while looking for affordable places to eat : ). After reading about the great service at Tropicana, I was disappointed with our check in. Without going into all the detail, I'll simply say we should have been called when the previous guests decided not to leave the room that was holding for us, and we weren't. Couple of comments about the room. Carpet in the suite was dirty to the point of being sticky in some places. Since we'd had the earlier hassle with check in, and we were finally in our room, we decide to ignore the carpet and get on with the fun part : ). I have no doubt that had we made a call, our carpet would have been cleaned, or we could have been moved. I was also surprised by the condition of the floor tile in the bathroom of both rooms. I'd read on TR about the tile being old and not having been renovated, but I never imagined it being as bad as it was. For some reason, the condition of hotel bathrooms are important to me, I understand that this isn't the case for everyone. I should add that the bathrooms were clean, it was just a visual thing. You can't beat the grounds around the Tropicana pool. I don't know of another location in Vegas where you can put your lounge chair under a tree on the grass near the pool. We're in our late 40's.....feel like we're still in our 30's, and enjoyed the vibe very much. We rented a cabana on two occasions. If you're going to spend the day at the pool, drinking and maybe eating, cabanas are the way to go. We like the casino and found a room with fun slots that paid us well. One night while one of us was winning $600 on WOZ (playing 70 cents a spin !), another in our group was winning over $500 at Deal or No Deal. Each night at least one person in our group won a significant amount at the Trop. The size, price and location of our suite in the Paradise Tower, along with the pool and cabanas will probably be enough to get us back to the Tropicana. My advice to others who are considering the Tropicana.....give it a try. Go there with an open mind, and don't 'expect' the special treatment that others mention in their reviews. Enjoy the location, the pool, the newly refurbished room, the bed (so comfy). And don't get hung up on the little things. No matter where you stay in Vegas with a room rate comparable to the Tropicana there will be some issue with the room, the service, the casino.... If you want perfection, you may be able to find it elsewhere, for a price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - I'd definetly go back!”
Reviews.Author: shazlar
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel just before check in time, which wasnt an issue at all! We asked for a quiet room, with 2 Queen size beds. On chatting to the check in lady, Wendy, this wasnt an issue and when we gave her a $20 tip she waived all resort fees - approx $80, so a good initial saving! we got a fantastic quiet room on the 14th floor, which looked exactly as the web site photos. The housekeeping service was fanstastic with an option to have bedding changed everyday! The hotel was at the end of the strip beside MGM and NY/NY - a good location and relatively close to everything. The only downside was that from the room, we could hear annoying music from MGM all the time. The hotel had a lovely pool area, with good area in the shade, for the hotter temperatures. Also, there was Nikki Beach onsite, which was a lovely way to spend a day! There arent many shops onsite, but there is a little shop, Starbucks and snackbar for all basic needs! On the whole, we had a fantastic time, it was a lovely time and we'd definetly go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Butterworths66
Reviews.Content: We went to the Tropicana after being told it was all redone, great location. The rooms were standard, yet sorely lacking in some area's. There is no coffee maker in the room, ordered room service to send coffee up, the cost was $25.oo. There is no fridge in the room, hard to keep the drinks cold without one. The day of the wedding, all water was not working in the room, came on later, then again that night after wedding the water went out again, seems they forgot to upgrade the system when they did the rest of the hotel. Went to the pool on one day, saw empty seating, got settled, then was told it was reserved, yet not signs saying so, tried to find chairs that were not broken was an issue. There was no refunds from the Tropicana for the guests troubles with the water & the cost of the hotel was right up there with much nicer ones.

Reviews.Title: “Got smoking rooms instead of non-smoking.”
Reviews.Author: Nomad_Jean
Reviews.Content: We booked our room about 2 weeks before arrival and specified non-smoking rooms. But upon arrival, they told us only smoking rooms were available. Though the rooms weren't that bad on the first night (maybe we were overly-tired), it smelled more and more each day, we stayed 3 nights. They did give us the option to switch after the first night, but really, who wants to go through the trouble of re-packing and checking in again on a vacation? But overall, our room is nice & clean,spacious, had a great view of the pool. I love spacious bathrooms. The bath products have a great citrus smell. It is probably one of the best deals on the strip of Las Vegas. We wanted to use the pool and the fitness centre, but with so much to do outside, who has time? Common issue with most hotels in Las Vegas is that you have to walk a mile from the lobby through the casino area before getting to your room. It can be tiring after a long drive.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Tropicana!~”
Reviews.Author: mandyk843
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Vegas, so maybe that was why we were so impressed with it, but we are not novice travelers so I doubt it. I was very happy with the Tropicana, not only was it very clean (there was literally someone wiping the doors down everytime we left) but the renovation was beautiful as well. I did enjoy how bright and airy it was (over powering or not the coconut smell is better than the over powering cigarette smoke) that so many casinos have in them. The casino is smaller and personable, we spent some time there but had some friends staying at the excalbur (which is where we almost stayed and everyone in my party agreed that the Tropicana beat the excalibur hands down)and so we ended up gambiling there and the MGM more. Spent some time in the bar and some time at the pool. The pool was very busy but as people began to thin out for the day the cabanas became available and we ended up closing out the day in one (which was the start to a great evening I might add). Our room was clean, spacious and stocked we were not expecting a room in the paradise tower but got one with a great view of the strip. The staff was friendly and welcoming. We arrived at 11pm and there was no wait for our room. The only thing I would like to see added to the rooms are mini-fridges just to keep drinks cold. We had to fill the sink with ice and throw some drinks in it, also a few more places to eat would be nice, most days we ended up walking over to the excalibur to visit the food court just for something quick and had dinner out at some of the nicer resturants.

Reviews.Title: “great time at a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: powerboater55
Reviews.Content: this hotel has gone thru a 230 million dollar renovation and looks great. our 2 room suite was in the club tower on the 19th floor and had a million dollar view of the srip.high speed internet worked perfect.kurig coffee a big plus.having a fridge meant always having cold water or bringing leftovers back to the room a plus. the hotel manager Tom went out of his way to make things perfect for my wife and I and because of him we will go back agin in the future. all his staff were also very attentive to details and made sure we were always happy. I give this hotel a 10 and agree with all the positive reviews.

Reviews.Title: “We had our wedding at the Tropicana, and it was everything we had hoped for.”
Reviews.Author: Kyle1972
Reviews.Content: Our wedding party stayed at the tropicana. The beds were great, the rooms were comfortable, and quiet. The wedding chapel was cute. The grounds around the chapel were great for pictures, with waterfalls and lots of greenery. All the staff were very nice, and helpful. We had our reception at the tropicana too. The food was really good. We loved our waiter, and waitress. The dj that we went with was recommended by the hotel (good vibrations) had all the songs that we requested, even a lot the were in spanish. In general, if your looking for a place to have your wedding, the Tropicana was beyond good for our budget.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Position, and fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: jocene23
Reviews.Content: This is one of Las Vegas's older hotels, but this just makes it more interesting, with its history of famous stars of old having stayed there. The position at the top of 'The Strip' makes it ideal to head out down the strip and not miss a thing.

Reviews.Title: “excellent short stay”
Reviews.Author: Hagee
Reviews.Content: We travelled with two couples, of which one couple with two girls (9 and 12). We loved our stay here, excellent suite and room. Very specious suite, very clean, just perfect for us. View on strip (MGM and NYNY, 14 th floor, wonderful). Mrs Nicole Marshall helped us in getting adjacent rooms that connected on the inside. Check in went smooth, as did check out. No lines. Very friendly staff. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: Suzie_and_Simon
Reviews.Content: When we decided to visit Vegas, I was worried the rooms would cost an arm and a leg (some of them do!) but the Tropicana was grat value for money. Although on the main strip, the hotel was a bit far from the action but with the monorail and the 100's of taxi's, it's not a problem. The casino at the hotel was my favourite in Vegas and the restaurants in the hotel were great. The rooms were spacious and the reception will accomodate your request to get a view of the strip. Although the pool was freezing, there were enough sunbeds by the pool and the bar staff were friendly. Would definitely recommend the Tropicana to anyone how wants to visit Vegas without paying over the odds!

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: luciya
Reviews.Content: Not bad location. Right on the end of stripe. Free parking. Has pool. The walk from parking to hotel entrance and from the hall to the elevator is a little long. Long check in/out waiting. The room looks clean. But the bathtub was a little clogged.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable room will definately stay again!”
Reviews.Author: javachic
Reviews.Content: We just got home from a 4 night stay at the Tropicana. We didn't want to leave! We had a spacious club suite on the 20th floor and couldn't have been happier. We had a great experience from check in to check out. Barbara at the front desk was incredibly helpful letting us know where everything was located and what hours the restaurants, pool and shops were open. The re-model has brought Tropicana up the level of the other high-end resorts on the strip. Our view was absolutely incredible and the hotel location on the strip is great! The room had two separate vanities which was nice and spacious, two 42-inch plasma tv's, a bar, i-home and a bed I never wanted to get out of in the morning. The new Nikki beach club looked very cool and I will make a point of going next time. I have never stayed at the Tropicana before and wasn't sure what to expect but was pleasantly surprised! I will be back and will recommend it to all my friends that are heading to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Bright and clean”
Reviews.Author: jaabda
Reviews.Content: Though the check-in was a little slow, it was worth it. The room was comfortable, great bed! No coffeemaker but I found out if you ask you can have one. We did the supper special at la bacio, it was a such a good deal and delicious. The casino is clean, the pool area nice (we never went to the Club Nikki section). I caught the bus to Fremont Street right in front of the Tropicana and otherwise just walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Love the New Trop”
Reviews.Author: foster_reed
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights over the Fourth of July. My last stay here was just over 2 years ago and the changes were drastic. We had brand new rooms on the 18th floor which were a vast improvement over the previous "Garden Rooms." For the money we paid these rooms were a steal considering the great south strip location of the Trop. The rest of the hotel/casino has been refurbished as well and we had a great time here even though we weren't big winners on the tables. What really impressed us about the Trop was the service we got from the employees. Everyone from the bellmen when we arrived to the front desk clerk to the dealers at the casino table games were very friendly and seemed genuinely interested in making sure we were having a good time. My only reservation regarding this hotel is in regards to their restaurants. While the food is very good, it is generally fairly expensive. Unlike other hotels in the area, there aren't any lower priced options if you're looking for something quick to eat. Overall though this is an excellent place to stay on the Strip and we will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Old Vegas with a New Shine”
Reviews.Author: DS-FLA
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Tropicana on our very first trip to LV some 20 years ago, and once or twice after that. We always loved the pool and the late, lamented "Follies" show and were sad to watch the property slip into decay. Therefore, when we read about the makeover and the (mostly) positive reviews on this website, we thought to give it a try on our recent 20th anniversary trip. We are happy to report that we had a wonderful time from the minute we pulled up to the valet parking to the minute we left. Every employee we encountered was similing and took great pains to make us feel welcome (unlike some other properties where they act as if they are doing you a favor by taking your money). Check-in took all of five minutes, and luggage was delivered to our suite within minutes of our call to the bell desk. The corner suite with a strip view was huge and bigger than some apartments we've lived in. There were two large flat-screen TVs, a comfortable bed, a fridge and a brand-new bathroom. There were one or two minor flaws with the housekeeping (there were a few things left behind by the former occupants in the drawers) but in fairness to the housekeeper, there was a lot of space to clean and it seemed like she had to do the whole floor by herself. We do not sweat small stuff like that in any event. The casino was small but comfortable and easy to navigate. We found the machine selection to be adequate for a property of this size and the payouts to be on par with other strip casinos. The slot club personnel could not have been nicer and more accomodating and the current new-member promotion is easiily one of the best in LV at this time. After venturing across the street to see a show at the chaos that is New York New York, we couldn't wait to get back to the Trop. When we asked a security genteman for directions to the slot club, he insisted on walking us to it instead of just pointing. That's the kind of service one finds only in small midwestern towns these days and something that leaves an impression. We had some nice pool time and enjoyed a great brunch buffet at Cafe Nikki. While the selection of food may not have been as big as the buffets at the larger casinos, every item was first class, from the lox to the lime tarts. We are only sorry we did not have the chance to eat at either of their upscale restaurants, as they looked very nice and were reasonably priced. Other than that, my only regret was that we had to leave and didn't have time to sample the 2-4-1 margaritas at the tequila bar during happy hour. Some of our former LV favorites like Luxor have gone dramatically downscale while others have decided to aim for a demographic which specifically excludes middle-aged modest players like us; we are not, for example, going to be hanging around Club Nikki in our bathing suits pretending we are yound and rich. We are therefore happy to find another property with modest prices where we feel comfortable and welcome and look forward to our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable enough and cheap, but location was less than ideal”
Reviews.Author: jswan7
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a cheap room for a long weekend in Vegas. I was enticed by the fact that Tropicana had just finished updating all of their rooms and were due to finish the new pool remodel by the end of April. They had the best combination of price and ratings, so I was hoping the pool would be mostly finished for our visit. Unfortunately, the best and largest part of their pool was closed for our entire stay, so that sucked. It is probably done by now and looked like it would be nice when finished. The casino has an odd smell. I think it's supposed to be coconut, but smells more like old pipe smoke mixed with sweet-scented tobacco- not very appealing in my opinion. They did a nice job remodeling the casino and rooms but, that said, you cannot change the fact that the ceilings are still very low in the hallways and rooms which reveals the building's true age and it does not look as nice as some of the newer hotels on the strip. The room was a LONG way from the casino, way in the back. We had a king-size bed that was very comfortable there was an adequate space for a large chair and table next to the bed and a nice flat screen TV. The bathroom was updated with nice, good quality fixtures/materials and my husband loved the large tub for taking baths. The showerhead was ridiculously low though for my 6-ft tall husband. It was ok for me at 5'6". We had friends staying at MGM, so we did not spend much time in the casino or restaurants. There is a poor selection of restaurants available in Tropicana and only one that we saw open outside of dinner hours, Cafe Nikki. We had dessert there one night and it was very good. We had their breakfast buffet which was a very good price and they had a great selection. Food taste was average/adequate, but all of the staff were very friendly and helpful. Coffee was very good and they included my latte with my buffet charge. Overall, our stay was fine, but I did not like how far we had to walk in order to go anywhere else on the strip and we were not really interested in spending our time in the Tropicana. So, I will probably not stay here again. Planning to just spend a little more next time so we can go back to the Venetian's beautiful suites and central location!

Reviews.Title: “Great strip hotel with a really relaxed atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: ccameron71
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to my stay here after reading about all the updates to the hotel. Renovations were still ongoing during my holiday but I was aware of this in advance so it was not a problem. All the staff we dealt with were friendly and courteous and the hotel itself is stunning. The room was large, comfortable and very stylish with exceptionally comfortable beds. The pool which was partially open was great and when completed will be awesome and a great place to spend a few relaxing hours. i did not eat here as the dining options were limited as some were still to open but you are right on the strip so have many great dining options within a few minutes walk. People say the casino area is small and of course it is not as large as some but it is by no means inconsiderable also it is light and airy which makes a pleasant change and is also well spaced out which is not always the case. Overall it might not be everyones cup of tea, if you prefer just to spend your vacation in one resort with everything at your fingertips then maybe one of the larger ones might be for you, but as a base relax at and explore from I found it hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the price.”
Reviews.Author: orendorff
Reviews.Content: Great customer service! Pool was nice size but did not look like pictures. Nikki beach club was crazy fun! Can't say enough about how helpful and nice all the staff was to our group of six women.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it advertised”
Reviews.Author: tjmacri
Reviews.Content: First time staying at this hotel, and very disappointed. The staff was less than helpful. We visited this hotel/casino several times in the last few years, and they always had great live entertainment. The live bands were so great we booked a weeks stay, but not before confirming that there would be live entertainment the week we were there. Upon arriving, surprised to find out that there was no entertaainment. Spoke to one of the managers who told us that they discontinued it the week before. Told him that was why we were staying at the Trop. Laughed and said they had it when we booked the room. The pool area was very nice, however the 4th of July weekend, with temperatures in the 100's, they were pumping hot water into an already warm pool. This went on the whole day. Needless to say it was not too refreshing. If you are young, willing to pay for access to Club Nicki or Nicki Beach you may enjoy this property. For those of us who like live entertainment, gambling and old fashioned customer service, this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: mtfrost81
Reviews.Content: 3 of my girlfriends and I stayed here July 21-26, 2011 and I read tons of reviews before we went. Im not too picky on hotels but this one sounded nice and we untimately picked it as we wanted lots of pool time. They recently renovated and we kept hearing that this was one of the best Vegas pools. Dont get me wrong...it was OK...the tiles were grimey along the inside of the pool and It just gave me a very bad impression right off the bat. My biggest complaint about the pool is that it closes at 7 PM!!! Seriously?!? The hot tubs were open 24 hours. Also they have a seperate pool for Nikki Beach that you have to pay admission to, they are seperated by a fence and the music was blaring over there so you all you could hear was the bass from that pool and you couldnt enjoy the regular music at the public pool! The casino is small...which I prefer but you cant EVER find a waitress for a drink! We only ate at the pizzaria and the food was OK and reasonably priced. One morning we did have to wait 20 minutes for a toasted bagel (guess they forgot). The hotel smells like coconut, which I liked, but 2 of my friends HATE the smell of coconut. I new about this but apparently they did not. They were both thankful that the rooms didnt have much scent. They beds were OK, lots of pillows, the bathroom was large enough. I dont think the AC was working properly...we turned it down as far as it would go (60) but it never really cooled off in there (some nights we got very hot). Every single day we had to call room service for more towels...4 girls need more than 3 towels! and there are definately not enough outlets in the rooms. Most of the staff was nice enough, but the girl at check-in didnt seem too thrilled to be there and didnt go out of her way to welcome us at all. We had a great view of the strip on the 18th floor. The elevators seemed very slow and every tiem you got in the same tropical song would start playing...after 5 days that was pretty annoying. I thought that being closer to the end of the strip would be quieter but Friday and Saturday nights we heard police, ambulance, or firetruck sirens about every 20 minutes! Probably wouldnt hurt to carry ear plugs if you are a light sleeper...and I had read before about the plantation blinds in the rooms...they are terrible! Most Vegas rooms have black-put curtains but these giant blinds did NO good at keeping light out especially since you are right on the strip with all of the lights. Since I knew about the problem I took an eye mask so it helped. I am hoping to go back to LV in Dec for NFR but I will definately not stay at the Trop again...Unless other hotels are booked and the Trop has some insanely great offer I just cant pass up. I was really looking forward to this hotel for a girls summer trip and was very disappointed! If you book here, be sure you are aware of the Resort Fee...what a rip off and $9.99 per day for things we never needec or used. Lots of hotels on the strip no longer have resort fees...so do a little research and find one with out the extra fees and a pool that is open later than 7 PM!

Reviews.Title: “More Unique and Special than other strip hotels”
Reviews.Author: SarahLovesLemonade
Reviews.Content: What I liked most about the Tropicana is that although it is one of the original leading hotels on the strip, it has a rather serene, laidback feel about it. I find that most strip hotels have the same atmosphere when you enter them - huge, dull and noisy casinos packed full to the rafters with tourists and those folk who seem to be unable to move from their favourite gaming machine. The Tropicana has a uniqueness about it in that the casino is bright, clean and fairly quiet as far as Las Vegas goes. Both the casino and reception areas are relatively small, the hotel isn't over run with shops, bars and restaurants either and I liked this much calmer atmosphere. We arrived fairly late on in the day but were still able to get an upgrade to a strip view room. This was fantastic, we were on a high floor in the club tower which gave an amazing view of MGM Grand, Excalibur, Luxor and New York New York. Rooms are very spacious, well decorated and comfortable. A safe is provided in the room free of charge. On arrival, the bathroom in one of our rooms didn't look like it had been cleaned so we rang reception who sent a maid up straight away. Very impressed by the responsiveness of reception in sorting this out for us. Pool area is of a good size, towels are provided by the hotel for use round the pool. Cabanas and super comfy sun beds are available for hire each day, there is no rental charge if you spend a certain amount on food/drinks throughout the day. Tunes are played by the pool during pool opening hours and make relaxing by the pool extra fun. Other plus points include free self-parking which once you find your away around the hotel is only a short walk (unlike other strip hotels where you walk miles to get back to your room from self park). A good shortcut is through the pool area. I would definitely stay here again, I have stayed at other hotels on the Las Vegas strip including Caesar's Palace and can honestly say for the value for money Tropicana offers I would stay here every time.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the Pool, Stay for the Service"”
Reviews.Author: sundaddydo
Reviews.Content: Although we have been Vegas several times, we decided to check out the remodel of the Tropicana, and we loved the hotel. We stayed here during the third week of June 2011. The staff from check in to check out was fantastic. For example, we were upgraded to a mini-suite in the pool tower because it was our anniversary "getaway", although we had originally booked a deluxe room in the pool tower. The mini suite was spacious, and had a separate sitting area with a dining table for two. We truly enjoyed having the extra space and views from the mini suite. The room was clearly above average with amenities. Our two biggest thumbs up are for the bedding, (extremely comfortable and clean), and the television, (large screen plasma and excellent picture), and the soaking tub in the bathroom. The downsides to the room were the air conditioning and a faint unpleasant odor. The room never seemed cool enough to me, but my spouse thought it was fine. The halls and hotels have a great coconut/citrus smell, but our room seemed to have a constant, faint odor. We got used to it after the first day, and after that we only noticed it for the first minute or two after going into the room. The casino was small, but intimate enough to make it nice to come back to after the mega roll palaces and noises of the strip. We really liked the light, airy feeling of the casino, and found the slots to be pretty good compared to the other casinos on the strip, (downtown slots seemed much looser to us), but the Trop casino was OK. The absolute best attraction of the Tropicana is the spread out and cool pool. Actually, not just the pool, but the service you get at the pool. Many, many kudos to the pool manager Staci for such a fantastic job setting us up in a cabana, and also to the staff who seldom let the glasses go dry and were making us feel welcome. In fact, we spent morning to afternoon during our whole stay soaking up the pampering attention and great ambiance, and we don't regret one moment of it. If you really want to make the most of your stay, check out getting a cabana. The food is also fantastic, the lobster tacos are excellent! Can't wait to get back!

Reviews.Title: “Make it a triple visit to the Trop!”
Reviews.Author: mamaluvsvegas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October 2010 for a girl's getaway with my bestie and again July 10-16/11 with my hubby and am looking forward to making it a third time next year! Loved the Tropicana! Casino is smaller and easy to get around, rooms are clean, beds are extremely comfortable and the service is well, just great!!! My husband and I were there to celebrate our anniversary - we were married in Vegas in 1997 and we had a great time. Biscayne's food and service was superb - excellent service from our waiter, Ken and his assistant, Vincente. Sherrie at the front desk surprised us by sending complimentary champage and chocolate covered strawberries for our anniversary - we were so touched!! We contacted the reservations supervisor by email after our trip was booked through our travel agent who gave us a complimentary room upgrade in honor of our anniversary celebration - again great customer service! Theo, one of the doormen, was very hospitable and offered us valuable information about taking cabs etc. Much appreciated! Our entire trip was great and we can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: DNR4ever
Reviews.Content: Our first room was wet carpet (?leak) do we were moved to new room. We had a great view of the Strip. On the last day, a water pump broke and there was no water in room for about 30 minutes. The staff was very responsive. Every staff member throughout stay was very nice, welcoming, and gracious. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “about what I expected”
Reviews.Author: nikki10digi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend with a group of 10 people. I have been to Las Vegas about 25 times over the past 10 years, so I come a few times per year and have stayed at almost all the hotels on/around the Strip. This was probably one of my least favorite hotels. We specifically stayed at this hotel to go party at Nikki Beach during the day. Granted we were at the pool on Friday and just part of the day Saturday, but nobody was at Nikki Beach. My husband and I kept riding up and down in the elevator to see if anyone was at Nikki Beach, and it was empty. I don't even think they opened until the late afternoon. That was a disappointment. The rooms have been remodeled, but we stayed at the Mirage last year, and their rooms remodel looks 100 times better. The bed was quite comfortable, but our AC didn't work. We turned the AC way down the second we got in the room, and the temperature didn't change the entire time we were there. Luckily, it wasn't too hot just warmer than we like our room to be. The value was good for the price. Next time, I will spend an extra $10 to stay at a nicer property.

Reviews.Title: “Gr8 place to stay”
Reviews.Author: happyholidays6969
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms lovely pool area. There is a bus which takes you down the strip which stops right outside which is gr8 to get around. This was my 10 visit to Vegas always staying at different hotels and the Tropicana was a gr8 place to stay. Not as large as other Vegas hotels but easy to get around. Ideal first visit

Reviews.Title: “For the price and location, it was perfect.”
Reviews.Author: breezio
Reviews.Content: I hate to wait an hour after check-in to get my room because it wasn't ready. I also wasn't crazy about the constant coconut smell. However, I was planning on staying in a hole for the price I paid. The room, pool, and casino floor were all very nice and well worth the price if you want to be in the middle of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Was expecting much more”
Reviews.Author: RDubSD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trop for 3 nights. We decided to stay here because the price was reasonable and we had read quite a few reviews that it was really nice after the renovation. The rooms themselves weren't that bad, pretty much what I expected for what we paid. The rest of the hotel left a little bit to be desired. We were in the back tower, so we had to walk through the hotel to get back to our elevators. There was construction through this part and it was always a little messy. We also had a terrible smell in the hallways on our floor that was there the entire time. I know other people talked/complained about the cocoanut smell, but trust me it wasn't that. It was a kind of dirty, mildewy smell. I guess over all the Tropicana wasn't terrible and I was never there before the remodel. I was just expecting a bit more after reading all the reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: Bob4Bob
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the newly renovated Tropicana Hotel in Las Vegas. The rooms were great. They were clean, the TV / shower were nice. There was some noise from the near-by airport, but more from sirens. There must be a station close to hotel. The hotel lobby and facilities were new and well maintained. The pool was super but busy. The only complaint is a coconut smell when you entered the lobby / casino area. It seemed to be overwhleming. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: katherine_94109
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple of nights when I was in Las Vegas for business. The rooms were very clean (I LOVE the bed covers... so much cleaner than a bedspread that cannot be washed), and it was nice to have such crisp and modern decor. The bed was very comfortable. We were in a Double Deluxe room, and the room and bathroom were both large and comfortable. The staff (especially room service staff) was very polite and helpful. I liked the pool and Cafe Nikki, which were both bright and clean; it was a refreshing break from some of the darker Las Vegas hotels.

Reviews.Title: “In it's price range it is the best”
Reviews.Author: Antony T
Reviews.Content: That is comparing to a normal room (not necessarily say a Go room at Flamingo which is an upgraded room) at flamingo, Excalibur, ballys, Luxor which I feel all of the same class. I remember walking in tropicana and being very unimpressed. However the hotel is most of the way through a terrific makeover. Public areas: the casino is bright, airy and clean. If you self park and come in via the rooms of entrance 5 do not be put off, they are not in use. I'm sure there will be something going in their place, maybe even new rooms? Everything is pretty much on the main floor, although there are shops and theatres on the mezzanine, which wasn't well signposted. Front desk: we arrived early bit were told we would get a call when the room was ready; we didn't but came back after some time at the pool and our room was ready ahead of normal check in. Whilst waiting though we were given dummy key cards so we could go to the pool so that was fine. The person who checked us in, Shonielle (? I think??) was terrific, she helped us out with everything we needed. You can also print your boarding pass for free at the machine in the lobby. The bell staff were courteous too. Casino: take advantage of the promo with $200 on them. It's complicated but worth it. I will say that when you use your free credit, everytime you win press cash out so you get your winnings. The free credit stays in the machine until you are done, so even if you win one dollar press cash out. Most waitresses were nice, although one in particular was not very efficient or pleasant. Facilities: this let's the place down a bit, there is a shop and a gift shop and stalls but not a lot on offer. There is also (although I have read differently on here) no buffet as such. For eating there are 2 high end restaurants and one very small, not cheap, but good food "Food Court". The gelato was excellent. Rooms: nice!! Very comfy bed, nicely renovated, a chaise lounge, a massive tv, decent bathrooms with shower and tub. Also nice tropical decor to the rooms and nice pieces of art. Terrific rooms and all less than 12 months old. Classy tropical would sum it up. Stayed in paradise tower (first one; recommend it as it is closer to everything) with a 20th floor view of Excalibur, Mandalay bay, Luxor. Pool: nice landscaping, the backdrop of the old motel part adds to the feel of old school elegance. The loungers and towels are really comfortable. There are just about enough for everyone. Borderline. Pool was what sets this place apart; this is where the fun was at. So for the summer, this is THE place. Maybe not as much to do in winter though?? But the rooms are great, location great and prices competitive. If we go again and it is pool weather we will stay here. Tip: instead of veering left to the pool from lobby, veer right and go out the exit past the old rooms, go straight and in less than a minute you are at an Am Pm store that is much cheaper than any hotel for stocking up on snacks, pop, water, beer an the like

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS THE WORST HOTEL IN VEGAS AND SHOULD BE SHUT DOWN!”
Reviews.Author: GranTree
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this this hotel in February my fiance and i were getting married there, we book far enough in advance ensure that each and every one of our guests were situated close to eachother in the hotel. We showed up and had nothing but problems the entire time I dont even have the time to go into detail with all of our issues. THIS HOTEL RUINED MY WEDDING ALL TOGETHER AND SHOULD CLOSE THIER DOORS, DIRTY ROOMS, HALLS, CHEAP ROOMS...... DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL BAD SERVICE, BAD FRONT DESK--- BAD OWNERS!!!!

Reviews.Title: “O-K once we got our room.”
Reviews.Author: abvegas
Reviews.Content: Not sure if I would book here again to be honest. After a long day of traveling, my friend and I arrived at Tropicana anxious to check in and sleep! (It was about 12am at this point, we had been traveling for several hours.) We approach the front desk and I told the woman I had a reservation. After ignoring me for about 10 minutes, she finally decided to let me know she had not forgotten about me and she was looking for a room. I specifically emailed 3 times for a note to be taken down about my room and how I had a late arrival. Yeah, no one cared. Finally, she says she does not have my non-smoking, 2 queen available. INSTEAD I am forced to go into a smoking room (my friend as asthma) and with 1 king bed. They sent up a roll away bed for the night so my friend could sleep on that. The roll away bed would not fit in the room we were given and I had to rearrange the entire room so that my friend wouldn't need to sleep right infront of the door. The next day we got the room we asked for after having to wait an entire day for it. This ultimately ruined my plans to the outlet mall. This hotel needs to get their act together. You don't see the Wynn or even lower class Luxor doing this to people. This was so unfortunate. I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great visit”
Reviews.Author: bdbad47
Reviews.Content: service was great ,staff was very helpful.The rooms were very good just remolded.Easy access to monorails and buses to downtown.The food at the Biscayne steak/sea food restaurant was great but a little pricey.I will be going back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the value”
Reviews.Author: Iris-BC
Reviews.Content: airport travel - take a taxi. It is very close and cab ride is about $15 which would include your tip. check in/out - needs some work if they expect more people to use the hotel. Only one or two people at the counter. We were the only one's in line and we saw about 3 or 4 people wandering around chatting but not helping us. Luckily we were in no rush otherwise it would have been a lot more frustrating. rooms - nice upgrades. spacious nikki beach - must be too new or the word hasn't got out. We were considering it but you could see it when you walk over the bridge and it never looked busy to me (night or day). pool - I wouldn't waste my money on nikki beach. The best part about this hotel is their pool. Lots of room, lots of loungers, bar servers, upbeat music. location - if you like to walk then no problem. this hotel is south of the strip so there is either a lot of walking or taking transit. My husband had a bad back so we didn't get to walk around as much as we had hoped to. monorail - NOTE the rail does not take you to Freemont. You are better off catching the express bus that will take you Freemont. Bus stop is very close to Tropicana. If you choose to take the monorail it is just next door at MGM. casino - not the largest but a decent size. table games are average and costs vary depending on time of day food - 24 hour cafeteria (great pizza, grilled cheese, and fries), starbucks on site, 3 restaurants. Most of what you need is right in the hotel. So to sum it up, for what we paid we definitely found it worth our stay. But we probably would not come back due to location. If we did come back it would be for the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place and the Hallways Smell Sweet”
Reviews.Author: localdougy
Reviews.Content: Although I was told after making our reservation at the Tropicana that it was one of the "older" hotel/casinos on the strip, but my wife & I did not get that feeling at all and were very happy with the Tropicana from the second we arrived. It's about a $12-$15 cab ride from the airport and takes less than 10 minutes to get there. The location is great. There's elevated crosswalk access to the Excalibur which has a free tram connection to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay. NYNY is adjacent corner and the MGM Grand is the other crosswalk from the Tropicana. This gives you great access to either side of the strip to start casino hopping and sight seeing on the strip. The Tropicana is a clean property and we loved the palm trees all over. The pool area is really cool. There's tons of lounge chairs (free) and no hassle to grab towels. The pool has a very curvy design which we felt offers lots of room for guests to hang out (with a drink perhaps) alongside at the edge of the pool and chill. The casino itself is not enormous like other newer casinos. We didn't choose the Tropicana to gamble - we chose it to be a relaxing spot with a good pool to spend our days. We were on the 9th floor overlooking the pool area and towards the Hooters Casino & airport. Regardless of the view, the room was clean & the hallways have a sweet smell, almost like coconut or something. The place didn't reek of smoke and the room was clean, bed was very comfortable, had a nice 42" flat screen tv, the bathroom was spacious and the shower was clean and had good pressure. We didn't pick the Tropicana for all the glamor that is Las Vegas. Pick it for the chill pool scene and nice rooms, staff and ease to get around the property and to the strip. I have no complaints and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “viva las vagas, i'll be back !”
Reviews.Author: dianeelizabethPerth
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel last year, first trip to sin city, holiday was fantastic and the hotel was even better. We were told just before checking in it was voted most in need of tearing down my stomach did a flip flop, but we were then told it had been renovated, and boy had it ! I have travelled a far bit and have never seen a room like it everything was HUGE beds,telly, bathroom and above all else CLEAN ! it was right in the action a short walk down the strip to anything and everything. I'm going back and i will stay there again. staff were nice and helpful. specially the drinks ladies tip them and the drinks are free !!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: TennRandy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tropicana in April, 2011, and it was great. The room prices were very reasonable and the staff was incredibly courteous. They went out of their way to make our stay comfortable and memorable. Even though it's one of the smaller hotels now, that's what made it so great. We felt a very comfortable intimacy -- from the concierge to the casino to the in-hotel restaurants. Everyone we met was friendly and polite. They answered every question we had and were most helpful. The restaurants were fantastic. We ate most of our meals there and were not disappointed at any time. The breakfast buffet is to die for. There was some construction going on, but that didn't interfere in any way. When we come back to Vegas, we'll be sure to stay at the Trop again. And...if you get a chance, take "The Mob Experience." It was a lot of fun!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Robles87
Reviews.Content: Check in was slow. Arrived early and was told to expect a call when our room was ready. After not receiving a call, I checked to see if my room was ready. Our room was ready. Thankful it was ready, but would have appreciated a call. Our room was not cleaned on first day. I just asked for clean towels and hoped for a clean room the following day. Arrived on second day, room still not cleaned. Called and someone was sent immediately. Would have liked to arrive to a clean room on second day instead of stepping down to casino to wait for cleaning. Didn't play much at casino, but did win some money. Didn't use pool, looked nice. Enjoyed our room, especially the comfy bed. I would stay again. Overall, a nice place to stay. Nicole was very nice and accomadating. Thanks again, Nicole. Funny thing, arrived to my room late one night to find a drunk outside my doorway. Called front desk and someone arrived right away. Ended up being my neighbor who just couldn't make it inside the room.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vegas Hotel...Ever”
Reviews.Author: traumathai2
Reviews.Content: This was by far the best Vegas hotel that we have stayed at. From check in to chesk out we encountered multiple employees that went out of their way to help us. I was in Vegas for a little business and brought my family for them to enjoy the city. We checked in late in the evening, and with in a few minutes of entering the lobby we were already checked in, no lines, no crowds. The rooms were great, nice view, very comfortable beds, and nice amenities. Housekeeping was also top notch, did not bother us when we had "do not disturb" and were very prompt when we requested service. Check out was also pleasing, again no lines, no crowds, just great service. Valet attendants were a nice touch every day, very eager to assist, no matter how many times we needed the car within the day. Truely caring staff, not what you would expect from a large casino/hotel, and cerainly not what we have experienced with most other casino/hotels in Vegas. Great Job, we are impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: rarrrk
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at Tropicana! Clean and spacious room, friendly staff, amazing pool, just a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms and pool”
Reviews.Author: irishtourerIreland
Reviews.Content: Brilliant find, got a great price and its spotless clean. Rooms are exactly as they see in the pictures and got a great sleep there but request a high floor or else you will be sick of the sirens! Pool is very relaxed and lovely to swim in. Hotel itself seems to be aiming itself at the higher class market with no fast food joints etc inside however casino is one of the quieter ones which is nice to use at night when others get crowded. They also have something in the aircon in the reception areas that give a tropical smell. Highly recommend. No problems finding parking in the self park.

Reviews.Title: “Great Great Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: Sandy2250
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Las Vegas in ten years...We are now retired and booked this trip with Airfare, Hotel choice, airport transfer, and Legions show (Harrah's), through Hotel.com. After surfing the reviews of the various hotels on the strip, we chose the Tropicana!! Great choice!!! Arrival check-in was easy, and desk clerk very helpful with our questions. The room was super clean, modern, and more than adequate size for my husband and myself. The bathroom was large, roomy and well lighted. Beds were more than comfy!!! Had a corner tub/shower combination for spacious and open for ease of comfort after being out in the warm sun or walking the Las Vegas strip. We would have really enjoyed a small refrigerator in the room, for breakfast snacks, and drinks...but, as with any resort we know the "business side" of not having them in room...It would had been a real "convenience" for quick breakfast before starting the day as well as for families with children to save money here to spend elsewhere... Thomas, a bartender at the Amhbar Lounge where we went for "Happy hour" was such a delightful individual... very social, friendly, and happy to everyone he greeted and served.... The Casino was light and bright.... smoke free, and spacious.... Not huge as "get lost" feeling as the other large resorts on the strip...just very very comfortable for all the activities between the tables and the slot area. We used the monorail across the street at the MGM to go to Harrah's for the Legion show... (9+) and walked the strip back to our hotel to take in the sights. We also saw the Mob Experience at the Tropicana and enjoyed the show staff personal involvement presentation and history detail during the tour. We also took a tour to the West Rim with the Skywalk experience through Las Vegas Sightseeing Tours/Greyline. Great day with stop also at Hoover Dam...Skywalk is truly an engineer's dream come true and so enjoyed the experience of the Grand Canyon below...Lunch was provided, their staff friendly and outgoing with "all" the number of people coming through. Food was very tasty we thought.... The resort buildings on the strip are amazing! So many new ones that have been built, with all the different designs, architectural detail, and the unending interior detail by each resort....one can spend days going through all them and just "looking"... Pretty incredible places.... My husband and I are little more conservative on pricing when eating out...Hotel restaurants were a little more expensive than what he & I wanted to pay, and walked the strip for other food dining choices which we felt more in line with our retirement budget... The restaurants were very classy and well designed and had many customers it appeared. So all in all, I would recommend the Tropicana and glad we chose the resort for our stay. Great fun time !!! Thank you again Tropicana!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better then i expected!”
Reviews.Author: koolaidsmiiles
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the tropicana for 2 days in July. I was kind of skeptical and scared of staying here cause there were mixed reviews & when id mention it to people it was like "OH" lol as if it was low class on the strip, but i must say they've renovated and everything looks great, new & fresh. Its close by a lot of the exhibits and shows & close to the airport. The pool is beautiful. Best of all its affordable, not only affordable but nice and your not paying 200.00 a night. If your thinking about staying here & are unsure dont think twice i promise you wont be disappointed. They have cab service and bus service right outside the hotel as well. Cafe nikki inside the tropicana serves a breakfast buffet that is phenomenal! nice setting & good food. I really dont know what i would say that is bad about it? nothing in my opinion. People spend all this extra money on extravagent expensive hotels & your outside 90% of the time. This place is beautiful & affordable. im glad i chose the tropicana i'd be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great beds”
Reviews.Author: AMP89
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on the room price and the room itself was spacious, the bed was probably the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in at a hotel. It's south strip so if you don't have a car it's a bit of walking if you are doing things mid strip but we've done mid strip before so the location was fine for us. Drawbacks-several stains in the carpeting-since it was a fairly new remodel that was disappointing. The bathroom was quite large for a hotel room which is nice but the drawback is the light switch is all the way in the bathroom and hard to find in the middle of the night-we went to K-mart and purchased a cheap nightlight which solved the problem. Housekeeping-our last day there they apparently didn't clean anything, just made the bed, put up towels and that was it-the bathroom floor was dirty and carpeting wasn't vacumned. This depends on your tolerance but the shutters are great-but they let too much light in since Vegas never sleeps-nor do their neon lights-I wish they had the room darkening blinds instead. Overall it was okay-especially in comparison price wise to what else is available in Vegas-and you aren't really hanging out in the room much anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Before - But Not Reliving the Glory Days Yet”
Reviews.Author: yourstarla
Reviews.Content: Last I checked in on the Tropicana it was March of 2008. My friend was the unfortunate guest of their hotel and she was staying in something I like to describe affectionately as the pit of despair. Peeling paint, stained carpet, disgusting everything. What a pit. I swore I'd never walk through the doors of that dump every again. As they worked on rejuvenating the property, I was impressed with the efforts they made. I stopped into the casino mid-2010 and was surprised to see that the casino was brightened and slightly cleaner. When early 2011 rolled around I decided I would be one of the guinea pigs to stay in the "New Trop." Eating my words, I checked in to a Paradise Suite that was alllllll the way back in the Club Tower. Was I impressed? Eh. It was better than before. But great? Nah. Sorry. I know there are a lot of Tropicana cheerleaders out there, but I"m not one of them. I think it was fine. Okay. A good substitute for a Hampton Inn perhaps. The room was spacious, clean (mostly), and definitely 800 steps up from it was in 2008, but I wouldn't stay there again.
