There are too many wonderful hotel choices on the LV Strip and I'm not going to choose the Tropicana again unless I'm desperate for a room, there's a gun to my head, or I lose a bet. I want them to succeed though. They've done a lot of work and it's greatly improved. It's a solid middle of the road option. The Mob Experience was amazing and worth checking out. It's just not the Palazzo/Venetian, Bellagio or Wynn/Encore. (Not that I expected it to be...)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing...!!!”
Reviews.Author: north12345john
Reviews.Content: after reading reviews on TA i booked this hotel .so we got to the hotel check in was a little slow then we got to a room they had checked us into the wrong room rang down they told me they had none of the rooms of my reservation available, waited 30 mins they got one. apparently the pool in Trop is the best in vegas it is far from it cant eat by the pool or seam to relax. yes this hotel was cheap and yes it has been renovated but it is not a snitch on the other 4-5 star hotels lasa vegas provides. thankgod we checked into encore at wynn for the remainder of our holiday. bite the bullet and pay more thats my advise.

Reviews.Title: “The old Trop was good, The new Trop is GREAT”
Reviews.Author: suwaneeman
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Trop at various times in the last decade the new Top is an island of sanity amidst all the chaos around it. The room was clean, the pool is great and the gaming area is not so massive like its counterparts, that you actually can relax during your trip. The steakhouse and Italian restaurant, while pricey, had very good food. The Deli and Cafe Nikki breakfast buffet were excellent. We will be back and a job very well done!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay !”
Reviews.Author: vanessaxo
Reviews.Content: Even for a 14 year old there was tons to see! The pool was amazing, the beds were super comfy and the bathroom was incredible! It was a nice environment and I want to go back already! Everything was well air conditioned and it was nice to take a dip in the pool when it got hot outside. I liked how Tropicana was located at the beginning of the strip and it was near so many cool places! My family and I were able to visit everything we wanted to see by foot , we even walked to the outlets!! 5 days in vegas at the Tropicana was perfect (: I miss the sun already.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience At the Tropicana!!”
Reviews.Author: Catacam
Reviews.Content: So my husband and I stayed at the Tropicana July 14th-18th (actually got married on the 16th!!!) with 24 of our closest friends. I contacted Nichole Marshall, the Guest Relations Manager back in February for help with our group. She was so helpful and surprised us in so many amazing ways! She was able to group all of us together, upgrade our room, and we even received strawberries and champagne to our room 5 minutes after we walked in! I cannot say enough about the amazing staff that work at the hotel. Especially the wonderful pool staff! Stacie, the pool manager was amazing and ensured that we had cabanas and the center island each day we were at the hotel, which was hard to do because there were so many of us! We also had an amazing time with table service at Nikki Beach! It is a great Vegas Club and certainly better then most! Our entire group had such an amazing time that we have decided every July will be our Vegas, Tropicana trip, so we will see you next year with even more people!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Light and perfect for business”
Reviews.Author: womantrvler
Reviews.Content: I was working in the Las Vegas area off the strip so this location was great with an easy off and on the highway. Staff was very helpful, I am an ex smoker and very sensitive to smoke so the hotel check in staff made sure I was able to get a smoke free room. The hotel was tropical theme so it was nice and bright. Rooms were comfortable and I especially enjoyed the wireless wifi in the room. I had the fresh fish dinner in the restaurant which was excellent. I am not a gambler but everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves. The pool looked so fantastic with the cool teepee cabanas and etc. I would stay here again the room was GREAT price for the value. I stayed 5 days and I was very comfortable at this hotel. Maybe next time I can get some R& R in. T

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful renovations, comfortable, and superior staff!”
Reviews.Author: DLY1947
Reviews.Content: The newly-remodeled Tropicana Las Vegas was a wonderful experience for my sister and I for our annual girl's getaway. From the free self parking to the terrific way each and every staff member treated us at every turn makes it a must for a return visit. Luxurious and super comfortable beds, quiet large rooms and great views! Pool area is roomy and lovely and the gaming was great since they pay back losses up to $200 with players club membership! Great location for strip properties and good proximity to the monorail station at neighboring mgm grand. I was most impressed with the personal service of each staff member we encountered. Super helpful and made us feel like we were the only guests. Yolanda at the front desk was terrific and listened to what we wanted for our room location and gave us top of the line accomodations! We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Would recommend it if you want Ibiza in USA”
Reviews.Author: Natla
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Tropicana. Our room had a pool and city view which really made you feel a part of the buzz of Vegas and Nikki Beach. The bed was very comfortable and clean but the bathroom hadn't recieved the same refit the rest of the hotel had, chipped tiles with mouldie grout. The Casino was perfect for me as it wasn't not too big like other hotels were you get so lost and disorientated, great if you're not a big spender. The food in Nikki's cafe was really tasty and the setting was great, just like South Beach or Ibiza. Plus the hotel has two Starbuck inside which make breakfast easy. Stay here if you enjoy a upbeat comtempory party environment around the pool side and gambling is a second on your list. All in all the hotel is in a great location and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “JUST WHAT WE NEEDED”
Reviews.Author: mkcalderon
Reviews.Content: We got there early and they let us check in early,our room was cool clean and neat,there was magazines on what to do in Vegas and other info. Bathroom was very clean and all amenities were at our hand. On the strip and walking distance to everything. Pool areas were clean. Staff was always on hand and very nice. Casino was great. Will stay here always

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: lesangeles
Reviews.Content: I like the color of carpet, very warm and passionate, fashionable! We went to MOP experience, it was so fun! We bought souvenir photos from it! My husband gave me a big kiss for this journey!

Reviews.Title: “Truly the last oasis in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: DonaldLewis
Reviews.Content: To give you the background My daughter was assaulted in Idaho by a man she knew and beaten badly I flew out from San Diego to get her, her things and her car. We decided to stay the night in Las Vegas. 50 miles out we have a blow out and limped in to the Tropicana on a small boot spare tire. The Valet said no worries was incredible nice and asked if I needed any help the next day he helped me locate a tire shop that took great care of us (Discount Tire on Maryland) reasonable cost and fast. We walked in the Hotel, it looks fantastic. The remodel was perfect -- clean bright and warm and yes it still has the charm and feel of the original hotels from the old days (Not the high-rise glass and steel that pepper the strip now). We were really tired and had to deal with the tire situation when we woke the next day. I called down and told them a bit of my ordeal, I was treated so kindly and warm and given a late check out to help us. More than that I truly felt like they wanted to help and cared (real people). I have been coming to Vegas for the last 20 years and it has been along time since I have walked into a Hotel here and did not feel like i was just a wallet to be emptied. Thank you so much Tropicana Staff and now for my own reviews. The room was great large clean bright Beds- so comfortable and multiple pillows to choose from so you can select the firmness you like. amenities were nice and abundant TV - Nice Large modern and lots of channels to select from Staff - I can not begin to tell you how great ALL of them are from the front desk, to the restaurant staff, valet, floor people and the dealers although we did not play much, more of a distraction to take our minds off the resent events. I own a small company and we come out as a group several times a year for corporate events. The Tropicana is now our corporate hotel for all of our business when in Las Vegas as well as my hotel of choice for pleasure. I will be coming back this September with several employees and I am looking forward to staying with them again. I am so happy I took the time to write this review and share this experience, to often we do not take the time to talk about the good experiences we have instead of just the bad ones.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms with even better price!!”
Reviews.Author: WanderlustLuv
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at the Tropicana! The hotel is beautiful all the way through. I try to travel cheaply and had their lowest rate of room and wasn't sure what to expect. However, when we walked in, it definitely had the WOW factor of a much higher price level! The beds were incredible! And the view was great as well! I love the layout of the casino and thought the dealers and waitresses were super friendly. I booked this room by calling the hotel and it was quicky and easy to make a reservation with email confirmation sent quickly. I went this time with a friend but am excited to return to this same hotel with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DonnySeafordUK
Reviews.Content: Great location - marvelous pool - the staff very friendly and attentive - the rooms were very well presented and clean - I visit las Vegas every six months and will be using this Hotel for my visits

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: chb1081
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on March/2011 for 2 days (unfortunately). Fresh, fancy and clean Rooms, recently updated, also the bathroom, big size room with 2 comfortable beds. Wonderful location at the corner of Boulevard. No breakfast as usual on the LV hotels. Very good price for the room, great view. Complimentary parking for our car. They have refrigerator inside the room, very useful. Elevator is pretty close of the hotel entrance. Aspects not good: you have to pay for the wireless connection in the room however not that expensive. I'd highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “They have done a marvelous job of renovating an old gem”
Reviews.Author: Jimbo2Toronto
Reviews.Content: My wife and I generally travel to Las Vegas twice a year. In December we stopped into the newly renovated Tropicana and liked what we saw. As a result we stayed there in late June for a week and loved it. Years ago the Tropicana was considered one of the jewels on the strip, but sadly it slipped downhill. A new company acquired the property and they did a fantastic job of renovating it - outside pool included. Our room was nice, cleaned prior to the afternoon and the staff was very pleasant. The bar people always remembered us and would be ready with our usual drink. Overall a great experience and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelingDK
Reviews.Content: Had a great time, hotel was clean. When we first go there the wait was a little long for the Paradise elevator, but usually it came quickly. Staff very helpful, one of the bellmen helped me and then when he saw me later on he checked to see how it worked out. I found that very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and awesome!”
Reviews.Author: zamtwin
Reviews.Content: We were there in July and made a last minute reservation(same day)thru our players club...they accomodated us for the 4th of July weekend! This hotel used to be rundown and was one of the last we would even think of playing at but as of last year, has been remodeled 100%! Beautiful, comfortable rooms! The staff was very very helpful, friendly and willing to help in any way that they can. We have stayed in all vegas strip hotels and I think this is where we will now stay every time we visit. Great location also since it is away from the strip congestion so driving in off of Tropicana Ave is easy and more accessible to restaurants, stores and businesses away from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “It's Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Zacattack-58
Reviews.Content: My first step into the Tropicana Hotel was already living up to my expectations! From the staff to the great tropical scent! Great place to lounge and enjoy a perfect vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly planned and mannaged”
Reviews.Author: beachbaby50_11
Reviews.Content: I was very disapointed in our stay at the Tropicana, I had read mixed reviews but hoped for the best. The room was pleasantly decorated but the plantation blinds allowed to much light into the room as opposed to drapes which made it hard for sleeping. The bed was comfortable but white bedding was not apropriate, iOur carpet was wet when we got in the room and the AC never got cold. I checked the AC filter and it was filthy. I took off cover and left it for house keeping to see. They never did anything with it. I had to open window and bang filter to clean it. My daughter stayed in another room with spouse and they had to change several times due to odor in one and in the other they put them by the pool. The music was so loud they couldent sleep. They then had to move them again. I was very disapointed in the motel. I think it is another one that wasted their money on renovations. If they arent going to change some of the old habits in maintainence and cleaning then it will be another one to be imploded. People were unhappy and will stop comming back. And the parking situation was horrible.They don't have enough garage parking and lots of the other areas were for emlpoyees with un easy access. We found ourselves driving in circles most of the time in search of a spot. There was an officer on a bicycle that drove the lot at night which made it more secure than some others we have been to in the past.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay... good thing you dont spend lots of time in your hotel room while in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: TrishaAmber21
Reviews.Content: The mirrors on the ceiling above the bed rocked! LOL We were in Vegas for Valentine's day. We did not do much at this hotel except shower and sleep. It was kinda scary that you can feel the room moving when its windy outside but I hear that is any hotel in Vegas. The shower/tub needed some updating as the tub was kinda yellowed and it was not very inviting for a bath. It would have been nice to use the tub while on vacation for a bit of relaxation. As a hotel in Vegas, its not like you need an extravagant room since you don't spend much time in it anyway. The bed was comfortable, the room was well air conditioned and we did eat breakfast once inside the hotel and it was very good. The concierge was friendly and helped us plan some exploration of Vegas. Would I stay here again? Yes, if the price was right. I do not think I would pay more than what I paid this time.

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised...”
Reviews.Author: MartinSwissTraveler
Reviews.Content: My room was clean. But I was very disappointed with the pool. All over the town you seethe ads: Nikki Pool Open - well, it was not. And the general pool area was a mess. Dirty, filthy, used towels, cans, plastic cups, ... Inside the casino you think they make money by cleaning - it would not hurt to give some attention to the pool. But - room is okay, some noise from street but okay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: ksloane407
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a couple of friends and we absolutely loved it. The room was very clean and spacious. Also, the staff was very polite and friendly. Overall, I just loved how clean the whole hotel and casino was. Club Nikki is also a great spot to go out dancing.

Reviews.Title: “I miss the old but like the new”
Reviews.Author: Lannuss
Reviews.Content: The Trop was my first Vegas experience over 15 years ago so I have fond memories of the old place. I have been a bunch of time since then but this was the first since the recent makeover. The first thing I noticed was the white on the outside, making the appearance almost non-descript which I was about to find out was a metaphor. I used to love the old style Vegas feel of the place and the rough around the edges decor gave it a sense of history. The blue sign over the entrance has been changed to red with a new font and that stale smell of cigarettes, gambling and spilled drinks has been replaced by a coconut infused scent when opening those glass doors. Mores the pity. Don't get me wrong, the new look is great and if you hadn't been there on a regular basis beforehand you would find it difficult to complain. The casino floor is clean and bright, the rooms spacious and nicely appointed (with the possible exception of the bathrooms - functional and clean but shower/bath is still a bit old school). It just lacks a little soul. I didn't check out the new Nikki Beach set up - I am a bit old for that scene - but the new Cafe Nikki was nice and the breakfast buffet, sitting outside by the pool was great. The new Starbucks and snack bar was a Godsend, especially at 3am after a heavy night drinking and gambling. Free in-room Wifi and the helpfulness and attitude of most of the staff was also great making the whole package difficult to beat from a cost/benefit point of view, not to mention the superb location. Its just that it didn't feel like the Trop I knew. I think they have gone too far chasing a new crowd. I cant comment on the business plan that sits behind the economics of running a hotel on the strip but I cant help hankering after a bit of the old style.

Reviews.Title: “Took a bad start and made it amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: Keithandjacob
Reviews.Content: What a great experience. We arrived late at night after a grueling flight with a yappy dog. We got to the hotel and the only room left was a smoking room (nasty) but the front desk person Sheila was incredibly apologetic and promised to get us a new room in the morning. After only four hours sleep I was back at the front desk and Lynn, Jan, and Gwyen, could not have been nicer. They took my cell and said they would call when the room was ready. At 11:00 they called and not only did they give us a new room but a suite on the 20th floor. What a room!! It made the trip - the service from the maid service to the front desk has been amazing! I cannot thank these four ladies enough - they took what could have been a bad trip and really turned into a spectacular memory! Thank you again to Sheila, Lynn, Jan, and Gwyen. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and play at the Trop!!”
Reviews.Author: JumpstartMichigan
Reviews.Content: Just got back 7-17-11! My husband and I went with our friends for 3 nights at the Trop. Overall the trip was a huge "check" off our fun list!! I requested a room in the Paradise towers due to location and view 6 weeks in advance, was told not a problem. Me being me...confirmed the request 1 week before we left was told we were not in the Paradise towers ask to be changed was told not a problem... checked night before we left on room, that tower was FULL without us in it. Once we checked in we were given tix to their Mob show and tix to the new Nicki Club. Went and bought "dance" clothes for the club showed up that night (only nite the tix were good for) and we were told we were not allowed in due to a private party. (wishing we never bought new clothes) Overall the hotel was a good experience... never ate at any restaunts they looked uninviting tucked way back in the hotel. Pool was fun Jessica was a great waitress! Played in casino, friends paid for thier entire trip on winnings!!!!!! Our room was basic but nice and clean. Ok ... a little rough around the edges, shower head fell off, crumbled tile in bathroom,sprinkler head fell on my friend in her room...BUT nice. Our stay was definetly not affected by the shortcomings of the Trop, BUT due to the variety of hotels located on strip, would not recommend to friends. PS Poker room Steve was a great host and liked the small atmosphere it had to offer. Already looking forward to next years visit!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Exceptional Mattresses, Rooms, Service, Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: iglok
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tropicana for July 4th weekend. Had 2 rooms - one with king bed and one with two doubles. Hotel is EXCEPTIONAL!!! Clean, bright, well air-conditioned, service is excellent, beds are awesome! You walk into a bright white-marble lobby insead of dark dungeon-like smoky casino everywhere else... Hotel uses Euro Top Serta Perfect Sleeper Ultra Plush mattresses, and we all slepped like babies! Cafe Niki has a breakfast buffet for $18.99 which was very good. Each day we ate there for breakfast. They change the menu slightly, and you can also get a custom-made omlette / eggs. The hotel has an award-winning swimming pool, with the private area. Drinks / music, towel service are excellent! Hotel rooms are extra large, very comfortable. Location is superb - across the street there is a Monorail that departs from MGM Grand, and you can cut across and get to the station within 5 minutes without having to walk through MGM Grand. Two West-Side FREE Monorails depart from Excalibur (accross the Strip) and Monte Carlo (also across the street, aside to NY NY Hotel). Shows are all right there, shopping (City Center or the Miracle Mile Shops) are all just 2 monorail stops away. Excellent service, location, quality for the price - will stay in this hotel from now on!!!

Reviews.Title: “What an awesome improvement over the "old" Tropicana!”
Reviews.Author: johndtx
Reviews.Content: On a Las Vegas friend's recommendation we booked a reservation at the newly remodeled Tropicana. The experience was great! The staff was awesome...the room was outstanding...and we loved the bright and light casino area. Their pool is beyond outstanding! As we visited some of the other newer hotels that we had not seen we did not find any pool area that compares to the Tropicana. The location on the strip makes it very easy to get anywhere along the strip, or to downtown on the excellent Las Vegas bus system. Trust me, you will be pleased with the "new" Tropicana...and you will enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: yorkieinlondon
Reviews.Content: Location perfect, right on the strip by the main attractions. 15 minutes drive to the airport. Hotel recently refurbished, it was modern, clean and welcoming. Our room overlooked New York resort ! fabulous comfy beds zzzzzzzzzz No noise from outside. Can't comment on in house entertainment, food or pool as we we ventured out all the time. Wish we could have stayed longer.! If ever we returned we would definitely stay at the tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “Take Me To the Tropics Tropicana!”
Reviews.Author: smilingcanuck
Reviews.Content: We went for my daughter's 21st birthday with friends and what a fantastic experience! From the second we arrived we knew we had picked the right hotel. The light coconut scent floats you into a bright, clean resort feeling hotel and the front door staff and front desk were so helpful and accomodating. The best front desk staff I have ever dealt with and we truly appreciated it. The elevators were quick and our rooms were beautiful, large, peaceful (which you need in Vegas for a little down time) and the BEDS were unbelievably comfortable! Do not forget to eat at Nikki Beach Cafe! The food was outstanding - truly! Everything we had was excellent and surpassed our expectations. The yellow fin tuna appetizer (though it was large enough to be a main) was spectacular as was the butter poached lobster bisque was so rich and decadent. You get a large bowl, so maybe share it! The buffet was excellent and if you eat later in the morning they add lunch items such as JUMBO shrimps, smoked salmon and beautiful salads. Breakfast and lunch for $17.99 - crazy. It also included juice, coffe, tea. I personally could have eaten all my meals at the Tropicana. We didn't get to try BIscayne but the menu looked delicious. The pool area was absolutely heaven. I really did feel like I had gone to a tropical paradise. Lots of grassy areas, lush landscaping, fountains and a lovely free form pool with shade available which was appreciated as it was 42 celcius when we were there. Free floaties available which was fun and all guests were super about sharing. This hotel attracts a really nice and friendly clientele which adds to the experience. I know this review is long but seriously I can't say enough good about our stay. The conceirge got us the best seats for Cirque du Soleil "O" and recommended a fantastic Italian restaurant for dinner. Great job - thank you! I actually feel badly for writting such a great review because I'm afraid they won't have room for me next time I go, but know for sure the Tropicana will be the only place I"ll stay.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Wasn't expecting that....”
Reviews.Author: Spatziano747
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip for some friends and I to get away. I've been to Las Vegas numerous time so I know the strip and the area well. In the end I decided on staying at the Tropicana. WOW! I sure was surprised. The second I walked into the hotel I greeted by the concierge desk, then I checked in. The checkin lady was SUPER nice, smart, knowledgeable about the property and honestly...genuine. She wasn't cheesy fake like you see at some hotels. You can tell she enjoyed her job. We chit chatted for a bit and she sent me on my way. Again, she set the tone for the rest of my trip. The room was BEAUTIFUL! There were a few small areas that were dated, but 95% of the hotel was completely redone. STUNNING! The tropical/bamboo feel was clean, fresh, modern and inviting. Loved it. The beds were soft, clean, and restful. The pool area was great. I'm not a huge partier (yeah, why go to Vegas then right?), but the pool was AMAZING! During the day and night there was something to do for everyone. If you wanted to chill and relax. Done. If you wanted to party and get wild. Done. I would highly recommend this hotel. It's in a GREAT location on the strip, price was right, staff was awesome, rooms were tremendous. Overall...AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: “The Right Time and Place”
Reviews.Author: DrDave090
Reviews.Content: I had just been notified of a last minute deployment for the Air Force and my wife and I wanted to get away for a few days before being away from each other for 6 months. We are regular travelers to Vegas and previous guests of the Tropicana. I have to say that Nicole Marshall, upon letting her know the circumstances behind our visit was extremely helpful and very generous with the pricing and location of our room. She epitomized customer service and ensured that our stay would be a fun, affordable, and a meaningful experience. This was affirmed throughout all the staff we encountered. What a great stay! The room surprised us. They have done some remodeling of the hotel and it was gorgeous! We loved it. and are already planning our next trip to the Tropicana upon my return!

Reviews.Title: “Had great time!”
Reviews.Author: kkerr1313
Reviews.Content: I have been going to the Tropicana each summer for the last 6 years and it continues to be a great value. The changes that have been done over the past two years have made it even better. It has nice , clean rooms, a wonderful pool, fantastic restaurants, and a relaxed comfortable casino etc.... I see myself going again !.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't want to leave!!!”
Reviews.Author: rochester21
Reviews.Content: I was greeted at the front desk like a long lost friend. The staff were well trained and the place was clean and well kept. I spent some time playing cards and the Pit personnel took the time to learn my name. That and the Casino Hosts meant a lot to me. The room was clean, and overlooked the pool somewhat. The pool is beautiful and the staff are very friendly. I went for dinner at the Biscayne. The food was excellent and the service was extraordinary. All in all, I never wanted to leave, as this was my best trip to Vegas Ever!!!

Reviews.Title: “Only one chance to make a first impression”
Reviews.Author: RubyTuesdayCalgary
Reviews.Content: I admit the hotel is clean and bright but nothing extra special. Beds were comfortableand rooms were quiet. Had a few issues that would make this a property we will not return to. Firstly did not honour what was advertised. We booked four months before our trip with the hotel website. Promised early check-in or first night was free, of course this was not honoured, also offered late check-out. (noon is not a late check-out by our standards, especially on a Tuesday). Also offered two for one drinks at resturants which they said was a coupon book that they don't have anymore. Don't advertise what you will not follow through with. Secondly I contacted Nicole to request ad-joining rooms, this was probably my mistake but I would assume these would have a door connecting them. This was one of the main reasons we booked the Trop. Were given room side by side. Not much help. We noticed this happening to other groups at check-in also. We did get rooms in the Paradise tower as requested. Thirdly pool was just annoying on the weekend. Nikki Beach blasting music and the pool also blasting their music made the experience very unpleasant, Was better on Monday when Nikki Beach was closed. Pool staff were very attentive. Gave feedback to the Trop and received the standard form letter. "Sorry we didn't meet your expectations but will try harder next time". Only one chance to make a first impression.

Reviews.Title: “Forget the reviews about the old Tropicana...”
Reviews.Author: HonestReviewer2011
Reviews.Content: The newly, completely renovated Tropicana is a great choice for quality and value, but what stands out is the excellence of customer service. The entire staff made us feel welcome throughout our stay and treated us like VIP's. The hotel and the pool area are stylish and nicely maintained. The rooms are clean and have very comfortable beds. The tile floor in the bathroom seemed to have been the only area that escaped the renovations. Our stay was memorable thanks to several employees: Isaiah and Oscar take good care of the guests at the pool; the front desk made every effort to accommodate our requests; Mr. Wolff went out of his way to make sure we found what we were looking for; Bobby was an outstanding waiter at Nikki Cafe; Brian makes a mean Mojito at Nikki Beach and David is an entertaining lifeguard; the entire security team at Nikki Club and Beach were polite, respectful and friendly; special thanks to Duncan, Steve, Mike and Boosie. I would definitely recommend The Tropicana and would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical chic at an excellent value”
Reviews.Author: amy_ami
Reviews.Content: We scored a terrific package that included a 2-night stay at the Tropicana. After reading some of the earlier reviews, I had some reservations but I knew exactly what to ask for at front desk in order to make my stay better. Right from the moment we stepped through the front doors, the Tropicana met or exceeded all of our expectations. Check-in was a breeze and the two girls who helped us were cheery and patient. We were given a room with a king bed in the Paradise Tower (the one I had been hoping for). The room had a great view of the MGM Grand, NY-NY, and all the way up the strip. The room was clean, comfortable, and spatious. The bed was like sleeping on clouds, with big fluffy pillows. I did not eat at the hotel but the Starbucks was very convenient. The pool and area were nice. There was plenty of room and chairs for people to spread out around the pool and grassy areas. The whole look and feel of the hotel lobby and casino was a drastic improvement from the previous year when I briefly played there. But beyond physical appearances, you can tell that the Tropicana is really trying to step up their game and be a major player on the strip again.

Reviews.Title: “Club Nikki - Nice but LOUD”
Reviews.Author: likestotravel62
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and the rooms are nice. Be careful not to book a room overlooking the pool in the back tower if you do not like noise. Club Nikki (open until 4AM) is nice, unless you want to sleep. The music blares so loud you it feels like you have a stereo in your room. The staff was OK but not the most friendly group I had ever encountered. The layout of the Pool area is nice but somewhat dirty with litter and leaves. The hotel is in a great location on the South Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana, Las Vegas, NV - A good choice”
Reviews.Author: slstaft
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Tropicana, Las Vegas, NV was a fairly nice experience. The whole hotel is newly renovated and the decor is modern. Everything was squeeky clean with an inviting, relaxed atmosphere. Our room was a nice size, with a very comfortable bed and plenty of dresser and closet space. The only glitch to our stay was with the bath tub design. The placement of the shower head was much too low and the design of the bathtub lead to pooling water during a shower which puddled on the bathroom floor and all around the tub edge. Other than this minor glitch, I would very much recommend the Tropicana as a place to stay when visiting Las Vegas. It's close to the monorail pick up which is just right next door at MGM, and there is quick access to the street overpasses to both MGM as well as across the blvd to Excalibur. The staff is very nice and friendly and quick to help you with any service you may need. The pool area is very nice with plenty of lounge chairs, access to beach towels and shade if you aren't a sun worshipper. Our over all experience at the Tropicana was a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room, amazing view and amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: Dng711
Reviews.Content: The tropicana is in a great location on the strip. The newly remodled rooms can compete with the newer hotels on the strip! Had a great experience and can not wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good start to honeymoon and excellent end!”
Reviews.Author: diswish
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night at the beginning and end of our honeymoon. We had a not so promising start after a 30 minute wait to check-in (we were told they were short staffed). The room was clean and quiet; it was a bit of a walk but we expected that. We went to the pool briefly and that was nice as well. For our last night they upgraded us to a suite:) Absolutely a lovely end to our trip. The suite was wonderful - spacious, new, welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific warm and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: britishisles2011
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana and its transformation are just amazing. The people working there seem to be hand picked for their interest in the guests staying in this casino hotel. The Tropicana has an intimacy that is not found in the large casinos where one is just a number- at the Tropicana, people do know your name. The rooms at the Tropicana are wonderful and the whole experience makes travel a pleasure. The Tropicana has a feeling of "home" not just a place to rest your head. The Tropicana has been my choice hotel/casino for the last eight visits and it is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Old is new again - what a treat!!”
Reviews.Author: cler7
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised at how nice they have made this hotel. Good restaurants, great pool, a new & pleasant poker room, very conscientious employees every where you go, and a great location to get anywhere. What a gem!!

Reviews.Title: “Somebody's stuffing the ballet box”
Reviews.Author: travelinman1212
Reviews.Content: Hard to believe the Tropicana is rated 18th of Las Vegas hotels. Either they are stuffing the ballet box so to speak, or these reviewers need to get out more. The rooms are OK for the money, but not at all upscale. They are updated, but the bones are still old. Think plumbing that does not drain and hot water that is iffy. They could also be cleaner. The old adage about putting lipstick on a pig comes to mind. To me they are very similar to the "go" rooms at the Flamingo, yet the Flamingo is rated way down there. The pool is very nice, but the music is outrageous. It is way too loud, think hearing loss loud. Also if you are over 30 you probably won't enjoy the pool playlist. I spent 3 days at the Trop pool and I heard one song that I have on my i-pod playlists. Now, I consider myself a fairly mainstream guy when it comes to music. I have over 2,000 songs on my playlists ranging from 1962 to 2011. I enjoy rock, classic rock, pop, and country. What I do not enjoy is rap. The fact that I heard 1 song in 3 days that I would have on my playlist tells you all you need to know about the Trop pool music. Come on Trop management at least mix it up, people over 30 have money to spend too! The one area that I would give the Tropicana a 5 star rating is the service. The people are friendly and the serviced is great. In summary I would say that if you are younger you will most likely enjoy the Trop, but if you are over 30 I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE, LOVE, LOVED Tropicana!!!!”
Reviews.Author: punkiefly
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews, we my husband and I were hesitant to stay at The Tropicana. We booked our stay on their website in February for our stay in July. We ended up getting a really GREAT deal on the Penthouse Loft Room! It included the limo ride to and from the hotel as well as a $100 food credit. The resort fee includes the internet. There isn't an extra internet charge. **We got the Penthouse Loft for $900 for 4 nights/5 days which is an outstanding deal as compared to the regular $3000 without the deal we got. From the beginning of our trip, we knew it was going to be a great experience. Our limo driver was cordial, very helpful, and answered all our questions. Our limo ride was pleasant. As soon as we arrived to the entrance of The Tropicana, we were greeted in a friendly manner. We arrived at the hotel around 12:30 p.m. The front desk ladies were very friendly and checked us in immediately. Our luggage was taken care of and would be sent up. We ended up on the 21st floor of the Paradise Tower. As soon as we walked in to our Penthouse Loft, we were pleasantly surprised. The room was beautiful. We didn't get the loft with the jacuzzi downstairs (probably because it was just my husband & me) but nonetheless, the room was amazing!!! The penthouse loft had a dining area, living room area and a bar area downstairs with a gorgeous view of the Excalibur, Luxor, Mandalay Bay and New York New York. There was also a guest bathroom downstairs. There was a refrigerator and a coffee maker with delicious coffee. As we walked up the spiral stairs, we continued to see how the Tropicana has outdone themselves. We got to the second floor and immediately loved our soft King size bed. There was another TV upstairs. The master bathroom was huge and very clean! There was a jacuzzi overlooking the strip which looked beautiful at night. Our shower was huge and the bathroom included a toilet and a baday. The hotel provided amazing toiletries that we definitely used. Since we had the $100 food credit, my husband and I decided to eat at Pellegrino's. We ate pizza, chicken strips, burgers, soups and other treats. The food was good for the price. The cook and the cashier were very good with us and even remembered us going there for lunch every day the five days we were there. We would highly recommend trying their pizza. It was great! Also, the casino area is small but intimate. It has the popular slot machines and you can't beat the Tropicana play incentives. We liked the Tropicana because it was bright. My husband is legally blind, having only 4% of his vision and the brightness of the casino allowed him to still be mobile around the buildings and casino areas without assistance. So, THANK YOU Tropicana!!!!! Our check out was smooth. Our overall experience was AMAZING!!! We hope to stay at The Tropicana in December again.

Reviews.Title: “amazing!”
Reviews.Author: lauradenes
Reviews.Content: everyone was awesome! everyone that was working , took their time to make sure that we were taken care of and that we were happy.... Josh briton was wonderful. He was so helpful. He stoped what he was doing and spent time helping me out with questions and making sure that our day would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “hate to share this well kept secret!!”
Reviews.Author: Allinelmo
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana has undergone a major remodel and Im not sure I really want to spread the word because we LOVED the fact that this property wasnt WALL TO WALL people like some of the other hotels we walked through! :) My husband and I decided to spend our 20 year wedding anniversary in Las Vegas and after much research, we chose the Tropicana. We had no idea that because Britney Spears would be in town that particular weekend, all the room rates (at just about every hotel) would be higher than usual, so I cant say that we got a killer deal on our stay. HOWEVER, when I contacted the hotel to ask if there was any possibility of a room upgrade because of our special celebration, I received a gracious email from Kennon Wolff, one of the managers, who did indeed upgrade us to the extent he was able (the hotel was almost to capacity) and also offered us complimentary show tickets to Recycled Percussion (A MUST SEE if you get the chance, it was alot of fun!) Our room was on the 19th floor and was beautiful, clean and had a great view. The bed was comfortable and we even received a phone call from the front desk after checking in to make sure our room was to our liking! We found ALL the hotel employees pleasant and helpful, all of them giving the impression that they truly enjoyed their job. One of our days was spent simply laying by the pool, and we enjoyed the music and variety of people there (meaning, yes there were "the beautiful people" but also middle aged folks like ourselves as well as families with children ----no reason for anyone to feel "out of place" like sometimes happens at other places) I dont know what the "old Tropicana" was like, but the remodled version is beautiful, airy, and completely amazing. We are not gamblers, so we didnt spend any time in the casinos except to walk through them to get where we were going, but I have to say that the Tropicanas casinos were the least smokey and brightest of all the ones we walked through......it was a pleasure not to be hit by a wall of smoke everytime we went somewhere on the property. They even pipe in a breeze of coconut-ty scent throughout the corridors, which I personally found fantastic---not heavy or cheap smelling, just gave things a tropical feel. We absolutely loved our stay and we are already trying to figure out when we can get back there again! Our huge thanks to the staff for making us feel comfortable and helping us celebrate a fantastic moment in our lives :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great pool, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: RyanO99_11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Tropicana from June 19th - 23rd in celebration of our 6th anniversary. Check in was fairly quick. Brinkley was very friendly and made some small talk with us in regards to being Canadians upon checking in. She had a little trouble with our upgrade request, however, Jay was there to assist quickly - he was also very friendly and congratulated us on our anniversary. We upgraded to a Club Tower Spa Suite - worth every penny! The suite had a separate living/dining area with a wet bar and 2 piece bath. The bedroom was huge and included a Jacuzzi. The main bathroom had a his n' her's vanity, steam room/shower and a sauna. It was great to come "home" to this after a long night of walking the strip to relax. The staff were attentive. I had brought some beer up to my room but did not have a opener for it. One call to the front desk and one was delivered within 5 minutes. Had some trouble with the Jacuzzi (the trouble being my fault..oops) and again, a call to the front desk and someone was up within minutes to help. Our suite was obviously very new and was clean, however, we did find some coins and a burnt match on the floor upon our arrival that were not ours ... a little odd, but still the suite seemed clean and so I don’t feel that it deserves less than five stars. We spent every afternoon at the pool and it was great. Very relaxed setting. The music was great and not too loud. The water was nice and cool and there were plenty of chairs to go around. We ate at Biscayne one evening. The food was superb, as was the service. Our waiter, David, was very attentive and went as far as to ask us what show we were going to that night. When we mentioned we were going to see Carrot Top he shared a story of how he and Carrot Top used to shop at the same grocery store. A simple, but effective touch in delivering good, personalized service. We also ate at Bacio for one meal. The food was great again, as was the service. Upon leaving, chef Carla Pellegrino thanked us for coming and wished us a nice evening. This was also a simple but effective touch. How nice to have the chef thank you for coming to the restaurant! You don't see that often enough. We found the price at both restaurants to be fair for the food and service we received. The location was great and the casino was nice and bright. We are not gamblers but we each put $5 in to penny slots on the day we left (could not leave Vegas without at least trying) and I walked away with $105. All in all we had a great trip and the Tropicana was a good choice for us. The price was good, the location was great and the hotel was clean and fresh. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “It was nice but we won't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: dlsparks68
Reviews.Content: Hotel overall was very nice. Had been renovated within past 6 months of our trip. New bedding was very comfortable and everything was clean. The staff was nice and at check-in we were given a free mini-suite upgrade, which is standard with them, if you ask. The casino is a decent size but not what we would call "big" compared to the other Vegas casinos we have been in. What we didn't like was the lack of choices for eating. They have one expensive steak/seafood restaurant and one expensive italian restaurant. Those are the only two restaurants. There is a deli that serves pizza, sandwiches, gelato, salads and a other items but the menu is somewhat limited. It is your ONLY choice for breakfast there, other than a traditional Starbucks. The walkway outside the hotel connects to Excalibur where there is a food court. We ended up going there the last 3 mornings of our trip, for some variety. We don't spend a lot on food, ever, so we walked the strip and ate at other places. Highly recommend Hard Rock Cafe that is mid-strip. Good food, great portion sizes and no more expensive than a night out at home in Indiana. (NOT the Hard Rock Cafe at Hard Rock Hotel). The pool at Tropicana is very nice. Much more spacious than The Rio where we stayed in 2009, and prettier too! This was not a bad experience for us but we will not stay there again. We didn't like having to walk, walk, and walk just when we wanted to eat and not spend a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice. Great value.”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel721
Reviews.Content: I guess this place used to be pretty bad from what people were saying, but since it's been renovated- it's very nice. The rooms are modern and clean. The pool area is beautiful. We got our room for around $40 a night which is an extremely good value- it's worth far more. My only complaint would be that we had to call for hot water at one point, were told that someone would come up to our room: no one came so we eventually called back and were told that the hot water was turned on for us- why didn't anyone call to tell us so we weren't sitting around waiting? Also- the tub was clogged and very annoying. We didn't complain about it because we werent there very long, but we should've.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: steeler1127
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at the Tropicana and we thoroughly enjoyed it. First of all, the room in the Paradise Tower was so nice, extremely clean and had a very comfortable bed with big, thick pillows. We were able to see the lights from the other casinos from our window on the 9th floor. The casino also was very clean, bright, and not really crowded even though it was the Fourth of July. We were able to play any slot machines we wanted. We ate breakfast at the Cafe Nicki every day. There was a good variety of breakfast foods, but we especially liked the made-to-order omelets and the Chef preparing them, Dan Christensen, was awesome! Not only did he make great omelets every morning for us, but he was so personable, talking to us about our trip, always concerned that we were having a good time. If you eat there at breakfast, have an omelet made by Dan! The waiters and waitresses were also great at the Cafe Nicki. And in the Casino, the waitresses were quick to bring you drinks while you were playing... unlike other casinos we have been to. Dawn was especially good at bringing our drinks and chatting with us for a few minutes. There is also a Starbucks and another little cafe to get a bite to eat. We didn't try the Italian restaurant, but heard it was good. We checked out by noon, even though our plane didn't leave until 11:30 p.m., but we were able to store our luggage until we left and Dean was very helpful in taking good care of our luggage since I had purchased some items that were fragile and just had them in a carry-on. I must also mention the wonderful pool they have. It has been recently renovated and it was wonderful!! We had no problem finding a lounge chair, towels were provided, and waitresses were available to bring drinks to you. We would definitely stay at the Tropicana again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money + Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: rickster08
Reviews.Content: Again I like to keep it short and sweet! Tropicana was absolutely value for money! It's location was 5 stars! right on the strip with easy access to MGM and New York New York! Room's were amazing! great size, comfortable beds, clean and safe! Hotel itself was very nice too. The only thing that let this hotel down was the pool was a little bit dirty due to the tree leaves and sticks but you would think it would have some sort of self cleaning system.....any how this does not take away from the fact this place is a real gem!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: tk4bama
Reviews.Content: We took our first family trip to Vegas in June. After extensive research and reading just about every tripadvisor review of dozens of Las Vegas hotels we selected the Tropicana. And we were not the least bit disappointed. Before we ever arrived I was thoroughly impressed at the high level of customer care via my correspondence with Nicole Marshall. She was attentive to our requests and assured me she would make certain that our requests were noted and fulfilled to the best of their ability. And she was certainly true to her word. When we arrived we discovered that the excellent reviews were accurate. The renovated rooms were outstanding and the customer service was extremely professional and courteous. After we checked out Nicole even went so far as to send a follow up email to make sure our stay met our expectations. To me that shows the personal care that will keep us coming back. For the combination of value and customer service the Tropicana can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled”
Reviews.Author: gajord51
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been touring the USA for the past 3weeks and have visited San Fran New York Washington and Santa Monica and on advice from Trip Advisor have had great accommodation by the reviews but alas now in Las Vegas and staying at the Tropicana I am bitterly disappointed. On arrival and knowing of the hotel charge of $9.90 per day for incidentals we also requested a fridge for the stay of 7 days and were charged $15 00 a day for that as well, on arrival to the room we were placed in the Club Tower with a view of the airport and the car park, not what the web sight said, " views of pool and gardens". Also finding that the room did not have tea and coffee making facilities rang reception to request a kettle only to be told there would be a charge of $10 a day for the privilege. Some reviews have mentioned that they have been given wavers for such extras but our requests have fallen on deaf ears. As I have mentioned before all other hotels we have stayed at via Trip Advisor have been great but alas the reviews for this hotel seem to rave about the recent upgrade,which is good but the more important things,listening to the customer have seem to have fallen on deaf ears. if you tally up all the extras if might be worth while looking at some where else

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money !”
Reviews.Author: Granville45
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 3rd to 7th July. Nicole, the customer services manager had offered us a free upgrade to a city view room but when we arrived they were all taken because it was the holiday w/end. It didn't matter cause our room had a great view of MGM and NYNY and overlooked the pool. Room was great, very clean and spacious. Beds were v comfy and bedding was spotless. We didn't do any gambling so I can't comment on that but the casino was brighter than the others we walked thru, most were v dimly lit and gloomy. I would say that the Trop's theme is not as obvious as some of the other hotels and it doesn't have as big a 'wow' factor but it is brighter and v clean throughout. We did the mob experience which I have to say isn't worth the $39. Only go if you can get a discounted ticket and of you have an interest in the mafia's involvement with the development of Vegas. We ate in Biscayne once and the food was excellent, hubby and daughter had rib eye steak and I had chicken with mushroom dumpling sauce. Delicious ! There are 2 starbucks stations in the hotel, great for an early morning coffee. The location of the Trop at the southern end of the strip means a lot of walking but we didn't find it a problem, we got plenty of exercise to work off the food we were eating. The Trop is great value for money, standard of our room was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience @ The Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: JoeV48
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently enjoyed a 3 day stay at the newly renovated Tropicana. We had a comped room at Harrahs but heard alot about the renovation at the Trop. They offered us a room at casino rate so we gave it a try, what a pleasant surprise! The renovations of the hotel, casino, pool and public areas were all completed and the place looked great. Plus all the staff were excellent especially Terry our bellman. Upon checking into the hotel there was a slight problem with our room location due to the fact that the night before we arrived Britney Spears was hosting the grand opening party for the Tropicana's new Nikki Beach Club. Evidently some of the quests were not leaving there rooms on time the following day and/or were staying an extra night, anyway with the friendly, courteous, and professional help from the Tropicana especially our Bellman "Terry" we ended up in the Paradise Tower with a corner suite overlooking the Strip at no additional cost! Another testimony to there staff, notably security (I think his name is Bob) is that following checkout while we were at the airport waiting for our return flight home, I realized I had left something of value in our hotel room. I quickly called the hotel and spoke with the security staff who in turn called me back and gave me the good news that they found the item. I caught a taxi back to the hotel and picked up my item at the security desk on the casino floor rushed back to my waiting taxi and returned to the airport without missing our scheduled flight. What a relief! Newly renovated, clean premises, friendly helpful staff, food a little pricey (but it is Vegas). Highly recommend, we shall return!

Reviews.Title: “CAN IT GET ANY BETTER NO WAY!!!!”
Reviews.Author: misslaydj
Reviews.Content: Got a suite upgrade from Arik. Even if I did not get one this place is PHENOMENAL!!!! I been to vegas before and stayed at the Wyndham. I want to move in this place it's so GREAT. To the lady who was mad no one helped her with her bags, are you serious??? This is why you won't stay here again, shame on you for being lazy. To the man who was upset over his airport view. Not every room will have a strip view, be for real. As long as your staying in a spanking NEW room your in vegas who cares. Your not looking out the window anyway. I have pics and videos to upload later. Staff was great. To the folks that said staff was rude I seriously doubt it unless you came off rude to them first. Even if you were just walking the halls everyone spoke. SPOTLESS clean rooms. Beds to die for, dont sit in them unless you plan on falling asleep cause it will swallow you in, in a good way. Entrance was bright with fun music playing. Walkways to MGM, Excalibur and Luxor. Why pay over $100 to stay at the Wynn or anywhere at City Center WHY??? no idea. This place is 5 Star. 24 hour starbucks, and a little cafe. Only $10 resort fee. This by far won me over hence making my reservation here. Why would I give a hotel over a grand for a week's stay for a resort fee. You won't get me a as a fool. Book at the Trop and you will NEVER seek out another hotel again. Didn't make it to Nikki Beach or any of restaurants. Yes a slice of pizza at the cafe was $4 but what do you expect put a dollar in the slot and get the money to get you a slice. People need to enjoy the place for what it is. Folks complained that the hotel didnt boast any young pretty folks REALLY people, REALLY. I rather sleep in a great clean room than worry if I'm partying next to my grandfather. To each their own I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: smashley1814
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in part because of the good reviews on this site and was not disappointed. Overall it was a good experience, especially for the price, and would stay there again. The good: Nice location right across from the MGM Grand Good sized room and bathroom also very clean The beds were very comfortable Really nice pool area Recently renovated so everything seems nice and new The not so good: Room was not ready by check-in time and had to wait a hour and a half for it to be cleaned Onsite restaurants were fairly pricey

Reviews.Title: “The "Trop" is WONDERFUL!”
Reviews.Author: HikeGaffney
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with 7 others were at the Trop from June 28th through July 1st. This was my first time to Vegas and we had a great time!! The "Trop" was awesome! The rooms were spacious and VERY nice and clean. The bathrooms were also spacious and clean! All of my group was on the 11th floor in the front building (Paradise) and I loved that location. Those rooms were centrally located around the casino, bars, front desk and front entrance of the building. The pool area was beautiful! We didn't get in the pool while there, but we enjoyed walking around and laying out by the pools! The Nikki restaurant was nice even though we had a bad experience with our waitress in the Nikki restaurant on our first day. We also got pizza at the other little snack/cafe and it was good! We did most of our eating breakfast and dinner outside of the hotel. The entire property was VERY nice!! The staff was WONDERFUL and VERY helpful! They always opened the doors for us as we entered the hotel and was helpful in giving directions or making recommendations! The concierge helped book our group tickets for the Gladys Knight concert. Gladys was performing live @ the Trop and was AWESOME! The concierge also helped book our tickets for the Grand Canyon and Hoover Dam tour (Sweet Tours) and what an experience it was!!...one that I will never forget! When I return to Las Vegas, I will definitely return to the Trop! Thanks Nicole for your help and the lady at the front desk who checked our group in (I can’t remember her name)…she did a great job getting us checked and settled in as quick as possible!! Thumbs up to the "New Trop" and we WILL be back!

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend to others depending on what they're looking for”
Reviews.Author: Mailgirl
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Tropicana for 2 nights of my 6 day trip to Vegas. I wanted to see how the remodel had gone. I booked online directly through Tropicana and after contacting Nicole Marshall, received an upgrade to a Strip View room and the resort fee waived. (resort fee is $11.99, not $19 as stated by another reviewer) The rooms have definitely been done over, and my non-smoking room did not have any hint of smoke in it. I think the only thing I can say about the remodel is that it's still a pretty basic hotel, but with new paint, wallpaper and furnishings. Not bad at all, but now blow-you-away great, either. I will include photos. The bathroom has a vent fan that runs as long as the light is on, which is a little annoying and the only towel rack for the shower is 6 feet away from the shower. I may just be spoiled by some of the other newer Vegas properties, but I still only stay at the mid-priced places, so I'm not comparing it to Wynn. The bed was very comfortable, and the chaise by the window was usable in that it didn't collapse like the one at Flamingo when you sit to change your shoes. The elevators at the Trop are really slow for some reason. There was actually a line I had to wait in when I was going up to my room with my bags. It seems that too many people stop the elevator at the Mezzanine Level and it holds up the people going to the rooms. It seemed like the elevator opened at that level every time I rode it, even if it was just some confused person standing there with a beer in their hand. Anyone who books through Tropicana is entitled to the VIP Breeze Check In which is a separate line that moves quickly and hopefully gets you early check in and late check out. Only problem is, that with them giving people 2pm check out, that means early check in probably won't happen. I did not get early check in. My room was ready at 3pm. (But I did get late check out.) Inside the hotel, all the employees were friendly. But the guys working valet were not so friendly. My friend valeted her car when we thought I'd be checked in, but when we went right back out to get it and waited in the wrong place (not clearly marked), she was chastised by the valet for not being there when he brought the car around. Well who would think the car would be brought up facing the lane where the cars enter the parking lot? That was just strange. Everyone else just uses another lane in the drop off area. Also, when I was dropped off by a cabbie who didn't realize that the completely empty North entrance was open, the valet there swore after him and the next one also yelled at him. Well, that's fine, but keep it civil in front of the customers. It looked to me like they didn't know which entrance they wanted anyone to use just yet. When I oringally booked, I was supposed to get some sort of deal where 2 pool chairs were reserved for me, but I don't know if that got lost in the shuffle when Nicole upgraded my room. I never had time to use the pool with my taking cabs all over, so it didn't matter. My "Strip view" was of Mandalay Bay/Luxor/Excal. It would have been nice without the banner over the windows. I guess most of the Trop is "wrapped" in a white banner at the moment. I'm not a fan of them. I like to have a clear view out the window. (that's just me) When I went to do the express check out on the TV, the resort fee was showing, so I went down to check out at the desk. I had my reservation printed and the friendly clerk took the charges right back off the bill for me. Finally, I'd say that the new Trop isn't bad at all - I personally like a more central location on the Strip, so I'd recommend Tropicana more to someone on a budget, someone with a rental car that is doing off-Strip excursions, or just likes that end of the Strip more. I would not recommend it for someone who likes the mid-Strip properties, or a bit more luxurious room. At least not the regular room - maybe a suite? All in all, it wasn't bad, but I just didn't get the vibe from it that I expected. It is definitely better than it was in the not-to-distant past, though.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasing, as usual!”
Reviews.Author: Jordan4900
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks great, inside and out, it is very hard to pull something that is entirely white off, especially in the desert, but the tropicana does just that. It is extremly clean, and really elegant in its own way. I have and will recommend it to any one that stays on the strip, in my opinion, dollar for dollar it is by far the best one there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facility and hotel! We're coming back!”
Reviews.Author: EdIsaacs
Reviews.Content: We came for business reasons but my wife and I talked about coming back again for pleasure. Great restaurants, excellent casino, close to many other places on the strip. We weren't sure what to expect but the whole place is new and redone.

Reviews.Title: “Great 1st Experience”
Reviews.Author: dindin84
Reviews.Content: I visited the Tropicana from June 29th - July 3rd for a bachelorette trip..being the first time any of us had visited Vegas we didnt really know what to expect..upon arrival we experienced a some what long line up at check in but it moved fairly quickly..no more then 10 min wait..we were placed in the Club Tower which is quite a walk from the lobby but as days went by it didnt feel as long..the view of the strip and the pool / nikki beach club made up for it..the rooms were very comfortable for a standard room..ive never slept in such a comfortable bed..the only problem we experienced with one of the rooms was that the lock would not lock properly..we advised the front desk about the problem..they sent up security to take a look at it..shortly after they had a maintenance guy look at it and determined it had to be fixed by whoever installed the door..they offered to switch us to another room but we were so happy with our room and the floor we were on that we just decided to use the latch and the DND sign and had no problems..the cleaning staff was great..clean towels were always available..the casino was a bit small compared to the other big hotels but it was still very inviting..the pool was amazing and lounge chairs were always availble even in the afternoon..the pool in nikki beach was very entertaining and the dj played great music..the drinks in the pool were a bit over priced but considering its Vegas they were pretty reasonable..the hotel is located on the far south end of the strip which means a lot of walking to get to the more popular hotels (ex. Bellagio, Caesars, Paris) but we found that it was still a great location to be in..we had no problems with noise and NO PROBLEMS WITH BED BUGS..overall this hotel was a great stay if u want more of a quiet atmosphere..i would probably stay here again if I ever want a peaceful stay in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “The Tropicana is back and better than ever!”
Reviews.Author: rthughbanks
Reviews.Content: I LOVED my stay at the Tropicana Hotel in June and would highly recommend anyone to book their room here. From an impeccable staff who provided great customer service to the trendy pool and club scene and to the GORGEOUS oversized room I stayed in, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and plan on coming back!

Reviews.Title: “WE WILL NEVER STAY ANYWHERE ELSE IN VEGAS!!”
Reviews.Author: wendykzoo
Reviews.Content: We spent the long 4th of July weekend at the Tropicana. Our stay began with amazing, efficient check-in service from Ladonna, who waived the fee for a fridge and also moved us into the Paradise Tower from the Club Tower because we were worried about noise from the club. We would definitely recommend the Paradise Tower - we were in room #931 which was a King room at the end of the hallway overlooking the pool. It is much more convenient than the Club Tower and we never heard any noise from the club or the strip. Everyone we encountered at the Tropicana was very friendly and helpful, including the wonderful woman who cleaned our room (I am mad at myself for not noting her name; she cleaned our room from the 1st - 5th of July). The Tropicana is much cleaner and brighter than most of the other hotels/casinos that we walked through. They seem to cater more to their hotel guests than to the walk-in casino visitors. Our room and bathroom were spacious and clean. The wireless was easy to use and high-speed. We were able to easily find lounge chairs at the pool, which was busy but not overwhelmingly loud or crazy (we are in our mid-40's). The only downside that we can think of is the location ~ at the south end of the strip, so a long walk to some of the action/restaurants, etc; however, we knew that going in. Our visit ended with more wonderful customer service at check-out from Gwen, who reduced our room rate by $30 after she found out we had taken the red-eye home and left at 9pm (and this was over the phone after we had arrived home!). STAY AT THE TROPICANA, YOU WON'T BE DISAPPOINTED!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: jamieandkurt
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews of Las Vegas hotels having issues with bed bugs I was very concerned with what to expect. I soon realized the Tropicana was at the far end of the strip. As this being my first time in Vegas I didn't know one hotel/ casino from the next. I was so happy with the hotel, our room, and the pool! After seeing all the other hotels I was so pleased with my choice. It was so clean and vibrant and most of the staff was warm and engaging. Our room was very clean and the comfy bed was exactly what we needed after the grueling walk down the strip. Our housekeeper Jean was outstanding- so friendly and did such a great job. The only negatives I have were I wish the pool was open later, and a bartender who was at the sports bar made us a little uneasy. He was rolling his eyes and complaing about customers to the cocktail waitresses, right in front of us. He didn't even acknowledge us, another friendly bartender came from the opposite end to wait on us. I've been in the service industry for years and the Brad Garrett look a like bartender was completely distasteful. Hopefully he was just having a bad day. Overall, when I return I won't be staying anywhere else. And I ended up enjoying being farther away from all of the fun chaos of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “We love the new Trop!!”
Reviews.Author: Smokechaser1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trop the end of June when we were in Vegas for a family wedding. We really enjoyed our stay. The first thing we noticed was how friendly all of the staff were; from the front desk to the folks we met in the elevator, they all had smiles on their faces. You don't get that treatment everywhere in Vegas. And they were able to accommodate our need for adjoining rooms, even when the hotel was sold out. The hotel is very clean. Everywhere we went someone is cleaning; sweeping the white tile in the gaming area, wiping down the elevator, emptying ashtrays in the gaming area. Our room was great - and it was their standard room. I've never slept better in a hotel, especially in Vegas. The mattresses are the best. Loved the layout of the bathrooms. They aren't huge, but arranged very well for their size. And my favorite thing: we didn't experience any "hall noise"!! No talking, slamming doors, etc. that normally wakes us in other hotels. We were in the Paradise tower and our room faced the MGM Grand. We heard the occasional helicopter or siren, but nothing that woke us up. We are a family of 5, with 3 teens, so the pool area is very important to us. The new Trop pool area didn't disappoint. We had an easy time finding lounge chairs and the kids enjoyed the pool. The location on the Strip is great, you can catch the tram across the street at Excalibur to go to the Luxor or Mandalay Bay, and the tram that rus the east side of the Strip is just across the street at the MGM Grand. The only downside was the pool was a little messy in the late afternoons and closed early. As much emphasis as was placed on keeping the hotel clean, it may have been due to the amount of wind that was occurring in the afternoons during our stay (blowing cups etc. in the pool. And it WAS much better on the last day of our stay. I think the management is very focused on the Nikki Beach experience and they need to work on the main pool a little more. Overall - we loved the place and the South Beach feel to it. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “The Tropicana Las Vegas surpassed my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: deb4435
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on TripAdvisor prior to making my reservations.Even though the reviews were glowing, I have to admit I was a bit worried. I have been to Las Vegas several times and have been disappointed more than once on an overpriced room in shabby condition. This was not the case with the Tropicana. From the moment we walked in the Resort doors I was impressed. It has just been renovated and it is in excellent condition. Clean, bright and well ventilated. And better than the resort's condition was the impeccalbe customer service. In this day and age not many companies put an emphasis on customer serivce. Not so with the Tropicana. Every employee we came into contact with greeted us and/or provided us with the best best customer service. Check in was easy as was being able to upgrade to a suite that became available. There was once person who impressed me the most and that was "Yolanda" at the front desk. She was very personable and focused on making our stay wonderful. I wanted to surprise my husband with a suite (we were celebrating his birthday and our anniversary) and Yolanda was able to make it happen. To top it off she had some chocolate covered strawberries and champange delivered to our room! The suite was huge, clean and the bed was so comfortable. the room also had, a fridge, coffee maker, safe, and internet (included in the resort fee). Now all that being said I do have only two issues of a negative nature. First is that I paid to be upgraded to the Paradise Suite with a strip view. However, our view of the strip was blocked by a massive sign hung on the exterior of the Tropicana. So all we got to see was the Excalibur and New York..And second is almost all the alcoholic drinks we received were pretty "weak." Especially in the Brad Garrett comedy club. We basically paid $50 for two souvenir glasses full of pineapple juice... But that wasn't enough to dampen our impression of the Tropicana. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful getaway”
Reviews.Author: theresa067
Reviews.Content: The rooms and casino are beautiful. The pool is gorgeous the staff was very pleasant and helpful. Iwill stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: marinelles
Reviews.Content: The remodel is gorgeous! The rooms were clean and spacious. Rates are very reasonable, def worth being slightly off the beaten path! I will def stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated and it smells like coconuts”
Reviews.Author: VacationFamilyGuy
Reviews.Content: I found a great price for the Tropicana online. The hotel was recently renovated. The room was very clean and modern. The hallways smelled like coconuts. We had great stay. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and family. Free Wi-Fi!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money this was a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robandwilson
Reviews.Content: The hotel is down the far end of the strip and compared to the big flashy hotels is a little basic, but the room had great soundproofing and was very very clean, pool was full of young hot trendys, overall the Tropicana was a good value place to crash after busy times in vegas

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: bangles12
Reviews.Content: Everything was lovely - no complaints. Pool is really nice and spacious, hotel staff friendly and helpful. Really enjoyed my time here!

Reviews.Title: “The Trop earns all 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: DonInConnecticut
Reviews.Content: Two words express it all: Genuine hospitality. Just back from my second stay at the Tropicana, and hard-to-believe news is that it's even better than it was last fall. A stylish 'boutique' hotel experience isn't what you expect on the Strip - but the Trop delivers. And at very competitive prices, too. A few things to know up front: -- The Trop is big enough to stay interesting and vibrant 24/7, but at the same time it's manageable. Like Mandalay Bay, it's far enough south to provide a break from the relentlessly bustling, noisy and overcrowded sidewalks of the mid-Strip - so after a visit to the Bellagio fountains or City Center, you truly get the sense of "coming home" and escaping the mid-Strip bedlam. -- Guests stand a good chance of getting individual attention here. The Trop's staff are remarkably friendlier than you'll find at most Vegas hotels; best guess is that they're treated better by management, too. It pays off for the guests. In the course of a single day, the cheerful younger doorman at the side entrance, a guy named Vernon at the entertainment desk & a woman working at the tux/bridal shop had all struck up conversations with me. The Cafe Nikki waitress at dinner and the waiter at lunch were both personable and professional. Nicole Marshall could write the book on hotel hospitality. -- The Trop's casino, room decor and pool area tell you right off that this isn't a standard hotel designed by corporate beancounters. Instead, the casino is gleaming white with touches of dark, rich red - way livelier, brighter and fresher than anything you'll find on the Strip or downtown. The tropical theme of light colors (with plenty of cream tones and bamboo accents) is carried throughout the corridors and rooms of the two high-rise towers, the Paradise and Club. Lastly, the pool area landscaping is spectacular; lots of gently sloping lawns and palm trees rather than the acres of bare concrete so common at Vegas hotels. -- Even with the renovations completed, the Trop still offers value-for-your-money rates. Downsides? Not many. Like almost every Vegas pool I've visited in the past couple of years, the Trop's has louder music than I'd choose. It makes sense for the Nikki Beach operation to be all about a party atmosphere, but the general pool area has a different mix of guests - and dialing back the volume couldn't hurt (particularly in the morning). Similarly, it's becoming harder for popular Vegas hotels to keep the pools clean.
