The 'perpetual spring break' vibe of the Strip is growing, and young partiers seem accustomed to tossing their empty drink cups into the water. (This trend is even worse at MGM's lazy river).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Casino”
Reviews.Author: FiftiesHavingFun
Reviews.Content: This Hotel just went through a major renovation. The grounds and casino were beautiful. The room was noisy and a far walk from the casino area. I have stayed in Vegas before and expected more in the quality of the room. I would say it was average as far as hotel rooms go.Nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Not as cheap as you might think and terrible...”
Reviews.Author: bstpierre
Reviews.Content: Beware the resort fee is $19 in addition to the $30 rate. They claim this is because you get perks like free WIFI. They are right, the WIFI is excellent for doing things like writing this scathing review! The whole place stinks of some coconut sun tan lotion air freshener. They pump it through the AC which barely works by the way to expect sleepless hot nights. Try the flamingo for a bit more $$$.

Reviews.Title: “do not forget something in this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hasanerdal
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights in Tropicana. I forgot 6 shirts in the closet when I checked out. Although I have sent many emails to guest relations, they could not find them. If you forget your belongings in this hotel, they will most probably disappear. A professionally managed resort must assure the security of guests' belongings both during and after their stay.

Reviews.Title: “Brad Garrett's Comedy Club and Mob Experience”
Reviews.Author: tkportersat
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay at the Tropicana but we did visit two places here. We had such a wonderful time that I felt like I needed to come and post a review. So here goes.... The Mob Experience- Really cool set up and very interactive. You are given a badge with a Mob Name to start (Bubbles here) and as you go along the exhibit your badge triggers things to happen. You get to select your "guide" at the beginning, we chose James Caan. Very interesting to see how Vegas got it's start and the Exhibit has a ton of information as well as many items and pictures from each of the Mobsters. What surprised me is how short in stature a lot of these Notorious men were. There is film footage as well as many boards you can read about the men and the mob. We were staying at the Flamingo this visit and there is information about it being the first big Hotel on the Strip. It was a lot of fun! Brad Garrett's Comedy Club- First of all I knew before we got to Vegas that Brad Garrett is not always at the club, again when we purchased the tickets the agent reiterated this. We went the night of June 25th and saw Bobby Miyamoto and Steve McGrew. The night was opened by a wonderfully funny black lady (sorry, can't remember her name). She got the night started on the right track and we knew were were going to have a fun evening. Bobby Miyamoto then came out and he was awesome, very dry funny guy. The headliner Steve McGrew was off the charts the funniest comedian I have ever seen in my life. He literally had the crowd laughing the entire time he was on stage. My throat and stomach hurt when the show was over. I can't for the life of me figure out why either of these guys aren't super famous by now. The Comedy Club was very nice and there isn't a bad seat in the place. Drink service is really good and all staff was very friendly. Loved the Tropicana and hope to get to stay there in the near future. I visited in 2004 when I stayed at the old Hotel San Remo ( now Hooters) and the hotel is so beautiful since it has been remodeled. The pool area looked like fun too. Definitely stop by here on your next trip to Vegas, you won't be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC - WILL DEFINITELY RETURN”
Reviews.Author: 2fortheroad2
Reviews.Content: From the minute we walked in the door (having just checked out of a disastrous horrid hotel) - we were renewed! Staff could not do more for us. The service from EVERYONE was outstanding, we felt like we were the ONLY guests in this marvelous property!!! Cannot express how we truly feel - superb rooms, service, all amenities were carefully thought out, everyone from the bell men, housekeeping staff, waitresses, desk clerks always greeted us with a smile and a have a nice day, etc. We definitely ARE going back; without a doubt! Highly recommend the Tropicana!!

Reviews.Title: “I am looking forward to coming back to the trop...”
Reviews.Author: Jpalafox
Reviews.Content: The Trop has definitely stepped it up with the renovation. We had visited on June 17-19th and we had sooo much fun. We experienced it all here. From the daybed at the pool to bottle service at the amazing Club Nikki. My wife and I started with the Mandalay Bay, but after reading some reviews we decided to look elsewhere. When I thought of the Tropicana I immediately thought run down, but not to my knowledge, the Trop did some major changes... And great changes. As soon as we arrived from California, Valet greeted us and treated us like kings! yea, that's what there supposed to do, but this was way different from our last trip to vegas, and we come often. We checked in very fast because the gentleman up front who has been there over 25 years (he told me, very funny guy), was about to leave but saw I was eager to hit the tables... HA! His shift was about to end in five minutes, but he took me anyway. He was a very funny fellow... The next morning we hit the pool and it was pretty packed, a great pool is probably why... So we decided to get a daybed and they put us next to the pool, it was like they knew we were coming because it was a perfect location... Club Nikki is absolutely amazing, great staff and great music... Not the XS nightclub, but Club Nikki is on the rise, and I'm sure this nightclub will be one to beat. Over all, my stay was probably the best I have ever experienced... Rooms were very clean, staff was amazing and friendly and our guest who we brought with us, will remember this trip forever... It was there first time to vegas, I am planning to go back in July... See you soon TROP!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, loved the pool”
Reviews.Author: 2Adventure_ca
Reviews.Content: Stayed at resort and was pleasantly surprised with quality of renovations that had occurred. Loved the pool, just wish there was more of it open. The new Nikki Beach experience wasn't yet open. Guess we'll have to go back when it's open.

Reviews.Title: “The New Trop, a revitalization we've all been anticipating”
Reviews.Author: INANEWYORKMINUTE
Reviews.Content: So the Tropicana...LV BLVD and Trop...what once was, has now become again...a refreshing 'experience' on the strip. The 'new' Trop resumes residency on the famed corner. I was reluctant to stay here, but my admin booked me on a last minute find. What was I to do, I was already on the plane and she said the room rate could not be beat...hesitantly I asked what the rate was - $59.00 p/night!!! OK, I'm running in the other direction. I decided to see it for myself, (i mean i could always leave, right?) I was impressed! The reservation agent on the phone told my admin to tell me to go directly to VIP check-in. Huh?!?! I was like what...really? (I know my admin had informed the res agent that her boss is VERY picky) She greeted me with a overwhelming smile and quickly located my reservation...(i hate how sometimes they are not so ready and re-verify your name multiple times b/c you booked w/ Hdotcom or some other travel site); it was later in the day when I checked-in, so i was assured i'd be able to go directly to my room; so anyway...from valet to walking thru the 'new' entrance i was like...am I in SOBE (south beach, miami) everything smelled new and looked new, honestly felt a little regal almost. I was impressed, WOW the Trop delivered! (OK, so I lived in LV for 17 years before moving to southern California; so I was sorta aware of the remodel; but I wasn't prepared for this...I mean the Tropicana has been laying dorment for so long, one could only think...how much of an investment can they really commit to do to make this place...well, ah, er...relevant again?); i honestly thought it was coming down... OK, back to my room...WOW! I was in the tower closet to the front of the hotel - new elevators! HUGE room...i'm a bathroom guy - so i judge the room on how comfortable the bathroom is and appears...right down to the shower head and water pressure when you flush...front desk rep told me it was a 'new' tower and that everything was brand new; oh c'mon...No, but really. The room smelled like a brand new car. and the bed - COMFORTABLE! (no saggy mattress - you know how they try and cover up an old mattress by adding new bedding); other amenities included a flat screen TV, Hi-Speed wireless internet (i usually dont connect to hotel 'free' wireless b/c it just isnt safe, but the Trop has Cox...) the rooms completely black out at night, NO VEGAS STRIP LIGHTS COMING IN...sometimes the curtains don't come together all the way and that one beam of light always finds your window...and, most importantly - the room smells good - NO SMOKE! whatever it is they pump thru the ventilation system in the casino...gently fills you room, w/out over powering your senses. What i really liked is that Valet remembered my name from the night before and each time i came back to the hotel...and the front desk reps have said "Welcome back!" every time. i've been back to the 'new' Trop many times after the first time, and have brought my friends and business associates - all hesitant but figured, if I can stay there and brag about it, it must be OK! The Trop has been my place to stay since Dec'10 and every month thereafter...both of my businesses are in LV so I have to travel back and forth, the Trop is home while I am attending to my business. (i once got what they call a 'courtesy' upgrade...compliments of the hotel for what i can only assume was my frequent stays) ROOM, excuse me SUITE, WAS...AMAZING! ty trop It's quiet once you settle in - despite the active construction, you hardly notice it. Room service menu has a good selection of food, tho' depending on what tower you are in; it could take a while to get it. (i think even the staff know it and actually apologized to me that it may have taken longer than expected/usual) After a long day at work if your room is in the tower towards the back of the hotel...Ugh! prepare yourself for a long walk! All in all...I'm a believer! see ya next stay Trop! P.s. no spa...c'mon Trop - it's needed! make the add'l investment...i like my steam! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Clean new rooms, Nikki Beach looks amazing”
Reviews.Author: electricmice
Reviews.Content: I stayed at tropicana the week before Nikki beach was set to open. All I can say is I am coming back,staying at trop and partying at Nikki Beach. The Checkin /out as very quick, the rooms were clean, spacious, and very comfortable. I ate multiple times at the nikki beach cafe and LOVE the food. Hands down the best calamari I have ever had. There is a small resort fee, however the fee includes wifi which I normally have to pay for anyways.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: LAVAustin
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for a family reunion in June. Our room on the 15th floor was very clean and (relatively) quiet. We booked through the Trop's web page several months ahead of time and paid $49 for weekdays and $75 for Friday and Saturday (when we arrived, the resort fee and quite a few taxes were added onto these base rates). This is a pretty reasonable rate for a hotel on the strip. There are certainly more exciting places to stay in Las Vegas. The Trop does not have a lot of restaurants or nightlife. But if you are looking for a good value, clean rooms, and a base of operations to explore the rest of the strip, the Trop is a good option. It is also a fairly good place to stay with kids (not that I'd recommend Vegas for a trip with kids). The pool is large, beautiful, and clean (although it is only open from 9 to 7 daily), and the food court has many kid friendly options (pizza, chicken strips, ice cream).

Reviews.Title: “It was great, clean, new looking. we will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: AleFarley
Reviews.Content: Our stay was great. The room was clean and very comfortable. The pool was a great plact to hang out. The night life was excellent too. The casino is great and fun. all staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN...what else could go wrong”
Reviews.Author: Michelleg46
Reviews.Content: For $369 a night because of the Electric Daisy Carnival in town we thought Tropicana must be worth it. WE WERE WRONG. Problems with the room were air conditioner was broken, bed sunk on one side, toilet clogged on second say. One of the worst problems was the HORRIBLE towel small. We were a group of 4 girls and would have to load up on perfume after the low water pressure shower and terrible smelling towels. It was a mix of smoke and mildew for all 5 days we stayed there! GROSS! Had a problem one day with the internet because it charged us 7.50 to use and print and then it was out of paper! Took 50 minutes to solve issues. Maids barely cleaned room believe they only made the bed. Wouldn't even give new soap and shampoo daily! Nice pool but VERY cold.

Reviews.Title: “What a Find !!”
Reviews.Author: andra-p
Reviews.Content: If your thinking of going to Vegas book this Hotel before everybody finds out about it. Stage 1 of a massive refurb is complete. Superb rooms, excellent staff, great pool area A bargain, would stay here again in an instant

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable, but Subpar Service, Very Noisy”
Reviews.Author: pjc1973
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife in late June. The hotel is clean and bright, though the service was not good. It took 45 minutes to get through a short line checking in at 3:00 in the afternoon, and the staff was unapologetic. Two phone calls from the room to the front desk were never answered (it just rang and rang). We eventually had to call the operator and ask for a supervisor to remove a refrigerator that had shown up unrequested and that would have resulted in an extra charge. Speaking of extra charges, we reserved the room online and were unpleasantly surprised by a mandatory $10 per day "resort fee." We also had the misfortune of being there for the opening of the Nikki night club, which resulted in room-rattling techno music being blasted through our room (even on the 12th floor) until 4:00 in the morning. Luckily, the club was closed the following two nights of our stay, so we were able to sleep. The club is open Wednesday to Saturday, so I'd ask if they've done anything about the noise before staying there again. On the positive, we were very pleased with a day at the pool, where we rented a cabana with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing changes!”
Reviews.Author: pcortes32
Reviews.Content: Happy to say the changes to the new Tropicana are well worth it. Staff was very friendly from beginning to end. Valet and bellmen made us feel welcomed and to my surprise doors were opened each and every time we entered the casino...NICE TOUCH, check-in staff especially Sarah never once said no to our many requests, casino cleaning attendant was dancing and singing with us as we waited for the rest of our family by the front doors, to the check out staff telling me they look forward to me returning. As for the rooms, new decor theme was beautiful and the beds are truly heaven. We didn't get to check out the new Nikki Beach but from the looks of it, it can give some of the other hotels a run for their money. Will I return for another stay...ABSOLUTELY!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Grasshopper7
Reviews.Content: This hotel has recently been renovated so everything looks nice and new. Rooms are very spacious as is the bathroom. Good location right on the strip. Great value for money. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Celebration Vacation”
Reviews.Author: pjterella
Reviews.Content: Great service the minute we entered. Check-in was quick effiecient and made us feel very special even tho hotel was in sell out status. Hotel rooms, casino, restaurants, and pools very clean and staffed with the perfect employees. All making us feel very special. Will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “we didnt want to leave...!”
Reviews.Author: natural1966
Reviews.Content: Well all we can say is that we thought the trop was fab.we drove down from manitoba,canada and arrived at 1.30pm.we were early but they let us check in,bit of a wait at reception but check-in went smoothly.we got to our room and were so happy with it.the bed was just so comfortable,very clean room and bathroom.we would have liked a coffe maker in our room as im a morning coffee person but that was ok.we loved the gorgeous coconut smell everywhere,just positively tropical.compared to some of the other hotels on the strip..we made totally the right choice,wasnt crowded,quiet in our room at night(we were in the island tower).staff were friendly.the pool was a bit chilly but very welcome in 45 degrees of heat. cant wait till august this year to go back with our 2 teenagers in tow for 10 nights.Nicole was great handling our reservations this time and did her upmost to make it affordable for us.we are looking forward to the vip breeze check-in this time and reliving our lovely holiday from last year,with more time to enjoy our stay. NOT LONG NOW...... DONT BELIEVE ALL YOU READ ON NEGATIVE COMMENTS..try the tropicana for yourselves...:))))))))))))))))))) We are also looking to renew our wedding vows next august 2012 at the tropicana,couldnt think of a nicer place to celebrate our 25 years of marriage.

Reviews.Title: “Great time, can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: SadieFX
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana has really upgraded itself. The rooms are very nice. The pool is one of the best on the strip! It's very tropical felling with the trees and grass areas. The night club (Nikki Beach) was incredible! Daytime at the Nikki Beach club and night time inside and out. Everyone is so friendly! The nice thing was that the club is right next door to MGM Grand which opens up a ton of opportunities (Food, Gambling, entertainment) Between the 2, I didn't so much else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service hotel - excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: RStjean
Reviews.Content: very pleased with the professional service displayed by ALL the staff we encountered at the Tropicana. The room was excellent and great value. Also a good quiet location off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Love Love Loved our room!”
Reviews.Author: connieliz
Reviews.Content: Overall beautiful property no complaints other than a few more people working the check in counter would be nice and the pool area needed some attention to cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “It's a NEW Tropicana Hotel and we LOVE it!!!”
Reviews.Author: fixedsite
Reviews.Content: For startes the Tropicana is located in the best part of the strip. The hotel has been remodeled to a new Miami/Havana feel, lots of white everything. My wife and I had a great time at the new Club Nikki and Nikki Beach was a blast. The Paradise Suite was very nice, super clean and the view of the strip was great. Everyone working at the Tropicana was nice and had a smile (we didnt get that at the other hotels we stayed at in vegas) This was one of our best stays in Vegas and we are sure to return again soon. Also, If your a gangster movie fan like me (Casino, Godfather, Goodfellas) check out the Vegas Mob Experiance. I seen it with my wife and we both had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience.....Again!”
Reviews.Author: liskelo
Reviews.Content: During my visit to LV, I had to stay at the Trop on 2 different nights--so 2 different reservations. !st night was great....easy check-in, clerk quick and extremely curteous. Room was in Club Tower, which is much quieter than Paradise Tower (except for music thumping through walls during the day from the pool...not good for naps). Second reservation night my room was in the Paradise Tower....lots of noise from the Strip, but otherwise very nice. During both stays, guest service was top notch. Accommodations just right. Visited my cousin's connecting suites and they were extremely well appointed and every amenity you could think of. I think a coffee pot in the regular rooms would be a nice addition. The pool and what I could see of Nikki Beach was amazing....quite well done!

Reviews.Title: “Overall great stay and club!”
Reviews.Author: Amballer
Reviews.Content: Club Niki was really nice! Great place to go out and dance and drink! Rooms were great! Front desk was the best that I have seen. Overall a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great remodel, beautiful hotel... I'll definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: elkchaser1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tropicana for two different weeks in June 2011. I was a little leary of staying at a hotel that in the past was run down and old, but I was very impressed upon checking in. The new remodel is incredible, the restaurants are fantastic, and the pool area is enjoyable and perfect. Nikki Beach coming in was a great touch and really makes the place! Mob Experience is a must see and the Brad Garrett comedy club was a lot of fun on two separate occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay elsewhere next time!”
Reviews.Author: gardenlady1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Trop in the Paradise Tower, mini suite. First the good: It was nice having the coffee maker and fridge, bed was super comfy, AC worked great, housekeeping was wonderful and Gladys Knight was spectacular! Now the bad: pool was FREEZING, not enough "inexpensive" food choices, Cafe Nikki morning buffet was $18.00 and not worth it, view was blocked by the massive banner on the outside and finally (no fault of the Trop) there was a water main break...no hot water at times, and sometimes No water at all. (Manager Nicole was very kind and offered us the Glady Knight tickets), drinks at the pool were overpriced...$10.00 for a Cape Cod, $6.00 for a beer!! Walked to Hooters for dinner $9.99 prime rib! Also walked to La Salsa restaurant (near the M&M place) for their hot and fresh $3.95 breakfast special..2 eggs, bacon,ham or sausage, potatoes and two tortillas, small bloody mary for 99 cents!! Will probably stay somewhere else next time!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!! We sooooo want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Stuie_Nickolls
Reviews.Content: Before we even got there, had some great dealings with Nicole, the guest relations manager. So already we knew that customer service is highly rated! Checked in, all nice and smoothly, got to our room, awesome, and i mean awesome! Looking over Excal and NYNY, iphone dock units with a big telly (didnt watch it much!), but just the room in general was well nice, big comfy bed! :) Was in Paradise tower, so worked out a quick trip in lift, down to casino, walk out into Pool area, onto nice comfy cushioned sun lounger, right by the pool, PERFECT! This is a great place to stay, it looks new, has a nice feel to it, staff were friendly, although the casino liked taking my money! Won some back on our last night :) I cant understand why anyone would moan about this hotel, given there were 5 of us (3 seperate rooms), we all said how nice it was to stay here. 10 out 10 for everthing that we used as such, our next hotel we stayed in was nice, but felt a come-down after staying at the Trop :) We will be coming back, thats fact!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: WesterlyGale
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Tropicana and really enjoyed ourselves. The hotel is a lot brighter than any others we visited which make the place feel more welcoming and the staff are very friendly. The room was extremely clean and the maids always made sure that we had fresh linen and towels. The location is great for visiting other casinos/hotels and also for the airport. It was only $10 to the airport by taxi. We only ate at Cafe NIkki but the salads were fresh and good. The pool area was very busy during our stay however the pool staff actively help you find a lounger and help you move them to another location. On the down side the double glazing in the rooms facing the strip is not very effective and when the club is open and playing music we were woken up by the noise however this was not every night as it is only open on a weekend. All in all we had a great time at the Tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “All the Remodeling has brought back a Vegas Star”
Reviews.Author: DougS117
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out and everything in between, I was thoroughly impressed by the remodeled Tropicana Hotel Las Vegas. The staff was courteous, the property was clean and bright, Niki Beach was fun (and brand new the weekend we stayed). They have really done wonders with this old gem on the most exciting corner of the Las Vegas Strip. I stayed in the tower and the room was almost brand new; the windows had plantation shutters, the bathroom had double sinks and the beds were very comfortable pillowtops. The food at Niki Cafe was excellent as was the Italian restaurant. The pool was fun and not nearly as crowded as some of the other properties we have stayed at in the past. We went out at 2:00pm and were still able to find two beach chairs together (albeit far from the pools on the grass). The door staff was friendly and knew all the right places to go. We came back early in the afternoon to take a break and interrupted our maid. Rather than either disappear, or worse shoo us off, she finished the room while my daughter watched TV (she needed a break). Overall, I was exteremly happy with our visit to the Tropicana and will be back to the hotel next time we make our trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay at the Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: rainyday77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tropicana in June. The hotel was nice and the rooms were pleasant exactly like the website. The pool area was nice though not many people were in the pool as it was quite cool. The service at the Tropicana was average - not the amazing service that many people have described which was disappointing. We were also disappointed by the lack of restaurants in the hotel. We would stay here again if we got a great deal. However, we did enjoy the Mirage more because of it's amazing and warm pool and the location with regard to restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Our second visit, a bit disappointed wont be back”
Reviews.Author: fayexxx
Reviews.Content: We made our second visit to the Trop this month after initially visiting last september. Since then the Nikki beach club has opened which pulsates a thud of music right through the hotel, we were on the 17th floor and we could hear it very loudly with the windows open, due to this fact alone I would not return. We were put on the 17th floor in a room that smelt strongly of weed (we asked for a no smoking room too) but we were too tired after the 12 hour flight to complain. The club tower we were in this town is really far away from the entrance, this didnt bother us too much but i can imagine it would bother others. The 24 hour cafe in the hotel is really nice and does nice food. Standards arent as high as they were last year.

Reviews.Title: “The Tropicana is the hotel of my dreams!”
Reviews.Author: JMR8
Reviews.Content: In 'Vegas mid-June 2011 for the National Hockey League Awards on June 22. I spent my 4 overnights at The Tropicans, a favourite for the past 10 years.Having done a full renovation, the Tropicana is fully 5-Star to me! My room was king-bed, deluxe, perfectly-equipped, and way up on the 17th floor of the ParadiseTower. It felt like heaven! Perfectly maintained suite, classy bathroom, decoratively-lit bedroom and a huge high-def flat screen LG TV. Chambermaids were fun, friendly and extremely competent! Restaurants in The Tropicana have dramatically changed to move way up the scale. Nikki's is a 24/7 eatery with a delightful menu, super service and an omelette-making-chef [Dan] who should wear a gold star! Bacio is a brand-new classy Italian up-scale ristorante with a charming menu, delightful wine list, excellent staff, and a gorgeous, talented proprietor, Carla Pelllegrino. What a perfect combo that is, eh? The casino has been fully re-done and ranks up there with the best in Las Vegas. Gweat games, friendly dealers, lovely servers and fun security staff. And the shows are gtreaty, too. The Brad Garrett Comedy Club just scored top marks in the city! Believe it or not, I loved my stay. As Arnold used to say,|"I'll be back !" JR

Reviews.Title: “The worst of times”
Reviews.Author: youngbeautyny
Reviews.Content: For the price of a double queen room of $300.00 - it was not worth it. Room was equivalent to that of a Comfort Inn in any other town/city for the price of $100.00. Front desk personnel were unfriendly, never smiled, nor wish a pleasant stay. Upon check-out day the room was to be vacated at 11:00 a.m.- maid tried to open chained door asking if we were done with the room at 9:30 a.m - TOTALLY UNCALLED FOR. Front desk upon check out neither asked how the stay was nor did they smile and stated "have a good trip" TOTALLY SUBPAR CUSTOMER SERVICE - INCLUDING THE CASINO

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wild110
Reviews.Content: Hotel has just had a full refurb you could smell the new paint, rooms are big and the most comfy beds ever, only draw back was lack of tea/coffee machine and a fridge would have come in useful we had to keep going to the ice machine in the corridor outside our room to keep our drinks cool, The location is good (south end of the strip) but beware when its hot like it was when we went ( 110 some days) it can be very tiring walking around and the temp didn't drop much at night but it gives you a chance to see what the other hotels have to offer, The food was pretty good at the hotel and starbucks came in useful for early morning cuppa. I had a nasty fall on our last day, someone had left a mobility scooter that was somehow leaking water and I slipped and hurt my knee which has now resulted in a big bruise, the hotel security were very concerned and asked if I needed medical attention but seeing how there was no blood I declined, but please be aware that marble floors and water can be a dangerous combination, all in all Vegas and the Tropicana were fabulous and when my knees better I would love to go back. would certainly recommend both.

Reviews.Title: “Nice renovations, not the best service.”
Reviews.Author: lilhomie787
Reviews.Content: For a great price on the strip and without sacrificing quality, this is the place! This place has been renovated from top to bottom and everything is nice. The upside to this place is that it has a nice large pool, awesome rooms and a pretty cool angled shower. The swim up blackjack is cool too! My only complaints are that the pool was very cold and housekeeping never cleaned my room. I was only there for two nights but the club scene is nice and the casino is adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations - Cannot Wait to Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: blairs1
Reviews.Content: after seeing the renovations that were happening at the tropicana over the past year, i knew i had to book there to experience the new rooms. i did just that. booked a package and wasn't disappointed. i had talked to someone at Tropicana and was hooked up with a Mini-Suite with a partial view of the strip/airport. what a nice room. it was a little walk to the island tower but after staying at some other hotels, this walk wasn't that bad. the room was large, spacious and bright. i think the tile in the bathroom hadn't been re-done yet as it was a funky purple colour. bathroom was nice, oversized tub/shower which was nice. i can't stop praising this hotel. ordered room service the first night which was a little pricey, but well worth it after a day of travel. housekeeping was great - probably the first hotel experience where housekeeping was energetic and upbeat about seeing us, asking about our days were, etc. i'm not a pool person, so cannot comment on the pool, but it seemed to be fairly busy when i walked by! enjoyed the vibe so much that i just booked another trip to return later this year and cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Great Value, a Few Minor Issues”
Reviews.Author: tfast
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Tropicana. Our room was very nice and the bed super comfy. The staff we encountered were all friendly and helpful. We arrived around noon, were told we would be called when our room was ready and received a call a short time later. The Trop is on the south end of the strip, away from a lot of the crowds and activity, which we liked. It can be quite a trek to and from other casinos and shows, but there is a tram available for a small fee. We ended up walking most of the time, which got to be a bit much, but helped burn some of the calories we consumed on our vacation. We did have some trouble with the water working in our room one morning, but it was fixed fairly promptly. Also, one day our room did not get cleaned, and by the time we returned to our room that night, we were so exhuasted, we decided to forgo it. The next morning, I called when we left for the day and the housekeeping staff said they'd put us on the top of the list. When we returned in the early afternoon, the room had been cleaned, although the bathroom floor could have been done better. The only other negative part of our stay was the noise coming from the promotional videos being displayed on the exterior of the hotel. Our room was on that side and i found the music and flashing lights very disruptive while trying to sleep. I am a light sleeper, however, and the noise did not bother my husband at all. The work out room was fairly well equiped. One eliptical was broken and there are no stationary bikes. There is a good selection of free weights and machines, however, as well as two treadmills. It is in sort of an awkward spot in a pathyway to the pool. Also, no TV's, so bring your Ipod. The workout area could have been cleaner. The racks with the towels was absolutely filthy. But overall, it worked and was not too crowded. We usually had breakfast at the Starbucks on site, which seemed in line price-wise with other Starbucks in the area. Other than a cafeteria-style deli, the hotel restaurants, however, were out of our price range, so we dined elswhere. Overall, for the price, we were very satisfied with our stay. If you like to be in the middle of the action, however, you might be better off a bit farther north.

Reviews.Title: “Great service! Great pool! Great fun!!”
Reviews.Author: arrowberg
Reviews.Content: My friends, sisters and I stayed 4 days and 3 nights at the newly remodeled Tropicana this June and enjoyed ourselves immensely. We arrived way before check in so the lovely woman at registration gave us a key so we could use the pool and the bell hops kindly checked our bags. That was just the start of the smiles on the faces and helpful attitudes of all the Tropicana staff. We LOVED the pool area. It may be because word hasn't gotten out yet on how fabulous the pool is but it was so much more low key than the bigger hotel/casinos. No problem finding a chaise and a place to congregate- even with six of us! One day we rented a cabana and Stacey the pool manager was such a delight! Being in Vegas we were ready to be scammed but the prices were on the up and up! $100 in food and drink is all you have to pay to get a beautiful cabana for the entire day. Since this was such a good deal we just stayed put for 6 hours drinking pitcher after pitcher of Greyhounds and snacking. They upgraded us to a double since we were a larger group and they were available, at no extra cost. These are $200/a day in food and drink and we may as well selected a double from the start because we surpassed that in food and drink!! Easy to do when 6 people spend 6 hours luxuriating! We do love the bigger hotels as they are grander and fancier but for the money this is the best deal in Vegas as far as I have ever seen!!! Check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with New Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: Vegascane
Reviews.Content: Tropicana has been remodeled, upgraded and marketed extensively. As a result, and because of an outstanding rate I was able to secure, my wife and I booked a seven day stay. In the past when visiting this hotel I found it void of activity and generally a dead atmosphere. That no longer is the case. Their marketing seems to have been successful in bringing in a younger, livelier crowd while still retaining mature adults as well. The employees were very customer service oriented with a special tip of the hat to Kimberlee in VIP check in. The pool area was beautiful. The sports book has the latest state of the art tv screens. The room was great with soft, fluffy pillows on a very comfortable bed. Flat screen tv in the room. Ambhar Lounge situated off elevators very lively, good service, pleasant atmosphere although we were not thrilled with the bands they provided for entertainment. Las Vegas has some super local bands such as Front Page, Klique, Chaze, HNLV, which would have supplied a more entertaining sound for a more variety of guests. Cafe Nikki provided a wonderful outdoor dining experience during the evening hours. As with any hotel there were some problems. One evening no hot water for a period of time. Check-out morning no water at all. Computer down during check-out, however, just received credit card statement and all charges were correct. Check-in lines much too long and time consuming. And, of course, the deceptive resort fee. My only fear is they will now be raising their rates.

Reviews.Title: “Nice change”
Reviews.Author: mark3all
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Trop for 2 night in the main tower. Had a view of the strip which was nice. The very nice lady at the front desk was very professional and waived the resort fee for me. Was very pleased with the room. The bed was comfortable and the furnishings were all in nice condition. The negatives were the actual casino floor. Was playing blackjack on Thursday night and the place was packed. The music was blasting so loud that I couldn't even have a conversation with the gentleman seating next to me. We both mentioned it to the pitboss. I ended up leaving and went over to the MGM to play. I'm not sure if management even thinks it is a problem but when I'm gambling I don't want to have the back round music blasting. Other than that the Hotel is very nice. Will probably come back there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Tropicana has been redone - AND WE LOVE IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: Olive_Vegas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love Las Vegas - everything about it! We try to go 2-3 times a year, and our goal is to stay at every hotel in Vegas so we can say we did it. We usually move around a few times when we're there. We read so many great things about the all new and improved Trop that we had to stay there...and I'm glad we did! First of all, EVERYONE is helpful, friendly, pleasant...I was shocked. The bellhops and valets, Club Trop personnel, room attendants, front desk staff - EVERYONE greeted us with a smile and a "welcome to the Tropicana" attitude. The rooms are decent; kinda small, but decent - the fact that you're on the strip and the staff is so friendly makes up for the smaller rooms. The hotel has had a major facelift, and the pool area (which wasn't open when we were there) looks heavenly. Surprisingly, the rooms weren't outrageously expensive, and I'm glad we stayed there. In fact, when we go back again, we'll stay at the Trop for a few days. Gambling was good, there's some good places to eat (check out Club Nikki's) - but the service makes it fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Trop rocks-las vegas”
Reviews.Author: habulious
Reviews.Content: Tropicana was a blast..a special shout out to the check in agent Barbara...so nice even upgraded us as we arrived after a long flight..she gave us a ton of info. The pool was a bit crowded but always found a lounge chair...music was a bit loud but I guess they have to serve everyone..sign up for trop card Parking and casino very small but room was great did not eat at rest. but food options looked ok again thanks to Barbara who checked us in June14th

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: Mikfarr
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Tropicana, and I have to say that my experience definitely exceeded my expectations. The staff there was extremely helpful, professional and polite. Everyone staff member we came across was extremely accommodating! After my stay here it is going to be hard to stay anywhere else on my next trip to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Bright & breezy bargain”
Reviews.Author: bravelion
Reviews.Content: By now everyone knows the Tropicana has had a comprehensive makeover. And it's pretty much all good. Check-in was a breeze. The room was of a decent size and very easy on the eye. The bed was extremely comfy. The big flat-screen TV had a good selection of HD channels. The pool area was a great place to be. The whole place seems clean, bright, welcoming, and just really very pleasant. There were a few niggles. Dining options seem very limited at present, and room service can be shockingly expensive. I had some raucous neighbours so I might have appreciated thicker walls (but hell, this is Vegas, you don't come here to sleep). And the layout is bit strange - if you find yourself in a Club Tower room, be ready for a considerable walk. But I'm nitpicking. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Tropicana, and at the current bargain prices, it represents a fantastic deal. With great rooms, a nice vibe and decent location, I'd say it's the pick of the strip right now when it comes to value.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, massive suites, gorgeous pool and friendly service...will return”
Reviews.Author: tombstone81
Reviews.Content: Tried the newly-refurbished Tropicana after many glowing reviews on the Internet and was not disappointed. We got a Club Suite (MASSIVE!) for about half or less of what a similar sized room would be in one of the fancier hotels on the Strip. The Trop has one of the best pools in Vegas with gorgeous manicured grounds; a paradise oasis only steps from the Strip yet you'd never know you were in Vegas. Housekeeping was great and the room was always clean. Quite possibly the most comfortable mattress I've ever slept on, in Vegas or anywhere! Only downside to the whole stay was the $180-million upgrade was apparently mostly to this older hotel's facade and not to its internal workings. We had a breaker go out 3 times in 2 nights, no power to our entire bathroom area and required waiting for a maintenance man to come reset it for us. Also the plumbing seemed a bit weird (slow drain, gurgling) but everything ultimately drained and flushed okay. Trop management refunded (without being asked) my $30 resort fee when they heard of the electrical issues. Overall, a very pleasant stay at a hotel that feels much swankier but is very kind to the budget. (Oh, and there seemed to be lots of constant comp drink service from friendly waitresses in the casino too!!)

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better”
Reviews.Author: sdchad
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews, I went to the Tropicana with high expectations and every one of them was exceeded. The staff was FANTASTIC, the rooms (we stayed in two due to construction noise, staff more than corrected the situation) were clean, the casino was bright with friendly table attendants. The pool was the best I've been to in Las Vegas. All in all, the value for the price couldn't be beat. The only complaints, and they are very minor, are the lack of inexpensive food choices and the shutters (which give a great feel to the rooms) do not black out light.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: afg2001
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Las Vegas before and had done a lot of research and learned that this hotel was in a good location near the top of the Vegas Strip. Plus it didn't hurt that we got a great deal on the room through hotels.com for 50% off! The staff was nice and helpful but check in was 3pm. We got there around 11:30 am and didn't get in our room until 2:30 pm. We were able to leave our bags with the luggage handler and he gave us a ticket. We went for lunch and looked around a bit. We aren't big gamblers so we didn't do much of that. When they finally called us we went up to the deluxe tower and found that the room itself was all redone beautifully and very clean. The bathroom was all done too except for the tiles and a few in the corner of the shower had a bit of black. The air conditioning worked beautifully and the tv was a big flat screen. The bed was so comfy and the sheets were fresh and clean. Even the comforter because it seems that they wash that with the sheets unlike the old polyester cover hotels used to use. Parking is included in an outdoor parking garage which is located near the back and we had to drive through staff to access it so it seemed secure. The hotel is so close to MGM, New York New York & the Luxor. We were within approx. 10 minutes walking distance to Cesar's Palace, the Bellagio & Paris. We took the monorail to the end of the strip but I wish we hadn't. It's not so nice around there. The Sahara shut down and it seems that there were no tourists there. We did happen upon the Winns and it was very nice. We ended up going for a drink there and then we went into the Flamingo and it was nice too. We ended up at the Venetian indoor canals with the shops and we went into the Signature Galleries shop and I was interested in a piece and the lady actually put us in a room and shut the door! She was so pushy and desperate that I actually had to push past her and walk out!! Her name started with an F? She was a white lady in her 50's, I believe, with glasses, and thin. I will never go in that shop again! I went to the other place where Michael Jackson used to shop at and I was inquiring about the artist from the other gallery and the owner was so rude! He said he never heard of that artist and to go back to the other place lol I guess I will never buy from that place either. We went to see Penn & Teller at the Rio and it was a good show. I wanted to see Donny & Marie but my husband wanted to see Penn and Teller instead. Anyways all in all Vegas is a must see but I'm not sure if I would go back. If I do I would probably stay at the Trop again if I could get the same or better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Osceola31909
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Tropicana a few years ago but stopped after it had started looking a little run down. As a matter of fact, the last time we stayed there was the day it declared bankruptcy. We decided to go back when we heard about the recent renovations. Suffice it to say that we were very pleased. Our room was comfortable and we had a great view of the strip. We were also pleasantly surprised at the food. We ate the breakfast buffet at Cafe Nikki twice. Though it was a small buffet, it was very good. We also had an excellent meal at Bacio. I had the steak, which was cooked to perfection. Although the Casino was not as large as others, it had a good vibe. The Tropicana is not as fancy as other hotels, but it is a good value. And if you want more gambling or eating options, it is a short walk to the MGM or New York New York.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined my dream wedding vacation”
Reviews.Author: kevinbuckingbronco
Reviews.Content: Tropicana ruined my dream wedding vacation, Tropicanas tux shop could not get the tuxes right even after 3 trys. The tux shop consumed half of our vacation and in the end I had to get a tux elsewhere and they still charged us for the unusable tuxs. serveral of my family and friends were put in the wrong rooms, some of my guests had to change rooms 2, 3 and 4 times during a 1 week stay due to - being put in the wrong room and toxic paint fumes. The Tropicana was painting the windows of our rooms while we were in them filling the rooms with toxic paint fumes and making people sick. several rooms were not ready for check in, my aunt was checking in at 11:30pm and was told her room was not ready check in is supossed to be at 3:00pm and her room was not ready at 11:30? My mother had to be at the check in desk when every guest checked in because they messed up our reservations so badly this was not an enjoyable vacation for her. Before we left we wrote up our complaints and talked with a manager and was told that they would contact us. They have never contacted us, they do not respond to my e-mails. I would never stay there again and would only reccomend this place to my worst enemy. I am absolutly discuded with the Tropicana and there lack of customer care.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back for sure”
Reviews.Author: Hubbs2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days as we were celebrating our 4th anniversary. We had the best time ever. We had excellent service. We were upgraded to a mini-suite and we just loved it as they have shutters instead of curtains. The room was very spacious and super clean. Of all the casinos in the strip, Tropicana was bright and cheery. The pools are awesome and the staff very friendly and helpful. Tropicana will be the only hotel we will stay as it was very rewarding.

Reviews.Title: “Will Definitely Be Staying Here Next Time!”
Reviews.Author: NCbound2010
Reviews.Content: On our last trip to Las Vegas (May 2011), we stayed at New York, New York. We visited the Tropicana and were so impressed at the complete remodeling of the entire hotel. It looked like a brand new building! The Miami South Beach theme was great! As soon as we got there, we knew the hotel was different. We were met by your doorman, "T", who escorted us to your slot club and explained all about the renovations. He showed us Nikki Beach and Cafe Nikki, which we went back to for dinner that night. You can be sure on our next visit to Las Vegas, we will be staying at theTropicana!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Trop.”
Reviews.Author: dambram
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location. Stayed on business, but was right in the heart of Vegas for night life. The rooms were clean and designed beautifully. The new look and feel will keep me coming back for business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- First Time vistor to the Trop”
Reviews.Author: drdallas33
Reviews.Content: Booked our 15th year anniversary trip May 29-June 06, 2011 to the Trop because of the reviews and pictures on Trip Advisor, we contacted Nicole Marshall via E-mail advised her that we would be coming and the nature of our trip and she returned our e-mail promptly and gave us good news in return that we would be upgraded. We had no problem checking in, me and the wife arrived early so our room was not yet cleaned but the gentlemen in bag checks held our bags. There was only a half hour wait and then up to our suite in the Island tower on the 20th floor. When we open the door all I could think was thank you Ms. Marshall the room was huge, two big flat screens TV, coffee maker, a living room and the best view I have ever had in my ten stays in Las Vegas. Nikki beach was rocking with music which was no disturbance to me since I stay busy while in Vegas. I highly recommend staying at the Trop, I am trying to make it back in December 2011. Also there was a young lady with glasses who work as a cocktail waitess on the night shift who was great and always ready to bring a drink everytime she saw us, it a shame I can not remember here name.

Reviews.Title: “Money Well Spent”
Reviews.Author: markwcollins1
Reviews.Content: My wife, son (13), and I just returned from a long weekend at the Trop. I have been reading the reviews for about a month now and couldn't wait to see all the changes the place went through. All I can say is "WOW". The place has morphed from an old time Vegas stop to a bright, clean and very vibrant destinatiom. I can't say enough about the excellent customer service in just a few sentences. I realize that everyone has a bad day from time to time, but you would never know it at the Tropicana. Every single employee we came in contact with was pleasant, smiling and eager to assist. From the second I stepped up to the front counter, to the housekeepers, bartenders and everyone else we came in contact with, we were all made to feel like high rollers. All the talk about the ultra comfortable beds is true, it's like sleeping on a cloud. I've read some comments about the coconut/suntan lotion smell throughout the hotel, and it is very prevalent. I can see where this might annoy some people but none of us had a problem with it. The pool area is beautiful with plenty of lounges, attendants, towels and music to be found. If I had one complaint I would put it here.....but I can't think of one. If you are looking to stay at the south end of the strip (where things are slightly more laid back) and be treated like some type of royalty while getting a lot of bang for your buck, then look no further than the Tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “The rennovation is terrific and I will definately Return”
Reviews.Author: Dworkin1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Tropicana a number of times in the past year and have watched as the property as gone through a major renovation. Every visit brings with it the ability to use a newly renovated area of the Hotel. During my last stay the new Nikki Beach area was just opening and I had the chance to take it all in. The new entrance and parking are simple and hassle free and the staff is very accommodating. The rooms are a pleasure and transform you from a typical Vegas room to a tropical island feel. The theme is being carried through the entire property and i can't wait to see the next step in the process.. I

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: givans
Reviews.Content: The rooms, casino, pool and Club Niki are wonderful. The renovation of the property is truly beautiful. The designers really put a lot of thought into the interior and exterior design. I had dinner at Cabio and the food was fabulous. I highly recommend this property to everyone and anyone who is planning a visist to Las Vegas. The people are friendly, the food was delicious and the rooms are beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: homerjsi
Reviews.Content: Although we didn't actually stay at the hotel, I would like to take the time to recognize Jill (working at the Gladys Knight theater) for providing me with excellent service when I purchased tickets to the Recycled Percussion show the other day. She provided me with one of my best experiences in Las Vegas this trip. Her great attitude and cheerfulness while doing her job was a pleasure to see and left a lasting impression with me. Thanks Jill once again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at a great price but very slow service at night....”
Reviews.Author: Jen411
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tropicana during the remodeling process March 14-17, 2011. Check-in was a breeze and helpful staff regarding the area and bus service. The rooms were very clean and updated but depending on where you stay you might have a walk to your room. Our second night we were out and got a VM saying we had to move because the bathroom was leaking. It took awhile for someone to bring us our new keys and move us to our room. The keys didn't work and we had to call the front desk which sent up security and they didn't know what was going on. My friend couldn't stand the cigeratte smell once we got in the room and we were moved again which took along time. All in all probably a 2 hour ordeal in the middle of the night. We told the front desk which was aware of some of the problems and we got the resort fee back. I was a little disappointed but willing to give the hotel another chance once the remodeling process is done. I see that they do read the reviews so I hope they put more staff to deal with guest concerns at night.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: astrunka
Reviews.Content: I'm very impressed at how the Tropicana has redone their property. Although, I never saw it before they remodeled I love what they've done. You feel like you're staying in old Vegas or in Miami or Palm Springs. The atmosphere at the Tropicana is so much more relaxed than other hotel on the strip. My husband and I were able to check out both pools. The first day we hung out at the large pool. We lounged on the grass (something you can't do a most LV hotels) ordered lunch and drinks. My only complaint was that there weren't many waitresses/waiters to order from and we were starving. The food and drinks were great, though :) The second day we decided to check out Nikki Beach. After we figured out how the cabanas and stuff worked we were able to stash our stuff and hang out with everyone else in the pool. The specialty drinks at Nikki Beach are great and the staff there is really nice. We dined at 2 of the Tropicana's restaurants, as well as ordered room service. The first night, we ate at Nikki Beach Cafe, outside overlooking the pool. Our waitress was great and so was the food. The second night we ate at Biscayne. We weren't terribly hungry at the time, so we ended up just ordering an app and drinks in the bar(ish) area. The nuts on the table were AMAZING and so was our Charcuterie Plate. The wine selection at both Nikki Beach and Biscayne are really nice. Room service was really overpriced, but isn't room service usually? Overall, we really like Tropicana and are planning on returning again really soon!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay...staff was nice!”
Reviews.Author: Asgirl80
Reviews.Content: I rated this hotel as average. Yes, it is an average hotel by luxury standards. Don’t get me wrong at all the hotel is nice and I would stay again.. But as far a Vegas Glits and Glamour its lacking. Nikki beach is super overrated! The pool is the size of an in ground back yard residential pool. (The regular pool area is much better!!) Nothing special about Nikki beach. The hotel is clean our room was very clean. We arrived before check in and were allowed to check in right away without question. The reason I rate the hotel as avg. is well simply because it is. There's nothing extraordinary about it. The dining options are very limited. Most...no every day we left the hotel for dining at nearby hotels. Overall, it’s a nice hotel and I would stay again...side note... a lot of reviews on TA say the bathroom tiles are old and dirty and should have been change in the renovation. So, naturally I was checking ours and it was fine. Its not gross tile that you don't want to step on right out of the shower , if you even step on the floor. I don’t. Just FYI. (on the tiles) Also as far as location, it’s a good location. You have to walk no matter where you stay on the strip. We were able to get a cab anywhere less than 20bucks for 4ppl where ever we went.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for a first visit: especially if you're not sure about Las Vegas...”
Reviews.Author: ThatNameIsTaken
Reviews.Content: We were on our first visit to Las Vegas and stayed in a suite at the Tropicana for our first two nights, then at the end of our tour, had a king room. The suite was on the 12th floor of the Paradise Tower, and had a corner views from The Luxor all the way round to New York New York & MGM Grand. The living room was huge - TV’s in both living & bedroom, coffee maker, bottled water, fridge - looked better than the Tropicana’s website photos. Bathroom - spacious plenty of good quality towels, decent toiletries. Bed: huge and extremely comfortable. Wi-fi was fast & reliable. Our room was at the end of the corridor and very quiet. There was some street noise, obviously, but nothing from inside the hotel. The king room was also large - had TV but didn’t have the other ‘extras.’ This room was next to the lifts, so I was worried that it might be noisy, but although we could hear people coming & going next door there was no noise from the lifts themselves. We found the hotel very light and airy - it was a relief to get back to as our first couple of days were very hot! Can’t comment on the casinos as we were using Las Vegas as a base for touring, not as a destination in itself - it was reasonably easy to get into/out of out of Las Vegas from the Tropicana: also close by the airport, so no hassle on arriving/departing. Restaurant choices inside the hotel seemed limited, but it was no problem to find options close by - New York New York suited us best for food. I wasn’t able to make a booking via the website, so I emailed the hotel directly and ended up getting a very good deal - decent rate, no resort fees, free late check out for our second stay (all of which were confirmed at our first check-in). Unfortunately, on our return visit we were charged the resort fee, but I didn’t notice until we’d arrived home. I emailed and got it refunded reasonably quickly. We were staying just before the ‘Nikki Beach’ opened, and enjoyed the fact that the Tropicana seemed to be quieter/calmer than the other hotels we saw - not sure if that would be the case if your room was overlooking the pool...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Tropicana..My New Favourite Vegas Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: rachaelclement
Reviews.Content: This hotel really didn't disappoint, exactly as expected if not more. Rooms felt very clean and fresh, even the bathroom was lovely. The beds are AMAZING!! so so comfy! One tiny point that could prove annoying to some, we were in the Paradise tower which at night they run a projection on the whole side of the hotel and you do get flashes of light in the room as there are no curtains, they have shutters instead. This annoyed our friends but we didn't seem to notice it as much. Location is great with links to MGM and across to Excalibur, so made easy access to the strip. Pool is great! v.cold but in the 100 degree heat mid afternoon was quite welcome. Great music playing, starting off relaxing first thing in the morining and throughout the day increases in tempo and volume! some people may not like it but we were happy with the vibe around the pool. Didnt get to experience Nikki Beach but we could certainly hear it!! Sounds amazing. Overall we loved it, its a smaller hotel with a good feeling about it, easy to get around, not much walking involved to rooms, clean and fresh and a great pool. Missing it soooo much already!! Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel, great rooms, highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: anglia48
Reviews.Content: the tropicana is a wonderful hotel. the room we had was absolutley beautiful! we had a view overlooking mandalay bay and the airport. very spacious room, always cleaned well. the staff were all very friendly and helfpul. check in was a breeze. hotel is in a great spot very easy to get around to other casino's via bridges out the front. mgm grand and excalibur are across the road. thoroughlly enjoyed the stay here and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hoping for great but got average-ish”
Reviews.Author: booyasgurl
Reviews.Content: I decided to book a stay at the Trop after reading all the rave reviews about the Trops renovations. It was my boyfriends’ first trip to Vegas so needless to say we were very excited about going. Prior to making the reservation I had read in several reviews that the pool area and Club Nikki was not completed in the time initially expected so I called the hotel and was assured by our visit in the beginning of May that both would be done. So I booked a five-day stay. Upon arriving in Vegas the weather was perfect and I could not wait to get poolside. We got a ride from a friend to the hotel and right away the exterior impressed us. There was only a brief wait at the reception (which was a plus) and even though we were early they were able to get us a room right away. I had been told on the phone that we may be able to upgrade based on availability but when I asked the clerk was VERY unpleasant and told us that it would be an additional three hundred dollars. I asked what the difference in the footage was for the room we had booked and the upgraded room and was told that she had no idea and she made no effort to find out. She also assured me the view was of the mountains in the room we had and so I settled on the room we had initially booked. When we travelled the substantial distance to our room and opened the door I was so sad. The room was small the view was of plastic! Not sure what they were doing but they had plastic covering the windows. Eventually this was taken down and then we got to see the not so lovely parking lot and airport. The hotel was still under construction and although the pool was done Club Nikki was not and the construction was loudly going on right next to pool. The worst part however was the bathroom. The toilet was stained, the shower had been broken and hanging from the wall and my poor boyfriend could not stand and shower because the showerhead was to low down for his 5’11” self. He had to hunch over to get his head wet. There was no coffee maker or mini fridge so we had to trek down to the dinning area to get over priced Starbucks every day since coffee is mandatory for me to survive. On the plus side the bed was comfy, the room was magically cleaned whenever we got back no matter what time we left for the day and the casino was nicer then most of the other hotels. We also ate several meals there and found them to be decent. Biscayne is the steak house and the food was good but is going to have a tough time competing with the plethora of outstanding restaurants in the area especially since the service was pretentious and borderline rude. Would I stay at the Trop again? Maybe if I got a REALLY good deal I would give it one more try. Would I recommend it? Not sure. I would give the facts (including the very strong smell of fake coconuts being circulated through the air duct system 24/7) and let the person decide on their own. Overall I was disappointed because I was expecting and hoping for great and got average or slightly below.

Reviews.Title: “The New Tropicana is Awesome!"”
Reviews.Author: BACDallas
Reviews.Content: We went to the Tropicana and it is wonderful the renovation and all the wonderful updates are great! It is so beautiful with that beautiful South Florida feel very clean, crisp and relaxing! You feel as is you are at a tropical resort in the islands! The staff is wonderful anticipating all of your needs and desires. Food, Rooms, Casino, Showroom, beautiful pools! The show at the hotel is very first class....Gladys Knight,,,Amazing Venue and she outs on a great performance very high energy and Ms. Knight is as wonderful a performer as ever and her band is Amazing! Great show and very personable. The restaurants are wonderful! Food was great at all the restaurants from Cafe Nikki sitting outside alongside a beautiful waterfall to Bacio amazing Italian Food as well as Biscayne a great steak and seafood restaurant and then you can dance the night away at the Ambar Lounge amazing live misic! The restaurants have great specials and the food is amazing! The rooms are lovely, clean, crisp, great beds and all the comforts of any 5 star hotel & resort! Do not miss this amazing opportunity to relax, unwind and enjoy all that Las Vegas has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: Steviejk1690
Reviews.Content: Great location Rooms are spotless Great atmosphere Feels more like a holiday hotel rather than just shops and casino Overall 10 out of 10

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel/casino anywhere else, but average here!”
Reviews.Author: timfullen
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that the hotel, casino, and grounds are absolutely wonderful, but this place needs to be graded compared to the others on the strip. The rooms are completely renovated and have a tropical decor. The hotel and casino have the same general theme. The pool is a plus though, it is winding with several sets of steps. You can sit your lawn chair anywhere, this mean around the pool or under a palm tree if that suites you. The restaurants looked nice, but just couldn't make time for them. Lastly, the people at this place are nice, being from the South it is important to me that people are easy to talk to and keep their word. We had some issue, but to there credit were resolved quickly. Now to the negatives: The air conditioning in the room is fair at best. The food and drink also is crazy expensive as compared to other places nearby. Lastly, the casino is almost empty at times and the table minimums are very high. Must do's: If all you want to do is party and gamble DO NOT READ THIS. Rent a car and go see some of the state and national parks nearby. Some of the most awesome sights I have ever seen are The Valley of Fire, Grand Canyon, Lake Mead, Red Rock Canyon, and the Hoover Dam.

Reviews.Title: “Totally remodeled and beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: ambergibson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Las Vegas with friends and family for our wedding in May 2011 and stayed at the Tropicana. We had an awesome time! The hotel has been remodeled and the rooms were beautiful. It was a great location on the strip and very convenient. I would definitely recommend the Tropicana to anyone. Great rates and great rooms!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay at the New Tropicana! Best Pool In Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: anjali2109
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I have been to Las Vegas Several time over the past year. This trip was our second time to Tropicana in 3 months, The first time in March, the pool area was still under construction as was parts of the casino. Upon our return back home, we filled out a survey about our experience at the "New Tropicana," Based on our first experience, we went back this week to visit and were pleasantly surprised to learn the the VP of Tropicana had upgraded our room and provided some pretty nice perks..including tickets to The MOB Experience. My husband and I spent 5 days by the amazing Nikki Beach Pool. It has to be one of the most amazing pools in Vegas without a doubt. The Nikki Beach Club, is a day and Night club, next to the main pool was awesome too. In the evenings, we would relax in our suite which had all the comforts of home. We ate at Bacio on our last night which had an amazing Italian theme menu. The staff were amazing, Especially Anthony, who remembered me from my last visit!!! After dinner, we went to The MOB Experience located in the hotel. It was a fun interactive lookinto some of the Las Vegas History and connection to natorious Mobsters. We loved it!!! It was full of artifacts and historical pieces that belonged to Ben "Bugsy" Siegel, and the likes. I would highly recommend a stay at Tropicanna. I can't imagine staying anywhere else again!!

Reviews.Title: “Place will look great once everything done”
Reviews.Author: lisawiscMilwaukee
Reviews.Content: Great stay at the tropicana from may12-14. We were a little early for the opening of club Nikki and nikki beach club but still had a gr8 time. The tropicana pool.was great...nice music playing, lots of ppl (get there early to get a chair,) nice bar in center. I liked the white shutters thru out the casino. It made it seem a lot less dark. It's a great location and very convenient to the mgm grand. Wished there were a few more restaurants on premises, but it seemed like a lot of construction was still takin place. We got the room for about $54 over a weekend, so overall a great value . Can't wait to see the rest of the changes!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...just a few problems...”
Reviews.Author: kgagnon
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to stay at the Trop this trip to Vegas - judging by the reviews here, it's now the place to stay in Vegas. Well, upon arriving, I was really disappointed. We arrived at check-in at 3:15 (check-in is 3:00). The front desk person, though pleasant, tells me that our room is not available - I say, I thought check-in was 3:00. She said, oh, it is. But I guess the guest in your room hasn't checked out yet. Okay, so when can we get in our room? She says, "Hard to say, why don't you check back around 4:30". 4:30?? No information on what to do with our bags in the meantime, no apology, no explanation except that she told me they were "sold-out". I walked away looking dejected enough that some other lady called to me and said, 'you look upset, can I help you?" I was relieved that someone was going to give me some information. She told me to leave the bags at the bell hop's until our room was ready..then she launched into a sales pitch about Polo Towers, wanting to give me free show tickets to go hang out there for a 2 hour presentation. Nice. No Thanks. The front desk person also said that she'd call us if the room was ready. No call. Decided to check back at 4:00 to see if it was ready - it was. Interesting that she knew I was upset about waiting but still didn't even call when it was ready. The good stuff: We had an awesome room - it was clean, well appointed (except it lacks a coffee maker), great view, quiet and close to the casino and the pool. The only issue was we didn't have a Do Not Disturb hanger in our room and housekeeping gives one swift knock with about a 1 second wait until they just walk on in - had a few close calls! Pool was fun. Lots of seating. Pool is freezing!! But, when it's 100 degrees, a cold pool is nice. Drink service was pretty non-existent, but that's alright -the pool bar is very centrally located. Fitness center (stated as a $9.99 value) is fine. It get's the job done, but I'm not sure it should be touted. 3 treadmills to service the entire hotel? Overall - good stay. I'm not sure we'd stay again, because we have some other favorites in Vegas, but we were relaxed and comfortable our entire stay AFTER we arrived to our room.

Reviews.Title: “4th trip to Vegas - Best hotel so far!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianBajan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Tropicana for a week in June 2011. We hadn't stayed at this hotel before it was renovated, but after reading some older reviews and seeing the place now - it definitely has come a long way! Everything seemed brand new, from the pool, to the comfy lounge chairs, to the plush beds and the huge flat screen tv, we were more than pleased. We checked in on a Wednesday afternoon and it was a breeze. No line ups and super friendly staff. Since it was our anniversary and we were staying there for an entire week, management was nice enough to waive the hotel fee and offer us a free mini fridge for our room. That was just an added bonus! The location is super convenient being right next door to MGM where you can catch the monorail to any part of the strip. Also, there are convenient bus stops right outside the hotel if you're adventurous enough to take the bus around town. Cabs are also reasonable if you're visiting another hotel along the strip. Cafe Nikki was excellent - I recommend the Fantasy sushi roll - I couldn't get enough of it! My husband had the Nikki Cuban sandwich which he thought was just okay. The restaurant patio overlooking the gardens is beautiful, and they have a light mist coming from the above to keep you cool on those hot summer days. We were saving the Bacio italian restaurant for our anniversary dinner, but sadly it's closed on Mondays. We'll definitely try it out next time though. They also have a great gelato shop right on the way to the pool, perfect after a long day in the sun. The housekeeping staff were very good and we always returned to a spotless room. The only thing we didn't enjoy was the loud club music at the pool. There are two sections to the pool, one side for Nikki Beach Club, and the other is the regular pool. I'd suggest keeping the club music for Nikki Beach side and offering a more relaxing atmosphere for the general pool. (Don't get me wrong, I'm in my mid-twenties and I actually liked most of the music they played, I just wish I had a choice of a quiet pool area to doze off in the shade). Overall we had a great experience and highly recommended staying at the Tropicana! Other must see's in Vegas: The lions (and baby cubs) at MGM hotel (free), the dolphins, white tigers and lions at the Mirage, Penn & Teller at the Rio and Celine Dion at Ceasars!

Reviews.Title: “What a difference a year makes!”
Reviews.Author: dcisme_11
Reviews.Content: I spend a lot of my year traveling from one Hotel to the next for my profession. The changes that have been made to the Tropicana are "Fantastic". The rooms are newly remodeled and are very guest friendly. A bright and cheerful atmosphere to wake up in, no matter what time of the day or night it is. The Sports book is 21st century technology, and is a must to see. The personnel has old Vegas mentality,PATRON SERVICE. Nikki Beach is absolutely beautiful and a must see. When in Vegas,which is about 20 time a year, Tropicana is the only place I stay. The Baccio Restaurant also has Great food, service excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money!!”
Reviews.Author: kelbel316
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 6 nights at the Tropicana and I have to say it was wonderful! It was our first trip to Vegas and the Tropicana was a good home base. The staff was so helpful everywhere we went whether it was checking in, the doorman (Jake was a delight!), the bartender, or the wait staff at Cafe Nikki. The first night we received an upgrade to a spa suite which was fabulous! Although for the rest of our stay we were in our orginally booked room in the Paradise Tower. I should note that the spa suite was located on the top floor in the Island Tower and for those who think or read on here that is a long walk from the entrance...it's not. Maybe if you had trouble getting around it might be then I would recommend a room in the Paradise Tower. The walk to the Island Tower is nothing though compared to all the walking you do in Vegas. Not a big deal. Our room was clean and comfortable. The remodel really looks great! The bedding was simply amazing! The pillows and sheets are so comfortable...it was just what we needed after long days (and nights) in Vegas. The bathroom was spacious and clean. There was lots of counterspace which was nice as I like to take over the bathroom as my boyfriend puts it. The walls are a bit on the thin side as we could hear music from the pool area (our room was on the 10th floor) but that wasn't really a big deal. I heard no noise from the airport whatsoever. We never did give room service a shot but we did eat one night at Cafe Nikki and the food was delicious! Maybe a bit on the pricey side for what you get but it was good nonetheless. We often went other places to eat during our stay. We did visit the pool once and it was very relaxing! Perhaps that is because we went to the crowded family-oriented pool at Excalibur with friends the day before (not our scene). The water was a bit cold I thought but there were loungers available so no complaints. Bring your wallet though if you want to have some drinks poolside-you will need it. We also didn't gamble too much in the casino so I can't say much about that. It looks a little on the small side but very bright and airy. It also smelled great compared to several other places we went. All in all I would stay at the Tropicana again on future trips to Vegas!
