Stay here before the rates go up as it really is a great value for what you get. It is a bit south on the strip but with taxis, buses, and monorails available for far travel it isn't a big deal. It was kind of nice to be away from the big crowds towards the middle part of the strip at night.

Reviews.Title: “almost don't want to share how great this hotel was”
Reviews.Author: hulamoongirl
Reviews.Content: My sister Sandy and I went to Las Vegas last fall ... we booked at the Tropicana and stayed ina 'Best In Class' room ... my advice to anyone going to Las Vegas for a vacation is to go for at least 10 days if possible .... we stayed 11 and enjoyed every minute ... we took the Grand Canyon tour and also saw Barry Manilow and Phantom Of The Opera, the ... both great shows !!! ... we enjoyed shopping and took City buses out to Sunset Galleria etc. .... we also stayed at Loews at Lake Las Vegas for a short stay during the Rose Regatta Paddlefest ... another unbelievably beautiful place ... our hotel room at the Tropicana had an incredible view of the four corners ... the staff at this hotel were extremely courteous, friendly and helpful ... what more could we ask for ... we look forward to returning in the fall ... Happy Trails and Travels

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas- Dream City”
Reviews.Author: Vishal79mehta
Reviews.Content: Best Part about Tropicana is its location.All other good hotels are located within walking distance of tropicana. So best part is that you dont have to walk much on the strip.Its a decent hotel, average ambiance but awsome location. Casino is good, rooms are clean. Its a value for money hotel. Their show was average as compared to Ballagio's "O". Resturants were fine but there are better resturants in other nearby hotels. So nice place to stay if you dont want to spend much on staying and want to be connected to other luxurious hotels.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: abjdre
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Trop in June 2011 for 3 nights. It was our 1st time in Vegas and it was great!!! Check-In: Very fast! Once we got to the hotel (took a cab from the airport for about $13) we walked right up. Front Desk was very nice. Our room was on the 2nd floor but she got us a room on the 19th floor instead in the Paradise Tower. Room was big, airy and clean. Overlooked the Excalibur, Luxor and Mandalay Bay. Staffat the hotel were very friendly, brought us toiletries and even a bottle opener when my husband asked for one. They gave us great tips on where to buy discounted show tix, got a GREAT deal on David Copperfield tix from a place near M&M World. Would def stay here again! On the strip but still had a quiet resort feel to it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: 2muchfun4us
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 rooms in the paradise tower for 3 nights. The rooms were renovated and huge. We requested coffee service after which they delivered Keurig coffee pots to the room but we had trouble getting coffee service restocked. All in all good value for the money and fairly good location on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not overly flash but excellent pool”
Reviews.Author: Alan222
Reviews.Content: Great location as at the MGM end of the strip. Massive rooms that are common with Vegas and recently refurbished. The downstairs can seem a bit dated in parts but there is an excellent pool area outside, it is one of the less flashy hotels but very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “From the moment we entered the newly renovated Tropicana Hotel we knew we had chosen the right place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: prsandbar
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas has never been known for its’ “gay friendly” atmosphere, so when my partner and I decided to drive there from Palm Springs to celebrate our 5th anniversary we did our research. We chose the Tropicana in response to the exceptional reviews we read on the web. From the moment we entered the newly renovated Tropicana Hotel we knew we had chosen the right place to stay. Upon check-in, the front desk clerk, Evie, informed us that unfortunately our requested room type was not immediately available. However her demeanor and willingness to suggest alternatives made us feel welcome and defused a possibly uncomfortable situation. Without provocation, she elicited the assistance of the Hotel Manager, Thomas Martinez and the eventual resolution far exceeded our expectations. As a matter of fact it seems as if the management has inspired all their employees to embody an element of service from a past era; understated, attentive and friendly without being gratuitous. Customer service is not the only impressive feature of this destination. Contrasting the usual glitz and overstated glamour of the Las Vegas Strip, the Tropicana has been transformed to embody a clean, relaxed, understated style, the likes of South Beach and the tropics. From the hint of coconut when you walk through the doors to the cascading waterfalls and whitewashed towers, no element has been overlooked. The rooms defy any visitor to feel as if they are staying in a hotel. Natural wood tones, wicker and bamboo are contrasted by crisp white linens and panama shutters and complimented with accents of the hotel’s signature orange-red. Oh…did I mention the pool area? Foliage and fresh flowers surround the lagoon style pool and the padded lounge chairs are plentiful (we never had to hunt for one, even during the weekend). The crowd is as diverse, eclectic and fun as the poolside music and the bartenders mix a cocktail that will ensure you are able to relax and allow your cares to dissipate with the beat. All in all it was a great anniversary week, thanks in no small part to open and accepting environment created by Manager, Thomas Martinez and the entire staff of the Tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “We won't be back.”
Reviews.Author: JSpindler
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana although newly remodeled still has a lot to learn about customer service. Cafe Nikki, a restaurant inside left a lot to be desired. Slow service, inattentive staff and managers. Too bad...we won't return.

Reviews.Title: “Better than ever!!”
Reviews.Author: TheSopranos
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Tropicana in three years. The remodel and updated look and feel are fantastic! It still has the relaxed, get away from it all, tropical appeal that we love. But now there is more of a hip, cool atmosphere. We loved the variety of guests from all over the world, a real mixture of young and old, all races and ethnicities! The pool area is better than ever and we enjoyed it every day. June is the best time to go before the temperatures get too hot. We were able to enjoy great entertainment right in the hotel and casino. Recycled Percussion with lots of audience participation was a real hoot! The Mob Experience was a total blast! The exhibits and especially the actors, both real and virtual kept us completely off-guard all the way through. It was mind blowingly and even hauntingly realistic. If I were a supersticious man, I would suggest that I felt the presence of Meyer Lansky in those exhibits. It was both strange and scarey. Bravo to everyone involved in this magnificent endeavor. It was more than worth the money. And the promotion was great too! We also were honored to spend a night with Gladys Knight. Her voice is as strong and soulful as ever. She made us feel a part of her family and took us on a sentimental journey that we will never forget! After seeing the shows, we enjoyed dining in the new restaurants located in the Tropicana including Cafe Nikki, The Marketplace and our favorite-Bacio's. Bacio's is simply our favorite Italian restaurant in the world! We ate there multiple times. The food is exquisite, the ambience superb, and the celebrity chef, Carla Pellegrino is charming, delicious and a delight to be around! It's a great dining experience and we look forward to our next trip to the Tropicana, and of course Bacio's! And we wish both the hotel and this wonderful restaurant the greatest success possible!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: dagmara56
Reviews.Content: Most casinos are like a dungeon, not the Trop. Light, airy, open, roomy, truly tropical feel. Room was in the Tower and was gorgeous and quiet. We stayed here from Wed - Fri and enjoyed all three nights. Only down side is where to eat. Nikkis is a bit pricy, there is a deli, avoid it like the plague. We waited nearly an hour for two hot dogs priced around $8 each (really??!). People had ordered pizza but oops... even though I could hear the guy tell the cashier about a dozen times, no more pizza dough, she kept taking orders. Nor let us forget, we paid for soft drinks, but... soft drink fountain was OUT of syrup for the entire hour we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Suites”
Reviews.Author: reviews1phxaz
Reviews.Content: I stayed in one of the new suites for a few days. It was awesome! By far the best view I have ever had in Vegas. It looked right down the strip. The suite had a living room and bedroom with one bathroom. EVERYTHING is new, everything. It was very large and had a lot of different places to sit. I have nothing to complain about and can say this was the nicest room I have ever stayed in. We had seen the suites a couple years ago before the hotel was remodeled and they were gross! The tropicana is awesome now.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: BlondieNYC
Reviews.Content: Check in was nice & quick they waived the resort fees all we had to do was ask I requested a Fridge for the room so nice I got it at no extra charge. Hotel smelled so good. I liked the fact it was a smaller hotel but just right. Hotel room was nice & renovated bed was comfy The pool was great felt like I was in the carribean not in Vegas we stayed in the tower right by the pool which was perfect took the elevator straight down to the pool every morning. They had a nice inexpensive cafe one of the cheapest on the strip( we went over to Aria paid $15 just for a hamburger by itself). All in All a great stay will definatly be back my boyfriend gambles alot on our last day they offered us a comp dinner when we told them we were leaving they comp us for a free stay next time

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Choice, enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: TheWarg
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights in a renovated room in the Club tower on 16th floor. We wanted a good clean budget spot and the Tropicana delivered. The staff at this hotel were very friendly. I like the smaller casino and the bright and airy feel here. We had a strip view room, but the airport side rooms had a cool view too, and are probably quieter. - enjoyed the pool, had great service from the Pool manager Stacy. Reserved a cabana for 3 days and a lounge spot on the little island for 2. It was nice to have a spot reserved and all ready for us when we got there. The cabana was $100 in drink/ food credit during the week, however it is not really a cabana but more of a pergola with some sheer curtains at the corners. - food menu at the pool seemed to change - first couple of days it was Cafe Nikki food that was very good, but then they started using a Club Nikki menu that was limited and very expensive ($34 for hummus and pita!) - enjoyed the room. very clean and a lovely view of the pool and the MGM corner of the strip. Large and comfortable for 3 of us. - overall a good stay. Would do again if on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “The Trop is back!”
Reviews.Author: hoel
Reviews.Content: It is so great to see this Vegas landmark be brought back to life. Kudos to the new ownership for tastefully giving the hotel an amazing renovation while retaining much of the Tropicana's original charm. We got a great deal on a Paradise Tower room facing the Strip. Incredibly quiet. The room was spacious-- and the bed provided one of the best night's sleep I've had in a hotel. The vibe at the pool has totally changed-- much more energy and a younger crowd. Overall, one of the best deals you'll find in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good times...”
Reviews.Author: BradandReese
Reviews.Content: We (3 ladies celebrating a milestone birthday) spent 3 nights 4 days at the Tropicana, checking in Monday, June 6 at 5:30 p.m. Before our visit, I emailed Nicole Marshall and requested that we had a room with two queens and a great view. Additionally, when we checked in I did the famous "$20 sandwich" trick, and it earned us a great room in the island tower on the 17th floor and a “free” refrigerator for our stay. The room was extremely clean, new and fresh. The tile in the bathroom should be re-grouted, but the vanity and sink are new, and we were happy with our accommodations. We LOVED the view of the strip and the pools. The TV is a large new flat-panel, and the in-room safe was deep enough to accommodate at laptop. We had dinner at Biscayne on our first night and did the Prix Fixe meal with wine pairings for $39.99. The first course was a vidalia onion with spicy ketchup, and we all agreed, it was sort of a joke. It was half an onion ring, and while it was tasty, it was a bit of stretch to deem it the first course even if it was supposed to be an appetizer. The rest of the courses were fabulous. We all enjoyed the wonderful room service and we heard great things from fellow visitors about Cafe Nikki. The casino is bright and clean and the coconut smell, by our accounts, was subtle. Every single staff member we encountered from the dealers, valet, room service, front desk, phone operators, you name it, were friendly and helpful. As much as we enjoyed visiting the Mandaly Bay, we found the staff to be rude and unhelpful with the exception of the wonderful waitpeople at MIX. Our experience there made us appreciate the Tropicana staff even more. The pool area was great, super clean with plenty of chairs, towels and wait staff. We enjoyed our hours at the pool, especially the people watching. The music was a bit grating, but I don't dig on Rihanna, Pitbull etc. We enjoyed our stay and would more than likely return. We chose the Tropicana because of it's history--it's 54 years old--and because of the recent renovation. However, it is clear that the Trop is aiming to attract a younger crowd. The club Nikki nightclub opened while we were there, and some staff encouraged us to check it out, so we did. In our 40's, we don't feel ancient, what with 40 being the new 20 and all, but it was clear to us the clientele was no older than 24 and frankly we felt unwelcome. On our last day, we called for a bell boy and that's when we met the incredible Edward (Eddie). Out of all the friendly staff members we met, Eddie was truly the gem that stood out. Eddie has been with the Tropicana the longest out of all their employees, but you would never know it, the way he was handling our baggage with ease. He told us stories about the Trops history from the Folies Bergere, to the famous people who have stayed there. We encouraged him to tell us more, but he had work to do. We could have listened to him all day. Eddie should be cherished and valued as the wonderful employee he is. I embrace change, and the Tropicana's remodel is a major step in the right direction. My hope is that while they aim for a more youthful market, they also respect the Trops history and the fact that there is huge demographic of people who are well over 25 and would like to stay in a historic property, have a great time in the clubs, and enjoy the historical perspective some of the employees offer.

Reviews.Title: “After a glitch with check in the hotel was great.”
Reviews.Author: discodollydiva
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over New Year's in the new rooms they had remodeled. The rooms are quiet, smoke free, ultra comfortable beds, new and clean. We loved the rooms. The casino is small but the MGM grand is across the street so for a base it's a great place to stay. We ate in their new steak restaurant and had an amazing meal. The prime rib was HUGE! Well worth the prices. However I would not recomend eating at their italian restaurant. The food was expensive and flavorless.

Reviews.Title: “It just keeps getting better”
Reviews.Author: juanitaboles
Reviews.Content: Returning to the Tropicana after six months I found even more wonderful changes. The Tropicana is a very friendly, clean, and well lit place to stay on the strip. The new decor is beautiful. Newly added are the eating places where you can grab a bite to eat in or go (the burgers are great) and the gift/snack shop near the entrance. Upon arriving early, I played the machines in the casino for awhile. I looked down and noticed my watch was missing. I thought I would never see it again. Wrong. One of the Tropicana employees found it on the floor and turned it in to security. He said this is what we always do. My favorite hotel in my favorite city; right on the strip close to everything, To go further north on the strip or to Fremont St., the bus is just outside. When you're tired, there's something special about watching the desert sunset from your room.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: dixiechick-TA
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here based on the reviews. What is nice is that it is just enough away from the central part of the strip to not be too crazy, packed, noisy, but close enough to still walk and enjoy all that the strip has to offer. The elevator for our room was also right inside the main door. You didn't have to walk a mile through a casino just to get to your room, like most of the other hotels. The beds were very comfortable and we both slept well. We arrived at the hotel at 1:00 am and there were no non smoking rooms left so they gave us a suite for the night and switched us the very next morning, which was very nice and appreciated at that time of the morning. We did not eat in any of the restaurants at the hotel, so can't comment on that, and we didn''t attend any of the shows at the hotel either. Even though my daugher is only 21 she also was glad to get to our hotel at night after battling the crowded sidewalks center strip. It was a breath of fresh air.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value - recently reno'd”
Reviews.Author: d_p_richards
Reviews.Content: We booked the Tropicana on Expedia and got a room for $35 plus the obligatory resort fee of $10. Free parking, free wifi, good fitness centre, nicely updated rooms. Had a good view of the strip, no coffee maker in room, but Starbucks and lots of restos in the hotel. Good pool area as well with good tunes! Good value for the money here - good location on Strip and really close to airport as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: topgunn_99
Reviews.Content: We booked the newly renovated Tropicana based on the very positive reviews from Tripadvisor. I can certainly tell you that the Trop did not let us down. The rooms were modern, with Kohler fixtures in the bathroom, VERY comfortable beds, and rooms that didnt have that normal "hotel" smell. From our first encounter with Terry at the front desk to our help with baggage from Jake as we left, the Trop has certainly placed customer service at a premium. I have to admit, we immediately went to the new pool, and had concerns. Because the Nikki Beach was having an industry day, the cacaphony of sounds from the techno beats of Nikki to the music from the regular pool was deafening and irritating...the initial stay at the pool was unpleasant. However, later in the week when Nikki was closed during the day, the regular pool was great. However, on Thursday, the music was WAYYYY too loud, and kept a number of people away. I was told that this is something they are working on. I have a feeling the pool is still a work in progress. The room was quiet (thank goodness Terry put us AWAY from the Nikki Beach side!) and we got GREAT sleep when necessary. We did not try Biscayne or the Italian restaurant because they were a bit pricey. The first floor restaurants were a bit pricey but normal for the strip. By far, the all star team member was Maria from housekeeping (for the Club Tower). She as professional, welcoming, and a VERY hard worker....the Trop (and Las Vegas) needs more great people like these in their hotels...kudos for Maria!!! The Trop casino was unlike others on the Strip....it was open, airy and well lit. If you like old school, dark, dingy and smoky...you wont like the Trop casino. Special props to Ed, Wally and Todd in the Poker room. The Trop has just redesigned their poker room; its small, but WAYYY nice....hopefully business will improve. If you are a poker player, you need to check out the Trop poker room. Most importantly, we felt safe at the Trop. Security personnel were visible, but not obtrusive. My only concern is wide open access for non-guest access to the pool (other hotels restrict access). We did venture mid-strip on evening, and DID NOT return...the volume and class of people, were...lets say less than desirable...we will continue to stay south or off-strip for future trips. The only other issue we had was an encounter with a less than caring female bell captain on the last day of our trip. She could have cared less about customers...this was VERY quickly taken care of as Jake and Nick saw what was happening and intervened. As a side note, I left a golf hat in my room hidden in a room lamp (yeah I know...stupid!). Josh from security was helpful the next day and went the extra mile trying to locate it. Unfortunately, other security staff could have cared less, as I made other inquiries the day after....I have given up the hat as a lost cause. All in all, a GREAT value (wont say what we got the room for ;) ). Customer service is great...the Trop is worth a try if you want to stay on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect budget hotel for Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: angel103
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be very clean, light and airy inside. Our city view room in the Paradise Tower had a great view of the strip - MGM and New York New York. Our room was big and the beds were so comfortable I wanted to bring one home! The location is at the southern end of the strip but it is only a 10 minute walk to the Paris hotel and centre strip. The pool is lovely with lots of sun loungers and cafe Nikki was great for breakfast, if a little pricey - you can get much cheaper elsewhere. We checked out lots of other hotels during our stay and only Caesars, the Bellagio and Mandalay Bay would beat the Tropicana in our opinion. We would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great value!”
Reviews.Author: tagrin
Reviews.Content: We were throughly impressed with the hotel and the helpful staff. The rooms were newly remodeled and were quite beautiful. This classic hotel has done a fabulous job in their remodel and really brought the hotel up to the standard one would expect in a resort. The casino was small, but clean, new and well ventilated. Don't miss out on the pool area. We felt that the location was ideal with easy access to other strip hotels via sky walks and the Duece bus stop located directly in front of the property. I would certainly book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised and Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Buttajess
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel and flight because of great vacation package deal. I hadn't been to Vegas since before marriage and child, so about 5 years and didn't know what to expect. we live in Sonoma County, CA and because of the extensive rain wanted to go somewhere sunny and dry with lots of activities. O foucrse we were unsure of bringing my 10 month old daughter due to all the smoking, but was assured that only in passing casino floor would there be some smoke....they cover the small with a good scent so as not to be overwhelming as well. Lots of ohter kids and families in Vegas! Pros: -Hotel is very clean and maid service is awesome on time and thorough -Hotel four acre pool area is amazing, refreshing and resort style, we ordered food from our chairs while tanning and drinks -Order room service for breakfast, we raved about the service they brought to room on table and set everything us in our room, very friendly and on time, piping hot! Very friendly hotel staff, very responsive to any needs -Let us check in three hours earlier for no fee and check out late -Press O and operator says "hello, last name" -convienent store inside hotel and chepaer but good food court (small) -Niki cafe is amazing for brunch, lunch and dinner.....Good! Ahi tuna amazing -Room is so nice huge LG TV, bed is very comfortable and huge -my daugter loved room tub, huge like a mini hot tub! Cons: -Drinks are 11 dollars mostly, so we had to purchase top shelf tequila for 40 dollars and mix our own drinks and take down with us so as not to run a 60 dolar drink tab for about four drink...not a big deal -Although Bath tub was huge and awesome, some mold on tile...complained and they were right on it to change our room, but we didn't want to since we uppact so they brought us some extra towels and spa stuff, very sweet! -A little far from some of the bigger hotels I wanted to visit, but would not be walking distance for....

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money - Great Feel”
Reviews.Author: TravellingWonderer
Reviews.Content: Tropicana is ten times better then the old version and the rooms are clean and cheaper then some of the four star hotels on the strip and was very impressed. Forget all the negative reviews you are hearing on this hotel, it is value for money - staff are very friendly, the pool party at Nikki Beach rocks big time and you are in the centre of the action in easy walking distance of MGM, New York New York and Excalibur. The only minus points is that if you are looking to go to sleep at the weekend, do not get a room looking on to Nikki Nightclub because the MC sounded like he was in our room but due to excess alcohol, we still slept through even with a man on a megaphone!!! In addition, the pool is a little on the cold, heated pool next time people but that was due to the weather not being the greatest at the time, I'm sure it works fine when in desert heat in July/August. The remodelling on the hotel really is exceptional although the buffet still needs to be worked upon as the selection was limited for Vegas but not wasted on Europeans who are used to a smaller selection as per what we would normally expect. Good Work Tropicana Management.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: jamclea
Reviews.Content: just spent 10 days at Trop and found it great value.We were in a mini suite well away from pool,which was our choice,nice and quiet and very clean.Staff were very helpful some bigger hotels,Encore in particular should take note.Down side are the eating places which are too pricey for what they are and food not great but thats about it.pool excellent but music far too loud!!!! not everyone is a rapper and deaf so Trop take note or risk loosing customers 40 plus.would i go back?only if they can guarantee the music is turned down.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Trop!”
Reviews.Author: ozpix
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel months ago while it was still undergoing renovations & as such booked a corner suite at a very cheap price. The Location is great as you are on the strip & there are walkway bridges connecting to the MGM, Excalibur & New York hotels, The centre of the strip would be no more than a 15 min walk away. There is also a bus stop outside the hotel connecting to Fashion outlets, Fremont st, etc. This was our first time to vegas & we really appreciated our stay at the Trop. Everything looked fresh & new & it was nice to see a bright looking casino in contrast to the darker ones you find elsewhere along the stip. Our room was by far the largest we have ever stayed in of all our travels. Our corner suite on level 15 had a huge living area with amazing views of the hotels nearby & the strip below us. The seperate bedroom was also huge with a nice comfy king sized bed & also a large spacious bathroom. The pool area was great & had a nice feel & the little food court with pizzas & starbucks, etc, was very handy for a quick inexpensive snack. Enjoyed our stay & cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Bozzer73
Reviews.Content: We decided at the last minute to go to Las Vegas at Christmas, and having checked out the reviews for the Tropicana on TripAdvisor we decided to give it a go. We asked for a king size bed but were told on check in that there were only queens available until the evening - so we took a queen. Best decision we took!!! I had read lots of reviews saying that rooms were a long way from reception but we ended up with a room right by the lift that took you straight from reception. The room had a fantastic view of the Strip toward Excalibur and Luxor - which only got better at night when all the lights went on. The room was great, really clean and modern, super comfy bed and huge TV. The bathroom was lovely and spacious too. We got a great deal for flight and hotel through expedia and will certainly be going again. We are poker players and the casino is not the greatest, too few tables, but that didn't worry us as we were so close to all the others and it was quite nice to go back to our hotel for a bit of peace and quiet. This was our second trip to Vegas and we are hooked - it's great for poker, shopping and just for marvelling at the ridiculous opulence of the architecture and decoration - you just can't beat it!! We walk everywhere rather than take taxis because that is the best way to not miss a thing- it makes for a tiring day but really satisfying - you cover miles without realising it. Thanks Tropicana for providing a great base for our great holiday - we will be back soon hopefully!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: shonil
Reviews.Content: I always check Trip advisor before making any reservations and found good reviews of the Tropicana. I was glad that I stayed here for the 4 nights I was in Vegas. The room was clean and the beds were very comfortable. The rooms were also spacious. It is in a good location. I ate in the restaurant for breakfast one morning and was pleased with the food. My friends say I am a food snob because I am picky about what I eat. The food that was on the buffet for breakfast was good. I usually don't like buffets because of the quality of the food but this was delicious and fresh. The MGM is right across the street and has some less expensive restaurants in it like McDonalds. For the price, the Tropicana is an excellent place to stay. The only problem that I saw was that there was a chip in the bathtub and some of the tile on the floor was also chipped in the room I stayed in. They do charge a resort fee that was of no benefit to me because I didn't need wifi and didn't have a chance to print out my boarding pass. It is on the strip so if you are looking for a reasonable place to stay on the strip, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “nice enough for the price”
Reviews.Author: chris293
Reviews.Content: The price and location were good and it was nice not to get lost in the hotel/ casino. The pool was nice, but the music was annoy, too much untz untz. The restaurants weren't impressive, but you have plenty of other options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “The Web Site Doesn't Do The Hotel Justice”
Reviews.Author: Melindal50
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful. The pool area was awesome. This was my very first trip to Vegas, I choose the best hotel. It was more than I expected. It was my 50th birthday and my girlfriend informed the hotel of this and I received a fruit baseket which included a bottle of wine. Since I don't drink I was given soda and told to keep the wine anyway. The location was great we walk everywhere. Ladies who like to party can get free waist bands throughout the different hotels for free entrance to all the clubs (also you cannot sit down in the clubs unless you are VIP). By the way don't purchase coffee at Starbuck you can get free coffee at the casino, I didn't know that until I spent money I didn't need to. Bring flat shoes you are goining to need them

Reviews.Title: “Recycled Percussion at the Tropicana is a MUST SEE SHOW”
Reviews.Author: Sewaldro
Reviews.Content: Recycled Percussion at the Tropicana is a MUST SEE SHOW! I was in Las Vegas for a conference and my family came with me. We saw Recycled Percussion June 3, 2011 and it was very entertaining! My mother has no musical background and she loved it, too! We saw other shows while in Vegas (Cirque Love and the Lion King) and I will rank Recycled Percussion right there at the top with those shows!

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana - Loved it....espeically the pool area”
Reviews.Author: lisawoz
Reviews.Content: Tropicana was a great hotel stay for my husband and I. The rooms were clean and comfortable, friendly staff, and a GREAT pool area. The pool area had plenty of shade, sun, music, and a relaxing atmosphere. Our next trip we will definitely be staying at the Tropicana. Besides you can't beat the price compared to other strip hotels.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST kept secret in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Daisycake3
Reviews.Content: If you've been hesitating to book a stay here, why? It's clean, it's fun, it's pretty, it's laid back. I've stayed at a lot of the fancy Vegas hotels - yawn. The Tropicana felt fresh. Very resort-y like old school Vegas. The room are darling...very Havana, Cuba. Comfy, functional, great, big TVs. And the beds are like sleeping on a cloud. You need to recover from something or many things? This is the bed to do in. And QUIET. Nikki Cafe has great, interesting but not weird food and really good service. Good coffee! Very important! Sit on the balcony ifnit's not too hot. The pool was awesome. Lots of chairs, good service, fun locale. Again, very resorty. Very diverse in all aspects, you'll feel comfortable. Stay away from the Nikki Beach side if you're not into loud pulsating music. I didn't go in but I peeked and it looked like a lot of fun if you're young, fit and into drinking beer at 10am. : ) The views, especially at night, of New York, New York and the strip are amazing. And it's a short walk to both NY NY and MGM where there are a whole bunch more, shops, shows, resaurants. Very convenient but just a *tad* set away making it really feel more exclusive. My only suggestions to the Tropicana are these: 1. Back it down a notch with the coconut-pineapple air freshener in the hallways. 2. MORE Tropicana-themed souvenirs! Like the Flamingo and their signature pink you should use that gorgeous coral and Tropicana brand everything. I'd buy it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay for a decent price on the strip”
Reviews.Author: crysstuch
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here after reading reviews about how nicely it had been remodeled. We were happy with it especially for the price. A few things, the remodel was nice but it seemed like they only partially did the bathroom. The rooms were a very nice size as was the bathroom. We did wish it had a fridge. Lower "resort fee" was VERY nice. My one main complaint would be that our reservations said it was buy one drink, get on 50% off. When we asked the woman at check in said that was no longer offered but they did have happy hour at Nikki Beach, went there said they no longer offered that either. Pool was great and lifeguards were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Niki Cafe has great food”
Reviews.Author: Jill10
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a five day stay in Vegas. Decided to try out the new restauraunt, Niki Cafe inside the Tropicana Hotel. You won't be disappointed. The food was great. My favorite was the pan seared salmon. Try the sweet potato fries as a side dish. If you arrive after 10am for breakfast, 2pm for lunch, & 8pm for dinner, you don't have to wait on line, although this may change in a few weeks when word of mouth gets out about this great new restaurant. Until approximately 10pm you could dine outside & enjoy a view of palm trees, flowers & a grotto where new husbands & wives like to get photographed. There's a limited dessert selection, but management may expand the offerings in the future. Hurry & try out this new restaurant before it become too popular. Didn't sample anything from the wine list, but by looking at the faces of others, everybody enjoyed their selections. You won't be disappointed with this new restaurant. Jill10

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing getaway!”
Reviews.Author: pucktraveler
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had a great time at the Tropicana. The property is renovated, upgraded and beautiful. We were offered the choice of two rooms - a tower closer to the casino or to the pool and we took the tower closer to the pool, which was PERFECT. Great view of the Strip, at the end of the floor. And the rooms were almost sound-proof! You couldn't even hear the planes coming into the airport nearby! Went and saw Gladys Knight in concert. Worth the general admission ticket. Make sure to get in line early for good seats to see the show. Cafe Nikki has a really good happy hour - $5-6 apps and drink specials. Try the mojito! Or the bloody mary. This resort is strong on customer service! The employees were VERY friendly, helpful and courteous, from a housekeeper who gave us extra towels to someone who walked us out to the pool when we were lost and a chef at Pizza Pellegrino, who offered us a full menu even though we wanted pizza. A couple hiccups: We checked in to the Tropicana at 2:30 p.m. and our room wasn't ready, so we had lunch at Cafe Nikki. My only concern was that we were at the restaurant during a certain window of time, when only a buffet was offered and we could not order off the menu. We were told that there would be a phone call letting us know when our room was ready (after 3:30 p.m.) and we never received a call, so we had to wait in line again for our room - which was ready. Never mind that we had to haul our luggage while we were waiting because there was no attendant at the luggage storage area. (Not fun) Also, our television did not work the first day of our stay. We called the front desk who told us it was a property-wide problem because of the television/satellite/cable provider and they offered to comp us on-demand movies. But, if you think about it, who goes to Vegas to watch television? The first day of our stay we went to the pool and it was filled with teenagers and college students, who were loud, running around the pool and making a mess, strewing empty beer cans, bottles and cups across the pool. Yet the next four days at the pool were nothing like that - completely relaxed, quiet afternoon at the pool with lots of sun and lots of adults. That made the stay much better.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: joncooper79
Reviews.Content: Stayed as part of a stag party in May 2011. The whole place has recently been refurbished and looks amazing. (I will write about the mob experience separately, but that was brilliant too). Unlike most of the hotels and Casino in vegas this has a light, airy feeling. All of the other casino in Vegas start to blend into one, but this one really stands out as a bit different. Having said that, people seem to prefer the dark, old fashioned casinos as they were busier. What I really like about this Hotel is that you can relax there. I thing teh Venitian, Bellagio, Aria would all feel a bit formal for me. I really liked that you could just relax, in your normal clothes and have a good time without having to stay in a slum. The pool is great (nice being served drinks by Beautiful women!) Location is fantastic. Staff as always in Vegas were very helpful and polite. I would have no problem advising anyone to stay at this hotel. - On a side note, Nikki Beach looks good. I will be going back to vegas same time next year and will stay at the Trop (assuming room rates don't go through the roof)- and I will be hitting Nikki Beach while there fo a boozy day by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: annabelle2904
Reviews.Content: Had not expected a lot from this hotel but it delivered, bigtime. Lovely quiet room even although we overlooked the Strip and the view of the Luxor and the Excalibur was fantastic. The room was so clean it would satisfy even the most fastidious and the bathroom was lovely. Flat screen tv was heaps of channels and the bed was certainly one of the most comfortable that we have slept when holidaying in the USA. The hotel is convenient to everything. I have heard that it has been refurbished and if so it has been done very well. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolBob1
Reviews.Content: this hotel is fantastic --brand new- the rooms are brillant ,if you can get a strip view room. This hotel has quality. The only downside was the pool area - noisey music- no quiet area .Maybe this is something that the managment can have a look at.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat the Tropicana - Great Room at Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Silly4Traveling
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Tropicana May 19 - 22. The deal was great and we booked for proximity to what we wanted to do. Our room in the club tower was on what was called the 1st floor but actually about 3 stories up. Had a spectacular view of MGM & NYNY straight across from the statue of liberty & empire state building. Everything in the room was nice and new & the bed was especially comfortable. Nice big tub/shower combo, big flat screen TV. Absolutely the only negative was the throbbing music that started around 11 AM and went on until 2AM from Club Nikki, but it wasn't a big deal for us. We got on the schedule and slept when the music was off so it worked out fine for us. Take the pedestrian bridge across the street to Excalibur and you can hop on the free tram to Luxor and Mandalay Bay. Easy walking everywhere, we found Tropicana a perfect home base for exploring Vegas. We will stay there again when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: pinkbikerider
Reviews.Content: I was riding solo & booked 2 nights at the Tropicana. Recently renovated this Hotel reminded me of the classic Las Vegas. Easy access to park,check in without walking miles through a casino! My room was beautiful & the bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in! All services were top-notch & the pool area felt like a glistening beach retreat. The new 'food court' had great food to grab on the way back to the room, while casual & more upscale options were also excellent. I had read a few grumblings about the slots being hard to win, but I certainly had great luck! drink service was very good while playing also. The Tropicana has 2 towers, I stayed in the original front tower with a view of the strip. I didn't use Valet service as I was on a motorcycle, but they were very helpful & I had a covered spot right at the side entry.

Reviews.Title: “Neat, clean, small and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: the5neumanns
Reviews.Content: The newly redone rooms have nice furniture, are impeccably clean and have all the amenities you would expect. Not luxury but very nice and far more than adequate. The pool area is nicely maintained but is a little kid heavy. It also gets crowded and chairs can be tough to come by. The downside? The fit and finish in the bathrooms. Poorly done around the edges. Some tiles are cracked and I assume they were not replaced when the remodel was done. Also, my pet peeve-I am 6 feet tall and the shower head is level with my neck. Measure from the floor of the TUB and allow for the fact that the neck to the shower head sloped DOWN! It should be a foot taller at least. The crowd varies from families, olds, couples and drunken 20 somethings. Pleasant staff and very clean public areas. Also that your resort fee covers "free internet". If there is a fee it is not, by definition, free.

Reviews.Title: “nice renovation”
Reviews.Author: SDblondie
Reviews.Content: nice rooms, i like the bed and pillows, bathroom is nice too. flatscreen tv, safe, ironing board, hairdryer. we couldn't figure out of they have room service or not. there was no menu in the room. we stayed in the club tower on the 17th floor with a view of the pool and the strip. warning: if you stay in this tower facing the strip you will hear club nikki/nikki beach all day and night. the pool party starts about 11am and ends about 6pm, then the nightclub starts up about 10pm until 2am. not sure why it's so loud. the windows block a lot of sound but you can definitely still hear it. the hotel is nice inside and the walkway to the club tower is non-smoking. the pool is very nice and has swim up blackjack and a couple spas. i would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Staycation Ever!”
Reviews.Author: bcrooked
Reviews.Content: We had heard that the Tropicana was all new so we decided to give it a try for a staycation for my husband's birthday. I booked us into a suite for one night. We ended up on the 20th floor, a suite with a view of the pool, the mountains (perfect for sunset) and the fabulous Las Vegas strip! The room was beautiful! Exceptionally clean and fantastic! We loved the pool too! Cannot wait to go back! The Caribbean feel of the rooms and the pool was just what we needed for a couple of days away from work! Love love love it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: annapink
Reviews.Content: First I need to admit I've there in 2008 but forgot to review. Probably many things changed, but that time it was a very nice experience although the hotel was pretty old. I loved that though. Liked the wall of fame (Elvis' fan) ecc. The hotel was pretty nice, the only problem we reported to houskeeper staff, was - I found someone else's male pants between the wall and bed. In overall I remembered the hotel as nice, interesting and funny. Would like to come back there to see what changed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!! Will absolutely go back!”
Reviews.Author: Lmaryn83
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the valets immediately assisted us and sent us in the direction of the check in desk. The reception desk employee was very willing to add another persin onto the room and give us an extra key. Every other employee we encountered while staying there was very helpful and polite. We had never stayed here before and were not sure what the rooms would be like, however they were well beyond our expectation! After staying in other hotels and seeing those rooms, this one was by far one of the best. The beds were amazing and we loved the big bathroom with enough room for two of us to get ready. We loved the location of the hotel and felt that we were in the perfect spot on the strip to go out. We were close to everything we wanted to see! We will undoubtedly go back and stay at this hotel next time we go to Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “Great renovation”
Reviews.Author: DSM305
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this completely renovated hotel. Everything is clean, bright, and modern, and the rooms are comfortable and tastefully appointed. A late-night check in was a breeze (took 3 minutes), everything was easy to find, and we rarely waited more than a minute or two for an elevator. The pool is fantastic, with plenty of lounge chairs even for a crowd. On the downside, there aren't many restaurant and bar options at the hotel, but with the MGM Grand literally a 2-minute walk out the front door, that was hardly a concern. We've stayed at several similarly priced hotels in Vegas, and the new Tropicana easily rises to the top of that list.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Remodel”
Reviews.Author: JenJen85254
Reviews.Content: We walked through this hotel while they were doing the remodel and weren't sure about staying there. When I had to organize a hotel in Vegas for 9 couples I found an excellent deal for The Tropicana. We arrived before checkin but they got us into a room right away. The room was gorgeous! And the bed was unbelieveably comfortable. Only issue was our toilet wouldn't flush and kept running -we called housekeeping and someone was there within 20 minutes to fix it. In the morning we dined at one of their buffet brunch places -not a huge selection but everything was delicious and fresh. Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “WOW..... Had a Blast at The Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: CinCin333
Reviews.Content: Arriving at this hotel was the highlight of our trip. I was expecting average service, however I was surprised when ALL the staff was indeed friendly and courteous. It was 3 females on this trip and The Tropicana made us feel safe in Las Vegas. Our room was bright and colorful and not your typical dark and boring hotel stay. lol! We also had a blast at The Nikki Beach Party........ I am definitely coming back to Las Vegas, and staying at The Tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Anna_Torres
Reviews.Content: I travel alot for work and this is by far the best hotel I have stayed at. This trip was actually over Memorial weekend just for fun, I have stayed at other hotels on the strip before and will never again stay anywhere besides here. The Front Desk employees remember your name and are very passionate about what they do..I ususally travel with room spray but didn't need it here, the rooms were absolutely spotless and smelled so flreshly clean, excellent housekeeping here. At the end of the stay the bell desk guys held our lougage for us until it was time for us to go to the airport, when we returned to get it they quickly helped us and also flagged a taxi so we didn't have to wait.....phenomenal customer service...this is truely how a company earns lifetime loyalty!!!!

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: hkh12
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week after finding an amazing rate. We ended up a corner room in the Island tower and had awesome views of the Excalibur. It is quite a walk to the Island tower though. It felt like it took us 20 minutes to get back there. But the walk will take you over the pools (it was being worked on at the time and was empty, but I'm sure it'll look neat when it's done). The room was nice and the bad was fantastic. You can definately tell the rooms were recently renovated. I could tell the bathroom didn't get as much of the renovation like the guestroom. The toilet had water stains, and the shower/tub still had the holes where the faucet previously was. But the vanity area was pretty nice. The location was good. It wasn't that far from the airport, so the taxi ride was a little cheaper. It's connected to a pedestrian bridge that connects to Excalibur and MGM Grand. I was also able to extend my check-out time. All I did was ask the front desk and she extended for a couple of hours free of charge. We only really had 1 issue. At the end of the second or third day, our room key didn't work. There was no light at all on the lock, like our key wasn't registering, or it was deactivated or something. It was unfortunate because we had to walk all the way back to the front desk, from the Island tower, which felt like forever. But we were able to get a new key and no more problems after that.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on what you are looking for...”
Reviews.Author: aqp
Reviews.Content: When we go to Vegas, we are looking for three primary things: no kids, hot people / good pool scene, and good casino table action. The Tropicana did not deliver any of these so we will not stay there again, but if you have different requirements, there’s a lot to recommend about the Trop. The Trop did a nice job with their remodel. This is not a luxury property, but it is good value for the price. Everything looks up-to-date and fresh, and the smoke factor is really low here. Employees here are some of the most helpful and friendly in Vegas, esp. the valets and bellmen. Property looks really clean. Elevators were fast and available. Location is good with quick access to MGM, Luxor and Mandalay Bay. The $11/day resort fee actually gives you decent value compared with other Vegas hotels, including in-room internet access. On the downside, if you are in the Island Tower, it’s a l-o-n-g walk to your room. Parking is bad, and too far a walk from the front door. Check-in took way too long, but check out was quick. The Trop doesn’t have enough gaming tables, and the minimums were $15+ even on Sunday night. The casino itself is mostly slots. The pool is clean and nicely landscaped, but otherwise average. The musical selections blared over the speakers were awful. The pool is large and there were plenty of chairs, plus they have grass areas that keep the heat down when it’s over 100 degrees. They need more waitresses at the pool – we never had anyone come by for a drink order. ROOMS: Pros- The rooms match the pictures on the website - big for average Vegas room, nice décor, plenty of drawer/closet space, in-room safe, nice towels, bed was good, bathroom is big (bath amenities are very basic), flat screen TVs, lighting is good. Everything looked very clean. Cons – Walls are thin, no black-out curtains, only plantation slide louvers, no view due to anti-glare window coatings, no mini-bar or fridge. The Trop has been advertising in L.A. like crazy, trying to attract the hip and beautiful crowd with Nikki Beach. So far it’s not working. Like most Vegas properties, Nikki Beach is the leased pool area that requires a cover charge to use. The Trop doesn’t have any packages that include entry to Nikki Beach so there is no advantage in getting in. Nikki Beach was a disappointment. Unless you rent a daybed or cabana, there is no seating at all. The pool looks like it would fit in a standard backyard. The Trop isn’t the pretty people party crowd, but it also doesn’t smell of vomit and no one is passed out in the hallways. Happy Travels!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Robt14
Reviews.Content: I was in Vegas for a conference at the MGM Grand but had stayed at Tropicana before and loved it. It was an easy decision to stay at Tropicana and walk over to the conference. There was a slight mix up in our bed choice .The front desk resolved the problem, however it took bell service 30 minutes to get keys to us. Not a big deal I responded to a survey on the Tropicana I received and explained the small problem I had. To my disbelief, within 2 days. Nicole Marshall (guest service manager) responded with an apology and an offer to help book our next stay. She was able to get a fantastic deal worked out for next month. Thanks Nicole

Reviews.Title: “The new renovations were amazing!”
Reviews.Author: honiib
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay at the Tropicana for our anniverasry, the renovations were amazing! We stayed in a suite that had an incredible view of the strip and overlooked the NEW club Nikki Beach. If you are looking for a comfortable, hip place to be THIS is where you wanna go! Quite a step up from many we have stayed at!

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana Joins The Ranks of Night Club-Oriented Hot Spots”
Reviews.Author: ptyronesmith
Reviews.Content: Memorial Day Weekend marked the grand opening of Nikki Beach / Club Nikki. We arrived excited for the grand opening as well as a fun and relaxing weekend. We were not disappointed. We had been at the Tropicana property just six weeks earlier and we were amazed that they had been able to complete the construction so quickly. Six weeks earlier they were just breaking ground on the pool and club area. VIP check-in was a breeze. The front desk staff is courteous and accommodating without any wait at all. Our room was on a ground level floor as requested, on the opposite side from Nikki Beach in the far tower. It's a bit of a hike through the casino and over the pool areas. But once we got into our room we were able to relax in our very comfortable room. Any opening night for a night club creates opportunities for missteps and production snafus. Nikki Beach has a reputation for attention to detail and high production value. We were not disappointed. Checking into the invitation only grand opening event only took a few minutes (the staff was cleverly using software on an iPad) and we were greeted with smiles and cold beverages immediately. The indoor space is low on dance area and high on VIP and lounge space. The outdoor pool area cascaded down towards the pool with levels of bedded areas and lounge chairs. There was plenty of passed food, free cold beverages and interesting ambient entertainment. The music was a more relaxed lounge-house sound and seemed appropriate for this more social invite-only event. Celebrities included Halle Barry, Gladys Knight, and a few other unexpected names that I can't recall at this time. At approximately 10pm the club and opened up to the general public and DJ Robbie Rivera took over the decks, who played a much more energetic and heavy house set, perfect for getting the energy pupped up in the club. The dance floor was busy for most of the rest of the evening. The Nikki Beach / Club Nikki was well staffed for the evening and all of the staff seemed to be well trained and on purpose the entire evening. They were friendly, attentive and kept the space from getting to crowded by keeping the flow of the club moving. Later that night (early in the morning), we returned to our room and ordered room service. The food was delivered within 45 minutes (as stated) and was hot and delicious. Quite a surprise for room service food. We also ordered room service again, the following morning, just before checked out and had the same experience. The food was warm, savory and delivered on time. I highly recommend the Cuban Breakfast Wrap - best room service entrée ever! Check out was quick, efficient and pleasant. We had our receipt in our hands, our luggage stored for the day (until our departure) and were on our way for a final day of shopping and sight-seeing. In closing it's important to point out that, as someone who grew up in Las Vegas, I was very surprised to see so many young persons on the Tropicana property at almost any time during the day. Much different from the Tropicana's previous reputation for catering to a much older clientele. I assume this is all part of their upgrade and partnership with Nikki Beach. The younger crowd brings fun, playful and beautiful to the property.

Reviews.Title: “All around wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: roeman218
Reviews.Content: After a rough flight to Vegas from Canada there is nothing more that I wanted than to get checked in quickly and efficiently so that i could relax and I got just that! Valet was at my rental car within seconds of me pulling in and Ricky couldnt have been more friendly. When I got to the front desk the girl checking me in was so nice and I couldn't even tell that it was only her fourth day on the job because she seemed so at ease with what she was doing and she even engaged me and my girlfriend about her own trip to Victoria BC which is where we had flown in from that morning! Normally in the past when I was checking into a hotel on the strip (and I have stayed at almost every property on the strip) people get annoyed when someone new asks for help. Ladonna graciously came over and assisted the trainee with finding me and my girlfriend a room with a view which I was surprised one was available considering it was the friday before memorial day weekend so I imagine they were pretty booked up but I guess we got lucky! We didn't get to spend much time in the room soaking up the view only because we enjoyed the pool and cafe nikki pretty frequently during our stay. Our waitress at cafe nikki mentioned that millions of $ went into your renovations and it definitely shows! The hotel looks fantastic and I hope the spa is open when I come back because I had to go across the street to MGM for a massage. Overall our experience at the tropicana couldn't have been better. Everyone was so friendly and helpful and more strip properties should follow your example! Please make sure that Ricky, Ladonna, and the trainee gets recognized! They all have a bright future with you and I hope to see all of them again when I return at the end of July!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: Suzee_K
Reviews.Content: This was my second holiday to to LV and the first for my partner. We decided to stay at the Tropicana after reading about the renovation and some of the good reviews. This was a special trip for my partner as he was celebrating his 50th birthday and he has always wanted to spend it in the USA. We were not disappointed with our choice. When we drove up to the hotel I was impressed with the foyer as it was bright and welcoming, just what you wanted after a long flight. Checking in was a little bit slow but we were offered water while waiting. As we were there for a special occasion I had previously emailed Nicole Marshall, Guest Experience Manager, who very kindly upgraded our room to a City View room in the Paradise Tower at the front of the hotel which we were delighted with. The room looked just like the website photos, very clean, nicely decorated with cheerful colours. The room was spacious and the bed was very comfortable. The majority of the staff were friendly and helpful. We would recommend the Mob Experience, it was good fun. For us the location was fantastic and although near the airport, we were not bothered by plane noise. It was handy for the monorail, buses, Dennys and most things were in easy reach. We had a good experience at this hotel and thought it good value for money. When we return to Las Vegas, this is the hotel we will be heading back to.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful place!”
Reviews.Author: Stitt1061
Reviews.Content: I had not heard much about the Tropicana but they recently did a major upgrade. My husband and I stayed there and it was beautiful. The hotel was bright, clean, the room was much bigger than I expected. The hotel staff from the maids to the dealers were all very friendly. Also, there was no one trying to sell you anything in the casino. Some of the other hotels will try to sell you offers for free shows if you go see a new hotel, but there was none of that at the Tropicana. I had a wonderful time here and would recommend it to anyone. The pool area is lush and tropical to go along with the feel of the hotel and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Much, much better at the Tropicana!!”
Reviews.Author: DEB42
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family 3 yrs ago and the hotel was really run down. This time I was here alone and I have to say the make-over is a huge improvement. The casino has had a face lift and looks cleaner and brighter and the restaurants are lovely. I had breakfast at cafe Nikki and it was really nice, a little expensive, but nice and the staff were all lovely. The rooms are a definate improvement and the bed was like sleeping on a cloud!! I had a nice big television and had free wifi included in the $9.99 resort fee, which i made good use of. The pool area was lovely before, but it is even nicer now, with bridges and waterfalls and beautiful flowers. They still havnt completed everything yet out there, as there is an extension to the nikki bar and apparently a beach area, so it will be really nice when it is all finished. All in all, it was a lovely 3 night stay that cost me just £134, bargain!!!!....the addition of a starbucks was a plus too.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: rmrm2310
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Las Vegas for vacation since the nineties. We have stayed at several of the hotels on the strip, and even one downtown. I can truly say that this was the best stay ever. From our host Ron Chalk, to Service Manager Tamara, to Vincente at the Restaurant, we could not have been happier. Our room was always promptly cleaned, with all the ammenities replaced, not like some hotels where they assume you can use what you had yesterday. The bar tenders were attentive and we never felt neglected.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Tammy17
Reviews.Content: Great check in with a smile from a lovely lady. Stayed in the paradise tower, large comfy bed, very clean sheets. Lovely new mod cons, iPod dock, tv. Could have done with a coffee make though. Room cleaned daily with no problems. Pool lovely, music a little too loud for me, but hey I'm not 21 anymore, but could read my book, plenty of sun loungers, but no parasols? Over all a great stay but will stay further up the strip next time for location reasons only.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: mumof2WalesUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights just before Nikki beach opened, but it looked like it was going to be impressive. We were upgraded at reception by using the $20 tip, we were placed in club tower floor 15, views of the pool and part of the strip,and part of the airport. Not a lot of noise at all, just from emergency sirens.Our room was large, spacious, spotless, very large bed which was extremely comfortable. The room was about a good 7-10 minute walk from reception, but not a problem, when you walk miles everywhere anyway. We didnt eat at the hotel resturants but you can get 50% off your meals if you buy a $3 coupon from the ticket booths on the strip. Where we also got show tickets for Jersey boys, and the rat pack shows. Both well worth it. The Tropicana is south of the strip so you do a lot of walking to get around. You can buy a 3 day hop on bus pass which runs up and down the strip for $7. Well worth the money , as it stops at every hotel and can take upto 1 hour to run from one end to the other. Or the express bus which only stops at certain stops and is obviously quicker. The pool areas look great, lots of bed both in the sun and shade, always beds available when we looked. The casino is very small when you see other hotel casinos, it depends on what you want. A great smell of sun cream is noticable around reception and parts of the casino, apparently it makes you spend more money? I cannot fault this hotel for the money we paid, friendly helpful staff and always plenty around. Las Vegas is a fantastic place, so much to see and do, and for the amount of time we spent in our room it met all our needs. Will definatley be coming back to the Tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful renovation and staff is willing to serve”
Reviews.Author: CoachSr
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights with a group in eight rooms and found the entire visit excellent. We had a slight problem with checkin after months of planning as a group visit, we arrived and found we had been handed off as individuals, so our rooms were all over the place. Yolanda took care to get us all on the same floor, and did it with a good attitude! What a great person to meet at the front! Later in the evening we went back to get other rooms keys and had more inefficient staff who wanted to charge us all over again. Why was there no record they could see? Their attitude was a little different in helping us. The rooms were wonderful and the whole place was just beautiful. The renovation has made this a real gem and I highly recommend you give this a chance on your next visit. Did not use the food services nor pool, but there is so much to see around town, why would you be hanging around? On the other hand, go ahead and hang around - you will love it here. The majority of staff were the best workers I have met in my recent travels. I commend the hospitality training staff for the great job they seem to be doing with employees.

Reviews.Title: “not too shabby”
Reviews.Author: ecr527
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews here, I was a little worried about staying at this hotel, but I got a package deal that was too good to be true, so I bit the bullet and went for it. Although it's no Bellagio or Venetian, it's definitely a decent place to stay at the south end of the strip. They have done a very well job with the remodel, although you can still find hints of the old Tropicana, like the front desk. The pool is also very nice. They did a good job trying to capture the South Beach feel. Another perk of this hotel is it's location. It's very close to the airport, which is a good thing if you take a taxi to and from there. The only real negative I could think of is that there are a few stairs you have to climb to get to the front desk. This wasn't really a problem for me, however if you have a big, heavy suitcase with you, it could take quite some effort to get it up with you.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic until the Nikki Beach Club Starts - Then Holiday from Hell”
Reviews.Author: Retiredtraveller6051
Reviews.Content: Travelled with Virgin Holidays fora one week stay at Tropicana, newly renovated Hotel. The hotel is superb and cannot be faulted. But unfortunately, they have now opened a Nikki Beach Club. We stayed on the 10th Floor in the Club Tower adjacent to the club and it was hell!!! Non stop music thudding in your chest all night. They claim the club will enable guests to enjoy the best Vegas pool parties throughout the day and party all night at what will surely be the best hot spot in Vegas. Their mission is to create unforgettable memories that will stay with our guests long after they leave our venue! Unfortunately, at the expense of the Hotel Guests. When I complained I was offered ear plugs and told nobody else had complained. Guests probably won't complain, but won't return a second time.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: sandraoh40
Reviews.Content: Ok, so this is not a mega five star resort. If that is what you want spend 3 times as much cash on your room, spend more on your drinks and food and have way more people in every line in front of you. If, like us , you are looking for a clean, comfortable hotel with good amenities, great staff a great atmosphere and a great location you could do no better than visit the Tropicana. It has been well renovated, the rooms are lovely, large and clean they are cleaned daily as are the bed sheets and towels changed on a daily basis. The bed is so comfortable!!We had a room in the paradise tower on the 17th floor which had an amazing view and so with it being right at the front of the hotel, of course there is going to be some noise from the road outside!! Do what i do at night, wear earplugs!! We ate in cafe nicki which had a fantastic breakfast and lunch buffet. Not like the huge ones on the strip, probably more suited to customers from europe ( which I guess is their thing given they are part of Nicki Beach), full of fresh fruit and salad items, really tasty food. I cant fault any of the staff, everyone was great. Not the type of false customer service which just annoys myself and my husband, but genuine proper good service with a nice friendly attitude, not forced looking for a tip!! The location is fantastic. This was our third trip to vegas, and the first at this side of the strip, but it is so handy for the nieghbouring hotels and only a 15-20 min walk to bellagio and caesers, but quiet enough if you cannot be bothered with the weekend party goers!! The best thing about this hotel, and if you have read other reviews you will have heard her name, is Nicole Marshall. She is a credit to her employers!! I contacted her when I booked as we had a special occasion while we were there and she couldn't do enough to help. So, I am sure there are others out there who have maybe had an issue while staying here... thats life ... but we had a fantastic holiday and stayed there for 12 nights , not just a couple... so had 12 nights for something to go wrong... and nothing did.... Well done Tropicana, and thanks very much!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome times at Tropicana, a great value!”
Reviews.Author: Miguel M
Reviews.Content: We were skeptical about staying at the Tropicana as I remember that hotel did not look nice at all before. However, after their major renovation (a complete overhaul) and the addition of Nikki Beach the hotel is awesome! Kristi at the Nikki Cafe was the most amazing bartender ever, she kept us entertained (and well served). The staff if very courteous and their customer service was quite nice. The rooms were clean and they even had a turn-down service, which is typical for the ultra fanzy hotels, so nice touch! We ate once at the Bizcayne restaurant, a little pricey but it was very good. The value for staying at this hotel was great and I'd stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “LOVED OUR STAY”
Reviews.Author: jillybean78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a hotel off the strip this time. We were so impressed to see the remodeling at the Tropicana. It is nice to see the older hotels keeping up with the new ones. We were greeted by a man who called himself "T". He showed us around and was very informative about the hotel and its restaurants. Tropicana will be definitely on our list of choices that we will consider for our next Vegas vacation. Jill Tropino

Reviews.Title: “Dont be fooled”
Reviews.Author: lilmom80
Reviews.Content: We checked in late in the evening and we pretty tired but yet excited, checking in we had to haul our luggage up the beautiful marble stairs then over to the front desk. Once we got checked in we recieved our map on how to get to our room (front and back). As we pulled our luggage across carpet to try and find the hallway to the elevator to our room (kept getting lost with no assistance to our issue). Find the room great now my arms can rest, the walk to the room was about a 15 minute walk in the hotel if your dont get lost. Went out for a little bit and when we came "home" we were greated with a horrible night sleep as the BED BUGS were having a party and we were there host! Great job on a newly renovated hotel, nothing seems to be new except the places that cost you and overpriced meal. We were somewhat comp'ed for our situation but was tolded that bed bugs do not survive in las vegas by a hotel manager (came home to a dr's confirmation that thats what they are)

Reviews.Title: “Waited over 40 min to check in!!”
Reviews.Author: Buffetgalore
Reviews.Content: Tropicana, why do you have one person working the check in at 3pm?! The line was endless and some verbally abusive Germans in line started going nuts- yelling at everyone. Really crappy. Room is okay- air conditioning noisy. Will walk over to MGM to do my gaming and changed my two night stay for one night only. No thanks Tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana,,,,Freaks,Freaks everywhere.”
Reviews.Author: DunmoreEast
Reviews.Content: Ok from when you enter the hotel there is a constant smell of coconut. Not bad for the first 4 hrs but after that you think your living inside a coconut. Then there is the loud mouthed teenage Anerican drunken fool. These seem to appear on the weekend nights staggering around barely able to walk drinking out of plastic tubes. Then you come across the multitude of transvestites,,,,yes you read it right. They are everywhere now I have nothing against these people,,,,,,but it seems that on a Saturday night the tranny bus is in town and they all desend on the Trpoicana as we didnt see them in any other casino. Apart from that the pool is nice well when I say nice it nice I mean without all the drunken teenagers trying to be models or movie star that all seem to have had a stroke in the last 5hrs before moving to the pool. Food is good staff seem a bit slow and the drinks ladies never return to you when you order a drink. So with all that I would recommend staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Changes - but downgraded with no explanation”
Reviews.Author: davis237
Reviews.Content: I travel to Vegas 3 times a year from Philly and am one of those travelers who likes to stay in suites when there. My brother and I went from 5/17-5/21, and stayed at Skylofts at MGM in a 2 bedroom suite the 1st 2 nights and I had booked a Penthouse Loft for me and a Paradise Suite for my brother at the Tropicana the last 2 nights. Going in, i had no misconceptions that the Trop's Penthouse would compare to Skylofts, however based on reviews of the remodeled hotel i decided to give it a try. So..on 5/19 my brother an i checked out of Skylofts and walked over to the Trop around noon. Began the process of checking in and was told that the Penthouse loft was not available (either was the Paradise Suite for that matter). Now, i know it is common practice to not guarantee smoking vs. non, queens vs. king, etc. However, when someone reserves something like a Penthouse Loft, it is a very high probability that the specific suite selection is quite on purpose. To top it off, as the subject of my post states there was no explanation why the loft was not available, just that we would "love the spa suites". Well, i didn't reserve the spa suite. Forget the fact that i had to haggle with them to drop my price down. Something like this probably doesn't matter to most people, but it certainly gave me a bad 1st impression. As for the rest of the hotel, they really have done a nice job with their remodeling, especially the pool area. Everything seemed quite clean and other than the front desk, the employees all seemed to be quite personable. As an aside, if you are looking for high-limit blackjack, they really seemed to be short on options (and dealers). I had to walk over to MGM to get my fix. Not a big deal, as i am sure that they are not going for that clientele very hard.

Reviews.Title: “Good times had by all!”
Reviews.Author: Ajna_Anahata
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay through the hotel and when I signed up I got 30% off my hotel stay which was great. We were in the tower closer to the airport which required a bit of a walk but I didn't mind it meant that there was lots of sun at the pool areas since it wasn't blocked in. I stayed at the Monte Carlo in 2009 and I have to say for my money I loved the Tropicana in comparison. We had no sun at the Monte Carlo pool area but at the Tropicana it was sunshine all day long. Our room was great and we had an excellent view of the strip and the pool. If you wanted a king bed it meant staying on the Airport side so my boyfriend and I picked the two queens so we could face the strip the only downside is the music from the club if you need it to be quiet to sleep which I do but for most people it isn't an issue I just am a light sleeper my boyfriend had no issues. The bed is the best bed I have ever stayed in a hotel. I loved it! Now our friends traveled with us and had an issue their bathroom flooded from someone getting drunk and turning the bath on above them but the hotel dealt with it and up graded my friends to an amazing suite so it worked out in the end. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Tropicana to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: CapitalS
Reviews.Content: I booked through Hotwire and paid less than $60 per night. The hotel is undergoing renovation and my room and bathroom were attractive and newly renovated as well. Work is still going on but did not affect my stay. I stayed in the rear tower which was about a 5 minute walk from the lobby. I had the breakfast buffet at the restaurant. The restaurant provided a pleasant atmosphere and the food was fresh and tasty. However, the selection was small and the meal was overpriced. I stayed at the Monte Carlo recently and the rooms at the Tropicana were much nicer and significantly cheaper. Not too fancy, but a great value if you're looking for a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel feels comfy”
Reviews.Author: robert george r
