Reviews.Content: Just come back from a week staying at the tropicana, its a good hotel in all the usual ways nice and clean, room service is really good (5 mins to get a coffee making machine delivered), the hotel restuarants are trying to be upmarket, and the main bar (club) is trying to be even more upbeat, which is not such a bad thing, pool area is great (beware of the sprinkler system in 1 part of the garden that goes off around 17:30hrs most people get caught out we certainly did ha ha) the shopping mail and another part of the pool area is not yet completed but does not distract from the hotel. the hotel is at the top end of the strip by the MGM and Camalot so if you are going to try and see the rest of the casinos be prepared for tired legs at the end of the day. i would advise people to get in here soon because the rates for rooms are good but not for much longer i would think next year the price will go up for a hotel as good as this

Reviews.Title: “No sugar-coating, Tropicana Las Vegas was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Cliffferreira
Reviews.Content: First off I wanna say that my first trip to Las Vegas was one to remember, and staying at the Tropicana made it that much better! I stayed at the Tropicana with my cousin and his soon to be brother-in-law from May 13-15. I'm not gonna write a novel but when I return to Vegas, Tropicana will most definitely be the number 1 choice. Although we didn't sleep that much, everything about the hotel was more than amazing...from the facilities, the hotel staff and management (shouts to Mr. Martinez), me and the boys were impressed with the customer service and cleanliness of the hotel. We spent our days by the pool, had a great atmosphere and Miami beach feel to it. Too bad that Nikki Beach Club wasn't open that weekend, but it is gonna be one of the premier clubs in Vegas for sure! I read a lot of reviews on the Tropicana before I booked but the negative ones were bogus. Take it from a 25 year old dude that enjoys a good party but also a classy hotel to stay, and no way the Tropicana is a 3 star hotel...I'll go ahead and give it a 5 star! Thanks again to everybody in Vegas and the Tropicana that showed us love, we'll be back sooner than later.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but would stay elsewhere next time”
Reviews.Author: ajb524
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that the room we had was nice and clean. The rooms were spacious and everything was new. What I was frustrated about was not getting the room type we reserved and paid extra for. I booked a city view room and they did not have any note of that when we checked in so we took another room with an airport view that is on the other side of the casino. It wasn't that far of a walk, but after being out walking the strip it would have been nice to walk in and go straight to my room. I called travelocity to try to get it straightened out, but they weren't much help even though I had paid extra for each night to have a city view room. The best they could do was move us to a room with two queen beds instead of the king bed room we were in and by that point we had already been there 2 days and were leaving in another 2. I asked about a refund and they claimed the room we had (not city view) was the same price as city view even though the website clearly had different rates. I didn't want to waste time arguing with them over what amounted to about $60 so I let it go. We ordered room service the first night we were there and our food was fabulous and the service was great. We had our food in less than 30 minutes. I think the food came from cafe nikki. That was the only food we had from this hotel. I went to the pool once. It was extremely crowded, but otherwise nice. If I return to Vegas though I'll probably stay somewhere a little more in the middle of the strip. I've only been twice and the other time was at Mandalay Bay (much better pool there by the way). If I had received the room I wanted I would give the Tropicana a 4 as a rating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, clean and well run”
Reviews.Author: RiponELL
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Trop for 5 nights with my spouse. Rooms were clean and nicely updated. Entire staff was friendly and great at all times. Easy in out to parking garage is a huge bonus for a hotel on the strip. We didn't eat in the hotel, ate off strip mostly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Poodler78
Reviews.Content: Travelled in April for a week with three friends. We wanted somewhere on The Strip but as we were there for the gambol/poker we weren't concerned too much about a luxury spa etc. We got a great price on the Trop and as we heard it had been done up, we plumped for it. I had also been swayed by the good engagement on here by Nicole - I like a hotel that takes the time. I'd got in touch but due to the guys wanting to book just after payday, we booked through a third party - Nicole got back to me a few days after with a better offer that I sadly couldn't take up but once again, excellent. The hotel itself was perfect for us and our needs. The place looks fresher than a lot of the hotels at the South end and the room was perfect - comfortable and clean. The pool was great. One or two gripes - the resort fee is standard Vegas fare so I don't mind but non-residents could just wander out to the pool and use it - some other hotels check room cards etc and I prefer this. This was the same for tower access - any random could get in a lift without a room card, I never like this. That aside, the Trop won't have the same footfall of randoms as the middle of the Strip hotels so it may not be such an issue or they may be addressing this as the makeover continues. Food wise we ate at Nikki Beach which was dead on - good clubs, burgers, sushi. The waiters were good and the outside deck is lovely. Biscayne was really good though. We had a really good time - top steaks, great wine and the crab/cheddar mash is something I'll need to try and recreate! We didn't gamble much at the hotel, some roulette & blackjack was all. The poker room looks nice but with few folk about, most beginners will just head across to the Excalibur for NL1/2 rather than the NL1/3 on offer in the Trop (change this!). As it was usually fairly empty, we played elsewhere. In all though, a great hotel if you get it at the right price as the money you save will go a long way in this town.

Reviews.Title: “Planning my Return ASAP! :) Grand Opening Nikki Beach!”
Reviews.Author: JesseFlorida
Reviews.Content: If Nikki Beach was open during my stay, I might not have left the property. The purpose of my trip was to relax and have fun. This hotel was perfect for that! The restaurants in the hotel were amazing ,providing enough variety for a different meal for breakfast , lunch and dinner for my 5 night stay. From casual breakfast and lunch dining ,to upscale dining in the restaurants open only for dinner. I couldnt resist the pool every day... its beautiful, spacious and anything i wanted to eat or drink was provided by poolside servers. We had a blast in the ahmbar lounge inside the hotel. Great bar, great band.,great atmosphere... As a plus... I didnt lose any money gambling on the tables, but it was fun,,,I think we knew all the dealers and pit bosses by the time we left! Fun group... As for anything else that i experienced,,,,, well, you know.. That stays in Vegas! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Casino/Staff”
Reviews.Author: JDIndy
Reviews.Content: Definitely recommend the Tropicana as a place to gamble. The renovated casino looks great, the casino staff and dealers were very friendly, and the drink service was swift.

Reviews.Title: “The renovation seems to work out well”
Reviews.Author: TheFalcon1982
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Trop from 05/09/2011 to 05/16/2011, lets hope I manage to put together a useful review. Pre-Check-In: After booking the hotel via Expedia, I found out on Facebook that Nicole Marshall is one of the nicest guest relation people in the whole city. Wrote her about my trip and asked her if it would be possible to get a fridge for my medication (the trip was a mix of birthday present and reward for being healthy again) and a quiet room. She responded within 24 hours that it wouldn't be a problem and told me that she would place a note on my reservation. Check-In: Arrived at 2:15am to see that there was no line at all and I could check-in right away. The way to the front desk, doesn't give you the whole casino tour, as it sits on the left side of the main entrance. That's a big bonus, since you don't have to move your luggage across the whole casino in order to check in. The women at the check-in gave me a warm feeling, called housekeeping because of the fridge and told me they'd knock within 5 minutes. Just as I got up to the room, housekeeping already knocked and helped me set up my fridge. Room: I had a room in the Paradise Tower, which has it's elevators right at the entrance to the right. From the entrance to the elevator it's about a 7-10 step walk, so you get in and out of the hotel fast, if you want to do some shopping/seightseeing/... . The rooms are big, even compared to other (more expensive) hotels on the strip. I had enough room to move around, set up my computer on the table without feeling like a canned tuna. It was a pretty quiet room for Vegas standards, which I really loves, since I am still recovering and needed some sleep aswell. Only downside, I got veeeeeery loud neighbors the last 3 nights (weekend), but since I already saw they were very well booked and since I also didn't want to change rooms, I didn't mention it. But it doesn't change my opinion of the hotel ... they couldn't have known. Also on a plus-side ... I had some friends stay at the Treasure Island and they complained that they didn't have a docking station for their IPod ... Tropicana has a very nice IHome station that also works with IPhones (which is rare, most docking station are IPod only). Nearly forgot ... there's a huge safe in the room, that handles a 17" Laptop with ease ... I had a big camera, laptop, mobile phone, car keys, and and and in the safe and there was still enough room for another laptop and some more stuff ... safe didn't work when I arrived, but within 5 minutes security was there trying to help me. Sadly they couldn't fix it either, but the next morning a locksmith replaced the lock and it worked like a charm. Casino: They had the "Even the Odds" promotion still going, which gives you 50% of what you lose (in slot play) back on the same day and 50 additional percent back on your next stay (between 1 and 12 months later). So even if you don't plan to lose, it is pretty nice to have a fallback-option ;) The casino itself is bright, unlike most other Vegas casinos and while it feels different, it's a very nice feeling to play in a friendly environment. Pool: They have a great pool that tends to get a little overrun on sunny days, as it's very inviting. The water was a little cold at first, but after some 85-90° days it really heated up and it was great to swim some laps there. Nikki Beach is opening in May aswell, so they'll add another pool to the mix, where I'm sure people will meet to party and enjoy themselves. Construction looked pretty much done when I was there and I got a sneak peak of what to expect ... it looks very promising and could become a got-to-be-there spot in Vegas, if the management does a good job promoting it. Housekeeping: Unlike some other people writing reviews here, I had no problems there ... they cleaned every day (except for my second to last day ... but that was because I told them it wouldn't make sense, since I had to leave at 3:00am in the morning) and did a pretty good job. Overall: I already told people to take a good look at the Tropicana, if they don't mind walking a little to the to the crowded places, to get the most bang for their buck on the Strip. I'd stay there again in a heartbeat ... would love to check out one of the suites next time.

Reviews.Title: “Staff, and service was terrific can't say enough about Kennon Wolff.”
Reviews.Author: tropicanvacation
Reviews.Content: Tropicana was a great hotel. It was close to all hotels and restaurants. It also had its own fine restaurants with a wonderful choie of entrees. The staff was courteous and helpful above and beyond. Kennon Wolff was the most courteous gentleman and helpful in advising us of the things to do and places to go, he went beyond the call of duty. Check in was quick and easy. We would not hesitate to stay at the Tropicana on our next visit. The casino was bright and not over-whelming with tables and slots. We saw two shows at the hotel and both were very entertaining and reasonably priced as were the restaurants. The pool area was beautiful and towels and lounge chairs were plentiful. The rooms were immaculate and the service was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “From the friendly staff to the clean & comfortable room our stay was wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: Cinderella49
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our 30th wedding anniversary. Nicole was very helpful. From the staff at the check in desk being very friendly and informative to the room that was clean and newly decorated, to the very comfortable bed and pillows I was very impressed with the Tropicana. We requested a coffee maker and refrigerator when we reserved our room, it was brought to our room just minutes after we checked in by another friendly and courteous employee. The room was cleaned every day. The pool area was absolutely gorgeous. The location is near the airport and an easy to walk to other hotels on the strip. The tower we stayed in was a bit of a walk from the main casino, but I enjoyed the exercise it provided me.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite as good as the hype!”
Reviews.Author: AlieC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tropicana for 7 nights, 6th-13th May. We were 2 couples and we had all been to Vegas before. After reading all the good reviews for the Trop we decided to give it a try. I must admit we were all slightly disappionted. Don't get me wrong it's a nice hotel, but they've done a good job on selling themselves and we found it's not quite as it seems. We all agreed that if it was your first visit to Vegas you'd be more than pleased. But if you have been before, you tend to do comparisons a little too much. Having said that our negatives didn't ruin our holiday. I really don't know where all the over friendly staff were on our week, we didn't find this the case at all. Not that they were rude or unwelcoming, but neither over the top friendly either. In fact most of the staff seemed to be new and unsure what they were doing. The rooms are really lovely, we upgraded to a deluxe room and it was great, with a fab view, and as sooo many say, the beds are AMAZINGLY comfortable...we had no probs sleeping, which definately helped with jetlag!!! Love the smell of the hotel, wafts of coconut but not a strong smell. Loved Cafe Nikki, nice ambience and yum food! The size of the hotel is great not large and easy to get around. The pool area is very nice, music is a bit repetative after a few days! The cocktail girls aren't assertive enough, our friend on the last day said they hadn't asked her once if she wanted a drink, we had to call them over, and they weren't overly friendly. We tended to go get our drinks in cafe Nikki ourselves. We were very disappointed with the Ambhar lounge, we had the impression of a cool lounge bar, with cocktails, music, etc, but this really was a let down. Its a small area with sport on the screens, which confuses me when there is a sports bar. We did spend time there though, happy hour 4pm-7pm half price cocktails! We ate at Biscayne, bit of a strange ambience, waiter was humourless, which made us laugh!! Food was OK, mediocre, you can get much better in other hotels. My Husband tried the taster meal, it wasn't good! Didn't eat in the Italian, it looked nice, but both restaurants a weirdly situated. The casino is bright and airy, my husband enjoyed some gambling. The drinks girls come round more often there than round the pool, and the drinks are free in there!! All in all we had a great holiday, nothing ruined it. It'll be even better when Nikki beach/club opens this week, it looks very nice, a bit smaller than I had imagined. It's a great value hotel but not in the same league as some of the others, once they've ironed out some teething problems it'll be much better. I wouldn't stay there again as I like to try different hotels but I would recommend this hotel. Contact me if you have any queries I might be able to help with.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice we made while on our trip - Tropicana!”
Reviews.Author: Meghuneyntyson
Reviews.Content: Let me start this off by saying that I looked over every last possible review of Tropicana before booking. I contacted Nicole Marshall as you will notice many people say. She was absolutely awesome. Did it take her a minute to get back with us? Of course. But imagine how many emails she must get a day from ppl wanting some sort of deal, "hook up" or assistance with something for their upcoming trip. Anyway, from the moment we arrived at Tropicana, we were greeted with warmth, friendliness and a smile. Our room was absolutely SPECTACULAR. It was a Penthouse Loft and it was just amazing. What I loved most about the room was the small dining table on th lower level. A lot of suites make the mistake of having some huge dining table that takes up most of the room as if you will have a huge sit-down dinner in your hotel. However, I did end up having a dinner in once and from our windows were able to look out onto the strip while enjoying our meal. The jacuzzi upstairs in the bathroom was ridiculous. It was so deep that a "little person" standing in it would drown if the water was filled. Again, there was an awesome view of the strip from the tub. As for the rest of the hotel, I would have been content to just stay there at night. The casino isn't too large and unlike my voyages into other casinos and hotels, I didn't get lost when trying to leave. The band playing in the Ahmbar Lounge was SPECTACULAR. After a night out, I'd often headed back to the lounge only to wish I'd have stayed there in the first place. They played modern songs and encouraged audience participation. The bartenders were AWESOME and the Berry Beach drink had me tipsy before I was finished with the first. I got a cabana during my stay and it was totally worth it. The cabanas are GORGEOUS. All white with a few red and island accents. Many hotels make you pay a large amount of money for a cabana and then on top of that, you buy your drinks and food. Tropicana charged us an amount and it included that set amount's worth of drinks. Completely worth it. I am from Texas. I am used to seasonings, flavor and tad bit of spice in my food. After visiting several Vegas restaurants, I was left disappointed in Vegas food. I'd wished I'd packed some Tony Cachere's seasoning in my purse. I'd given up and accepted the fact that in other areas, people just don't cook the way I'm used to. Then I went to Bacio inside the hotel. Our waiter was absolutely delightful and our meals (Chicken Parmesan and Filet with Lobster Hash) were the best food we had in Vegas...seriously. I still dream of the lobster hash some nights. HA! It made me wish I had taken the time to visit Biscayne while there. I did, however, have some of the Spicy Havana Nights sushi rolls while at the pool and those were pretty good as well. The only issue I ran into was WiFi. It was spotty and sometimes worked and other times did not. Not a huge deal as I wasn't planning on working while there, but when trying to use my Nook to purchase a book to read while relaxing, I ran into some issues. Of course, this was a level 1 problem on a scale of 1 - 10 in my book. I've seen complaints of the section of the Strip. To each his own, I suppose. We ended up walkign down to Venetian once or twice but really, we would have been content to just stay on our end. I love NY,NY's rollercoaster. There is a small food court between MGM and Tropicana. We went to Excalibur for ice cream one night after clubbing and walked to MGM for KA on our last night. For me, everything I really needed was in that area of the Strip unless I wanted to venture out to sightsee the rest of the Strip. However, this was trip number 4 for me and I've seen the rest of the Strip. For those who say the walk to the other tower was bad, I disagree. While my room was in the main tower, I'd gone exploring the hotel once and the walk wasn't that bad. Was it a minute or two? Yes. But hardly the hiking trip many ppl have made it seem. In conclusion, I would readily stay at The Tropicana again. It wasn't too large, the staff was awesome and while I had never seen the hotel previous to my trip - it was beautiful in my opinion. I have stayed at Venetian before as well as Treasure Island and I would, without a doubt, choose Tropicana again. From the lounge, to the staff, to the calm but fun pool to the DYNAMITE Bacio - I was impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with amazing customer service”
Reviews.Author: msthang22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here May 12-15th. Our flight was 3 hours late so we got to hotel about 3am- the lady @ check in was so kind, engaged us in conversation and was very pleasant - wonderful first impression. We had a room with a queen bed - room was beautiful - nice that they have safes large enough to stow your laptop. Ours wouldn't let us set the code so we called down to the front desk and security was in our room in less than 5 min to fix the problem. The cleaning staff was so kind, curteous and friendly as well. The room was spotless - very crisp and clean ! The beds are AMAZINGLY comfortable - wish I could have brought it home with me - slept like a baby there! The bathroom is large with plenty of space, large flat screen tv's , loved the decor. Perfect amount of space to relax in! The resort fee per day is 9.99 - one of the cheapeast on the strip - we used our internet - and the connection was great - I think once it was slow but otherwise , no problems! Some will say the hotel is small - well compared to MGM and Venetian , yes it may be smaller but that's what we loved about it - you dont' have to walk 2 miles just to get through the casino and then get to your room - I liked that it was easy to navigate !! The pool was large enough to accomodate everyone - I like that part of it is in the shade so if you get really hot/sunburned , you can chill in the cooler areas. We got lucky both days with finding lounge chairs but it can get crowded - I do have to give kuddos to the lifeguards/employees who were always helping guests locate chairs - they really went above and beyond with customer service. We didn't utilize any of the restaurants in the resort as we were traveling on a budget but they did have a 24 hour starbucks and small cafe type place which is really nice. I love the location - it's not in the middle of the strip but it's close to alot of the bigger hotels to go sightseeing and you can take monorail or bus down the strip or just walk. The Nikki Beach area wasn't open yet - they are still finishing construction but we never were woke up by it. It looks like it will be really cool once it's all complete Oh and don't forget the 24 hour hot tubs - OMG - that was WONDERFUL - especially after a day of walking all over the strip - total relaxation for sore muscles - take advantage of it - there are 2 of them! I highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Vegas, It will definitely be at the top of my list next time I go. Thanks Tropicana for such a wonderful stay and for all your friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Stacie the pool manager was fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Akhurdl
Reviews.Content: Stacie made our trip- cannot give her enough compliments!! Thanks for superior service!!

Reviews.Title: “almost a new hotel (they are still working in and around the hotel)”
Reviews.Author: sofieandkris
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the late afternoon and we had to queue for more than 45 min to check in the hotel. We were located at the end of the hotel (about 5 min walk from the main entrance) Nice moderne hotel were you can relax at the swimming pool. The room and bathroom were spacious. The hotel was very clean. The hotel is located at the beginning of the strip. Next time I would choice a hotel that is located more on the center of the strip. The airport is located nearby the hotel but it we didn't hear the plans. Our room was located on the 18th floor. We overnighted Thursday and Friday and it was rather pricy. We were on a roundtrip (so next time we avoid a Fri of Sat night)

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, convenient, WONDERFUL customer service, fun atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: traveladdict_525
Reviews.Content: Will definitely go back to the Tropicana! I didn't plan the trip and didn't know what to expect... I was aware of Tropicana’s old reputation and of the renovations, but didn’t know if it would really be grand change or just minor updates. But I was VERY impressed! I was with a big group of girls and didn’t spend much time at the hotel, but it was a perfect location and enjoyable home base for our trip. We didn’t realize how close the Tropicana was to the airport so we played it safe and took a shuttle, but a cab would have been cheap. It is an awesome location, right across from the MGM and super convenient for walking or for cheap cab rides anywhere (for those of you wearing heels and are not into walking at night!). Customer service was amazing, friendly, sensitive and engaging from the first door that was opened for us! Check in went quickly and smoothly, we went straight up to our rooms which were beautiful and spotless, then out to the pool to relax after our long trip. Gorgeous pool, exactly what we needed! We didn’t try out the restaurants and mostly relied on the Starbucks for breakfast, and the cheap pizza next to Starbucks for late night meals (and sometimes breakfast), but they looked great. Couldn’t be happier with our rooms, they were perfect. The beds were insanely comfortable, a large bathroom and enough mirrors for multiple girls to get ready, an ipod dock alarm clock which unfortunately we didn’t have an ipod for, but a huge flat screen with music channels we had on at all times. Unfortunately Club Nikki wasn't ready yet when we were there but we will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Staff was rude and hotel was underwhelming. Too small. Decor was hawaiian, not Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: travvvellller
Reviews.Content: When we first checked in the front desk staff was fine but as we stayed and spent time around the hotel, the restaurant staff was rude, service took a long time. I think the "new" part of this hotel was to paint it white and call it new and add some construction club or something. There's nothing going on it's soooo small. Stay at MGM next door.

Reviews.Title: “TROPICANA REBORN!”
Reviews.Author: egtact
Reviews.Content: PAY NO ATTENTION TO OLD REVIEWS!! The "new" Tropicana Las Vegas is GREAT! It was with more than a bit of trepidation that we booked a weekday getaway for ourselves and family visiting from Manila at the newly renovated TROPICANA resort in Las Vegas, but let me begin by saying that we could not have been more pleased with our visit! If you've been to Vegas in recent years, you would know that the Trop has had a horrible reputation and it deserved it. But this is no longer the case. This hotel has had not only a complete renovation of the buildings and rooms, but the staff seems to have benefitted from this makeover as well. From the parking valet to the doormen, everyone actually seemed to care! (Next trip, we'll be reviewing the restaurants) The only "bump" in our visit was when we got to our rooms and the carpets were still damp from shampooing. Now, I don't know about y'all, but I REALLY can't complain about a hotel being "too clean", so it was no big deal to call the desk and let them know we'd like to change rooms. Since the bags were not up yet, a short jaunt back to the desk to pick up our new room keys took all of 15 minutes. AND we were able to get the adjoining rooms that were not yet available when we first checked in. On top of that, the desk clerks Ladonna and Gerard were SO nice, they made sure we were sent free in room coffee makers for the "inconvenience". Keep in mind that we were not paying top fare for the rooms, so this made their gesture even nicer. Mr. Yamenidjian, the new boss, has done a fine job of staffing the Trop with some of the most professional, welcoming and courteous staff in Vegas and he should be commended for it! The rooms were spacious and SPOTLESS. They were welcoming and the beds were wonderful. The bathrooms are also very nice, but the grout on the floors could use a bit more work. Showers on the 6th floor where we were are full pressure and the convenience of the in room safes and FREE WiFi cannot be overstated. BIGass flat screen LED tv's and comfy lounges had us kicking back and relaxed enough to plan the evening in no time. Even being close to the airport at the south end of the Strip, the rooms were so quiet we never noticed any jet noise. The alarm clocks even had Ipod docks! We didn't have the chance to check out the restaurants, but that can wait until our next visit which will hopefully be very soon. Being just across the street from the MGM Grand and the monorail, the Trop's location is almost perfect. Just far enough away from the rest of the Strip to be quiet, but close enough to the monorail to be able to do the entire Strip in one day! In a nutshell, we have found a new favorite place to stay in Vegas and we will continue to visit as much as possible. The Tropicana has gone from "rundown" to "wonderful" and is at the time of this writing, the best VALUE in Vegas. I suggest you visit soon, before word gets out!

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay, not amazed.”
Reviews.Author: CalHusker
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights in a 3rd floor room in the Island Tower during April 2011 for a conference. A couple annoyances...the check-in desk is on a raised platform with 5 or so stairs up. This makes checking in with suitcases inconvenient. There is a small ramp, but it's on the opposite side of the check-in area from where you enter at the main doors. Maybe it's a minor inconvenience, but if they just spent millions remodeling the place, why didn't someone think this through? The Island Tower is quite a trek from the casino floor without many distractions along the way. The room was adequate. Best part was the bed--so comfortable! Much more comfortable than Treasure Island, if not Cosmopolitan as well. The recent renovations meant my room was fresh and in good shape. I think the decor will quickly be outdated in another 5 years though. Table minimums were much higher than I expected--$15 most nights with a rare $10 table. Food options are pretty bleak. Thankfully, Starbucks opened the week I was there. The noodles restaurant and side by side cafe were overpriced for the quality of food. Unfortunately, didn't have time to enjoy the pool because it looked like a great setup. The gym was very strange. It was essentially within the wide hallway that led to the pool. 2/5 cardio machines were broken. Overall, my stay was fine. Nothing major to complain about, but I also wasn't as impressed with the renovations as most reviewers seem to be. I would book another comparably priced hotel on the strip before booking a return stay at the Tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “Love the new look....from the minute we walked in and met "T" we felt so welcomed and special”
Reviews.Author: mooniechicago
Reviews.Content: As a Chicago resident we come too Vegas a few times a year. We stayed at the Tropicana years ago. This last stay was at a popular strip hotel. We heard about the Experience and decided to check it out. "T" was wonderful.... showing us the exciting changes and he even personally escorted us to Niki's CAfe. We enjoyed his tour and knowledge so much that I felt I needed to let you know. Our next stay will be at the Tropicana...It was great ...keep it up Mona Solare 38 Lancaster Ct Burr Ridge Il 60527

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: taunaj
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay in a Paradise Suite. The newly remodeled rooms are gorgeous! I would stay again. We did have a couple of issues; the first morning we were woke up by a generator or air pump vibrating through the room. They are still in the remodel stage so it is understandable, but, we should have been warned. We talked to the manager and were offered a different room and she comped us room service. So we were happy. Another issue we had was our room didn't get cleaned until after 5 pm. Once they were notified it was cleaned immediately. All in all we enjoyed our stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than I had expected”
Reviews.Author: cali1
Reviews.Content: The hotel just had a remodel so it was very nice. Check in went very fast and smoothly. The person helping was very friendly and helpful and upgraded us to a higher room in the front tower without even asking. The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated and the hotel has free wifi. There is a Starbucks in the hotel which was a pleasant surprise. The restaurants and room service are expensive but good. We had the breakfast buffet & Nikki Beach but they didn't offer any pancakes/waffles. Just omelet bar so besides fruit, bacon & muffins, there wasn't much else to eat for your $18 and the service was terrible. Skip it and go to the Denny's next to the MGM. The business center never had anyone there to help you conduct any business so, thankfully the front desk helped me with printing and faxing I needed done. The location was great as it's across from MGM & Excalibur and there are bridges for you to use to get to each of them. If you are using taxis make sure to always tell them you want to go the direct route and not the fastest (unless you are in a hurry of course) as the faster way is always the most expensive way and isn't much faster.

Reviews.Title: “Lipstick on a Pig”
Reviews.Author: prometheusgr
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana is touting their new remodeled hotel as something special but it's nothing more than lipstick on a pig. Their rates have gone up now so they are not even cheaper than the other strip hotels and their rooms still smell like mildew. To top that off after my stay I got my car back from the valet and there was a "u" stamp on my front bumper from where someone backed a trail hitch into it. Filed an incident report and their risk management department stated that there wasn't evidence of "grosse negligence" so there is nothing they will do for me. Stay at your own risk...

Reviews.Title: “convinient”
Reviews.Author: anaya
Reviews.Content: good value!we were upgraded with a strip view.Nice but anoisy!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - would come back again”
Reviews.Author: Cdn_traveller59
Reviews.Content: After reading a few negative reviews on TripAdvisor we were wondering a bit about the Tropicana, but the professional and friendly staff soon put our concerns at rest. Our room was modern, clean and comfortable. Perhaps this is de riguer for all Vegas hotels but it did seem to be a long slog from the front of the hotel to our room. The staff did forget to clean our room our first morning there, but when we discovered this in the late afternoon, the front desk sent someone up in the evening while we were out to rectify this. Nice pool, too. One complaint: not quite enough self-parking. When we checked in about 8 pm we were told we should probably just go with valet parking, as they did not have enough parking spots. A security person did help us discover one final spot, but we wonder about the others who came after us. Be aware of this shortage if you've got a car and you're coming in later. Other than that, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: travellinbubby
Reviews.Content: Cons: pool is cold, they chose to not re do the gross bathtubs and showers. Mold and very dirty tile grout. resort fee, very limited dining and expensive. Fake flowers in and out of property.Construction is going on still and you hear the noise in the morning at 7am.If you want a drink at happy hr price at pool you have to go inside and get it your self. No happy hr at pool, $10.00 drink,beer $7.00. Windows are dirty,you can't see out the window very well. The faucet in the tub ran all 5 days we were there. Pros: Hotel is nice now just fell short by not doing more in the bathrooms. Pool area is beautiful and chairs are plenty. Nice smell of coconut. The beds are ssssooooooo comfortable. The sheets and pillows are nice also. The furniture is nice, everything is nice and new. Corner room was very quite. Don't be afraid to try this hotel, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Bright well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: woodsy_l
Reviews.Content: The hotel Tropicana is a bright,clean hotel located at one end of the strip. As it is situated away from some of the other older hotels it appears less busy and noisy in its casino, with a light and airy atmosphere, as you have to make an effort to get there. The rooms are large and well equipped, with comfortable beds and smart bathrooms. There is easy access from the hotel to all of the attractions on the strip and the staff are welcoming and helpful. The pool area is beautiful and will be even better once the areas being renovated are completely open.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great service!”
Reviews.Author: LeePTL
Reviews.Content: We checked in late. They did not have a king sized bed on the same floor with our friends. They upgrades us to a suite and told us to check in the morning and they would mve us. In the morning they choose to let us stay in the suite for 6 days at no cost! This was after we had gotten the original room at a very good discount price with airfare on Expedia. Several in our group were bothered by soem constuction noises so they moved them also to a higher floor and one of them got a jr. suite also. The staff was also very kind, consideralte and helpful. The remodel is almost done outside. In another month it will all be done and will be a great place to stay for years to come. Also great location. Very close to the airport.. WE will go here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: wingnut38
Reviews.Content: I arrived on Sunday 5/1 for 4 days. I had contacted Nicole Marshall by email several weeks before arriving to see if she could help me with a few issues. When I arrvived all my requests had been entered into my reservation. I received a suite upgrade at no charge, a humidifier for the room that was there upon entering, a high floor with a view and extra blankets. Nicole went above my expectations to see that my stay was enjoyable. The hotel, rooms and grounds are spotless. Did not encounter 1 rude or discourteous staff member. Everyone had a smile, greeted you and opened doors. Spent each day by the pool. The pool grounds are beautiful with lounge chairs everywhere. We never had a problem finding an empty chair or a coctail server. There are 2 hot tubs that are open 24 hours. The Nikki beach day club was still under construction and may not open for several more weeks, but when I peeked in on the construction everything was coming along nice. I have a feeling that this will be packed with people when it opens. I did not eat at any of the restaurants but other reviews say the food at each place is great. Their website does not show this but there is a full starbucks coffee in the hotel. The only downside is the casino, it is small with a limited selection of slots. Also the fitness center is very small with a limitied number of machines. The sports book is really nice and right off the skybridge for easy in/out access. Just outside the main doors is the bus stop for the strip express and the duece bus. The buses drop you off across the street right next to the sky bridge so it is very convenient. I am sure that I left something out but if you do not need 5 star accomodations then you will be very happy staying here. Also if you have any special requests then contact Nicole at nmarshall@troplv

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing experience! Would go back again without a doubt!”
Reviews.Author: SB2412
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tropicana Las Vegas with a friend and right from check in - which was so easy and quick we were both impressed! The lady that dealt with us saw that we were staying for 10 days which is a long time for Vegas (as so many people told us) and upgraded our room to a great view of the strip we could see everything, although this was a long walk to the main hotel (we were in the club tower) it really was worth the walk as this hotel is just amazing! It was great value for money I think we paid under 500 GBP to stay here for 10 nights! We were treated like royalty by all members of staff who were all so friendly and helpful. Our room was cleaned every day of our trip and even the housekeeping staff are friendly and accomodating which is a sure sign of the quality of service the Tropicana aims to give its guests. The room was tidy and clean - we were in a smoking room too :-) A massive TV along with lots of wardrobe and drawer space, the bathrooms were big and updated the added extra which made it for us was the Ipod/Iphone docking station with alarm and radio, we got new towels from housekeeping every day and our beds were also made every day - housekeeping even came back when we were still in the room at a more convenient time - they didn't just leave the room uncleaned We ate in the chinease takeaway, the starbucks and the other restaurants within the Tropicana and the staff including the chefs and counter staff were just amazing, they made conversation with us and made an effort to get to know us individually, they never seemed unhappy to be there which was amazing. The pool area is lovely the pool staff (life guards etc) always came over to offer us towels or to try and help us to find a spare chair - the pool area was very busy. The concierge staff were lovely and friendly, always opened doors for us, helped with luggage even helped us when we were carrying bags to our rooms and also gave directions and offered on best places to shop :) They charge a resort fee of $10 a night per room which is so worth it, we got free internet along with other things - we used the internet every day and had no problems with the internet it was very fast, I don't know why people complain about paying the fee as the price to stay here is so good I honestly do not have a bad word to say about this hotel I just hope that they can continue to keep their prices low so that we can continue to enjoy coming to Vegas :) Thank you to all of the staff for making our first trip to Vegas such an amazing time and we will definately be returning! :-) ** A non hotel related tip because we didn't know this until we got to Vegas if you want to use the buses to get to and from hotels etc on the strip it only accepts cards as a method of payment so we had to use taxis but to be fair split between two of us the taxis were not expensive - for example from the Tropicana to the Venetian costs just over $10 and most of the taxi drivers are friendly and can even give you advice on great things to see and do in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: prairiedot
Reviews.Content: I booked the Tropicana for an exploratory trip to Las Vegas to review resorts along the Strip (I'm a Travel Consultant). The price was excellent, and I was very pleasantly surprised at the quality of the resort. A whiff of coconut sets the mood when you walk in the doors, and the decor is delightfully tropical, bright and cheerful. The buffet at Cafe Nikki was out of this world and the filet mignon at the Biscayne for dinner was as good as I've had anywhere. The Tropicana has had a recent facelift and the room was excellent, clean and well-appointed. The pool area is charming with lovely flowers and waterfalls. Staff were super helpful. All-in-all, a superb experience. I would recommend this resort to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: AspenHB
Reviews.Content: So we generally dont stay in nice hotels. But this one was great. We moved here after one night in another hotel that was not so grand. Positives: Nice, stylish rooms (i think they are newly remodeled), great bed, great view of the strip, friendly staff, fast service. Negatives: There is not cheap food nearby...one must cross over to New York New York to get a bagel and coffee or walk down the strip to find snack stuff. There is a small convenience store downstairs, but it is really just chips and soda type stuff.

Reviews.Title: “I love the TROP!”
Reviews.Author: joyo17
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tropicana from the 12th - 19th April. This was our first time in Vegas & I spent hours & hours on trip advisor trying to decide where to stay. A combination of good reviews & good price led us to booking theTrop & I am so glad we did! We arrived at 9pm after a 10 1/2hour flight. There was no queue at check in & we were seen straight away by a lovely, friendly lady. We had booked via a booking agency & I was a bit worried that we would either not be on their system or we would be given the shoe closet to sleep in! There were no problems at all & we were soon on our way up to our room on the 16th floor in the Paradise Tower. Having read some of the reviews I expected a long slog to get there but we were there in minutes - it really isn't a long way at all. The room was bright, clean & spacious. The bed was heavenly! Ipod dock/radio brilliant. Safe was easy to use. WiFi fast & easy to connect to. We had the breakfast buffet twice at Cafe Nikki. The first time it was lovely & the waitress was great. The second time on our last day was not so. We waited for a table for 10 minutes & then was shown to a table outside on a high table over looking the pool. There was renovations taking place inside which had reduced the number of indoor tables. If we had been told that at the beginning we would not have bothered. The waiter, Brian, was not exhibiting the high standard of service we had come to expect there. I gave up trying to get a second drink or even a spoon to stir my 1st one! Cafe Nikki happy hour was a great success though - 4pm-7pm. Fab Mojitos $5 Beer $3! YUM! We loved the location, the rooms, the slots & the friendly but not too over the top staff. There was construction work going on while we were there but we didn't hear anything at all. The only disturbance was in the resturant on the last day as previously mentioned. Great things we did while we were there: Love at The Mirage (Mesmerising!) The Gun Store (Terrifying at first but we had THE BEST Range Master - Brian - a legend!) Hash House A Go Go (HUGE portions!) BLT Burger at The Mirage ( YUM) Gospel Brunch at Mandeley Bay (Great food & a whole lot of soul!) Outlet Shopping Centre (Leave room in your case for lots of bargains.) Freemont Street Experience (Fun old school style!) Not so Great BB Kings Blues Club (Food OK & Fab band but no prices for drinks on the menu & bloody hell that was a dear night!) Drink prices at the House of Blues ($11 for bud light! A cheap but dry night!) I could go on & on but in short - We loved our stay at the Tropicana. I wish I was back there now! I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms. Small Casino”
Reviews.Author: MaryBeth8
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and tried hard but were uninformed as to the goings on at the resort, especially regarding advertised specials in the lounges and restaurants. The rooms were fresh and clean but amenities were sparse.

Reviews.Title: “Meeting Space and Hotel Review”
Reviews.Author: marvin2770
Reviews.Content: I am an event planner so most of my experience involved a meeting we had at the Tropicana. This is the second event we've had and both times it went off without a hitch. The service and food was fantastic. The meeting space is wonderful...not a complaint to be had. Susan Chavez and Martha Cornwall were great to work with. With regards to the rooms, I've stayed twice at the island tower. They are big, comfortable and brand new. One of the most comfortable beds I've stayed in...Only issue I had this last time was construction. They start rather early and our room faced where they were working so that was unfortunate. Otherwise I'd gladly stay there over and over. They added more food courts and restaurants and its tough to choose which one to go to... they are all FABULOUS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Has become a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: airhughes
Reviews.Content: Huge improvements have been made to this hotel, with more on the way. Very friendly employees, and great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “The "NEW" Tropicana is Fabulous!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sassy97
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Trop for 24 years, but the last few years it was just plain BAD, but decided to give them one last try with there "2 NIghts Free" offer. It was fabulous and we will definitely be going back!!!! Remember those miserable hard mattresses and the tiny pillows? They are gone and the new beds are better than what you have at home!!!! Every thing is new, including the great safes that hold a laptop and they work too! We tried Italian food at Bacio - great. Salad and sandwiches at the deli - very good and the prices at both places were reasonable. The revamped casino is roomier and I even won gambling - what's not to like???? Give it one more try - I think you'll be glad you did!! Wi-fi didn't work first day but after that it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, pool, staff!!”
Reviews.Author: asacMapleRidgeBC
Reviews.Content: Well I must say the service at this hotel was fantastic. It started with a tip from the hotel manager, when I contacted her about room selection, and she advised that they have i-docks to bring my i-pod and get a white noise application if I'm used to sleeping with sound in the background. Amazing tip. Great for those of us who are light sleepers but love to vacation. The first day of our arrival we were heading out, I asked my friend if she knew when the pool closed and the gentleman that was walking beside her, a staff member, told us, and also asked us if we had just arrived. We said yes, and we weren't even sure how to get out to the strip, he then walked us through the casino, up the escalator and outside, telling us information as we went, really very nice, and then when we were thanking him, he handed us his card, turns out he is the general manager of the restaurants at the Tropicana, Stephen. So we felt really great that he had taken time out of his schedule to show us out and give us advise. Our room overlooked the pool, fairly standard room, but great view of the pool, the strip, and nicely furnished, with new linens and such. All and all we had a really great time, fantastic waiter named Peter at Nikki's cafe. We really enjoyed the pool area, great pool, the weather was hot, the pool was refreshing, and warm enought that I spent a couple hours a day in the water. Pictures to follow. Thanks, Nicole, Stephen, (Brandon, front desk clerk), and Peter, as well as the wonderful lifeguards, and pool staff, who were always ready with helpful hints and suggestions. Hope to see you next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good Re-Model”
Reviews.Author: martinibill7777
Reviews.Content: Hotel renovation is about 90% complete. Guest room was nicely furnished and very clean. Comfortable bed. Large flat screen tv. Pool area is beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and grounds”
Reviews.Author: ChattyCat58
Reviews.Content: This hotel is undergoing a wonderful transformation. They are currently building a beach which should be done in the next month or so. The pool is large and beautifully landscaped. The only problem I could see was the bathrooms located on the far side of the gym (which meant wet people from the pool were crossing the wooden gym floor). The buffet was not available due to the renovation. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and for less than $50 a night, we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to their word”
Reviews.Author: nick1534
Reviews.Content: Hotel is just what is advertised. Refurnished and refreshed. The rooms were spacious with super comfortable beds. The casino and common areas have a bright look to them with all the white they are using. As mentioned in other reviews, they could use more food choices. We ate at the quick grill area and at Cafe Nikki and the coffee and muffins were fresh and tasty and the dinners at the Cafe were outstanding. The pool area was kept extremely clean and the personnel made sure you kept your chairs from overlapping in to the aisles blocking other people. Garbage was picked up constantly. The music being played, while not my choice of music, was not overbearing. At one point we asked if they could switch to a different track as we had heard all the songs once around. They took care of that without hesitation. The casino has room to improve on the slots. We had a blast with what they had. A couple of areas are sparse and could use more machines, but the ones they have gave you a bit of play for your money. Housekeeping did a good job of sprucing up the room except for the last day. We must have taken too long to get out of the room because it never got cleaned. Not the end of the world, but having someone to make my bed each day spoils me while on vacation. I tipped them every day, so they missed out on that the last day. As mentioned in other reviews, they have doormen to hold the doors for you. What a nice touch to be greeted with a smile and a "Good Morning/Afternoon"! They helped us find the Pawn Shop and genuinely seemed to care if you were having a good stay. All the employees had smiles and good attitudes. We really felt like they put forth their best effort to be welcoming and we would return. We had no problems with anyone and we were there four nights. Overall I think the property has come a long way. I have to admit, I was doubtful about the whole package: the promises with our existing reservations right through to the customer service. But, no worries. They came through 100%. Everything they promised us at checkin was given without any issues, the renovations were all as described and the customer service was top notch. Thank you Nicole, our vacation was wonderful! The reviews that talk about the "long" walk to the pool if you are in the Paradise Tower are ridiculous. If that is considered a long walk, somebody needs to get out and exercise more. This is a smaller size property and not scaled to the size of the MGM or Wynn or Venetian. If you enter the front door you could be at the pool or up to your room within 5 minutes. I like not having to walk for 20 minutes and get lost several times while trying to find something. The elevator wait got a little long Friday evening and Saturday. I would definitely return to this hotel. They are on the right track with all the improvements and it is obvious that they are taking the customer service seriously

Reviews.Title: “Enoyed our stay at the Tropicana with one exception”
Reviews.Author: santa4four
Reviews.Content: After a 6 hour flight delay we were more than ready to get into our room. We pulled up and asked where to park to go in and register and were told to go into the valet area since they weren't busy and then we could move the car.....valet didn't want us there and told us they would be parking the car....after awhile were told if they got busy they would move it but otherwise it would be there. If we hadn't been tired I am sure it wouldn't have been such a big deal but after over 10 hours at the airport and in the air it wasn't needed. But registration greated us wonderfully and upon telling them about the valet we had the nightly fee taken off and were given complimentary tickets to "The Mob". The new rooms were wonderful and the bed heavenly. The only thing really missing in the Trop is a lower end sandwich shop or a place you can get breakfast. The other restaurants were nice but not what I wanted for a breakfast. All staff were very accomodating to every request that was made of them. Overall we really enjoyed our stay at the new Trop!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: denist_eg
Reviews.Content: Hi, stayed at the Tropicana Hotel April 24th to the 28th. This was our first time in Las Vegas. Lots of fun and a great place to visit including a few days at the grand canyon - south rim. The hotel is close to everything and is easily accessible. Our room had a great view on other hotels on the strip (NY NY and Excalibur). The hotel guests were mostly adults which we found pleasing - since we were vacationing away from our kids. There was a little noise from the ongoing construction, but the level was acceptable to us.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvs2travelthew0rld
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana is undergoing an180 million dollar upgrade. We received fast, friendly service upon checking in. All of the staff were friendly and helpful - from the Concerige to the Housekeeping Staff. Our room was nice , and had a view of the strip. The beds were too soft for my liking and bothered my back. The weather was great the week that we were there and we were able to relax by the pool. There is still lots of construction happening on the outside close to the pool but it was fine. The breakfast buffet at Cafe Niki was excellent -- lots of fresh fruit and yogurt, an omlette station and some pastries and choices of bacon, sausage, etc The coffee was really good here as well as the freshly squeezed orange juice. Again the staff were friendly and attentive. We went to the Brad Garreet Comedy Club on our last night there -- Don't go to the comedy club! The drinks were expensive and the show was awful. The MC was pretty good, and the comic that opened the show was okay, but the headliner was terrible. He had a few good jokes -- but for the most part he was very crude -- it was very disappointing. Any of the staff that I spoke to, loved working there -- and it showed in how they treated their guests.

Reviews.Title: “The Tropicana was Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: TracyEllen056
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Las Vegas and because I read so much about the renovations, decided to give it a try, and the price was right. From the moment we walked through the door we loved this place. Clean, comfortable, and everyone was very nice. Checked in 3 hours early and it wasn't a problem. Was in our room within 20 minutes of arriving. Loved the pool area, and the Cafe Nikki was excellent. Not a bad thing to say about this place. Some of the bigger hotels are nice, but a little too busy for our taste. Would definetly stay here again! We stayed in the back tower and even though it was a little bit of a walk, we didn't mind. Had a great view overlooking the pool.

Reviews.Title: “tropicana - fantastic !”
Reviews.Author: matlad
Reviews.Content: my wife and I spent a week at Tropicana for our 10th wedding anniversary in early April. The room was lovely and spacious,clean, comfortable,and cleaned each day. Pool area fantasitic,clean towels on sunbeds,very clean and tidy, my personal favourite was the jacuzzi in the pool. Casino, small and more friendly than the larger casinos. Cafe Nikki was a nice restautant, although food not to our taste. Overall a lovely hotel in a good position on the strip,with friendly & helpful staff, good value for money, even though we lost quite a bit in their casino(we won it back across the road at the excalibur)!. We would certainly rebook!

Reviews.Title: “What an improvement!”
Reviews.Author: Laura E
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 day stay at the Tropicana. We knew they had just spent $180 million on renovations, so we were very hopeful. We were not disappointed in the least. The service was excellent from the moment that we called for reservations, to our check in (which we were accomodated at a very early hour) our easy friendly (late) check out and every moment in between. We were upgraded to a suite on the 19th floor and it was FABULOUS! Everything was very clean and top notch. The beds and the bedding were wonderful and we are picky. I have seen comments about thin walls, but we thought the very opposite, we never heard a sound. Nikki Beach is still under construction but the existing pool area was great. While busy, we never had an issue getting a lounger and lots of employees were hustling everywhere to make sure the guests were taken care of. Loved the music that was playing all the time at the pool and those frozen drinks (while pricey at $10 ea) were heaven. The casino is very nice and every staff memeber we interacted with was always wonderful. I am so happy to see this place revived as it really is such a great location and the crowd itself has gotten younger by several decades.

Reviews.Title: “A+++++++ Tropicana is THE place to be in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Frank_Slegers
Reviews.Content: After several trips to Vegas decided to try out the new and improved Tropicana. Making that choice was the jackpot for this trip. All the renovations look wonderful. Friendliest staff to be found on the Strip. People enjoying their work and showing it. Tropicana does really feel like a home away from home! Bright and fresh colour throughout the whole resort. Beautiful rooms with 42 inch flatscreen, safe and real comfortable beds. Everything is new. Also go see the Las Vegas Mob Experience because it absolutely is an experience!!! Beautiful interactive "museum" with a large amount of relics and some great "wiseguy-actors" in there entertaining you. Check it out, you won't be disappointed. Also go see Gladys Knight. She still is one of the best soul-diva's out there. Her voice still is nothing less than amazing. We went to Brad Garret's Comedy Club when Brad Garret himself was performing together with Mike Marino and another comedian. That was so much fun and the show took over 2 hours. Well worth the money we spent. Would we recommend Tropicana to others? YOU BET! Go give them a try when you go to Vegas. Don't expect it to be like the Wynn of Encore but expect to get the best buy for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Trop is back”
Reviews.Author: magician29
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Trop. Our room was comped, but we were still concerned because Tropicana used to be terrible. However, now, it is awesome. The rooms are spacious and clean. The casino was great too. If we were to go back to Vegas, we would definitely stay at Tropicana again. I did not give it a 5-star because this hotel is not a 5-star Vegas hotel. It is not a Wynn. But it does not have to be. It is awesome in its own right. If you are looking for awesome, update, spacious, clean rooms, then the Trop is right for you. If you are looking for spa treatments, heated floors, high end restaurants, huge casinos, then you may want to consider a pricier option. There were only a couple of minor issues. First, the elevators are terribly slow. We were on the 17th floor and once had to wait over 4 minutes for one to arrive. Second, the walls in the rooms are not sound proof. We could hear our neighbors talking and coughing. Definitely try it out if you get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal establishment that exceeded expenctations by a mile!”
Reviews.Author: PhillyBilly24198
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas five times now, and three of those times I stayed at the Trop. The first time was in the summer of 2006, before any renovations happened, the second was the summer of 2010, when renovations were under way but not nearly completed, and the most recent time was spring 2011, when things were really shaping up at the place. I gotta tell you, the incredible changes - all positive - I have seen at the Trop have been astounding. In '06, we went there because it was cheap and affordable, and we couldn't get be picky with where we stayed. The subsequent visits, however, boasted comparable prices with rooms and amenities that rival the best of the best in Vegas and around the world. The rooms were gorgeously decorated in the style of South Beach, with lots of warm whites reminiscent of flowing linens in the sun, and vibrant hot hues like oranges and yellows. The furniture was very well matched, and mostly made of wood. There were beautiful paintings depicting music and dance scenes from South Beach adorning many of the walls. The rooms themselves were wonderfully spacious, and the beds were to die for. When we first checked in we were greeted by a delightful Filipina woman named Yolanda, who held pleasant conversation while simultaneously being of huge assistance. As we walked the short distance to the rear tower, we were greeted nicely by virtually every staff member along the way. There were also a smattering of actors from the Trop's new Mob Experience (mroe on that later), who always stayed in character but still mingled and greeted guests, which was a lot of fun. The view was stunning, as the Trop is located at the same intersection that is shared by the MGM Grand, the Excalibur, and the NYNY. The TVs and all the other applicances/furniture/amenities were all brand new! At one point I called down to guest services and spoke to someone named Pat, and they were so pleasant and helpful. We were able to see the new Celine concert, Beatles LOVE, Ka, and go to attractions like Shark Reef and the Springs Preserve Museum, all because of the help of wonderful staff. Incidentally, we rode to the airport in a cab driven by an older Japanese-American man named Eddie, who said that the Trop has been his beat for over a decade. He asked us how we enjoyed our stay, to which we of course replied that we absolutely loved it. He then told us that he has seen a huge increase in the numbers of people (and therefore, business) at the Trop in the last year, and that every single one of them has been gushing about their stay at the place. He said that the positive changes in guest feedback have been completely consistent and entirely noticeable, whereas before the Trop was just another casino. Now it's a place to be. The place to be. In summary, if you're going to Vegas, stay at the Trop! There is no way that you will regret it! We were so pleased, and I know for a fact that I will be going to Vegas again, and that the Trop will be my hotel/casino when that happens.

Reviews.Title: “The Absolute Best Weekend Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: dkay1211
Reviews.Content: My friend and I planned a Las Vegas girls weekend to celebrate our recent 40th birthdays. We had been to Vegas together in the early 90's and stayed at the Tropicana then and wanted to "relive the fun"! =) We couldn't have asked for a better weekend. From start to finish, staying at Tropicana was top notch. My friend had emailed them ahead of time about our celebration. When we checked in, we received an free upgrade to a strip view room and 2 tickets to the Mob Experience (comp) to help celebrate our weekend. The renovated hotel is gorgeous and the rooms are very nice. Beds were extremely comfortable. This hotel was the only one we noticed that had doormen opening the doors for you every time you left and came in...little touches mean a lot! One day we went to the pool, and while it is still partly under construction, the open area was wonderful. It was a little crowded and one of the gentlemen working at the pool area told us to wait while he rounded us up 2 lounge chairs together and brought towels. What a relaxing day we had at the pool!! We spent one evening in the hotel lounge listening to a great band. Our bartender, Pat, was super friendly and mixed awesome drinks!! The Mob Experience was REALLY fun...even more so than we expected it to be. It was easy to walk to many other hotels and to catch the tram right across at MGM. Everyone and everything from check in to check out was fabulous. The only thing we didn't get to try was any restaurants there....just not enough hours in the weekend. I would highly recommend staying at the Tropicana and I will plan to stay there anytime I go to Vegas...our expectations were exceeded at the Tropicana!!! Thanks for a incredibly fun stay and a memorable weekend!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Digs”
Reviews.Author: westcitytraveler
Reviews.Content: First time staying at Tropicana since going to Vegas for the past several years. I was not too thrilled at first but i got a good deal through a vacation bundle. Did not regreat it, it is nice. Renovation is still ongoing here and there, none of it affected my stay or my tower, it did bother my friend in the front tower, he had no view at all, but I know its only temporary. They did a nice job with the rooms, everything is new. The only little complaint would be the shower head being too low and low water pressure. Had a fantastic time there and if you know Vegas well, the Tropicana is right on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected except one thing...”
Reviews.Author: mskai32
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Tropicana for 3 nights. I stayed in the Paradise Tower. I love the location of this tower. After you exit the elevator you are on the casino floor. The room was very nice. This is nice comfortable place to stay at an inexpensive hotel. Everything was great about the hotel, room was great, elevators were great, Roulette table was good, & the staff was great. There is only one thing, I have a few bumps that itch on my body & I am not sure if it was bites from Bed Bugs from the room or mosquitoes. I didn't see any mosquitos but my boyfriend said he did.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE...GREAT SERVICE...FRIENDLY...ITS THE NEW TROPICANA”
Reviews.Author: pdvarg
Reviews.Content: I took a four day vacation to Las Vegas with my six year old son. I had reservations at the Flamingo which is where we started out trip on Thursday night (where I had also stayed before and like the central location on the strip). A few problems such as: a) their Deluxe rooms not Deluxe and pictures on internet does not properly reflect the room, I even showed them to a few of the staff and they basically squinted and then laughed "no way"..."those are some good pictures" they said b) their very nice website insinuates that all rooms have been remodeled when really only the Go Deluxe rooms were remodeled, I thought the only difference between GO DELUXE and DELUXE was the fact that the Go room is more for business travelers with iphone stuff, etc...but the truth is that only the GO rooms are remodeled the others are from 20 years or so ago... c) they seperated their swimming pool (probably the best thing of the hotel) which has three slides into two pools; 3/4 of it went to the ADULT POOL and 1/4 of it to the children/family leaving only two working slides out of the three slides available; in addition to the fact that the slide pool is tiny. Also there was no vibe or atmosphere in the family pool...just because we have children doesn’t mean we dont' enjoy nice music...ALSO NO JACUZZI IN THE FAMILY POOL... When I arrived at the Flamingo I had upgraded to the Go Deluxe Room for $40.00 a night because the girl at front desk confirmed that the regular Deluxe room was the same room from “when I used to visit in my 20’s” as I put it because I was in disbelief especially after seeing the website. Then after visiting the pool area and having to sit on a rock while my son played on the slide, it forced me to go complain to Manager. He did nothing for me other than to tell me “we reserve the right to make changes to the hotel”…”the picture online properly reflects the Standard room”…he kept saying “Standard Room” although its called “Deluxe” online. He had a speech ready which I’m sure he had used millions of times since a lot of people complain (which was confirmed by the Concierge Desk when I was complaining to them). In any event, I called Tropicana that evening and made reservations for Friday, Saturday nights. I was very pleased...the room wasn't ready when we got there and it was getting to 2:30 pm and so the front desk gentlemen removed the resort fee for the two days. (BTW VERY VERY reasonable resort fee compared to other hotels - $9.99). The rooms was really nice and clean and the beds comfortable (stayed in 1621); they did remodel their rooms very nicely. The pool atmosphere was nice, liked the music. NIKI CAFE was awsome!!!! The food was fresh, clean, waiters/waitresses friendly, loved the feel of the outside seating and the high top tables. The view with the waterfall beautiful! I used to stay at Tropicana in my 20's and always enjoyed the atmosphere although the rooms were run down. To my surprise everything has changed and the Hotel, the Service exceeded my expectations fully! Tropicana may not be glitzy with all the expensive stores like Mandalay Bay or MGM...but it is a great value. Very clean and very friendly. I will highly recommend it to my friends with kids and those without kids espcially when Niki Beach opens...BEing alone there with my son, I felt safe in the Tropicana environment...felt welcomed and taken care of. Overall had a great time with my son. We watched KA and a magic show, went to Adventuredome. Shark Reef, I will definitely be back to the Tropicana. Best value for your money and you can use the savings on the hotel cost to go watch the many awesome shows.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: 4nsic1
Reviews.Content: It was outstanding. The rooms were decked out in tropical style and the beds were very comfortable. If it wasn't for the windows, it would feel like a lanai... minus the real beach view. They are expanding the pool and the deck around it. So the whole experience is only going to get better. The tropical landscape was a great place to relax away from the hustle and bustle of The Strip. You can get lost in these large hotels and there was always a smiling and helpful face to point us in the right direction. I will definitely go back here the next trip to Las Vegas. Book online directly on their website (not travelocity, etc) and you get to use the VIP line to check in faster.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and bright”
Reviews.Author: Alexander278
Reviews.Content: As a solo female traveler, my attention was focused on security. The front desk clerk was very accomodating and did her best to fulfill my requests. The Paradise Tower elevator is located right inside of the front entrance off the lobby. I requested this tower because the other tower was quite a walk from the entrance. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very nice, the view from the 12th floor was lovely and focused on the South Strip, Excalibur, Luxor and Mandalay Bay. I dined at the Nikki restaurant once and it was very good. The casual Noodle bar was also good. The hotel doesn't have a dedicated buffet, which I would have liked. My only complaint was the security at the room elevators;there was none. No one was checking key cards and on two occasions pizza delivery restaurants were up on my tower floor putting coupons under the doors. I think that a person should always be checking key cards or that a swipe system should be installed to assure that only registered guests can access the accomodation towers. All in all a pleasant stay...I would stay again if the security issue mentioned above is corrected.

Reviews.Title: “an oasis in an otherwise hectic town”
Reviews.Author: bussy_11
Reviews.Content: go there before the price goes up because it will. the remodelling of this hotel has been done with taste, and quality. Hopefully that just new look, smell and nice touches won't ware off. Also the enthusiastic, helpful staff were a pleasure. Well done to the Tropicana. Its the only hotel for us in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Hey Vegas veterans! Give the Trop another shot!”
Reviews.Author: LuvtheSteelers
Reviews.Content: If you previously stayed at the Tropicana, but thought it was old, out-dated, not-so-clean, GIVE IT ANOTHER TRY!!! My Husband and I had stayed at the Tropicana MANY times over the past 15 years. Our past few visits we decided to stay elsewhere. However, after viewing the Tropicana's website as well as traveler reviews, we decided to try the Tropicana again. We were VERY pleasantly surprised! We arrived at about 9:15am hoping to check in. Doug at the front desk explained the rooms were not yet ready but offered to call me on my cell phone as soon as one was available. We were so happy when he called in less than an hour to say a room was available! (After our LONG trip from Pittsburgh, we were eager to check in and change clothes) Upon entering our room, we were elated to see the completely remodeled and oh-so-clean room! (Yes I even brought a flashlight to check for the much dreaded bed-bugs...finding absolutely NOTHING) EVERYthing in the rooms has been replaced! Since we were able to check in before 11 am, I decided to hit the pool for some sun. The pool area AND the pool itself were VERY clean. There was a little noise from the construction underway on the other side of the pool area and it was drowned out very nicely (not even noticable) by the music playing ! The new pool area should be finished by May....judging from the progress the crew made during our short stay, I'd say they are on target. All renovations are very nicely done. (I was told there is yet another stage of construction to come!) The rooms are quiet, nicely renovated yet still affordable. The staff was very accomodating. The pool was clean and tranquil. The rooms and hallways were clean, remodeled, yet still the most affordable on the strip. The casino is clean with new machines...Even the slots were fairly 'friendly' ! We stayed for 5 days/4 nights (Including a Friday) for under $300. I will stay here again! Great value for your money!

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Dream”
Reviews.Author: decemberlady
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be very traveler friendly with a quick and easy check in. Our room was large and comfy. We had a great view of the strip.Our television was not working properly, but a call to staff had service within 10 minutes.The rooms were cleaned daily. The Cafe Nikki offered a romantic setting at it's outdoor tables.Reminder, at check in a 9.99 Resort daily fee was added to our prepaid bill. A minus was the block out shutters did not really block out the lights. If you are not a big city person the almost hourly sirens hinder your sleep Overall, this is a beautiful place to stay in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Good first experance to Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: tmac59
Reviews.Content: Even though the hotel is still going through renovations our stay was very comfortable.We weren't to happy with the fact that our room wasn't cleaned properly every day...mirrors,toilets,counters ect. not even wiped down,but the bed was changed and the floors were clean.For our first stay we had nothing to compare too I believed the hotel to be very beautiful and the staff friendly. Thanks for a good first experirnce.

Reviews.Title: ““All in all a good experience””
Reviews.Author: jadams444
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tropicana Las Vegas for 3 days over Valentine's day. The hotel and casino have gone through major renovations and I was pleasantly surprised by the upscale nature of this hotel. I generally find that "casino hotels" are a bit "tired" for all the wear.
