And some of the other places we were in had that smell of stale tobacco smoke Our room was very clean and quiet and had a comfy king bed w/heavy comforter. I was very happy here, particularly for the convenience of walking back to my room after a late night at the casino.The casino is bright and cheerful .The lobby/check-in was well staffed and friendly, and eager to help on a moment's notice. We checked in early and our room was not yet ready but we were offered another room in the Island Tower. I have read the reviews and it seemed people have found staying there was a long and boring walk to their room, so we decided to check our bags and wait till or room in the Paradise Tower was ready. The next day we decided to see for ourselves how boring this walk would have been. i can honestly say that is quite the contrary. The walk down the connecting walkway was no trouble at all.(6-8 minutes) And the views from that tower were fantastic. I would stay in either tower when we go back. Unfortunately the pool was closed during our stay but it sure looked very inviting and the grounds just added to it. Also the location of the hotel is at the quiet end of the strip which was quite nice if you wanted to go out for a late walk. All in all the tropicana is a great place to stay. Good service and it seems they are always willing to help or improve if anything needs it! we will definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “RECYCLED PERCUSSION - AWESOME SHOW!”
Reviews.Author: NHlakelover
Reviews.Content: What a great show!! These guys are fantastic!! You've got to see it to believe it! So energetic - and great that they involve the audience too! Did not stay at this hotel but did use the casino - very bright & clean - friendly staff. Trip Advisor would not let this show be rated in another catagory so using the "hotel" to rate the show - a must see!!

Reviews.Title: “Day two of pleasant surprises”
Reviews.Author: brousmith
Reviews.Content: As promised, I wanted to add photos of the property. Room are very roomy. Called room service one night the biggest club sandwich I ever ate

Reviews.Title: “The light tropical colonial decor is easier on the eye than the dark formal looks of some of the other casinos.”
Reviews.Author: Aussietourist45
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews about the Tropicana on this site I was a apprehensive about what it would be like but I was pleasantly surprised. The refurbished rooms are lovely, with the biggest bed I have ever slept in and plenty of room. The rest of the complex was still undergoing renovations but it didn't really affect our stay and from what I could see the end result should look great. The light tropical theme is nicer than the dark formal decor of some of the other casinos and the fact that the front desk and the elevators (to the paradise tower) were actually at the front rather than hidden down behind the gaming areas was a plus to this non gambler. The location is pretty good too.

Reviews.Title: “The new Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: TMac_10
Reviews.Content: The people at the "new" Tropicana have gone to a lot of work to upgrade their hotel/resort. The rooms (Paradise Tower) are good, not five star but very comfortable and really how much time do you need to spend in a room in Las Vegas anyway.The resort itself is nice and bright and the service was great. The casino was on the small side but not overly busy and crowded. We found the Tropicana to be in a perfect location to visit all the southern casinos. Nice easy walk to shopping and dining nearby. The only complaint I have is that the Trop Plus card benefits were not explained very well. Check your points periodically as you can get free meals and shows. Luckily we had charged some meals to our room and they were kind enough to apply our points to the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable staff..great staff...hollow walls”
Reviews.Author: chickenoregg
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the Tropicana very much...the room was big, the bed comfortable, the hotel clean. I did hear a good amount of noise from both the hall and from the room next door on my first evening there - however, by the second night I think the rooms next to me were empty so i had pleasant sleep. If I was there for fun I wouldn't have cared at all though...for I would have been out on the town instead of in at earlier hours. The staff was great - very helpful and accomidating. The restaurants were great as well....food was delicious! I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “decent for the price”
Reviews.Author: hotel2010
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick and easy. The Airconditioning smelt like cigarette smoke when turned on. Called for someone to check it out. they replaced the filter, but it still smelt the same. It was a bit warm in the room, but to avoid the smell I didnt turn on the aircon. If i was to come back, id stay in a more central hotel. Ceasers place, bellagio, cosmopolitian. The casino was quite small, and the hotel I found was quite boring compaired to the other casinos that had lights and themed. Rooms are of good size. Plasma TV. Internet good. kinda close to bus stops. Good for the price, I found that if your young(likes us) and wanna stay somewhere where there is young ppl. Dont come to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: brousmith
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are currently at this property and decided to write this review. You may see more to follow as the trip continues. The construction stands out when you first get here, but the potential is very obvious. The check in was fast and friendly. We were given an upgrade to a strip view room and for 75 dollars more we could have stayed in a suite. The people at the front very friendly and as a person not a number. We walked around and I loved that smell suntan lotion..just hint of the tropics..looking at the services the Starbucks is now open...my wife very happy about this new addition. More to follow

Reviews.Title: “Super renovations, quite pleased with our stay...”
Reviews.Author: letsgosomewheres
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth time in Vegas. We usually choose a hotel more central of the strip but because of a huge convention going on that week, we were not willing to pay the overpriced hotel rates that were posted for that particular weeks stay. The Tropicana hotel was much more affordable so we booked 6 nights from March 23rd to the 29th. Gerald or Gerard (not sure) was very nice at the front desk for accommodating 2 couples who were joining us a few days later and had reserved rooms next to ours upon their arrival. The rooms were clean and beds were quite comfortable. The casino was nice and the tables were affordable ( not like $50. min. bets) and lots of slot machines available. Very friendly staff at the small gift shop at the entrance. The dealers were very nice except for the ones on the craps table commenting that they had a audience and that they would charge $20 for watching. We found that pretty unprofessional as we were only trying to learn the rules of the game so we could try playing, but with those comments, we just walked away. We were quite pleased with our stay. The only downfall was that we had to take taxis mostly everywhere because of the location of this hotel. Of course we stayed at the Ceasars Palace, the Bellagio, Planet Hollywood and Luxor the other times and Tropicana is not comparable, but on the other hand, when you stay at those fancy places you have to go elsewhere to play the tables because of the high limits they have there. I would probably stay more central next time only because we like to walk and visit around and Tropicana was a bit too far on one end. Another great service at the front desk was they printed out our boarding passes for our early morning flights and let us check out the night before. Really nice place to stay would recommend to friends anytime. PE, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money”
Reviews.Author: Liliane11120
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Las Vegas, stayed at the Tropicana. Very nice. The room was spacious, very clean, comfy beds, flatscreen t.v. We asked for a coffee maker, they provided us with one, no problem, We even got bottled water. They waved the hotel fees of $9.99 per day. Dined at Bacci restaurant, excellent. Stayed in the Paradise tower wich is closer to the casino. Best hotel for your money. Would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, cozy, ..”
Reviews.Author: ilanaum
Reviews.Content: We are stayed in this hotel for 6 nights. We came to the hotel early. In the front desk Ms. Gwen helped us, she was so nice and helpful!!!! She gave us a very nice room with an amazing view of the strip. I am really appreciated to Gwen, for making my vacation pleasurable. Everything was perfect. Thank, for such a nice vacation Ilana , Adanessa

Reviews.Title: “Refurbished areas are great; care over housekeeping and wi-fi.”
Reviews.Author: mtjon007
Reviews.Content: In Room 1731 in Paradise Tower as I type. As a summary, I'd say the hotel is looking good (still ongoing work), our room was very good, the staff are friendly, the quick food options are pretty good, the housekeeping is poor (bins not emptied when full, bed not made up!), wi-fi took five phone calls before they got it sorted. In a bit more detail: 1. Hotel is easy to find from airport as it's at the airport endcof the strip. Parking's easy. Chek-in was fast. Room pleasing. 2. Yes, the hotel is a little out of the main drag but it's next to MGM, New York New York and Luxor so no big deal. 3. It's very easy to get to the I15 which is a great way of avoiding the Strip when you're driving. Once you've driven the Strip you'll know why that's important! 4. Wi-fi was a pain. We had three devices none of which worked at various times. Very frustrating. 5. Housekeeping was desperate. To the point that we were clearly totally missed one day. 6. Good parts about being in this location include the fact that there's slightly less hubbub at night, and it's near the Town Centre Mall which has a good cinema and eating options and is so simple to drive to. You can get the deuce bus to it too. 7. Didn't use the casino but as an observation it's far less smokey and much brighter than others. Many reviewers have commented on the aroma throughout th hotel. I found it quite pleasant. 8. Pool area will be good. Massively under construction as I type so we're like sardines on the sunbeds that are round the open part of the pool. It's ok though and I think it will be very good once completed. 9. I must comment. You can walk to The Cosmopolitan Hotel. They do a buffet there, the Wicked Spoon. It is brilliant! Overall, I like The Tropicana as it's much "easier', than being in the main drag and I'd happily stay here again - housekeeping notwithstanding!!

Reviews.Title: “It should be called "THE NEW Tropicana" - Forget the old one”
Reviews.Author: Valdiri
Reviews.Content: Great experience - WILL stay at The Trop next time. Why? 1- Value for $ - Room was brand new - loved it. Great bed. White duvet cover. Louvered blinds (they do block out the light if you know how to turn them.. not as well as a black-out curtain of course) 2 - Staff - always helpful 3 - Convenient - Paradise Tower elevators right at front door. Walk to room is short because this is a smaller property. 4. Easy to drive to. Renting a car? Getting in and out of The Trop is a breeze. And given it's location, you avoid strip traffic compared to hotels further north. I am looking forward to the new restaurants that have opened since I was there and the poker room too. The old Tropicana had a terrible reputation - the NEW Tropicana is awesome (for the price!) If you prefer to spend more, stay at The Cosmopolitan! For me The Trop was great... I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and a great bargain!”
Reviews.Author: DaveDworkin
Reviews.Content: The Trop has been greatly improved, but keep in mind that it's a work in progress. Construction is ongoing and it's getting better every day. My room on the 9th floor of the Paradise Tower has been completely redone. At that height the sirens rarely disturbed me, though I'd rather not hear them at all. Earlier reviews claiming a lack of a coffee shop and inexpensive food are no longer true. On the way to Cafe Nikki you'll find a 24-hour coffee shop and a separate 24-hour deli. The latter has generous sandwiches for under $9, but beware the $7 beer. I had a delicious cheese steak sandwich there. The also have a 24-hour mini-store near the main entrance with $4 sandwiches. I would have eaten at Cafe Nikki, but all the tables were taken when I tried to walk in for lunch. The staff wasn't just first-rate; many of them seemed to really be enjoying their jobs. A few of them were singing while they worked. One even danced around a bit. My only complaint is that the shower took several minutes to warm up, even though the faucet in the sink warmed up quickly. So if you get room 930, just start the shower and brush and floss your teeth. It should be warm by the time you're done.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: Jtcacti
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the new Tropicana on our most recent stay in Vegas ( Feb 26th - March 1st) and it lived up to our expectations of a true renovation. Prior to our stay we contacted Nicole Marshall and booked a Penthouse Suite for our stay. The room was gorgeous. Two floors, spiral carpeted staircase between, a master bath complete with garden tub and a walk in shower that could fit six people easily, a second bathroom downstairs, and our favorite- the jacuzzi hot tub on the main floor. The room offered a great view of Mandalay Bay, Luxor, and the Excalibur. The Tropicana sits in a great location on the strip, some may say it's too far south, but with tram access to MB and the Luxor via the overpass to Excalibur, and the overpass walkway to MGM the Trop sits in the main action on the southern half of the strip. We were able to gamble quite a bit and I will commend the blackjack dealers on having a personality, at times that's a rarity in a casino, and they have good overall table odds on all betting levels (3:2). The one complaint given during the trip would have to be noise. I am unsure if it was simply the guests staying next to us or continuous construction but my wife was unable to sleep the duration of our trip. When recommending a hotel to a new Vegas visitor or even frequent visitors I would definitely give the Tropicana high marks overall. Thank you Nicole for the wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overall - Greatness”
Reviews.Author: jeffrey014
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas 4 times now and on my last visit I stayed at the Tropicana with a few buddies and we had a GREAT experience. Rooms - were very nice, TV, ipod speakers, comfortable beds -everything you need. Loved the pool - comfy lounge chairs (better than at the last couple places i've stayed). All the staff were friendly around the casino, the pool, the cafe. We even had a great chat with 'Steve' the doorman while we smoked a cigar outside. I would definitely stay at Tropicana again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, Even if Just for a Night”
Reviews.Author: kristy3251
Reviews.Content: I am a local here in Las Vegas, my girlfriends and I stayed at the Tropicana for our "girls night out." The hotel was in a great location for night life and dining. The room was spacious and offered plenty of room for all of us to enjoy. AM room service was extremely fast and the breakfast was delicious. I would definitely stay here again, and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana-Revised and Revitalized!”
Reviews.Author: jrzshore
Reviews.Content: I last went to the Topicana 6 or 7 years ago. I was not impressed. It was run down, a hallway to one of the towers was a bazaar during the day, and there were mirrors on the ceiling. CLASSY~! However, times have changed! The exterior has undergone a facelift, keeping it's old-Cuba theme without looking like... well, modern Cuba. The inside was re-done, fresh paint all over. It still boasts one of the smaller casino floors in Vegas, which is GREAT for those of us who aren't huge gamblers. The rooms have been changed, no longer sleazy but very much classier. Even the bathrooms were re-done! Added to the hotel are a Starbucks (sadly and annoyingly not opened yet!), an over-priced grill (but surprisingly tasty pizza!), and a Nikki Cafe, which is attached to the soon-to-be-completed Nikki Beach pool they're building! Overall, a happy experience here, and while not the multitude of things to see/do as most of the other casinos, it's close to them, and cheaper, so you really can't go wrong. Just avoid a bartender there, bald guy, think his name is Jeff. What a jerk.

Reviews.Title: “Dont go there. They are a disgrace”
Reviews.Author: jackhales
Reviews.Content: Went with a group of friends to the gambling capital of the world. Only to find that after winning a couple of hundred quid on the tables i was escorted by security to my room. I hadn't had a drink and was well behaved. Just having a bet and won a few but obviously this hotel tropicana is built only for people who are losing their money whilst gambling. I mean come on a couple of hundred its not retirement money is it? In short choose another place

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a great resort!”
Reviews.Author: phone4u
Reviews.Content: We traveled for my son's 21st birthday. I booked this hotel off of bookit.com and was a little uneasy because of the rating. This hotel was outstanding. Our rooms were up-to-date, flat panel tv's and all. The view of the strip was awesome. The hotel was very clean and from the looks of the construction going on, there is only better things to come! The food was also great! The casino was wonderful also! Majority of the dealers at the table games were very friendly. I mainly followed Randy! He was super! We will be returning to Tropicana soon!

Reviews.Title: “Extra Charges - Beware”
Reviews.Author: Debonator
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Las Vegas so I didn't know what to anticipate. There was no benefit derived from the 'resort fee' - except free local calls. I knew one person who lived in Las Vegas, but I am certain the number of calls made did not amount to $11/day. There were no (non-smoking) rooms available so I was given a suite at no extra charge for a few days. It was an inconvenience having to switch rooms mid-vacation. It was funny how even the shampoo/conditioner bottles were downgraded to half-size when I moved out of the suite. No coffee maker, no bottled water......ouch! But I did score a bathtub and it was nice to soak after a long day at the dusty canyon. Also, it wasn't until I arrived home that I noticed I had been billed for rooms even though I had an all-inclusive package. The staff was helpful in reversing the charges, however, I have yet to see the reversal on my credit card. Caution: Check your hotel invoice carefully. I would have to stay at several other resorts in order to make a fair comparison, however, I would recommend the Tropicana to friends.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Spinniecur
Reviews.Content: stayed there for a week, the rooms are nice, staff very friendly, most of them are smiling all the time overall a great week

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: prisk04
Reviews.Content: we really like our stay at the hotel. We could not say anything that would be wrong. Had a starbucks which was great for my friend. Ahd a great deal by bookit.com for $44 a night. Great pool, great staff .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - hope it stays reasonable”
Reviews.Author: ohiofoodluv
Reviews.Content: I'm afraid to write this as I want it to be 'my' hidden Vegas gem. We got an amazing rate. I thought more of the renovations would be done when we got there... but when done it will be fabulous. The weather wasn't great but we got an hour by the 'old' pool and it was like being on a tropical vacation with the green, palm trees and winding pools. The casino always seemed to be alive which was fun. On the down side...the rooms were nice... but the large window slats didn't block out much light... and you could hear everything in the hallways. The beds were VERY comfortable though. For a new reno there was a HUGE koolaid stain on our floor (not by us). My friend said the service at Nikki Cafe was horrible ( I didn't make it myself). There are nicer places on the Strip but this is so worth the price... as my subject says, I hope it stays reasonably priced!

Reviews.Title: “Worth it. Give it a try.”
Reviews.Author: sun987
Reviews.Content: First off, this is our 6th trip to Vegas, and we have stayed at many hotels. After reading many positive reviews on the New Tropicana I thought I would contact Nicole Marshal to check out what kind of deal we could get. She is the main reason we decided to book, she is prompt, helpful and very nice to talk to on the phone. The only thing is we did try to meet her during our stay and we were never able to thank her in person. I digress, before the trip started, Nicole gave us great deals/rates for our five day visit that I cancelled our free/comped stay at MGM as I figured it was worth a try. She made our dinner reservations at Biscayne for us and the meal was very good, got us tickets to Recycled Percussion which was fun, but was very short, not even an hour long. I read that staff at the Trop are exceptional, we on the other hand never met any staff that left any lasting impression on us. None were rude but none went out of their way to help us except for Patrick the doorman/bellman, when we arrived he was very attentive. The casino is bright, abit too much for me, but was clean and enjoyed the cocunut scent throughout the property. We did play slots quite abit here, never won anything, and we would have liked it to have been bigger with more selection, but that is just our personal preference. Food choices are not great at the moment but were told that quicker food options are underway, which will be nice since right now there is no place to pick up a quick slice of pizza, coffee etc. Our room was nice, clean, and a good size for a standard room, but I was dissapointed on the floor and view, since I did request higher/strip view, and we received 10th floor facing construction and Hooters, but again, we do not stand looking out the window for hours on end so this was not a huge deal for us, just would have been a nice perk to have had it. The bathrooms like others have said, still look abit worn and dated, but they serve the purpose. Housekeeping was always done when we returned to our room around 5.00 pm everydaynto freshen up except the very first day it was still not done, but we just went downstairs for about an hour and when we returned the room was cleaned. We had internet in our room that worked quickly and was nice to have. All in all, we will definately stay at the Trop again, we like that location, but we like to walk alot. We hope our next visit the construction is done, and the food choices are better. Thank you to Nicole for all she did to make our trip nice, it was much appreciated. Oh one more thing, our flight home was not till 8.30 pm, and she arranged a late checkout for 4.00 but mentioned to ask that day to see if we could extend it till 6.00 pm and the front desk did, for free. No other hotel has done that for us before, and this was really nice to have the day of our leaving since we had access to our room and did not have to worry about moving our bags early in the day. We are glad we tried the Tropicana, it is great value for your money, and once all is done it will be even better.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING rooms, service, and atomosphere!!”
Reviews.Author: jennmw76
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, clean, spacious rooms, service was first class and food was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: Kickit9
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights with my women's soccer team. At one point we did not have a wine opener. Our conversation about it was overheard and the tropicana employee said he would deliver one to our room and he did! Also, the valet and housekeepers were very friendly and prompt! I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Great rooms and pool too!

Reviews.Title: “The Trop was great and had loose slots!”
Reviews.Author: TxAndi
Reviews.Content: Booked the Tropicana after finding an excellent deal package. I'm so happy I did. The Tropicana was CLEAN, smelled great and had excellent customer service. Our room was nice with a great view of the strip and right next to NY NY, MGM, Mandalay Bay and Excalibur. The beds were super comfortable it made getting up in the morning difficult. Everything has been remodeled and looks great. It is located on one end of the strip near the airport so there will be a short walk to the center of the strip but hey its vegas and everyone should walk the strip and take in all the sights. There is still some construction going on in the pool but it didn't affect our stay because the main pool area was open. There was a couple of times when we could hear the construction early in the morning but it wasn't that big of deal..The best part of the Trop....loose slots! I played the Wheel of Fortune and I won 400 bucks! Others around me were winning too. This was the only hotel we hit at. I have stayed at other hotels such as Harrah's, Monte Carlo, Polo Towers and even Encore and I have to say Tropicana has been my favorite so far. Definitely worth it and the price is great.

Reviews.Title: “Can the coconut!”
Reviews.Author: TioPablo
Reviews.Content: Four days at the Tropicana were more than enough for me. To start with the positive, the hotel’s staff were uniformly pleasant and helpful, from the door staff and front desk right through housekeeping. Brad Garrett’s Comedy Club is fantastic, and if you get a chance to see comedian Michael Loftus when you are in Vegas, take it! The guy had our diverse group crying. On the down side, the awful odor of fake coconut that pervades the property is truly nauseating, and even extends to the restaurants. I’d guess that since the hotel likely has a higher proportion of chain smokers than many others in Vegas, they are trying to compensate with the Smell-O-Vision, but it doesn’t work. That, along with bright orange 1970s-era carpeting and a preponderance of trashy clientele (even by Vegas standards) made me regret my choice. The Tropicana’s location at the end of the Strip gets annoying very quickly, especially when you realize that its amenities (many still under construction) don’t measure up to the rest of the Strip. The restaurants, like many in Vegas, are staffed by well-meaning but untrained waiters. The pasta restaurant served me a $22 plate of the “house special” rigatoni which was simply inedible. The waiter did ask me how the food was, 20 minutes after serving it. While adequate, our room was nothing like the others noted in reviews below, lacking a fridge, coffee maker, or new decor. We weren’t offered any “free upgrades”, and we were charged a steep $75 for a late checkout at 5 p.m. The verdict: you can do a lot better for the same price in Vegas, and even the best staff can’t make up for a remote location and a bad smell. The comedy club is worth the long walk from your hotel on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “New Tropicana Las Vegas is fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: vegasgirl55
Reviews.Content: We ate at Biscayne...top notch service, excellent food presentation and such delightful tastes on every item our party of 4 ordered! The hotel renovations are truly noticeable and pleasing to the eyes, a nice mix of the new and the old. So nice that the hotel wasn't blown up to make room for something new, which isn't always better. Gladys Knight show as so much fun! She has energy, an excellent band and singers, and most of all, she sounded just exceptional. She is very humble and genuine, unlike many performers. Overall, the Tropicana was delightful and we will go back for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana delivers service, atmosphere, and fun”
Reviews.Author: BrendaJ73
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas many times. I always enjoy my visits, partly because I'm a pretty low maintenance person and partly because I'm prepared to roll with the punches to make the very BEST of my precious vacation time. We decided to stay at the Tropicana this trip, and I was so impressed with the place that it may become my new "regular" hotel. The service started before we ever left home. I emailed Nicole Marshall with some questions and requests, and she responded promptly with all the information I wanted. Hooray! I did not run into one grumpy or rude staff member the whole time I was there. Our waiter at Bacio was particularly awesome, as was the woman who checked us out. I wish I could remember their names to give them proper credit, but I'm terrible at that. One evening we needed more towels, and housekeeping was at our door within ten minutes, towels in hand. The room was fabulous. We got a suite in the Paradise Tower with a beautiful view of the Strip ... we could see MGM, Excalibur, NYNY and Monte Carlo quite well. We had a coffee maker, a refrigerator with bottled water, a desk, a couch, a nice chair with ottoman, a big flat screen TV and a bureau in the living room area. In the bedroom, of course, there was a cushy, inviting King bed, another TV, another chair, a closet with full length mirrored doors, two nightstands, and a safe large enough to store our laptop computer with plenty of space to spare. It was clean and spacious, and if there weren't a thousand things to do in Vegas, I could've spent hours just enjoying the room! Our room was cleaned and our amenities were replenished daily. FYI, they have hair dryers in the rooms, and they provide some pretty good smelling shampoo, conditioner, body wash and lotion if you want to travel lighter and leave yours behind! The casino was pleasant and enjoyable. I only play slots, so my opinion doesn't factor in table games, but they had a good variety of slots. I didn't win big, but if I held that against a property, I'd have to dislike MOST places in Vegas! The good news is that I didn't lose big, either. And although the casino is a bit smaller than surrounding ones, I liked it because I never felt disoriented. We ate once at Cafe Nikki and once at Bacio, and both meals were good. It's true that the Tropicana doesn't presently have a huge variety of eating options, but being located within easy walking distance to other places made it an absolute non-issue for us. The pool and hottubs were fantastic. Even though it was fairly busy while we were there, we found chairs by the pool pretty easily. My only complaint, and it's a minor one, is that if you want to use the hottub at night after the pool closes, there are no towels available nearby. So be prepared to bring towels from your room if you go down after 7 pm for a soak. During the day, there was ample staff to provide us with towels and drinks poolside! Go stay there and enjoy yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it...no complaints”
Reviews.Author: alanmansfield
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the MGM last year and it was big and impersonal. This year, we stayed in the Tropicana and loved it. Very easy to get to, lovely friendly staff, no shortage of booze when gambling!! There were 4 of us travelling and we all loved it. Can't wait to go back there...when all the renovations are done it'll be great.

Reviews.Title: “The Tropicana is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: amocat253
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Tropicana was excellent! We went down for a wedding and we were travelling with a one year old. The staff was amazing and helped accomodate all of our needs. We got an upgraded room and a free crib for our child. The room was beautiful and the fact it had a refrigerator and coffee maker was great. The food was delicious and the hotel was clean and bright. Overall we loved our stay and plan on returning. We would definitely recommend the Tropicana to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Without doubt top class”
Reviews.Author: jgafcw
Reviews.Content: I can't praise the Tropicana highly enough. The place itself looks amazing with all the refurbishments going on and now feels like a quality establishment. The rooms are lovely and clean a good size, great beds large screen tv what more do you need?? Maybe slightly better sound proofinglots of siren noise at night although it didn't stop me sleeping but a light sleeper might find it a little more troublesome. There were quite a few renovations going on when I stayed the one downside was the lack of open restaurants. Only one open was Cafe Nikki but that was superb and had great food (really wanted to try bacio pasta but wasn't open will definietly eat there next time) With this exception I didn't find any of the renovations got in our way. The best thing about The Tropicana is the staff everyone was so curtious to us through the whole trip, and when our flight home was cancelled due to bad weather the staff on the desks couldn't have helped us more, I really felt like a vip with the service we recieved, Special thanks go to Doug Worovski (sorry for the spelling) Who was brilliant. I plan to return to Las Vegas again this year and without a doubt I shall be returning to The Tropicana again it really is that good now!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is like gambling, either you win or loose”
Reviews.Author: emartinot
Reviews.Content: This will be a little of a long review. This was my first time in Vegas, and we prepared months ahead to ensure that we had an amazing time. Reading all the fabulous reviews about the Tropicana and the details and attention they have towards their guests, we decided to give it a shot. I started exchanging emails with Nicolle Marshall, guest relations manager, explaining to her that we were getting married and that I wanted to treat my wife to an special week in Las Vegas. Since I read that so many guests got upgrades and gifts for this special ocasion, she was kind enough to offer us a free upgrade upon availability. Lets divide this review into different aspects: Check in: Quick. Theres always a little line of people but nothing that will keep you waiting for more than 10 min. Upon check in, we were told that there was nothing available for an upgrade in the paradise tower (which is the one on top of the casino) but that we were gonna get a mini suite in the island tower. I like to walk, and the first two times we walked towards our room we were fine. But after the second time, it gets annoying. It is definitely a long long walk, and it feels longer if you've been walking all day. We were located in the first floor, last room. First night went by, and exactly at 7:45 am in the morning the construction of the new club (Nikki Beach) started. Someone with a motor drill was right outside our window drilling in a way that it felt he was inside with us drilling the bathroom. Needless to say I WALKED all the way to front desk and complained about it, and we were told that if we wanted to relocate to the paradise tower all they had to offer us was a regular room. Of course I took it cause id rather stay in a smaller room without the noise of a construction outside my window. We were offered our first night on them, a nice detail I guess, but I didnt get my sleep after that. Cleanliness: The rooms are nice. Clean. They can improve the bathrooms a little more, since they look old. But in general the renovations in the room are really nice, Nice TV, ipod dock, and cold A/C. Casino: Small, to me it was great cause since Im not a gambler, I could just walk around between the few tables they have and gamble here and there. One thing to note is that if you are playing slots, you will rarely be offered any drinks, as a matter of fact there were 2 times that I couldn't even see or find someone to ask for a drink. On the other hand when I was playing roulette and poker drinks were flowing all the time. Costumer service: Excellent. To me the nicest people in the hotel have to be the valet service, Outstanding, nice people that are always ready and running to get your car. People in check in were really nice as well. Food: We only had the chance to go to Cafe Nikki for breakfast, we got there around 10:15 am to find out that we had to wait 15 min to be sat, not because there were no tables (half the place was empty) but because they didnt have enough servers at the time. I was bugged by it. I wanted a nice patio table (there were like 6 open tables there) and I was told by the hostess that patio wasn't open anymore, that we had to wait for something in the dining room or we could just self sit ourselves at the bar. Needless to say, we sat at the bar, the breakfast buffet was great with really good and fresh food and at a decent price (16$). It really got me thinking why would you only have staff for half a restaurant and make people wait. Its just not my style to have breakfast at the bar, but then again, a lot of guests had to sit there in order to get quick service. Bartender was super nice. I cant give a review on the rest of restaurants since we didn't eat there. Rooms: The regular room that we had to get in the paradise tower, was between 2 suites, connected through doors. Which means if you have no luck and someone decides to throw a party, you are in for a long night. Luckily enough only one night we were bothered by noise coming from one of the suites, but be aware of this. Pool: Small nice pool, with people always offering you towels and making sure you are having a good time. Nothing outstanding, but im sure when the renovations are over is going to look much better. Check out: When we got to the check out, this lady handed me the final bill, which didn't have the first night that was i offered off. When i pointed this out, she said that there were no notes on it, and looked at me. Of course i asked for a manager, which came out immediately and was really nice and helpful. He just asked me for the name of the manager I talked to. Thankfully i remembered the name, but im so distracted that normally i tend to forget names, so be careful and if you talk to a manager or costumer service, make sure you remember the names of the people you are talking to. He then took off the night and offered us to waive the resort fee for all the hassle we went through. Conclusion: Tropicana is a nice hotel, with nice rooms and great costumer service. Sadly all this reviews saying that you get free stuff and upgrades, on my personal experience, didnt happen at all. All we got offered when we were walking to our room the first night was a "complimentary dinner", which we accepted, only to find out after more than 20 min talking to an asian lady that could barely speak english, that we had to attend a timeshare exposition the following day at 11am, and then find out that they were completely booked, so we wasted our time, their time, and we got no complimentary meal. My final thought is that you will have an average experience at the tropicana, with nice rooms and smiley people, but after my first time in Vegas, i realized that for the same price, or maybe a little more, I cant get a room in a much bigger and better managed property. All we got for our wedding week in Vegas was a waived resort fee, and a free night because there was a construction outside our window, otherwise, it would've been a regular hotel stay. No upgrade to a suite, no free tickets, no coupons (they were out of coupons books...really? in vegas?), not even a coupon for their comedy club. No hard feelings at all cause at least we got a clean room and nice service, but I won't be staying in tropicana next time I go to vegas. As for Mrs. Marshall, I emailed her the day before our check in to confirm everything, got no answer, or no follow up on our stay. Keep up the work. communicate better with your guests, finish those renovations, and im sure that the Tropicana will be a much better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: mamalad
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time at the tropicana this week! Shaunille checked us in and was awesome! She was able to get us an early check-in and bumped us to a great view. The rooms were beautiful and the beds, so comfortable! I would have been glad to take it home with me! I loved how clean and bright the room was. The only thing I didn't love was the walk to the pool, a long, confusing trek, and the pool closed early! oh well, still a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “o.k”
Reviews.Author: melkat12
Reviews.Content: Casino is small and many slot machines working poorly. Pool area pretty nice still working on it. Room very comfortable. Wife had to call front desk to bring kleenex and bath tissue one night because never got maid service one day. Restaraunts a little expencive and service in casino poor compared to others we stayed at in vegas on previous trips. Did have nice view and was quiet. Staff was helpful.Not as hip as described .No "Nikke Beach"

Reviews.Title: “Nice remodel!”
Reviews.Author: kablasha
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana has done a great job (so far) remodeling the hotel and rooms. The pool and hot tubs were enjoyable. The rooms were nice and beds very comfortable. The construction that was still going on wasn't annoying or in the way. Not all of the room had a full restoration however. One of the rooms we were in still had some moldy spots in the bathroom as well as some cracked/broken tiles around the tub faucet. The front tower is closer to the casino, but loud due to the proximity of the strip (think sirens all night). the back tower is a little walk from the casino, but closer to the pool and much more quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the ruff.loved it...loved it!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vegaslady58
Reviews.Content: Travel to Vegas 4 times a year....The Tropicana was incredible. Clean, Clean, Clean...The rooms and suites are magnificent...all brand new....and light and airy. The best staff in Las Vegas. They are warm nice people and it is clear they enjoy working for the new owner. They are so warm and genuine....they make you feel important and they cannot do enough. You know they are thrilled with the new owner, who by the way is on property. This is not a big corporate casino it is a friendly, warm, comfortable casino with all the bells and whistles of the big guys on the strip. The restaurants were outstanding...7 of us stayed at the Trop and we loved it.....we usually stay at Bellaggio...well I have to tell you we found a new home at the Trop and cannot wait to return. The staff could not do enough ....they were pro-active and friendly. We never waited for a drink while playing in the casino...My friend lost her diamond earring and the maid found it and returned it....she also left her slip in the slot machine late one night...would you believe the staff called her room and told her they had her money and she picked it up at the cage the next morning.....Honest People ....THE MOB EXPERIENCE IS FUN....This will be our new home in Vegas...We cannot wait to return..The pool area was great...they are opening Nikki Beach Memorial Day ...The manger at the cabana actually came in on her day off to say Goodbye to us.....unbelievable....What a warm Friendly, Beautiful Place ...BELIEVE ME BIGGER IS NOT BETTER....LOVED IT ....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time”
Reviews.Author: Lakersfan35531
Reviews.Content: Room was very nice,bed was a little too soft for me.Location is great,not far from anything.Service was better than great.From restaurant staff,bar,casino,security,all exceeded our expectations.Needed help with my father in-law getting in and out of hotel.Staff members were right there.One of my daughters had fallen ill on the casino floor,and in seconds there were four to five staff members assisting us.Guess all the excitement got to her.We had 12 family members staying and all of us thoroughly enjoyed this stay.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel does a great job!”
Reviews.Author: FreddyA32
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a business trip to Vegas and I stayed at the Tropicana. I wasn’t sure what to expect staying there, as I had only been to Vegas one other time, 5 years ago. Well, I have to tell you, I was delighted with my experience. Here are some details. The property: It looks pretty good, but they are clearly working on it right now to update it. I think in around 6 months it will have a new pool and a dance club. The room: The room was clean as a whistle with contemporary styling. The bathroom was a bit older than I would have liked. I actually informed the management of a problem I had with the bathroom, and they were able to move me to an upgraded room for my last night. All hotels have problems and it is how they handle them that makes the difference. One of the highlights of the rooms (both I stayed in) were the beds. They are some of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. They were absolutely wonderful, and I did not want to get up in the morning! The bedding is attractive…it has the European look where the duvet is white and they put on accent pillows. No old school bedspreads…yay! By the way, flat screen TV too. The entertainment: The timing was such that music legend Gladys Knight was doing a show and I was able to see it. I could not stay in my seat- song after song of fantastic hits, bringing back memories and making me smile. She really connected with the audience which made the experience even more special. A gem of a show. The lounge outside of the theatre also had some really fun entertainment. I saw the Brad Garrett comedy show too on another night and that was good for a lot of laughs. The food: I ate at Café Nikki twice-once for breakfast and once for lunch. The food is fresh and wonderful. Never made it to the steak place (Biscayne, I think?) but it looked top notch. The pool: I enjoyed one entire afternoon at the pool reading and relaxing. I sat next to a friendly group of 20 something guys. The guys were drinking up a storm and enjoying what sounded like their 3rd or so afternoon at the hotel pool. The service for drinks was great- the waitresses were around a lot to keep the drinks flowing. It would have been awesome to eat lunch poolside, but they do not offer that. There were lots of security-looking guys who kept making the rounds at the pool. I was finally wondering if there was a celebrity around or something, to explain why. One young, handsome employee in a suit (he was not a security guy, I don’t think) started talking to the guys sitting next to me. He brought up that he wanted to try to set the up the guys at the Excalibur pool for the next day. It seemed odd that he was sending business (tons of drinks, for sure) to another hotel. Staff: Every single employee I dealt with was exceptionally polite and friendly. Where ever I went at the Tropicana, there were always employees around to help with your needs and answer questions. So, I recommend the Tropicana for a surprisingly luxurious bed, the awesome Gladys Knight show, delicious food, and the really friendly staff who do their best to please. I can’t guarantee that this will happen to you, but I also won a few hundred bucks there playing roulette in their casino! I was sad to leave, that is for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Will be great when all the renovations are complete!”
Reviews.Author: Zenhut
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice and clean. The price unbeatable! But the renovations made the stay a bit inconvenient... There was no place other than the diner to eat late. Went to the Italian restaurant to grab a quick bite, and the wait was astronomical! To get a cup of coffee, we had to walk all the way back to the back end of the Tropicana - so we ended up walking over to the MGM Grand! Seemed like a shorter distance! Only half of the pool was opened.... Again, it will be very nice went the renovations are complete!

Reviews.Title: “Bright, clean, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: vacati0ner1234
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. It was clean, clean, clean everywhere.It was quiet for Vegas once you get past the Casino but the hustle and bustle is just across the street at the other hotels, so you get the best of both. The pool area is beautiful and they are still renovating it. The staff are very helpful Conceige, front desk and Bell desk. Even though it's on the south end of the strip, the mono rail is next door at the MGM and the buses stop right in front. Definitly a great place to stay,

Reviews.Title: “New Favorite Place to Stay & Play in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: KelleyFam
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tropicana last weekend in Vegas and was very impressed with well, everything. We wanted somewhere reasonably priced and central to the strip and we got just that. Not only did we enjoy how easy it was to get around, our time in the hotel was wonderful. The casino floor is newly remodeled, everything is bright and clean. When we got into our room, I felt like I had stepped into a Banana Republic catalogue...in a good way. Instead of pull-across drapes there are white shutters on the windows and everything felt cozy, like you were actually staying in someone's home. I had the best cocktail of my trip at the Ambhar Lounge during happy hour one day...cucumber...mmm. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. We ate brunch at Cafe Nikki on our final day and I had the best eggs benedict I have ever tasted. We also spotted a celebrity at the table behind us which also speaks to the quality of the new hotel. Nikki Beach (currently being built) is opening soon and it looks so cool I think we'll be heading back to see it this year. I used to travel to Vegas twice a month for work and have had the opportunity to stay at many places. Tropicana has quickly become my new favorite for vacation or business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the younger generation!”
Reviews.Author: PickyTraveler8280
Reviews.Content: We were there from March 31st to April 3rd. Negatives= Bathrooms were dirty hair on floor dirty grout in tile and the bathroom smelled like smoke, sinks and tub don't drain well. A/C does not work well so hot rooms It was SO loud at night had to turn fan on high to block out the noise from the strip. Don't gamble here you will NOT win any money! The only thing you will want to do here is sleep! Positives= Comfortable Bed Brad Garret Comedy Club Hot Tub

Reviews.Title: “The good and the average.”
Reviews.Author: Bulldozer22
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel to Las Vegas 2 to 3 times a year. This trip we were going to celebrate my birthday. We typically stay at Harrahs but because of the excellent reviews and the crazy price we got through the airline we decided to give the trop a try. We arrived via taxi to the hotel. First thing we noticed was the area was under construction. Which didn't bother us just a bit of an eye sore. We pulled up to the entrance, which has been updated and seemed very nice. There was no one there to greet us or to offer assistance with our bags. This really didn't bother us but thought I would mention it becuase I remember other commenting on the greeting they recieved. Walked into the casino/hotel lobby and had to find someone to ask where to check in. Found the check in and everything went smooth. No upgrade offered nor did we ask. Got up to our rooms which was not that bad of a walk. The room was nice and updated. Bed was comfy and for the price we were happy. The casino, just was not our style. Seemed older and just no real atmoshphere. We did play a little bit but just wasn't feeling the vibe. One note, we didn't get any cocktail service while we were playing and come to think about it I don't remember seeing any CW around the machines. Did see a few around the tables though. I ended up moving to a video poker machine at the bar and the bar tenders there were always great, friendly, and on top of things. I guess the bottom line here is we spent most of our time at other casinos gambling. As far as eating we had other food places outside the trop on our list so we didn't have any major meals here. However, we did come in late a couple of nights and ate at the sandwich place in the trop. the first night it took along time to get our sandwich (30 minutes) but once we got our food it was really good. The second night when we came back in late we decided to give them another shot and service was much better and the food was great again. One other negative for us there was no starbucks or coffee house in the hotel. Each morning we ended up going over to the MGM to get our starbucks fix. So the only major negative that happened to us was during our last night there. We got back to our room around midnight and noticed someone had checked into the room next to us. They must have decided to have a private party and had there radio sitting right next to the door that adjoined our rooms. So instead of making a fuss about having them turn down the music and calm down the other things that were going on in there we decided to move. We called down to the desk and requested to be moved. They had no problems moving us. This was a pain to back up everything and move to a different room but seemed to be a better option then fighting with strangers in the next room or laying awake listening to there sounds all night. When we got down to our new room it was all good. But I noticed that this room also has an adjoining door to the room next door. Lucky for us there was no one in the room so all was calm. It just seems strange that after all the money they spent to upgrade/update there rooms they would have sealed up some of the adjoining room doors. Not sure, but I am assuming most of the standard rooms have the adjoining room doors. In my past experience these adjoining doors always allows for to much noise to be shared. To sum things up, we are planning another trip to vegas this summer and have decided to stay at another property. Just becuase we like a different casino vibe and like to have lots of things to do in the property we are staying at. But for the price we paid I have no issues with the trop.

Reviews.Title: “What a Big Change”
Reviews.Author: cgarmer
Reviews.Content: Wow, this is an all new Trop. The change is a total 180 from a few years ago. We were upgraded to a suite and loved the room. It was larger than other suites we have stayed in, in Vegas. The bed was way comfy. The iHome made getting ready to go out a lot more fun. Loud music and beer with your "s#!t, shower and shave" is always a good time. The tub did need to be redone; it was the only thing not remodeled. The casino was different than most others. The Trop has a more laid back feel. You will not see the 35 person craps table with the screaming, yelling, high fives and billows of cigar smoke. You will however be able to find a table or slot in a nice atmosphere with comfy chairs. The white interior mixed with the dark wood and the red lighting does give the Trop a Miami feel. My wife and I had a great time losing our money there, but an even better time winning it al back right before we left. This is a gem on the strip. Most people do not know about the remodel or the quick cocktail service. The only negative, and it is not even a negative about the Trop, is the area you need to walk through to get from the middle of the strip to the Trop. Between the Plant Hollywood and the MGM there is a stretch of Las Vegas Blvd that is a little shady at 3am. We did it one night then decided that was enough and got a bus pass. I would rather be a cheap-o on a bus than a broke guy in the streets. Try out the Trop. You will be pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Celebration”
Reviews.Author: cgoronkin
Reviews.Content: We had a terrific stay at the Tropicana. The suites were newly renovated, very clean, spacious and had wonderful views. The staff was extremely accomodating, friendly and cared about their guests. We had breakfast, lunch and dinner at the hotel and the meals were very good along with the service. My only suggestion for Cafe Nikki is to turn the music down. It was somewhat distracting while having a conversation. We enjoyed a good steak dinner at The Biscayne restaurant and would eat there again. We would stay there again, it will be our first choice the next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “The newly renovated Tropicana, bringing class back to Las Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tropicana Las Vegas from December 24, 2010 to January 1, 2011 and what a surprise I had. The hotel and casino have gone through major renovations and I know it's not done yet, but the words I have to describe it is amazing and full of class.  The hotel is beautiful inside and out, the beds are extremely comfortable, and the hotel staff is beyond friendly and helpful.  I would recommend this property to anyone and have full confidence they will leave with a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice decor definitely not a dump anymore”
Reviews.Author: YQR
Reviews.Content: We started our Vegas vacation by getting ripped off by the cab driver. The hotel is very close to the airport and we paid 15 dollars for the cab ride as the driver decided to take the long way. It should not cost that much. We booked our stay at the Tropicana over three months in advance since we saw a crazy deal for $144.51 for four nights tax included. Based on the reviews we contacted Nicole Marshall to verify our reservation and get a room with two beds in the Paradise Tower which is near the strip and front entrance. We were very dismayed to upon check in to find out our room was in the Island Tower. The desk clerk said there were no rooms with two beds available in the Paradise Tower. So much for booking ahead of time. The last thing we wanted to do after walking all day on the strip was to walk another two blocks just to get to our hotel room. The room was very nice and looks just like the photos on the hotel website. The beds are very comfortable and we had no issues with the room except the location. The casino is bright and cheerful instead of dingy like it used to be. Its nice to gamble in and the drink service was better at night than during the day or early evening. We knew about the slot promotion so we decided to get a card but the line up was long so we got one later after losing a lot of money in the slots and never bothered using it. We asked for a coffee maker and did receive a Keurig coffee maker and all the stuff to make coffee with which was good. We knew about the resort fee which is $9.99 per day plus 8% tax and did not feel we got anything of value for paying it as we didn't go to Vegas to sit by the pool. We never ate anything at the hotel as the dining options were expensive. We spent most of our time at Planet Hollywood seeing shows and eating at the buffets so probably after wasting time walking back and forth we should of just stayed at Planet Hollywood which has no resort fee. We looked at the sky high menu prices of all the Tropicana restaurants and it would be nice if there was at least some specials in the restaurants. We don't want to eat greasy fast food but a restaurant with reasonable prices and we probably would of stayed gambling more at the hotel. I know we gambled enough at Planet Hollywood because we were there eating most of the time. Its a nice hotel and I would recommend staying there at least once while its new but I don't think I would stay there again. The walk to the hotel room every night was exhausting and we had to leave everyday just to go eat.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected, but still needs some improvement”
Reviews.Author: cougargirl70
Reviews.Content: I took my mother to Las Vegas for her birthday, it was her first time in Vegas. I've been many times but never stayed at the Tropicana. After reading many reviews and reading about all the changes, I was curious. I was able to get a great deal which included airfare and 4 nights at the Trop (through Expedia). There were a few issues. I had read about the bathroom floor tiles being old and some were dirty/chipped, so I expected it. Too bad that they renovated the washrooms and didn't bother to replace the floors, looks bad. Also the bathroom doors are very old, knob was very old looking and the door itself was dirty and looked like it needed to be painted. The bathtub and shower is ok, but they have one of those curved shower curtain rods, with only one curtain. So if you leave the curtain on the outside of the tub while showering, water gets all over the bathroom floor. And if you leave it on the inside of the tub, the curtain slowly starts to open at both ends and you still end up getting water all over the bathroom floor. This should be fixed, very poor design. I ended up having to request extra bath towels so we could cover the floor near the tub. We arrived late at night and the only place to eat was at Cafe Nikki. We were too tired to start walking around the strip to look for other food options. It wasn't very busy at Cafe Nikki but we still had to wait for a table due to the fact that they didn't have enough servers. The late night menu was very limited, compared to the regular menu. It took a long time to get our food, and when we got it, it was average. The dressing on the caesar salad was below average, I'd say. The people who work there are friendly and generally nice, they try their hardest to please. Currently there aren't a lot of options for food, but they are working on a Starbucks and a marketplace with casual food/fast food. One day I wanted a latte and I asked at Cafe Nikki where I could get one. I was told that I could order one at their bar (inside Cafe Nikki), so I did. They use Starbucks products, but I paid a lot more than what I would have paid for that same latte had I gone to a Starbucks (over $2 more!). The room was nice and clean. We had a view of the strip, which was nice. The flat screen tv is nice, but there's not a great selection of channels. We didn't spend a lot of time in the room, so it wasn't a big deal. The pool that is open, was nice. I understand they are working on a large beach-style pool area, called Nikki Beach, which is supposed to be really nice. I like that the casino isn't huge. It does get busy but you can still get around easily (unlike at some of the bigger hotels/casinos). I also appreciate that once you enter the front door, the elevators are close by (for the Paradise Tower). You don't have to walk through miles and miles of smoke-filled casino to get to your room. When you first arrive, there are stairs to get up into the lobby. We asked about that and were directed to the right, where there is a ramp to get in. I don't remember seeing any signs directing us to the ramp though. There were usually one or two bellmen at the front doors who would open the doors for some guests, but at times there was no staff around or they were busy talking to each other. When my mother and I got inside, we were greeted by more stairs, on the left side, where the registration desks are. We asked the bellman to help us with our bags, which he did. We were later told that there is also a ramp (to the right of the front desk). It can get noisy outside at night, and we did hear sirens on a few occasions. In all my previous stays (at MGM, Mandalay Bay, Treasure Island) I don't remember hearing as much outside noise. Also, the construction that is still going on (on the outside of the property), started at 6:00 am. Our room was on the 9th floor, and we were able to hear it, although it wasn't bad enough to keep us awake. We gambled and ate at some of the other casinos on the strip and mostly just slept at the Trop. As far as some reviewers who mentioned that there is mostly an older crowd at the Trop, I don't agree. We saw quite a mix of people, ranging from their 20's all the way up to 60's/70's. I think a lot of the younger people are seeing what a good value this hotel is, and are giving it a chance. Overall, the rooms are clean and the beds are super comfy. Water pressure in the shower is good once you turn the dial on the showerhead to the 'massage' setting. Bathrooms could be better, but they are still decent. Tip: bring your own bath soap because they don't have any, just hand soap and a shower gel (I'm not a fan of shower gel and theirs did not have a great scent). Carpets everywhere are new, and the hotel staff are all very friendly and willing to help when necessary. It's on the south end of the strip but easy to get anywhere. We tried the bus ('the duece') and for $5 you get a 2 hour pass, or for $7 you get a 24 hour pass. There are stops at most of the hotels. The bus is a bit on the slow side because of all the stops it makes and how many people get on and ask questions, etc, so not a good option if you're in a hurry.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location on South Strip”
Reviews.Author: WardCleaver
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights during Spring break. We don't gamble but wanted to see a couple of shows and ride the Stratosphere tower rides. The Tropicana is in process of remodeling but it doesn't impact your experience. Of course it is a casino so it is not really a "family friendly" place (our teenagers handled it OK but were a little awestruck at first). They try to mask cigarette odor but it's still present in common areas. The pool area is beautiful. They are in the process of doubling the size of the pool area. It will be very impressive when done. We ate at one of the restaurants...Good but on the pricey side. Gone are the days of cheap food in Vegas. Hey, nothing is cheap here....you go to Vegas to lose money, right? If I was coming to Vegas I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff made our stay”
Reviews.Author: SNJL
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our entire stay at the Tropicana. Barbara checked us in and was genuinely nice and helpful in finding us a great room. Our 2 favourite staff members were Leigh and Robert who were both dealers. We had so much fun with them one particular night as well as the pit boss Arthur. The room was clean and nicely renovated as we have seen old pics of the place. All staff we encountered on our travles through the hotel always smiled and said hello. Big thanks to Brian , the Security supervisor who found my clothes I left in our first room as we moved to another to be in a smoking room.We only ate once, room service from Cafe Niki, which was very expensive but I do know they have a small food court coming soon. We ate next door at MGM and Excalibur every day as they had many feasable options for food. We would definitely stay again at the Tropicana

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana is Back and Great as Ever!”
Reviews.Author: yeoyeoyeo
Reviews.Content: I want it clear that this is not a 5 Diamond property but simply needs at least another star added on. Here we go......First off at check in, we were in one of the shortest Que lines ever at vegas and were treated so good by the check in staff especially KIMBERLEE EDWARDS-WARD. She filled us in on all the great changes and things to see. Our Suite was in the ISLAND Tower with an outstanding view of other casinos. We paid extra for an upgraded room at a absolutely fair price at the help of another great Trop-staff member Nicole Marshall. Our room was on the 20th floor and it was great. Like others before me stated, the beds are to die for. We did everything at the hotel to do and enjoyed two of the shows offered. Do Brad Garrets Comedy Show and we loved Recycled Percussion as well. Not to be missed is their MOB EXPERIENCE...loved it and you could spend 4 hours in that place and not read or do it all. We loved eating at the Biscayne and do their four-course dinner and wine special...simply a great dining experience. We also ate at their other two places called Cafe Nikki and Bacio pasta and vino...but don't miss out on the dinner at The Biscayne steak*sea*wine for Dinner Dining. The pool is wonderful but the drinks were high at pool side. Everytime my wife and I came back to the tropicana after time out, it was like walking back into Paradise. It was busy, busy, busy due to spring break but the hotel remained clean and great to stroll around, and lets not forget gambling was nice as well under their glass mosaic canopy overhead. The grounds are great and only going to get better with all the new things going in. THANKS TROPICANA FOR A GREAT 5 DAYS OF FUN.....

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was great but the bridal shop left a lot to be desired to say the least”
Reviews.Author: hunter016
Reviews.Content: I thought that the hotel was great and all the staff were courteous at all times The restraints were good and the food was excellent The rooms were very comfortable and the staff were very helpful The only problem we had was at the bridal and tux shop the lady there was down right rude and the service was terrible she measured me twice and still did not get the jacket right, not only that but I did not get my suite till hours before the wedding and when I put my hand in the pocket there was a tissue in my jacket as there was no one at the store to complain to at five o'clock even though there sign said they were open till six I was forced to wear it. when my son in law went to get fitted for the third time she said he was so big he was almost impossible to fit ans asked his mother if he was a big baby not in a nice manner after all of that the day of the wedding my son in laws suit still was not right and he was forced to go to the tux shop up the strip where they took the original measurements that he had sent down weeks before and they fitted him in about twenty minutes and that is the suit he wore at his wedding and we checked three other places and they were all around $65 accept at your shop She also did not want to take credit cards for the bill and tried to get us to pay cash for everything in fact I did give her cash $145 when she had quoted us $125 when my daughter complained she returned $20 to both my son and I we wasted almost two hole days running back and forth from the hotel to the shop and could not get anywhere as we were forced to return to check on our suits This lady is not only unprofessional but incompetent to say the least and had my daughter and indeed the whole wedding party upset and ruined two whole days of our trip

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: londonseptember
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from four days at the newly refurbished Tropicana. We were very impressed. The location of this hotel is on the corner of MGM, New York, New York and Excaliber. It was easy to get around on the monorail to the other hotels from the MGM or use taxis. The room itself was clean and large. The hotel levies a room charge of $10 for internet, gym and service but we needed to use these so was happy to have this. The bed was the best I have slept in in a long time. Room service, if you need it is prompt and all the staff are friendly and helpful. The cost was very reasonable too - less than £100 for three nights and they allowed a late checkout because of our flight. They were fully booked when we were there so you may need to be prebook to get a room. The pool complex was still undergoing restoration and the casino was not as classy as some of the other hotels, but a very good comfortable hotel at a great price. Would not hesitate to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a few minor issues...”
Reviews.Author: hahaok
Reviews.Content: The hotel, in terms of rooms, are excellent value. On the strip, the rooms are big and clean, and I paid roughly $70 a night in the middle of March Madness. I was skeptical on the way there, but hotel was really a treat in terms of value. Some minor complaints: 1) No poker room. I'm not holding this against the hotel, as it simply wasn't ready yet, but apparently will be in a few months. 2) Room service refused to take cash..unless you asked them twice. Every night when I got back to the room, I ordered a meal at some absurd hour before I went to sleep. Every night, room service absolutely refused to take cash, until I told them they took it the night before. The argument was like groundhog day. 3) Lastly, I gave a reasonable amount of action to the Blackjack tables on a daily basis, losing at least $300 every night to them. I wasn't chasing comps or anything, but there was 1 supervisor there that saw me every night playing, to the point he asked me and my friends feedback on a new dealer (he was terrible, but I digress). On the second last night I was there, there was a drunk guy next to me betting $20 a hand constantly, until the very same supervisor came over, and he quickly bet $200. The supervisor quickly comped his stay, whilst acknowledging my presence but not even hinting at any sort of comp. That was day 10 of my 11 day stay. You can do the math at how much I lost at the BJ tables. A dinner would have been nice... Overall, a great stay, but I might do a bit of research in the future in regards to comps..

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated, good location but not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: ruadh_ruadh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with friends for 3 nights on a girlie break. The hotel is really reasonably priced, great location (walking distance from everything on the strip) but it's not for everyone. We went on party weekend but the Tropicana isn't the liveliest. To its credit though, they're renovating and they have what looks like a fab pool area that will be ready in time for summer. We had a bit of hassle while we were there with management over our room and the mess it was left in by the accommodation staff but once I contacted the hotel upon arriving home they were very helpful. Over all, I'd recommend it but you'll probably spend more time in the bigger hotel and casinos

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Renovation”
Reviews.Author: Fancyfreetraveler
Reviews.Content: I had heard so many negative comments from prior patrons I was concerned about staying here, but for the price I paid, I though, why not? I was surprised. They have apparently been renovating the hotel for quite some time. My room was just like new & bathroom was modern and clean. All carpets (halls, rooms & casino) still had that "new" smell. The day I flew home the local paper had a huge spread about all the renovations and how this hotel was now in the top 10 in Vegas. It was impossible to disagree.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: briss99
Reviews.Content: i took my partner for his 40th birthday to vegas+stayed at tropicana,it was clean,tidy+a lovely hotel to stay in,the casino was amazing,the food was excellant but huge!the staff were all so friendly+couldnt help enough,it was our first visit+definatley will not be the last.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, didn't wanna come home”
Reviews.Author: jamie_harms
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 day vacation. Didn't know what to expect since they were doing renovations on the hotel, but was pleasantly happy with the room and hotel. Very nice, updated rooms. Hotel was nice, little small, but was very nice. I preferred the smaller hotel, not as many people. Has an outside pool, and 2 hot tubs. Sat in the hot tub every night, was perfect. Plus hot tubs were open 24 hours. Staff was very friendly and hotel was very clean. You can also get a mini fridge put in you room, if you would like. For a fee of course. I think it was $15/day. But it was great to have, that way we didn't have to buy water, pop, or beer on the strip. Much cheaper this way. This is where I'll stay next time I visit Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Bright, clean, refreshing experience.”
Reviews.Author: zultdush
Reviews.Content: As a group of five who go on small week-long trips every 3 to 6 months, we've had some experience with hotels and casinos. To be honest we picked them for price and they were super cheap on travelocity, For what we paid, we were very surprised by the quality of the rooms, and gaming areas. It was refreshing instead of smokey, It was Brightly lit instead of dim, and it was new and exciting even though its been around. you could tell they were always maintaining the facilities and remodeling to keep up with the times too! The check-in staff to the cleaning ladies were all very nice and courteous. Terry at the check-in desk was very efficient friendly, and will make sure everything is perfect with your bill. Richard, his manager was very professional, and personally ensured we had the best experience at Tropicana. OH and btw, Carlito was an awesome craps table dealer, thanks! FYI, internet was FREE, FAST, and no signup. and 10 free incoming/outgoing faxes per day.

Reviews.Title: “classic elegance once again on the strip”
Reviews.Author: laura_steve_11
Reviews.Content: we met here for a family reunion of several generations, including a 21st birthday; all of our interests were available and accomodated; we all had upgraded rooms; the beds are unbelievably comfy; we never saw the room staff (they were so discreet) but they definitely kept everything clean/stocked; our view of the strip was great; the elevators are timely but have some computer glitches (floor #, voice-over, but not serious, and nothing mechanical wrong!) the casino is small but interesting which is fine with us; the nightly entertainment was a bit lame, but it was 'live'; the new pool area is gorgeous with landscaped space and great privacy / lots of sunlight; they have a few things to work out with the restaurants because they have just re-opened (food is great, service erratic but friendly; management maybe? or changeover jitters?); definitely worth a try; and congrats to new owners for renovation vs. demolition; we love to see respect for the history and architecture!!

Reviews.Title: “BEST find in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Ralphy128
Reviews.Content: The newly remodeled Tropicana is now the BEST hotel in Vegas. Our entire stay was amazing! All of the staff were incredibly courteous and helpful. We were immediately greeted by Hannah at the front desk who helped us check-in efficiently. She even put in the extra effort to answer questions and joke with us for a bit. We already felt like we were at a party. The remodeled casino and rooms are unbelievable! It is clean and bright everywhere. It feels like the entire place is a day spa. The new pool remodel looks like it will be a fun scene once it opens. Not to mention how clean and airy the rooms were. The new room design makes you feel great! Its bright and comfortable. All the soaps and shampoos are amazing! We stole a bunch. We didn't have a great view, but we weren't there much either. We loved all the new restaurants! Cafe Nikki had an amazing atmosphere with view of the pool and lush outdoor seating. Our breakfast was amazing! Get the vanilla french toast. You will never want another french toast in your life, its so good. Biscayne Steak House was also a gem! The food was absolutely amazing and the servers were great! The eggplant tacos are to die for! We couldn't believe how inexpensive the food was either. I've been to the Tropicana twice before the remodel. This place was entirely a refreshing experience! Stay and play here before everyone else finds out about it and it becomes the hottest place in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: g0g0anna
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Trop with my husband and some friends. We had booked a suite in the paradise tower, and when we checked in they sent us up to a standard room. We were so tired from our trip from australia that we just collapsed into bed which was really comfortable, The room was quite nice with a view of the Excalibur.
