The next day my husband went to sort out the room situation and we ended up with a suite in the island tower, which was beautiful and had the most amazing view of the strip. It still wasn't what we had initally booked, but I was happy enough with it The room was always cleaned, and it had 2 large plasmas, a bar(although no corkscrew or wine glasses were provided which I thought was a bit strange). The bed was awewome. Service was pretty good. We ate at the Nikki cafe which was good food and also the Biscayne which was a nice expereince. I didn't find that they were overpriced, they were comparable to every other place in Vegas as far as I could see. We were able to get a late checkout until 3.00 but our friends staying in the paradise tower in a standard room weren't. The smell when you entered was actually very nice, not too overpowering. The music in Nikki cafe I thought was crap, definately for a younger crowd. The band in the casino was awesome. Overall I would definately stay again, however would probably try something more central. The resort fee definately is a pain, I had to do my own boarding pass which was a pain as I couldn't figure it out at first and no one was around to help. The internet was quick in the room. We ordered room service one night and it was delivered very quickly and was reasonably priced. It was displayed beautifully.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, only one hiccup at check-in and they need more dining options”
Reviews.Author: MelfromTO
Reviews.Content: The renovations are impressive and I highly recommend this hotel. Beds are super comfy and most of the staff is fantastic. We ate at Cafe Nikki once for breakfast, it was great, the fruit was really fresh and not a bad cup of coffee too. We went to see Recycled Percussion while we were there (thanks Nicole), also a fantastic show I highly recommend it. I want to preface by saying that I have previously stayed at Caesar's, The Mirage, and the Wynn. I think the Trop culd be competitive with these properties, except they need more restaurants/coffee shops. We found ourselves leaving the property every morning to grab coffee and a bite elsewhere. Which usually meant we would do our gambling elsewhere. Location is a bit south but we enjoyed the walk, so that was not a problem. The location of the Paradise Tower was fantastic at the end of a long day. Gambling at the Trop is tight in the day and loosens up at night. The only problem we really had was at check-in. We were early (around 11:30AM) so understandably our room wasn't ready yet, but the bellman suggested we go try the front desk anyways. The guy behind the front desk (Terry) was very rude how he told us we were too early to check in. No smile No hello. Just rude. He told us to come back at 2pm for checkin. Well, at 2pm the checkin line was huge and after waiting over 30 minutes, luck of the draw we got Terry again. Even ruder than the first time, saying he told us we were wasting time and that we could not checkin until after 3PM! We reminded him that he told us 2pm and that we just waited so long in line, and that tons of people were being checked in in front of us, we saw them leaving with their keycards. So finally he brushed us off and said come back in half an hour and just come straight to him and we won't have to wait in line. When 3:15 came around we made eye contact with him and approached the desk as he was finishing up with someone, he took off in back and then we saw him slip onto the casino floor leaving us hanging. Thankfully the line was shorter now and we were checked in by Evie who was a doll. Tropicana if you are reading this, so something about Terry! The new pool area looked great, but it was a little too chilly to go swimming. Everyone else was great, and our stay was wonderful. I do recommend staying here. The cleanliness, comfort and price cannot be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana has made tremendous improvements”
Reviews.Author: Tantus100
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at this newly renovated hotel. It's simply wonderful that's clean and upscale at an affordable price. On the strip and easy to get around which makes the location wonderful. I have my new #1 Vegas hotel and it's called the "Tropicana".

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! Inexpensive and wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: obright1
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing stay at the Tropicana. We had visited two years ago and it was dirty and dark, but had some of the best tables in Vegas. Now, the remodel is beautiful and everything is clean and bright. Our room was very inexpensive and we were upgraded to a suite on our arrival. Our only critisism is that they no longer have many $5 tables as they did just a few years ago. If they bring back the $5 tables in the evening we would say it was the best place to stay in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Friendly, and Fun place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: iannantuonofrank
Reviews.Content: We were there for a week. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and went the extra mile to make our stay there an absolute pleasure. The room was great; clean, neat, comfortable, and inviting. The bed was more comfortable than ours at home. After being out on the Vegas Strip all day, it was like coming home when we returned to our room. We checked out a lot of the other hotels and casino's, and found the Tropicana to be the most friendly. The casino was bright and cheerful. After trying out some of the other casino's we found we had the most fun and excitement at the Topicana Casino. The Cafe Niki, were we were provided with a wonderful late night comped meal was outstanding. We would recommend the Tropicana to anyone who enjoys being made to feel important and welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Renovations make this a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Terry19_62_11
Reviews.Content: Can not say enough good things about the Tropicana during our recent trip. From little things like getting a coffee pot in our room and a wine opener to the major things like the entertainment at Brad Garret's comedy club and the Mob Experience, the staff at the Tropicana are bending over backwards to make the experience a great one. Once the external landscaping is done, this will be one amazing hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay, will recommend to friends and go back ourselves!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly1963_8888
Reviews.Content: We just stayed a week at the newly renovated Tropicana Hotel in Las Vegas and we had a blast. The rooms are bright, cheery, tropical, crisp, and very clean. We had a view of the strip which was amazing. Our check in was quick and easy. We requested a coffee maker in our room and it was provided withing minutes of us arriving. We had room service from Nikki Cafe which was quick and tasty. We ate at Biscane, which I have been recommending to all of my friends, even if they are not staying at The Tropicana. The pool area was wonderful, and the lady making our drinks was a jem. We had an evening at the Brad Garretts Comedy Club and it was a riot, great seats for the entire theatre really. The staff at Tropicana was so accomodating, we had a late flights and they let us stay in the room until 5 p.m. at no charge and then they held our bags at the Bell Desk unitl we left at around 8:00. We will definately go back to the Tropicana and I would recommend it for sure. I am really looking forward to the new pool area and the South Beach Marketplace.

Reviews.Title: “#1 Place to Stay in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: JMJ697MN
Reviews.Content: Our trip started off perfectly from the moment we started to check in at the hotel. We flew in late from MSP and were exhausted after getting through the airport and picking up our rental car. When we arrived at the Tropicana, we easily found parking in their covered parking lot. There was absolutely no line at the desk to check in and 3 people available to help us. This trip was for my 30th birthday, and our first time in Vegas, so we wanted it to be special. We asked if they had any rooms available with a King sized bed. The woman at the desk was trying to be helpful and look up rooms, but she wasn't sure what to do so she called over her manager, Thomas, who quickly found us an incredible suite on the 19th floor. He also bought us dinner at Cafe Nikki, which was delicious and completely unexpected. When we finally made it up to our suite, the view of the strip was amazing. Yes, it was a bit of a walk to Paradise Tower, but completely worth it to stay in such a luxurious room. The bed was huge and incredibly comfortable. The $10 per night resort fee was completely worth it for use because we used the internet every single day. The bathroom was large & our sitting room with mini bar & fridge was very nice also. The alarm clock with radio & ipod player was a nice touch. Our only complaint about this room was that the TV in the bedroom did not work at all! There must have been something wrong with the connection because the picture came through all fuzzy. We ordered room service from Cafe Nikki one night after returning from Arizona on a day trip and it was very fast and tasty. The casino itself was very nice, a little on the smallish side, but that was almost refreshing after walking through the MGM casino atleast 20 times to get to the shuttle. We played a ton of blackjack late night/early morning and the dealers were very friendly and nice and even waved at us a few times when we were just passing through. I also LOVED the slight coconut scent that seemed to infiltrate the entire casino and hotel. I don't know how they did it, but we loved it. The tropical music was fun as well. We regret that we did not get to experience the Mob Show, but next time for sure! It was fun to see the characters walking around the hotel. The renovations did not bother us at all, probably because we were so high up and couldn't even hear them. The pool area will be amazing once they have it finished. All in all, we easily gave everything about this hotel 5 stars. From the minute we walked in the door of the Tropicana, everyone on staff helped make our trip unforgettable. We have told many friends and family members about the Tropicana, and we will never stay anywhere else when we return to Vegas. Thank you so much for everything. We will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, tacky, bad atmosphere, poor facilities.”
Reviews.Author: willshaylor
Reviews.Content: The hotel was noisy and lacked many basic facilities. Of all the hotel complexs I visited during my stay Tropicana was the poorest. Unfortunately that was where we had chosen to stay. I would not recommend this hotel or casino.

Reviews.Title: “Below Average Stay at the New Trop”
Reviews.Author: sdtovegas
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stay at the Tropicana March 12-15th with 3 other friends. I had one comped room and we all pitched in on the Penthouse Loft. The room online looked great with a wet bar and hot tub. We arrived early at 10am on Thursday and fortunately our room was ready. Once we went up to the room on the 21st floor I quickly found out that I was given the only Penthouse Loft with no hot tub. I quickly called down to the front desk and was very quickly told that they had no other Lofts available and there all booked. I told the person on the phone that this was classic "bait and switch" and was not going to take the room. Almost immediately I was told to hold on and after 10 mins on hold they said they had another room available(what a miracle). After waiting 2 hours for the room I checked in to the new room but this room had no wetbar. Again we requested another room switch which took 3 hours. Once in the room the hot tub did not work after another 2 hours and again repacking everything we arrived back in the second room at 6pm. Needless to say we were tired and disappointed with all the moving. Worst Vegas experience ever. Everything the rest of the stay was Ok. Might give the Trop another chance if I ever get a response from them through email. Sent 2 emails to the person who responds on here and got one response 2 weeks later and to late for my trip and still no response to my new email.

Reviews.Title: “Improvements to the property are amazing; looks clean and fresh!”
Reviews.Author: liskelo
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate to be upgraded to a suite, which was quite spacious and comfortable. Spectacular view added to the overall atmosphere of the room. Was slightly disappointed in the bathroom, however. Having stayed in suites in several different LV properties, this was on the low end of the scale. A longer counter and 2 sinks would have made a huge difference to me. The tub/shower was average; if I had paid full price for the suite, I'd have expected above average. Bed was comfortable; slept well in spite of noise from street (sirens). Service was excellent in every area. Employees seemed to be genuinely please to assist us. Pool area looks fantastic and I loved Cafe Nikki. All in all, great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Walshster
Reviews.Content: We went to for a girl's birthday celebration/weekend. We arrived with only 30 minutes to change and get ready for a show. At 5:30 p.m., OUR ROOM WAS NOT READY AND/OR CLEANED! They gave us wrong directions to our show. We did not get in a room until 1:30 a.m. - unbelievable. The hotel manager did try to smooth things over with free drinks, limo service and some food credit, but it really messed up our Friday night. The staff was confused and unhelpful. Our rooms were not updated or even very clean. Yucky bathrooms with no water pressure or amenities. Ice machine and soda machine on our floor was broken. REALLY BAD!

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly Fun, Great Service, Will Return”
Reviews.Author: Iluvclaire
Reviews.Content: I worked at the Four Seasons Hotel in Newport Beach for 8 years, during college and after before I left for law school. So I know what good service is. I was so amazed at how the employees at the Trop treated me and my friends. Just a few quick highlights that I can remember. Our waitress in the Sportsbook, Claire, was such a nice person and hard worker! I kept looking at the full sportsbook wondering how she gets around to everyone and back to us so fast. It was amazing. I guess she is into fitness or something, because for the entire time we were there (all day) she never looked tired! She was funny too, great sense of humor! She also called us by name which was really cool. We also had another girl with a tatoo on her back that was super nice and fast. She was very attentive and sweet as well. I should also say the sportsbook guys were so nice to us, they kept offering to give us better seats but we had great seats. They helped us when it was super busy. They called us by names. I loved it. I went from the Sportsbook to Cafe Nikki all the time to eat. I thought that was the best hotel cafe I have been in. The girls out front, Ecko and the other girl can't remember her name, but super bubbly, great smile, they were great. We never had to wait. They dealt with big crowds and always smiled. They worked long hours, they were there for break, lunch and dinner. The waiters and waitresses inside worked hard and were super attentive to me and my friends. So nice! I really think good service brings people back and these employees went the extra mile for us. I also ordered room service and the guy was up in about 2 min! I cracked up, how could you get up there so fast??? I also had good service from the valets and bellman! And the front desk girl that checked me in and out was awesome. They even charged my friends phone!!!!! I have already told at least 15 people to come and also told my classes (ha ha) to go, so that makes about 80 ppl so far! I loved my experience there! So a huge thank you to Todd Kunesh and his team, they gave us 5 star service and it seemed effortless. That is a good reflection on the people there, good people!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall great experience”
Reviews.Author: twinkie2477
Reviews.Content: Niki Cafe - Awesome, housekeeping was TERRIBLE but when complained to front desk, they refunded our daily resort fee and we were satisfied. Bring your walking shoes for sure as it is a long walk to the rooms once checked in. Need more entrances that are convenient to entering hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well, it's clean....”
Reviews.Author: BerthasDad
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Paradise Tower in March, 2011. I am, frankly, puzzled by the overwhelmingly positive reviews here. It ain't that great....by Vegas standards. First, note that the hotel room, while recently "remodeled" is pretty much your standard 1956 Holiday Inn room. It was two beds, a TV and a phone. No fridge, no microwave, none of the modern trappings you might find in pretty much any two and a half star hotel near the freeway. The bathroom was a similar 1956 style. The "remodelling" consists of new bedding and new wallpaper. There were new sinks in the bathroom, but the shower was the standard tub with shower like one might have at home in the basement bathroom. Nothing glamorous about this place. The rooms were relatively clean--although it took until 6 p.m. to get maid service. Some folks are picky about dirty tile grout; if so, you won't like this place. The tile is all original to the building. And is dirty. That's a picky point, but when the selling point is the $80million rehab... Some folks have raved about the service here; I would comment on it if I actually got any. The luggage help was non-existant, and no one was at the door to even point us to the front desk. The hotel restaurants are OK, service there just OK, but the prices are gigantic. You cannot get breakfast here for under $16.00. Beer at the bars: $9. Shot of tequila: $14. There are a couple of specialty restaurants on the Mezzanine level, one steak/seafood, the other Italian. Those are also Vegas-expensive and forgettable. Now, about the Casino. Suffice it to say that this is NOT the HIP casino on the strip. It is more like the "hip replacement" casino. The casino is VERY small, and in three nights playing there I never once saw anyone screaming that they won...the slot games are dated and old. There were only a very few card tables. Most of our group went elsewhere to gamble. This same group stayed at Mandalay Bay, The Hotel, on our last trip. This hotel and casino is the polar opposite of that. Would I stay here again? If I needed a cheap place to stay, yes. If I were looking for a luxurious Vegas experience, no. The primary reason to stay here is price. You get a plain-jane 1956 era hotel room that has had recent paint and bedding changes. No glitz. No glamour. Nothin' special.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Customer Service, Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: CRD1980
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our first time in Vegas, a few of our friends that had been to Vegas before had recommended other hotels but we went with the Tropicana. We were not disappointed and we were very happy to tell our friends about our great experience. The customer service could not have been better. We ordered room service one night the gentleman that brought our meal up was so nice and so helpful and he even said, don't worry about the tip it is already included, which was great to know. Checking in and checking out was a pleasure. I played the slot machines and although I did not win, I earned a lot of comps which were great. I was able to pay for my resort fees, order room service, eat at a great restaurant in the hotel, attend Brad Garrett's Comedy Club which was awesome all with my comps!! The staff are very professional and will do anything to help and provide excellent customer service. We hope to be back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for Vegas trip”
Reviews.Author: BorderRambler
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed a recent stay in the Tropicana. After reading reviews we requested a Paradise Tower room, this was very convenient as the elevators are right by the concierge and casino floor so you were always only moments from the Strip/your car. Being a birthday trip we also requested a Strip view which they could only honour on the second day, so we ended up sampling two rooms. The first room had adjoining doors, this felt as if we were sharing with strangers as you could hear everything next door. Second room with no adjoining doors was very peaceful which was ideal for a nocturnal holiday pattern! Great view of the Strip too. Both the rooms were of a high standard, great furnishings, comfy beds and decent bathrooms. Not sure about the constant air freshener (of a tropical theme), got a bit tiresome in hallways and sneaking into the rooms but necessary in the smoky casino I guess. Casino was fine, probably a bit small for most tastes but it being more manageable added to our hotel experience (we had friends who'd traipse for ages through enormous casino floors to reach their rooms!). Good communication from manager (Nikki) prior to visiting. Free parking garage very useful too. Would recommend this place for a luxurious Vegas stay!

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel That Has Everything You Want And More!”
Reviews.Author: THELUCKYONE033
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for the hotel that aims to please, look no further! They can't do enough for you. It's the right size. Not too big. Not too small. All the rooms are brand new with a cool contemporary look. Great bathrooms and flat screen TV's in every room. The beds are the most comfortable I've ever slept on. So are the lounge chairs at the pool. The minimums at the casino are not high and the dealers are very nice. In addition, you will look a long time to find a better value than this hotel on the strip. Can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel -- Would Definitely Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: JustACoupleOfUs
Reviews.Content: I started in a standard room for the first 2 nights and then was switched to a suite (it wasn't available right away, due to a Nascar event). Both were excellent. When I moved into the suite, the bellhop found a problem with the fridge and there was someone there, literally within minutes, to check it out. They then had a replacement fridge moved in before I had even finished unpacking! We were on the 20th floor and the hot water for the shower/tub was almost instantaneous -- I don't have if they have a boiler or a booster on that floor, but it was impressive. We both ate at the Nikki several times and quite enjoyed it (although we found it was quite noisy in the evenings on the weekend). We did not try the Biscayne or the Bacio and the Ocean Deli (Beach Deli?) was closed for renovations. As it was my birthday, we were given the 'Romance Package' free of charge, which was very nice. There was a slight glitch, however, as I had asked that it be delivered around 8:30 in the evening when we returned from supper and instead it was delivered at 3:30 in the afternoon, before I even got back from my conference meetings and so caught my wife somewhat off guard! The pool was not yet open when we were there (unfortunate, as there was a heat spell and the temperatures were in the high seventies to low eighties) but it certainly looks like it will be one of the better pools in LA when it is ready. I did use the Fitness Center and enjoyed the variety of equipment and the number of units (no waiting for anything). We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, efficient service, and the best bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: candy_crosser38
Reviews.Content: From Sunday March the 13th to Thursday March 17th, myself and 3 friends, all aged 25 years old, stayed at the Tropicana in Las Vegas. While waiting outside for our cab at the airport, we could actually see the sign for our casino. However, the cab ride there was about $22! I forgot to tell him to take a certain way there that I had read on the internet (not that I even know if he took that way or not) but let's just say that the cab ride back to the airport was $10! We got to the check-in counter at around 9:30PM and up to our rooms in about 10 minutes tops. The check-in was efficient, the lady at the counter was polite, and we had no problems finding our room. The hotel is relatively easy to navigate through and the only place we did find difficult to find from our room in the towers was the pool because of the lack of signs. We could see it from our room, we knew where it was when we got near it, but we didn't know which door to take to get to it. We often found that at most hotels, they want you to get lost. One could easily take out their frustration (money) on a slot machine! The rooms have been recently remodelled and so they do not look as dated as the lobby - very modern. The shutters are beautiful AND hide the lights, both at night and during the day. The beds are very high and comfortable and we were able to fall asleep with ease. The only complaint I have about the sleeping conditions is the construction happening just outside our window. They are now in their third phase of construction on the hotel and it just so happened to be right below us. It wasn't THAT bad, and the guys worked very hard at it all day long, but I did wake up a couple of mornings from the banging. Problem solved by buying ear plugs the next day at the pharmacy. There were some window washers one morning at 9am and again, it's their job, but it would have been nice to see them at the window a little bit later. We never really saw the maid but she was always there to make our beds and fold our towels for us. My blow dryer didn't work the first day and she was quick to replace it when I left a note and a couple of dollars. I was very appreciative. The casino here was relatively small compared to the bigger places, but we enjoyed this because those long walks everywhere else tired us out! There were always enough slots, and the centre tables were pretty busy at most times of the day. My friend went up to a "Let it ride," table and asked the dealer to teach her and he had no problem helping her out. We went to see "Recycled Percussion," which was located right near the entrance of the hotel, and it was fantastic! There were also people walking around advertising the "Mob Experience" show and we would have loved to check that out but there wasn't enough time. We went swimming on the second last day and the temperature was great, the pool was busy, and the life guards/supervisors were very friendly. Only half of the pool was open due to the renovations but that was the side that got the sun at the end of the day! We ate at Cafe Nikki the last morning and had a nice meal before our flight. They had a breakfast buffet for $16.99 and the food seemed to look very good. I had oatmeal with dried fruits and it was delicious and cost $7.00. Overall, I would definitely stay at this hotel again and would highly recommend it to friends. We got it for a great price and I'd be excited to go back and see how the outdoor renovations turned out. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own everything”
Reviews.Author: suki3333
Reviews.Content: I arrived with my best friend, Carri and went to check in. The lady at the VIP check-in asked for a credit card and I gave her my visa to which she sighed and said the money would be taken out of the account because the card is hooked up to a checking account. So, my friend gave her a credit card. I understand she probably has to explain this to alot of people but it was a bad first impression. On the way to the room, me and Carri talked about how rude she was. The room looked good, standard 2 bed. Very clean. But there's no microwave, no coffee maker and no fridge (oh, unless you ask for one ahead of time and then it's $20. a night). This made things hard if you're trying to keep drinks in your room and snacks. We kept things in bags of ice in the bathroom. By the way the ice bucket is very small- so, you'll be making many trips to the ice machine. And we never got to use the coffee we bought for our stay. After partying all night, we got back to the room and noticed the bottom lock would not lock. It would not turn over. So, we only had the latch lock on top. It was 6:30am and all we wanted to do was go to sleep. I called the operator to tell her so that maybe they could fix the lock the next day. I told her, we have a "do not disturb" sign on the door but I just want to make sure that housekeeping doesn't come into the room. She instited to have maintence check it out. We waited. I called the operator and they said "they will be there in 3 minutes". We waited. Now I was getting mad, this was the 3rd phone call I had to make when all I wanted was for them to not disturb us!!! The man on the phone said "would you like to be moved to a different room tomorrow?" and I said I guess so. We were never moved to a different room. It was pretty expensive for not having many amenities and the pool was not even open!!! We weren't allowed to lay out even. I'll end this by saying all the valet guys were always awesome!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Tropicana Does It Right”
Reviews.Author: plymouthLVfan
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, quite and comfortable. Casino was light and airy. Pool area was very relaxing. Room service was great. All the hotel staff were friendly and heplful. I was always able to find ample parking. Can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “very clean and spacious”
Reviews.Author: Jan56_10
Reviews.Content: Although the tropicanna is at the end of the strip it is worth visiting. It is in the process of being updated but this did not affect our stay. All the staff are very pleasant. We were upgraded to a mini suite when we told them we were getting married. The room was spacious and very clean. When you looked out of the window you could see the MGM this should give you some idea where it is. I feel we made the right choice. If we had stayed at some of the bigger hotels it would probably have taken you half an hour to get to your room. I would definitely reccommend the hotel and hopefully go again finances permitting. Thanks for a great stay Tropicanna 10/10

Reviews.Title: “The service at the Tropicana is Amazing!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: simor72
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Las Vegas for fun and to celebrate and friends birthday. From the moment we arrived, we were greeted with smiles and positive attitudes. The moment we pulled up to the front door until the moment we checked out we were treated like VIP, although we were just there for one night, it didn't seem to matter to the hotel staff. The hotel staff made us feel like our business was truly appreciated and they wanted us to have the best experience possible within the hotel. I have to say, walking in through the glass doors and into a bright environment with the white marble floors and colorful decorations was refreshing. It really started the mood for the whole trip. As we walked to the front desk, which is less than 60' from the hotel entrance, which is awesome, I didn't feel lost not knowing where the front desk was. The first thing that really impressed me was the friendly front desk clerk that engaged in conversation with us. The check-in to the hotel process was a smooth and easy. We have stayed in Vegas hotels many times and I am one that gets impatient while in hotel check-in lines. Not the case at the Tropicana. We were not in line for more than 5 minutes before we were checking in to our beautiful suite. Our room was immaculate! We had a suite which we were told was just refurbished through a hotel renovation. I have to say, I was truly impressed with the decor and comfort that our suite offered. Our friends were staying at another hotel, the MGM, they came over to our room and and their jaws dropped as they walked through the door saying, "we got ripped off, your suite is amazing!" I have never stayed in a hotel in Vegas that I didn't wake up the next morning with back pain from a very uncomfortalbe bed. I woke up the next morning feeling refreshed, no back pain and ready for day two in Vegas. I would truly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Vegas. I have already told my family and friends of this experience and that the Tropicana is amazing! Awesome hotel and service. I would recoommend to anyone traveling to Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value”
Reviews.Author: BostonPeripatetic
Reviews.Content: I had a great four night stay at the Trop. The hotel is being renovated, but it's still very pleasant and will be even more so when the work has been completed. The restaurants were quite satisfactory. Cafe Nikki provided a nice breakfast brunch. Foodies should check out the prix fixe at Biscayne for dinner; on the night I went, I had a choice between Ostrich Tenderloin and Seared Bronzino for main courses, along with suitable wine pairings. As of March 2011, the pool was a work in progress, but was already lovely, with a sloping green lawn and plantings leading down to an art deco shaped pool surrounded by chaises and cabanas. The casino has white walls, which makes it a little brighter than the usual cave-like Vegas gambling den. The waitress came around twice during the time I was playing slots, and like everyone at the hotel was very friendly. The room was terrific, recently renovated in soothing desert colors. There was no minibar, but ice and soda machines are available in the hallway. The only reason I'm assigning 4 stars instead of 5 is that I requested a view of the Strip, but instead was given a room facing the rear of the building, with a view of about 1000 acres of parking lots and the airport in the distance. Also, when I checked in I was told that the hotel didn't have a room of the type I'd reserved available at the time, so I was going to be upgraded to a suite, and then moved after 2 nights when a King room became available. Therefore I had to wait around on day 3 to check with the front desk, and then pack, move to a new room and unpack for a second time. While all these machinations didn't totally destroy day 3, they didn't make it any better either. But when I told the front desk staff person that the room change was disruptive, she immediately waived the resort fee, which made me feel a little better. While it still isn't clear to me why a room that was reserved two months in advance, and then confirmed by telephone two days before check in, wasn't available upon arrival, it all worked out. And everything else was great. The hotel has a really cool, laid back, relaxed Miami feel, with white walls and marble floors in the public areas. The restaurants are good and more are coming. I enjoyed my stay very much, and plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great surprise”
Reviews.Author: IGX
Reviews.Content: We are staying at Tropicana for oye anniversary. The renewed rooms look great, they are big, clean and comfortable. You can't beat the location right in the center of the strip -the four corners-. It has been a nice surprise, as we had the old hotel image, and with the renewal is a great option with great value.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: pfanny37
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tropicana for four nights in March. The rooms were newly renovated and very nice. Part of the pool opened the last day of our stay. It looked very nice, but we did not spend any time there. The construction was not an issue for us. We were in the Island Tower which was a little bit of a walk, but it wasn't too bad. We never heard any construction in our room. My one complaint is that the website says they recently renovated their fitness center. It is extremely tiny, and they only offered 3 treadmills, and one of them was ot working. Out of the three times I went down (between 5-6 am) I only got on the treadmill once. It seemed a little ridiculous to have to pay the resort fee for a pool that was closed until the end of our stay, and a fitness center that I was barely able to use. All in all, it was a very nice stay. I would consider staying there again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect!”
Reviews.Author: J_Vito
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, the people were on the front desk were helpful. They granted us late check out. One thing I'd like to point out, was that from the moment we got in, the smell of smoke was quite strong. Hopefully they do something out it. The hotel was huge and our room was quite far! When we got to the room, it was clean and nice. But when I went to use the IPOD dock, it was dusty! The rooms don't have a microwave or a fridge, so you have to eat your meals as is, in case you have leftovers. The pool was decent size and there was a lot more renovations going on. I liked the free ice dispenser on our floor. One thing I didn't like was that we got locked out of our room on the last day but before the check out time. I inquired about it and front desk didn't apologize and even blamed me that I might have demagnetized it with my cellphone. I'm aware of this issue with cards hence, I always kept it in my pocket far from anything the might demagnetize the card. Plus both our cards didn't work. But they didn't care to look into it further. I think what happened was that they forgot to put in the late check out on their system and didn't want to admit the mistake. Overall a decent stay but wasn't perfect. PROS: *good value *ice dispenser *pool *helpful staff *great room CONS: *smoke smell *a little dust on some parts of the room *got locked out the room *no fridge/microwave

Reviews.Title: “Great blackjack dealer”
Reviews.Author: saltpnut
Reviews.Content: Seven of us met at the Tropicana from 5 different states for a get together of old high school friends. We had a fabulous time. The rooms were very nice. Everyone we dealt with who worked there were the absolute best. A blackjack deal by the name of Tamae was the best experience for me. She was very professional and made it the most fun for me. She will be the reason I'll return. Two things I felt could have been better were 1) need to have a deli, 2) the pool/spa was closed for const & we still had to pay the "Resort Fees" which I felt was not right.

Reviews.Title: “Will Definitly Return”
Reviews.Author: Pooveypoo20
Reviews.Content: We had an exceptional time staying at the Tropicana. I told the front desk clerk at check-in that we had a special occasion (birthday) and asked if they could do anything "special". she said she would check with her manager, who happened to walk by at that instance, and he was super nice-within 30 minutes of check-in we had champagne and strawberries "on the house". We had a terrific room that was very clean with a great view of the strip. We slept well (no noise), ordered room service (twice) that was very reasonably priced and the portions were huge, so we split an entree the second time. The restaurants were great (Biscayne was one of our best meals in Vegas!) and I can't wait until I return next year to see the Hotel's remodeling complete (Nikki Beach here we come!). The only negative was the resort fee, because the pool was not open, I did not need/use the Wi-Fi, and parking is free in Vegas anyway. I asked the front desk to wave it at check-in for the previous reasons I stated, but she would not. Next time I stay there (or anywhere with a resort fee), I will make sure the pool is open so I won't mind as much to be charged.

Reviews.Title: “Will be beautiful when finished, staff is indifferent.”
Reviews.Author: IdeasWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is undergoing major renovations and will be a beautiful hotel when complete. Some major issues with construction noise starting at 6:00 am. When we called prior to booking, we were assured that the noise would not bother the guests. Promises made on rooms when booking will not be honored. Promises of discounts and coupon books on site will not be honored. Desk clerks could not care less if you have an issue and neither does the Guest Services Manager Nicole Marshall. They have mastered the art of the brush off. We emailed them a week ago about our experience and heard nothing until we emailed them again today. Received a long winded email basically saying "too bad". Promised to give us personal attention NEXT TIME! Cafe Nikki is very nice and the staff there is great. Bell hops and Valet are super friendly and knowledgeable too. Room was clean and housekeeping was excellent.Casino is bright and very enjoyable, the nicest casino in Vegas in my opinion.Pool area will be nice, but will not be ready for a long time. They were pouring concrete when we were there last week. They still claim the pool will be open in May, but with their track record of honesty, I would not be too sure about that. My opinion, WAIT awhile before considering staying there and get everything in writing. I go to Vegas 4-5 times a year, and I can't see myself staying there again. Seems like they think they are the only hotel in town. They will learn the hard way.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: OG_1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and it was wonderful. The service was second to none,we had an amazing room with a strip view and the food from room service was delicious. Overall a great experience . Enjoy Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Would definately stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Sok53
Reviews.Content: Everything from check in to check out went smoothly. We really enjoyed the open and bright atmosphere. The rooms were very clean and quiet. Our room didn't have the greatest view. It actually faced the airport but we never heard any planes. We ate at the Nikki Cafe and the food was very good. And if you want the atmosphere of one of the larger casinos, MGM and New York New York are right across the street. I managed to find a very loose slot, so they can pay off good. The casino staff were very friendly. My only complaint was that the room didn't get cool enough at night. Other than that we would definately stay here again when we return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “EXCEPTIONAL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Want2gobackagin
Reviews.Content: We returned from a 6 day stay at the new Tropicana and have absolutely NO complaints at all! Everyone from the front desk staff to the concierge to the cleaning staff, casino staff, security,,,,,everyone is very friendly and more than accomodating. We encountered strong winds that resulted in two windows being smashed out of our suite due to a guideline being loosened...staff were very prompt to secure the room and upon our return from an evening out, attended with us to move our belongings to a suite higher up. The beds are very comfortable and the big bonus was not only a Keurig in the room, but coffee, bottled water and a bar fridge in our second room! I hate letting such secrets but credit is due to everyone at the new Tropicana! We cannot wait to go back and thanks again to Nicole for the 'sweet suite'.....see you soon!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: nice_huesped
Reviews.Content: I had the chance to stay at the hotel with friends and I was surprised at how nice the rooms look after the remodeling phase. The rooms are pretty big, the furniture is trendy and has a South beach feeling (which is the look they're going for with the adition of Nikki beach club), and they are clean and fresh. We had connecting rooms which provided a lot of space and we had a great view of the Strip from our rooms. Even though there are still parts of the hotel undergoing construction/remodelation, the place looked clean and bright. This hotel has a great location and with the good rates they offer it's a great value for travellers in a budget.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: Darangers2004
Reviews.Content: The NEW Trop is AWESOME!!!!!! The staff was super friendly and really responsive. I oly wish the slots paid a little more. Seriously, this was one of my best stays in Vegas. I can't wait until July when I go back and the Trop is where I am staying. Thank you Trop staff for making this vacation actually feel like a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience at the Trop”
Reviews.Author: Shejet
Reviews.Content: What can I say. Everything was excellent at the Tropicana. From the time we checked in with Shelia to Marcos, our bellman, was so informative and took extra time out with us. From Nikki's cafe to the bellman, to the concierge to the entire hotel staff, our stay was very pleasant. Valet parking was great and all I can say is that our entire stay at Tropicana was worth giving the "new" Tropicana a try. I will definitely stay again on my next visit to Vegas, although I wish we could have gotten a strip view room because of the airplane noise. Overall great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “SERVICE IS OUTSTANDING!!!”
Reviews.Author: stoneinsac
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the "Trop" was one that had some very wonderful memories, most all great with only one not so great. First of all I traveled, due to a recent surgery, in a wheelchair throughout the Hotel. Access was easy with only a couple of longer jaunts throughout as i was attending a Convention. Service from Todd the Food & Bev. Director was above great as he brought me some gloves to my room in knowing my hands were hurting from my travels in the chair. Jen Spraul was another of the incredible staff of the Trop who was willing to go out of her way to do whatever she could to make my stay comfortable & pleasant including offering to push me if I ever needed a break from wheeling on my own! I only was able to dine in Nikki's Cafe, which during Happy Hour was affordable and excellent! Service was knowledgable & always freindly! My only complaint was I was staying during the renovation of the outside pool area which my room was facing. Construction started very early in the morning, ( 6:00 am ). I was offered another room away but had my room completely set up with Diecast for our Convention and would have taken me hours to break-down and re-setup. I will be back and look forward to enjoying the Trop again!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: sgordon3
Reviews.Content: We were there last weekend. Check in was great. I asked if the room they booked us for a good view and she looked and changed us rooms. We were in the paradise tower. Casino was very bright and clean. Room was clean. Beds were comfortable. The remodeling was not bothersome. The location was not the best as it is at the far end of the strip. As long as you take the bus it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice on the strip with a few quirks”
Reviews.Author: holly1385
Reviews.Content: So my husband and I decided to do an early anniversary trip and booked this hotel. After booking it we saw some good reviews and some bad reviews. That is just typical on here. All in all to start off: we are not picky people! All in all we like a clean room to sleep in! So we arrived on February 21 and staying for about 8 nights. We had delayed flights so we were a little on edge and tired. We pulled up to the Tropicana and were super impressed of the new renovations from the outside! We haven't been here since 2009 and no offense it was a major dump than! So this was a good start pulling up. Everyone was super nice and polite from holding doors open for us, trying to help us with our luggage, straight through to the check in process! Its bright and lively when you walk in and its CLEAN! :) The walk for us didnt bother us at all. We wanted the exercise anyways. We were put on the 4th floor. Decent. So I walked into the room and told my husband not to touch anything. ( I use to be a housekeeper in my younger days) lol The odor hit me in the face and I knew right there something wasnt right! To keep this section short and sweet : lets just say that they shut the door and forgot to finish cleaning that one! ... BAD! Even though to some that seems horrible the ladies at the front desk promptly changed me to a mini suite down the hall! I told them I would get the key myself so I didnt have to wait 20 min for someone to come up. NO BIG DEAL! They were nice and very apologetic! This room was a lot better. Corner suite with an ok view. 10 minutes goes by and the front desk called us to make sure everything was ok! A+ in my book for checking in with us! We went to Nikki's cafe for a bite to eat which we had wonderful service late at night there! bar tender -- forgot his name-- gave us great ideas for our trip, talked with us and was super friendly!! A+ We went to the fitness center which was ok! I didnt realize how many people are on vacation working out! Until I was here and people were waiting in line to use equipment. If any recommendations can be made; I would suggest adding another treadmill / elliptical or two. This is what people were waiting for while I was there during my visit! Along with adding an additional water cooler, and more towels. Everything was out and it was usually only 8 am when we went!!! Housekeeping was ok, several days I think she forgot that we use towels to shower and soap as well, so we used the one that was still left! Other than that was good. All in all the tropicana is a great place to stay. Good service and it seems they are always willing to help or improve if anything needs it! I just wished that we were placed at the other end of the building. Unfortunately our room was right under the construction site! YIKES!!!! I was up every morning at the crack of dawn hearing "BEEP BEEP BEEP, BOOM BOOOM CRASH CRASH!!!!!!" Ear plugs worked well! Didnt take the smell of the demolition away though. Again pretty easygoing people, so we really grinned and barred that situation trying to take into consideration that they are fixing things. Wasn't too thrilled of sleeping like that though for my anniversary trip! Oh Sunday was an amazing sleep in day! Of course no construction workers! :) Again nice and can't wait to see what else they do with it! Next time I want a quiet section ;)

Reviews.Title: “Beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: cdncole
Reviews.Content: My great experience started just after booking - I joined the facebook group and was greeted so politely by Nicole Marshall, and she was so very welcoming and helpful... although I got a great deal online through a wholesale travel website, she still was able to enhance the experience even more. I was greeted by a very friendly security guy as our cab pulled up, and our check in was a breeze (we were early and our rooms weren't ready, but the check-in clerk did her best to find us the best room with a view. Then the hotel knew beforehand (from facebook) that I was there to celebrate my birthday and presented us with a welcoming gift and sweet card from Nicole and the hotel. Housekeeping staff was very friendly each time we passed her... and when I had an very serious incident, both the bellman's desk and the concierge desk went out of their way to help me resolve it... which helped me to enjoy the Vegas experience so much more. We went for breakfast at Cafe Nikki and a very friendly Jeremy (ask for his section) was our server and had the warmest smile the second time we saw him. He remembered us and that was very nice. I have stayed at many different hotels in Vegas, and I can honestly say that this one goes beyond others... it was like staying at Mandalay Bay service, but with friendliness and warmth, from every facet to the shop, to the dealers and cocktail waitresses. When leaving... and waiting for a taxi in the queue... the attendant was genuine in his delivery and asking how our trip/experience was. I can't wait to return to Vegas... I've already talked my co-worker and friend into booking there, as they travel to Vegas almost as many times as I do.

Reviews.Title: “The reception from the front desk made the stay”
Reviews.Author: GuyCadden
Reviews.Content: I booked The Tropicana for my Dad's 80th Birthday. When I checked in on Sunday March 6th I was greeted by Rose @ registration. Rose was absolutley wonderfull!!! My father was actually booked for Monday the 7th and Rose made sure that we would have connecting rooms. My brother also was booked for Monday the 7th and we were all on the same floor. We were also able to check in early. Like the airlines(with there added fees), hotels are adding a so called resort fee. At the Tropicana that fee is 9.99 per day plus tax, which allows you to use all the Hotel's ammenities. I'd rather they just add it to the room cost so you know right up front what your total cost will be. You basically have to pay that fee. Because it was my Dad's 80th when i went to check us out Rose waived that fee for my Dad's suite. As far as I'm concerned Rose went above and beyond. I will definetly stay @ The Tropicana again. There were a couple of negatives that hopefully will be resolved when they complete thier remodle. (1) There wasn't a lot of options for reasonable priced food. I'm sorry but $16.99 for breakfast buffet is not a deal.I understand they are building a marketplace with various food options . Also I when I ordered a coke @ the bar I was charged $4.00 which is fine if you can get refills, I was told no refills. (2) While the TV's are new and a great picture the delay is crazy and needs to be resolved, also it is not real user friendly . The engineer told us that they were having issues with there provider which is Cox cable. That really is the only to negatives and all staff were great

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveller69
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tropicana for 8 nights from Feb 27th 2011. Had a fantastic stay from the moment we arrived. Check in was quick and easy and Melanda (check in) gave us a corner room which is slightly bigger and overlooks the strip to Mandalay Bay, Luxor, Excalibur, New York New York and MGM. Thanks Melanda. The rooms are fresh and bright and the beds very comfortable. My room was in the Island Tower which alot of people on this website are saying in their reviews is a ridiculous walk from the front desk. Well that's ridiculous. The only way this walk is a problem is if you're an invalid or more than 20 stone (300 lb). It's not very long at all. Some people just need something to complain about. Also, there are 6 elevators serving the Island Tower so you never have to wait long for one. The casino floor, although probably the smallest on the strip from what I saw, is clean and bright. Not like the rest of the hotel casinos, you can actually tell whether it's night or day. Not dark and dingey. All the staff we encountered during our stay were pleasant and helpful. Yes, there is construction work ongoing but this doesn't bother or affect any of the guests. The pool area looks like it will be great when it's finished, which I was told will be around the start of April. I didn't eat at all in the hotel so I can't comment on the quality of the restaurants. I did read the menus and the prices seem to be consistant with the restaurant prices all along the Strip. When I stayed, the hotel didn't offer a breakfast buffet which seem very popular with holiday makers, including my wife and I, but it's a very short walk to other hotels that do offer breakfast buffets, (The Cosmipolitan's is the best by a long way). I went to the car hire desk to get a car for the following day and when I went down next morning to collect the car, it wasn't ready so got a free upgrade to one that was, so was able to drive out to see Hoover Dam and the Grand Canyon in a convertible Mustang. Overall, I've no complaints about the Tropicana. In fact, the opposite. It's great value for money, I had a fantastic stay and would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Still renovating, but a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Linda60188_10
Reviews.Content: Was here the end of February, the first part of March for a convention. My room was in the Island Tower. Bed was extremely comfortable, new flat screen TV. Nice bathroom. However, if you are very tall, the shower head will probably be too low for you! All the employees were very polite, friendly, and helpful. They are still constructing the pool area, but since it wasn't pool weather yet, this was not a problem for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a beautifully remodeled hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HappyWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at the Trop! Smaller and quieter than the bigger hotels in a good location. The staff was very friendly and our room was beautiful. The hotel is still under construction. The pool was not complete, which was disappointing. Also, no coffee makers in the rooms or coffee in the lobby, and no place to buy a cup so we had to go to the Starbucks in the next hotel. But, overall those two inconveniences were minor compared to the value and quality of our experience.

Reviews.Title: “NLPOA Las Vegas & California Conference”
Reviews.Author: MarcosdeNiza
Reviews.Content: From the time our party arrived until the time we departed the quality of service at the Tropicana was excellent. This comment holds true for the service I received throughout the hotel to include the server that hosted our after conference reception, Mary was her name and she did a wonderful job picking up after the attendees and overseeing the catered banquet. The entire staff was friendly, displayed patience and understanding. I will recommend the hotel to friends and stay at the hotel again given the oppurtunity.

Reviews.Title: “everything went well”
Reviews.Author: is4belle
Reviews.Content: Clean room, no noise heard, great service. Although it is the further down of the strip, it is also the closest to the airport. It might not be the most extravagant casino, but it was great to lodge there (and not expensive). We would stay there again but would not take any shuttle (better by taxi - great time saver and not that much more expensive since we were so closed to the airport).

Reviews.Title: “Refreshed and ReInvigorated”
Reviews.Author: HWJOEA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the LV Trop for a convention 2/23-2/28 and I have to say right off the bat that the hotel staff had to be the friendliest people I have encountered in LV in a long time. They really seem to care about making the refreshed atmosphere work! Everyone right down the the snack shop clerks were helpful and knowledgeable. The rooms in the Paradise Tower where I satyed were nicely renovated and clean! Housekeeping staff were very courteous and conscientious. While I would like to have had some lower priced food oiptions that was is currently offered, the Caffe Nikki breakfast buffet was good value at $14.99 and the Ciao Italian restaurant prepared very tasty food for an OK price. POthers in my party stated the lunch and dinner offerings were also quite tasty! The catered food I had for one function was well made as well! If you want some cheaper alternatives, they arent a far walk away off property. The casino workers were all friendly but the slots were only a little loose. The pool area was still being renovated but it would have been too cold to use anyway during my stay. All in all it was a good stay at the Trop LV and I would very much like to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best value hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: labhras
Reviews.Content: I paid £212 pounds for 7 nights in the Tropicana and feel that this was very good value for this Hotel. Rooms were the best I have ever stayed in at this price range. Staff were friendly especially Doug at check in who waived the resort fee for the whole 7 days. We had a room on the 7th floor Paradise Tower and although we did have some noise from the renovations that are on going it did not spoil our trip. The waitress service was very good and never had to wait to long for a drink even though are small time gamblers. We received a promotions book to the value of £900 at check in but to honest this was a bit of a con as it only cost us money that we would not have otherwise spent. We had a very good stay and would recommend this resort especially when it is finished and when the weather gets a bit warmer.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated and right next to the MGM”
Reviews.Author: Swim4speed
Reviews.Content: I went to Las Vegas for a wedding photography convention at the MGM. I decided to stay at the Tropicana because of the good/great reviews on TripAdvisor.com & because of the location and price. The Tropicana has been renovated & is still going through more renovations...including the swimming pool area. The room seemed almost brand new. The bed, linens, desk, dresser, night stands, TV, and carpet all seemed to be like new. The only things that were not new, but were still okay, were the tiles on the bathroom floor and shower walls. My room was quiet, so I had no trouble sleeping. I plan on staying at the Tropicana again for the convention next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great lower priced rooms...still renovating”
Reviews.Author: MLBogert
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tropicana Las Vegas for 4 nights at the end of February in a standard king room. It was one of the best deals I could find using the usual gamut of online booking sites (went through priceline.com). If you're looking for a very clean room, without over the top decor, at a very reasonable price on the southern part of the strip, Tropicana is your place. If you're looking for a large casino in your hotel, the Trop is not the place for you. It has probably the smallest casino (by a long shot) on the strip, but it is probably the brightest and best smelling (if you're bothered by smoke filled casinos). They really pump the tropical air freshner into this place! We stayed in the Garden Tower, which is a good bit of a walk to the southeast of the main part of the hotel, through a long hallway, with the pool areas on both sides. Speaking of the pool area, it is all still under renovation and probably will be until at least April. Of course, that's about the time it would normally be opened up, so it shouldn't be too much of a big deal. They have renovated the rooms and I was very impressed with the cleanliness and bed. Also, be aware that you are charged an additional $10/night in addition to the regular room rate for a resort fee, which during the winter months amounts to nothing more than "free" internet. Bottom line: If you want a lower priced, but very clean and casual room that's within close walking distance to all of the casinos on the south side of the strip (right across the street from MGM, Excalibur, and New York New York, with very easy access to all), this is a very good choice. If you want a large, in house casino, this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “A great time hotel”
Reviews.Author: htcfred
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Tropicana was very nice. The view we had of the strip was awesome. The service was exceptional. The rooms were clean and comfortable. I did wish they had a coffee maker in the room for my morning coffee. I had to travel every morning down 19 flights on the elevator and either get coffee at the bar or travel to the other side of the hotel for the Java Java coffee stand. Also, a microwave in the room would have been nice to reheat my coffee or make popcorn for the nights we dicided to stay in and rest up. Overall...... It was the best vacation I've ever had anywhere. PS. I found the food prices to be excessive considering the gambling and losing I did. The machines are very very tight.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mandyjo44
Reviews.Content: A large group of us stayed at the hotel for a wedding that took place there and I can honestly say this was the worst hotel i have EVER stayed at. It was a headache the whole time we were there and nothing went right at all. THey management was did not communicate with eachother so each time we had an issue which was alot we had to deal with a new manager and explain our story over and over agian. This was suppose to be a relaxing stay for the wedding party but in the end it was nothing but stressful!!! I would never recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Is there any way you could get your staff on the same page?”
Reviews.Author: christykuntz
Reviews.Content: I will get right to the point. We had a group of approximately 25 people come to stay at your hotel for a wedding. The bride is very detail-oriented (as she should be, it was HER wedding). She planned out everything, talked to your staff countless times and after all that, we show up to...excuse my profanity, a $#@% show. There is one easy way to remedy this. May cost you some money up front but in the long run, it may just work: Could you all maybe get the same computer system? So when Thomas at the front desk says that all the tuxes will be taken care of, the lady in the tux shop knows this? Or when Alaina(I believe thats her name) says it would be more than okay for us to store our hand made food w/ room service...when we called them they wouldnt answer, so I had to go to the bell check(?) desk and THEY couldnt even get a hold of room service. To the bell desks credit, they let me store the 2nd round of food in their break room refrigerator. (By the way, these promises were made due to room screw ups, etc) I am not writing this to be rude. I am not asking for anything free. I am pregnant and could be doing a lot of other important things w/ my time. I am typing this in a frenzy because maybe the next wedding party you have there wont have to endure the same problems(I didnt even get into all we went through). We do have mutual friends getting married there in May and I was told by a friend who was present w/ me at the wedding that shes already informed them to cancel their reservations w/ The Tropicana and go elsewhere. My friend, the bride, spoke w/ the vice-president of Tropicana when we got back and he couldnt have been more rude. Really unnecessary in my book. Also, we live in a fairly small community(but a college town, nonetheless) full of service industry workers, white collar, blue collar, trust funders, etc. To your vice president, what Callie had to say didnt matter one bit. Here, before we even stepped foot back in Montana, everyone knew about The Tropicana. On a high note, the room my husband and I stayed in was nice and clean. We took quite a bit of money from your casino, that was a plus. Alaina (again, I think that was the managers name~pretty, long dark hair), was very nice. Thomas was very nice, the day he was working. Too bad none of them ever worked more than one day in a row...which is where your computer system would come in handy! Imagine being able to type in a room # and know whats gone on w/ that room, what needs to happen, what was told to the guest, etc. If you have that capability, it was never used, and that is truly unfortunate. There are so many places to stay in Vegas. Obviously, individual business doesnt hold much weight in the eyes of The Tropicana. People will continue to book reservations w/ you, and you will continue to look at your year end numbers and not wonder what you can do to make someones experience the best it can be(for your price range). We know we didnt book at The Bellagio. No one in our party has champagne taste on a beer budget. Just stop promising things you cant follow through with. Underpromise and over deliver, ever hear the phrase? We may not matter, and maybe the wedding party that'll probably cancel in May doesnt either...but keep it up and dont try to fix it when its too late.

Reviews.Title: “excellant service”
Reviews.Author: gilli
Reviews.Content: writing from our room on the 20th floor overlooking the strip.we are here to celebrate our wedding anniversary. the room is very clean and spacious. the beds are extremely comfortable. in particular the staff are very attentive and helpful. the view is exciting every time we look out, so much going on day and night, but the windows do keep out most of the noise, although have heard some people grumbling about it. we think its great to be in the middle of all of it. we would definately stay here again and would recommend to friends also.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL WE EVER STAYED IN”
Reviews.Author: TheKings70
Reviews.Content: The Tropicaca Hotel had excellent staff we loved our room hotel in great location we had the time of our life would definetly stay again planning on returning again in august for a weekend getaway looking forward to see them again

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Louandjon
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Stayed for 4 nights and found rooms very comfy and modern. Stayed in island tower which was fine, just a couple of mins walk from casino floor. Casino staff were friendly, they taught us how to play on tables that we were unsure of! On departure, staff were helpful and printed out our boarding passes for us-very polite! Location was ok, right next to MGM. A but of a long walk to ti etc but surely you go to Vegas to explore the strip! The hotel smelt lovely of coconut oil! Shop was a but pricey but it is a hotel afterall! Overall, a great hotel that will be even better when pool facilities are complete! We would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Trop!”
Reviews.Author: chichi62
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Oct 2010 with girlfriends. Check in very fast and I loved being in the Paradise Tower. I am starting to really see the plus's of staying in a smaller strip hotel, first, it took only a few minutes to go down for a Starbucks in the morning, as opposed to a good 1/2 hour trek in the big hotels. And if you forget something in your room, or need more cash, the room was only a couple minutes away. We were on the 2nd floor, and next time ( which will be Apr 30 -May 4) I will request a higher room , we looked over to the Luxor and Excaliber. The location of the Trop is fantastic for those having a car in Las Vegas, it was so easy to get anywhere from there. Overall, we were treated very well by the Trop staff and have nothing but good things to say. Looking forward to Apr 30 when we will be there again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! Great room, great staff, great experience!”
Reviews.Author: somethingelse44
Reviews.Content: From the check-in to check-out an awesome experience! We used the valet service and the guys were most helpful. They would go get our car the minute they saw us coming! The suite was roomy and the beds comfortable and inviting! Ours overlooked the strip and satisfied our desire to be right in the middle of the action of the city. All of the staff were friendly, pleasant and helpful. We tried all three restaurants and each one had excellent food with great service.

Reviews.Title: “great stay!! outstanding customer service!! best rooms in vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: amberj17
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times during the summer, and staying in February in the off season is just as wonderful!! Staff was friendly as always! Nikki cafe is open and the food was delicious!! Got room service one night and it was fast and also delicious! Went to the Beatles tribute concert called Yesterday and it was extremely entertaining!! Due to the conference I had to stay close, and honestly I could have stayed in the Tropicana the whole time!! The gym is still in great condition, so they are not letting things go unrepaired or unstocked like some places do. The cleaning staff did a wonderful job on the room, and the room was AMAZING! Since it's off-season the upgrade to a suite was very affordable. I did it and have no regrets! Jacuzi tub, sauna, HUGE room, bar with a fridge and coffee maker, definitely worth it!! The room was a perfect swap to not having a pool (which is awesome in the summer, trust me!) Will be back and will continue to go back whenever I go to Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “Bugs and Indifferent staff”
Reviews.Author: Accessible_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I brought my 89 year old, wheelchair-bound, great aunt with me for a getaway. Bell staff pretty much ignored us (no help with bags arriving or leaving; help getting taxis spotty); Registration requires three steps up or a tight, switchback ramp... very difficult pushing a wheelchair and pulling a bag. The room was a wonderfully accessible room and very easy to work with. Food was overpriced and uninspired (MGM Buffet next door was great and we loved seeing the lions every day). I would have recommended staying at the Tropicana ("Great rooms; great prices, great location; everything else not so good") right up until we woke up with about 15 bites between the two of us. Spiders? Bedbugs? We didn't see anything but definitely were biten by something while we slept. To deal with the issue, we went to the Information Desk who sent us to the Concierge who sent us to the Manager who sent us to Security who sent a team up to the room to photograph everything and take statements. No compensation in any form was offered at any point. NOT A SINGLE PERSON, AT ANY POINT, APOLOGIZED OR EXPRESSED REGRET. "Risk Management" was supposed to contact us when we got home, but we've heard nothing from them. Nicole Marshall sent a nice email this morning saying to contact her for "more personal attention" when we book our next stay. Our next stay?? Not very likely!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: vacationlovers
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tropicana for 5 nights in February. Picked the hotel because of the reviews on Tripadvisor and the reasonable price. Check in was was quick. There were no long lines like we saw at other hotels. Rose at the Front Desk could not have been nicer or more professional. It was our anniversary, so she upgraded us to the 21st floor of the Paradise Tower. (Try to get a room at the Paradise Tower, if you are able.) I tried to leave her a tip, but she refused to take it, saying it was not necessary. It was the perfect start to our vacation. Thank you Rose. The room was new, very clean and had a nice view. Our luggage arrived moments after we reached the room; he even brought us a bucket of ice and answered some of our questions. The room was kept clean daily and twice we had turn down service in the evening, including a bar of chocolate and a bottle of water. Since we did not expect this, it was a nice touch. We even got a little hand written "thank you" note from the maid on the last day. The Tropicana seems to pride itself on its new image. Everyone was friendly and helpful. Customer Service was beyond our expectations. We saw almost none of it at any of the other places we visited, except, of course, from people trying to sell you something. Upon entering or leaving the hotel, we were always greeted with a smile and an open door. We are not big gamblers so we only played the penny slots for a short time. We were asked if we wanted drinks twice. The hotel is very convenient and the monorail is right next door at the MGM Grand. Also, it is very bright and the cigarette smoke is not overwhelming, as it was in many of the hotels. If you are looking for a nice, clean, new room and a friendly staff, this is the place to be. If you are looking for something else, Vegas has plenty of options. One problem was that are only a few restaurants, but we were told that more are on the way. We cannot wait to visit again once they have finished construction. Our only hope is that they remain as reasonable as they are now.

Reviews.Title: “If you like a dirty bathroom floor and getting locked out of your room at 2 a.m-this is the place!”
Reviews.Author: GoinNowhereFast
Reviews.Content: So, this was our first trip to Las Vegas and I wasn't really sure of a good hotel or location. I did book at the last minute (a night before) and I can see why there was a vacancy. Check-in was quick and the staff seemed nice, but right away we realized the "Island Tower" where we were appointed was really like walking to an Island. The walk from the entrance to our the elevator was a very long one. Our FIRST room was on the 18th floor at the end of the hallway. My husband inserted our room key and two young men were sitting on the bed and watching tv. We were shocked and I'm sure they were caught by surprise as well. One of them comes out and lets us know there was a mix up with the room and the bellhop was due any minute to bring them their new key and take them to their new room. They quickly got their bags and left us in the room. Needless to say we both felt kind of uncomfortable that two complete strangers had already been in our room for who knows how long. At first, we decided to make the best of it and just chalk it up to bad luck. That was until I went to the bathroom and saw the dirty bathroom floor. When I mean dirty I mean PUBIC HAIR on the floor, dusty, and what looked like to me haphazardly (if even) swept/mopped. I guess they don't expect people to walk barefoot in it or at least that's how it was cleaned. That really pissed me off and my Husband and I decided to call the front desk for another room. They apologize and say they will send a bellhop up to give us a new key. While waiting, the previous bellhop comes knocking for the previous "tenants" room key. We were annoyed, but finally we get a new key. My husband tells the bellhop that because of their mistake we're now late. He continues walking away and says, "I'm just here to bring your key, I don't know". Anyways we get to our room on the 14th floor. Bathroom floor still dusty, but we're over the room situation and get ready to go out. We come back around 2am and after the long trek to our room realize that somehow the SECOND key is not being read and the door wont open. My husband calls the front desk and they say we'd have to pick it up because the only bellhop working is unable to take it to us. So we're tired as hell from walking and drinking the last 6 hours, but my poor husband has to make the trip back and forth. We didn't have enough energy to make it a big deal. PROS: Bed is comfy (most things are when drunk) Easy to find Close enough to a Monorail Station (MGM Grand) Flat screen TV (we probably watched 30 minutes total) Hotel/Casino looked clean CONS: Walk from lobby to Island Tower Staff was unhelpful Unorganized and understaffed No fridge

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Orland0belle
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights during the Rugby 7s last week - chose the Tropicana as it was one of the 'partner' hotels for the Rugby and we got a very good deal. Front of house staff were super friendly and efficient. Check was a 'breeze' - Allocated connecting rooms (as requested) in Paradise Tower overlooking the MGM. Beds & pillows were super comfy but the constant sirens, road & advertising noise from outside were not conducive to a good night's sleep. Rooms were a nice size ,well decorated and functional. Bathroom area was adequate, tiles were not new which seemed a little strange against the rest of the refurb going on. Toilet had a habit of 'running' continually and on occasion the shower took ages to heat up. Room was only cleaned 2 days out of 5, only once was a card left outside indicating that our room had been 'missed' due to us being in. As there was only me - it wasn't an issue as I had plenty of towels & did not make a mess. Loved the tropical smell in the corridors, hated the cigar/cigarette smoke everywhere else. Casino was light and not at all intimidating for a first timer, though we never once saw a cocktail waitress whilst playing. Great place to people watch. Ambah Lounge had a great atmosphere too. My real bug bear was the dining. Firstly no coffee makers in the rooms. If you are not going to provide the facility PLEASE provide somewhere to grab a cup in the morning!? Five times I trekked to the Island Tower coffee stand, only once was it open. No opening times posted, no 'back in 5 minutes' just the lights on but nobody home - very disappointing.
