Cafe Nikki - ate breakfast there one morning & were not made aware there was a breakfast buffet by hostess or server. Same thing happened at dinner, we overheard the server at the next table making reference to it after we had ordered. Aside from the restaurant the staff here were excellent, doormen, gift shop, even just walking around - everyone was friendly and approachable. Not particularly happy about the resort fee for no facilities either. We had 2 rooms and it cost us almost $130 for no pool, did not use phone or internet or fitness center or need boarding cards printed (which we mentioned at check in). Would I stay here again? Probably, but after the refurb has finished and I would pay a visit to Walmart for a cheap coffee maker. For a value hotel it is a great option, rooms exceeded expectations but the dining options came no where near.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, Great deal”
Reviews.Author: cletraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and another couple spent four nights at the Tropicana in January. We got super rates (approx. $40-50/night) via a Southwest Airlines package deal. I don't understand the $10/day resort fee but at that rate I don't care. The rooms are beautifully decorated, very clean and comfortable. The staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful. Breakfast buffet is small compared to some other places but there is a fair assortment of fresh fruit, bakery goods, eggs, breakfast meats, etc. and the breakfast room (Cafe Nikki) is bright with big windows and very quiet compared to some of the other mega-buffets. (If wanted, a large, luxury buffet breakfast (with the usual big crowds) is easily available at the Mandalay Bay, just a short walk and tram ride away.) We were not at all bothered by the construction going on around the hotel. It is visible but not noisy or obstructive. When we return to Vegas the Tropicana will be our first choice -- assuming the rates do not sky-rocket when the construction is finished.

Reviews.Title: “Great, good and not good”
Reviews.Author: On-the-road79
Reviews.Content: Arrived February 6, Super Bowl morning. I asked nicely if I could check in if they had a room available, and was told sure. Great! They only had Island Tower available. The "long walk" that everyone seems to complain about is not really that bad. My opinion is that elderly persons and persons with disabilities should get first shot at the Paradise Tower. Seriously, after all the walking a person does in Vegas, the walk back to the Island Tower is nothing to complain about. The room was great. It was nice to have so much "new" and the bed was very comfortable. The room wasn't anything fancy, just very nice. The bathroom, while not remodeled, was also something that wasn't worth complaining about. It was large, clean, and had good hot water. I had to fix the chain in my toilet to keep it from running all night, but again no biggie. All of the (hotel) staff went out of their way to be helpful. Housekeeping/ room service/ front desk/ doormen-- all of these contacts were extremely positive. As for the tropical odorant-- I was really looking forward to this as it is one of my favorite scents. I'm not sure it is going to work, though. I think it is because of it mixing with the odor of smoke in the casino, but every time I walked in the door, it smelled like-- hate to say it, but, farts. The sports book-- I have to have a good sports book at my Vegas hotel-- was a complete catastrophe. I have probably visited 90% of the sports books in Vegas, and I am always my happiest when there. Now I know that Tropicana's is a brand new operation, but every single experience I had at this one was a mess! The people did not know what they were doing, they had terrible hours (don't want to hear about the construction, they have a remote station but didn't open this at the promised time, either). I could go on and on with the negatives, but I'm getting mad and I don't want to. My friend and I took most of our gaming business elsewhere because of this. Also, I contacted Nicole Marshall by e-mail prior to my visit to ask two simple questions. After not getting a response in two weeks ( gave her the benefit of the doubt, I know weird things happen in cyber-space) I very carefully typed in her address again and waited patiently. No response. I mentioned in the email that I got her name from TripAdvisor, so I thought she would be motivated to respond. Because so many people on here sing her praises, I would say that my biggest disappointment in the Tropicana would be that she didn't respond to my simple questions. So, overall, worth going to the Tropicana. Steer way clear of the sports book. And if you see Nicole, don't say hi from me.

Reviews.Title: “WoW! How a massive remodel make for a Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: sa78258
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana Hotel just made a 161 Million Dollar renovation to its' facilities. The rooms are inspired by South Beach decor and furnishings. The room was beautiful! I was fortunate to have a corner room that had a beautiful view of The Strip. The Casino is well lit and has very bright decor and carpet as well. The staff were very accommodating and friendly. I highly recommend this as your next Hotel while in Las Vegas. I sure look forward to returning there in the near future. Of course I will be staying again at The Tropicana!

Reviews.Title: “Next year will be better”
Reviews.Author: Bonzer
Reviews.Content: Since we will return and good outweighed the bad - I will start with the good 1. Excellent customer service 2. Beds excellent comfort, wonderful view, new carpets, guest room doors, elevators, new flooring and bright new casino area. 3. Great location for that end of strip, lots to see and do. Although the monorail at the MGM seems about 2 confusing miles away. 4. Great new comedy venue (Brad Garrot), spelling of his name?, and great shows at the Tropicana. Bad 1. No cafe or coffee shop, breakfast not our favorite meal, do not like to spend $15 for a buffet at the Niki for coffee and something light. Long trek to the MGM (casino I hate due to the heavily perfumed odor and sheer size), each morning for coffee and food. If you go now you will have this problem - they plan to add a deli and cafe. 2. Uneven maid serivce - don't get it, although I did not alter my usual daily tip. 1st night I had to call for service the floor, tub and sink in the bathroom were dirty. Not just a little bit - hair all over the floor, countertop, in the tub. When you see that, you wonder about what you don't see. It appeared the beds and living room area were clean and comfortable. 3. Maid service - one day left one wash cloth, one day no bath mat? 4. The $10 a day charge for amenities that do not exist - no pool, no spa, we did not use the phone or internet. The charge was waived for the couple we traveled with - by the way I picked the hotel. When checking out they were asked how was the internet, they did not use it and the charged was waived. We were charged. Frankly if they had a coffee shop I'd paid $10 a day for it! 5. The highly promoted Mob experience is not open and the preview is just gift shop with a few small to scale models. Overall - we loved it, and we and the other couple are returning next year. Make sure you stay in the Paradise tower the other tower is closesr to Hooters than the main casino. Also if you want a view be prepared for some light in the windows and street noise. For us a bit of noise is worth it for a fantastic view.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, bed so comfortable and can't wait for how rockin' it'll be after the renovation!”
Reviews.Author: TravellinKitty
Reviews.Content: Loved the staff - they were all really geniuinely nice - esp. Kimberlee who we had at checkin and checkout - what a great way to start and end our stay! :-) Lots of renovations going on arund the pool area but that did not affect our stay. The new rooms are gorgeous and the beds incredibly comfortable. My hubby ate at Nikki Cafe and said it was good, but we pretty much dined elsewhere on the strip. Would have liked a coffee maker and fridge in the room, but figure they do not have that bc they want you to buy coffee, etc. and make the $ on that. Wish there was a coffee bar in the casino area near the front of the hotel instead of in the back Island Tower area. The key lime margaritas were awesome - watched the bartender squeezing the limes - yum! We had a room facing the strip and could hear the sirens at nite so the windows not that insulated, but it was not a big issue. Loved Recycled Percussion show at the hotel - amazing high energy, fun and inventive show where you get to play with them. Great interaction with the crowd and fun for the kids,too! :-) So looking forward to when the renovations are complete as I think the place is gonna be awesome! Wish they had had a miniature layout of what the property will look like when it is complete so I had a visual. We'll be back as the hotel is also in a great location to catch the monorail at MGM to go North or the shuttle to Luxor/Mandalay Bay to go South.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on the strip which is in a renovation process right now”
Reviews.Author: dg0209
Reviews.Content: - Rooms are super spacious and I got a 45 Dollar deal there which was just perfect for the location and the service you get. - Hotel is just right accors MGM and all the attractions are just in walking distance. - There are some minor distraction due to the construction work (renovations) onsite but I was not bothered by them at all.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect....I recommend without hesitation”
Reviews.Author: nettlesaj
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tropicana with my husband and friends for 7 days in early February. The hotel has been decorated to a lovely standard. The casino is lively and the public areas are clean and airy. We were in Paradise Tower on the 14th floor and I was impressed , it appeared to have been updated recently although I suspect that bathroom was still to be updated as the grouting was stained, some tiles chipped and the general design did not seem to go with the rest of the room. But it was clean. The bed was lovely I felt like I was being wrapped in snuggleness whenever I got into it and had no problem falling asleep. I found the Tropicana to be a real oasis, initially I was disappointed that I had not booked a 'themed' hotel however after traipsing through other hotels I appreciated that generally the Tropicana had guests and not just tourists hanging around it which I preferred. I also liked the fact that I did not have to spend 20 minutes walking from the car park, through shops and casinos get to my room. It was perfect. We didn't eat in the hotel so I can't comment on the food. During a week stay there are likely to be a few problems wherever you stay and we encountered a couple which were quickly rectified. During our first night and exhausted from travelling we had problems with noise from our neighbouring room. It sounded like high spirits but it was late, I couldn't sleep through it so contacted the front desk Within 5 minutes security attended and the late night revellers quietened down. After a few days the air con did not seem to be working as well as it had . A call to the front desk had this quickly sorted out. I really would recommend staying at the Tropicana. It's a great location and as it was not high season the roads were not too busy and we were able to drive around really easily. There is self parking available in all the hotels and we found this the easiest way to get around in the evening if we were heading to the north Strip or freemont. During the day we tended to walk, good exercise! Our trip coincided with the Super bowl and the hotel was extremely busy. Not only did this make it an exciting weekend for us it was also very busy, everywhere! Unlike some places I have stayed in the numbers of people had little effect on the efficiency of the hotel. Staff remained helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort hotel”
Reviews.Author: bohdan09
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 days/3 nights during the HSBC Sevens rugby tourney-enjoyed the excellent room/service and staff

Reviews.Title: “A Classic is reborn”
Reviews.Author: R0adguy
Reviews.Content: Recently I booked a group of business associates and myself at the Tropicana after reading some positive reviews covering the make over the old classic hotel/casino is undergoing. The reviews were accurate the rooms are new clean and smell great. Gone is the ashtray smell and the beds are excellent. Everything in the rooms worked great. All four of us are in agreement this was a hotel offering great value. The new NIKI bar offered correctly priced tasty food with quality ingredients. Service throughout the hotel was good, although it's time for some new ATM machines, as they were are all unreliable!

Reviews.Title: “I Really Wanted to Love the Trop.... But”
Reviews.Author: VTS64
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying the Tropicana is very, very nice. It is 200 percent better then it ever was. I stayed at the Trop my first trip to Vegas 17 years ago and it was a dump and i swore never to stay there again. However i was impressed by the changes and decided to give them a shot. it was a mixed bag. I made my reservation 6 weeks in advance and approximately one week after I sent Nicole Marshall an e-mail. Never heard from her, not even a thank you for your e-mail. I was ensured I would have a paradise tower room when i made my reservation. Check in: Arrived 7 PM on a Friday evening and was greeted by a somewhat stand offish reservation clerk. She checked me in and when I seen I was in the Island tower i voiced my displeasure. She stated rather coldly that is the room that was reserved for you. When I asked if i could be switched she said sorry we are sold out.( I booked directly with the hotel not some third party sight). After shlepping all the way to the island tower I realized the room would not work due to the airport noise. I called the front desk and asked to speak to a manager. they gave me the supervisor who was an extremely nice young man. He explained I was given the Island Tower because I requested a king and he could put me in the Paradise in a double Queen if that was acceptable. I stated yes and schlepped all the way back to the front desk. I will say it was a quick transfer as he had the key waiting and just handed it to me. The Room: Very nice, extremely clean and comfortable. Quiet also. rooms are pretty sound proof here. Could of used an additional lamp but no biggie. Cafe Nikki, had the Buffet one morning and the Oatmeal and Eggs were cold. I offered feedback to the Manager Justin and made it very clear i was not complaining just passing along some observations. He comped my Buffet despite my insisting to pay. I returned the next morning and had the Breakfast from the Menu. Excellent. I will say the Buffett has one of the absolute best fruit selections i have ever seen. Each morning I would make the long walk to the coffee stand in the Island tower until I learned on my last day you can buy coffee in cafe Nikki. They have a walk up station at the front of the bar. Will Definitely do that next time. Aside from the check in lady all the employees at the Trop are extremely friendly and helpful without being intrusive. The dealers are great as are Door men Steve and Dean. Each morning I would stand out front with my coffee and chat with them. Sportsbook: Very nice, except for the vendor selling sports memorabilia at the entrance. Tacky Overall: I would absolutely stay at the Trop again. It is the best value for the money. I think once they get the kinks worked out it will be a contender on the Strip. I just can't figure out the personality of the place, I hope they do soon.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: wayne38
Reviews.Content: we were guests for 4 nights and we feel that the stong points for this hotel is the staff, they were second to none,the best we have encountered to date. They were very helpful to people like us who were not familiar with the area. From the manager on down they were top notch and made our stay a pleasant one. Thanks to all.

Reviews.Title: “Shined above my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Shannon085
Reviews.Content: From the time we checked in until the time we checked out our experience at the Tropicana Hotel rose above and beyond our expectations. Checking in was very simple and Terry at the desk was very friendly and helpful. Our room was beautiful and the view of the strip was great! At first I thought being so close to the strip that our room would be noisy but it was quite the opposite. The room was very quite. We had some cheesecake pops from Nikki Beach Cafe that were so yummy!! I definately recommend them. I really liked that we were so close to everything. We were within walking distance to all the sites we wanted to see, so staying here was convenient as well. I would definately recommend staying at the Tropicana. I'll be staying there again on our next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Will be a decent place when the construction is complete”
Reviews.Author: GolfballCanada
Reviews.Content: Overall a decent place, except they checked in a guest at 1 pm into my room by mistake, I ended up with a security guard and two strange men in my room who woke me up at 1 am , the incident took over 1/2 hour to resolve. I lost a nights sleep, they offered me a dinner coupon even though I was checking out that day. Never be back!

Reviews.Title: “The Tropicana is right! They are changing everything! - Luv it!”
Reviews.Author: FastTrackTalent
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at Mandalay Bay but I noticed a Facebook post by Nicole Marshall from The Tropicana on how "They're changing everything". She couldn't be more right! The Tropicana is almost done it's remodel and I can't wait to go back and see the finished product. Nikki Cafe and Biscayne served up great service and food! Christina (Nikki Cafe Mgr) made us feel like VIPs! The room was big, great design, and had a very comfy bed. (time to replace mine I think, ha) The Super Bowl Party was a blast as well! Great food, plenty of bars set up for drinks, plenty of big sreens to watch the game! What impressed me the most, was the service! There was always somebody to great you at the door, the Blackjack dealers were fun, never had an empty drink, everybody wanted to make sure we were taken care of. I even took the Tropicana limo (almost same fare as a taxi, & so worth the little extra) to the airport and left with a smile on my face and excited for my next visit. The Strip better watch out, The Trop is looking to be back on top for entertainment! See you again soon! ;)

Reviews.Title: “Good renovated hotel”
Reviews.Author: DonWag
Reviews.Content: Just home from a 6 night stay at the Tropicanna. It is fine, with a few flaws, but I think these are common flaws in Vegas. No coffee maker in room (we took our own), when you see what they charge for a cup, you see why. $15 per night for a fridge, we didn't bother. $9.95 resort fee, you basically get high speed internet, not much else. Lastly, the thing that bothered us the most, is also common everywhere on the strip (and even in shopping and outlet malls). It is the time share sales people. It's bad enough to have to put up with them and the porn card hawkers on the street, but if you happen to wander close to them in the hotel, they try to latch on to you. How many times I just wanted to scream out, "I DON'T WANT A TIME SHARE, LEAVE US ALONE!!!" So this is a review as much about the law in Vegas allowing this crap, as it is about the Tropicanna. If Vegas was to ban the hawkers and time share scammers, we would return to Vegas and stay at the Tropicanna, in a heartbeat. I doubt if we will ever return, I doubt if the lawmakers there have the balls to do anything about this problem...

Reviews.Title: “Not bad in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: cdstour
Reviews.Content: surely not the best hotel in Vegas, but for the money it's a pretty good deal. Room was spacious and clean. Location is great: close to the airport, the end of the strip, and the monorail (so you can get to the rest of Vegas). Once the pool area renovations are complete, it may be even better.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: keithmyatt
Reviews.Content: We,ve never been vegas before so it was pot luck which hotel we went to-what a result!!!.The place is fantastic-the staff fab and couldn't help enough.Rooms are light and all brand new,location was brilliant-right aross fron the mgm grand and excaliber-and didnt take an age to get to the strip from our room-which i would imagine could take a while from some of the bigger hotels.I cant praise this place enough and would definatly stay here again instead of the bigger hotels.Thanks again to all the staff for a fantastic first trip to vegas-im hooked already and hope to be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: HeadFullofStuff
Reviews.Content: I wanted to try the Tropicana as I had seen all the reports of their newly refurbished rooms, which didn't disappoint. We got a very good deal on a suite, so had a huge sitting room as well as the bedroom. Being on the corner of the building the rooms also had the most fantastic views of the Strip. We had a couple of problems whilst we were there, including a loose window catch which let in some of the noise (the double glazing hasn't been replaced in the refurb!) but the friendly staff attended to everything very quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations for the price”
Reviews.Author: pfdiagne
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Las Vegas and I had no idea where to go and on a limited budget. I trusted Trip Advisor ratings to choose from all the choices we had. It was an excellent choice! There wer 4 of us and they provided connecting rooms with a great view on the statue of Liberty. The rooms were clean, spacious and luminous. Jsut like the picture (we were anxious what you see wasn't what you get... not the case here). When mentionning it was my birthday we got champagne and chocolate strawberries delivered to our rooms! The location is great down the strip and it was easy to walk to the other hotels and casinos. On the downside we ate once or twice at caffé Nikki, not much choice and the Angus bugger was a little burned for my taste but my friends enjoyed the wraps. Veru friendly staff (even if you only drink water!).

Reviews.Title: “Staff were unbelievable, they couldn't do enough.”
Reviews.Author: Gascoigne_06
Reviews.Content: From before the holiday started the staff were unbelievable. After reading some reviews on this site I emailed Nicole Marshall who is the hotel experience manager and explained that it was my wife’s birthday and it was a surprise holiday for her and it was going to be our first time away and first time away without any kids. In the email I explained that I was a little disappointed that the pool was closed whilst we were there. Nicole quickly sent a reply explaining that the pool was closed due to it being winter but because of my disappointment she would waiver the resort fee. I felt that this in itself was a great gesture, but the email continued to say that due to it being my wife’s birthday she would throw in 2 tickets free of charge to see Brad Garrets comedy club. (Which was an excellent show as I laughed from start to finish). When we arrived at the hotel there was a package for my wife which was a small birthday present which included the tickets for the show and also a las vegas photo frame and a pack of playing cards. Again what a nice gesture. After the first day me and my wife went back to the hotel for a shower, after she dried her hair she plugged in her hair strengtheners to find that they didn’t work. We presumed that because they worked at home before we left that it must have been a problem with the electricity in the hotel so we contacted reception who said they would send an electrician. The electrician didn’t turn up for a while so I said to my wife to go and get her hair straightened at the hotel salon whilst I waited for the electrician. When my wife came back she was furious as it cost her $45 just to straighten her hair. So we went down to reception to complain. The staff were great about it and gave us a $45 food and drinks voucher as a good will gesture. They then rang the electrician who stopped what he was doing and came to our room to see what the problem was. After checking every thing it was actually the hair strengtheners that didn’t work. He took them away to try and fix them, but he didn't have the part to do so. He then rang the hotel manager to ask what he should do and the hotel actually went out and bought us some hair strengtheners for us to use whilst we stayed there. I’ve never known a hotel to do so much to keep its customers happy. The room we stayed in was fantastic and I have never slept so well in any bed than I did in that one. The internet connection was extremely fast also. Also I have read a couple of reviews that said the cocktail waitresses never ask if you want a drink. In my experience that could not be further from the truth, I barely had sat down and they were there in a flash. We had the breakfast buffet in cafe nikki one morning and it was nice, but if you are going to eat there, please try Biscayne restaurant. The service and the food was excellent. I had the rib eye stake with mash potato of the moment and I can safely say it was the best meal I've ever had. My only regret was we ate there on the last night and I wish I tried it on the 1st. Overall it is the best hotel I've stayed in, especially for customer service and the for the cost of staying I would have still been as pleased if I’d paid treble the price Thanks for an excellent experience Iain Gascoigne

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel4931
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Trop during the SEMA Show. The rooms look just like the web site! The room was clean, the bed was large and comfy. I really liked the large tv and the iPod dock! The safe was large enough for my iPad and camera gear! My only gripes are that housekeeping did not empty the trash can that is near the window, and I had to call for towels because even though I didn't leave them on the floor, housekeeping took them anyway but didn't replace them. Also, FYI, the Island Tower where I stayed, is a very long walk from the lobby! After a long day of walking the SEMA Show, I dreaded the walk from the lobby back to my room! I didn't even want to go back out because of the distance! Overall I was happy with my stay at the Trop, but next time I want to stay at the Paradise Tower. The Hotel was clean, the people were professional, and I even made money playing the slots! The free wifi was a big plus too!

Reviews.Title: “Anxious to go back”
Reviews.Author: momoffive7477788087
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tropicana in September and are anxious to go back at the end of this month. Just ask that the resort fee be waived and it will be. We did find that the restaurants were pricey. And since you don't have coffee in your room, I would go down to the casino, drink coffee and play for while. It did take a long time to get the coffee though and the bartender would not give you a cup, you had to wait for the waitress. That's just silly! Set up a coffee and soda bar in the casino. It will win you more points with your visitors. You won't lose any money on this idea. I had not reservations about staying there again. The rooms are clean, beds comfy and our view was great.

Reviews.Title: “Better hotel since the renovation but”
Reviews.Author: Daylove
Reviews.Content: I would not call it the best..c'mon we know what the best hotels in Vegas are and this will never be one of them. Perhaps is one of the best 3 stars but not the best overall like some trump up. Be objective. The room was well decorated, spacious, and clean. Check in and check out were painless and fast. Aside from the comfy room and the good location there is not much else that stand out...for entertainment and a better food selection we went to nearby casinos.

Reviews.Title: “The Trop is back !”
Reviews.Author: BLUTOV
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights and wish I could have stayed longer. Check in was smooth, I received $200 in gaming credit for free, my room was recently renovated, the staff was cordial and professional...the best deal on the strip. I slept very soundly, my room was made nicely by the chambermaids. Just wait until they finish the pool area...very impressive, I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprised, enjoyed my 4 night stay”
Reviews.Author: ConnieLovesToTravel
Reviews.Content: Went along on one of my husband's business trips. We went for 5 days 4 nights with the thought he would be working two days and have two days to explore together. Well, he ended up working for all 5 days! When I read reviews of this hotel I was skeptical of what to expect with all the recent remodeling and the location on the strip. Some folks didn't like the fact that it was on one end of the strip. At the end near right next to the airport. The hotel sounded quite simple and nothing special. Our room was booked by his employer so obviously we stayed where they booked us. I have to say I was pleasantly suprised. This hotel was very clean and our room was wonderful. And the location turned out to be one of the better ones on the strip in my opinion. Yes, it was a bit noisy being so close to the airport, yet it was fun watching the planes take off and land all through the night and day. I enjoyed watching them. When we first checked in we requested a room with a king bed. The front desk gal, Victoria, was as nice and personable as she could be. However, after dragging our luggage the mile or so to our room (yes, we were too cheap to pay to have them brought to our room - I would recommend you have the bellman take your baggage up to your room as the walk to the north tower is quite a hike. Perhaps it is different if you are in the front tower where the elevators are next to the front door.) we entered to find two queen beds. So after a quick call to the front desk they told us to stay put and they would send up a bellman with a new key to another room which had a king bed. Not sure what we were getting ourselves into as the room we were in was nice and we hated to give it up, but we really wanted a king bed. We waited almost 45 minutes until finally a gentleman tapped on our door and gave us a new key card to another room up one floor. Yes, we dragged our luggage up to our new room not knowing what to expect. (the bellman did offer to help us, but we refused. ) Well, when we opened the door to our "end of the hall ,corner unit" room, we were both relieved to find an even better room then our first. This room, #1250 was a lovely room with a great view, in my opinion and perfect for our needs. It was a corner room with an extra sitting area with a panaramic view with 4 or 5 windows to look out. Our view was of different parking lots, a church, the airport with planes taking off and landing and a section of the strip and oh, did I mention parking lots? I suppose I would rather over look parking lots and a distance then a building directly infront of my window. The view was lovely at night looking across to the Mandalay Bay, Luxor and Exchaliber resorts across the strip or a.k.a. Route 15 North. Sunsets each night were to die for with the back drop of the mountains and the colors were amazing. Our room was perfect since I would be spending lot of time in it. Since my husband worked every day. I myself worked in the room for two days on my lap top and got quite a bit done. No problems hooking into the hotel's free wireless internet. And the reception was great in our room. The room was a lovely retreat to be confined to for two days. Their TV had a choice of music channels which were nice to utilize as I worked on my cell phone and computer. I enjoyed pampering myself and even ordered room service for lunch each day, The first time in my life and I have to say it was quite yummy, although I still have a hard time justifying my $38 and $59 lunch tabs. (Cesear salad with chicken, execellent black bean soup complete with two dinner rolls and two bottles of budweiser! ) I will say both times the waiters advised me that the tip was included. I appreciated their honesty and bringing this fact to my attention. The food was hot and arrived in a timely manner. The bed was quite comfortable and the pillows fluffy and fresh smelling. Our sheets were changed once during out stay. We had a rental car so loved the free parking. Which was included in the $9.99 daily resort fee. If you are a member of AAA , be sure to tell them so and this resort fee can be waived. Victoria waived ours once we mentioned that we were AAA members. The dissappointments were: The bathroom - Nothing to write home about. Simple corner type tub/shower combination. I would think for such a lovely room, the bathroom would have had a jetted tub or just been a bit more "special" or elegant looking. The hike to our room - Although our room was lovely, it was such a long walk out to the front door or casino. Only two dinner restaurants in the hotel, both are only open at night. No cheap easy places to get a quick bite to eat. Both inhouse specialty restaurants were expensive. Each had very few customers while we were staying. The 24 hour Cafe which we thought was less expensive was still pretty pricy for what you get and the food was not that good. ( Although I think this is the restaurant where my roomservice came from and that food was pretty good. hmm??) We tried the breakfast buffet our first morning and were very dissapointed. Oatmeal looked like wallpaper paste, eggs were cold, rubbery and tasteless, muffins and breads were stale and dry. No waffles or pancakes for my husband who doesn't eat anything with eggs in it. I think a bit over priced for what you get. At lease the coffee was tasty and our waiter was attentative. The high priced drinks and gift shop in the lobby. With all the interior smoking going on my allergies were acting up so I bought a small bottle of visine. Price wa $10.49! Also drinks were expensive - $6 for a bottle of budweiser. Cabs were very easy to obtain at each hotels main entrance there always seemed to be a supply waiting on hand. I felt the housekeeping staff was very pleasant. But other then those two women and my roomservice waiters, most other employees were not very friendly. This would included the front desk gals (with the exception of Victoria), the doormen and especially the bartenders. Bartenders didn't like giving you drinks for free whether you were playing the games or not. They also took their time to acknowledge your standing or sitting there. And they certainly didn't advise us of that Las Vegas tradition. We had to find out the"Tricks" in another hotel casino from a very friendly staff member there. Who explained the way the drinking and playing the games works in Vegas. Needless to say we gave that bartender a rather large tip for his helpful hints. The pool was closed as it was way too cold to swim during our visit. Still construction going on near the pool area and on the side of the resort where the two floor older resort stands. All in all I would recommend a stay here at the Tropicana. I took several walks down and up the strip and felt very comfortable walking around alone during the day and in the evening while my husband worked. I wondered for a couple of days by myself and worked in our room for a couple of days. I did a little shopping here and there and walked through several of the large lobbys of neighboring hotels by myself. I would say Las Vegas is definately a place everyone should see once in their life. Personallyl, not a place I would want to call home - but a fun place to visit just the same! Happy Travels!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel, Best Staff, Best all around in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: kingair pilot
Reviews.Content: My Husband & I stayed for 3 night on the 16th floor! Our room was awesome, the staff was top notch and we were treated like royality our whole stay! I have always wanted to stay at the Tropicana but we always choose others but not anymore. It's Tropicana from now on!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't pass this one up!”
Reviews.Author: ChasMK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for seven nights. Great location, EXCELLENT staff, very easy free parking. Yes, this casino/hotel is in a reconstruction mode but do not let that keep you away. We stayed in the Paradise Tower facing the Strip. We ate at the Italian Restaurant - very good. No coffee pot? We went to the nearest WalMart and bought a coffee up and 2 cups for $11.00. The resorts want you out of your room - therefore, no coffee pot. We also bought fruit and muffins and did breakfast in our room on our own. The resort fee was waived when I asked if it could be. We were booking two rooms - one for seven night and one for five. The fee was waived instantly! ASK. ASK. ASK. We rented a car for a week through Budget - a Pontiac G6 for $140 for the week. We ate at three restaurants featured on DDD on the Food Network - one in Vegas, one in Boulder,NV (The Coffee Pot) - NOT TO BE MISSED, and the third in Baker, Ca. One great find was "Off the Strip" - a restaurant we found on Trip Advisor. Don't miss this one either. The Trop is in a great location - even better if you are adventurous and rent a car. Traffic was not an issue. Stay here. Stay here. Stay here. Looking forward to visiting once the renovation are completed.

Reviews.Title: “Best experience in Las Vegas in 30 years”
Reviews.Author: Dsauceda57
Reviews.Content: We have frequent visitors of Las Vegas and we had the best time ever at the Tropicana. Nikki food was great and the room was off the chart nice. We have stayed in all the top ranked hotel in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Dead Casino”
Reviews.Author: tootsiecat
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the newly remodeled Tropicana are truly lovely. But, be aware that they charge a $10 per night "Resort Fee" in addition to their advertised room rate. Be sure and ask about this fee...it is not optional. Apparently most hotels in Vegas charge a "Resort Fee", some as high as $25 per night. The Casino is a ghost town. If you are looking for a great room but intend to go to other casinos this is a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: DDKDHiggins
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our two teenage daughters visited Las Vegas for the first time last week and stayed for 3 nights at the Tropicana. We fully recommend this hotel, our stay was perfect. We had a room with two Queen beds that were very comfortable and whilst in our room during our stay we cannot recall hearing anyone else which made for great nights sleep. The location was perfect for us as we went to shows at the south end of the strip which were all within a very comfortable walking distance. Definitely stay again and fully recommend this hotel and the newly renovated rooms. See you next time !

Reviews.Title: “Nice affordable option”
Reviews.Author: NashvilleTNGuy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Tropicana on the 19th floor January, 2011. This place has a recent makeover and is pretty nice. The place was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. And, it was much much less that the surrounding properties. I would suggest The Trop if you are watching your budget in Vegas. To get around the strip, the Monorail station is just across the street from the hotel at the MGM.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: GENEANDSHERRY
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Tropicana in mid January for four nights. Having heard stories from the past we were a little hesitate to change from the hotel we had stayed in Las Vegas the prior three times we were there. After reading the Tripadvisor reviews I decided to give the Tropicana a try and I am so glad that we did. Arrival went smoothly and check-in was quick. Our room was spacious and very clean. The bed was well appointed with some of the nicest pillows I have had in a hotel lately. The room was relatively quiet and the louvered shades kept it dark at night. House keeping was excellent. Upon returning to our room each evening one had to notice the detail that was done in the room. The only problem we experienced was on the third day we had an odor of paint thinner in the room that I was told from refinishing bathroom tubs on the floor below. I called the front desk they sent up a bellman and were were moved to another room, no questions asked. I cannot expect that I could have found any better value for my dollar than the Tropicana offered. When they finish all the renovations it will be back to it's glory days

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at the southern end of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: landmark-7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is being updated and modernized. Everything in my room in the Island Tower was new - big (47") flat screen TV, nice plantation style louvers on the windows, new bedding, new carpet - all very good. There are only about 20 channels available on the TV, and they carry Faux News - no CNN, MSNBC or any premium movie channel. The first room faced the airport -- between the noise from the planes and the A/C not working too well, I asked to be switched to the other side of the hotel. Even numbered rooms face the airport and odd numbered rooms face the Strip. The view at night was great. Front desk staff was very good. The only other bad thing about the hotel is that the Island tower is about 2 or 3 city blocks from reception. The connecting walkway is all enclosed and air conditioned, but they really should have put in slidewalks or some other type of people mover. Considering the cheap rate, I feel that I got a good deal. The pool area is also being massively renovated, and they do not know when it will be open to the public.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: MC1324
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Las Vegas for a work related training, which was held at the Tropicana. I absolutely love this hotel! The renovations are beautiful and the rooms are a great value and extremely comfortable and clean. Each employee went out of their way to be polite and extremely helpful. The restaurants are fantastic and I especially love Nikki Cafe! The Tropicana is a smaller hotel/casino, but it was so comforting to return to the quiet calmly lit hotel after being exposed to the chaos and crowds of other hotels and the strip. The location of the Tropicana is great. It is a short walk (short by Vegas standards!) to MGM, New York New York, and numerous other attractions and hotels. I can't wait to return to Vegas and I will definitely stay at the Tropicana. A big thanks to the Tropicana and its staff for making my first Vegas trip easy and memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Best price and service ever”
Reviews.Author: gitsche_waller
Reviews.Content: The staff were great! Really friendly, professionell and made us feel welcome. We got a late check-out which was nice. The design of the hotel is really appealing. Everything is in this "tropic" theme... not overdone but little features that we enjoyed very much. It is overgoing some constructions/renovations (we weren't bothered) right now so I'm sure it will even improve. We had a room to the back side which was really loud as the airport is right next to the hotel. We only stayed one night so it was ok but I would have asked to move into another room if we would have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK, but beware of restaurant scams.....”
Reviews.Author: Loves_Great_Travel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tropicana in Las Vegas in late January 2011. I picked the hotel due to its low price, great location on the Las Vegas strip and some good reviews on here. However, at the end of the day, I can't really recommend the hotel. Setting forth the good and the bad.... THE GOOD Great location Good price The friendliest staff you can imagine (people are always smiling and seem generally happy to see you). The rooms are pretty large and very clean. THE BAD When I went to check-in they couldn't locate my reservation - I will chalk this up to Orbitz (who eventually helped sort things out) however it meant spending forever and a day in the check-in line. When I got to the room the air conditioning was broken the safe didn't work and I couldnt' access the internet. This was all taken care of the next morning however. In what was a good faith attempt to make up for the above, the hotel comped me breakfast one morning. I went to their Cafe Niki which was decidedly middle of the road. However, the interesting thing was that despite the fact the food was comped they did bring me a check. When I went to look it over I noticed that the prices on the check did not match at all the prices on their menu. When I complained they took care of things, after quickly shuffling me off in a corner. But I warn anyone - - MAKE SURE YOU CHECK YOUR BILL. This could easily have gone un-noticed and the difference was fairly substantial (30% of the price). So overall I would not stay here again. . .

Reviews.Title: “Ok, Not Great”
Reviews.Author: aks21
Reviews.Content: We booked a trip to the Tropicana Wed-Saturday, mostly due to the fact that I found a deal on Travelzoo for $44/night. The hotel itself is going through a renovation and there were some issues because of this. First off, we could not find the parking garage and ended up parking where the construction workers parked. Once we got inside, I had to ask the front desk where the parking garage was and move the car. Annoying, mostly because we were in the tower furthest from the front of the hotel. The room itself was good, we were given a corner room, which was very nice. Everything was clean and new, although I did notice the tiles in the bathroom were not updated. They were fine, but if you are doing a huge reno, why not update everything to stay above the curve? We could not find the fitness room to save our lives, so once again, we had to ask at the front desk. It is downstairs where they are doing the pool renovation, but the fitness center has not been renovated, just an FYI. My husband was a little disapointed due to the fact that he likes to use the sauna (esp. since we were paying $9.95/day for use of it and the internet, which did not work in our room). Other than that, everyone was very nice and helpful. I just wish they had better signage and maybe stepped things up just a little bit. It is hard to compete with all the mega hotels on the strip and you have to have something that will make you stand out...I don't think the Tropicana has anything.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Update to an Iconic Hotel / Casino"”
Reviews.Author: SingerEsq
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend in LV. We stayed at the Tropicana. Anyone reading these reviews of late knows that the Tropicana is undergoing a major renovation. I stepped foot in the Tropicana approxiamtely 10 years ago and did not get much further than the front door. It was disgusting. Now, you enter a completely redecorated casino and the tropical scent of coconut embraces you first. Then you start to notice the plantation shutter accents and the updated decor. We checked in at the VIP / Breeze desk. The desk personnel was our first experience with the staff. They have clearly been through extensive customer service training, because she was very nice and attentive. This was consistent throughout our stay. We had a suite in the Paradise tower with a view of the Strip. The suite is about 900-1000 square feet and nicely laid out. The decor continues with the tropical theme, but not in a kitchy way. Think Bahamas / English tropical decor. Dark rattan furniture, sisel rugs, muted fabrics with punches of color. Loved it. The bed and linens are excellent. The noise from the street below was audible, but it did not prevent us from getting excellent nights of sleep. But, if you're sensitive to noise, you might want to bring earplugs or download white noise to your ipod and use the dock next to the bed. We ate breakfast at Nikki's both days and it was very good. We at a late supper on Saturday night at Biscayne. Again, the service was excellent, as was the food. We walked around the hotel quite a bit. There is quite a bit of construction going on for the new Nikki's Beach Bar and Pool, as well as other updates and upgrades. We're not big gamblers, but played a few of the machines. We look forward to returning later this year to see the new changes.

Reviews.Title: “All the recent reviews live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: wesleywoo
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Las Vegas and we stayed here right before Christmas for 3 nights. My sister had stayed here 2 or 3 years ago and warned me about the hotel saying the rooms are old, and even the non-smoking rooms smell like smoke. However, Trip Advisor was telling me otherwise, and I read that the whole hotel had been renovated and completed August 2010. So, as Trip Advisor has been good to us (always use it before booking hotels and rarely been disappointed), we decided to go for it. Overall, it was a good, cheap place to stay while in Las Vegas. The room we had was renovated, spacious, and didn't really smell of any smoke. However, that might have been masked by the sunscreen smell of Tropicana which is all right I suppose (you'll smell that when you first walk into the lobby doors). The rooms were well furnished and clean. The location is sort of near the south end of the Strip. We found it to be no problem. The best thing about the room was the bed. It was probably the most comfortable bed we've ever slept on in a hotel or at home. If you're looking for a really comfortable bed and good sleep quality, you'll definitely want to stay here. We knew about the resort fee which is supposed to pay for free wifi internet. The internet was great, no problems with that... but honestly, the resort fee should just be built into the cost of the hotel. There is no reason that you should have to pay again when you get there... but maybe that's the standard in Vegas. A tip on transportation to and from the airport. I tried to search this specifically for Tropicana but I couldn't find anything. Since Tropicana is one of the closer hotels to the airport, should you take a shuttle or taxi service? We did both... the shuttle costs $6.50 per person... so $13~$15 depending if you tip the driver. When we left, we took a cab to the airport. It was early in the morning so traffic wasn't too bad, although the driver said it was more than usual at that time as people were probably going back home for Christmas. The trip turned out to be about $11 before a tip. The bonus at Tropicana when taking a cab is you don't even have to drive on the Strip to get there, so you might be able to avoid some traffic. If you have 2 people in your party I'll let you make the decision on which form of transportation to take. If I had to stay here again I would. But it's Vegas and I want to experience other hotels too. It's definitely a great option if you're on a budget... or just want to save money for other things since nothing in Vegas is cheap!

Reviews.Title: “NEW ROOMS GREAT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: JRCZAR
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in Jan. 2011 and it was just perfect for good, new, clean rooms, about three star on my rating scale and the staff was outstanding at all levels. Disliked: No coffee or frig in our rooms, we had King Beds very nice sheets and covers, at the Island Tower they are new and very nicely furnished. Coffee available at a Starbucks near elevators. If you save your cup all refills are $1.25 so use this for your entire stay. We Rented a SUV from HOTWIRE, $60/day, and drove to RED ROCK CANYON 30 Mins and then to Mt. Charlston where they still have snow and ate at the Hotel. From the hotel to Vegas is about one and a half hours.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: linnett
Reviews.Content: Many other comments on the Tropicana by others were very accurate: VERY smokey resort, more so than others on the strip. Also few food choices during this construction phase and no shopping to speak of. That said, the Trop is a nice alternative to the huge crazy resorts up the street. Rooms were nice and clean. Street noise in the tower by the Strip was evident but not overwhelming. Windows needed to be washed! The "resort fee" was joke. When we booked our trip through Allegiant we understand the $10 daily fee was optional but we were told at the hotel it was mandatory. You got nothing for your money -- the WiFi was spotty, the fitness center closed and meal/drink discounts non-existent because nothing was open.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great service”
Reviews.Author: DanBucsFan
Reviews.Content: First time staying at the Trop, but won't be the last. All employees were friendly and made sure our expectations were met. There still is some renovations going on, and it wasn't an inconvienience for us. What's completed looked great. Pro's: Great Value Excellant staff Con's: Long walk to Island towers (Paradise towers much closer to entrance/casino)

Reviews.Title: “You must stay at the New Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: sdw1
Reviews.Content: The New Tropicana is beautiful! The rooms are spacious and comfortable with all the amenities you would excpect from a world class resort. I look forward to my next vacation at the Tropicana. I highly recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!!”
Reviews.Author: lickitysplinter
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with another couple booked two rooms for three nights at the Tropicana for what should have been a relaxing weekend. Upon entering the rooms we noticed our room had no towels and our friends room had only one dirty towel, a used bar of soap and trash in the ice bucket. We called for house keeping and the bathroom oversight was corrected in a timely manner. We also called and requested our luggage be brought up and were told it would take 20 minutes. Over an hour later, and only after placing a second request did our luggage finally arrive. This was after 10:00pm on a Friday evening, and very few people were checking in or out at that time so it seemed rather peculiar that our luggage would take so long, never-the-less we brushed it off. Trying to sleep that night was not easy. we were very tired from our long trip so we chose not to request that the bed be re-maid due to the fact that the bed was short sheeted. Also, because all the pillow cases were too small for the pillows a good portion of the pillows were exposed. Just imagine how many heads laid on those pillows without a clean, proper pillow case - gross! Sleep that night was fitful at best. The second night I got up at 3:00am to use the bathroom. Upon returning to the bedroom I noticed something on the bed and turned on the light. It was a bug so I grabbed a napkin that was on the nightstand and picked it up. This was a bed bug, and it was filled with fresh blood that left a very large stain on the napkin when I squished it. To say the least, my wife and I were in utter shock! What happened over the next three hours was almost surreal. The clerk at the front desk told me "to be honest with you we've had many complaints like this in the past, before the remodel." The security supervisor said "we can't control the bugs." and the security officer assigned to us couldn't get his camera to focus when he tried to take photos of the bug, so I took the photos for him! I was then told that the only way I could report this If I filled out an accident report, so, at 4:15am I filled out the report including describing the incident in "my own words." We were then offered a new room and a reduction of one night off our 3 night stay. Wanting nothing more but to go home - but being exhausted, we accepted the new room. So - we then had to go back to the room pack up all our stuff and wait for the bellman. After the security man called a second time for the bellman he finally showed up - without a cart. Eventually by 6:00am, we left our 6th floor room with a view of the strip, and got settled in the first floor room with the roar of the ventilation fans just outside the window. This room also had pillows sticking out of the ill fitting cases - plus - the TV in this room would not bring in most the of the channels! The last night we just couldn't sleep because we kept on checking for bugs! Three nights at the Tropicana without sleep, without relaxation & without satisfaction from management! We were told by every employee whom we encountered that they have done everything they can for us and to talk to Heather Katz risk manager. When we checked out at 10:45am and asked for her we were told she was at lunch so we had to leave a phone message for her as nobody else was authorized to help us in her absence. Heather did call us at home the next day. she actually had the Gaul to request that we send her the bug! She clearly was not interested in putting our satisfaction first, her concern seemed only in analyzing the bug. We asked for nothing in compensation from anyone at this hotel, and what they gave us was the big run around, and one nights refund for a ruined 3 night stay. What totally pathetic customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Skeptic turned fan, as good as ANY other casino on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: SQORPEO
Reviews.Content: Having family in the area and being from California I've spent my fair share of time in Las Vegas and on the Strip. I've stayed at many of the large casinos as well as some of the "off the beaten path" properties and can HONESTLY say that the Trop EXCEEDED my expectations from the moment I arrived. I was skeptical due to the old school rep of the Trop. Upon arrival I was greeted by a friendly bellman who took my bags and walked me to the reservation desk where I was greeted by an equally as friendly girl who went over & above to get me my desired room and amenities. They made me feel like I was their only guest! The casino, hallways, elevators & rooms were VERY clean. So clean I felt like I was the first person to ever stay in the room. There is a nice tropical scent throughout the hotel along with nice decor. The windows open too!!! My only complaint is that there was construction noises in the distance in the morning due to the renovations, not enough for anything other than for me to take notice. Oh, and the room was huge! Great place to stay, no matter what quality you are accustomed to!

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: mellieann
Reviews.Content: We had to choose between a Mirage (Player's card rate) room or a really good deal at the Tropicana. We are glad we picked the Trop! Quiet, clean and spacious room. Bathroom was very clean but bathtub and tiles were old. Not a big deal. Counter and sink were new though. Biscayne Restuarant was nicely done - prix fixe with wine pairings was another good reason to go to the Trop, service was top notch and food was good. Not huge portions which is exactly what we wanted. Wish the casino had rapid or video roulette!! We aren't slot players so I had to give my money to MGM to get my fix !

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for the money.”
Reviews.Author: AnnaMcBee
Reviews.Content: The service was outstanding. Our first night we had a room that the air conditioning did not work. We were accommodated the next night to a room with a strip view. The faucet in the bathroom leaked and they came to fix it within the hour. The rooms are very nice size and the beds are very comfy. When they are finished with the whole hotel remodel it will be outstanding. The pool was closed when we were there, but it looked really nice. The location of the hotel is good. This is a smaller hotel compared to others I haves stayed at on the strip. You don't have to walk a mile to get to the lobby or casino. The casino is small,but the table games were great and the staff working were great. If you are just learning how to play I would recommend this casino. We did eat at the hotels 24hour restaurant which was okay for a late night snack. If you are looking for a nice place on the strip that is not crowded and economical this is the spot. We got married during this trip, so it made it even better. I love you Robert McBee. 11/15/10.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Shirtgirl
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference with my husband at the Mandalay Bay Convention Center and chose to stay at the Tropicana. Much less expensive than the hotel choices offered by the trade show housing service. The Tropicana was clean and bright, almost too bright. Kinda detracted from that "Vegas vibe", but that's OK because we weren't there to gamble. The place was virtually deserted on a Wednesday night. The room had new tropical themed furniture and was very pleasant. Good bathroom with a corner soaking tub. Everyone was very friendly and efficient with the service. The only cons were the lack of eating places, most were still closed for renovation and the very loooong walk to the rooms in the Island Tower. That was not fun after a long day of walking the expo floor. The MGM and NY NY are a quick walk away and had plenty of restaurant choices. For anyone with business at the south end of the strip, I think would be wise to give the Tropicana serious consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Pines26
Reviews.Content: Renovated and very nice! We found this property very clean and comfortable with a friendly and accomodating staff. Not a glamorous property like some of the extravagance on the strip but suited us well for a place to crash at the end of a busy day. There is some construction going on around the property so there can be some noise as the workers start in the am but it wasnt terribly distracting. Resort fee included reliable high speed internet access. Tram access across the street at MGM was nice and we used our 3-day pass often to get to various locations on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Revamped Tropicana is Nice”
Reviews.Author: gypsydogg
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Tropicana this week for CES. My friends always stay here and I couldn't figure out why, it WAS a real dump. I stayed once an there were ants in the room!! BUT NOW!!! WOW, Clean, Bright, Smells great! Totally different, do not judge this place off of it's past it is way different and they aren't even done yet. The Italian Resturant was goood. I took off a star for the room and service, only because I have to leave room for Ritz Carlton level, but it was good. The nightclub they are building looks promising. I only have 2 complaint, is they are going a little too "foo foo" for me. After a night of clubbin I like to eat some nice junk food, they had shrimp and calamari or some crap like that...we had to go all the way to Luxor to get junk food....grrrr. Come on, this is south strip where the younger party ground likes to stay!!! And I ordered a fridge and it didn't have legs in the front so the door was dragging on the carpet. you had to lift it up just to open the door. With all the improvements they are doing I'm sure it's on the list.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: cmore2517
Reviews.Content: We booked through Alligent Airlines and we told nothing about the resort fee. The pool was closed of course we didn't have a laptop and didn't need to make any local calls so what is the point of the resort fee? The room was great nice bed, for some reason the bathroom didn't get updated kinda chessy. Now the negatives bar service was horrible, we were told to wait in line for a drink there were others ahead of us. If we wanted a drink we had to run down a waitress then they acted like we were bothering them by waiting on us. On the second night of our stay we were playing video poker at the bar and having drinks after dropping about $500 in the casino, the bartender told my wife she needed to gamble more if she wanted more drinks. Overall service is terrible in Vegas period!! The best place we found for service was the new cosmo.

Reviews.Title: “Totally decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: CvilleEater
Reviews.Content: Was concerned about staying at "only" a 3 star hotel given some of the poor reviews, but for the price this hotel was very nice. Clean rooms and friendly helpful staffers. Completely lacks the amenities of the deluxe places on the strip, however, and the dining options are forgettable. My one real complaint is the lack of a coffee maker in the room, forcing you to order an $18 pot of crappy room service coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: BeeandJay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tropicana over the Christmas holiday. We found a tremendous deal on-line and couldn't NOT go. The Tropicana is a quick and cheap cab ride from the airport. Check in was a breeze; no line ups and pleasant employees. Our room was on the first floor (room 166 I think). It was a nice room, quite large, recently renovated, clean and confortable. We had no view at all, but honestly we spent hardly any time in the room anyway. Like previous reviewers mentioned, the rooms are a long walk from the main reception area; if you have limited mobility this could be quite an issue. I think we were in the Island tower. Overall we had a pleasant stay. We loved how close the Tropicana is to New York New York and the MGM. It's also a quick walk to the bus stop (the Deuce) which was convenient for us. The only downfall is the lack of casual restaurants in the hotel. We did try Cafe Nikki's lunch buffet, but it is certainly not worth the price ($17.99 I think). The service was also very slow and honestly they seemed quite uninterested in serving us at all. I know the restaurant has only been open for a few weeks, so perhaps it will improve with time. There was also an issue with charging our lunch to our room. We recieved a message from Cafe Nikki before we checked out indicating that we needed to come back down to the restaurant to pay our outstanding bill. When I checked out and tried to pay this outstanding lunch bill at reception I was advised that I needed to physically go back to the restaurant and pay it there. I was told (by the restaurant) that I didn't have a credit card number on my file so they could not charge the bill to my room (strange because I'm sure there are very few hotels in the world that would allow you to check in WITHOUT a credit card..). However, the lovely lady I spoke to when I checked out told me there was no indication that Cafe Nikki even tried to charge my room. It was confusing, weird and inconvenient for me to go back to the restaurant the next day to pay this bill, and it didn't really improve my overall impression of the restaurant. I did see a Starbucks stand in the hotel but it wasn't open while we were there. Overall it was a pleasant stay, the price was right and we'd likely consider the Tropicana again.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Quality- everything truly is changing!!!”
Reviews.Author: tarabl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a trip to Vegas to celebrate a milestone birthday.I had stayed at the Tropicana many years ago as a teenager. I barely recognized the place! There are signs everywhere claiming "We are changing everything." This couldn't be more true! The new feel at the Tropicana is fresh, clean and very "South Beach". I felt like I was in Miami. The service was top- notch. Everyone was so friendly!!!!! We ate at the hotel several times during our stay. The prime rib at Biscayne was THE BEST I have ever had. Unbeknownst to me, my husband arranged for an "upgrade" so that he could re-propose to me! He made a phone call to Mr. Keenan Wolf who went above and beyond to make our stay a comfortable one! The room was the nicest I have ever stayed in, a two room suite with a jacuzzi, sauna, and huge shower. It also included an incredible view of the strip. The bed was amazing! I slept like a rock. I can't wait to come back and see the place once all of the renovations are done. Thank you Mr. Wolf and Tropicana staff for an amazing getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with superb service”
Reviews.Author: cbl7
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the first day of CES. The employee at the front desk(Lori) was one of the most courteous and friendly hotel employees I have ever had the experience of dealing with. I have rarely seen courteous service like this especially in Las Vegas. As for the hotel, the new Tropicana is amazing!. They have done a great job transforming the hotel. The rooms are clean and excellent. I will stay here on all my future trips to Vegas. I will take Tropicana any day over the overpriced luxury hotels. You definately get more value for your money here.

Reviews.Title: “housekeeping personnel - quick service”
Reviews.Author: luchiebernardo
Reviews.Content: The housekeeping personnel are courteous, responds quick and does a wonderful job in our room: Anita, Ana, Elizabeth and Bruce - they provide service with a smile and always helpful to ask if we need anything else other than what we requested for. They deserve a FIVE STAR rate as far as me and my husband is concern. Torpicana LV has done a great renovations and we will book for a main suite next time we visit Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: mhstar75
Reviews.Content: I visit Las Vegas twice a year and this was my first time at the Trop. I enjoyed the hotel, the casino and Brad Garrett's comedy club. The room was spotless and quiet, the king size bed was very comfortable, it had a 42 inch plasma T.V. and in general everything was very good. While not central-strip located, the Trop is still in a very good location, within close walking distance of MGM, New York, New York, Excalibur, Luxor, Mandalay Bay and (if you're in the mood for chicken wings) Hooters. Getting back to the room, be aware that it's very basic; the furniture (except the bed) is very sixties-ish and the hotel in general is not very glitzy. If you want glitz stay elsewhere. But for the great rates the Trop offers these days, if you're more interested in reasonable prices than glitz, the Trop is for you. I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “THANKS TROPICANA!!!”
Reviews.Author: jblackhawk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trop for a week in August, because we were getting married that week. The remodel was fabulous, the casino floor was still being updated but the changes looked great. The white hallway is gorgeous and we didn't mind walking down it to our room because it was so pretty. The colors and decor of the rooms are nice, the bathrooms are clean and modern. The beds in the rooms are extremely comfortable, the rooms themselves are beautiful. Only one small downfall is not having a fridge in the room. Its so hot in august and I had so many water bottles, it would nice to keep one cold in your room before you head out walking. The pool was awesome, clean, the waitstaff were very quick to serve and friendly, we spent almost every morning out there. We did want to float on the water with the blue floats they rent, but $15 is steep. $30 for me and my husband to float on the pool? I wish these would have been cheaper we really spent alot of time out there and wanted to float. The day before our wedding we happened to ride the elevator with some of management, after hearing us talk about our wedding, they sent chocolate covered strawberries to our room. We loved everything so much we are spending a week at the Trop Aug 2011 for our anniversary, and I cannot wait to come back! Nicole in guest services is a nice contact too, she answered many of my questions via email before our arrival.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Improvement Over Previous Stays”
Reviews.Author: wmmdguy21162
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to the Tropicana for years, but due to certain circumstances, had not visited the property in over two years. There has been quite an improvement over our previous stay. The rooms have been updated to a nice modern fresh look and feel. Let's just say they are very spacious and comfortable. The flat screen tV's are big, the beds very comfortable and the bathrooms have been redone. The casino and restaurants have been updated with a modern look and feel. The variety of live shows and comedy is outstanding. On the positive, the staff has obviously gone through some extensive customer service training because everyone could not have been more helpful and friendly. Our entire reservation had to be changed due to our flight being cancelled because of the blizzard in the east. Everyone we spoke with went out of their way to accomodate our ever changing travels needs. We especially like the fact that a doorman holds the heavy glass doors for everyone walking in and out - very nice touch. The unfortunate part of the trip is that the renovations are still ongoing. Currently there are limited eating establishments,, so if you want a quick meal, we had to use the property accross the street for light meals. The buffet is very small, but good and has been incorporated into an existing restaurant where as it used to be on its own. Would love to see a large buffet on the property and maybe thats in the plans. The sports betting parlor is a 20 foot long desk with no seating. We were told that a new parlor was being constructed and that would be first class. There is only one row of table games, so when the casino gets crowded, we were forced to visit other properties on the surrounding corner (Trop Blvd. & Strip) to play table games. The pit boss said that an expanded table area was on the way. While the room was outstanding, there were some minor annoyances. The bathroom timer light switch was broke and the lock holding the suite window (yes the windows do open) was loose and our window kept rattling in the high winds. While these things are minor issues, a good quality review by the housekeeping staff before the next guest arrives could have caught these issues. My wife would have liked the room to have a fridge. You can rent one. On one occasion, the housekeeping person knocked on our door at 9:00 AM. We told her we were leaving in 5 minutes. We came back at 3:00 PM and the room had not been done. So what was the point in knocking on the door at 9:00 AM? A call to the housekeeping office and a housekeeper was at our door in 5 minutes and the room quickly and efficiently cleaned. As I have been to almost every large property in Vegas, one recommendation I have for this property is that as improvements are made, that the ventilation and air handling systems are updated. The smoke in the gaming area is much worse than in other properties. Hopefully one day Vegas will go non smoking with a smoking area like the rest of the country. I continue to recommend this property and believe it will be a great property when all of the improvements are finally completed. The pool has always been outstanding and it sounds like they are making improvements in that area as well.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms nice but seldom seen a waitress in casino”
Reviews.Author: Mikki2011
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice and clean. All though we had to call for towels the first night as only 1 in the room, and no wash clothes left the next day I still consider the room a good value. If you are looking for a casino to play slots and have a few drinks, this is not the place to stay. We played at the bar machines for awhile and received free beer but once we left to play at other slot machines & returned for a beer, we were charged $12. I think I only seen 1 waitress for both sides of the casino. Maybe because we were there 28, 29 & left on the 30th of Dec, they had let all the waitress off in prep for NY Eve. If you are staying @ a hotel & you don't have staff to wait on customers, drinks should be at least half price at the bar not $6 for a bottle when you have to go get it. Alos, there is no where inexpensive to eat in the hotel like there is other hotels. If we go again, we will stay at Hooters where the waitress was there before you even got your beer finished.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you can”
Reviews.Author: papagopark
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay. Friendly staff, new and clean rooms, and most of all very quiet when your putting your head down for the night. NOTE: My flight was cancelled due to bad weather. I called the Trop and they took care of me for the night. They never tried upping the price. The staff (Wendy) showed sincerity in her voice as she took care of us for the night. All this was done during New Years Eve. The Trop could've easily asked for top dollar for their rooms but never did. Thank you Trops, (Wendy).

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: dbldblbonus
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying that I have been a regular customer at the Tropicana for over 10 years, and have stayed at least twice each year. I have visited the casino, since the renovations, but this was my first stay at the hotel since last November. While there are some nice changes, my overall impression was not so great. The room was very nice. Very comfortable beds, that are a vast improvement from the old ones. Considering the "newness" of it, I was upset to see the scratched night stand, and less than impeccably clean shower. The tiles were a bit moldy. The staff was much nicer than they had been in the past, and that is a plus. The construction was not much of an issue, except for the fact that much of the casino is blocked off. There is a major lack of dining options. If you just want a quick snack or sandwich, there are no options. The South Beach Deli that is advertised on their website is closed. There is a steakhouse, an Italian restaurant, and Cafe NIkki. The Steakhouse and Italian restaurant are not open during the day. Cafe Nikki is not a good choice if you just want, say, a BLT. It has a very "club-like" feel and is very Cuban influenced. That is not a bad thing, necessarily, if there had been other options. There was a small coffee stand that offered "gas station" style pre-packaged egg salad sandwiches ( no thanks), and excessively priced pastries. It was open on Sunday. It was closed Monday, and literally gone on Tuesday. If you don't mind leaving the hotel for coffee, and snacks, I guess this would be ok. I think that once all of the refurbishments are complete, this will be a nice place to stay. In my opinion, they should just close for 6 months, and get everything done. But as it is now, I don't think I could really recommend it. We ended up leaving a day early, as we just felt so "blah" about the whole thing. My final disappointment came after arriving home to find that my card had been charged, even though we presented a different one at check in(my husbands). They had done this to me before, and after a very unpleasant phone call to the front desk, I swore I wouldn't stay there again. That was last year. I thought with all of the changes, they wouldn't do this again, and yet they did. I did call, and the woman I spoke to was pleasant about it, but it left me with a bad feeling. Overall, yes the rooms are nice, and the employees are more pleasant, but they have lost a long time customer. I would much rather stay at the Flamingo or Mandalay Bay.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite Vegas Hotel, bye bye Mirage”
Reviews.Author: royalpiper
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the holidays with a friend, I'm a veteran Las Vegas visitor over the last 15 years, always staying at Mirage as I have been of fan of Steve Wynn and his vision for the town.
