After staying at the newly renovated Tropicana, it will be now be my hotel of choice for the future. Staff are excellent and well trained in their duties, the property is clean and although undergoing renovation, it does not get in the way of enjoyment. I am curious to see what the pool renovations will bring once completed, the Trop has always had one of the best pools in town. The rates are excellent at this time and the value is the best on the Strip in my opinion. I have a reservation for Super Bowl weekend, this time in a Paradise suite and am looking forward to seeing what this class of room is like, especially in comparison to what Mirage has to offer. Cheers, Al Gonzales

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana Las Vegas is the best resort for friendliest staff and service”
Reviews.Author: 45953Sharon
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana Las Vegas has the friendliest staff, service, and outstanding restaurants with great value of all other resorts we have ever visited in over 46 years of travel my husband and I have done throughout the country. We are looking forward to many more stays there. We would rather stay there than cruise ships, which we have taken over 15. We were greeted everywhere we went throughout this fine resort, making you feel like part of their family. We visited 6 other resorts during our 4 night stay and never got greeted at any of them. We will be there again to bring in the 2012 New Year in Las Vegas. The suite we had and cleanliness of the establishment was top notch!!! Management deserves a thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “TICKS ALL THE BOXES”
Reviews.Author: Jaffa66
Reviews.Content: We had a very bad year 2010,but our christmas break to the Tropicana was a breath of fresh air,i can not fault any one or any thing .take some beating ,good price fab room (de luxe)worth that little bit more. many thanks tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “Without a doubt, the friendliest Resort / Hotel We ever visited!!”
Reviews.Author: DavidHaywood
Reviews.Content: The entire staff made us fell like We were truely welcome guests. We were always greeted by everyone with a "Hello" and a friendly smile. We noticed this shortly after check in and it continued for our entire four day stay. Have Fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Military Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Overmedicated
Reviews.Content: I used the military rate and was upgraded to a one bedroom suite. The new rooms are clean and comfortable. The hotel is undergoing renovations, this doesn't affect the guests other than a small gaming area and no poker room for the next couple of months. Restaraunt (Cafe Niki) has very good food. The buffet has limited selection but, what is there is excellent and very well priced. The a la carte selections I had were excellent. Stay now so they will know you in the future. When all the renovations are finished this spring it will be the place to stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Among the most blah hotels in town”
Reviews.Author: Voyager058
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tropicana over Christmas for 5 nights. All the restaurants except for the pricey Cafe Nikki were closed due to construction - we had to walk over to the Starbucks at MGM (which is lovely & lively, by the way). The brunch at Cafe Nikki was $14.99 for a very limited number of options, and we chose not to dine in given that there were hardly any others at the restaurant. The TV cable and the wireless connections in our room were spotty throughout our stay despite our calls to customer service. On the plus side, the room was large, and the mattress quite comfy. I also liked the fitness room even though it was situated way out. The hotel itself seemed lifeless compared all the other casinos with very few people at the casino floor (which, strangely enough, is located at the entrance). The hotel did not have ramps for lugging baggage (beware if you have heavy luggage!!). We ended up spending most of our time at the other hotels for meals and for just soaking in the Vegas ambience. We chose Tropicana because of the other positive reviews, which in hindsight, I should have been skeptical of, because so many of those mentioned names of specific Tropicana staffers (how often do you see that with reviews of other hotels ??). Almost any hotel on the strip would have been a better choice, that too at a price competitive with the Trop. The place just did not have a personality. We will not be returning in a hurry.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: msmallfeet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Tropicana one the 30th and 31st of December. We stayed in the Island Tower. The rooms were very nice and updated. The bed was very comfortable. The only problem with the room was the bathtub didn't drain that well and when you were done with taking a shower you were ankle deep in soapy water. The island tower was a bit of a walk from the front entrance but not that big of a deal.

Reviews.Title: “good place for the buck but, its not where everyone goes”
Reviews.Author: cainer120
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the tropicana from dec 26th to dec 30th. For the price it was worth it to stay here, as the rooms are as nice as everyone else has stated in thier reviews of the hotel. I found it odd to walk into the hotel and instantly you walked into the gaming floor. Only about 20 tables and not much in the way of variety. To my surprise, there wasnt one Pai_Gow poker table. I had to go to other casinos to play this game. The rooms were nicely done and i had no trouble with the shutters as many have stated. Just make sure the shutters are pointing upwards when u closed them. We stayed on the second floor(im a smoker and those rooms are on the 2nd and 18 floor, i think) Our room was in a dead area where the reception was terrible for the internet. Our first day we had zero connection to the internet and they waved the resort fee for our first day. They offered to move us but, we had connection for the final three days of our stay, so, we turned down the offer to move(didnt want to pack everything up) The pros were this. 1/ good customer service 2/roooms were pleasant 3/they had a scent of hiawaiian breeze threwout the hotel and it was a pleasant odour.(better then smelling smoke, and i am a smoker) 4/price was right and location was average Cons were 1/ The atmosphere, because not many people were in the hotel, it seemed not as exciting as other hotels that were crammed with people. 2/ wifi can be a bit dicey. 3/ The cocktail service was unacceptable when playing slots after midnight. ON a couple of occasions, i played for over one hour and never got asked if i wanted a drink. (all i wanted was a coffee)I searched the entire gaming area and didnt find one waitress on the floor. 4/Cafe nikki was over priced. We went there for a snack on our first night after arriving late at night, and i didnt feel like forking out over $40 for 2 meals. I wanted something simple and cheap. I couldnt find a place to do just that in the Tropicana. Also the boutique buffet was something like $22. I would have thought they would have started with a lower price and because of that, we didnt eat one meal at the Trop. Overall, i liked the place. It seemed very small compared to other casinos and it seemed very tranquil compared to other casinos. We didnt eat here, didnt gamble much here (no paigow poker and no cocktail service after midnight while on the slots)and basically just used it as a place to sleep. The staff was good as everyone else here has indicated. They did make you feel welcomed and appreciated to an extent. Id stay again, but, only if they kept the price cheaper then everyone else. If they raised the price id stay probably at the flamingo or across the street at the excalibur.

Reviews.Title: “STAY HERE IF YOU CAN”
Reviews.Author: Cutesy
Reviews.Content: Our family of 7 stayed at the Paradise Tower from Dec. 26 to Dec. 30 2010. We checked in with this super lady named Lynn who is super nice and helpful and everything about the hotel was right on after that. Clean and comfortable beds and rooms ( I booked 3 rooms), short walk from room to elevator then to the strip, nice and courteous hotel staff, cheerful cleaning lady Maria. Although the weather was chilly, the family just spent time together lining up at the buffets, walking along the strip, basically just chatting and spending quality time together. The only request that was denied was giving us one room for a later checkout for free. Front desk lady said we have to pay half the full price of one night stay. But again no harm in asking. I think after the pool opens and construction is totally done, hotel will even be more exciting and we will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: thodana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tropicana for six days over the Christmas holiday. While the location was ideal for our trip to Vegas to visit family and friends (easy access away from the strip), the hotel itself was not ideal for our needs. The rooms were surprisingly spacious, however, we were surprised that we could hear street traffic on the 16th floor. We were unaware when we booked this hotel that because of the construction they did not have a front entrance ramp. Since we were traveling with my 90 year old grandmother, a ramp would have made the scooter we rented a little easier to maneuver. After three days at the hotel we were finally informed of the rear entrance that had a ramp, but it was in the bowels of the hotel. The fact that we had the scooter delivered to the hotel and that they had to retrieve it for us but never mentioned the rear entrance lends to our second concern which was general customer service. We found it lacking and a general sense of dissatisfication with the current ownership and its direction. My favorite incident was while approaching an information desk on the casino floor, I indicated that I had a question. The woman pulled out a mirror and began to check her makeup before she turned her attention to me. Housekeeping could never seem to get the towel situation right. The first day we left just the face towels on the floor to be replaced. When we returned later that night, all the towels had been taken (with no replacements). We called for towels and within 20 minutes we had our towels. On the second day, we repeated the same incident. So by the third day we got the hint and left the do not disturb sign on the door (although I was tipping daily). Overall, the hotel provided a convenient location for our stay, but the lack of a ramp, poor customer service, and uncertain housekeeping, I would be hesitant to stay at the Tropicana again. I will note that upon mentioning these issues to the front desk (Yolande who was great), apologized and waived our resort fees. Also worth noting is that on our final day, some of the outside construction barriers were removed and revealed the new front entrance ramp.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana delivers...”
Reviews.Author: Little_Atlas
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week to celebrate Christmas and my 50th birthday at the Tropicana. From the moment we arrived this hotel delivered surprise after surprise for us. I don't think I can say enough to express how dedicated they are in making their guests feel special. Every staff member we met expressed a cheerful attitude and always made positive comments that showed how much they cared about pleasing us. The hotel has undergone extensive renovations that are reflected in the clean, bright classy atmosphere. Our bed was so comfortable! I don't remember the last time I slept so well in any hotel. Everything was clean and sparkling. I really liked the casino versus all the other dark casinos along the strip. It has an open brighter feel. Restaurant selection is limited and rather expensive, but there are plenty of cheaper alternatives very close. We took a small coffee maker with us, as there are none supplied. So, if you need a wonderful, friendly hotel to stay in Vegas I highly recommed the Tropicana. They exceeded my expectations! Kudos to all their employees.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kaissa123
Reviews.Content: I had done some research of hotels to stay in Vagas and had selected the Tropicana based on the positive reviews and the great price, we were not disappointed and had a great time staying here. Everyone were friendly and tried to be as helpful as possble. We had a room on a high floor with a king size bed at the Paradise tower - the room was spacious with a big bathroom and included a 42 inch TV with HD channels. We were initially charged a 'resort fee' (which includes internet access and use of the gym) but was refunded this fee on checkout when we told that because we booked with WestJet this fee was alrady paid for. The gym/sauna itself is located at the older building (a bit of a walk through the casino) - but it was fair sized with treadmills and free weights. Eating at Vagas can get expensive but we managed to find 2 great places to eat outside of the hotel - Eliis island (Koval LN and Flamingo) with $8 steak dinners wich included a pint of beer or root beer , salad or soup, 10 ounce steak, fries or baked potato and green beans ! The Cheese Factory (Ceasers Palace) served delicious meals at very reasonable prices - plus you get a little 'Atlantis' show on the hour while you wait outside. Overall staying at the Tropicana was great and would definitely stay at the Trop again when I come back to Veags

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Family Vacay”
Reviews.Author: ringstwo
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Tropicana for 5 days and 4 nights over the Christmas holiday and our stay was fantastic! Our flight arrived super early b/c of the time change, but we were able to check in early AND receive adjoining rooms in the Paradise tower. The rooms were beautiful! My family was very pleased with my choice to stay here. The beds were extremely comfortable, bathroom was huge, the renovated rooms are pristine. The ipod cradle and player came in handy. We had a great strip view...always had the window open and we lived the coconut/vanilla that was piped through the hotel. This hotel was fabulous for the price. We walked to many of the hotels along the strip, but we were very close to NYNY, The Excalibur, The Luxor, MGM and Mandalay Bay. All these hotels connect through various walkways. Although this hotel did have some remodeling/construction going on, it never bothered us. We did not eat at Tropicana b/c they only had one or two restaurants open during our visit, but the prices seemed reasonable. The casino was nice and my sister and I had a few drinks at the bar during a live performance in the lounge area that was very good. When all construction is complete this is going to be quite the hotel. We would definitely stay here again. Thanks to the Tropicana this was a great first trip to Vegas. Oh, and we used the wifi daily which is covered in the resort fee ($9.99 a day). The front desk staff also helped with online check in and printing tickets for our return flight home. We had a blast!

Reviews.Title: “Renovated rooms are fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ajeancompton
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in a Paradise Suite with Strip View in the remodeled tower of the Tropicana. The prices were completely reasonable and we had a great time! The bed was really comfortable, there were lush white robes in the room, we had a view of NYNY, and the room service menu was affordable and delicious. We felt very pampered, and the service was excellent. The only thing was that it was a little far off of the "main" part of the strip, and also it smelled pretty strongly of vanilla when you walk in the door. As long as you like vanilla you'll be fine! (My boyfriend said he didn't really like it , but wasn't enough to bother him; I hardly noticed it at all).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, awesome staff.”
Reviews.Author: tangerinethirteen
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana was absolutely beautiful. Walking through the other hotels/casinos made me so glad we chose it. Everything was so open and spacious and well lit compared with other spots that seemed so dark and dingy. The staff was super friendly from security to the doormen. On our departure day our flight wasn't until very late, so the front desk gave us a late check out of 3pm at no charge, for which we were very grateful. The location on the strip was great, as it was so close to Walgreen's, 7-11, and The ABC store, which can be a huge money saver. We did stay in the farther tower, which can be a bit of a pain when you want your morning coffee, it's a bit of a trek to get it, lol, but I think that's more of a Vegas thing than a Tropicana thing. I think most hotels have a tower that you have to trek to if you are staying there. Yes, there is construction going on, but we were never bothered by it in the least. All in all, the Tropicana is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected”
Reviews.Author: stringman77
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the renovated part of the Tropicana. Early reviews from both sources printed and eye witnesses had told us to expect construction. There was construction, but because we stayed in the renovated tower far from the noise, the whole experience was great as far as the room was concerned. Very comfortable bed, beautiful refurbishment and renos, and new carpets in a cheery white "South Miami" style made that part very enjoyable. Ditto the food: while 2 of the Tropicana restaurants were closed or opened sporadically, (and many restaurants generally in Vegas/casino hotels were closed until Dec 23rd), the Cafe Nikki was open, featuring a variety of excellent food at reasonable for Vegas prices. Unfortunately, the Beatles cover/tribute show was taking a week off before the expected Christmas rush.The staff was extremely helpful in every way imaginable from serving staff to doormen to concierge arranging a tour for us, to front desk. In our case, we needed to have our bags held over past checkout until we could catch the airport shuttle. No problem: the front desk staff allowed us to check out at 3Pm, and we had a rest in the room until that time. Overall, a maximum effort in the midst of timely renos that will eventually bring the finished Tropicana to a new modern height. The whole refurbishment upgrade leaves one with a cheery more "open to the light" feel than some of the other dimly lit casinos. This is a hotel worth the visit!

Reviews.Title: “Remodeled Hotel is Great”
Reviews.Author: JTM6
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed tne new (still under rennovated) hotel very much. Casino and our room were very nice & clean. This is very good deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana was a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: BemidjiHoffmann
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana has been renovated since our last stay a few years ago. The room was upscale and very comfortable. Although the hotel is very near to the airport, noise was not a problem. Check-in and check-out was easy and pleasant. The AAA discount made the room very affordable. Only downside was resort fee of over $10.00 a day. The fee basically paid for internet, which we wanted anyway. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great rooms, need more restaurants open!”
Reviews.Author: ldobson500
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay in the Paradise Tower for 3 nights was great...rooms are nicely redone, mattresses and bed linens are super, staff was very helpful and friendly. Our complaint was the lack of open restaurants due to remodeling and the slow time in mid-December. Cafe Nikki was the only restaurant open. It's good, but not where you want to grab a bite. This situation will change by Christmas Eve I understand. A GOLD STAR should be awarded to Nicole Marshall in Guest Services. I called Nicole when making the reservation. Nicole advised me and generously helped out in many ways. Nicole is the best asset the Trop has!!!

Reviews.Title: “Renovation is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: foot5841
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights on a jetblue special. Room was in Paradise Tower-nice and spacious. Bed was perfect-not too hard or soft. Room was very quiet and very well appointed. Elevators were right off the casino-close to the front entrance. Staff was very polite and accomidating on all levels. Location is on the far end of the strip but plenty of public transportation not far away. The renovation is still going on so there was a bit of noise early in the morning. Great value for the money-well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice...but it would be lovely if they would've told us that two of the three restaurants were closed!”
Reviews.Author: thatkimgirl07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned a get a way for our 4th anniversary. Found a great deal at the Trop..we decided it would be fun to do the dinner with the wine pairings at the Biscayne restaurant there. When we checked in, we asked about it and were told that it, as well as the Italian place in the hotel were both closed. Lovely. When you're going to do that, at least have the courtesy to make a note of it on your website, as you did with the pool closure. Other than that, the room was fine, beds comfy and staff were very nice. I don't appreciate being accosted by some chick in the casino area and being "tricked" into talking to someone about trying to get us to sign up for a timeshare. Makes me feel like someone is trying to get me to attend an Amway meeting. They ask you if you're "just checking in?" all friendly and then take you over to someone else to talk to, I said, no thanks, we don't do timeshares.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value at the Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: legallinda
Reviews.Content: I searched many different hotels for our trip to Las Vegas. Looked on the bed bug site as well and didn't find the Tropicana. Also saw the Tropicana was revamping itself. We couldn't have made a better choice. The price was great. The room was spacious and very clean. Checked for bed bugs when we arrived and found the mattresses looked brand new. Everyone was very nice and helpful. The hotel was a good size - the reception was right by the elevetors and we were in our room in minutes. We've stayed at the bigger hotels before and it took forever to find your room. You walked out of the hotel and could use the walkways to the other hotels and the bus stop was minutes away. The Tropicana was at the end of the strip that was much quieter, so if you are looking for that, this is the place. We did not eat there, so I can't recommend any of the restaurants there. The casino was small and so didn't offer as many machines as other hotels, but that was a small trade off for everything else about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - All the way around !!!”
Reviews.Author: bluejay82777
Reviews.Content: I will definitely be staying at the Tropicana again. The Paradise Tower room was beautiful with a great view of that end of the strip and very easy to get to- you don't have to walk through the whole casino to get to the elevator, which is wonderful if you are carrying luggage or bags from shopping. The bathroom was huge. Absolutely loved the size of the tv. The old fashioned doorman was great to have when your hands are full of packages and the front desk people are the friendliest around !!

Reviews.Title: “First time in Vegas...no complaints here!”
Reviews.Author: Shay011
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The rooms are brand new and have huge flat screen TVs. It's directly across from MGM Grand and the monorail stop is right outside. The parking is free and the restaurants are good. Unfortunately, the pool was closed but I hope to travel again and stay at this hotel when it is warmer. There are only two small complaints - check-in and check-out could have been faster. There were only two or three staff members working. Additionally, one tower is a little bit of a walk from the main lobby. Other than that, it was great...cute...small...well decorated...great artwork...I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the "new" Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: Swooks
Reviews.Content: We tried the Tropicana because of a great package deal and were delighted with our stay. We had a King in the Paradise Tower and loved it. The room was very quiet, roomy and comfortable. The decor is fresh and modern. Everyone from the front desk staff to the doormen was extremely friendly and seemed genuinely glad to serve us. The 4 course tasting menu at Biscayne was wonderful and Hector and Ken were great. If you are looking for a terrific room at a great price, the Tropicana should be on your short list. It is absolutely "Best in Class" in my opinion. We are already planning a return visit in the summer when the pool area (hopefully) is complete.

Reviews.Title: “It all started with the Reservation Agent”
Reviews.Author: thegasgod_slcut
Reviews.Content: Okay, we have not even traveled yet. But after reading the recent reviews on the Tropicana I decided this is where we would be staying during our trip to Vegas next October. I am surprising my Husband with tickets to the PBR World Finals! I called to reserve our room and got Pat on the other end of the line. She solidified my choice. So professional and fun. I can't wait for our stay! Kudos to the Tropicana, Pat was a pleasure to work with!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Tropicana!!!”
Reviews.Author: JMartW
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying at the Tropicana. My husband and I were in Vegas to celebrate my 30th Birthday. This was our second time to Vegas but the first time at the Tropicana. I liked the faint smell of suntan lotion when you walk through the front door. Everything is very clean and the employees' are friendly. The rooms are excellent and the beds are so comfortable! I will definitely stay at the Tropicana the next time i'm in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great people, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Toni3962
Reviews.Content: This property is beautiful since the renovation. The beds are very comfortable, great bedding and pillows. The rooms were very quiet at night. The service was fantastic. There were 8 girls traveling together. We asked for rooms on the same floor and close together. They did a great job accomodating this request. The casino was fun. Dale Smith is a great Pit Manager. He was very friendly and had a great personality and we enjoyed his company. Next time I am there I need to bring him a McDonalds yogurt parfeit for breakfast. Thanks for a great weekend and thanks for all of the decks of cards! I will definitely recommend this property for people to stay and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Kudos Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: breanna501
Reviews.Content: I travelled with a friend and we both had rooms with a great stripview. Both of our rooms in the Paradise Tower were clean and comfortable and we both really enjoyed the “beachy theme” which is such a departure from the standard Vegas hotels. We also enjoyed the very subtle scent that was reminiscent of suntan lotion, but not overpowering as some hotel signature scents can be. The location in the Paradise Tower, steps from the elevator to the Casino and entrance is wonderful!! To those who have complained about light coming into the room, the beauty of shutters is you can close them in a downward position to let in a little light, or close them in an upward position to block any light. The shutters also can be opened right up to have an unobstructed view. The iPod docking station and large flat screen television are also a nice touch if that is important to you. The front desk staff are wonderful (kudos to Doug for setting the tone for our stay); very helpful. ALL our interactions (with the exception of some spotty cocktail service in the Casino and some non-existent at times) with the staff at the Trop went above and beyond service levels I've experienced in "higher end" Vegas properties. What the Trop lacks in “glamour” is definitely countered by friendly, helpful staff. As you enter the Trop each and every time, the doorman is quick to open the door and offer a greeting. As I started away from the front desk on departure, the Bell staff was quick to rush over to "schlep" my luggage. We both enjoyed breakfast at Nikki Beach and I am really looking forward to seeing the pool area when completed as on visits years ago, I always "loved" the Trop pool so can only imagine how much better it will be with the renos complete; I do hope the Cabana prices don't rival those of other strip properties. I had really hoped to try the 4-course sampling at Biscayne, but with previous plans made had to add that to my "list of things to do" for the next trip. I did have a look at the menu though and it looks wonderful both for the samplings and dinner menu. I really enjoyed the bright feel to the Casino (the glare from the potlights on the VP machines adjacent to the white walkway was a bit much in the wee hours for tired eyes though, but what the heck….that’s what you get for staying up until 4:30 a.m. daily and I did locate some in a darker corner). The band that played at night was FANTASTIC and I enjoyed listening while playing VP (in the afore-mentioned darker corner). I really enjoyed finding some slots that are hard to locate elsewhere on the strip and not having to "wrestle" for a seat at them. The staff at The Trop is definitely what sets it apart; I have been travelling to Vegas for 29 years, many times a year and haven't experienced better customer service anywhere.... high-end hotels I frequent included. Now that the accommodations have been upgraded, the Trop is a must-try for Vegas vets and a great value for first-time visitors. Don't hesitate to give the new Tropicana a try!!

Reviews.Title: “Things have changed - Give it a chance!”
Reviews.Author: JacksonCaesar
Reviews.Content: Ran the Rock n' Roll half marathon and attended a convention at the Tropicana this past weekend. Never thought I'd consider the place after my stay years ago but looked into it because of my convention. I was surprised to read about the renovations and with the great group rate, figured it was worth a try based on the pics and reviews of the remodel. I stayed in a Paradise Suite which had a view at the corner of Tropicana & Las Vegas Blvd. Location: Great for the south end of the strip. From the paradise tower elevators it is 20 steps to the front doors. Easy in and out. Cross into MGM, cross over to Excalibur, catch the monorail to Mandalay Bay or cross again to NYNY etc.. Rooms: Recently renovated but don't expect luxury. They are nice clean rooms.The beds and pillows are the best I've slept on in a hotel room. The baths were updated and refit, not gutted and redesigned with modern upgrades. Typical, tub/shower combo, toilet and new vanity. Food: Ate breakfast at the new Cafe Nikki. Food and service were terrific. Casino: New bright space but only threw a few bucks in the slots. Ventured out to gamble along the strip. Meeting Rooms; New and comfortable. Staff: Always pleasant and there to open the doors for you. Needed some tape for a luggage repair and found some at the business center, where they gave me the roll. (Thanks again!) Overall: Many options in Vegas but I'd definitely consider staying there again. I'm interested in watching the rates as the hotel completes the renovations and Nikki Beach opens. I hope they don't go to high!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jay61008
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Las Vegas. The location of the Tropicana could not be better with it being on the south side of the strip. We stayed in the back tower, which is a couple minute walk from the casino area. The only problem was that if you walked all the way into the casino and forgot something in your room, it was a little of a pain to have to walk the distance again. My wife and I learned this quickly and made sure we had everything with us for the day. Rooms were clean, quiet, and the bed was comfortable. We did not eat in the hotel. The restaurants looked good, but I thought they were a little too pricey. Instead, we walked to the Hooters Hotel and Casino and ate at their Mad Onion restaurant a couple of times. They have a 9.99 prime rib that was fantastic. Hooters is only about a five minute walk from the Tropicana. We did do most of our gambling at the Tropicana. The casino area is smaller than most others, but I enjoyed the atmosphere. It was neither too loud nor too quiet. If you don't want to gamble there, you can easily walk across the street to either New York, MGM, or Excaliber. While there, we rented a car for two days from the agency in the casino. No problems there and the parking was free and close to the hotels entrance. We will consider staying at the Tropicana again.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a find...”
Reviews.Author: Unusualname
Reviews.Content: Moved here for 1 night after 3 nights in Excalibur and found it a very welocme step up. Having been very recenty refurbished, the hotel was exceptionally clean and tidy, and was a refreshing change. Massive room with massive TV, massive bath, etc... All with a good location on the strip. Staff were very friendly. Would recommend this for anyone...

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NewToChicago
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Tropicana. The room was beautiful, the staff very pleasant, cafe had good food and free coffee refills, we both won $. We have staying in Las Vegas about 9 times now and the Tropicana is where we will return! Also, the location was perfect for starting the Las Vegas Rock N Roll Marathon.

Reviews.Title: “Cafe Nikki was so beautiful and the food was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: SarahPK60713
Reviews.Content: My husband I plan a trip to Vegas every year and were decided to stay at the Tropicana because we had heard that they had remodeled. We had stayed there once before and were shocked to see all the changes! They have one of the most beautiful restaurants called Cafe Nikki where I had the best lobster benedict and my husband had the juiciest looking Kobe burger I had ever seen! We can not wait to come back in the summer to experience Nikki Beach Club!

Reviews.Title: “newly remodeled almost done good value on the strip”
Reviews.Author: petsvette
Reviews.Content: we were there during thanksgiving 3 nights we requested king bed strip view before we got there and sure enough thats what we got no problems as for the people that complain about the room not being dark at nite with the shutter style blinds LEARN HOW TO CLOSE THEM ALL THE WAY

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: gvwhite
Reviews.Content: Tropicana was just perfect for us. My husband and I are more sight-seers than gamblers. This hotel/resort is relatively smaller than others and that is what we liked about it...quick and easy to get in and out of. It is on the corner of the intersection with Excalibur, New York New York, and MGM Grand, which gives access to bigger casinos, more restaurants, and other attractions. Also, there is a tram that leaves from MGM Grand and goes to the other end of the strip, making stops along the way. Service was excellent. The property was being renovated, but that did not disrupt the fun.

Reviews.Title: “More then just good service, but good people.”
Reviews.Author: ColBender
Reviews.Content: My outstanding customer service started before I even set foot inside the hotel. I had a nice young gentleman help me with my bags and walked them to the front desk. I don't usually do this, but that really stayed with me the whole trip and my experience in Las Vegas a good one with a lot of good things to say about the Tropicana. I definitely recommend and will come back.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: knach
Reviews.Content: My husband had a business lecture in October at the Tropicana so I tagged along. We stayed in the Paradise Tower and our stay was flawless. The rooms were beautiful, clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel was smaller then others on the strip but we found this to be a positive part of the experience. It is right next to all of the larger hotels. We ate at the South Beach Cafe and the food was delicious with friendly service. We spent a lot of time at the pool. Pool is large and very pretty - when we stayed it was not a "happening" pool spot but they are in the middle of renovating and making some changes to this. Overall we had a great time at the Tropicana and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: cmarshall5151
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tropicana when I was in Las Vegas for business. The room seemed to be newly renovated and it was very nice, I had a great time, the staff was very attentive and courteous, I really have no complaints. I will be back to Vegas soon, my wife and I will be celebrating our 1 year wedding anniversary, and we have booked the Tropicana for 12/13-12/16, I am looking forward to coming back!

Reviews.Title: “New and improved!”
Reviews.Author: dragon57
Reviews.Content: I was lucky to get a very good deal on this hotel but I would have happily paid more. The location on the Strip won't suit everyone but I have stayed in this location many times and find it convenient for my needs. Although undergoing some renovation this in no way impacted on my stay. I was given a wonderful Strip view for no extra charge and my room was nicely decorated and bright. I also found the staff friendly and helpful. I would happily stay her again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: HOLIDAYLOVER89_10
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed at the Tropicana the last week of November. We loved every minute that we spent there and we did not want to return home! The Tropicana is a smaller hotel than others than on the strip, but this is an advantage! Customer Services Skills were spot on, smiles all around the Tropicana. I loved the freshness of the hotel, very bright and airy with a tropical infused smell. No smell of stale of smoke like many other hotels. The rooms were amazing for the value! Very comfy bed, lots of space and a great bathroom. No complains at all! A word of advice for enyone that eats at the South Beach Cafe - Portions are huge, so you can quite easily share! But very yummy and good value!! Will definitely be recommending the Tropicana to friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Outstanding - We've found our favorite hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ivanhny
Reviews.Content: Our flight from New York came a bit early and they allowed us to check in at 1:00 instead of 3:00, a big plus after a 5 hour flight. We really appreciated the courtesy and professionalism of the staff, they were friendly and accommodating without being overly so in a phony way. The room had extremely comfortable beds, a nice size bathroom, and a great 42 inch LCD. The pool area was still under renovation, but it when it's complete it should be outstanding - lots of space but no so big you can't maneuver around it. The casino is light airy and the slots are not overly stingy, a fact my pocketbook appreciated, also drinks service was outstanding. I like the fact the hotel is not overly big and impersonal like some of other hotels on the strip. I think they're trying to go for a "boutique hotel" feel and they are wildly succeeding at it. The new Trop is now our first choice when we head out to Vegas. Chic, stylish, and the crowd is a cut above the hordes of masses at the other strip hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Newly remodeled, clean and comfortable - Best value on the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: FredInCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Paradise Tower. The rooms have recently been remodeled, the beds were among the most comfortable I have ever slept on in a hotel. The whole hotel in bright and sunny - which is not the norm for most of the Vegas Hotels. This hotel, by Las Vegas standards, is mid-sized, so you do not have to deal with enormous crowds just to get through the casino. It is very well located - walking distance from four or five other major hotels and casinos, in case you get bored and need a change of scenery. Nightly room rate was among the lowest we found, so this was also a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Rick1955
Reviews.Content: Stayed there Thanksgiving week. Everything from reservations, checkin, room, casino, and checkout all first class. Of course I wish we would of came home with more money but we all had a great time. They really know how to treat you like a guest vs a ATM machine at the other casinos. Can't wait to go back and will be staying at the Trop.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel..would stay again in a heartbeat.”
Reviews.Author: sunbear2008
Reviews.Content: Stayed there Thanksgiving night, had our room upgraded to a suite. It was great. Clean room, most comfortable I have slept in. Great view of the strip . Clean bathroom with a huge tub. Staff very friendly, from the doorman to the person behind the desk. Everyone stopped and talked to us. Our friends stayed at the Luxor during this time and loved our room , said wished they would have known it was this nice. I will stay there on my next trip to Vegas. Only complaint I had was the blinds ...they didnt keep out the sun in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “18th floor and it seams everybody was partying all night...”
Reviews.Author: MeuterMedia
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute decision and we stayed for 2 nights. Some idiot knocked at all the doors after 3 a.m. and again around 4 a.m. our room was on the 18th floor in the last tower - no view, - a very small window, no real daylight in the room, some renovated areas, very small bathroom, the hinges to the bath room are rotten, the carpet infront of the sink (next to the bathroom) was stained all over. The good stuff, very reasonable priced, but watch out for the daily RESORT FEE! The large pool was closed for renovation and 1/3 of the casino was blocked for constrcutions (a week prior to Thanksgiving!). Instead of a breakfast buffet the only offered Brunch (on a Monday!) just to make it more expensive. After we finished our breakfast they added cakes and other sweets to the buffet. The good: Elevator rides to the top are included, great views. MeuterMedia

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: cbowers777
Reviews.Content: As hotels go in Vegas, the Trop has really turned itself around. Rooms are modern and updated, no overpowering smells of smoke or air fresheners, very comfortable beds, and proximity to other fun places make this a good choice for a fun weekend trip.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like driving a brand new car”
Reviews.Author: grevo77
Reviews.Content: Its amazing. Brand new rooms. Everything smells and fells new. Actually staying there feels like driving a brand new car! Free wireless internet and free parking but no coffee maker in rooms. Highly recommended and for reference please read the previews reviews. I have only two complains. When I booked online from a third party site, the hotel recorded my name wrong. This became an issue when I checked-in and shows that somebody in the hotel is not doing a very careful job. My second complain is that my room was on the island tower which is a quite long walk from the main entrance. I am a marathon runner but still found this part boring and not comfortable. Look, I paid with tax and fee $75 per night for Thursday and Friday night. Because of this, but also because the fact that the rooms are brand new and clean and since the hotel is in a perfect location I highly encourage you to stay there! But please do a phone call to confirm your reservation before check-in! Ask them to spell your first and last name.

Reviews.Title: “The "New Trop" is a Flop”
Reviews.Author: KBEsq
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews on various sites, including trip advisor.com I changed my reservation from the Luxor to the "NEW" Tropicana for a vacation the week of thanksgiving. BIG MISTAKE. The first "new" room my girlfriend and I got was in the Island Tower. The only thing new about the room was the furniture and the bedding. When we woke up in the morning to take a shower, we had to actually duck our heads to shampoo our hair, keep in mind I am only 5 foot eleven and my girl friend is 5 foot ten if your over 6 foot don't even bother trying to bathe on that side of the hotel. When we called the front desk, they did accomadate us by moving us to the Paradise Tower early in the morning on the second day of our stay. The room in the Paradise Tower was better, however, it wouldn't of taken much to beat the Island Tower room. The good thing about the Paradise Tower is that you can be out of the Hotel in under 2 mins. According to some reviews on here the vanilla smell that is piped into the casino and hotel is "pleasant'; We did not find this to be the case. I would compare it to sitting in a car that has too strong of a vanilla airfreshener and after a few days that starts to wear on you. I would of liked to take my girlfriend to a spa, however, there is no active spa here due to the renovations. Also, we only ate once at the hotel at the "South Beach Cafe" this place is a total joke. We had two burgers and some cheese sticks for 40 dollars. In comparison, we had an a couple of sandwiches over at the sports bar of New York, New York and it was under 30 bucks. The good thing about the Tropicana is the location as it is right across the bridge from both MGM grand and Excalibur/Luxor/Mandalay Bay. I can't envision a scenario that would make me stay at the Tropicana Hotel again. The constant loop hyping the "mob experience" in the hotel elevators was enough to almost make me loose my cool. What a dumb idea for a vegas hotel, other hotels have cool themes like greek/roman gods iconic cites paris/new york but their idea to get hip is to try and capitalize on the Soprano's? That was popular like ten years ago way to get with the times! If you are looking for a hotel that is attached to a nice shopping center with great places to dine you are looking at the wrong place, spend more money and stay elsewhere. Further, the sportsbook was not even open I had to walk across the bridge to the MGM grand just to lay some sports bets. Not an ideal place to stay/dine or bet on sports as of late november 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Need to check out the service of Matt and Ron- '' what a team''”
Reviews.Author: msnay
Reviews.Content: I felt the need to write in and tell you about my expirence, sorry it took me so long. In July of 2010 my wife and I decided to stay on the strip in Las Vegas. We have stayed at the usual hotels before Newyork, Newyork - Luxor-Mgm- but this time we were looking for something a little different . We discovered the Tropicana, we have always said we need to go checkout that hotel but never seemed to manage to go. Upon check in we felt welcomed and more then just a number. Check in was quick and easy with no long lines. The newly remodled room was very nice. We really liked the shutters rather than the big heavy curtins. My wife ran up the room to change later on the day we checked in and found that our floor was wet. We called and talked to Matt Brown who assured us not to worry and there were some "kinks" they were still working out. He insisted on moving us to an upgraded room. Additionally, Matt introduced us to Ron Chalk (Casino Host) who was also very nice and took us on a tour of the new construction. He spent time with us making us feel like welcomed customers. Due to the outstanding customer service by both Matt Brown and Ron Chalk we will make Tropicana our new favorite hotel on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Lots to like, with a few quibbles....”
Reviews.Author: Coreenkay
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Thanksgiving week for 4 nights. We had a room on the ninth floor of the Paradise tower. The casino is a big improvement, with a light, open, clean feeling. When I visited a year ago, it felt a bit grim and grungy. The staff was unfailingly polite and pleasant to deal with, from Doug at checkin, Rose helping with boarding passes and the quick and polite response when I requested an additional luggage rack from housekeeping. Room Pros: Comfortable king size bed, very roomy, safe, big flat screen tv, new furnture. The look is understated tropical, I was expecting a few more bright splashes of color with the South Beach theme. The wall art was of Jazz musicians, and seemed to evoke New Orleans a bit more than South Beach, but it was fine. Plenty of hangers, an i-home clock radio with an i-pod dock. Bathroom was a good size with a nice layout. Room Cons: Window treatments were shutters rather than curtains, and they were difficult to close tightly to block light. This was a particular problem since we were right across from the MGM electronic sign, that flashed and blinked all night. They shutters look good, but really need to be paired with some sort of blackout curtains, after all, this is Vegas and there is a good chance you were up late. Also, the first night was very noisy. We discovered that one of the windows had not been closed properly. It is nice to have windows that open, but quick check to make sure that they are closed correctly when the room turns over seems like a no brainer. The bathroom had a nice updated marble counter, new sink and faucits. Unfortanatly, they stopped short of a complete re-do, and left the old tile. This would have been fine had they regrouted and replaced any broken tile, but in our room the floor grout was stained and there was a broken tub tile. It did not affect the functionality at all, but left an overall impression of old and dirty when compared to the rest of the room. if you are planning on using the fitness room, the new upgraded room will not be available till spring. The current room is small and light on cardio equipment. There was no exercise bike (bummer for me, I'm supposed to bike for physical therapy for a bad knee) 2 elipticals and a few treadmills. They are well equiped for free weights and weight machines, a bit ironic since most of the demand seems to be for cardio. I'm looking forward to checking out the new facility when it opens. The parking got a bit dicey as we approached the weekend, there is a very small parking garage, and half is dedicated to valet. We had one evening that it took us 20 minutes to find a spot. I believe that they are going to build a new garage over where they imploded the old tower, but parking will be a challenge during busier times untill then. The wifi included in the resort fee was fine, we never lost signal, and it was great to have. The business center is closed, and since printing of boarding passes was included as well, they took care of that at the front desk. A couple of (very) small quibbles with housekeeping, we did not have the disposible bag for the ice bucked replaced the entire week, and a wire coat hanger was left on the bathroom counter one day. Also, kudos to the social media team. I joined the facebook page, and posted a question before we left, and had a response promptly. Overall, I feel we got an outstanding value, and do want to go back for pool season. I am hoping for a fresher feeling bathroom and a darker room for sleeping, tho!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay”
Reviews.Author: laoyoutiao
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Tropicana. Let me tell you something, right off the bat I got a good feeling about this place. Checking was smooth. They only gave me a 7thfloor which is fine. All i want is a nice room. And nice room I get. All the furniture looks new40 inch LG TV is enough for hotel room. Bathroom is a little outdated, but consider the price I can accept that. What IMPRESS me the most are all the staff, top to bottom.Few people I would like to mention is front desk , Maria, Eve , they are very patient and polite. The doorman are very friendly. TEO and BOB. Keep up the good work, cuz I will be BACK.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Tropicana!”
Reviews.Author: ebattl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New Trop from 11/21/10 through 11/24/10 and were treated like kings. The staff was top notch and the renovated rooms are nicely done. The price was a bargain and the location is convenient. I read many reviews beforehand and noticed that some people had been upset about the lack of coffee makers in the rooms, so we packed our own small coffee system. Problem solved. I can't wait to come back in the summer and see the new pool. Extra props to Steve, the doorman and Rose at Check-in.

Reviews.Title: “great service waiting for amenities to catch up”
Reviews.Author: milesken
Reviews.Content: probably about two months early until construction is done. not much to do for kids. rooms and bed were OUTSTANDING. maid service great. bell service great. hope the food improves. coffee and newspaper service availability could improve. check in pleasant. Met Matt Brown, Hotel Mgr. I wish ALL hotels had someone of his caliber and expertise on duty. He definitely went above the call of duty yet protected the Hotels integrity quite superbly. Very pleasant and knowledgeable about business yet still had empathy for guests and the service they receive. He got the job done quickly, professionally and with a smile. Much better than the surly attitude of many employees else where. Keep an eye on him!!!! KEN JOHNSON

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mmmfajitas
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Island Tower, took about a 10min walk to get from my room to the front of the hotel so not too bad compared to some Vegas hotels. My room looked exactly like the pictures online, very clean and everything had that new carpet smell. The bed was so comfy, next time i'm bringing a king size case to smuggle it home! We ate breakfast in the South Beach Deli, portions are huge! I used the wifi every day without any problems too (it's included in the resort fee). Every member of staff i spoke to was very friendly and Yolande (?) at check in was great, offering lots of info on where to shop which made for a very pleasant check in experience. I really liked the casino here too, it's very bright and airy compared to some casinos which are really dark when you walk in. The Tropicana will definitely be my first choice when i return to Vegas and hopefully they'll keep their rooms affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: jimmyg_la
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tropicana to attended my niece's wedding. They were all staying across the street at NYNY. I found a great rate at the Tropicana and decided to stay here instead after reading the great reviews here on Tripadvisor. I too wasn't disappointed. I asked to stay on the tower closest to the strip; however, the room was on the second floor, had no view other then electrical connections, shower only plus the TV didn't work. That was OK because I wasn't going to spend much time in there the first night; however, I asked to switch on the second night. No problems - switched to 20th floor overlooking Luxor & strip. Great spacious room, huge flat screen TV, full bath, great views, very comfortable beds. Hotel and casino is clean, bright, low key. So much for relaxing then NYNY, MGM, or Excalibur or for a matter of fact any of the others hotel/casinos; however, 2 bridges easily connect to the other hotels/casino across the street. Staff were very nice and helpful. Again for the price and location I really don't think I'd stay anywhere else in Vegas. The other hotel/casinos were just way too crowded & crazy. Tropicana is old world Las Vegas as it should be....classy, comfortable and reasonable priced. Good job.

Reviews.Title: “I'm a construction worker and THEY made me a king”
Reviews.Author: lancelowery
Reviews.Content: How to start? This was my first time to stay at tropicana. We went for my wifes b-day and at check in i was asked if i was expecting mail, i said no she said let me check on it and when she came back she had a card for my wife with free things in it and they were nice things to use for FREE. Mine started at getting my trop card, from getting it, to asking questions, to not sure what to do, over about a 6hr. time frame ALL HANDLED BY THE SAME PERSON and all answered, not blown off. Check this, a floor security person saw that i was drinking it was empty didn't see a watress asked if i was having a good time and if i wanted another drink i said yes and he got a person to get it for me. now one time only, no, he asked how i was doing all the time.My wife and her sisters came down later we played then went to the bar where we didn't play and STILL got great help.this was all in the first 6hrs. and it only got better.The Prime rib at Biscaye cannot be matched. The Tropicana is a Big time place with GOOD SMALL TOWN MANNERS.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & bright. A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ladiebird
Reviews.Content: Stayed at beginning of Nov 2010 & this has been beautifully renovated. Pool closed for the season, but enjoyed the hot tub. Lovely bright airy rooms, quiet and nice size telly. A very pleasant stay, would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: rd2g0
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again and again. Customer service was great and the hotel was totally changed from what we remembered

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Countryrose30
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights and was impressed by the new rooms. Everything was very clean and the staff were always polite and helpful. Construction is still going on but didn't interfere with our holiday although the gift shop and one restaurant were not open yet. Asked to change rooms because of noisy neighbors and staff were very accomodating. Will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: konarm
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Island Tower for 3 nights during the week of Nov 15th. The Island Tower rooms are a bit of a hike to the casino floor but that just equates to a more peaceful retreat from the noise. The room is large and well lighted. The 42" TV was nice. The wi-fi worked great. Large soaking tub. The towels leave alot to be desired. Also very convienient to the pool and gym. A little disappointing that the Spa is closed so a massage was not an option. I think it is being rennovated along with many areas of the casino. The sportsbook is closed and is also a work in progress. They anticipate opening the sportsbook in May 2011. It is a 5 minute walk to the MGM Grand Sportsbook. The pool area is also under construction but looks as though it will be very nice. The gaming area is small consisting of 2 roulette wheels 2 Craps tables and about a dozen or so Blackjack and assorted card games. Plenty of slots in a rather simple to navigate casino floor. You will never get lost or separated from your party. Very nice sports viewing lounge with plenty of TV sets. Purchased discounted tickets for the Yesterday Beatles Tribute show. Very entertaining. Cozy theater with great acoustics and very comfortable. They are advertising another interactive show called The Vegas Mob Experience which opens soon and looks quite fun and historically educational. The staff was very gracious. I only ate a sandwich and fries and a coke at the Cafe for $16. It was very good. They had a classy looking steakhouse and a pasta place as well. No buffet if that is important to you. Overall a great value and convienient walk to MGM, Excaliber and the free tram to Luxor and Mandalay Bay. Also the $5 monorail is easily accessed from MGM and will take you clear to the other end of the strip. Funny thing happened in the gym that I will share and I'm certain management will address it. I was the only one working out and thought I would turn the TV on and flip the channels. Well channel 33 is "hardcore triple XXX". Pretty sure I did'nt pay for that little perk. LOL.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable. Convenient. Great Improvements. I'll be back, soon!”
Reviews.Author: dz9r89
Reviews.Content: The overhaul that has taken place to this hotel is amazing. New rooms, new casino, new look, new attitude. I loved every minute of my stay. The only thing lacking was a mid-range food place. The steak house and the Italian restaurant served excellent quality food with immaculate service...but once in awhile it's nice to go into burger joint or rib hut. There is a cafe on the lower level but I'm not a sandwich person. I'm making plans for my return to vegas in February... I will be staying at this hotel everytime I head to town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: FreeUpgradeHunter
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tropicana due to it's low price(time of year) $39+resort fee of $10. The resort fee covers pool internet etc, pool is closed in the winter though. The room was updated, although they left the original bathroom tiles which needed the grout cleaning badly. The room had a newer t.v and overlooked the boring end of the strip, the construction outside fades away with the window closed. No facilities in the room so take a coffee maker and a cooler. Beds were better than many hotels. Location is alittle far for some to walk to get to the main area of the strip but with free parking at the hotels you can always drive. The casino was quite capable of taking your money and the courtesy drinks can be slow, so sit near the bar/serving area then they keep walking past you. The renovations are ongoing but don't inconveniece you, for the price I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Employee's”
Reviews.Author: Diana7Michigan
Reviews.Content: We stayed next door at Hooters but went to Tropicana to play, we always play at the Trop when in Vegas. The Employee's is what stands out they are very helpful. And have always gone beyond the norm to answer questions and show us where something is. Drink servers come around often. The New Bright interior is Clean looking I'am so glad they kept the Stained Glass ceiling. I would stay here in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “The best, best, best hotel in Vegas (for the price)!”
Reviews.Author: lac25
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Tropicana for my birthday weekend and I cannot even begin to explain how amazing our stay was. From the moment we checked in, Malanda, was so helpful. My boyfriend had sent an email to manager, Nicole, weeks before our stay and advised her that it was my birthday and he wanted to get a room in the Paradise tower with a view of the strip. We informed Malanda and she quickly accomodated our request. Our flight was early, so we were able to check in when we arrived to the hotel at 1:00pm. Our room was so beautiful and spacious! The beds were unbelievably comfortable! I heard it was recently remodeled, and you could totally tell everything was brand new. We never actually got around spending time at the casino and the pool since we were out and about most of the day but from what we saw it seemed nice. We stopped by our room for a second on Saturday (my actual birthday) and I was surprised by a knock on a door with a complimentary bottle of wine and a birthday card from the lady who had checked us in, Malanda! It was such a thoughtful surprise! We had some other friends staying at another hotel, down the strip, so we had to walk a while to get there, but it's Vegas...that's what you're going to do anyway. Please DO NOT listen to any negative reviews on this hotel. If you stay here but are expecting it to be the Venetian, well then go spend hundreds more and stay over there. Overall, a wonderful experience for my birthday!

Reviews.Title: “The rooms were spacious, clean and very well priced and the customer service was outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: slohrman
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by how nicely the rooms and casino floor had been renovated. The hotel staff was very helpful in directing us to places within the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You gotta see this place, they have done an amazing job”
Reviews.Author: SCtravelers0
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in the newly renovated Tropicana Hotel in Las Vegas and were absolutely thrilled with our room and the whole renovation. You can't beat the Trop for quality and price.

Reviews.Title: “excellent and still getting better”
Reviews.Author: lkstephens
Reviews.Content: Customer service was just great--not one problem. They are in process of remodeling, but what they have done is very nice. We liked the better lighting in the casino and our room was very nice and well done. We would like to mention an employee, Hilaria, who works in the South Beach Cafe. She truly represents the term "customer service." She is friendly and made us feel really comfortable. We ate about 4 meals in the cafe and she was there to assist us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: sbfive
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Tropicana on a Wednesday. The remodel appears to be nearly complete. Nothing is going on that would be disruptive to sleeping if that is what you are looking to do. ;) We walked in to the lobby and the sign said "check out" no sign for check in, but as it turns out this is also where you check in. It was smooth after our initial confusion. The casino is very bright but not real big. I enjoyed the brightness. The servers were around and quick to check back to see if you wanted a refill. The rooms were excellent. I don't recall sleeping in a more comfortable bed at a hotel. The room was a very nice size with very large screen television. We ate in the cafe for one breakfast it was about $23 for the two of us for an OK breakfast of egg/sausage sandwich and 3 egg/potato/toast meal. We also ate at the buffet for breakfast on Saturday for $9.99 each. Not a lot of choices but for the price reasonable. We also ate at Pampas which is located in the PH Mall area $5.99 for steak and eggs this was pretty decent. We did a lot of walking but we also would catch the monorail which is located right next door at the MGM. We took in 3 shows. Defending the Caveman at Excalibur which was not bad. It was all about relationships so if you are married especially it is funny. We saw the newer show called VEGAS the show. This was entertaining and well done. We enjoyed it and bought our tickets at half-price shows on the strip. This was about $40 each. The final show we saw was Nathan Burton we found free tickets online, before we arrived. If you purchase there it is about $30 each. Great trip would go back to this hotel just due to very reasonable price and EXCELLENT rooms.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: azwytravelers
Reviews.Content: My wife had a convention in Las Vegas and I got to go along for fun. When I heard we were at the Tropicana, I winced a little. But once we arrived it wasen't as bad as I expected. it is an older property and theres just nothing they can do with that....theres remodeling going on and once they're complete ....maybe they will be a little more modern. The room was renovated with new furnishings and nice TV. But the A/C was terrible...don't let the room get hot..cause the A/C has a tough time keeping up. But overall we enjoyed our stay, the price was right and the staff is trying to make rhis the "OLD" tropicana. I would stay again....would just make sure the A/C in my room was working properly.

Reviews.Title: “What's All the Fuss About?”
Reviews.Author: LK333
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at the Tropicana for 3 nights during the 1st week of November. I booked the Tropicana because of all of the positive reviews on Trip Advisor about the renovations and changes that were made recently. I never had gone into the Tropicana during my previous Las Vegas visits, but I would hate to see what the old Tropicana was like if this is now the newly renovated version. Don't get me wrong, the hotel looks nice but I wasn't overly impressed. To me, it just seemed like an average hotel when you walked in. The casino was bright but not overly big and impressive. There were really no wow features at all to look at., The new rooms however are indeed nice and comfortable and we did enjoy our beds at night. They are renovated but I noticed that it appears it wasn't a full refit as the tiles in the bathroom still looked a bit dated so you could still see remnants of the old rooms. A lot of users commented on the staff. Again, not impressed. We had arrived at the hotel after 1pm on a Tuesday afternoon and was told we could not get a room until 4...when check in was supposed to begin at 3. I didn't feel like the woman was very accomodating and also felt that the bell hop was rude when asking about holding our bags. When we arrived around 4:30 (i was afraid to arrive any earlier with fear that the room would still not be ready), the only room they could give us was one facing a cement wall and roof area? Not thrilled, but I knew we wouldn't be in the room much anyway. The check in woman commented that check in was 3 so other rooms were already given away....I complained that why did the previous woman tell us to show up at 4 then! She didn't seem to care. Staff did open the doors for us almost each time we entered and exited the hotel, but other than that nothing to brag about. To sum it up, the hotel doesn't have any wow factor. There isn't much to do in the hotel as far as good restaurants and entertainment so don't expect the hotel to be a real happening place....perhpas this will change once they open Nikki Beach? We did visit the pool once and it's nice but again wouldn't say its the best pool in vegas like the hotel sometimes states. The location is on the south end but the Excalibur is across the street which has a tram to the Mandalay Bay and Luxor and Tropicana is also across the street from MGM which can connect you to the monorail system so you can still get around somewhat easy to most areas on the strip. Regardless, I would stay at the hotel again though for the value of it but at least next time I would know what to expect. So I would recommend the hotel if you want a comfortable place to sleep at an inexpensive price but I consider it to be more of a regular hotel than a casino resort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at the "Trop"”
Reviews.Author: billcop
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our trip to Las Vegas, where we stayed at the Tropicana. The hotel & casino are currently being renovated, but of the parts that are finished, we rate it an A++!! Our room was in the Paradise Tower. It was large, clean and modern, with a very comfortable king size bed, and modern furnishings including a 42 inch flat screen tv. The decor had an island theme to it, and the bathroom had a nice tub/shower combo and large vanity area. Although the casino was still under going renovation, the part that was finished was tastefully done, and was not smoky at all. All of the staff that we encountered were very friendly and attentive. Since we had a vehicle with us, we utilized the valet service and each time they were very prompt in retrieving our vehicle. They charge an upfront fee of $10.00 per day for unlimited wifi internet use and for some of the other amenities which was fine, since most hotels on the Strip charge you more for internet usage alone anyways. Once they are finished totally remodeling and renovating, the Tropicana will be a very nice place to stay, and you can't beat the location! Overall, we had a wonderful stay at the Trop, and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “The Trop is back!”
Reviews.Author: conferencetraveler62
Reviews.Content: Everything they are saying about the new and improved Tropicana is true. It's not one of the glitzy brand new hotels but if you want dark, loud and smokey atmosphere, you an always go up the strip. If you want clean rooms, open, bright and airy atmosphere and a great staff to guide you to a great time, the Tropicana is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Best new rooms on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Jman2473
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tropicana with my best friend and I am so impressed with the room we had. The beds were extremely comfortable. I loved that the alarm clock is also an iPod/iPhone docking station. We had an awesome view of the strip. The bathroom was huge. Very clean and completely unbelievable for the price. I have stayed at more expensive rooms at other hotels that do not even compare. We were close to everything on the strip however we didn't need to leave because of all of the excellent restaurants available. The only negative about it was the construction going on at the hotel. However, once we found parking, we were never bothered by the construction. Everyone was very friendly on arrival and throughout our stay. I hear the steakhouse is amazing and look forwardbto trying it on my next visit. Again I am extremely pleased with the value of this hotel room. You won't beat this deal anywhere else on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and very efficient setting for conference”
Reviews.Author: slc015
Reviews.Content: I recently hosted a one day conference at the Tropicana. The hotel rooms are very new and clean. The conference room was perfect for my group of 50. The food and service from all of the employees was excellent. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “The best for the money”
Reviews.Author: goliath6980
Reviews.Content: I completely enjoyed my stay. The rooms in the paradise tower are simply gorgeous. The beds are wonderfully comfottable. The staff was very pleasant and goes out of their way to ensure that your stay is the best possible.

Reviews.Title: “What a change!!”
Reviews.Author: SoCalBabe6
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the tropicana back in April of 2010. I was completely disappointed with the stay. Anything that could go wrong, did go wrong! I ended up writing an email to the company to let them know how their guests were being treated. I got an immediate response (like 6:30am the next day). I was put into contact with one of the head honchos Arik. He was absolutely AMAZING!!! He was so extremely nice and was sincerely concerned with my bad experience. He invited me back to come experience the new casino. I must admit, I was hesitant to go back, but Arik had gone so far above and beyond his call of duty I felt obligated to give it another chance. My two best friends and I drove up from California for my birthday this weekend. We were in awe when we drove up. If you havent been there in awhile you will not even recognize the place. We were put up in a corner suite with the best view of the entire strip. We had a bottle of champagne waiting in our room right when we arrived. We were also introduced to the head of service, Kennon. Kennon is probably the best thing that has happened to that casino and hotel. Not only was he extremely hospitable, he was genuine. He personally wanted to make sure that me and my friends had an amazing time. Amazing does not even come close to how much fun we had! Everyone working in the hotel and casino were always smiling, everyone from dealers to waitresses to housekeeping, to floor supervisors would constantly being saying hello to all of the guests. I dont gamble all that much but was having fun playing three card poker on this trip. The dealer even remembered my name! Being that she probably deals to hundreds of people a day, I was very impressed by her attentiveness. Customer service and hospitality at the Tropicana is through the roof. Bottom line: Tropicana looks amazing. The rooms are glorious and the service is even better. My friends and I were sad that they decided to close down the buffet they had last October, but we were very happy with the 24 hour cafe. We found the prices to be extremely reasonable for Vegas. Not to mention they had an array of great "drunk food" along with a great breakfast and sandwich menu. My friend also loved the fish n chips! IF YOU DONT STAY AT THE TROPICANA, YOU ARE MISSING OUT ON A GREAT EXPERIENCE. THANK YOU TROPICANA FOR MAKING THIS THE BEST VEGAS TRIP I HAVE EVER HAD.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: eke_brown
Reviews.Content: We attended the SEMA show in Las Vegas November 3 - 6, 2010 and stayed at the Tropicana. Having never stayed there before, and knowing of their renovation work, I was a little skeptical. I was truly surprised. We had a room in the Island Tower. This area has been renovated already. Our room was great. It was quite, clean, comfortable and provided us with the much needed rest we needed. The staff was courteous and helpful. And everyone went out of there way to make us feel welcome. The only negatives about our stay was it was difficult getting in and out of the parking lot, it was quite a long walk from the entrance of the hotel to our room, and the cigarette smoke was quite oppressive that everyone has to walk through to get any where in the hotel. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very fine room and service.”
Reviews.Author: donbarc
Reviews.Content: We stayed midweek for 3 nights taking advantage of their mid-week special.. The room was clean, comfortable and the beds were outstandingly comfortable. The rooms are not huge as some of the newer hotels rooms but were fine for 3 nights. Service was fine and the bathroom was elegant. Missing was a coffeemaker which would be a inxpensive convenience. The hotel/casino is located mid-strip and is a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Updates look great!”
Reviews.Author: Rachele777
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Tropicana late at night.We asked for a room near the floor with a view of the strip,if possible.My husband and I were traveling with another couple and we needed two rooms.They said that they were almost fully booked.They found one room on the 19th floor facing the strip for our friends and gave us a luxury suite on the 3rd floor.What a great upgrade!! We had a corner unit,the view was spectacular. It was a bit noisy at night but hey,that's Vegas.The staff were friendly and accommodating.The rooms are newly renovated,the Casino is clean and well kept.They are still doing construction,but it did not affect us at all. Pool is open,but there is a section closed off for more upgrades.We had quick access via sky bridge to MGM,Excalibur and New York New York.We had a very pleasant stay and will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay!! Renovations and staff make this an increadible hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jackie7890
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a weekend stay at the Tropicana. I have stayed there a couple of times over the years, mainly for the inexpensive price of the rooms. However, this was my first stay in the Tropicana since it has been newly renovated. I was completely blown away. The Tropicana seems like a whole new hotel! The exterior of the hotel is so much more inviting, and the rooms are beautiful. The entire staff was great- very friendly and accomidating. I ate at their new steak and seafood restaurant Biscayne, and the food was delicious. I went on this trip with two friends for a birthday celebration, and it was the best Vegas trip by far I have ever had. I will absolutely be reccomending the Tropicana to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Trop. not like the old days.”
Reviews.Author: DaveFairview
Reviews.Content: Used to stay here, years ago. Thought I would try it again. Booked price fine; added extras a little too much. As usual, in Vegas, they do not want you in your room. They want you gambling. Even if they would let you make your own coffee in the morning; no, go down, or order 2 coffees for $20.00. A $12.00 pizza: $23.00 by the time you pay for it in your room. I come to Vegas every year, but not back to the Tropicana. The Pool area that your pay $9.99 a day; a joke.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money but unable to compete with other hotels on the strip”
Reviews.Author: vegasman10
