Reviews.Content: We checked in around 8 pm and when we arrived in our room it was not clean from the previous visitor. The shower and bathroom was not clean and there were towels on ground and food in room. We called the front desk to request a different room and after waiting about a half hour and 3 more phone calls a bell boy who did not speak english brought us into a different room. The hotel did not even apologize for the inconvenience which is unacceptable. We also stayed in the Island Tower and this was supposed to be newly renovated but it just couldnt compare with most of the other hotels on the strip. We were not impressed with the room quality and would probably not recommend staying here if you do not like walking. The rooms are a long walk to the casino and the hotel is located all the way down the strip so there is a great deal of walking. The casino was ok at times but during the weekdays you were able to hear the construction and demolition that was taking place on the property while sitting at the tables and slots.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana is coming back up to top standards.”
Reviews.Author: foradrive
Reviews.Content: While the tearing-down of the the older parts continues, the newer refurbished parts are quite nice. While not extremely extravagant as a few other hotel/casinos, the Tropicana is tastefully being done in more modern colors and fashion. The rooms are bright with natural colors, modern furniture, and soft yet surprisingly supportive beds. It was a very good value for its qualities and location. When the master plan for the remodeling of the buildings and grounds is complete, the Tropicana will be quite awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana should be burned to the ground not remodeled!!!”
Reviews.Author: Aggie9797
Reviews.Content: To make it brief and to the point - stay somewhere else. Tropicana is undergoing it's 'renovation' but it is just a process of putting lipstick on a pig. This hotel sucks and should have been razed to the ground years ago. The renovations just put a nice cover on an old worn out mattress. I am here for a conference at $59 per night and while the bed is comfortable I was woken up at 6:30 AM for construction noise. While they moved me the noise continued and the value I got from the conference I flew in for was diminished. Tropicana is under construction no matter what they or the website say. Unless you are ready to deal with dust, noise and cab drivers that can't find the entrance stay in a cheaper place like Excaliber or Circus Circus.

Reviews.Title: “The renovations are making this a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: hudakan
Reviews.Content: Great restaurants, very friendly staff, great location, casino was busy but not too busy, remodeled rooms are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value/Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: lsdfarrell
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a trip to Vegas. We were very reluctant to book at the Tropicana, as we have stayed at other hotels on the strip and loved them. I had read several review sites, which the reviews were good, and for the value we booked our stay at the Tropicana. The casino is bright, clean, and smells good. Not too smokey, except in the slots area heading up to the second floor. Our room was very clean, spacious, and the bed was very comfortable. We were in one of the newer rooms, and it was very nice. Our room faced the airport, which was a little bit of a drag, and we were not able to get it switched due to a very large convention in town. Our room was very quiet the entire stay. The only downsides was there was no tissue or tissue dispenser in the room, and I would have loved a coffee pot in the room. My husband did walk to the cafe the first morning and paid around $4 a piece per coffee, but we were able to refill the cups every morning. There are very minimal choice for food in the hotel. We did cross over to the MGM and went to the Food Court there, where almost all of the restaurants changed to breakfast in the morning, so lots of choices. The Tropicana did have a breakfast buffet on the weekends, and it was good. We did use the pool, and we would love to see the changes that are coming up to the hotel and to the pool. Best tips from us for your trip to Vegas....walk down the strip past MGM, to the tickets4tonight booth, they are next to the Coke Store. We got very reasonable prices on shows, and half price vouchers for food at a fabulous restaurant, we really enjoyed. In the same area, visit the ABC store. They are a chain from Hawaii, have great/cheap souveneirs, and have great prices on beverages, including beer and wine. If you are looking for liquor, you have to go to the ABC store in the Planet Hollywood Shopping Area.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK and nickel & dimed!”
Reviews.Author: cynthiaclagg
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed there for three days and had a fair experience at best. The hotel is at the south end of the strip and out of the way from a lot of the action we wanted to see (that was our fault). The first night there we purchased tickets for the Brad Garrett comedy show ~ shame on us for not paying attention but there was no Brad Garrett and the other comedians they had were TERRIBLE - worst comedy show hands down that I've ever been too! They had a few restaurants in house which were over priced. I got wings at the cafe (btw - also OUTRAGEOUSLY priced) and had numerous wings with no meat on them! It was the craziest thing I'd ever seen and after paying an arm and a leg for them I thought it would be better quality (at least have meat!). The casino has a nice ambiance and is clean but there were little to no waitresses to bring drinks (I hear free drinks at casinos are becoming a thing of the past anyway). To top it off, my husband and I were tired of spending all of our money on food/drinks and went to the store to bring a few things to our room to help cut cost. We had to pay $25 for a tiny refrigerator which looked like it had been thrown down the stairs and when we called to ask for it we were interrogated about why we needed one in the room...I was very offended that I was treated that way. The room was very nice but for some reason it was impossible to get the room cool enough despite putting the thermostat on 63 degrees, we were burning up. Going through the hotel it's obvious that a lot of effort has been put into the remodel and it does look great. I really was looking forward to a relaxing time for my husband and honestly am not that picky (you'd never be able to tell from this review) but we both just felt like it was one thing after the other. It's really a shame...

Reviews.Title: “The new rooms very nice would like to stay again next trip to LV”
Reviews.Author: hate2drive
Reviews.Content: Not as busy as other end of strip but liked that about it. Rooms very nice great TVs, staff very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Gwen at the front desk made this trip to vegas even better”
Reviews.Author: jamesconer
Reviews.Content: the tropicana has been reno vated and really looks good. the casino is beautiful

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! Great room! Great employees!”
Reviews.Author: betaalphapsinau
Reviews.Content: I am a member of a business organization at a university and we got the opportunity to get a tour of the Tropicana. We thoroughly enjoyed the tour, talking with the employees, and also staying at the Tropicana. They are really trying to revamp their image, and it's definitely working! I would for sure come back to stay again, whether it be for a business or personal stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but the hotel is still lacking....”
Reviews.Author: jsesme
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tropicana at the end of October for 2 nights in a standard room. The room was on the corner, and was one of the remodeled rooms. For the price paid (about $80/night), I'd say it's probably right at a good value for the money. There was nothing to hardcore complain about during the entire stay. I was a little hesitant to stay here at first, but one of the things that helped convince me it'd be okay was that I noticed that the hotel was fairly reactive to the comments left here, which indicated that they were paying attention to feedback, and reacting to it. For some reason, that helped reassure me. That being said, the staff was very friendly and attentive to our needs, the room was clean, spacious, and was very convienent to the south end of the Strip and neighboring hotels. BUT, be warned that the food/beverage offerings in this hotel are severly lacking. Only one option for breakfast, and a small grill at that. With literally countless options surrounding the general area, from expansive buffets to something as simple as Denny's, I felt disappointed by this lacking. Not anyone's there fault, as I really didn't see a lot of room anywhere in the hotel to put another restaurant - but this really should be addressed. Also, I was somewhat disappointed by the lack of staffing at Bell Services and Valet outside the main entrance in the morning hours. The front canopy was getting fuller and fuller of people checking out, and only ONE person handling luggage outside? Of COURSE he's going to get overwhelmed, but come on, get the guy some help! Valet also seemed understaffed at this time, though the staff was extremely friendly, and will always offer great directions and/or suggestions for things to do that are sometimes off the beaten path. Overall, the hotel's a good place to crash at the end of a long day, but I wouldn't consider it a "destination" hotel as the "makeover" appears to be trying to make it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Content: Hotel fully renovated. Location is good. Best price/quality ratio you will find!

Reviews.Title: “They were so flexible and focused on what we wanted, we had a great event.”
Reviews.Author: SpiroChicago
Reviews.Content: In October, my company planned a poolside reception at their great, newly renovated pool. The weather looked like it might rain, but we were desperate to be outside. The staff let us wait 'til the raindrops fell, to move the party under cover. They had to set up, take down and set up for us again and they were fantastic! Not only were they flexible, the food and service was excellent (the shrimp scampi was a hit). We look forward to going back next year.

Reviews.Title: “This gamble paid off”
Reviews.Author: Tmonster80
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Tropicana for wks from 13th-27th Oct. We had originally planned to stay in the MGM for 1 wk and TI for the 2nd wk, but had seen pictures of the rooms refurbished and the prices were amazing so thought we would take a chance. First impression on entering the hotel was good as it was nice and bright. Although no ramp to get our heavy suitcases up :-( Only problem we had in the whole 2 wks was at check in. I paid $850 for the room upfront at check in. The next day in Abercrombie & Fitch I tried to use the same card for $300 at the check out and it was refused (very embarrassing) so i paid with a different card and contacted my card provider. They said that the Tropicana had taken 2 payments, $850 and a separate $700. I questionned this at reception who said that it was $50pn for incidentals. I was very annoyed that when i checked in and asked the amount being taken from my card I was told $850 and never said anything about the other $700. The whole transaction had to be cancelled and paid with a different card, but I had to wait 7 days to get the money from my my card issuer as they had to wait for the transaction to expire. Don't know if this is a common practise in US hotels, but i would have at least liked to have been told or asked if I required that service. Anyway, pleeeeaaasssseeee don't let that put you off as the rest of the 2 wks were perfect. Genuinely friendly staff, clean nice rooms with the most comfortable beds i've ever slept in, we stayed in the Paradise Tower 17th floor with great strip view, great location by MGM. NYNY & Excalibur, beautiful pool which will be even more amazing when Nikki Beach is finished. Didn't eat in restaurants so can't comment on them, but South Beach cafe was nice. My only worry is that the prices will rise a lot due to all the renovations putting prices similar to MGM, TI, Mirage, etc. I'm going back to Vegas twice next yr and if i can get anything near the price i paid this time then i won't even bother looking at other hotels. Finally, a big thankyou to Patricia McKay in reservations for all your help with our booking.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Bjb46
Reviews.Content: The tropicana has been renovated and is clean, bright and nice rooms. The casino is not smokey and is not dark like some others. It is not extremely large but adequate. Everyone from the person who booked for us (Pat) to the check-in Melanda were very friendly. Melanda and Rose sent chocolate covered strawberries and champange to our to room for our anniversary. We would stay again. They are building a new area, Niki Beach which is supposed to be great. Would like to have had a coffee maker in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Perfect”
Reviews.Author: mainer5
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have said the Paradise Tower Rooms look great. The pool area, while still under construction is going to be excellent when finished. The hotel staff were as good as I have seen in years. My TV remote batteries were dead when we first got to the room and within a few minutes a working remote was brought to our room as requested. We forgot to close our room door one night and a hotel staff person knocked at the door to let us know the door was ajar, which I thought was very good. I liked it, that once you have purchased a coffee at the South Beach Cafe, if you kept the cup refills were free. I lost my ink pen and went to the Tropicana Hotel Store to purchase one and the cashier pulled out a can of pens and gave me one which again I thought was a nice touch. We contacted the front desk and were given a late check-out which was real good of them, they didn't have to do it. The access to the hotel parking was very good and we never had trouble finding a parking spot. My only complaint was the room noise. My Room #1928 didn't do well keeping the noise down from the HV unit, trains, planes and especially sirens at night making it difficult to sleep. I finally went to Wal-Mart and purchased some foam ear plugs that helped a lot. Next time I will ask for a room on the Tropicana Ave (north side) of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The New Tropicana is the "REAL DEAL"”
Reviews.Author: forbigmoon
Reviews.Content: My wife and i recently stayed at the renovated Tropicana -what a pleasant surprise! In addition to the millions of dollars in renovations management has put a premium on the real difference-maker in a Las Vegas stay - CUSTOMER SERVICE! From the Doorman greeting you and opening the door on your way in/out to the extremely helpful casino hosts it was a real joy to stay there. Their new restaurant is fabulous too! We highly recommend the "New" Tropicana in Las Vegas. Tim & Nan Naples Florida

Reviews.Title: “After all the recent renovations a really smart hotel”
Reviews.Author: peter_nutt
Reviews.Content: A really nice feel to the hotel and nicely furnished rooms in the Paradise Tower. Everything fine, except on one occasion the cleaner forgot us and nothing was done until late in the afternoon. This was reported to the Reception Desk who apologised - but we thought it unlikely they would follow it up.

Reviews.Title: “I will only stay with Tropicana from now on!”
Reviews.Author: Italianabella
Reviews.Content: I went this weekend to stay at Tropicana with my boyfriend so we can have a weekend away from everyone kind of like a anniversary weekend and Halloween fun! We had the most beautiful room ,beds were comfortable ,like sleeping on clouds. The room smelled so fresh . The moment we walked in doors opened we were greeted with nothing but gorgeous smiles as if they knew who we were. Check in was so fast and exceptional customer service wherever we went. We even passed a porter and they looked at us straight into our eyes with a smile and said welcome.We then walked around the first day and not one frown ,it was like we were in another world. Tropicana is the best when it comes to Customer Service,being very clean, excellent service no matter what we did in the casino.Tropicana has my loyalty as a customer from now on. Forget the Belagio,forget Palazzio and Mandalay Bay with their bad attitudes as if they didn't need my money . Tropicana staff all seemed very happy to be working ,they looked very proud. I will recommend this place to all my friends from NJ - California and from TX - Michigan.The value for the rooms was wonderful too. I shouldn't say this but for what they offered and as excellent as the rooms were I would charge more.On top of all that ,they are still surpassing their selves by making it even better and bigger. The entertainment was wonderful from the bands to Salsero Saturday in Tiffany Theater very classy .The food at the Biscayne was to die for ,excellent tasty ,unique menu! Even the South Beach Deli had such great sandwiches and coffee. They give you so much my boyfriend had to share my food and take his back to the room.It is so beautiful I wish them the best in years to come.Maybe we will go back and get married at their chapel..next year or for New Years!!!

Reviews.Title: “Needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: Heidi1979
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to the Tropicana, so I can't comment on the renovations, but I can say that both the hotel and casino were clean, bright and spacious. Our room in the Island Tower was great - very large, the bed very comfortable, and with a nice view of the MGM and New York New York Casinos. The temperature indoors was perfect. Generally, the Tropicana has an aura of "newness" which is in stark contrast to some of the old, out-dated interiors that I saw at various locations on the Strip. Unfortunately, however, the Tropicana needs to improve in a number of areas before it can even come close to competing with some of the other establishments on the Strip. Our hotel room didn't have a services guide (the booklet you're used to finding in your hotel room that tells you of the resort's services and facilities). When I called housekeeping to request one they said they'd deliver one immediately; however, I got a phone call 5 minutes later saying they didn't have any spare, but that I should dial 0 on the phone if I needed anything - a bit rough considering that without the resort guide I didn't know what was on offer! So my husband and I decided to look up the Tropicana website for details of the services and facilities provided - only to find that the promised free wi-fi connection didn't make it to our hotel room. I would have really loved to know that there was a fitness centre before now..! Granted, when I found someone in the lobby who I could speak to about the lack of wi-fi access he offered to move us to another room, but as we only had 2 nights remaining we didn't want the inconvenience of moving all our belongings. The bed linens and towels in our room smelled of smoke, although I'd requested a non-smoking room. We carried our own bags on arrival and departure, with no offer of assistance from hotel porters. The casino lacks an exciting vibe that makes you want to actually stay there (we spent all of our time elsewhere, and returned to sleep). If there's one thing I dislike whilst on holiday, it's having to chase up the services and facilities you know you're already paying for - I just want to enjoy myself with a minimum of fuss! I do think the Tropicana has a lot of potential, but really during our US trip we stayed in some very basic hotels that were able to provide free wifi access/non smelly linens/attentive staff, so it's a shame the Tropicana couldn't deliver. I guess from all the hype I was expecting a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay EVER”
Reviews.Author: Jenlau07
Reviews.Content: Myself and my friend endured a VERY long journey from London to Las Vegas (25 hrs from leaving the hotel in Heathrow to arriving at the Tropicana). I had read a few reviews beforehand and was hoping that The Tropicana lived up to my expectations. We arrived at about 9pm and check in was smooth. Gerard who checked us in was very informative and welcoming. We got up to the room and was MOST impressed!!! The view out of the window was of the Excalibur and MGM. Truly breath taking! The room was very spacious and modern. It was one of the new modified rooms. Sooo clean and tidy. The bed was sooo comfortable and I had no problems falling asleep as I normal would do in a new environment. Would I stay at the Tropicana again?!?! Most definately! Without a shadow of a doubt

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the new "Trop"”
Reviews.Author: karen1104
Reviews.Content: The rooms are completely renovated. Our room was very comfortable. It was an end room with a great view. Renovation continues in other parts of the hotel, however, it did not disrupt our stay. The pool is great...located in a beautiful garden area. They do need to get rid of the fake palm trees & flowers inside the hotel/ casino. We are looking forward to coming back & seeing the "Trop" when it's complete.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay ever in Las Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: BROWN1960
Reviews.Content: Could not believe the treatment at the Tropicana top notch. From the valet to the bellhop, house keeping and everyone there made our stay the best ever. Did not know what to expect when booking the room there but what a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent holiday and equally excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: DannyB1977
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Tropicana in Vegas in the second part of our States trip. I've been to Vegas briefly before but wanted a longer stint but was slightly concerned that some people said six days was too long. For that reason I wanted a hotel that i enjoyed spending time in. The Trop exceded my expectations. Firstly the customer service was top notch; everyone you met smiled and said hello but if you required anything they would bend over backwards but also genuinely take an interest in you. This started with Nicole who made our reservations and ensured everything ready for our visit. The entire place has been renovated (some still to go but this doesn't impact on any visitors) and the rooms were lovely. We were in the Paradise Tower and the room had plenty of space in the main room and the bathroom was big. above all else everything was very clean. Oh and nice big TV's in HD! The casino was small by Vegas standards but had a pleasant airy atmosphere and was well lit as well. The pool was also quite small by Vegas standards but was pleasant and laid back. We actually only really ate at the 24 hour place late at night but the food was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: buffettbound
Reviews.Content: I don't usually take the time to fill these out but we had such a good expierence I wanted to share....from Melanda who checked us in early and got us a great view!....to the front desk manager that bought us breakfast to make up for a little construction noise....to the extrememly nice staff all over the hotel....and the Great Food from the South Beach Cafe (night and day) we were very satisfied with our stay....would definately stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: UncleRiley
Reviews.Content: I am an infrequent traveler and chose the Tropicana on price. I was pleasantly surprised at how nice it was. The rooms were comfortable, clean and attractive. The casino was small enough to enjoy, yet large enough to accomodate any games you wish. If going here seek out the doorman Jake. He is a fountain of information. He can tell you the history of the Tropicana because he has worked there over 30 years as well as "fun facts" about Vegas in general.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is best in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ffgreg
Reviews.Content: From the minute I arrived, it was clear the staff knew how to treat guests. Wendy at the front desk - AWESOME and pretty. Cyrus the Bellhop - AWESOME. All the staff were accomodating and very willing to grant special requests...late check-out, print parking passes, etc. I will definitely be returning to Tropicana the next time I am in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Journey at Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: agb0320
Reviews.Content: Well I am currently staying at the Tropiciana and so far I can say that everything is meeting my expectations. Although I do have to say that the air conditioning in my room that I am in currently is not working very well. We have had maintenance in here twice and yet we are still not having a cold air. You walk in and it is humid and warm this is NOT what I expect when I have it cranked as low as it will go. So I am very disappointed about this especially when I am going to be staying here for a week.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service from convention banquet services”
Reviews.Author: Lauriess
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Las Vegas for a Conference that was at the Tropicana. Although we did not stay at that hotel, we did interact with the banquet staff in the convention center. One day we had been in meetings all morning and did not remember to enter an order for lunch through the hotel. We stopped by the table to see if they had any extra and they did not. At that point the banquet manager, Ms. Chavez, went to the kitchen and had the chef prepare lunch for the two of us and bring it to our individual sessions we were in for the afternoon conference. Customer service like that is unheard of, especially in Las Vegas. Ms. Chavez and her staff have definetly earned our business in the future.

Reviews.Title: “all around good stay”
Reviews.Author: fred_reade
Reviews.Content: Customer Service at the Tropicana is superb. Everyone and anyone that can help you immediately does so and then they follow-up to make sure it was done to your satisfaction. That was impressive. The room was clean, didn't smell like a former smoking room or anything like that. The pool area is nice, especially the grass areas. All in all The Trop is good and the price was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value and more intimate than a lot of the hotels”
Reviews.Author: Jossters
Reviews.Content: Loved: Pool area is cool and will be brilliant when it's all finished Not as huge as some of the others so far easier to navigate Really happy staff, particularly in the casino Brilliant value for money, only cost about £40 a night and rooms were better than most of the other hotels Free wireless, Sky and iPod docking station Couldn't hear any of the other guests (there were huge groups of noisy teenagers staying on our floor but couldn't hear them once in our room) Mega comfortable bed Huge and bright bedrooms Would definitely recommend this as somewhere to stay if you don't want hordes of people around all the time Not so impressed by: There was a bit of building work going on but even that was considerate in terms of timing Slightly further down the Strip but we're used to walking everywhere in London so didn't bother us!

Reviews.Title: “Not very happy so far....”
Reviews.Author: GMoore91
Reviews.Content: Well I was going to wait till our trip was over to write a review but after the first days events I thought I would go ahead a do a review now. We arrived early and attempted to check in early to no avail, which in its self was no big deal. I was told that they would put a rush on house keeping to get our room ready and to check back in a hour or so, 2 hours later our room was still not ready. Tried back at 3pm which is normal check in time and our room was still not ready, got told once agian to try back in an hour or so or that they could put us in a smoking room with 2 beds. Went and played some games and tried back about 3:45 just hoping that our room would be ready and yet agian it wasnt, go the just another hour or so spill agian. Needless to say this was getting out of hand!! So I went and found the hotel manager, he went up to the desk and came back to tell me that the room was being cleaned and it usually takes about an hour to get the room clean. I had a few choice words with him and he went back to the desk once agian and came back with keys to the room. Bt the time this ordeal was over I was so peeved that I couldnt see strait. I did end up getting comps for $50 dining and the resort fee being waived for the duration of our trip to some that would be worth the aggravation but not for me. Comps are Vegas' way of trying to make you happy for their screw ups, frankly no comp could have made my initial expierence any better here at the Tropicana. Oh and one last thing before I start my day here in Sin City, the showers do not drain very well at all, turned on the water to adjust the temperature and by the time I had it right there was over an inch of water in the tub, turned on the shower and waited for the standin water to drain but after 5 mins it still hadn't. I'm not a real fan of taking a shower in standing water. So that was day one, lets see what today and the rest of the week brings....

Reviews.Title: “A great time at the Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: marc037
Reviews.Content: Rooms a great, the pool is fabulous, and when it's going to be finished it's going to be even more fabulous! Needs more restaurants. We would return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Don't underestimate the Tropicana.”
Reviews.Author: DaryleDickens
Reviews.Content: We came to Vegas for a mix of business and leisure and as always it is difficult to choose what hotel to stay in. Having been to Vegas a few times in the past we had a very different picture in our mind's eye of what the Tropicana was than what we saw on their website. But due to the great deal we took a chance that they indeed are "changing everything." First thing you'll notice when you walk in is that the hotel is bright compared to other hotels on the strip. This was refreshing. And when I checked in there was not a wait and the staff was friendly and quick. Also refreshing if you've ever waited in a long line at a Vegas hotel only to be greeted by a grumpy hotel clerk. The tower our room was in was a bit of a walk away but this is norm in Las Vegas. What was nice was the quick escape from the casino. And shortly after that you escape the second hand smoke due to the business area part of the hotel being smoke free. This was really nice. The rooms are indeed "best in class." Much nicer than the room we had a few months early at a hotel just across the street. Nice and clean with a very bright and modern vibe. It was a great room to come back to after long days of conferences, shows, and casinos. Not to mention free wi-fi. Our room did not really have a good view though unless you like airports. And forget about looking out the windows after dark. Large spotlights pointing directly at the windows make that a blinding experience. Also the windows only had shutters which did not block 100% of the light from the spotlights at night. So it was impossible to make the completely dark. Tropicana please consider installing some shades guests could pull to completely cover the windows. Those of us that light it completely dark while sleeping would appreciate it. Over all it was a great place to stay. At every turn the staff was friendly and really helpful. In fact we found the dealers at Tropicana to be really good for us novice gamblers. Happy to answer any questions about the games.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but still being refurbished”
Reviews.Author: suzdave
Reviews.Content: Spent one night in a suite. All rooms have now been upgraded, however the pool area & one of the smaller blocks are still being modernised. There is also some modernisation in the restaurants & shopping area so choise is limited.

Reviews.Title: “If this is the best pool in Vegas… Vegas needs a new pool.”
Reviews.Author: woodenrabbit
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Tropicana the last time we went to Vegas. The sole purpose in choosing the Tropicana was that they advertise having "the best pool in Vegas". The pool is ok, but no big deal. I understand they are still in the midst of a renovation, but I don't see it becoming anything to write home about. The hotel itself is decent enough. I did not like that we were there on a Sunday, which apparently for the Tropicana means more than half of their amenities are not happening. Tried to go to dinner at their Italian restaurant. Closed on Sunday. Wanted to listen to a little lounge act. We were told we could go to one of the nearby hotels to see their acts. We mentioned to them that we could have also stayed there as well. To wrap it up, this hotel is clean and you will get a decent night sleep and you will be close to everything else one would want to do in Vegas… but you just have to leave the Tropicana first.

Reviews.Title: “ALL THE CHANGES HAVE MADE THIS THE PLACE TO STAY IN LAS VEGAS!”
Reviews.Author: 2BUGS2TRAVEL2
Reviews.Content: We had a GREAT time at the all new Tropicana! Our room was clean and comfortable and HUGE! We had great views of the strip and mountains. Service from ALL personnel was helpful, polite and genuine. EVERYONE knew our name from the valet, to door person, to front desk and housekeeping, to PBX and restaurant staff. Casino floor personnel were also very friendly and helpful, including the maintenance staff and slot attendants. (did not play table games, but I'm sure they are friendly also! ) We were warmly welcomed and greeted each day by name, whether in person or on the phone. We understand that changes are still underway (spa, pool, restaurants) which will make this THE place to stay. The location is perfect at the Strip and Trop--easy access to all major properties by foot, taxi, or tram. Surprisingly, valet delivered our car each day in a very timely manner--not the case with some of the other larger LV resorts. Rose at Front Desk went above and beyond and exceeded our expectations from a service standpoint. We went there to mail some cards and she asked a few questions, and before we knew it, she helped print out our boarding passes, escorted us to the Promotions booth and had our charges picked up based on our play. In the end, we found out we still have enough points on our player's account to enjoy a return visit and the points stay on your account for a year! Be sure to check with the Promotions Desk to see what specials they have in regards to signing up for a Player's Card. If you are going to gamble, it's smart to get credit for it and thier program seems to be very generous in comparison to other properties in Las Vegas and other gaming destinations. While we were there (3 days) their current promotion changed twice, so be sure to inquire. Although they were busy with lots of customers, they were VERY patient and happy to help. This is not a big fancy hotel. It is one of the oldest properties in Las Vegas that has undergone some much needed renovations and face lifting that have made it great. We stayed there about 5 years ago and checked out early due to the uncleanliness and poor attitude from the staff. You will get a good value for your dollar here. We didn't have time to see Brad Garrett in the theatre (who replaced Comedy Stop at the Trop) but that would be a good show to see if you like comedy--and be sure to inquire about ticket specials for this show--there were coupons located around the property for discounts.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: JOJIMS
Reviews.Content: Arrived 14 sept with husband and two adult sons for one week Sons were returning home after week We were travelling round for two weeks before returning to vegas for two nights then flying home We had booked are last two nights at the pallazo at the venetian we had such a great time at the tropicana we cancelled the venetian and returned here rooms were fantastic many thanks to GERRARD on front desk who was great allways on hand to help what a star. Pool was not quite finished but lovely anyway will be fantastic when it is. Had such a great time hope to return next year

Reviews.Title: “This is a review on the Tropicana casino”
Reviews.Author: htc001
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana casino has the worst customer service. They only have one guy servicing the slot machines. Most of their machines are so ancient that they kept rejecting tickets. One of them would not spit out my ticket so I had to push the red 'help' button for service. Waited and looked around for at least 15 minutes, but no one came by to help. I had to use my cell phone to call their main line to get some help. They were barking questions at me rudely. One guy finally came over, but then he took off for a very long time to get me my money. If you come to this casino, good luck to you. Be prepared to wait a long time if something goes wrong with their slot machine.

Reviews.Title: “We got Vegas'd!!!!! This place was awesome!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Longshoregirl
Reviews.Content: First and foremost...the pool was where it's at! Wendy and ESPECIALLY RACHEL, made our pool party kick'n! Rachel and Wendy know exactly what superior customer service means. Our drinks were never empty and they made our group and the birthday boy feel like a king! Seriously though, can't say enough about Rachel, she knew where to guide us for a good time on the town and always had a smile and a great attitude. She’s a keeper! The beds were soft and the sheets were smooth and inviting. I hate scratchy sheets and that can be a deal breaker for me. The clock radio even had a port for my ipod! How freak'n cool is that?!!!! No smell of smoke...the air felt clean and fresh. Perfectly located next to the Ex, NY NY and the MGM...which has the Tram... we took the train down to the Hilton for some tasty Benihana! A must! We can't wait to go back! New Years here we come!...and the hubby's birthday in Mach! Thank you Tropicana family for making our stay memorable. Well done. Cheers from the O'Neill’s! ps: can't wait for your pool side rooms to be complete...now that would be some fun during the summer months!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great deal (with some caveats)”
Reviews.Author: Bob2222
Reviews.Content: This was my 20th or so trip to Las Vegas. This time I stayed at the Tropicana from Oct 16 through Oct 19. The price was excellent (part of an Expedia fly-hotel package). The check-in was fast and the clerk was polite and friendly (as were all of the employees I ran across). I had to sign a waiver which stated that there was a $9.99 daily 'resort' fee (which I already knew about) and that I would have to pay for any damaged and 'missing' (i.e. stolen) items from the room. I haven't seen that waiver for years, and only in those hotels in my student years which were, how should I say, 'budget' hotels in the Tenderloin district. We last stayed at the Trop approximately 10 years ago, and our room at the time was in a 3 story '60s type motel near the pool. It was quite basic and badly in need of refurbishing. This time, we stayed at their advertised 'best-in-class' room in the Island tower. I assume it’s called the island tower since it's approximately a long city block away from the check-in counter. You walk through the casino, past the pool (shortened by at least half due to construction) and the aforementioned motel rooms, past their convention area. Fortunately, there are water stops (cleverly disguised as restaurants) about half way along the trek. This tower is not for anyone who has difficulty in walking. Try to get a room in their other tower, the Paradise Tower, which is only 30 or so feet away from the registration area. As far as I could tell, the rooms in either tower were identical. The room itself was tastefully done with modern conveniences such as a LED flat panel TV and an alarm clock with IPOD and other MP3 player access. Mine was on the 6th floor with a view of the airport and employee parking lot (which I was told I couldn't use; that would have shortened my walk approximately 90%). The windows were covered by wooden louvers which unfortunately failed to block the light from the powerful spotlights which illuminated the towers. Fortunately, I was able to cover my head with one of the many pillows provided on the bed itself, thus blocking out most of the light. The room was very quiet (it was a long way from the main area, remember). The $9.99 daily resort fee included Internet access, fitness room (which I didn't use) and 2 for 1 cocktails (not too useful if you're a teetotaler) as well as a boarding pass printout. To their credit, management had previously stated on their web site and Expedia that this daily charge will be assessed. Unfortunately, the charge had mushroomed to $11.90 per day on my bill, which I assumed was from taxes and did not need to be stated in advance. I will refrain from proselytizing on my opinions of resort charges since this is a family web site. Just be aware that some (fewer and fewer) unrepentant hotels still impose this charge. There now is a $10.80 weekend hot breakfast buffet available in one of the watering stops (Bacio Pasta). Unfortunately, it is only available on the weekends. On balance, I strongly recommend you take advantage of these rates during the reconstruction.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and would for sure return again to this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Bgladiator99
Reviews.Content: We had found a cheaper rate on another website and they matched it. We stayed a total of two days and were extremely happy. The rooms had just been redone recently and still looked new. The kids loved the pool. Only negative was the walk through the casino to get to the pool and the hot tub jets did not work very well.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas hospitality second to none”
Reviews.Author: jcframar
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler to Las Vegas [ 4 to 5 times a year], And having stayed at all strip hotels, I have to say the service and hospitality at Tropicana was the best i have ever experienced. From the doormen to maid service. A very special thank you to the front desk. It goes without saying that this will be my new home away from home when i travel to Las Vegas. I strongly recommend this resort , You wont regret a moment. Thank you Tropicana. See you in January.

Reviews.Title: “disaster”
Reviews.Author: zonie0531
Reviews.Content: I was not impressed at all. Everywhere you look it says we are changing everything. 1. Air conditioning was not working, rooms were hot. 2. The t.v. was not working, 3. 2 different technicians were in the room for the air and t.v. still could not get them going. 4. Room did not have wash clothes. Called housekeeping, took 45 minutes and 3 calls to get them to the room. 5. Paid for room in advance, was placed in the Island tower, worse view and lights and night shown into the room which was distracting. 5. Had the breakast buffet. 9.99 a person. Food was cold, below average. 6. Has dinner at the steak House. Overpriced and again very average, nothing special. 8.00 extra for a baked potatoe? 7. Hidden charges, got hit with additional 23.00 for a resort tax/fee.

Reviews.Title: “Best sleep ever...boring outside of the bed.”
Reviews.Author: Traynor80
Reviews.Content: Holiday had a bad start to it as my luggage was lost by DELTA. So i wasn't in the best of moods to begin with. I would completely agree with KBARNES review. As it stands... the resort itself is quite boring due to key points: 1.Brad Garrett comedy club... No brad garrett..( left with Bruce Baum...not funny at all) 2. No life in casino floor at all 3. Bars have no atmosphere (crucial to the sucess of any bar...anywhere) 4. pool area not done It is understandable how hard it is to compete with the super casinos on the strip so i think with the changes (i.e. nikki beach) there may hold hope for the tropicana... nikki beach will instill life into the resort. I do think the general casino area should be redone. i dont think the white walls work its not a comfortable gaming colour. On the upside... i was considering squuzing every last pillow into my suitcase... unbelievable pillows and bed over all... the rooms are really nice. i stayed in the mirage before it had renov. work done in the rooms. and the tropicana's rooms are better. fantastic value on the rooms... Also check out the eggs or sandwiches in the south beach deli... fantastic... Overall i was only looking for a nice room as i didn't plan on staying there other than to sleep (guns to fire, celeb birthday parties to go to). So essentially this was great for us. location is a bit out there however you do have mgm and new york close by. So, definite thumbs up for the rooms and the future of the pool area. location isn't THAT much of a burdon but unfortunately it is the casino area (gaming and bars) that let the tropicana down massively. Staff great. Thanks to Nicole for booking my stay. I do not regret it. i would like to know where you got them pillows from :)

Reviews.Title: “The power of Tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: geomon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a couple of nights at the Trop on our way back from a trip to California. I booked this property because of the many good reviews on TA. I noticed that on the very few bad reviews a representative from the hotel had given very clear and timely responses. I sent a nice e-mail to the resoponder telling her how much I appreciated their customer care and her well chosen words. Well, when we arrived we got the VIP treatment from the first minute. Express check-in and a big corner suit with a killer view right up the strip. Our brand new suit was really top notch with big screens in every room and more square footage than our first little house! Had a wonderful time and the folks at the new Trop couldn't have been nicer. I guess that old saying "You can catch more flies with sugar than with vinegar" really is true!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: kbarnes26
Reviews.Content: I normally swear by the reviews I read on Trip Advisor and was excited to stay at The Tropicana. My husband and I went with another couple as they were renewing their vows after 10 years of marriage. The Tropicana seems very understated and not true "Vegas" to me. I have stayed in the larger hotels like MGM and wanted to stay in a smaller place but this was too small and plain. The rooms are all new and the beds incredibly comfortable like all of the reviews say. Our bathroom had old, dated tile and was just very basic. The ceilings are low and the hallway decor mundane. We were in the Paradise Tower. From what I understand from other guests I spoke to the other tower is much nicer and more luxurious. Even the front desk just seemed basic and plain to me. My bathroom glasses were not cleaned or replaced in 3 of the days we were there and pretty much the only thing the cleaning staff did each day to the room was make the bed and replace the towels. If you left clothes on the floor they stayed right there. I will say most of the hotel staff is very nice and accommodating. The bell hops are all friendly and very hard working! The table area of the casinos is very small and only 1/2 of the tables are open the entire time I was there which was Thursday - Monday of Columbus Day w/e. The bar in the casino is way too quiet ~ no entertainment ~ and boring and a couple of the bartenders were as slow as could be! Many of the other people staying in the hotel are 60+. The pool was nice and I'm sure will be GORGEOUS once the construction is done. If you are young and going to Vegas to party Vegas-style and/or looking for an above average hotel I would recommend staying some place else. If you are looking for a new room with comfortable bed in a quiet hotel than this is for you. I would pay the extra money to stay elsewhere next time. I'd also prefer a hotel that is more centrally located on the strip rather than all the way at then end.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Tropicana!”
Reviews.Author: PomegranateMan
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana is doing it's remodel right. We checked in on a Saturday afternoon 2PM. Got to a registration clerk within 2 minutes. Requested a room with a view of the garden/ pool area and also quiet. She got us a room in the back tower (Garden Tower?). Very nice renovated room on corner (so a little bigger). Very comfortable bed, well setup room with nice flatscreen tv, desk, sitting area. Of course it being Vegas we never turned on the TV. Room clean, Even staying at the back corner of the back Tower we were within a few minutes of the strip. (I hate the hotels that route you all around the casino and make it as hard as possible to get to the strip). All the staff we met were very helpful and friendly, even an old dumpy couple like us were treated as true guests. Thanks! Pool and garden area still in middle of renovation. But the 2/3 of the area open was great. As I am always the first up I enjoyed having the garden area to walk in while enjoying a cup of coffee. I hope the Nikki Beach club area has some tables open in the am for us early birds when it opens. I only ate breakfast there. It was a smaller buffet but fresh and tasty ($9 I think). Only gripe was it was not open the next morning (a Monday). Only a small coffee house with starbuck type fare. The "Biscayne Steak house" looked inviting (was running a special for a 4 course tasing menu). Maybe try it next time. There definitely will be a next time, great location, great service. If they keep that as they finish the renovation this will be a hotel on my short list. You sat in lounge Saturday night and enjoyed a nitecap and listened to a Jazz group (Dave Perrico group). Nice comfortable lounge. Only Negative: The buffet was not open the next morning (a Monday). Only a small coffee house with starbuck type fare. Also be aware that work is still being done and may impact your visit. (Although staff seems very interested in making your stay great) I am interested in seeing how the renovation of the rooms around the pool garden area go. A staff person I was chatting with gave me a description of these. Should be plush with a patio on the garden. Sounds very cool.

Reviews.Title: “The best vacation in Las vegas we have ever had.”
Reviews.Author: glw6306
Reviews.Content: The newly remodeled rooms are great. The Casino was bright and freindly. The gaming people were very freindly and personable. The Tropicana has gone the right way in it's remodel. We ate at the Biscayne Steak*Sea*Wine and will return to it on our next trip to Tropicana. We would like to have 2 chairs in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Wedding.”
Reviews.Author: Sarah S
Reviews.Content: The place has recently (and currently) gone through a major renovation and is crisp, clean and beautiful. We had our wedding at the Tropicana and the catering staff was accommodating, helpful and extremely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: geoffndi
Reviews.Content: The customer service at the Tropicana is top notch. From the Bell Man and housekeepers, to the Front Desk and floor personell, everyone had a smile and went above and beyond to make sure our needs were attended too. There was always someone cleaning the front glass doors, and another staff member or two to open the doors and greet you. Our room was comfortable overall, but the bed was luxurious. I usually don't sleep well if not in my own bed, but this bed was incredible, no difficulties sleeping at all. I will definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the new renovations!”
Reviews.Author: vegas201086
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Tropicana in Las Vegas for the past 5 years and recently had the pleasure of staying at the hotel in the newly renovated tower. What a difference! The rooms were clean and very modern. The hotel has added new restaurants which rival the best in town at reasonable rates. One other thing I had noticed with this trip is that each of the hotel staff we came in contact with were dedicated to ensuring our stay at the hotel was above and beyond our expectations. As always the pool area is amazing (which is why we chose this hotel each year).

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Go Back”
Reviews.Author: DebsterBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights from Oct 6th to Oct 11th. Everything was so much better than I expected. We were in a remodelled room in the Paradise Tower and had somewhat of a strip view, but largely of MGM and down to Hooters. The room was clean and functional and the bed and pillows were super comfortable - this can make or break a stay in my opinion. I love the clean and bright feel of the casino. I'm a smoker but hate the smoke haze in many casinos and The Tropicana's ventilation system does an excellent job. The staff were amazingly courteous and polite. All of them had the time to talk to you and treat you as someone special. We took the time to go to The Mob Experience preview and I have to say it sounds as if it will be great entertainment for a reasonable price. Such a shame it wasn't open when we were there. Still, it will be something to look forward to when we inevitably return. We didn't try Biscayne and Baccio was closed on the Sunday we were going to try it, but both restaurants were busy and people seemed to be having a great time. South Beach Cafe is adequate. The staff are great, the food average. All in all a great stay and would recommed it to anyone. We spent the last 2 nights of our trip mid-Strip in a Paris remodelled room and found out what is was like to be treated as a number rather than people who had spent a lot of money just to get to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: cjrede
Reviews.Content: We had stayed there before, and were amazed how much they had done to improve it. The room was wonderful, convenient, and the service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Luxury for a Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: MrsTirrell
Reviews.Content: Tropicana Las Vegas is newly remodeled and fabulous! We typically stay at the one in Atlantic City NJ near our home (we learned in Vegas that they are no longer affiliated) and we were pleasantly surprised. Free parking and on the strip, close to NY NY and MGM. Walking distance of all the popular casinos. We checked in early to our strip view room. It was on the inexpensive side but everything was brand new and luxurious! It smelled so good in there we even asked the front desk what scent they use in their hotel! The bed had a down comforter and the room had a flat screen tv and ipod dock. The view was awesome. The bathroom was spacious and had the toilet in a private area. Vending machines were located on every level. The casino was great for us. We aren't huge gamblers but we enjoy playing the slot machines for a night and there was a large selection and great beverage service. EVERYONE at this hotel was beyond polite. The front desk treated us like gold! If I ever go back to Vegas we will be staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Heather_Laflamme
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at the Tropicana in September for 4 days. It was great. The staff were all very helpful and the rooms were clean. I loved their bath products and their pool was fabulous. There was some early morning renovation noise on the monday morning of our stay, but nothing crazy. The weekend nights were great and they allowed us to have a late check out free of charge. All in all, I think it's a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Wait for the remodeling to be complete”
Reviews.Author: abfla
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana is in the midst of a remodel project (10/10) and large portions of the casino and shops are closed off. It also appears that they are just doing a partial renovation. For example when we first entered our room it looked really nice, however upon closer inspection, the bathroom tile needed to be but wasn't replaced, the tub was old and they just added a new vanity and called it remodeled. They also did not honor a late check out that was part of a package I bought through another travel website. I asked repeatedly and very nicely for them to honor it and they flat out refused. That was disappointing. For that reason alone, I won't stay there again. Just remembered, the brunch at the Biscayne was very lame, the eggs were not good and there was just a limited and tasteless selection.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfaction Guaranteed !!”
Reviews.Author: KevinandKelly
Reviews.Content: Well were do i start . When we checked in, we started talking to the check in person Wendy , she had asked if we were there for any special occasion , we had let her know that we were celebrating our 25th anniversary . Wendy called over the manager and asked if she could give us " this room ,"" the manager wanted her to double check to make sure no one was booked into that room when we were there (Oct.4-7,2010) . Wendy had said no one was booked in , so the manager said "sure give them that room ". Well when we walked into our room we were in awe ! We were placed on the 18th floor corner suite , and it was new and had alot of room . We were in a corner room which overlooked the strip , kiddy corner to NY NY right across from MGM and we could see right down the strip , it was beautiful ! We then walked into our bedroom and the wow factor kicked in again as we were right across the street from Excalibur and could see the Luxur and Mandalay Bay , and the mountains were also in sight ! The room had two 42 inch flat screen tv's , a couch , a lounging chair , fridge , safe ,complimentary umbrellas , not that we needed them but a very nice touch . The bathroom had alot of room and was decorated very nice . So we go out that night to Freemont street and when we get back to our room which was around midnight , we walk into our room and to our surprise we noticed two mini bottles of champagne on ice , chocolate covered strawberries , and a fruit basket , with a note that said Congratulations Kevin and Kelly _ _ _ _ _ _ _ , from your check in girl Wendy !! We were so amazed by the service we recieved . Thank you so much Wendy , you are the best !! We had spent time at other hotels and we will definatley stay at the Tropicana again , it doesn't take long to get to were you want to go , the pool was awsome clean ,warm , great music , comfortable loungers , it was a great time !

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect! - Modern, clean, contemporary”
Reviews.Author: caandmick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Tropicana for 6 nights. The check in was fast and friendly. The room in the Island Tower had been refurbished. It had a bright, clean, modern contemporary feel. The bed was really comfortable. Staff were always friendly and polite. The pool area, although undergoing building work (behind a screened off area) was excellent. We were really pleased with our choice and would definitely go back again. So on the whole - location, hotel, staff and room - all perfect.

Reviews.Title: “This remodel is wonderful! Amazing Pool Area!!”
Reviews.Author: pipercub56
Reviews.Content: I was so pleasantly surprised in the remodel at the Tropicana! The room was absolutely beautiful. We had a great view of the pool area and also spectacular view of the MGM Grand, New York-New York, and Excalibur hotel on the strip. We spent an entire day at the pool. The pool area was clean. The pool was very clear and clean, and perfect temperature! The one and only negative that we had was with the remodeling going on we had to haul all of our bags through the front door of the hotel and drag, which was very inconvenient and frustrating! Once we saw the room and our view it made things less frustrating!! Great value! Great hotel! Would recommend without hestitation!!

Reviews.Title: “Best View in Vegas - and the Best Value to boot!!”
Reviews.Author: MaxDan
Reviews.Content: Though at the end of the strip, the newly remodeled corner suites at the Tropicana were well worth the walk to get to the action! Well appointed and nicely furnished with room to dance, play and well, have fun! Large flat screen televisions in each room were wonderful, though we spent most of our time looking out the windows at the best view in Vegas! From left to right, the castles of Ex, a bit to the right, the mountains/sunset, pan a bit more to the right to watch the roller coaster and view the Statue of Liberty, a bit more to view straight down the strip, a bit more to enjoy the fountains and the large bronze lion, a bit more for a beautiful sunrise... And that is just from the living room! Though fairly limited, the room service was great with a very friendly staff and not too bad with the pricing either! Be sure to ask for a carafe of coffee as it's not listed on the menu. We look forward to the newly remodeled pool area and The Mob Experience, both are to open in 2011. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Fun Fun!”
Reviews.Author: nakafam
Reviews.Content: I loved the changes Tropicana made to the decor and the rooms. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. As far as location....we were able to walk with ease to visit the other hotels in the area. We met our casino host, Joe Phillips, who set our trip up and thought he was GREAT, so nice and personable. We're planning on returning to the Tropicana in November for a 21st birthday celebration. Thank you Joe and the Tropicana!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: shooter37
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights in October and the stay there was great. We had a newly renovated suite in the Paradise Tower and it was terrific. The hotel is still going through renovation, so the amenities are limited, but once they are completed this is going to be a great hotel. We had dinner at the Biscayne and the food was very good. Also saw Brad Garrett at the comedy club. I did like the casino because it is smaller than others. Go to MGM, you will get lost in their casino. Overall the stay was great and staff was friendly. We may have to book another trip next year just to see the completed NIKI beach and the other renovations.

Reviews.Title: “You have to wait to score the Trop until all remodeling is done”
Reviews.Author: AZ-Traveler85253
Reviews.Content: This was about my 60th trip to Vegas and my first to the Trop since the late 80s. Since my casino host offered for us to preview the changes on him, I couldn't resist. My problem in reviewing the hotel is that it really has a way to go to be completely remodeled. I recognize that, so I won't be too hard on them, nor will I pick them apart. The rooms were remodeled and I had a great corner suite overlooking the strip. Problem is that there are so many sirens throughout the night, you almost think you are sleeping (when you can) next to a fire station. Oh...you are...well that and an ambulance station too. The sitting/living room is huge! The bedroom is also a good size, but I hated that the bed was literally two steps from the bathroom door. The remodeled bathroom was not as nice as I thought it would be. Seems like they cut costs on showers and toilets....nothing special at all. Not sure I dig the tiki motif; sort of bland for me. Service was very good (dealers, front, other staff). Pool was nice, but there were no tables to eat lunch at. We had to sit on lounge chairs in our clothes. I understand they are opening a Nikki's Beach there...so that should be amazing. Casino is small....6:5 on blackjack is the worst. No poker or sports betting yet. The 24 hour deli is too small to deal with any kinds of crowds and there is no buffet. Biscayne was excellent and I did not get to try the Italian place. Brad Garrett bought the comedy shop and it was about half full. On a side note...haven't actually walked the strip in about 10 years (walked to Planet Hollywood for show), and if it is another 10 years before I do it again, I won't be sad. Streets are filthy, drunk people everyone spilling beer on you everywhere, and assaulted by no fewer than 20+ people banging pamphlets of naked women in my face. Really? Walking with my wife? The cards and pamphlets are everywhere on the street...a shame for what was once an exciting walk. I will evaluate it again when everything opens and the Trop reinvents itself next year. Loved my casino host...but right now I give it a C and will wait to see what happens with all the coming changes.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay at the Classy Troicana”
Reviews.Author: mtn-iowa
Reviews.Content: Though I've been to Vegas before, this was my first stay at the Tropicana. I would highly recommend this newly renovated and classy hotel/casino to anyone! We had a beautiful room in Paradise Tower on the 2nd floor - very clean and we loved the color scheme. Also loved the shuttered windows, which allowed us to let in varied amounts of light. Housekeeping staff were very friendly and did an outstanding job! Tropicana's entrance is elegant and makes a beautiful first impression. The double set of glass doors is always clean and friendly staff are at-the-ready to welcome and get the doors for guests. Unlike many other hotels which are jammed with noisy slot machines from the front door inward, Tropicana has its beautiful gaming tables up front under a breathtaking stained glass ceiling. Slots are off to the side and spaced to allow room to manuever, which was a definite plus. The entrance and check-in areas are elegant, and lend an impression of class, not clutter. We were out and about in the evenings, but had lunch and a few early dinners at the South Beach Deli at Tropicana. The food was excellent - freshest sandwiches and salads we've had anywhere, and delicious french fries! The fresh breads and ingredients made these sandwiches and salads/fries a much better choice than some of the buffets and other dinner deals in Vegas - highly recommended! The portions were huge, so you won't go hungry after eating at South Beach. We couldn't finish all our food, but it was absolutely delicious! South Beach also offers morning coffee for a comparable price to other places, and refills are free. The pool at Tropicana is truly a gem - gorgeous, well-maintained grounds with plenty of pool deck space and elegant cabanas! One truly has the experience of being in a secluded resort while swimming and relaxing. Pool staff were very friendlyand welcoming, and wait staff there did an excellent job. The woman who served us at check-in was not friendly and, had we allowed this first impression of staff to influence our stay, it would not have been pleasant. However, all other staff truly made up for her rudeness, and left us with a great overall impression of Tropicana staff. Our only real complaint was the resort fee, which was not mentioned in our package. Our travel package clearly stated "all taxes and fees included." This is something which needs to be corrected, as most people want to know the bottom line when booking a hotel stay. We had a fabulous stay at the classy Tropicana, and would recommend it to anyone. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning remodel: The Trop is worth a fresh look”
Reviews.Author: DonInConnecticut
Reviews.Content: Outstanding deal. My advice: Visit now. The Tropicana's renovation is truly making the place altogether fresh, and it's sort of going counter to the recent Vegas trend. Many Strip hotels have been "de-theming" themselves for several years, and now a lot of them are getting a homogenized, chain-hotel atmosphere. One looks a lot like the other. Not the Trop: This place is aiming for unique. The casino is glistening white, utterly unlike anything else on the Strip. The hotel is a South Beach theme with lots of bamboo-style decor and wicker, plenty of whites and creams and soft colors throughout the building. It's both attractive and distinctive. The Paradise Tower is freshly remodeled, and - at least for now - the rates are a remarkable bargain. The scale of this property seems to work nicely; I didn't see the massive registration lines that are common in bigger hotels, and the casino and grounds all have a "manageable" feel - big enough to be interesting, but not so large that you can get lost. Nicole Marshall, who responds to many postings here, is serious about providing customer service. The staff throughout the hotel is notable for friendliness & concern for the guests; Barbara at check-in went out of her way to be sure I knew about the hotel's amenities, the dining options, etc. You could get the same information at a lot of hotels, but it would be a rushed, mechanical speech - with Barbara, I got the sense that she sincerely wanted my stay to be enjoyable. Several other employees provided that same feeling, and I never encountered anyone who appeared bored with the job or impatient with a guest. The location is way south on the Strip, but the MGM's monorail station isn't far ... and the walk to the center Strip from the Tropicana is both safe and interesting. (Unlike the Strip's northern end, which is neither). The pool area is extraordinary; the pool and main hot tub are both attractively designed, and the landscaping is gorgeous. Many Strip hotels, even a couple of the 5-star properties, provide nothing more than a rectangular pool surrounded by concerete; the Tropicana's is an entire experience. I'll hope it doesn't get too popular after the remodeling; at least as of October 2010, though, it's the pefect mix of lively but not overbearing. For long-time Vegas fans, this is a property you've got to see again. If your memory is about the Trop of the past 20 years, you'll be thinking of a once-terrific place that is long past its glory days (similar to the Sahara or the Riviera). But that's last year's news; this remodel is much more than just paint and carpet, and the Tropicana of 2010 is unlike anything before. My hope is that it doesn't become too trendy in the next year or two; for right now, I doubt you can get a better mix of quality and reasonable price anywhere in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel to stay in”
Reviews.Author: 4freemind
Reviews.Content: Everything was great. Great service, great attractions. Pool was unbelievable. They had pool parties that I liked a lot. They upgraded me to a better room. We enjoyed staying in this hotel. It was inexpensive and worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the value”
Reviews.Author: peteanddonna
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights recently. Had a room in Paradise Tower. Very nice and very clean. Hotel treated us very well. Casino was well lit and clean. Halls were well lit. Just walk out of hotel and cross overhead walkway to Excalibur and tram to Luxor and Mandalay Bay or use other walkway to MGM. Great location with strip bus to Freemont St stopping right outside hotel. Stop the other way from downtown at the Excalibur. Would stay here again in a heartbeat. In fact, we have stayed here before and been pleased with our stay every time. Hotel is going through a major renovation of some rooms and we consider it to be a higher star rating than most travel sites show.

Reviews.Title: “Great new fresh feel with clean comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: L_K1509
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tropicana for one night after staying at the Venetian. We decided at the last min to stay one extra night in Vegas before two weeks touring the States. We has stayed in theTropicana last year and thought it was great value $30 a night! however it was tried but didn't bother us. This year the price has gone up slightly abd the makeover is great. The casino is bright, clean and the rooms look modern. The room we had was in the paradise tower. The bathroom was a good size. We were given free drinks when we said we were on our honeymoon, however you can get free drinks by using the 1cent machine in the casino (plus any of the casinos on the strip) for the price of a tip. Parking is free and self parking. The swimming pool is great, the best we see. There is music playing giving it a real holiday feel. Its not just square but a nice pleasent shape. We had a nice afternoon with family in the pool drinking iced fruit drinks from the outside bar. (They sell alcohol as well, however can't understand why people drink alcohol while swimming) We ate in the hotel cafe, South beach deli. Its pricey but the food is fresh and portions large.

Reviews.Title: “Trop comes through with great meeting and fun!”
Reviews.Author: Kizchris
Reviews.Content: This is my second review of the Trop this year - last one was several months ago and they are just getting better. The place is looking sharp but above that, the staff really does have a caring "can-do" attitude. Was there this past week for a meeting and had a great time! Room was great - newly remodeled and super comfortable bed. The casino has been updated with still some more construction under way...The construction is not obstrusive to the fun. There still seems to be lots to do. They are currently tearing down the motel structure on the east side of the property to make way for a beach club. Again not really affecting my stay, although when walking back to the convention area you can see the bulldozers and dirt. Another successful Tropicana stay - will go again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Clean and Comfortable Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Cherryg
Reviews.Content: Just returned on Oct. 6 from a 5 day stay at the newly renovated Tropicana. We breezed through check-in around 1:30 pm and our large room overlooked the strip. One of the most comfortable beds we've slept in. There were lots of plush towels in the bathroom and I was happy to see that in the cloest there was an electrical outlet to plug in the iron. Silly, but that impressed me! Also the size of the bathroom was impressive. The staff I encountered were all polite and helpful. We only ate at the snack bar type restaurant and the food there was very good and had huge portions. One night we were so tired, we split a sandwich and still had leftovers. We had fun in the casino and didn't find it crowded. Good for the guest, not for the hotel I guess. The pool area is very nice, extremely clean and again the staff around the pool very friendly. If I had to complain about something it would be the too loud music around the pool. But that is an age related thing (I'm 55, he's 66). I'm more Barry Manilow, and the music was more aimed at the younger party crowd. We did find that at night the room didn't get quite as dark as we would have liked, but that was a minor thing. We slept like babies once we got to sleep. This was our 15th Vegas vacation, but first time staying at the Trop. We would definately stay there again and recommend it to the travellers who like us, prefer a smaller hotel, instead of the huge Vegas strip ones. Also, I had emailed ahead to request an early check-in and was very pleased to receive a quick email reply.

Reviews.Title: “Had A Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Giggreen8
Reviews.Content: The renovations at the hotel are about half done. I stayed in the front tower in a newly renovated room and it was beautiful. I have stayed at some of the larger hotels in Vegas which means lots of walking just inside the resort. The Tropicana is not too big and not too small, just right. The pool still has work going on at it, but as soon as it is done it will be very nice. I'll be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL - GREAT MAKEOVER!”
Reviews.Author: ambroa
Reviews.Content: I live in Las Vegas and recently booked Tropicana for my son's birthday party (hockey game at MGM so very convenient!) - I was amazed at the transformation of the hotel and the amount of upgrades that were done! The rooms were fantastic and roomy with everything that we needed! Kids had a blast in the pool while we sat at a cabana chilling out!! Service from the valet to the front desk was amazing! I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool, Nice Rooms, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: africal0ver
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our recent stay at the Tropicana. It is a small hotel by the standards of many on the strip, but it made getting from one place to another so easy. I LOVED the pool We say right at the edge of the pool in very comfy lounge chairs. The sound of the waterfall drowned out any city noise. It was great. The rooms are new and fresh as they have recently remodeled all of them. The gaming area is small, but everyone was very friendly and it was a nice change from the huge impersonal casinos around. The location is great with MGM, and New York, New York right across the street. I would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value, great location, very comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: sosdrive
Reviews.Content: We stayed for (only) 2 nights in mid- August. It was busy, but we did not feel overcrowded inside the hotel. The pool area was lovely, with very helpful and polite staff. The room was amazingly good value, easily 4 star and very comfortable beds. The only downside of the experience was that the hotel was under refurbishment in the main reception area, and it was initially difficult to work out where the room was within the large complex.

Reviews.Title: “Great Entertainment”
Reviews.Author: ERADonna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tropicana for two nights. The new rooms look great and are very comfortable. The casino has a very nice new look also. We were pleasantly suprised with the free entertainment, T Fox was outstanding, have not had that much fun in a long time. We were upset that they did not have their buffet anymore, but we were informed that in a few weeks they will have a new 24 hour cafe with buffet, that means we will have to go back and try that.

Reviews.Title: “HOPE THE HOTEL IS AS GOOD AS THE COMMUNICATION”
Reviews.Author: MRENTERTAINMENT
Reviews.Content: I have travelled may times to Las Vegas and stayed in many of the hotels so I think I can safely say the communication at the Tropicana is outstanding. we have recently booked a fantastic deal via the Thomas Cook website to fly out on 18th October for ten nights. The Tropicana is undergoing a major refurbishment so I contacted them to see what if any impact it would have on our stay and to ask for a room with a view of the strip, Nicole Marshall guest Experience Manager at the Tropicana has been fantastic responding to us via email on numerous occasions to ensure our vacation goes with out a hitch. If the Hotel is as good as the Communication and service from guest relations WE ARE IN FOR A FANTASTIC HOLIDAY !

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: starg8r
Reviews.Content: Positives: On the strip. Negatives: (1) The large screen television was on the dresser next to a stand for another television. When I turned on the TV, it didn't work. I called down and was told an engineer would be "right up". An hour later, a very friendly engineer came in and explained that the hotel ran out of plasma televisions, so the rest of the room just had flat screens. And those new TVs didn't work all the time. Fortunately, it was an easy fix. About 45 minutes into watching television, it turned off by itself. I knew the problem and fixed it this time myself. (2) The room only has shutters over its window (probably to keep with the tropical theme). However, at night, with the lights of the building shining up the sides of the tower, the room is very bright even with the shutters closed. You can get up and move around without a problem in the middle of the night and see everything in the room. If you are a light-sleeper (like myself), this is an issue.
