I was facing east, so when the sun came up in the morning, the room was lit up like a spot light! (3) The windows were in dire need of cleaning. Otherwise, not a bad room for one night in Vegas. If I go to this event again next year (I was there for a hockey game), I will most likely splurge and stay somewhere else. If you are short on cash and want to stay on the strip, this isn't a bad hotel. It's comperable to a Super 8 hotel or any other average hotel, room-wise. The room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was decent sized with a large bathtub. The room came with a safe, but no mini-bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience! Love the hotel! :)”
Reviews.Author: CaitandJust
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tropicana and absolutely loved it! The rooms are beautiful and spacious, the pool and outside area are gorgeous! I love that the Casino is a bit smaller than most and not too crowded yet has a really fun, lively vibe. The Location of the Hotel is ABSOLUTELY perfect!! We were right in the middle of all the action and we were able to easily walk the strip and see all the sites! All in all, a GREAT experience!! :) We will definitely be coming back soon! :)

Reviews.Title: “fab fab fab”
Reviews.Author: shelly5029
Reviews.Content: stayed in the trop for a week it was wonderful the room was very stylish and modern better than i expected , the hotel remodeling is going well with everything bright and very new , the pool is excellant plenty of sun beds for everyone, nd in landscaped gardens so you can sit in shade when it gets too hot , i liked everything about this hotel its in a good location with mgm new york new youk and exczliber within a few mins walk will defenitaly be back again and again

Reviews.Title: “Heard it was a dump originally, and now staff there are very proud of it”
Reviews.Author: PMM04
Reviews.Content: Got a deal with bookit.com. Was skeptical about the hotel as we heard it was old and was still being renovated. The room was very spacious and clean. Our maid(s) made the bed and replaced towels and tolietries, but for some reason the floor in the bathroom didn't seem to be mopped the entire 5 days we were there - but only irritant. The staff at the front desk, security, and concierge and bell hop were very couteous and helpful. So much so, that when we ask one of the security guards for directions to the pool he kindly gave us a tour and a couple of options on how to get there. The casino being at street level was small but brightly lit because of natural light. The pool was nice, but the day we used the pool it was half utilized while the other half was for some event, so it was crowded. The hotel is situated across from Excalbur, MGM and New York New York, which is the south most end of the strip. Being at the south end was great for shopping at the Las Vegas Outlet Center and Town Centre shopping - only a very short bus ride away on wither the Gold or Deuce line. Like anywhere in Vegas on the strip, be prepared to walk and bring comfy shoes. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and even go back there.

Reviews.Title: “The Tropicana was a wonderful surprise!”
Reviews.Author: cavecv
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to book a room at an older Vegas hotel after a nightmare stay at the Sahara earlier this year, but the reviews convinced me to give it a try. What a wonderful surprise! The hotel was fabulous. Our room in the Island Tower was beautiful and very clean and comfortable. The pool was gorgeous and every staff member we encountered was very friendly. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone going to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “great renovations to hotel”
Reviews.Author: pokerbabe0717
Reviews.Content: This is an long established hotel that has been refurbished in a very nice South Beach decor. Still ongoing renovations, but rooms are very nice, clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: Mom160
Reviews.Content: Having been in the travel business for the last 25+ years, I was leary about staying at the "Older Tropicana". But after reading all the Trip Advisor revieiws, I thought we would give it a try. What convinced me to stay was that Ms. Nicole Marshall responded to almost every comment posted, regardless of whether or not it was positive or negative. All I can say is that our stay was WONDERFUL! Nice sized rooms have been tastefully renovated (beds super comfy), beautiful 42" LCD TV's, great pool, (enough sun and shade, comfy chairs with pads, & free water with lemon/lime or cucumber), music, great for young and old! Improvements still to come. Staff is very friendly and helpful! Duece bus stop ($7.00 for a 24 hr. pass) directly in fromt of hotel. If you want the express GO bus (also included in the 24 hr. pass), it's just a short walk in front of the MGM which is next door. Monorail ($12.00 24 hr pass) is also next door at the MGM. Across from Ex Calibur, New York New York...Luxor & Mandalay Bay close by. Without a doubt, I would have NO reservations recommending or staying at the Trop again! Reasonable rates, easily accessible, new and clean rooms, friendly staff, bright casino, and short walk to elevators to get to your room. My only negative comment was that they need a buffet to entice people to stay a little longer. Not to worry, combination buffet along with short menu restaurant (sandwiches, salads, etc.) opening soon! Nikki Beach opening in April 2011! I would definately stay again and thank everyone at the Tropicana for making out stay sooo nice. Hopefully we'll see you again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Construction spoiled the fun”
Reviews.Author: Posers
Reviews.Content: Recent remodeling almost ruined our vacation at Tropicana. We stayed there September 19-23 Seems that resort will be wonderful after the remodeling will be finished in Spring 2011..until then...not so much. The pool time was very challenging. Let me guess if you are visiting Vegas in Fall, you probably are coming from cooler states and want to prolong your summer - lay in the sun by the pool, get some tan and swim. Well, that was pretty difficult because the pool was half closed for all 5 days we stayed there. Lots of work was done, we saw lots of construction workers walk around, construction fence separates the pool from other (possibly more pools?) areas, the noise sometimes was so loud, we couldn't hear the music at the pool area. Unfortunately if you are an early bird, there is NO sun at the pool area until 10.45am - the hotel building make a big shade that covers entire pools side. A few hotel guests, including us, were trying to find a sunny spot around the pool in the morning ( that was difficult too because the pool is surrounded by the construction fence) but we were kicked from different locations because we were interrupting remodeling. You would think that the hotel would do everything possible to make your stay there less inconvenient? Nope. Actually guests had to do everything possible to have their remodeling going smooth.. You will see lots of workers in the resort and lots of people in suits with clip boards in their hands who are supervising them. Every morning we woke up around 7am to a drilling sound or hammer or something else from remodeling. You will see their motto everywhere' We are changing everything" Yes, they are, indeed, at your expense. The hotel has enough guts to charge you additional $9.99 per day fee even during that inconvenient time! Now, don't get the wrong idea - there is no construction dust. The hotel is actually very clean. It smells good, the room was very sunny and clean. Bed was incredibly soft, linens are higher quality. Nice big TV in the room ( if you went to Vegas to watch TV). Bathroom was spacious, clean with nice big bath tub. Our window was overview the pool and main strip. Room was very quiet, we didn't hear any noise from the strip at night. Food: The have South Beach cafe in the building that open 24/7. It serves decent breakfast for the cost of $7-10. Coffee, pastry, fruits, drinks are at additional cost. OR you can walk to your next door neighbors Hooter hotel, that is literally in 5 minutes walk, and get a buffet brunch at Mad Onion for $9.99. For the same price of one meal in South Beach cafe you can get all you can eat including fruits and pastries. On Sundays you can have brunch with bottomless champagne for $12.99 They have 2 restaurants - Bacio and Biscayne. We didn't go to Bacio but dined at Biscayne. It was ok. Don't plan to get any glass of wine under $12 there. We ordered a prime rib that was $30 and was just OK. Any side dish at that place is for additional cost. ( the Hooters offer prime rib dinner every day for $9.99. We never made it there but would love to hear some feedback on that) The restaurant is meant to be fine dinning but something is missing there. The idea was right but the ambiance just didn't work The hotel doesn't have bar in the gambling area so if you like to sip on your drink and watch people, that won't happen. They have Celebrity Lounge in the corner, nice bar but hardly any people there. One night there was band playing. The music was so loud, we had wait when a song is done before ordering our drinks. Service in the gambling area was incredibly slow. You will finish your game and still won't get your drink. We lost couple of ordered drinks because couldn't wait any longer. The service at the pool was very efficient - we got our drinks very fast and the waitress checked on us regularly if we need anything. Once again, it will be a very nice hotel next spring when remodeling will be done. Looks like they are opening more restaurants and more pool area. As for now THEY ARE CHANGING EVERYTHING and make you part of it Would we recommend this hotel to a friend? Yes, but only after remodeling is done.

Reviews.Title: “almost perfect-ish”
Reviews.Author: WOTME
Reviews.Content: stayed at trop due to very good price we got from lowcostvagas.com, in fact it was almost half the hotel and other sites quoted so i was a bit apprehensive when checking in. they did try to impose the resort fee on us but told them it was a inclusive price what we paid and they forwent the fee.which was the case in fact.,all taxes and fees paid . (i,m in no way involved with lowcostvagas). we had booked the paradise tower for 6 days but were given a room in the island tower,asked why and were told that the paradise was not as good and got the impression that it has not been updated completely,so when to the allocated room which was fabulous but the view was of the air port and along way to walk from the entrance, so we insisted on a room in the paradise tower, and eventually got one (found out paradise tower over booked . rooms are what others have said fantastic, only criticism and other people we spoke to agreed is that there is no coffee /tea making facilities,so you have to go to cafe down stairs which was a inconvenience and wasn't cheep, there is a safe big enough for laptop but no fridge. casino is on small size at the moment and pool not completely finished. overall apart from one member of staff (when checking in)found it a nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for better”
Reviews.Author: Eric4227
Reviews.Content: I was a little leery about staying here given a few things I read about previously. I stayed at the luxor a few days before & moved to the Trop & was IMPRESSED. From the very personal greetings as I walked in, doors were opened for me & the service was unbelievable. And it wasnt perfunctory service as you get elsewhere.... everyone was engaged & seemed interested & wanted to make this a spectacular stay. I stayed in the newly renovated area & the rooms were crisp, clean, beautiful & extremely comfortable beds in a quiet location. Seriously I could not believe this cost so little. The pool area is breathtaking.... music was kind of lame but overall... this property blew me away...

Reviews.Title: “Best deal on the south end of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: pathdaft
Reviews.Content: Only a short taxi ride from the airport, the Tropicana represents one of the best deals on the south end of the Strip. It is situated right across from MGM Grand, New York New York, and Excalibur and easily tops them in the standard/deluxe room category. Our room was renovated within the last year and included a flat screen LCD, new carpet, new furniture, new bedding and linens. Surprisingly, the room was still cheaper -- MUCH CHEAPER -- than similar offerings at MGM Grand, New York New York, and Excalibur. Room aside, the hotel itself is relatively small to its casino resort neighbors. I found the size to be just right and not having to deal with huge crowds was definitely a plus. If you fancy a livelier experience, the MGM Grand is just a short walk away. Stay there and spend the money you save with a few hands at the poker table.

Reviews.Title: “Cleaner lines, more chic than the typical gaudy strip monstrosity.”
Reviews.Author: tmersky
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a deluxe room which had been very recently renovated. It was very well done, tasteful, but not extravacant. If your only experience at the Tropicana was before its recent renovation, you should really check it out. It is completely different and better. The pool area is fantastic (as good as any in Las Vegas) and the service was both efficient and exceedingly friendly. I stay at the larger strip hotels as well and the Trop was just friendlier and more personal. The food was also excellent. Again, unlike some Vegas spots that over reach and disappoint, at the Trop everything was done appropriately and well executed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room and Great location”
Reviews.Author: jetlag139
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Tropicana and had a great stay. Our room was beautiful, newly remodeled, and very clean. The location is GREAT!! We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great upgrade”
Reviews.Author: leelee1977
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Trop for 4 nights at the end of August. We stayed in the new Paradise Tower. We loved the room. The bed was super comfortable and the room clean and contermporary. The ease of access to the elevator from the entrance was wonderful in comparison to many hotels where you have to walk a mile, often tired, to get to your room from the lobby. The parking valets treated us like family after one day of getting our car for us. All staff was friendly and accomodating. The pool area is beautiful and they are working to make it even more lovely. They have retained some of the old charm in the ceilings in the rooms and in the entrance. A great compliment of the old and the new. All in all we had a great stay and would like to make this hotel our hotel of choice each time we visit Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Love the Renovations”
Reviews.Author: AZSunshineTravels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Vegas to meet up with several friends from around the country for a fun long weekend. I had never stayed at Tropicana, but they were running a special rate and it was too good to pass up. This hotel was the least expensive on the strip by far. I still wasn't completely sold, as I had thought Tropicana was a bit outdated last time I had been in there (had never stayed though), but when we got there I was pleasantly surprised. The updates they have done to the inside are very nice so far, it even smells tropical inside, and all of the lotions and soaps smell that way too. I thought it was a nice touch. Our room had a great view of the strip, very spacious, new flat screen television, very clean, very comfy bed, and even had a little lounge sofa thing. Room service was quick and tasty. I think this location is great, taxis are so cheap in Vegas, if you don't feel like walking and seeing the sights, which is always fun to do. The outside of the hotel could use a facelift though, it just looks dowdy compared to the newer places. Also, I don't think they should get rid of the stained glass ceiling in the casino, it is so beautiful, why would you want to remove it?I would stay here again and recommend it to the traveler on a budget but still expects quality.

Reviews.Title: “I like this casino because it is small and not overwelming.”
Reviews.Author: blco9
Reviews.Content: I have always stayed at the Tropicana. I found this trip to be relaxing and fun. However, I think that there is a lack of casual sit-down restaurants. (Coffee shop type). The steak house (Biscayne) was excellent. Also, I found the casino to be entirely too cold at some spots. There was no escaping cold drafts in some areas where I like to play. The rooms need a table, not the backless whatever you call it.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: rodma910
Reviews.Content: what makes the tropicana the place to stay is all the emploees staring with my casino host Joe Phillips he went above and beyond pushing around in a wheel chair to the awards banquet to get after my oxigen company when the kept messing up my delivery he checked on me making sure I was ok and if I needed anything! The two ladies at the bell desk spent calling the oxigen company until the company got it right! then there was Ellen a slot tech went found a lower chair for me the higher one was cutting off circulation because I play for many hours. The security people when I needed wheel chair pushed. The cocktail waitrees Tracy Gwen Karho looking after me! Cheryl helping check in for my flight home making all my speal needs there.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Service! It makes a difference!”
Reviews.Author: DImlay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our wedding night/honeymoon. We were treated so kindly. Everyone congratulated us. The front desk staff was amazing. The bartenders were very nice. The management went over and above by upgrading us to a suite. The pool waitress named Liz was our favorite.

Reviews.Title: “They Really Are Changing Everything”
Reviews.Author: JMA0512
Reviews.Content: What a change! The rooms are great - very comfortable, clean and tastefully decorated. I was very impressed with the food and equally pleased with the staff - cheery and helpful at all times and clearly proud of their new hotel. The pool area is quite expansive and nicely landscaped. I'm looking forward to going back and enjoying its transformation into a pool club.

Reviews.Title: “Best service I've experienced in ages, and an amazing makeover”
Reviews.Author: 2411ajs
Reviews.Content: We were looking for good value in Vegas and took a chance on the renovated Tropicana. It was an unexpected treat. The room was first class, the food was outstanding, the feel was upbeat and fun, and it was the best service I've experienced at a hotel in Vegas in years. It was a complete breadth of fresh air.

Reviews.Title: “The Best !! Wouldn't stay anywhere else !”
Reviews.Author: marilyndevies
Reviews.Content: We go to Vegas 4 - 5 times per year and always stay at the Tropicana. It has recently been remodeled and is still in the process but the rooms have been done and are absolutely beautiful !! The restaurants are all excellent. We absolutely love the Trop because it is one of the smaller casinos - easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing people”
Reviews.Author: looloo1812
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 9 nights at the Tropicana. It is our 2nd time to Vegas and decided to stay further down the strip this time. We booked into the new paradise tower room, however when we arrived, the lady on reception upgraded us to a mini suite in the island tower as we were staying quite a while, this was a nice surprise. As days went along, this was not a "one-off" all the Tropicana staff we encountered without question were friendly, helpful and had a "nothing is too much trouble attitude." Our room was large, clean and bright. We had an amazing view of the strip, and could see the mountains in the distance. The only slight issue, was our room was situated next to a staff entrance/cupboard, and some mornings I was woken up by banging about, however this is such a small issue. The casino is quite small, we didn't play much there, as we prefered other casino's. However when we did play there, we didnt wait long for a drink, and again the staff were extremely friendly. We ate in the South Beach Cafe one night, this was really nice, just what we needed after a busy day at the Grand Canyon. The pool is fantastic, once the new area opens next year, it will be amazing. We had a few mornings at the pool, it never felt crowded or especially noisy. Excellent waitress service for drinks, or a decent bar if you could be bothered to get off your bum!! Didnt seem to matter what time of day or night we left or entered the hotel, there was always a smiling doorman to open the door for you, this was a lovely touch. We had a late flight on our last day, we checked out, and the bag service looked after our bags until we were due to leave around 8pm, this meant we had all day on the strip without having to worry about dragging our bags around, or sitting around the airport waiting for our flight. When the shuttle bus was late picking us up, one of the doormen offered to call for us, again service with a smile. In summary, excellent service, lovely clean bright hotel and good location for the South end of the strip, would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay at Tropicana!”
Reviews.Author: BigMike5556
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Tropicana. The updated look is great. The casino is on the small side compared to others on the '4 corners' but the dealers were very friendly. My group had 2 rooms, 1 with 2 queens and a strip view and 1 with a king bed a view of the airport. Both rooms were on the 4th floor of the Island Tower. The rooms were clean and quite which made for a good nights sleep. There is still some construction going on around the property but it's not very noticeable. We ate at the 24hr restaurant and the food hit the spot after a late night of partying. The price was the same as most of the restaurants in Vegas. For the price, this is one of the best deals on the strip. I would recommend this hotel, and will stay here again soon!

Reviews.Title: “personel are the best”
Reviews.Author: vegasnut1
Reviews.Content: As part of the Trop room remodeling a "romenesque" setee was put in. The settee is absolutly worthless. Install a coffee and a second chair. I realize the company wants guests in the casino not in their rooms, but some balance has to be struck. Supply spreadable butter in the restaraunts; try spreading rock-hard butter on rools, pancakes, or any food for that matter. I realize things are in flux right now, but temperatures in the casino were absolutly horrible. In some areas one could nt enjoy a machine for long before teeth were chattering and hands were cold. A verity of restaraunts wouldn't hurt either. Again, the staff was fantastic and, as usual, very helpful. Very pleasant chatting with them. Thanks for an almost great stay (temperature the drawback). Jim Cole, room 918. vegasnut1@verizon.net

Reviews.Title: “A great place with great accommodations, great service and great location!”
Reviews.Author: LoveMKE
Reviews.Content: We have been loyal guests at Tropicana because the pool is the best. Now with the renovations, the rooms are fantastic and the service was the best yet! We have stayed at other hotels on the strip, but we always come back to the Tropicana because they make us feel like guests and not tourists. If you have any doubts please don't, this place is awesome. Our friends that have never been to the Tropicana loved this place and told us they will come back and recommend to their friends.

Reviews.Title: “Consistantly Good Service - Fresh Room”
Reviews.Author: FriedaWander
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tropicana a over the weekend to relax before attending a huge convention across the street at the Mandalay Bay. I reserved, and got, a "Best in Class" room in the Paradise Tower - it is the one with the Bamboo furniture and chaise lounge that is featured in their current ads. Got a great rate on getaroom.com. I was able to check in upon arrival before noon and the desk agent was knowlegable, friendly and efficient. Did not use the casino, so I cannot comment. it is smaller and brighter than most, and they do pipe in nice smells. Pool area was nice, but I agree, it will be better, post renovation. It got crowded in the afternoons, but people came and went so you could always find a chair. This is the source of my only complaint - un-related to the hotel itself - but I was grossed out by cigarette and cigar smoke out there - I moved several times to get away from the cigarettes, but one guy puffing on cigars stunk up the entire area one day. Everyone I met on staff was friendly and helpful - even got an extra hour before checkout on Sunday (ask nicely...) Last but not least, as I told everyone I saw at the Conference, my Trop room was WAY nicer than the Mandalay Bay room, and over $125 cheaper. HINT - if you are attending anything at Mandalay Bay - stay here - 10 minute (free) tram ride away

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Tropicana!!!”
Reviews.Author: Forrestgump21
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 3 nights in the Paradise Tower for our 25th anniversary. First time to Vegas and I couldn't decide where to stay, but couldn't pass up the new rooms at the Tropicana. Loved just about everything about the it - the vibe of the hotel, friendly employees, light casino, location on the strip and rooms. Bathroom not totally redone - tile not replaced in shower or on floor, but everything else seemed new. Did not swim in the pool and only tried one restaurant - the restaurant was nice. The Trop is on the south end of the strip, but even if you stay centrally on the strip you still have to take a bus here and there and this was a great location to catch the bus or tram and go wherever. I heard no noise in the hallway or other rooms, which I hate at other hotels when you can hear every door close. Never heard anything and our room was right by the elevator. For the price paid for the 3 nights this was a true bargain. We never had to wait for the elevator to return to our room; it was like returning to a welcoming home. I hope the Tropicana continues to improve with its ongoing renovations; I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “great improvement on rooms”
Reviews.Author: lpnpup
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the paridise tower. the room was nice worth what we paid. maid service needs to have more maids our room was cleaned after 4pm during our stay. seems late compared to any place else we have stayed. cocktail service in cASINO IN mornings the best fair to poor in evenings. still a great improvement from years past. i did find it odd that they did not have BUSH BEER but no big deal. Biscayne resturant excellent food and service highly recommened it. the do need more food choices at the hotel had to go to NY NY HOTEL for coffee, sandwiches,hot pretzels ect. the pool needs to stay open later 7pm too early to close. we would most likely stay again if we could get the same rate we paid. i do think the resort fee is unreasonable didnot see a spa and unable to use pool due to it closing so early.heck in illinois the pool in hotels stay open till 12am

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but expected better”
Reviews.Author: Sidney8787
Reviews.Content: Had a deluxe room in the Paradise Tower. The front desk staff person was really personable and efficient. The room was spacious, the bed extremely comfortable with a clean, crisp white sheet over the bedding - instead of the usual comforter or bedspread that rarely gets changed! The windows had louvered shutters instead of dusty curtains, and were aesthetically more pleasing. Nice big HD-TV. The view was decent, and all staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. Now, the not so great stuff...We were a bit disappointed to find we had been checked into a room that clearly had not been finished by housekeeping. Within a few minutes of getting into the room, a housekeeping staff member used her key to open the door unaware that we were in the room. She then asked US if the room had been cleaned, which was upsetting. The bed was made and the room appeared to be "ready" at first glance, however, after the encounter with the maid (who brought a bath mat), we took a closer look. I immediately noticed there were no washcloths, so I caught the maid on her way down the hall and explained we needed them. She stated she didn't have any, that she was leaving, but would send someone up with some. Getting back to the room, and looking further, it was obvious that the carpet had not been vacuumed and that the bathroom floor had not been wiped clean. There were black streaks and hairs present. Other issues with the bathroom were mold in the shower, the tub was not a tub you would dare to take a bath in (dirty no-slip strips) and dirty areas in the tile floor grout. When there is white grout on a tile floor, housekeeping had better be prepared to keep it white. In this room, it was not, and was really dirty looking at the sink area. Later that night, upon returning to the room, well after midnight, we still had to call for the washcloths. The response was prompt and the staff member was apologetic. We had a comfortable, quiet night's sleep. The next morning we were up and out of the room by 7:00 am. We returned to the room to get ready for the evening only to find it had not been made up which meant no new towels. Another call to housekeeping...they said rooms were cleaned anywhere between 9 am and 5 pm. It was 4:30. So we asked to have the room made up while we were out and were accommodated. The next day we called to state that we would be out until 3:30 and requested that the room be made up by then and had no problems. Our request for the maid to clean the bathroom floor and the tub were honored to the best of her abilities. She placed an extra bath mat on the floor to cover the dirty grout near the sink. Hopefully it was scrubbed clean after we left since we called it to their attention. Other annoyances were: the track of the closet's sliding doors was bent to the point that only one door slid easily, the other literally had to be lifted from the track to open it to gain access to that side of the closet, and there was a hole in the bathroom ceiling where the sprinkler system came through that was way bigger than it needed to be. Minor, but it added to the sloppiness of the bathroom in general, as did the misaligned tiles and mismatched grout in the shower stall. The hotel room did have lots of hangers, drawer space, nice, hot, soft water and a multi-setting shower head. The towels could have smelled fresher, though. The location of the hotel was decent, with easy access to a number of other casino hotels and a walkway to get across busy Las Vegas Blvd. We did not use any other hotel amenities. Late one night we went to take a stroll around the pool area, which we were told was open 24 hours, but the sprinkler system was on, so that was a no-go. Would have used the pool while my spouse was using the hotel's sports book room, but it was closed to begin construction on a new one which forced us to venture out to other hotels instead of spending more time here. What we liked best was the friendly staff, and what we liked least was obviously the condition of the bathroom. Overall, not a horrible experience, but we'd need a great deal for us to stay here again. Would recommended, but we wouldn't candy-coat it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly positioned, light airy and clean.”
Reviews.Author: HobartThommo
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Vegas and this hotel was superb. Arrived early in the morning and were checked into our room straight away. Rooms spacious and clean and the beds soooo comfortable. Located at the south end of the strip with perfect access. Casino entrance is light as opposed to a lot of the other casinos which are very dark so always nice to come 'home' to. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Truly enjoyable vacation!”
Reviews.Author: skinny74
Reviews.Content: We have been to LV many times over the past 15 years and this was our first stay at the Tropicana and we really, really liked it. We found the location to work fine for us, we had a car and drove any where that we needed to go. We liked the fact that the place is not as large as some of the other hotels/casinos, much easier to get around. The construction did not bother us and we look forward to going back to see everything when it is done. Good food, drinks, great pool area and everything was kept neat and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Lynnep_Willerby
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights and I think the title says it all. Intend to put in a formal complaint, not worth the money I paid and certainly not the resort fee, I mean who charges a resort fee for a resort that is half finished and not fully usable and is dirty! Too many items to list that were wrong however on the plus side the room was excellent although on the first night we were totally locked in and couldn't get the door open for a good 10 minutes. Had to call family in another room and slide the key under the door for them to open it from the outside to get us out. Not good if there was a fire!!! Told reception on checkout we would be putting our complaint in writing as we still had another 5 days of our holiday left in another location and had no intention of letting this experience spoil it for us. Won't ever stay here again, which is a shame as we intend to visit more often and most certainly would have passed business on.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile - a bit of an older crowd”
Reviews.Author: wintertime11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tropicana for 2 nights with a friend. Although I didn't make much use of the services, I found the check-in ladies to be very friendly (and it's kind of cute that everyone signs in at the "VIP" desk). The rooms were great, very roomy, brand new, and spotlessly clean. My only gripe is that a big reason for having booked this hotel was for the pool, after reading many good reviews about it. Unfortunately, after having spent most of the night (and morning) gambling at the casino downstairs (the roulette gaming staff were great fun, and having $5 roulette tables probably made me end up spending a lot more than I would have at a $10 table :) ), and having a late lunch, my friend and I got suited up in our swimming gear, went to the pool, only to find out it closes at 6pm. This probably suits the older clientele that the Tropicana attracts (we were one of the few people under 50!), but for us it was a major let down. All in all though, the place was great. I'd like to see where the Tropicana heads with their new "changing everything" direction.. I purposefully chose not to go to one of the more "party" casinos, because I wasn't really interested in hanging out with "the beautiful people" and the associated posturing, but likewise I found the Tropicana a bit too much of a retirement home. If the Tropicana swung just a bit more to the younger crowd (more bars, much longer pool hours etc), I'd be back there in a flash, otherwise I'd probably try somewhere else and compare.

Reviews.Title: “A great, fresh place...give it a try.”
Reviews.Author: toml71
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I had an excellent experience here. Not the place it used to be, really improved with crisp and luxurious rooms. The staff is excited to help, and very eager. A nice moderately-sized place as well, nothing intimidating about it. The location (very central) is perfect, easy walking distance or tram distance to other places on the strip. The pool is nice sized and not too crowded, with great mature trees and landscaping....gives it a garden feel compared with some of the concrete pools I have experienced in Vegas. The food was much better than my expecations, and in the top 25% of meals I have had at any restaurant in any town. I strongly recommend this place and that you give it a try, a good value and a fresh perspective.

Reviews.Title: “Not there yet, but it's a GREAT start!”
Reviews.Author: sharpasice
Reviews.Content: I have been reading reviews of the Tropicana on TripAdvisor and wanted to post a review but did not think I could do it without actually having been at the Tropicana. Then I noticed Ms Marshall's email address on many reviews, so I wrote to her. I am booked in April, 2011. I just wanted to tell someone, anyone..that the people taking reservations have been the NICEST staff members I have dealt with over the phone. I called a number of hotels for information during April, I am going for a special poker tourney and the reservation staff at the Trop were actually exciting to talk to! I made my reservation with Julie just yesterday and believe me when I say, she is a wonderful addition to the Tropicana staff. She praised the hotel and made me so excited about going there that I can hardly wait! I also had many questions and she answered all of them. I can just imagine she answers her calls with a smile. I wrote Ms Marshall just today to compliment Julie and received a reply within about an hour! A REAL reply not an automated "when we get to it" reply. I am anxious to go, looks like I am booked in the Paradise Tower and if other staff members are as nice and these two ladies I KNOW we will have a wonder time! I will post again after the trip. For now I am rating this hotel as Excellent just because of the great staff! I am sorry I can't at this time fill in the rest of the ratings but will as soon as I return.

Reviews.Title: “I'll give it a C+. Comfortable and affordable but not much else.”
Reviews.Author: JLMOORE
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Trop for 4 days for our anniversary. When we checked into our first room, it was nice but small, not like the extra large rooms shown in the pictures. So the next day we asked to be moved. The hotel was pretty full so maybe another room would be more like what we saw in the photos. Moved up to the 9th floor and had a great view but same small room. Maybe in the Paradise tower? Front desk said that was for VIP's. I will say the beds are fantastic though. Rare to find great beds in hotels. You will definitely sleep well. As long as you do not stay on the ninth floor and are awaken at 6AM by the hammering of the construction on floor ten. Not good when you just came in at 3AM from a night in the casino. (Losing by the way, their machines are tight!) But I dont want to move again when we only have one more day. Now the pool. It is a nice pool but the ad "best pool in Las Vegas"? Not a chance. Its cute and sufficient, but nothing more. Cant figure where the 4 acres of pool comes in. And the waitress at the pool was never to be found so I always went to get my own drinks. All in all the hotel is bright and cheery with great beds and a great price, but you'll find that you will want to do everything else somewhere else. Which is what we did. I rather enjoyed the Excalibur across the street. Lots of food choices, great buffet, several gift shops, and a very lively casino, (where I won by the way). So next trip we will stay somewhere else. Sorry Tropicana, I had high hopes, but our visit didnt live up to the hype.

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly feel with fabulous rooms”
Reviews.Author: HazePaze
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel as it was so friendly and had a good feeling compared to the bigger hotels in the area, the gaming area is not so daunting. The pool area is lovely but we did have to complain about the loud music which they would turn the volume down for a while but it crept back up again, this is not conducive to relaxing but maybe will change when the new Nikki Beach is open in 2011. I have never slept in such a comfortable bed and it was spotlessly clean. The location is fantastic and even though there were renovations being carried out, we were not affected by the work, just fascinated to see how quickly things were changing around us with minimal disruption.

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: igram42
Reviews.Content: our family stayed at the tropicana and enjoyed our stay.My wife wasnt too keen on going to vegas,but after staying here,its now near the top of her list as a good place to stay.The hotel renovations look very good,The casino had lots of tables available,one $5 blackjack,mostly $10 tables.We ate only at south beach bistro..not worth the money...never heard of sandwhiches not comming with a side(fries.or slaw).2 sandwhiches,2 bottle water..$30.The pool is very nice,complete with shallow end for the kids.No hassle for towels.Drinks were $10-12 each...pricey.Mcdonalds,starbucks near by at luxor, for breakfast,,check your order.Lots of elevators,never a long wait, and very fast. Pool closes early..18h30.It isnt your glitzy las v hotel,but it definitely does the trick,and i look forward to staying here again buses near by,Boulavard mall easy to get to,lv outlet centre easy to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: fayexxx
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! The best we have ever stayed in! The rooms were fantastic! We had a great view of the MGM from our room on the 9th floor. The bed was so comfortable and the room was huge. There was a 42" plasma tv in the room which was great. The only negative thing was when we arrived the room hadnt been cleaned and there was food all over the place, once we told a member of staff there was a whole team of cleaners up there immediately so this wasnt a problem. Room service was great and very good value and its 24 hours. Will definitely be back and will recommend to friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Just redone”
Reviews.Author: Suilenroc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the "Trop" Aug 21 to Aug 25 2010, they had just redone the hotel and the price was good with a good location on the strip. The check in guy didn't seen to know the hotel, or what was included, he put us in the quiet end of the hotel the Island Tower, but because of the contruction ( it was not done and the sound system they were testing stayed on till 1am and the hammering work woke us at 8am) Although when brought to their attention the hotel was very accomadating in getting us a quieter and better room (thanks Nicole) The casino was small but much better than getting trapped in MGM or Caesars Palace. The valet parking was quick and friendly and also doormen asking if you need a taxi. You can walk the strip, things look close but it takes forever to walk there For the price and what we needed the Tropicana is a great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel we're coming back soon”
Reviews.Author: Car1952
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 nights at the Tropicana and it was great. We were extremely well treated, especially Gerard at check-in, our new room was wonderful, the bed was extremely comfortable, bathroom spacious and with amenities and the food at the Biscayne was delicious. We enjoyed the friendly helpful staff and the dealers at the Roulette tables were good and fun. Although still renovating it did not interfere with our stay what so ever. We hope the Tropicana will have us back within the next 4 months. It was great.

Reviews.Title: “The Tropicana was a great price for a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: amberd76
Reviews.Content: I was a bit leary about going to the Tropicana as I had heard some contradicting reviews. However, from the moment we stepped in the door we were treated royally. The wonderful customer service received throughout the resort came from all areas including the reservation desk, security,store clerk,s doormen, and housekeeping. We mentioned we really liked the hotel shampoo and the housekeeper left us a few extra bottles to take home. Just little things, but when added up we felt very well taken care of. The rooms were beautiful, the pool area great, and the location perfect for us at the start of the strip. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: helsenhelsen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister for 2 nights. We were staying in Vegas for 4 nights in total but split the time between Tropicana and one other hotel. Honestly speaking, we chose this as one of the cheap but nice hotels (wasn’t really one of our first choices) – we couldn’t or didn’t really want to afford 4 nights at the hotel of our choice (where we stayed the other 2 nights). After our 2 night stay here and 2 nights at our “chosen” hotel, we both wished we had stayed at the Tropicana for the full stay. We liked it MUCH more than the other hotel. Had a new room each with King bed – nice and bright room, lovely size, comfy and clean etc. Nice big room with good flat screen TV. Bathroom also clean etc. The pool area is really nice and clean, easy getting sunbeds. The hotel is still under renovation so will look really good when finished. Can’t think of any bad points. I would definitely stay here again, infact would most likely be my first choice if I was to return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cutieintheburgh
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on Trip Advisor and noticing that Ms. Nicole Marshall responded to several. I decided to take a chance. I figured if it was horrible I would let her know. Wow, its a really nice, clean, hotel, the bed was so comfortable. The renovations are impressive. Mandalay Bay rooms could use some renovating. ( I stayed at both ) Its a good location and price. I stayed in the Paradise Tower. My first room faced the Boulevard and was next to the elevator it was too noisy (for me) so I asked to be moved and the staff was very accomodating. Unfortunately I only stayed for one day, but the next time I'm in Vegas I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic renovations and service, keep it up!”
Reviews.Author: muppetx
Reviews.Content: We have been to the tropicana pre-renovations for several years to gamble. We would never dare staying there before the recent renovations though. I saw the positive reviews here and on facebook and accepted an offer on facebook for a nights stay for the beginning of our labour day trip (stayed the night of Aug 31, 2010). I must say, my wife and I were so utterly surprised at the difference at the tropicana. The staff were exceptional at every point of our stay. The cocktail waitresses in the casino were prompt, very friendly, and would even chat with you a little rather than quickly run away. Check-in was smooth, efficient, and also friendly. The room we were given was newly renovated, and the decor was great and fit with the new atmosphere. The bathroom was a little oddly configured, but was clean and spacious. The pool area was half closed off due to the construction, but the pool area was very well kept, was comfortable, and the staff were exceptional. The transformation of the tropicana has really changed our opinion of this once decaying property. We will definitely return on our next trip. PS. The brad garret comedy club was hilarious, especially considering we went back on a night brad garret himself was there. Aside from his exceptionally race-tinged bit, and the fact it cost $4 for a water, the show was great.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly beautiful room, great experience in newly redone Paradise Tower”
Reviews.Author: GScoutmom
Reviews.Content: All I can say is "WOW! We have got to come again soon!" My husband and I stayed at the newly redone Paradise Tower at Tropicana last weekend for his birthday, and the room was just beautiful, spacious, and had the feel of other four star hotels we have stayed in. You can tell they have poured a lot of money into new pillowtop beds, new decor, new 42-inch plasma TVs, and new ornate ceilings in the room. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the walls were virtually sound proof (great for sleeping in after being out late.) Compared to the stay we had last year in the other tower, it was a completely different experience (kinda dark and dumpy last year). We talked to a manager to compliment him, and he said the hotel has a new owner and wanted to completely redo the "feel" of the hotel from old and dark to bright and new. I say he has succeeded! The pool was amazing too, with a tropical feel, waterfall, and palm trees with fun lifeguards and waitresses taking drink orders. We will definitely come back any chance we can.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Tropicana!”
Reviews.Author: Tangent69
Reviews.Content: I booked at the Tropicana because of all the positive reviews I've read about their newly remodeled Paradise Tower rooms, and I'm so glad i did! I stayed there for 5 nights (Aug 20-25, 2010). The room was very spacious and clean and the bed was to die for. What a perfect retreat after a long day of walking and sightseeing, very very comfortable beds. My friend couldn't agree more. All the staff was friendly (Maria at check in was wonderful) service was great, and the pool was just lovely! They now also have Free WIFI!!! I also played at their casino and i think they have one of the loosest penny slots, only place where I have actually won some money. There were some renovations still going on but they did not bother me at all. Honestly, I was so busy I barely noticed because it's not like they're right in your face. They would do little things here and there (from what I've seen) and they were never in my way. And I did not hear any "pounding" or construction noise. Upon arriving at the hotel, u walk into a cozy, warm, clean atmosphere and I like that it's not as busy and crowded as the bigger hotels on the strip. The tropical scent in the hallways was also nice touch. And the location? Perfect... just steps from the tram whether you're south or northbound. I just love the Trop, I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: tochance
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my stay at the Tropicana September 1-5 and I don't even know where to begin. My younger sister arrived at 9:30 am and had no problem checking into her room as she was the first to arrive. Once she got to her room an inspector was checking to make sure a spill was cleaned up and asked if they needed to clean it again which my sister didn't see anything so told them no. My husband and I arrived at 3:30 and had no problem with any lines to check in. My sister's room was in the Paradise Tower and was double, we were upgraded to a suite in the Paradise Tower that was absolutely AMAZING! I can not rave enough about our hotel stay at the Tropicana! I also had a friend get in at 9am the next day and was able to check in as well and the hotel accomodated us by placing us all on the same floor. I had no problem with the elevators which I thought were very neat inside. Yes, there might have been a few minute wait later in the evening but nothing you wouldn't get at any other hotel in Las Vegas on a weekend night. The rooms were so clean and the air worked completely fine. The TV's were great and in the rooms you just felt very comfortable. The beds were so fabulous and comfortable as well. The view from our room I absolutely loved as you could see right now the strip, it was like watching a movie with views of the strip. Gambling was one of the best parts of our stay, I am a roulette player so it was just awesome seeing a $5 minimum bet even on the weekends. Also, the casino floor may be smaller than some other casinos but in my opinion this is great if you want to get service. You are not sitting there long before someone walks over to ask you if you want a drink. All of the dealers as well as the cocktail services were so friendly. Moving on to the pool. It is a beautiful pool with lots of lounge chairs that are very nice and comfy. On Saturday the pool was pretty busy but we just asked a pool guy if we could get a couple of chairs and he had no problem going to get us a few extra so we could sit together. They also have a grill outside where they cook food. The best part about the pool is that there is a sushi restuarant that is set up serving their sushi and it was the BEST sushi I have ever tried. I recommend trying it to anyone. The cafe that is open 24 hours was a really good spot to get something to eat late night or anytime during the day. The breakfast was huge portions and at night it wasn't busy at all. Another plus is that if you order a drink you are allowed to go back and get refills throughout the day. There was always someone outside to direct you or help you with anything. We had 6 people in our group and the max allowed in a cab is 5 so the bellman suggested we take the Tropicana limo which was $60 and seeing as we were going down the strip pretty fair it actuallly made sense to take it as we would have probably spent $40 for two cabs. We had an enjoyable ride down the strip and had comp water to sip on. Instead of riding in a cab that we have to make go the back roads to keep the cost down. We also took advantage of the comedy buy 2 for the price of 1 tickets and the show was hilarious. I laughed so hard that I was crying. They really have a great comedy show at the hotel and it's a great size of room. Also make sure you sign up for a players card because I was really surprised at the end of my trip when I found out we had over $100 in comps to use however we wanted. All in all this was the best trip to VEGAS I have had and that is all thanks to the Tropicana as well as Nicole Marshall. Nicole really helped in making this trip the BEST and I really appreciated all she did for us. Don't think twice about the Tropicana, because it is the place to stay and they are continuing to make changes and listening to what the customer says. You will be very happy with what you get. I can't wait to go back and stay again. Happy Travels!

Reviews.Title: “Needs Help”
Reviews.Author: kge_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited the Tropicana hotel in Vegas on August 10 - 14, 2010. To make a long story short, there were stains on our sheets and young kids left alone in the room next to us and they were very loud until 4:00 A.M. We addressed the problems the next morning and we offered to pay the difference for an upgraded room. All they could do was move us to another floor or charge us full price for a suite.....the hotel wasn't even half full. So, we took our gambling money elswhere, MGM, Luxor, etc. The P/R was so bad that we will never visit the Tropicana again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: herminator
Reviews.Content: I go to Las Vegas several times a year and have been watching the positive reviews for the newly remodeled Tropicana and decided to give it a try myself this past week. Though it was still in the construction phase it lived up to the high expectations that I had. The new Paradise Tower rooms are big, clean and have all new furnishings. The bed was very comfortable and the large flat screen TV was great. Plus it had a safe large enough to store a laptop unlike some other hotels in Vegas that have the smaller sized version of a safe. The casino is small though that is still being worked on, though it was no problem to get on a table. Plenty of slots. Not much for entertainment during the middle of the week but maybe that will change as all the rooms are completed and the hotel fills up. The pool was great and they had comfortable lounge chairs with padding unlike a lot of the other locations in town. I happen to like where it is located on the south end of the strip with MGM, Mandalay and NYNY close by in addition to the monorail. The staff, from check in to the dealers, bartenders, etc are the most hospitable in town that I have found. Friendly, courteous and they seem to enjoy their jobs which is not always what you find from some of the other casinos. I look forward to staying there again when I return in December for the Las Vegas half marathon. In fact its location is near the starting line so any runners looking for a hotel that weekend may want to check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JBJMSS
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana is great! We stayed in the recently renovated Best-In-Class room and it was awesome. Very clean and the beds were very comfortable. The huge 42in. flat screen TV was also great and the bathroom was very spacious. From our room we had a great vew of the strip. The hotel staff was exceptional from the minute we started our stay. I even emailed the Guest Experience Manager, Nicole Marshall, before our trip and she gave me great tips on what to do while in Vegas. Overall it was a great experience and we'll definitely return in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service; excellent stay.”
Reviews.Author: kerisalynn
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to take this time to tell about my wonderful experience at the Tropicana where I stayed for 5 nights from Aug. 27th-Sept 31. Initially when the group I was travelling with informed me that we would be staying at the Tropicana, I was a little leary. In fact, I was a bit embarrassed to admit I was staying at the Tropicana when asked which hotel I would be staying during my Las Vegas trip. However, I was very pleasantly surprised. Upon arriving at the hotel, we were greeted by a very freindly and courteous door man named Dean. He informed us that perhaps we would be able to check in early which we were able to do. The check in staff was very friendly and made sure we were happy with our accomodations. When we entered our room, we gasped at how nice it was! The room had a very tropical feel, was very clean, and had a great view. The pool area was amazing. All of the staff were very courteous including the front door, the front desk, the pool staff, concierge and housekeeping. We made requestes for an extra door sign and for extra towels which were delivered promptly. All questions were answered respectfully and all the staff was very helpful. However, Dean made sure to make two Minnesota gals feel special every time we walked through the door. He made our stay feel very personable and welcoming and it is because of him we have such a lasting impression of the Tropicana. We even took his picture! Because of our wonderful experience at the Tropicana, both my travelling partner and I feel a strong loyalty to the Tropicana and would not hesitate to stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressive.....”
Reviews.Author: mndavet
Reviews.Content: Do you remember what the Tropicana used to be like not that long ago???? Those days are GONE! This hotel is FABULOUS! I was upgraded to a new Paradise Tower Suite and I was AMAZED how big..... too much in all honesty. Great view right down the strip. The bed is the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in... it actually made me look forward to going to bed at night! The service at the hotel was A+ from check in (Sarah) to the door men.. to the waitresses, to the dealers, to the staff at Havana Go Go... super friendly and always a smile! The casino is going through a major change and it makes it VERY small at this time.. but all good things are worth the wait.. I know that when it is done it will sparkle like the rest of this redone hotel!! And I didnt eve mention the pool!! Also what I love about the Trop is that the guests are pleasant... LV is getting much too ALCOHOL FOCUSED especially by 20 something girls that have no clue what class is.... Leave the big resorts like NYNY and Treasure Island for those people! I will definetly be back to the Tropicana and hope that this will help you make a wise decision and consider this Las Vegas landmark.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room”
Reviews.Author: Myr1am01
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is undergoing remodelation, rooms have been upgraded as well as the pool. It seems this hotel will be FABULOUS once remodelation is completed. Very, very comfortable beds. Public transportation is one step on the sidewalk outside the hotel. If you're planning to walk, keep in mind hotel is located at the South of the Strip. We missed not having shows at the hotel nor free bussiness center. If you do not bring your own laptop, you need to pay for the use of a computer. Staff was excellent. Overall great deal for what we received in comparison to other hotels which were a lot more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: KiwiLea
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Tropicana but after staying in one of the newly renovated suites on the first night we found the rooms we were moved to for the remainder of our stay to be a bit tired and an awfully long walk from the main entrance. However, the beds were really comfortable and there was very little outside noise.

Reviews.Title: “What a transformation!!!! New rooms are amazing”
Reviews.Author: arowdybunch
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Tropicana. We have stayed at the Tropicana several times over the last several years(20 years) and I have to say that we were pleasantly surprised at the transformation of the hotel, casino and rooms. We arrived at midnight on Thursday night. Check in was a breeze. We decided to head up to the room before bringing up the luggage and all I can say is WOW!!!!! The rooms are incredible. They are spacious and clean, with brand new decor and our room had an excellent view of the strip. As many have noted in other reviews, the beds are so comfortable, just this side of heaven, with down comforters. Even the 42" plasma tv was a nice bonus. The bathrooms are spacious with nice counter space. The pool was just as I remember it, but with cabannas added and music playing over the loud speakers. Others have mentioned that the music was blarring, but I didn't think it was over the top. Just loud enough to be enjoyed by everyone while relaxing/hanging out at the pool. I understand the pool will be going through a major renovation itself and I can't wait to go back and see the changes... As everyone else has mentioned, the staff at the Tropicana were all very friendly and would go out of there way to make us feel at home. Everyone greeted us with a smile and truly seemed to appreciate us as guests. The only downside to our stay this time was the lack of restuarants and not much gambling space, but we had our young daughter with us so didn't spend much time in the casino anyway and I understand that everything is being renovated which is why there wasn't any restuarants. I truly can not wait to come back and see the trop after all the renovations. This is going to be the place to stay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “They really are changing everything - in a good way!”
Reviews.Author: ejangles
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana had such a bad reputation that I had never stepped foot in there before my recent trip (August 26-30), despite having stayed on the strip about a dozen times. Their new marketing showcasing the much needed renovations is what changed my mind. The group: I think it's always helpful to know what kind of people are writing the review so you know what our expectations/needs were. We are laid-back late-20-something professionals from the midwest, somewhat low rollers (we like $5 blackjack). Four of us had just been in Vegas in February, staying at the Aria. One other had stayed at the Encore the last trip, and the other was a Vegas virgin. All of us understood that we were taking a step down staying at the Trop, so we had certainly adjusted our expectations. The hotel generally: the renovations look great. There was usually somenoe at the door to open the doors for you, always with a smile and a hello. Once you walk in through the newly done entrance, the airy, light casino floor opens up. After staying at the Aria my last trip (I know, quite a different type of resort!), the big thing I noticed was how bright everything is at the Trop. The renovations are ongoing but mostly out of sight - there are temporary walls erected around the casino so you don't have to see the men at work. There is a slight coconut scent in the entrance area - one out of the six of us did not like it, I liked it a lot, and the other four did not mind it much. Definitely not as overpowering and offensive as the scent in the Venetian. The rooms: We had three rooms - two in the Paradise tower and one in the Island tower. All the rooms we had were newly renovated. I'd say the rooms are solidly 3.5 star rooms. Everything is clean, and, like the hotel, airy and light. The 42" plasma TVs have HD channels, which is not always the case for a lot of the 3 to 4 star hotels on the strip. Toiletries were adequate - your standard shampoo, conditioner, bath gel, lotion and soap. They were scented with a coconut scent to go with the general motif of the hotel - again, I found it very pleasant, but one friend thought it was tacky. The bed was very comfortable. I understand the complaints people have with the shutters. They definitely do not block out all the light. I personally didn't mind because I woke up around 7:30am anyway, but I can see that if you're a light sleeper, you might not like it. None of the people in my party seemed to have trouble sleeping well into late morning, however. One bonus was that you are able to open the windows just a crack, to let some fresh air in. Island Tower vs. Paradise Tower: The rooms are essentially identical, but I think if I were to go back, I would stay at the Paradise Tower - it's very close to the casino floor and the entrance. In fact, it's so close to the entrance that I realized that the MGM Grand casino floor is closer to get to for someone staying at the Tropicana Paradise Tower than for some of the folks staying at the MGM Grand! However, the Island Tower would be very nice for people who want to use the pool - the elevator takes you basically right up to the pool. Which brings us to... The pool: I read in a review that the Trop has the best resort rate to pool quality ratio, and I have to agree with that. The pool is relaxing and unassuming - an "ultrapool" it was not, and that's a good thing. About 1/3 or so of the pool area was closed for renovation, but we were always able to get 4 chairs together (2 of our friends weren't much for the pool) and they always kept the free water filled (one was cucumber infused, one was lime infused). Drinks were a little overpriced - we did not order drinks after the first day. The gym: there is a small gym near the pool area. It was hardly used but had all the basic equipment you need - treadmills, a few machines, a variety of freeweights. Not great but, hey, it's free. The casino: The casino was very small, although I didn't mind that much, since I only play at one table at any given time anyway! Plus it made it easy for us to say "meet at the blackjack tables". As of last week, there were about a dozen tables open and a bunch of slot machines, but I understand that another renovated section of the casino is opening soon. I appreciated the fact that there was 3:2 $5 blackjack basically all the time. Swim-up blackjack was also pretty fun - a little gimmicky (you basically just sit in about 3 ft of water while you play) but fun for an hour or two. The casino never felt super exciting, even when it got fairly busy, probably because it was so small. The restaurants: There were 4 restaurants when I visited, including the steakhouse which had just opened. We tried all but the steakhouse. Bacio is the mid-range Italian restaurant. We had pasta dishes, pizza and salad among us. The portions are huge (2 or 3 people could probably have split the spaghetti) and quality is decent enough for the price range ($11-16 entrees). The Havanna Cafe was a good cheap option - cheap but not poor quality, mind you. My girlfriend said the veggie reuben was probably the best that she's ever had. The South Beach deli is open 24 hours and very mediocre - I would not recommend it unless you just need a quick bite at late hour. We also had coffee from the Starbucks kiosk near the conference center area - the coffee was not burnt, so that's always a plus (I noticed that a lot of coffee kiosks on the Strip burn their coffee by keeping the coffee on too long). Complaints: I do have a couple of minor complaints. First, there was a timeshare scamster set up as an "information" desk right near the check-in on the casino floor. Very tacky. I walked away saying I just want to go to the room, so you would think they would've taken a hint, but when I came back down to the casino area they tried to talk to me again ("all settled in?" etc). Second, more minor complaint: there were two conventions while we stayed, some kind of kids' martial arts convention and a kids' dance competition. That filled the hotel up with a lot of families, some with unruly kids. I understand it might be good business to get those conventions in there but THE reason I don't stay at the Excalibur is because of all the unruly kids - it'd be nice to phase out the family events. Lastly: there was almost no shopping to be done. I understand that part of the renovations includes putting in new shopping, though, and it's certainly not a priority for me. Final words: I enjoyed the Trop immensely. I had low, low expectations, which were certainly exceeded and then some. For the price, I don't think you can get much better than the Trop right now on the strip, in terms of hotel/room/pool quality and location. And the renovations keep going! I'd be very curious to see what the Garden rooms look like after the renovations - it would be awesome if they were as nice as the Island and Paradise rooms, and they keep the balconies. I also would love to return when the Nikki Beach stuff is done.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and clean with a fabulous staff!”
Reviews.Author: webb2010
Reviews.Content: When we pulled up to the Tropicana we were promply greeted by the bellman. He was incredibly friendly and patiently answered the billion questions we had for him! In our conversation, he told us stories of famous people who had come through the tropicana throughout the years (neil armstrong, alan shephard, etc). Declaring the place the old "Tiffany's" of the strip, we couldn't wait to stay in a place with such a neat history. When we walked in the front door, I was suprised by the look and feel of the casino. It was very bright! The clean white floor tiles and stained glass ceiling made the atmosphere feel fresh and clean. It is a very classy place to stay. It is very different from the mega resorts in vegas! The woman who checked us in was also very friendly and helpful. We felt like we were home! When the bellman brought our luggage to our room, he was very helpful. He made sure we had everything we needed; he even offered to fill our ice bucket! We stayed in a room in the newly refinished paradise tower. The room was very spacious and had a breathtaking view of the strip! The room had large flat screen TV's, free wireless internet access, and bathrobes! The bed was AWESOME! Very comfortable! We felt like we were sleeping on a cloud! The bathroom was very large and clean; the water pressure was great! They even had an iphone radio charger (we loved this little detail). There are a few places to eat at the tropicana. We loved the 24 hour cafe. They served boars head meat on their sandwiches (my favorite). Everything was priced very reasonably! The other cafe there was open in the morning....they served starbucks coffee and had krispy kremes! The pool area was amazing! I was so happy to see that they had grassy areas and trees for shade! The lounge chairs were lined with comfortable pads; the pool staff kept everything very clean and in pristine condition! There was even a man that went around drying the area around the pool to keep people from slipping in the puddles. They paid a lot of attention to detail! We can't wait to visit this place again next year! We were very happy with the atmosphere, the friendly staff, and the classy feel of this casino! The staff made this place so special. Their friendly attitudes made us feel at home! A special "Thank you" to the security man Brian. We loved chatting with you! Thank you for being so nice and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrsraz2
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ the Tropicana 8/22/thru8/27 rooms were great service was great price was great.We were treated like KINGS&QUEENS .Had a really good time,I was a little disappointed that we did not see Brad Garrett,I did not realize that our BOGO tickets were for his theater and not him,still we were very happy with this hotel

Reviews.Title: “planning b/day trip nov 4 2010”
Reviews.Author: bobaluuu
Reviews.Content: with some trepidation I booked my upcoming trip to the famous "Trop" based on price and proximity only. my fears were based on previous experiences(old outdated decor/a really bad dining experience, it felt like a trip to the old folks $5.99 cafes but the prices were higher/ gambling while being accosted by street walkers/ and being crowded into a show where the costumes looked very worn and the performers jaded. after reading these reviews I am again excited to be coming to the "Trop". your responses to patrons is encouraging and their enthusiasm has lifted my spirits in anticipation of my stay there. I look forward to posting my stay experiences in a like positive manner.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise tower is beautiful and worth it!”
Reviews.Author: rer01
Reviews.Content: Went for a weekend trip and booked Tropicana last minute because it was the best value on the strip. Was a little worried because my previous experience at Tropicana 5+ yrs ago was poor. This time it was wonderful! Stayed in a remodled room in the Paradise tower and the rooms are gorgeous! On par with hotels like Monte Carlo, Luxor, Rio. Loved it and will be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “They've Definitely Changed Everything! WILL RETURN”
Reviews.Author: BargainBri
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Trop 9 years ago, and I must say that true to their word, they've changed EVERYTHING. Gone are the annoying vendors on the bridge between towers, the cheesy Miami Vice attire for staff, the '80s idea of "tropical" decor, and the general cheap look of the hotel. What stayed? The AMAZING staff, some of which have been there nearly (or over) 20 years. This is a major recipe for success as far as I am concerned, since those people who helped us--from Bellmen to front desk personnel and everyone in between--were incredibly sweet, helpful and totally seasoned. After spending the first night in a room with an airport view, I kindly requested to move to a more appealing room with a better view, since this was my husband's first time in Las Vegas. Kimberlee quickly obliged with a smile, reserving us a room which would be ready in the early afternoon in the Paradise tower with a much better view at no additional charge. That's right folks, free upgrade! When it was time for us to move, my husband was busy in a poker tournament and so Chuy came to move our things from one room to the other. He was super friendly, and his service level again, was out of this world, right down to setting up our suitcase on a luggage rack in the new room. While we were there, we decided to eat at the South Beach Cafe, which is open 24 hours for room service as well. A really nice staff member there let us in on a little secret that is the $8 coffee tumbler. This got us free coffee for the entire time we stayed there, which is a HUGE savings with the way we drink coffee! We ate there several times for a few reasons: 1. It's SUPER cheap, compared to the other options out there. 2. The portions are HUGE, so hubby & I were able to split our meals. 3. The food is AMAZING! 4. They're FAST. We made our way down to the pool a couple times to take a quick dip and cool off from the hot desert sun, but this isn't finished yet. The open pool was far less exciting than the old one, but I have to give them a break here since the remodel won't be complete until next year. I will say that it was fairly large, not crowded, good temperature & had REALLY comfy lounge chairs. The swim-up blackjack tables were closed both times we were there, which kind of bummed me out, but other than that, it definitely got the job done. The location of this hotel was also perfect for us, since we stayed primarily on the south end of the Strip anyway. Although, even if you plan to venture further north on the strip, transportation options are abundant and easily accessible. The monorail is quite close at the MGM next door, and the Deuce has a stop right out front of the hotel. Overall, the Tropicana WELL-exceeded any expectations I had going into this trip, as I was just hoping for a bargain hotel and wasn't expecting any great service or luxury experience. We chose the Trop simply because it was a cheap bed for the night that was close to the action. We got WAY more than I ever expected, and I was pleasantly surprised! Thank you to the staff at the Tropicana for making my husband's first visit to Las Vegas unforgettable, in the best possible way!

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: crucibroke
Reviews.Content: I choose the Tropicana over other comparable hotels due to the fact that they boast newly remodeled rooms in the Paradise Tower. While they delivered on the room renovations (ours looked exactly like the pictures), don’t expect ANYTHING more. Pros: The rooms were remodeled. Cons: Check-In took way too long - about 20 minutes before we even reached the counter. The line was all the way down the lobby, and yet they only had 2 employees staffing the counter. Such an antiquated system – they still use adding machines to total your bill! The lady helping us had to redo her math 3 times! We believe the air-conditioner in our room was leaking condensation. There was a huge wet spot in the corner of the room. House-keeping said we could either have someone sent to assess the situation or we could opt for a new room (we didn’t want to deal with the front desk again). We declined. While it was unsettling to step barefoot into a puddle of unknown substance, it wasn’t ultimately bothersome. We had to call to get our room serviced. House-keeping somehow missed our room after the first night. We opted for the delivery of few towels, as we didn’t want to leave and wait for housekeeping to show up and clean. While the room was nice, the tile in the bathroom was pretty worn (a relic from the room pre remodel?). It detracted from the overall appearance. Don’t trust the advertising regarding the hotel’s restaurant, Legends. They promote a $34.99 four course meal with wine pairing. Sounded great until we were seated and found that it’s only a “tasting” menu (small portions) and the wine (not even full glasses) is not paired with the last course. If we had been aware of the bait-and-switch, we would have gone elsewhere. Because we were short on time, we had to stay. Service was terrible. Not exaggerating, we sat for 15 minutes with finished plates and empty glasses between EACH course before we were even acknowledged. Food wasn’t great either. Separate review coming… BEWARE: The final coup de gras was coming home to find “Resort Fee” charges on my credit card after I had paid in full through a booking agency. Do a little research and you’ll find that this is a sneaky, fully legal charge and that the Tropicana isn’t the only hotel to use it. Just because you can, Tropicana, doesn’t mean you should. You certainly aren’t begging for my return with the practice. Overall, I’ll probably try something else of a comparable rate next time.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great weekend at the Trop!”
Reviews.Author: horsegal682
Reviews.Content: Arrvied at the Tropicana on a Thursday and was promptly checked in by Terry. He was very helpful and anwered all of our questions.
