Just by looking around, we could tell how much work had been done in the casino area. Eventhough it wasn't finished yet, it looked great and I'm sure it will look even better upon completion. Our room was nice and big with an ok view. The bathroom seemed alot bigger, which was great. However, the floors were a little dirty with tons of scuff marks. Other than that no complaints. The water pressure in the shower was awesome! The casino area was good. Everything was spread out a little due to the ongoing construction, but it wasn't bad. I didn't think there were that many table games, but am hoping once everything is completed there will be more. There were a nice assortment of slot machines. The service in the casino was a little slow, but not bad. We spent Saturday afternoon by the pool and had a good time. There were plenty of servers and Lifegaurds on duty. Our server, Cory, took great care of us. My only complaint is that it can get slippery by the pool, I was walking over to check in and slipped and fell. I wasn't hurt, but have a little bruise on my knee. Another woman slipped as well. Hopefully when the pool gets redone, they can put another kind of floor in. I think it gets slippery because its so smooth, maybe a more textured floor would be better. The pool area is great, lots of trees which provided nice shade. There was good music playing and people were having a blast. We ate at the Italian restaurant one night. It was ok. The penne I ate had lots of veggies in it, but didn't really have much of a sauce. My boyfriend had the chicken picatta, which was slightly overcooked and a bit dry. However, the clam chowder was amazing!! The best we'd ever had. We would probably try it again and order different things. Overall, we had a great time at the Tropicana. The hotel looks great and is going to look even better once the construction is completed. I am hoping to plan another trip before the end of the year and can't wait to come back to the Trop!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, new rooms, poor air conditioning which matters in the summer”
Reviews.Author: CassieinRSF
Reviews.Content: The rooms are all new and fresh which is great. Location is across street from MGM and New York New York. I paid about $50 for this room and it was fantastic value. The rooms have just been renovated so they are fresh and clean. However, the air conditioning is not effecient and in the summer months in Vegas at 100 degrees plus, you need the air conditioning. I ended up sleeping on the floor as close to the cool air as I could. I did let the front desk know. She apologised for the inconvenice and said she would send someone up to look at it. I think that was more than a inconvienence! A hotel guest sleeping on the floor??? I spoke to the manager and he took of the $9 resort fee for one of the two nights I stayed. Supposedly the a/c was working fine but I was not anymore comfortable the second night so I guess they just have an inefficient ac system and the temperature is as good as it gets. I would recommend this hotel if you can get it for around $50, but not in the summer months - too hot and rates are really competetive I would stay here in a heartbeat in cooler months. Mostly because I love the fresh rooms and it is a little smaller than other casinos. I have tired of walking a mile to the pool at other hotels BTW - if you stay in the Island Tower - you can take the elevator to "P" and this takes you to pool level. It is not marked and I ended upn taking the very long way- that's my tip.

Reviews.Title: “I dont think I would go back”
Reviews.Author: garlicspamsam
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tropicana for 3 nights and I think that was more than enough. The check in was quick and painless. The hallways to the rooms smell like pina coloda in a concentration that makes it very offensive. The rooms are nicely redecorated but there is no mini fridge, the air conditioner did not work and the one morning there was no hot water. The pool is nice but half of the pool area is being worked on and is planned to be open in 2011. There is not much choice for restaurants here so I would advise eating elsewhere. For the price it is okay but I dont think I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “WOW...CAN'T WAIT TO COME BACK!”
Reviews.Author: ollenip
Reviews.Content: To ease the pain of my 40th birthday, my husband and I decided with a few friends to go to VEGAS! We chose the Tropicana just because we had never stayed there and the pool looked great. What an experience from start to finish. Extremely pleasant staff who helped us from check in right up to check out with a ton of questions in between....from where to get a tattoo, to where to spend a quiet evening for dinner, to where the best spot to party would be. The rooms were great! Clean, cozy, and cool. The vanilla scented hallways were awesome! Our friends who stayed in the same hotel were on the same floor...we all arrived on different days, but once this was known that we were together we were pleasantly accomodated with staying on the same floor. To top it all off the management delivered for my B-day 2 beautiful chocolate covered strawberries and 2 small bottles of champagne. This was not requested, just something special they had caught on to while I was chatting with the staff on check in. What an awesome experience! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “NICE & NEW”
Reviews.Author: NATIVETEXANLUBBOCK
Reviews.Content: After reading rereading lot's of reviews we settled on the trop.Upon arrival we din't know what to expect.We were pleasantly surprised.Check in was a breeze room very large with great view of strip.New bed everything was very clean.Improvements were great.Casino is small but fun.Only complaint would be the front steps into hotel hard to lug luggage up them.Had other family members stay @ other hotels on strip.Our room was much better with a better price.Hotel is great for a budget traveler clean,large ,& new.

Reviews.Title: “A tropical stay at a beautiful hotel, right in the heart of the Las Vegas Strip!”
Reviews.Author: chelsea10_10
Reviews.Content: On our short visit to the strip before staying with family, the Tropicana was a perfect fit. We had a wonderful newly renovated room, with a beautiful TV and a bamboo theme! Our view of the Luxor and the Excalibur were awesome. At night both were lit up beautifully, and you could see the bright light on top of the Luxor. The service was exceptionally good. The 24 hour store was perfect for anything you needed. We had breakfast at the South Beach Deli (which was open 24/7), which was delicious. For such a short stay it was very worth it, such a perfect location on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: csrn1715
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Tropicana numerous times and this maybe our last. We were so disappointed. We weren't prepared to see so much construction going on "Where was the casino?" It seemed Baron. Everything we loved was gone. There were no more vendors in the hallway going towards the island tower. No daytime bird show, no evening bands at bar near island tower. No more game room by pool area ( it was empty). No bar at pool area (under construction) Swim up blackjack was not open (representative had told me it was open). No more Calypso cafe that was under contruction. The only places to eat were South Beach Cafe which had no atmosphere looked like it was in a basement and Havana Cafe was only good for a morning cup of coffee (if you like starbucks coffee) and a donut. The white marble floors was not a good choice constant scuff marks especially near entrance too hard to maintain. However, on a positive note, all the employees were very nice and pleasant. The valet attendants were a joy and very helpful. The paradise tower rooms were very nice. Loved the bed. The paradise tower is in a great location, right near main entrance, you don't have to walk a mile to get to your room which is a plus. The representatives on the phone should prepare the customer of all the construction going on and not to "down play it" All I heard from employees was when this is done it's going to be great but one thing they forgot this was my husband and my vacation we waited for 2 years to return and to be mislead was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Night”
Reviews.Author: ScottLasVegas_Nevada
Reviews.Content: Having never stayed at the Trop, I didn't know what to expect but had heard about the remodeling and it is a very impressive hotel! The service was phenominal and the room was amazing! We ordered room service at around 2am and were told it could take up to 30 minutes. It was almost 15 minutes, piping hot and delicious! Everything went seamlessly and every staff member that came in contact with us knew we were just married- nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “Great value right on the strip.”
Reviews.Author: StevePal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the tropicana for three nights as part of a bigger trip around the US. The price was great for a strip hotel, we got a 'buy two nights get one more free' deal direct from the hotel website. No breakfast with the eal, but theres no shortage of place to eat here, so thats no problem! The checking inn procedure was easy, room was huge and spotless. We were in the Paradise tower, which is now fully refurbished, as the rest of the hotel will soon be. It has the usual casinos, apparently the best pool in vegas (very nice!) and some nice eateries. As and idea of the hard work theyre doing here.......on the second morning, as we were leaving to find food (about 7am), there was a pool of water by the lifts being mopped up by a couple of guys. On our return an hour or so later, a team of workmen were busy replacing huge floor tiles, repairing leaking aircon unit. When we again left the hotel. about 3 hours later the job was finished and looked as though nothing had ever happened, fantastic! The Tropicana doesnt seem to be one of the big popular hotels here, but I'd recommended to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana has come a LONG way!”
Reviews.Author: NordicBlue
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tropicana on the tail end of my Vegas vacation. All I can say is, "Good job!" The renovations are still in progress, but what an improvement from the Crapicana that existed not too long ago! I stayed in the Island Tower, which was a bit of a walk, but it was worth it to stay in a newly renovated room. The bed was extremely comfortable, plasma TV and stereo with iPod docking station for entertainment, and the furniture and decor were very effective in creating a comfortable environment. My only qualms - 1. The shower head was placed fairly low on the wall, forcing me into a crouching position to wash my hair, and 2. The thermostat didn't show the room's temp, only what temp you have it set at. The AC was working, though, so no worries on that. One complaint I hear from people is that the Trop charges a resort fee of $11.99 a day, which gives guests access to amenities that most other hotels on the Strip charge a la carte: Wifi Internet ($14 at other hotels), Fitness Center ($25 at other hotels), Business Center ($15 at other hotels), and also gives you drink specials at their restaurants. For the internet alone, the resort fee should cause no worries for guests. Tip for your stay: Tired of waiting in line to check out? Use the "Check Out" feature on your TV under Guest Services. A few clicks on the remote control and you're ready to leave! I would definitely stay in the Tropicana again..... as long as the promotional rates for the newly renovated rooms continue!

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed but Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: tahiti_ldy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got a good deal for the Paradise room at the Tropicana ($63 NOT including resort fee of $9.99). They actually put us in the Island Tower which was fine since they had completed the remodel of that tower 2 week prior. The two best things about this hotel are : 1. Location. Easy walk to monorail or any other section of the always busy Strip. 2. The bed. Seriously. Best. Bed. EVER. This is what set it apart from let's say South Point Hotel and Casino who has all the same amenities as the just upgraded Tropicana but the location sucks and the beds are hard. I know a lot have raved about the rooms being "stunning" but to me it was just neat and clean and with all the amenities that everyone else has listed...not a whole lot of character to it. The casino is small. The pool seemed small and with the construction, it got a little crowded since they are working on the Nikki Beach section. However, construction itself never was a problem for us. We never heard it early in the morning and weren't tripping over tools and equipment during the day. Note that the pool closes at 7pm. Staff was friendly enough and let us do a late checkout of 2pm which was nice. There is WiFi in the rooms but I could never get mine linked up and in reality didn't pursue it much since there is way better things to do than sit around figuring out internet. All in all a pleasant stay. Perhaps my exceptions were really high from all the glowing reviews but the Tropiana's upgrades are great and make it a good deal for on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad stay but needs more”
Reviews.Author: NJDevil
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay somewhere in Vegas that wasn't too expensive and where I'd have a nice room. I came across recent reviews and pictures of the Trop and decided to give it a shot. I wasn't disappointed. I had booked an Island Tower room but was upgraded to a 20th floor strip view Paradise Tower room when I told the friendly front desk agent we were there to celebrate my birthday and had a very long day getting there thanks to the airline. There were literally no lines at check in. The room was spotless. It was a smoking room but I couldn't tell other than the ashtray and matches in the bathroom. It felt like we were the first people to stay there. The 42" HDTV was incredible. The bed and sheets were beyond comfortable and on most nights I slept great, however the walls are incredibly thin. Our second night there our neighbors had a raging party and it sounded like there were 30 people in the room. I realize this is Vegas so I didn't raise a stink and luckily I was so exhausted from my day I fell asleep again in the middle of the festivities. The next day I could literally hear every word of one guy's phone conversation in the same room. The other problem with the room is the blinds on the windows let in an incredible amount of light in the morning, despite the fact that I had them completely closed. It woke me up every day and it was tough to get back to sleep. I think they could easily install curtiains in front of the windows and blinds to correct this. The bathroom was nice, but I think with the upgrades they could have done more. The tub and shower were standard and I would have preferred a stall shower similar to what Mandalay Bay has. The sink area was great. The maids did a good job cleaning up but for some reason didn't like replacing our soap. Twice during our stay they took the bar of soap that we had just opened and didn't replace it. They also didn't replace our bath mat one day and we had to use a towel instead. I can't comment on the pool because we never used it. I wish we could have but it was over 110 degrees and the thought of lying out in that heat wasn't appealing to me. It looked great though, and the lounge chairs looked really nice as well. In visiting the other casinos on the strip you get the idea of how tiny the Trop is compared to everything else. This was both a good and bad thing. It was great because I literally had to walk a few feet to the elevators after checking in and when coming back from being out all day. The down side is that there really isn't anything going on at the Trop at this time. I know they're renovating but there are hardly any dining options or stores to check out. Other than the comedy club there aren't any shows, and the casino was tiny and due to the renovations it's kind of scattered. There are slots thrown here and there without any organization. The location of the Trop is ok, but be prepared to walk or take a cab to the heart of the strip. The walking was rough in the heat and cab prices added up very fast. As others have stated, the service is very friendly. We were greeted by everyone we passed and when we asked a maid in a hall for some soap, we were gladly given several bars. I think once the renovations are done and with a few tweaks of the rooms, it will be a great place to stay and an awesome value.

Reviews.Title: “The best sleep I have had in a very long time!!!”
Reviews.Author: mardigrasmama
Reviews.Content: We got an awesome deal on LasVegas.com on this hotel. We paid half of what the hotel would of charged us! so shop around! We were automatically upgraded to a renovated room in the Island Tower. The room was spacious and the beds were so comfortable that I am still dreaming of them! I am even thinking of purchasing one. GO to Serta Hotel Mattresses online. The hotel is still being renovated but it did not inconvenience us in any way and it was very clean. The hotel is also quieter and not quite as exciting as the others but it will be interesting to see how it will be after the renovations. All the major casinos are within walking distance. We were told check in was at noon but they let us go up at 11:30. They also said check out was at 11 but they let you stay until noon. NICE! The pool was clean and we had no problem getting a drink.. We had to show our room key to get a towel and we didn't notice any outsiders coming in. Great time overall!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good Experience”
Reviews.Author: janjanBoston
Reviews.Content: Checked in at 9pm...at the Tropicana...no one at the door to assist you or even hold the doors open...Lines were long...but we were invited guests - so we went to a different line...Had seen the hotel a few months ago was being upgraded, so thought we would stay there for a few days...checked into our room, which was newly done over - decor - ok...definitely an improvement. We went downstairs to eat and when we returned to our room - our bathroom was a mess ! Water backed up into the tub and all over the walls in the tub area - like mud sticking to the walls and the bathroom sink - called the front desk and waited over 30 minutes - finally called again and asked to be transferred to another room - which they did within 20 minutes...comfortable room Toured the pool in the morning, staff at the pool did not check hotel key - anyone can walk into the pool area...pool needed cleaning...that was enough for us ! we left !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Tropicana is lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Gigicommon
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Las Vegas from Detroit, MI On Monday, August 9th before 9 AM. Took a shuttle to the Tropicana where Doug checked me in. My room was not ready (check in time is 3 PM) but he permitted me to put my bags in the room I was assigned and expedited the cleaning of my room so it was available to me by 10:30AM! How's that for good customer service? My room was lovely and I almost felt guilty realizing how ridiciulously little my friend had paid for the it (I was in the Island Tower). I look forward to returning to Vegas and to the Trop in the not too distant future!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with new renovations minus the prostitutes”
Reviews.Author: MNVideo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Tropicana hotel In early August of 2009. The hotel was pretty nasty then but the pool was nice. In looking for a hotel for this summers visit, I looked into the Tropicana again. I noted that the Paradise tower had been completely remodeled in January of 2010. I noted the pictures of the renovated rooms and they looked pretty good. I decided to book a room for three nights. The end cost before resort fees was $160.00. Upon arriving the bellhop were nice and we tried to check in (9am) and unfortunately they sold out the night before so rooms would not be available until after noon or so which was not an issue as check in is at 3pm. Upon arriving to the room it looked new nice and fresh. The rooms, hallways and elevators were much nicer than last year. The bed was ridiculously comfortable. I am thinking of purchasing the same brand due to how nice it was. The AC was set to 60 degrees in the hotel and it stayed that way the whole time we were there. It was nice to come back to a comfortable hotel room after a days walking around. One day we arrived back at the hotel at 3am in the morning. I decided to go alone into the casino to see what was happening. There were a few people around a craps table having a great time and the staff was into it and laughing along with everyone. I watched the craps table for about an hour. The rest of the casino (which is ridiculously small as compared to other casinos) had maybe 10 people on machines 10-20 people in the table area. I noted that there was a woman walking around that looked out of place. She seemed to have no direction except eyeing people. She was very skinny and very tall black woman dressed with minimal clothing. After she wandered around for a while there was a very built black man and a very skinny tall black woman wandering around in the same manner. It appeared that they didn't know where they were going and looked out of place. The first thing that came to my mind was a pimp and a prostitute. Giving the people the benefit of the doubt I shrugged the thought off. I walked around the slot machines for a while and noticed a third skinny tall black woman that again looked out of place. This woman had her arms around two obviously drunken looking white men in their 20's sitting at a couple of machines. It was obvious that she did not know them and was propositioning them for something. I try to give the people the benefit of the doubt as to what this woman was up to but there were too many factors that this person was out of place and trying soliciting something. I didn't see anyone of the staff members or security approach these people and ask what they were doing. Besides that the only negatives were that one morning there were loud indistinguishable noises coming from the hallway or above floor like maintenance work. I think I would recommend this hotel for its price and value but I will personally be staying somewhere to get a little atmosphere change and be closer to the middle of the strip and a hotel with a decent casino.

Reviews.Title: “nice new rooms....excellent service”
Reviews.Author: phoenixdeb
Reviews.Content: after seeing so many good reviews of this hotel lately we decided to book a new room, as there are some really good deals out there for this hotel during the summer months. we were pleasantly suprised at the quality and cleanliness of the new rooms and we were very pleased with the excellent customer service we recieved form everybody. our check in was fast and courteous, all requests were graciously honored and early check in was not a problem. since the hotel is undergoing renovation, there isnt a big selection of places to eat, so if you are looking for a "destination" resort, look elsewhere...if walking across the street to other hotels to eat for a better selection of restaurants is ok with you, then this lack of selection will not be a problem. the steak house is open, but pricey and the coffee place is open and is very good for breakfast and quick sandwiches. gaming is ok.......table games were fun due to great dealers and low minimums for betting......slots were new and fairly plentiful. of course, there will be alot more gaming when all is done and from what i can tell, the casino will be beautiful. the pool is up and running, but there are even more plans to expand and renovate it. the pool is still surrounded by lush gardens, grass and trees that are still there from the original Trop (YEAH!!!!). i cant wait for end-of-renovation-day as i think this will be a beautiful, fun place to stay in a year or so. for those of us who are old enough to remember the original Trop this is a very welcome renovation. there wasnt a better place to stay and play than the old hotel, so i hope they get it right again. i cant wait!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: mmarnimitchell
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tropicana for 3 nights from the moment I walked in the door the service was outstanding and the pool was great. I would refer the Tropicana to anyone who is going to Vegas they made my vacation so nice.

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: pamtessitore
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Tropicana 3 times in the past 7 months - they have been wonderful, great service, except for trip in July, only because of the remodel - the staff is wonderful, friendly - just great! Planning another trip there in Sept. and looking forward to it. Mr. Kennon Wolff has been a wonderful help for any problems we have had. I would recommend this hotel to everyone! If you want great and friendly service - stay at the Tropicana, Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Great Renovation.”
Reviews.Author: Kristy1021
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a girls get-a-way to Vegas, which we booked completely last minute and through a travel site. I thought I knew what we were buying, when we booked our room at the Tropicana, I had stayed there several years ago. I was completely wrong… I could hardly believe what I saw as I walked in to the Tropicana. I knew the property was undergoing a renovation, but this is complete transformation. If memory serves me correct, the hotel was dark, dingy and very smoky. I walked through the door and saw bright, crisp clean and new. Add to that, no trace of cigarette smoke (which is a HUGE bonus in my eyes) and I knew this stay would be nothing like the first time I had visited. That was just the beginning. When I got to my room the bedding and furnishings were also brand new, including new flat screen TV’s. One of the most comfortable beds I've slept in while traveling. And, I travel for my job, frequently. Absolutely incredible! The guestrooms & bathrooms are both very spacious. The pool, which is where I spent the majority of my time was still wonderful. The pool attendant also mentioned that it would be resurfaced and have a little “facelift” once it closes for the season, sometime in October. However, the pool at the Tropicana has always been wonderful, so I’ve got no complaints. Finally, I know construction was taking place during our stay, but I definitely did not hear any "construction" noises and I was completely impressed with what is complete so far. Everything from new carpet, wall coverings, linens, the casino and I know more is coming. Definitely a hotel I will look forward to visiting again when I am in Vegas for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Trip”
Reviews.Author: SPUD101
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 days at the Tropicana. Had a fantastic time. The new rooms are great & the staff were all very friendly & helpful. The pool area was great & will be even better when the rest of the pool area is completed next year. Have stayed at numerous hotels on the strip & would recommend this holel as we will be going back on our next trip for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel...questionable service.”
Reviews.Author: vangj3n7
Reviews.Content: The good: This was the first time my husband and I ever went to Vegas, so I wanted to make sure our experience would be great. After reading several positive reviews about the Tropicana, I decide to book a room and take advantage of their summer deal ( 3nights stay with the 3rd night free). We arrived ten minutes before check in so we toured the hotel. Although there were some construction going on, it was not distracting. The walk ways were well let. The hotel had a delicious but not over powering coconut smell to set a tropical mood. The pool was very clean and attractive for all ages. It was not overly crowed like other resorts and there were plenty of lounge chairs for guest. - Gerad checked us in quickly. He was very friendly and full of smiles. He went over all the hotel fees, attractions, and entertainment. He made us feel like VIP; Thank you Gerad. - We stayed in the new rooms in the Paradise Tower. BEAUTIFUL AND SPACIOUS. The rooms are a must stay. The decor was modern. The king size bed was very comfortable and supportive( especially after long walks on the strip). There were plenty of closet and bathroom space. We had a fabulous view of the strip. The blinds kept all the flashy lights out so we slept peacefully. -The pool staff was friendly. They always made sure there were clean towels. The life guards were aware, professional, and enforce pool rules when guest were being reckless. - The sandwiches at South Beach Cafe were delicious and quite big. Had to share a sandwich with my husband. The Questionable: - Right after we checked in we were approach by Peter from guest services. He explained about the Polo Tower hotel tour and wanted set up an appointment. I kindly thanked him for the offer but explained it's our first time in Vegas and decline the offer. I then asked him about the hotel's reward services and if he could direct me towards the reward center. He told me," It's my first day working at Tropicana so I don't know. You'll have to ask another staff." I just stared at him as he turned around, drank his coffee, and began a conversation with another staff. I was extremely shock by his rude and unprofessional behavior and attitude. Every time we think of the beautiful Tropicana we will always think of Peter's horrible service. - Check-out was complicated. Gwen checked us out but over charged us for an extra night. I had to pull out my first receipt and explained that I had book for the summer package. She apologize and corrected the situation. We spent quiet some time waiting for the mistake to be cleared; We waited a few days for the money to be returned into our account. - Housekeeping was okay. They were friendly and provided my husband and I with clean towels. However, on our last day we decided to sleep in until 11:30am (since we don't check out until 1pm). We put the "do not disturb" sign on the door handle. However, house keeping knock on the door and woke us up so they could come in. Overall, the Tropicana is a beautiful hotel located perfectly on the strip (not too far but not too close to the traffic). Some staff provide great customer service and others need to be re-trained. I'm not sure if I will stay at the Tropicana again after my bad experience but I would suggest it to others who may have better luck and not experience what my husband and I went through.

Reviews.Title: “We had an excellent time at the Tropicana!”
Reviews.Author: chrisandbrent
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 4 nights/5 days in Las Vegas. We were celebrating our 16th anniversary so it was important that this trip go well. We have only been on one other 'major' trip (to Mexico) and I managed to get 2nd degree sunburn on the 1st full day so we were confined to our hotel room because I couldn't walk. Needless to say, that trip was a wash............ I contacted the hotel via email a few days before we arrived to ask about setting up some type of surprise for my husband, maybe chocolate covered strawberries in the room or something (I wanted to make up for the last disaster). The person that I corresponded with was very pleasant and advised me that they would have 'amenities' in our room, compliments of the hotel staff . (I apologize if this seems long winded but if you want to know what the hotel is all about, read on.) We arrived at the hotel just after noon on Sunday and found the lobby to be quite busy with check in/check out. The line up was kind of long but one of the hotel staff asked anyone waiting in line if they would like a bottle of water. In speaking to the front desk clerk, we were advised that our room was not ready yet and that we should come back in roughly an hour or so. I had to ask if there was something that we could do about our luggage because we didn't really feel like dragging luggage around outside in 103 F temperature. The clerk suggested that we find the doorman. We did look for the doorman for about 20 minutes but I guess he was on his break so we decided to sit outside and wait it out. I am not going to fault the hotel for any wrongdoing because the check in time is 3:00 PM (I believe). The Room: We stayed in room 2025 which has been recently updated. Nice room, super comfortable bedding/linens, large flat screen tv and a nice day bed lounger in front of the window. The only things we found wrong with the room were 1) looks like someone left some dark clothing on the tiles in the bathroom, which unfortunately stained the tiles & 2) there is a cover on the glass of the windows that makes taking pictures of the view kind of difficult. It would have been nice if the covering on the windows had been plain instead of black with little holes. Other than that, room was great! Location: The Tropicana is located at the intersection of Tropicana & Las Vegas Blvd South. The other three hotels at the same intersection are the MGM Grand, The Excalibur & New York New York. There is tons of stuff to see so make sure you have good soled shoes because you will do plenty of walking. It would be nice if the hotel was a little further north down the strip but you still have access to take the monorail or the 'Deuce' (double decker bus) to go further north down the strip. For us, the only major drawback to the location of this hotel was the fact that all of the helicopters use Tropicana Avenue as their guide to get back to the airport. The helicopters are going all day long and it can get annoying after a while. Restaurants: We only ate at the South Beach Cafe here. Menu is somewhat limited but the food that we ordered was excellent. Really good chicken wings! One thing that really impressed me about this little restaurant was the staff. They were pleasant, friendly and always smiling. Menu prices were reasonable. Pool Area: When I originally checked out this hotel on the hotel's website, I found it to be lacking information & pictures. What little pictures and write ups there were lead me to expect something other than what was actually there. On the website, it offers 'swim up to your own private island ($50/day)'. I was expecting that you would swim to this little island but in fact, it is just part of the pool deck sectioned off....you're still at the main swimming pool. To me, it just seemed like you would be paying $50 to reserve a lounge chair at the pool. As for the pool itself, it's a nice large pool and you never felt like it was over-crowded. There were always lounge chairs available. One thing about the lounge chairs on the pool deck was that it reminded me of a cruise ship, with all the chairs lined up in rows which kind of sucks because you don't really have the option of moving them around too far. The pool deck seems to need a little bit of grit or something on it....my husband watched a kid slip on the deck and fell onto his head. Be careful when getting out of the pool and walk slow. The lifeguards are on duty and won't hesitate to blow the whistle at anyone running on the deck. They also use a squeegie type tool to push the pooled up water on the pool deck into the drains. There were a couple of drawbacks that we noted...1) as they are still renovating, they have a section fenced off and on the other side of the fence, it looks like there might have been a pool or lagoons or something. Every now and then, if the wind shifted the wrong way, you would get a strong smell of sewage. I am assuming that it was just the stagnant water on the other side of the fence but it was unpleasant at times...and 2) there is a sign in the hotel, at the doors leading to the pool, advising guests that there is to be no 'outside' food or drink beyond the sign. I can understand not having glass containers brought down onto the pool deck, but I still think you should be able to bring your own bottled water, juice or pop (as long as it is in a plastic bottle), as well as snacks. There is a bar at the pool offering beverages (kind of pricey) but they do have two containers offering super ice cold water (for FREE). One container has lemons/limes with the water and the other has sliced cucumbers. I was a little sketchy about the 'cucumber' water but you have to try it.....it was really good and refreshing! The Casino: I can't really comment too much about the casino, to me, they are pretty much all the same. This hotel does offer you to sign up to be a club member (as do most, I believe) and during our stay, there was also a promotion to scratch off an amount on a ticket. Both my husband and I both got the same amount ($10) but that $10 was loaded onto our member cards and gave us $10 in free play. I thought that was nice of them to give you money to play with. (We made our way to the Riviera and signed up as 'club members' there and they gave us a WHOLE DOLLAR!) Housekeeping/Cleanliness: The housekeeping staff member that I met was great. I had to run back up to the room for something and she was already in our room. I said hello and she was very friendly and very apologetic when she asked that I put my card 'key' into the door, for security purposes. I had no problem with that and thanked her for doing that. I appreciated the position she was in and doing that was fine with me! Our room was always clean and the little shampoo/conditioner/shower gel & lotion bottles were always replenished if they were getting low. Some hotels give you the token bottles but they never get replaced so that was also a nice touch. The rest of the hotel was always clean. The Staff: So remember earlier, I mentioned about the staff member that I corresponded with via email and was promised complimentary amenities in our room? We arrived Sunday, got up to the room and nothing was there. No problem, I figured that they were waiting for me to check in. Sunday evening, nothing. Monday and Tuesday go by with no contact by the staff member or the other four staff members that were also copied on the email. On Wednesday, I was a little annoyed and went to the front desk to ask that a message be left with that particular staff member to advise her that we had checked in on Sunday and would be checking out on Thursday. One of the front desk staff members, Gwen, overheard my conversation and pulled me into another area (away from my husband because it was supposed to be a surprise) and asked me to explain the situation. After explaining, Gwen was horrified that a staff member would do such a thing. I suggested that maybe there was just a communication error but she was still shaking her head saying that what happened was wrong. She sent my husband and I to the South Beach Cafe for a complimentary breakfast and when we returned to our room later that afternoon, there was a beautiful wine & cheese basket delivered to our room, along with chocolate covered strawberries and a card wishing us a happy anniversary, which was signed by all the Front Desk staff working that day. Gwen went out of her way to see that the error was corrected and I cannot stress enough how thoughtful that was as well as appreciated. So now to the pros & cons: PROS: 1) Cleanliness of the hotel, 2) The Staff, 3) Nice pool, 4) Relatively good location on the strip, 5) Our flight didn't leave until 7:55 PM but the Bell Desk stored our luggage until our airport shuttle arrived, 6) Ice makers on every floor, along with pop machine ($2/pop). CONS: 1) Helicopters use Tropicana Avenue as their guide to get back to the airport and these things are flying non-stop all day long so it can get annoying, 2) No fridge in room, 3) If you don't have a credit card, you have to have your phoneline 'turned on' in order to make a local call, 4) Resort fees.....if you have to pay the resort fees, the internet should be included. I did bring our laptop but it was $12.99 for 24 hours, which I certainly wasn't going to pay since I didn't plan on sitting on the computer long enough to get my money's worth. I just wanted to send our kids an email to advise them that we arrived safely but it was cheaper to text, 5) Telemarketers right in the hotel lobby, trying to sell you timeshares. We had never been to Vegas before so we had no idea what was really going on. We had only just arrived when we got cornered by two woman, which I thought were part of the hotel staff. We were offered a ride in the limo, free dinners and show tickets and we stood there listening to all of this until she mentioned '2 hour presentation'. STOP! We're on vacation.......not shopping for condos! (Just as a side note: these people are not limited to the hotel lobby, they are EVERYWHERE, in every hotel and I swear, on every street corner! Just learn to say 'no thank you'. Also, while I'm on the topic of street corners.....both men & women will be on the sidewalks, spread out along the strip. They have business cards that they 'snap' and 'click' and try and shove into your hands. These business cards are for 'escorts' (ya right). They even have a catalogue! Only in Vegas, LOL! To the women reading this, don't be offended if your husband is offered these cards, these people offer this stuff to EVERYONE, including kids, so if you plan on bringing your kids along (which I personally wouldn't recommend), have a pep talk with them BEFORE you start your journey. You will also find many, many vendors on the walkways/sidewalks offering you water for $1. If you go when it is as hot as it was for us, you will appreciate paying the $1/bottle, and the water is ICE COLD! Also, if you are in the mood to get a tattoo, we found a shop further north down the strip, Rockstar Tattoo, located between the Wynn & the Riviera. Shop rates $100/hour much better than the rates charged further south on the strip in hotels.) This hotel is in the middle of a major transformation. There were guests of all ages but it seemed like there were a lot of 'mature' adults. It looks to me like the Tropicana is trying to bring in a new group of guests and they are well on their way of achieving their goals. There is a new 'beach' concept that is scheduled for completion in 2011 which looks really cool. So would we recommend this hotel to others or stay there again?? Most definately!! Even though there were a few bumps along the way, we had an excellent time. We will definately be back because we didn't see half the stuff we wanted to and I am rather intrigued to see the completion of the renovations. Not to mention the staff, their kindness did not go unnoticed and they need to pat themselves on the back for a job well done! No one was rude, other than a lot of tourists, who don't know how to say please or thank you when the door is held open, etc. We could always tell when someone was Canadian because they were either smiling, thanking you or apologizing for bumping into you. It is great to be Canadian!!! Give the Tropicana a try and you won't be disappointed!!!

Reviews.Title: “thouroughly enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: murmin
Reviews.Content: had stayed here years ago so on our trip to celebrate our 40th anniversary decided to return. checked in on saturday 17 late and our room had been given up so were upgraded to suite wow huge and beautiful thanks guys. left on the 18th to return on the 24th. met with nicole and she assured us our rooms in the paradise tower would be waiting for us on the 18. everything was perfect - thanks nicole and the mac and chees lobster as good as you described. spent 3 wonderful days there and could not be happier, everyone was so helpful and courteous. from the restaurand to the big guy in the players club what a riot he was. definitely preferred the tropicana to the bigger noisier crowded ones . cant wait to come back. thanks to nicole for making our 40th anniversary special. we will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Best Christmas Vacation EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: VegasLover0000
Reviews.Content: I was a bit nervous booking this hotel due to bad reviews that I read but I am glad I did. I have been to Las Vegas numerous time and this was the best hotel so far. To start, upon check in we were given vouchers for free shows and drinks, not buy 1 get 1 or $ off the price, it was totally free. That was so great! To feel valued right from the moment you check in. Actually, come to think of it the doormen were also great even before we got into the hotel and help us to get our bags inside and up the steps. Our room was not the fanciest but still, it was clean and comfortable. We asked for a strip view and were given a room on the side looking out to the MGM and a part of the strip. It wasn't exactly what I was expecting for a view but still was beautiful. We were 3 floors up but there was no noise from the strip below. We had a television, safe, couch and table in our room with the king bed we requested. After leaving our room, we went to the bar near a little restaurant, I think it may have been a deli, the bar was in a corner with only a few machines and sort of away from the main crowd. The bartender was extremely nice and friendly and new we were Canadian by our drinks. He proceeded to tell us the origin of our drinks and how they related to Canadians. I thought it was very nice that he went out of his way to know facts about other countries and to share them with us. It made us feel special. The drinks he made were perfect, I don't always get my drink exactly as I want it but he got it bang on. We had a few drinks and then left. We had gone back later and each day after in hopes he would be there again but no luck. We ate at the deli/restaurant near the theater and elevators to our room, it was great. I tried several different items and all satisfied me quite nice. We also ate at the buffet, you can get a 24 hour pass for $30, not a 1 day pass but a 24 hour pass. We got ours early in the day so we could have breakfast, lunch, dinner and then breakfast again the next morning before it expired. LOVED IT!!! The food was good, great selection, and the wait staff were very friendly every time. There is a self serve drink station but a few times the wait staff would go and get our drinks for us. Very nice! There is a resort fee but I can't remember what it was or what it included. I have read alot of reviews complaining about this fee but it seems to be becoming popular among the hotels in Vegas, so get used to it. In general the stay was great and it was my first time going in "winter". Christmas in Vegas is beautiful and for anyone who hasn't seen it, you should check it out, very unique. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE the new Tropicana!!”
Reviews.Author: family_of_four_mn
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our stay at the new Tropicana. We went to Las Vegas to celebrate my 40th birthday and our 10th wedding anniversary. We booked our room from the hotels website and got a package deal which included a standard room in the Paradise tower. Before we left I contacted Nicole Marshall, the Guest Experience Manager. I explained to her the reason for our visit and asked if I could get a free upgrade or discount. I honestly did not expect to hear back from her but a few days after sending her the email she replied telling us she arranged for us to stay in one of their suites for no additional fees. We were very surprised and couldn't wait to get to Las Vegas. Our package included VIP check in. We arrived at the hotel at 11am and went to the VIP line. There was one other couple waiting to check in in this area and about 20 people trying to check in in the non VIP line. We waited only a few minutes and then we were greeted by Doug. Doug explained to us that our room was not ready yet and to come back around 1pm. He informed us that we could check our luggage at the bell desk, which we did. We went and had lunch and returned at 1pm. Doug explained to us that our room still was not ready and to come back at 2pm. It was a little frustrating but well worth the wait. They did not want to move us into another suite because the one we were booked in was a great suite. So at 2pm we finally were able to get into our room. All I can say is WOW - WOW - WOW! It was unbelievable. I have posted some pictures for you all to see as well. Two HUGE rooms and the view was outstanding. We were right on the corner of the strip and could see MGM, NYNY and all the way down the strip. We took a look around the room and everything was just perfect. I could still smell the fresh paint. The bed was so comfortable my husband even made a comment about it. He normally wakes up with a sore back but he said that with this bed he did not. There were only a few things that were not working right - the brand new TV in the living area would skip channels (so we just watched the TV that was in our bedroom) and the AC unit in the bedroom would make a terrible noise during the night. (On the last night my husband got up and tapped the unit a couple times and that made the noise go away). The hotel itself was still being remodeled but it was very clean, NO NOISE at all!! The pool was great, very clean and refreshing. The casino/hotel is much smaller than the ones close by but this is what we liked. It was easy to find your way around. The elevator to the Paradise tower was right by the front door. The elevators are not air conditioned but we did not have to wait for the elevator like others have mentioned in their reviews. It is a beautiful hotel in a great location. The people that work there were always very friendly and because of the upgrade that Nicole gave it made this vacation one to remember. My husband and I did not want to leave. I would highly recommend staying at the Tropicana! Deanna

Reviews.Title: “The Way Vegas Was Meant To Be”
Reviews.Author: brianNslc
Reviews.Content: Well that use to be Tropicana's motto. And it was comical. I had stayed at the Tropicana a couple times in the past based on the great price but knew what to expect from the rooms and casino. Old and tired. But things are changing for the better! I booked a last minute room and was put in the "Garden" area of the hotel which has not been renovated, so I was not surprised to open the room door to the same old awful room. But the next morning we asked if any of the Paradise Tower rooms had become available and were immediately given room keys to a new room. WOW. What a difference. Modern rooms with new beds, 42" plasma tv, updated bathroom, new carpet, new furniture, shutters on the windows, and a great feel. My fear is the prices will begin to creep up, but as long as they stay competitive and hopefully cheaper than the competition I will be back. Also, they offer a $5 craps table which you can't find at any of the bigger hotels on the strip. That was a big plus for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and super service!”
Reviews.Author: makinmajik
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Island Tower. It is the one closer to the airport. They are close to finished with renovations in that tower. The new rooms are all they appear to be in the web pictures. Wonderful beds, and furnishings. They still have a lot of work to do on the casino, other tower, pool, etc. I was impressed at how little the construction effected our stay. Pool is great, and will be better when they finish. Overall, a great place now and a sure bet when the work is done. We will be back! One other thing, it may be the best location in town. Close to the airport, lots of great casinos in walking distance, or take the Excaliber/Mandalay tram. And cat stops right outside the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mofofohosho
Reviews.Content: Myself amd 2 buddies stopped in Vegas for 1 night on our way to San Diego and booked at the Trop. It is amazing what they are doing there. From the doorman to the Front desk the service was great. We checked into the paradise tower and were blown away by the new rooms. The pool area, which was voted best in las vegas was great also, from the DJ to the swim-up blackjack tables. The casino bosses and dealers were the most friendly, that I have ever experienced. ( not to say that I made a few bucks at the blackjack table ). Looking forward to staying there again, on our way back east.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location and Price!”
Reviews.Author: MDelf
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana looks fabulous! The staff was very helpful and friendly from the time I checked in until the time I checked out. My room was newly renovated and had an amazingly comfortable bed and awesome flat screen TV. The Tropicana is located in the middle of the strip, so for the price and quality of hotel this is the best place to stay in Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad for the Price”
Reviews.Author: MirandaPr
Reviews.Content: I was in Las Vegas for a roller derby convention, and a lot of the attendees stayed at the Tropicana (me included). We were in the Paradise Tower, which was recently renovated. It was pretty nice. The beds were comfortable, with cotton sheets and pillowtop mattresses. I would have preferred a down pillow, though. The pool is beautiful but closes at 7 p.m., which seems strange to me in summer in a 24-hour town like Las Vegas. There is a $12.99 per day charge for in-room wireless internet, which I found outrageous. The 24-hour McDonald's on the Strip (about a five-minute walk away) has free wifi, though. An in-room refrigerator costs $30 a day, which I also found ridiculous. The staff were universally pleasant and helpful. I didn't see anything gross (like bugs or anything like that). Other than the lack of free wifi, my only complaint is that the elevators and walkways were uncomfortably warm.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful time we had!!”
Reviews.Author: christine51891
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tropicana for a quick weekend getaway and didn't expect to feel like royalty... The Paradise Tower, recently remodeled, was absolutely gorgeous! The room was so big! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We very much enjoyed our stay here and would highly recommend the Tropicana to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: traveller41Uk
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 5 nights and a very good stay .on check we asked if could get upgraded to the paradise tower and she went through the diff price options to upgrade, we decided not to upgrade but then we got upgraded to the island tower for free which was a good gesture . the room was on 14th floor, overlooking on the rear not the strip . the room was good size ..very very clean .. had a queen bed with pently of mirrors all round and a fold out sofa bed. the bathroom was a good size with a corner bath. we asked for a late checkout and we were offerred a couple of hours extra and due to an evening flight we were also able to leave our luggage in the secure storage area. all the staff we were very helpful and friendly . the pool was very good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lindakysr
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Tropicana was great. The room was clean and spacious. I would (and did) rate the Tropicana a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “tropicana delight”
Reviews.Author: ballooball
Reviews.Content: great value for money !! and great staff !! some work being done but not a problem

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel201011
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Las Vegas. We had no Idea where to stay, so while driving down the strip we saw the Big reader board out front claiming the new rentovations and first in class status. We were not told while booking that our room was not one of the new rooms. Our room was awful!!! Not only was it dark, it had rust in the bathroom sink, mould in the tub/shower ,the carpet was filty and smelled. We had just travled across the US by car and had spent the majority of our nights in Best Western type Motels. All of which were far nicer than what we had at the Trop. I would have expected this type of room at one of the Motel/Gas Station/Stores out in the bonnies, but ont on the Strip. We have already made plans to return to Las Vegas but will never set foot in this dump again. Please be sure to ask if you will have a new room. Location was good for walking, which is what we did all night so we didn't have to go back to our room. We paid 85.00 for one nights storage and a place to change our clothes and got out.

Reviews.Title: “Fab, Fab, Fab!”
Reviews.Author: Shegalah
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tropicana with two friends from the 10th to 16th July 2010. We had stayed here 4 years ago so we were looking forward to seeing the renovations - we weren't disappointed. We had a room in the newly refurbed Paradise Tower - it definitely has the wow factor with great views up the Strip, huge room beautifully decorated and very clean. The pool was fantastic and we loved the relaxed party atmosphere there. We mostly ate outwith the hotel but we did have some snacks from the South Beach Deli and the Havanna Deli. The Buffet appeared to be shut when we were there for refurbishment. All staff were very helpful and did their best to make sure we had a great stay. Will definitely be back to Vegas and will be making the Tropicana our base again.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana is fresh, clean, and cares”
Reviews.Author: clint52
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the "Trop" for two nights, 7/25-7/27, in a newly remodeled Paradise Tower room. Overall, a great trip. For me, the key difference between the "old" and "new," was the customer service. I am not sure if this will be permanent but it seemed someone was always around to hold open a door or lend a hand with directions. We were even allowed to check-in early by a very professional and polite lady at the desk (Sarah). Because we were visiting friends and relatives, we did not eat in the restaurants or use the pool so I can not review those areas. The room was terrific. Clean, fresh, with a big screen TV and a very wonderful bed. Nothing bad to report, just a quiet comfortable room. As it turns out, one of the people we were visiting had a friend working at the Trop and they secured a Family and Friends rate which is about 50% of whatever you pay. The ongoing rate at the time was $58 a night($51 + 7.99 resort fee). The remodel effort means some areas of the casino are closed off but it did not inconvenience us at all. I say stay here BUT note the remodel is incomplete in that the Garden Rooms are still run down with old carpet.

Reviews.Title: “WOULD STAY AGAIN!!”
Reviews.Author: Travelor96
Reviews.Content: We went for July 4th week and had a nice time! We stayed in the Paradise Tower rooms and they were nice. When we walked in we got suckered into a time share presentation since they said they would give us 2 free show tickets, a $50 voucher for their Legends Steakhouse Restaurant and a free 3 day 2 night stay at the Diamond Resorts to use within 6-18 months. We picked the Hypnosis Unleashed show and I didn't enjoy it at all. The Legends Steakhouse Restaurant was pretty good. They have a buffet across from the restaurant and I didn't like the food there. I also didn't like the food from the South Beach Cafe. The sandwiches and salads are ok but that's about it. I played blackjack at several casinos in Vegas but had the best luck playing at Tropicana. The good thing is that they also have $5 tables 24/7. You won't find that anywhere else in Vegas. They also have 1 or 2 non-smoking tables which I love! The casino is not busy like others are and it's very quiet. There is a lot of white (floors and walls) so it makes the casino look bright inside compared to others. It's also very cold in there! The pool was also nice if you like to just relax. The chairs are very comfortable! It's more of a family style atmosphere. We played enough blackjack so they comped our room upgrade and food. Overall, we had a nice time at Tropicana and I would recommend it. If you go on their website, you will see pictures of their Paradise Tower rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience, Poor Customer Service...Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelerrrr123
Reviews.Content: Someone tried to break in to our rental car and we had cockroaches in the bathroom. We stayed at the Tropicana while visiting and hosting a guest form out of the country. We had 2 rooms and one had cockroaches in the bathroom. When we reported this to the front desk they offered us a ticket for a free drink which they give to each guest upon checking in or anyone playing penny slots. We weren't looking for anything free just wanted a room without cockroaches but they would not accomodate us in changing rooms. Our big issues were with how an incident was handled that happened in Tropicana's parking garage during our stay. When we went to leave after our second night We noticed our rental car had been damaged while in the parking lot. There was chipped paint by the drivers side door and window as if someone had attempted to break in with a crowbar. The damage was obvious and we had moved the rental since we parked it upon arrival. There are signs that clearly state that Tropicana is not responsible for anything that happens to your car while parked there, however, it seems like security guards might notice someone attempting to break into a car with a crowbar. We understood the casino not being liable for the damage and when we noticed the damage we tried to file a report so the insurance company and rental car companywould know of the damage and attempted break in. This is where we had problems. We talked to a security guard who referred us inside to talk to a security supervisor named George Cardenas who was EXTREMELY UNHELPFUL. He was very defensive and acted as if he just wanted us to stop bothering him. We just wanted documentation acknowledging the fact that someone attempted to break in and caused damage to the car but he acted like we were asking for money to repair the damages or something. He was very rude and unprofessional. Overall it was a negative experience and I wouldnt stayt there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great new rooms, grose old room and not to good service”
Reviews.Author: Alanis82
Reviews.Content: I don't know how to rate this hotel, because at the same time we think it's great but on the other hand not. We arrived July 3rd, in the evening. We booked our room in May( because we new it is very busy time in LV) and payed for the room in the renovated Paradise Tower which was perfectly clear since the price was not low. After waiting in a long line to check in, after seeing a scared face of a lady that was checking us in, I asked what's wrong and she said there is a problem with a room- meaning- there isn't any for us!Come on, we paid for it in May!And we were on our honeymoon which made us much more angry. Some other guy came and started to search something in the computer with no comment. We stayed there for I think 15-20 minutes. He told us they are overbooked because it is 4th of July so he will give us a room in the old Island Tower. We said we don't want the old one, because we booked our room in May and paid for it 120 $ per night. He told he can't do anything and left. with now I am sorry or anything. Nothing. We didn't like that- no appology at all.What could we do, it was 4th of July weekend and everything was booked so we had to took the old room. The room was huge, but very old, like from the 80, but the view was spectacular. Trully , we were affraid to walk barefoot on the carpet. It was hideous with some red stain just in the middle of the room. Everything was old, even tv. The next day we were told , we can move to our new room. First they told us, someone will come to pick us up and our luggage, but when I called the reception we end up going to the lobby with our luggage, waiting in a long line again to get the key to our new room. Our new renovated room was wonderfull, worth the price 120$ a night. Everything was new, even shampoo and gel shower was different- better!( we could compare). It is like a different world. In the end, we liked the hotel, the pool area is great, though casino is small which is not a problem, because MGM is really close. The location of the hotel is perfect and it is not huge, so you don't have to walk miles to find your car. We didn't like the service. I read so many great reviews about the staff, but I wouldn't agree with them. We were treated in a very unpleasant way. In sum Old rooms- they are just old and crumpy- don't go there New rooms- worth comming, very nice and classy Staff- so so ( the ones we were served by) Location- Awsome

Reviews.Title: “Had a blast at The Tropicana!”
Reviews.Author: rnt96
Reviews.Content: Since this was our first trip to the "strip" we had no idea if we made a good choice of hotel or not. Needless to say, we were very pleased with everything the Tropicana had to offer.The service was great, the price was right, it was very comfy and the casino , although smaller than most, was definately where we wanted to sit and play. We are planning to stay here agin on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed our stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Hills2008
Reviews.Content: The staff were ALL helpful and friendly. Stayed in the new rooms - the beds were extremely comfortable. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room with a great view”
Reviews.Author: mnky7275
Reviews.Content: The paradise tower is great. The room was like new and the hotel is definetly getting better. Check-in was a little slower than I expected but once to our room we forgot all about it. I will definetly stay here again and will recommend it to any one. The staff was friendly. The best part about the room was the bed. It is the best in Vegas and I am now looking for one for my room. The price for wi-fi was a little steap but needed it for work. Overall it was a great experience. Stay and be surprised!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait To Go Back!!!”
Reviews.Author: fkrumland
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 40th wedding anniversary in April and decided to go on a trip to Vegas. We had stayed at the Tropicana before and have always loved it there. We thought about staying somewhere else, but we decided to stay with the Trop, and we are so glad we did! After booking rooms in the Island Tower, I started reading some of the reviews and became concerned. We thought some of those rooms would be done by July, so I contacted Nicole Marshall, who said that those rooms would not be ready , and she was upgrading us to the Paradise Tower! She answered all my questions and was ready to help in any way she could. I hope the Trop knows what an asset she is to them! We were in our room about 10 minutes and the phone rang. It was room service, saying they had a surprise for us! It was champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries, and an anniversary card! We couldn't believe it! What a way to start our vacation! The room was awesome, beyond our expectations! We spent a lot of time at the pool, loved the music! The pool is one of the main reasons we stay at the Trop! Another reason is that the hotel/casino isn't so huge that you get lost. We ate at he South Beach Cafe, delicious, but you can share a sandwich, portions are huge! Havanna Go Go is a good place for coffee or a snack. We had a great stay at the Tropicana, and it is only going to get better! We can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel under construction, but still a good stay.”
Reviews.Author: loucaz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is undergoing renovation so there is one tower that is renovated and the other is in dire need of renovation. The photos that are shown online are of the renovated section of the hotel. I ended up having the pleasure of staying in both sections of the hotel. The section of the hotel that needs renovation is stained, musty and drab. The renovated section is bright, cushy, clean and…paradise compared to the other section. So just beware when booking to make sure which section you are staying in. Those photos on the travel websites are misleading. Other than that my stay was enjoyable. The staff is wonderful and friendly. The pool was clean and relaxing. I only give the 'rooms' and 'cleanliness' three stars due to the unrenovated section. the renovated section gets five stars all around.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT experience at the Tropicana!”
Reviews.Author: LaiJo2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tropicana for 7 days and 6 nights and were very pleased. I was not sure what to expect but Nicole Marshall answered all of my questions and reassured me of whatever I was questioning. She is definitely an asset to the Tropicana and without her assistance I would have picked another place to stay while in Vegas, but I sure am glad I went with the Tropicana. I did tell one of the front desk staff to tell her I said thank you because we had a wonderful experience. This was our first time in Las Vegas and everyone at the hotel was extremely nice and helpful. I actually liked the size of the casino at the Tropicana because it was adequate and I didn't get lost like I did in some of the bigger hotels and casino's. Even though the Tropicana is at the end of the strip, it always had a lot of people in it. We stayed in the newly renovated Paradise Tower and it was absolutely beautiful. The beds were especially comfy and cozy and my fiance' certainly enjoyed the size of the T.V., when we did watch it. We had a wonderful view of the MGM and could see the beautiful lights at nighttime. The bathroom was nice as well and the room service was great. We always had fresh towels and our bed linens were changed about every day, even though we didn't request our bed linens to be changed everyday, clean linens are always great! When I showed pictures to my family, they all thought the hotel and bedrooms were beautiful. If I had a question the front desk answered it and they always were very helpful. Even though the Tropicana is at the end of the strip, there was transportation available in front of the hotel (across from Excalibur) or you could walk over pass the MGM and buy a $7 24 hour shuttle pass. I only had a couple of issues with the hotel. The first being the elevator's were extremely hot but I am pretty sure they were trying to fix that. The wait for the elevator to take you to your floor or to the main lobby/casino level took FOREVER and there was always crowds of people waiting. There is only four elevators and I didn't see any stairs to take. We were pretty much at the top of the hotel but I wouldn't have minded walking up them if it meant not waiting forever. The hotel is clean, but they always had cleaning ladies directly in front of the elevators or near the elevators mopping or what not, but oh well, at least the floor was clean! It was kind of annoying because there's really only one or two ways to get to the elevator's and it was blocked by the cleaning ladies, or the crowds of people trying to get on the elevator. There was also a pretty long line checking in, but probably not as bad as some other hotels, it didn't really bother me. They were extremely nice and thorough when they checked you in and very friendly, so that's all that matter's I guess. The one thing that did bother me is when we first checked into the hotel, the person at the front desk told us the pool was open until 7pm during the week and 8pm on the weekends. However, we rushed back on a Saturday from what we were doing to go enjoy the pool since it supposedly closed at eight. When we got down to the pool one of the staff members let us know that it was closing at seven, which was in 5 minutes from when we got down there, needless to say I was not pleased. I even looked at the brochure when we first checked in because I thought I misread what the person at the front desk wrote down, but it did say the pool closed at 8. This was another issue because I did not like the fact the pool closed so early. I have never heard of a pool closing at seven during the week, and especially on the weekends, and in Las Vegas no less?? I think they should definitely consider closing at a later time. The pool was nice and I would have liked to been able to lounge around pass seven. There needs to be better communication between the front desk and pool because when I questioned the pool staff girl, she automatically said, "Oh, did the front desk tell you that it closed at eight?", to which I responded, yes. So i knew there wasn't great communication there. The pool issue really bugged me, but oh well, I did enjoy the time I did get to spend there, none the less. Although the hotel is under construction, it didn't phase us at all. We did trying Bacio, the Italian restaurant at the Tropicana and it was very good. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anybody and I have recommended it to family and friends who regularly go to Vegas or want to go. Very pleased and happy...just fix the pool hours please!!

Reviews.Title: “Modest but still comfortable”
Reviews.Author: purple2183
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room on the first floor in a wing off the casino. It has not been renovated yet so it's somewhat outdated and due to have some work done. However, it was still comfortable and adequate. Blinds kept the light out so it was super dark. Also pretty quiet even though we were right next to the casino. The biggest downside was that the shower was awful (shower head super low.. kept banging my head and I'm 5'8", also pressure wasn't much more than a strong trickle and temperature fluctuated) and our AC didn't seem strong enough to combat the July heat (110-115 most days) very well. Service was AMAZING though. I just loved the staff. Anything we asked for was brought immediately and with a smile. I would stay here again but upgrade to a better room.

Reviews.Title: “unexpected pleasantries”
Reviews.Author: gunggung
Reviews.Content: In July, My family of 4 decided to stay at the newly renovated and still renovating Tropicana Hotel in Las Vegas. Since the hotel is still renovating, we were a little skeptical but after talking to Nicole Marshall (one of their guest experience specialist), she convinced us to come and experience what the new Tropicana is planning. She handled my special requests like connecting rooms, close to the elevators since I have bad knees, and even supplied us with a mini refrigerator for my wife's medicine. The rooms were realy clean and large and the beds were so firm and yet very comfortable. I would highly recommend Tropicana to all my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Best spot to be pampered”
Reviews.Author: pattipmoose
Reviews.Content: Stayed @ the Trop For my husbands "60th" surprise Bday..We arrived on Sunday and the family (7 peo) arrived on Monday...The Trov. met them @ the airport w/limo and had them all checked in w/the players card and rooms all ready. This was soo helpful as we were trying to keep it a secret from the Bday boy...they were professional and wonderful to all of my family, the rooms were amazing w/strip views and adjoining rooms, Dinner @ the Legands was the best of any strip we have eaten at..The service was above and beyond, the waiter(Mike) even sang in itilian HAPPY BIRTHDAY..how special.. I will never stay anywhere else. They treat you like family and the good side of the family.... The remodel is also top quality..We have stayed there all through the remodel and were never put out by noise or construction... They can only go up from my point of view. Just wanted to share my happy thoughts. Patti Patoka Wisconsin

Reviews.Title: “Could see myself staying here in the future”
Reviews.Author: DebMichelle
Reviews.Content: This trip, I did not stay at the Tropicana, but I visited the casino, sports book, & a restaurant there. I had been there prior to this trip & felt like the casino was dark and dirty...hardly what is known as the current Vegas experience. This trip, we walked through the bright casino, remodeled with beautiful attention to detail. It looked like classic Las Vegas met sunny paradise! The service at most areas we visited was friendly & outgoing. And, the perks for signing on for a players card were super...$10 free dollars in my case. Overall, an outstanding turn around from what I had just seen last October! If you haven't been to the Tropicana since the remodel, you haven't been to the Tropicana! Give it another chance!

Reviews.Title: “OK, But Trop still a ways to go to be 'best in class'"”
Reviews.Author: CZLAW
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay at the Tropicana. The Tropicana is currently promoting itself with the tag line, "We're changing everything." Well, they might be changing everything, but the job isn't done yet. It will be a while before they truly can claim to be "best in class." Right now, the Trop has good points, so-so points, and a few downright down points. That doesn't mean you should rule it out, but you should go in with an open mind to the idea that this is a hotel in transition, and there are still some warts around the edges. We stayed in the newly remodeled Paradise Tower. It is important for anyone staying at the Trop to understand that they are undergoing a remodelling that began with their Paradise Tower, and is moving through to the Island Tower now. The "garden rooms" have NOT been renovated at all as of this time. We had time to explore all areas of the hotel, and there are still vast differences between the newly remodelled tower and the other parts of the hotel. The overall effect is sort of schizophrenic as a result, which likely accounts for the wild disparity between reviews. First, the positive: The Trop is a very convenient place to stay if you want to be near all of the action on the strip. It is an easy walk across the walkways over Las Vegas Blvd. to MGM Grand, Luxor, NY-NY, and the tram to the Mandalay Bay. We liked the fact that the Tropicana is not as "hustle and bustle" as the other hotels and casinos nearby. A plus is that you do not have to walk through miles of casino space to get to the elevator to the Paradise Tower. Parking was ample and free. Our deal, booked through the hotel, was three nights for the price of two, $69 a night plus resort fee of $8.99. The deal included two free drinks in the bar (well only) for each night of our stay, as well as a free apetizer in Legends, the Trop's best restaurant. Check in was speedy (our deal included VIP check in). Our room in the Paradise Tower was nice. Everything was new, down to the wallpaper. Comfortable bed, spacious room and bath. A nice touch was the hand makeup mirror in the bathroom. Although our room was right by the elevator, we weren't bothered by any noise. Overall, it was very comparable to our room at the Bellagio where we stayed several years ago. Now, for so-so parts of the Trop. Construction is definitely occurring here. I am putting this in the "so so" part, because, honestly, it really wasn't all that obtrusive in most parts of the hotel. (See the section on the Garden View rooms below however). Yes, there are some large white screens in the lobby/casino, and, from time to time you might hear a bit of noise while walking through the public areas, but, overall, it was easy to ignore. The Trop's restaurants should also be classified as "so so" It does have several places to eat --- two of them are more coffee shop, order at the counter types of places. We had dinner at Legends, the Trop's "upscale" option our first night. NOTE: The Trop is currently advertising a $34 "four course" dinner with wine pairings at Legends.
