Sounds like a good deal, and that is why we decided to eat at Legends. However, our waiter immediately warned us that this is really to be considered a "tasting menu" not a DINNER. When we looked at the actual menu for what was being served, we both had a good laugh. The four courses were as follows: First course: One scallop Second course: One shrimp and two mussels Third course: One short rib Fourth course: cup of sorbet We couldn't help wondering if the wine would be served in a thimble. We felt that this was something of a "bait and switch" -- get you in the door for the "price fixe" then tell you that you will starve to death if you don't order something else. Still, our regular dinners were fine (nothing out of this world), although we would have probably given the experience a higher rating if the view had been a bit better (our window table overlooked a flat empty roof). There were also some aspects of the new rooms that we found lacking. For instance, the shutters in the rooms look nice - until you turn off the lights to go to bed and realize that all the lights of the Strip are shining directly between those shutter slats. They really need to have some sort of black out curtains! Also, the "daybed" that they show in all of the pictures looks great, until you realize that it is impossible to sit on because there is no back to it, and there is only ONE "real" chair in the room, a very hard desk chair. If you have more than one person in the room, the other person will end up having to sit on the bed. Finally, we couldn't remember the last time we'd stayed in a hotel where there was no coffee maker! These are the little things that really make you feel comfortable and at home, and they were just not quite up to snuff. I wonder whether the interior decorators actually spent a night or two in the rooms they designed. :) We also felt it was somewhat off-putting that there was a sign on the desk warning us not to damage or remove any of the furnishings. Made us wonder just what type of people the Trop thinks their customers are. Again, a small thing, but left a strange taste in our mouth. Internet access is $12.99 a day. When you're paying a "resort fee" one would expect free internet. Now, the Trop's real downsides. The Tropicana is one of the oldest hotels on the strip. While the renovations in the Paradise Tower have brought it up to modern standards, there are still many areas of the hotel where it is obvious upgrading still needs to be done. For instance, the hallway to the restroom in the casino is lined with mirrors. Several of the mirrors were broken and had been taped over with duct tape. Rather odd to see something like this in a hotel that is claiming to be "best in class." The worst area of the hotel are the "garden rooms" which are the original parts of the hotel. We walked through here several times on our way to the parking area, and we had the opportunity to look into several of the rooms. At best, this area resembles a Motel 6 - dark hallways, doors with worn numbers on them. Furniture in the rooms resembles a Motel 6 as well. While we saw housecleaning in this part of the hotel, they don't appear to be really taking care of the public areas of this part of the hotel. The floor of one of the elevators was covered in big clods of dirt for our entire stay. I'm talking BIG hunks of dirt. While it is likely that this was dragged in by the construction workers, there really is no excuse for something like this not to be cleaned up immediately (how about putting some plastic down if the workers are going in and out of this elevator?). Also, we noticed that a lot of the construction equipment and supplies were stored directly outside many of the garden rooms, so it seems likely that there will be more noise there than we experienced in the Paradise Tower. DO NOT stay in the Garden rooms, unless you are on a severe budget! However, if you're staying in the Paradise Tower, you probably won't Other public areas of the hotel also aren't living up to the standard of "best in class" that Trop is advertising for its Paradise Towe rooms. For instance, the walkway from the parking garage to the front is literally a hot alley between a cement wall and the airconditioning unit. The lobby itself has not been renovated yet, and feels dark. Worse, you have to go up two flights of stairs to get to registration and there is no ramp for your bags. We found this an odd set up, and somewhat unwelcoming. So, should you stay at the Tropicana? If you can get a great deal like we did for the Paradise Tower, the answer is "yes." While there are some warts around the edges, we enjoyed our stay overall. However, be sure you know exactly what you are signing up for - ask questions about whether you'll be staying in the Paradise Tower, and do consider whether you'd prefer to stay at a more "happening" place while in Vegas. In spite of the downsides, overall, we enjoyed our stay, and, if the price was right, would stay here again. But, by the same token, we could see how the Trop might not be right for others. If you're looking for "best in class," it probably would be best to wait awhile to stay at the Trop. If you're OK with a few warts around the edges, and can book a good deal in the Paradise Tower, I would say you shouldn't have any worries about the Trop.

Reviews.Title: “it was the most beautiful and special place in Vegas " Tropicana Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: yunibear
Reviews.Content: it was the most beautiful and special place in Las Vegas. Obviously, it was convenience place and easy access to every where you go. The rooms are so nice and clean, bed is so comfortable the rooms are newly renovated. The front desk staff are so nice and professional professional service. they all so kind enough to assigned our family to a connecting rooms. especially Kennon who were there to greeting us when we check in. and Jasmin front desk agent. The swining pool was so nice and water was nice and cold. it was hot in Vegas but we enjoy our vacation there!!! my kids are enjoy it. I will visit Vegas next time again and will defiantly recommend to friend and family. Thanks so much to Tropicana team!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Tropicana!”
Reviews.Author: krd133
Reviews.Content: We just got home from our 3rd stay at the Tropicana, and each time it has gotten better. Even though there is construction at the hotel, it isn't a bother, and seems to be making great improvements. Our room was clean and spacious, with a great TV, and the bed and linens were very comfortable. Our casino host, Joe Phillips, went out of his way to make sure that we had everything we needed. Actually, everyone we encountered was very pleasant and helpful. The dealers in the casino were friendly and personable, and we really had fun with them! The shows were funny and the comedy club is a good addition. The pool was great. You might give up some of the flash and glitz of the huge mega hotels, but the personal attention and welcoming attitude of all of the staff more than makes up for the difference. We consider this our only place to stay in Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “the room was very comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: betty3ne
Reviews.Content: Waited in line for 30 mins to check in, even though only 5 people ahead of us. Lots of construction at the hotel, which we knew about, but didn't realize the full extent of it. It didn't have the same feel as the other hotels on the strip due to this. There was a special event starting at 5 pm at the pool so couldn't use it unless you paid $25 per person. The room was very comfortable though with a great view of the strip!

Reviews.Title: “IS THIS EVEN THE SAME HOTEL?”
Reviews.Author: SONSOFBEN
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas a number of times in the past and have always heard that this hotel was the worst, but what a difference the new management has made. After the rate that I could get for this place, I couldn't refuse to at least give it a chance. That was the only time I took a chance and came out ahead all weekend. The rooms are great-- flatscreen LCD TVs, huge beds, and large bathrooms. For the value, you have to give this place a shot and decide for yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Trip!”
Reviews.Author: Morgasn30
Reviews.Content: Pat made our reservations and did an amazing job! She was polite, kind, and a pleasure to speak with. When we arrived Dan (a bell hop) treated us like "high rollers" and took care of us with a smile. Gwen checked us in and continued the trend of kind and curtious employees of the Tropicana! We stayed on the 21st floor in a suit for my wife and I's anniversary. It had a great view of the stirp and the awesome pools. The room was clean and did not smell of smoke. The renovations were going, but were not a hassle to get around. The restaurants were very good and priced well. Todd, Ken and James will do a great job of explaining the menu and taking care of you! The dealers are polite and will help our the rookie gamblers! Carlitos and Presley will make you laugh while you gamble! My wife and I will never stary anywhere else. We were treated highly by everyone employeed by the hotel (even people waxing/cleaning the floors say hi when you pass). My 5th anniversary was amazing all thanks to the Tropicana. I appreciate your effort and you will always have a loyal customer in me! My experiecn

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: vlindlau
Reviews.Content: The hotel is convenient to the Strip, surrounding areas and the airport! The staff were always friendly from the time we checked in to the time we checked out. We appreciated the fact that the Havana Cafe was open 24 hours to get a snack and drinks. Although there is no refrigerator in the room, just let them know you want one when you check in and your desires will be answered! The beds were extremely comfortable and the rooms are spacious. We can't wait to see what else is in store for us after all the renovations are completed!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME TRIP”
Reviews.Author: jaythomas_10
Reviews.Content: My wife, and I just got back from Tropicana. What an awesome trip. Everything was better than expected. We checked in with no problem, and Nicole was so helpful. We were delayed, and added extra days to our stay without any issue. The room was outstanding. The bed was so nice. We want to buy one!! The pool, the fitness facility all outstanding. ALL of the staff stopped what they were doing just to say good morning, afternoon or evening. Even if you were just passing them in the hall. What a suprise that was. Do yourself a favor and stay at the Trop!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: mauler749
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to the Trop it gets better every time I stay. The new pool with cabanas were top notch. The cabana girls we so awesome, polite, and went out of their way to make you feel relaxed, but the best part of all was the swim up blackjack, what a way to spend a day in 100 degree heat

Reviews.Title: “The new and improved Trop was an extremely pleasant surprise.”
Reviews.Author: kingaglet
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the recent renovations made to the rooms, gaming area, and pool of the hotel. While it's not one of the newest casinos on the strip, it might just fool you once you walk in the doors. I would certainly recommend the Trop, as it's probably the best hotel value on the strip. They really are changing everything... for the better. Excellent work, new Trop management!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations by a long shot!!!”
Reviews.Author: PhillyBilly24198
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Trop back in the summer of 06 and it was....lacking. Let's just say that you could tell it's age. There were very few positives to write about. However, I went again this past month to visit for a week for leisure purposes, and it was a phenomenal experience! Their new motto is something like, "We're changing everything," and let me tell you, they're right. They're changing everything in a good way! Everything is totally cleaner, the beds are to die for, the TVs are huge and flatscreen, the service is top top top of the line, and it was just an all around wonderful experience. Everything is new. I highly recommend. It's right up there with the other top of the line casino hotels, no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Overall Experience!”
Reviews.Author: cooltom1617
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Las Vegas. We wanted a hotel that was reasonably priced, near all the action of the city, and one that offered the usual accommodations. The Tropicana Hotel exceeded all of my expectations. When you walk in with your cumbersome luggage there is a door man waiting to greet and help you. You walk through the lobby and casino and are pleased with the new renovations. Then you board the elevator that takes you up to your room. I walked in the room with excitement! Between the flat screen TV, well designed bathroom, plush beds, and new furnishings I knew Tropicana would be a great stay for my trip to the city of sin. In addition to these amenities, going to the pool is a vacation in its self. Tropics themed, the pool is large with two hot tubs on the side. The sunbathing cots are also cushioned, allowing for a peaceful day in the sun. I would 100% recommend the Tropican hotel to everyone. I hope it makes your stay as memorable as it made mine.

Reviews.Title: “Great rates, wonderful room, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: mikeyeeeee
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights in the Tropicana, and when I arrived, I was pleasantly surprised by the attractive interior and newly renovated rooms. The staff was very friendly and very helpful, and it made my stay particularly pleasant. The rooms were very comfortable, especially the soft, spacious beds. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rate, Great Rest”
Reviews.Author: reviewer8908
Reviews.Content: Very nice, refurbished rooms. Excellent pool. Far enough away to relax, but close enough to get out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gc17
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana has remade itself into a great hotel since its recent renovation. The rooms are nicer and the beds more comfortable then before. The house staff was very accommodating. Great overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Class, Excellence, and Value”
Reviews.Author: ofire
Reviews.Content: I was quite favorably impressed by the quality and value of the Tropicana. A senior staff member assisted our group in obtaining an excellent group rate, for which we got a remarkable stay. While not as flashy (or expensive) as some of the gaudier hotels on the Strip, the Tropicana offers a truly high-class experience to guests who choose to stay there. I'll try to touch quickly on the rated categories above, in order. The Trop is kept quite spic and span, and the rooms are daily prepared to a state of comfort and beauty that recalls the hospitality of times past, when the customer was king. The bed was amongst the most comfortable I've ever slept on. The room was spacious and well-furnished. The service is wonderful. Employees at the Tropicana are amongst the most polite and accommodating I've encountered in a hotel. They hold doors open for you, they smile, and they generally try to ensure that your stay is worth your while and dollars. The location was, in my opinion, ideal. The Trop is situated just off of the Strip, which allows you to venture onto it during the day and enjoy the various hedonistic pleasures that Las Vegas has to offer, yet permits you to retreat to a place of relative calm in the evening after a show (though, of course, the gambler will not be disappointed by the Trop's casino). The value was excellent. It was easy and pleasant to negotiate a rate which was affordable for our group, and needless to say the experience was worth every penny. The rooms are, as i mentioned, splendid. They have dual large beds, comfortably outfitted with high-quality linens that ensure a good night's sleep after cavorting about the Strip. Each has a large flat-screen TV and cable. The bathrooms are spacious. I find it sort of odd that sleep quality is listed a separate category, but since it is, I'll put in a good word for it. I slept very well at the Tropicana. It was quiet and off the Strip. My one complaint is the high expense of the sandwiches (which, like everything else, were very good). Overall, five stars out of five. And the outdoor pool is friggin' sweet.

Reviews.Title: “Super Service with a Smile”
Reviews.Author: hau_khang
Reviews.Content: Dude, best hotel I've had in Vegas yet. Staff is super helpful, and everything was cleaned promptly.

Reviews.Title: “Had an awesome stay with excellent service and a great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: DrewNTrina
Reviews.Content: Had an awesome stay with excellent service and a great atmosphere. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, probably the best I've ever experienced and I travel quite often. The bed was so comfortable that we had a hard time getting out of it. Everything is right in the hotel, casinos, restaurants, entertainment and most especially the gorgeous pool. The Tropicana is definitely where we will be staying when we return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience !!!”
Reviews.Author: lenorrlen
Reviews.Content: The following is the actual email that I sent to Nicole Marshall (Guest Experience Specialist, Tropicana), who made this wonderful trip possible: Hi Nicole, I just got back from my vacation at Tropicana yesterday. What a great experience! You guys have done everything right. Thank you for such a wonderful treat. I checked in the hotel on July 4 and was placed on the 18th floor at Island Tower on the first night of my stay( Paradise Tower was fully booked but the agent 'her name is Rose' made arrangement for me to switch to Paradise Tower the following nights). The room at Paradise Tower was amazing: nice view, modern decor, new furniture, comfy bed, big screen LCD TV, clean bathroom... As to the workers, everyone in your staff is very professional and friendly: the front desk agents, room service, casino attendants, valet parking... All in all, I had a marvelous time in the Trop this time, and I am looking forward to my next visit to the ALL NEW TROPICANA in the near future. Best regards to you and your wonderful team.

Reviews.Title: “This is definitley the new and improved Trop.”
Reviews.Author: bct1009
Reviews.Content: Their Italian restaurant is very good and great price for the Strip. Service was over the top friendly and attentive and the room we stayed in was very comfortable and looked recently refurbished. When we checked ion the girl at the front desk isaid they just redid all of their rooms (the rooms actually look better than the MGM Grand rooms). Best buy for your money on the Strip!

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: EBetts2009
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed from July 4th to July 9th. Yes there is some construction but it didn't bother us at all. the casino floor was small but very beautiful. If your going for a romantic getaway this is definitely the place. The pool was fantastic, clean, and beautiful. We ate at the Bacio Restaurant, it was so good. Best italian food I have ever had. All the bigger hotels and casinos are within walking distance. Denny's and Mcdonalds are right down the street. Their South Beach deli is open all night, they have the cheapest food you can find and it's delicious with huge portions and open 24/7. Hyponosis Unleashed was very fun, Michael Johns is a great guy. They don't have too many employees but neither does any other casino. When i went to the MGM to buy the tickets for KA, all the people in line were complaining about how the MGM does have enough staff and how there stays were horrible. So staying at a smaller casino definetly was a benefit. The paradise rooms are really nice. There is a information booth in the casino were they will ask you to go to a timeshare presentation, which isnt at all that bad and you get a free $100 gift card for any shows or restaurant at the mgm locations. We went to see KA by CDS. it was awesome. When we go back, we are definetly going back to the Tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: moorehbk
Reviews.Content: i am writing this review because i was so pleased and happy with everything at the tropicana i felt compelled to share my wonderful experience with everyone! where do i begin? well, the room was beautiful and clean. the bed was more comfortable than my own! the bathroom was set up perfectly with great lighting. the pool area was beautiful and never too crowded. the staff was extremely friendly and made us feel right at home. everything about my stay at the tropicana was perfect and my boyfriend and i will definitely be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful new rooms”
Reviews.Author: Johnh1995
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay booked through a travel company. Booked into the newly refurbished Paradise rooms which really gave the "Wow" factor when you walked into the room.Could not ask for anything more. Hotel itself was quiet enough but very small casino floor when compared to the other hotels on the strip.When the building work is finished, the hotel will look really good. Lovely pool area, but far too hot to lounge around. (110 degrees).

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: michjome
Reviews.Content: We traveled to the Tropicana in Las Vegas with a small group of friends/family and really had a nice time. This was a short 3-day vacation and a first to Las Vegas for all 4 couples. If we ever go back, we would definately check into staying at the Tropicana again. PROS: *It was a short ride from the airport. *The hotel room was WONDERFUL!! Clean, remodeled, had a great view of the city, and very worth the price. No COMPLAINTS about the rooms!! *The RTC (public bus system) has a stop right in front of the hotel. We bought the $7 passes to use for 24 hours while there and it was a life-saver. Consider doing this if you want to explore the area. It even goes to old Las Vegas (the Fremont Experience) and that alone is worth the cost of the ticket. *The pool area is nice...and it will be nicer when the renovations are over. Currently they are working on expanding it, so it will probably be spectacular when done. *There were parts of the hotel that were still original to the building and it was kind of neat to see. They may not be there after renovations are done, but we enjoyed the old and new atmosphere. *The location. Some may not like the location of this hotel, but we found it was exactly right for us. Our hotel was one of the very first stops on the bus going toward Fremont Street, so we found that being able to get on the bus and get a seat was a great advantage. It also has 4 overhead walking bridges to get to Excalibar/Luxor/Mandalay Bay, New York New York and MGM. No waiting for traffic lights to cross to these resorts, just take the pedestrian bridge. CONS: *The old rooms the (the pre-renovated ones) look really old and "well-used". I wouldn't want to stay in any of them and would have been upset if I got one of them. *There is construction going on with the renovations. Nothing to disturb you, but it does distract from everything. Outside, inside, the lobby, the casino...drywall and workers everywhere. *The casino wasn't as classy as most on the strip, but after renovations are done this may no longer be the case. We did play some slots in our casino, but found it to be lacking compared to the rest on the strip. It also wasn't very busy. This could be a PRO or a CON, depending on how you look at it. Overall, it was worth the money and after the work is all done this is going to be a great resort to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly disapointed”
Reviews.Author: pdsmith
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before but never will again. The room was in the older wing and had a terrible smell, the service at check in was slow and unfriendly and the prices were obnoxious.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT TIME at Tropicana Las Vegas!!!”
Reviews.Author: mikeuesugi
Reviews.Content: I go to Vegas almost every month for business meeting, and had stayed most of the hotels on the strip. I have not stayed at Tropicana Las Vegas since their current renovation. But then I signed up with their Exclusive email offers from their web site, and received amazing deal of $49/night with Paradise Tower room upgrade for free. At first, I was very skeptical about the Hotel and how the room is going to be. I must say I was very impressed with the room they provided me, and service they gave me, not to mentioned that front person gave me couple free welcome drink tickets when I checked-in. Surely the construction was still going on, but they handle it very well and really did not bother me at all. I stayed in one of the new rooms in the Paradise Tower, Once I went in the room, I noticed they had beautiful big flat screen, and iPod docking alarm clock station. Since I had my iPhone, I just set my iPhone and played my favorite music and worked thru the night. Since the room was new, all the furniture was brand new as well. I would go back there again. In fact, I am going back to Vegas next week, and already reserved at same Tropicana Las Vegas again. I think I will stick with Tropicana for a while.

Reviews.Title: “Change is a Very Good Thing!!!”
Reviews.Author: GJS126
Reviews.Content: I got an email from Tropicana with a great offer to check out their “best-in-class” in rooms, so I figured I’d give it a try. I usually stay at PH. Wow! I was blown away by how nice the room was (I stayed in the Paradise Tower). The design was bright, and the shutters vs. drapes was a nice touch. Tropicana wasn’t kidding when they said the rooms were best-in-class. The check-in process was easy and all the staff I encountered were unbelievably friendly. The energy and crowd at night was crazy! I would definitely stay here again. Nice work TropLV!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not good-stay away from the Garden rooms”
Reviews.Author: wtravweler
Reviews.Content: Wife and I had a last minute trip to Vegas to attend a funeral. Looking for something relatively inexpensive at or near the south end of the strip. Stumbled accross the Tropicana on one of the hotel web sites. Lots of hype about renovations, newly refurbished rooms etc. We choose the least expensive Garden room. What a mistake, The building and the rooms were old, dirty and delapidated. Just walking down the hallway to our room was depressing. Dirt on the carpets, paint peeling off the walls, etc. I can't beleive the hotel had the nerve to actually sell these rooms. When we checked in we told them it was our first time at the Tropicana. You would think they would want to put there best foot forward and give us one of the newly upgraded rooms. Would never go back to that hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jimi444
Reviews.Content: I stayed over a 3 day weekend recently. I got a great deal via Southwest vacations for the paradise tower. I knew the hotel was going to be under some renovations, but I wanted to try it out anyway. Ya, there was some construction going on, but it really didn't bother me much. First impression walking into the hotel, the casino floor was nice, bright and clean. It seemed pretty different then all the others. The floor was a little smaller than most casinos, but still pretty nice. We showed up way early for check-in, like 9AM, but we were able to leave our bags and run around town. Check-in around 3PM was kinda long (could have had more people working the front desk), but was expected. We stayed on the 12th floor of the Paradise Tower. It was a really nice room. My room was right next to the elevators and I had no problems with noise. This was only my second time in Vegas, my first hotel was TI. I'd say this hotel was on even playing ground for me, minus any shows like the Sirens of TI. For the price, you couldn't beat the location. The sports bar was pretty nice also. Nicole was really nice and responded to any little question I had about the hotel prior to my arrival. Go check out the pool too! Awesome pina coladas! Swim up black jack table as well! Very friendly staff at the hotel! The cons: I wasn't really impressed with the food. My room had no towel bar outside the shower. The blinds in the room suck, really need black out curtains. But none of this would keep me from staying at the Tropicana on my next visit. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, terrible, terrible!”
Reviews.Author: Power18
Reviews.Content: I had to stay at the Tropicana due to an event I was attending at the hotel. A few weeks before my arrival, I received a special offer for the "Best of Class" Paradise Tower, with one night free after paying for two nights - the first two nights had to be paid for in advance. We arrived late on Friday night, only to be told that there were no renovated rooms available in the Paradise Tower - - even though we had paid in advance! The clerk disappeared into a back room for 15 minutes only to come back to tell us that we could stay in a "mini-suite" in the Island tower. The room was terrible! Cracked counters with cigarette burns in the bathroom. Stained carpet. Tiny TV. On the positive side, we called the manager to complain, was given a reduced rate, and was moved to the paradise tower two days later. We heard similar stories from other guests who had the misfortune to stay at the Tropicana - one woman had no air conditioning the first night and was moved three times. Also, the hotel failed to provide us with the "special" offer items even when we asked. Hotel negatives: constant charges for everything other than a bed. A refrigerator costs $25 a night! You have to pay a daily resort fee of $8 for the pool, even if you don't want to use it. Wireless internet is $13 a day. Limited TV - no premium channels. Hotel seems like a construction zone. Staff is not particularly friendly or helpful. While the new Paradise rooms are fine but overpriced, one definitely should avoid the Island Tower and Garden rooms. Do yourself a favor - don't stay at the Tropicana!

Reviews.Title: “The Tropicana in Las Vegas has a nostalgic feel and great new look.”
Reviews.Author: Brian323
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the middle of all the action. The staff was friendly and the areas being remodeled didn't get in the way. The Tropicanas new Paradise tower was great with a large clean room and a good view. The pool area is one of the best. This hotel had a nice nostalgic feel with a great new look. We will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Sunshine, Service, Pool & Construction”
Reviews.Author: szimn
Reviews.Content: Visited at the end of June till the 30th. The construction is everywhere but they handle it professionally and never in your way. It could get confusing when a wall would go up in a place where there was a machine that you played before...but I was a bit 'confused' most of the time in Vegas. The work on the front entrance did not get in the way, traffic flow is a bit tight, as it is around any construction. The pool looked to be refurbished, I had not seen it before the makeover but it is bright white and clean now, one of the best pools in which I have ever soaked up sun. The construction walls for the Nikki Beach section are painted and don't effect the pool. We stayed in one of the new rooms in the Paradise Tower, new, clean, & modern. The bed was like a dream, the flat screen TV looked good, but never turned it on. Ipod docking station for the radio had great sound, but don't use it as an alarm, slept through its electronic dinging twice, I need a good buzz to wake out of a buzz. The bathroom was odd, light switch on the wrong wall, towel holder out of reach, and then the plumbing had a gurgling sound and tub wouldn't drain. We were only on the 3rd floor and its an old tall building. There is also an extra fan switch on a timer in the bathroom, maybe because the first fan was so loud that came on with the light was not big enough. I would go back again, especially after the construction is done. Thanks to Michael at the bar for the quick explanation on how the video poker machine deals the cards.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana renovation is fabulous...”
Reviews.Author: CMluvlasvegas
Reviews.Content: We booked our paradise tower renovated room through Vegas.com and we were a llitle skeptical before we arrived. For 130.00 including tax we booked our room for 3 nights. Great Deal! When we arrived I was pleasently surprised! The room was fabulous! Nice LG flat screen, Chaise lounge chair in front of the window with the view of the strip, big comfy bed with Egyptian cotton sheets! The bathroom was so great with a roomy area to get ready for the night. And to top it all off an Ipod doc station! I loved the room. The casino itself is blah, but the bartenders in the sports lounge are great and my lemondrops were always primo! The South Beach Deli is open all night and the food is awesome, especially if you have been out all night drinking! We ate there all thee nights at 2:00 am. The only thing that could have ruined our trip was the elevator getting stuck on the 19th floor for 15 minutes. But for our inconvenience Tropicana gave us 100$. Thanks Tropicana! Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Greatly improved”
Reviews.Author: Maps10
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Mirage but this time thought we would give the Trop a try since they redid the rooms. The rooms are nicer now than MGM, Mirage, Ceasars Palace and other mid range hotels in Las Vegas where we have stayed recently. We stayed in the Paradise Tower. About the only thing we did not like was that the new window coverings let in too much light in the A.M. They do look very nice however. I have never stayed anywhere that had over 100 T.V. stations in H.D. Now, that's service and on a 42" T.V.! The casino and other areas are still very much under construction with stark white panels in place. When it's completed later this year it should be very nice. One big turn off in the table area was that it has very bright lighting - the brighest I have ever seen in a casino. It made it very unpleasant. They need to cut down the lights. I heard others complaining about it too. For that reason alone we did not play any table games there. We went to the MGM across the street to play table games. We would had preferred staying at the Trop to play but could not stand the bright overbaring lights. The pool area is great and I would rank it up there with some of the best in Las Vegas. I have been to just about every pool in town. The major complaint is that they seem to let in anyone and not just hotel guests. I saw people changing clothes in the bathrooms just inside the doors leading to the casino. They obviously were not hotel guests. Someone, I later found out it was an adult, made the pool their own bathroom so the pool had to be closed for awhile. I am sure it was not a hotel guest that did it. I think other L.V. hotels are allowing non guests to use the pool but that really is a policy that needs changing. One day it seemed that about 40% of the people there were not guests of the hotel. I talked to a L.V. local that was in the pool and he admitted to me that he and his five kids just wondered in! Overall, I would recommend the new Trop and we may try it again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Room service quick,food was good”
Reviews.Author: sexystarr
Reviews.Content: My friend Serina and myself had a wonderful time. The food service was quick, food was fresh,and very good . The customer service was most pleasant, , friendly, happy ,made the both of us feel very welcome. Which was a real treat, unlike some hotels. In closing ; we had a great experience and definitely will be back. Thank you again for a very pleasant and memorable stay at the Tropicana.!!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved garden and waterfalls and swimming and music at the pool, We loved pretty roomy room and view and slept great.”
Reviews.Author: wonderful32859
Reviews.Content: We loved the paradise pier room with a view. We loved the bright gambling area with the white tile floor and high ceiling with pretty glass ceiling. We loved walking around the garden and looking at the pool and swimming in the pool and the music at the pool. There is a walkway with windows that goes over the pool area and the restrooms are clean and the soap has perfume like a tropical punch. The staff was friendly and helpful and wanted us to have a good time and we did!

Reviews.Title: “The all new Trop!”
Reviews.Author: nagleee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tropicana this weekend, in the new Paradise Tower in a 1 bedroom suite and LOVED LOVED LOVED it. Great decor, awesome view. The staff was amazing, and loved the pool. EVERYONE poolside was helpful in finding lawn chairs, towels, food and drink. It was my first time at the Trop and I'd never imagine staying there and was PLEASANTLY surprised!

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana - Check it out! Much improved from the Old Trop!”
Reviews.Author: BarbickEwing
Reviews.Content: We did a one night staycation at the Trop, checking it out for when visitors come... We were shocked at how much it has improved since the last time we looked at it -- last time it was dirty & smelly! The renovations are still in progress, but are making the place beautiful! Our tower room was beautiful -- Fully renovated with white shutters on the windows... and the most comfortable bedding I have had at a hotel in a long time! Really beautiful & so comfortable! We took breakfast in room, and loved it! Fast room service, and the food was great! (The omelets are gigantic!) We had a blast at the table games, playing a lot of blackjack, and roulette. (Last time I was there, they had the stain glass overhead, and the rest of it was sort of dirty & old. Now, it is beautiful, redone in white. Really sharp & inviting!) We didn't do great, but we had a great time. The table games staff that we had contact with was so much fun -- and they were funny! Also love the music playing throughout the casino.. Felt like a party! You have to check out the pool area... BEAUTIFUL... and the food & drink service was great! Had dinner in the Legends Steakhouse... The steaks were great, as was the Sushi App. Special... Really good coffee & key lime pie too! (We didn't get to try the italian restaurant, but heard good things about that too... they were closed the night we were there.) Also convenient for food was the Deli... Good food, big portions (almost too big) We were most impressed with the service. Anyone we stopped to ask for directions or help were really helpful & friendly. One person just cleaning in the casino stopped what she was doing, and walked us part way to our destination. You don't get that kind of friendly attention at the bigger casinos. We had a great one night staycation, and would highly recommend the Tropicana. It is so much different than it used to be! Check it out! You can't beat the price!

Reviews.Title: “The Tropicana has great shows/service, fun rooms, and the pool is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: hmoon14
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana has great shows/service, fun rooms, and the pool is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: rawkin58
Reviews.Content: My husband and 2 year old stayed in the Paradise Tower on Wednesday and Thursday nights June 2nd and 3rd respectively. The pool is fantastic.. I love that there is a shaded area apart from the cabanas so we weren't in direct sunlight.. There were plenty of chairs and everyone was very friendly. The room was fantastic! We stayed in a king room on the 14th floor.. it had an additional chaise that our daughter loved cause we were able to push it towards the window and she could see the lights... We loved that we were a few steps away from MGM and could take her right over to Rainforest Cafe or to see the lions when she was getting antsy. Very impressed and am looking forward to seeing the finished result!

Reviews.Title: “Not your parents' Trop”
Reviews.Author: annl0722
Reviews.Content: Tropicana upgrade is impressive. They have gotten rid of showgirls, trapeze acts and tacky design. New island rooms are roomy with comfortable beds, large bathrooms, windows that open, and very clean. Casino upgrade is noticeable although not done yet. Lots of new, fun video slot machines. Pool area is still beautiful, upgraded, large, impressive, clean & fun. Includes shaded & unshaded hot tubs. Looking forward to adults-only pool area "Nikki Beach" opening next summer. South Beach deli has what you are hungry for but beware, the sandwiches and breakfast plates are HUGE and enough for 2! Only complaint is there is still construction noise that woke us up early but that will be a short-term thing.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana, Emerging diamond!!!”
Reviews.Author: rooster2439
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tropicana from 06-16/06-20. We were in the Paradise tower in a newely renovated room. All we can say is WOW! Great rooms. Service was out of this world. Every staff person we had contact with at the Tropicana was friendly and bent over backwards to make sure our stay was perfect. The only negative is the construction. Not that it wasall that intrusive, just seemed to really disrupt the flow of the resort. Once the construction is done the Tropicana will be our only Vegas destination! Try it out, we switched hotels mid week and wished we had stayed the entire week at the Tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana..the best rooms, the best pool, the best people..the Best in Las Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: randybarrie
Reviews.Content: My huaband and I travel to Las Vegas every May. We plan our trip around lounging and relaxing by the pool. We have stayed at different resorts over the years, but have found that the pool at the Tropicana is our favorite. This year as we were planning our trip we learned that the pool at the Tropicana was under major construction and we could not be guaranteed that it would be open at the time of our vacation, so sadly we booked at another resort. We chose a resort close to the Tropicana so we could easily visit the casino and other attractions the Tropicana has to offer. We love everything about the Tropicana, but a huge thing we love is the people who work there. We remember from year to year the same employees, coctail waitresses, dealers, pit bosses, among many others. We know they all see thousand upon thousand of guests every year and couldn't possible remember us, but they always great us warmly and sincerely. It is because of the atmosphere, the employees, the pool, and everything else the Tropicana has to offer that make it such a great place for us. When we arrived for our vacation we found out that the pool at the Tropicana had opened earlier than the expected. We were so disappointed not to be staying on this resort, and now to find that the pool was actually open was an even bigger disappointment. Each night as we made our way back to the Tropicana for our usual evening of fun at the BlackJack table we would find ourselves in convesations with the dealers, the cocktail waitresses, the pit bosses about how we loved their resort. One night as we were about to head out for some much needed rest we were presented with the most beautiful and delicious cocktail. We were being told of the amazing rennovations that were occuring not only at the pool, but with the entire resort from the fabulous resturants, the gorgeous rooms....everything. At this point we were surprised with the most amazing gesture. We were graciously given a beautiful room for us to spend our last night in Las Vegas. Along with that wonderful gift, they allowed us an early check in so we could spend the entire day lounging at the pool. We could not have been more surprised or blown away by their gererousity. It truly made our entire trip, and we can't wait to come visit again. Each and every person at the Tropicana from check in- to check out is truly excited about everything new at the Tropicana and are excited to share with each and every guest. The proof of that is how the went above and beyond sharing everything new with us in such a special way. We tell anyone and everyone who is planning a trip to Vegas about our experience. We can't wait for our trip next year to see everything complete, everything changing!! One thing we know that will not change is the people of the Tropicana....they are the absolute best. Our most sincere thanks to all of them for making or trip so memorable!!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be Back!”
Reviews.Author: Christinas_Travels00
Reviews.Content: Our stay was fantastic! We started receiving great service from the moment we stepped off of our shuttle from the bell hop. We were early, so we walked around and played slots a bit before we could check in - where we received fantastic service from Jan at the front desk. Our room was beautiful with comfy beds! I mean, who goes to Vegas to sleep, but with beds that comfy, I enjoyed every minute! The pool is very nice (music could be turned down a bit) and I enjoyed starting my day off every morning on a bench in the garden area. So pleasant and quite listening to the water fall and birds. It was before the pool opened so the gardeners were working and were very polite and friendly. The South Beach Deli has great food, large portions and at reasonable prices. The staff was friendly in every department from the casino floor, restaurants, housekeeping, etc. Everyone had a friendly smile and was friendly. I got the impression they enjoyed their jobs (and that says a LOT about a company). Great Job Tropicana! You will be the tops when your renovations are done... like the new place in town!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! The Trop is coming back better than ever!”
Reviews.Author: Kizchris
Reviews.Content: All I can say is WOW - Stayed one night at the Tropicana on June 22, 2010 and wished we could have stayed longer. The new Paradise Tower is now completely remodelled and the rooms are impressive. Large in size, especially the bathrooms, great bed, and good sized flat screen TV! The place still smells like new carpet (not a bad smell in my book). Check in was with Rose who was very accomodating, We were checking in early (11AM)and hadn't really expected our room to be ready but Rosemade some calls and told us to come back at 11:30AM and it would be ready. We went back to her, and low and behold she handed over the key and went through the property highlights with us and we were on our way up. Shack was the bellman who brought our bags to the room, and wow was he on his game. Went through all the ammenities and even got us ice! He saw us a couple of times during our 24 hours there and made sure to ask how we were doing and if we were having a good time. There is construction going on as they remodel the whole place but really didn't affect our stay too much. You do have to go a little out of your way to get to the bridges over to Excalibur or MGM because the front area was being worked on, but it really wasn't bad. You can totally tell the new sections of the casino as opposed to the old - and the new is really nice and clean and bright as opposed to the old sections being much darker. Overall impressed with the hotel and can't wait to see the whole place finished! Unfortunately I cannot comment on any of the restaurants save the Havana a Go Go which is a little coffee, sandwich place. Sandwich was very good! Otherewise we ate at different places the rest of the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Superior service Levels!”
Reviews.Author: luvmesumtravel
Reviews.Content: I made it point to remember each staff member that helped me as the service was outstanding! From the servers, guest service agents and housekeeping! Excellent! The newly renovated rooms and pool are relaxing, clean and nicely appointed. With amazing views of the strip, lush vegetation and competitive pricing, it’s truly a great find at the top of its class! I’ll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Birthday EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: AlyssaSivertson
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana was wonderful to us. We booked 2 rooms and we got adjoining rooms, it was awesome! We had 7 in our group and had the time of our lives!! The rooms were wonderful, I must say I have stayed in many resorts in Mexico and in Vegas and what they have done to these rooms in the Paradise Tower is amazing!! And the beds were amazing!! We spent all day Saturday at the pool and it was great, they have a great pool area with a dj and the pool servers always made sure we didnt go thirsty!! Check in and check out was no problem. I would recommend Tropicana to anyone looking to stay in a resort like environment!! Thanks for taking part in my Birthday!!! Alyssa S.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay at the Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: Frankie_5252
Reviews.Content: I have returned from my trip overseas and I wanted to write to say that I was really impressed with The Tropicana. Myself and my partner stayed in room 2109 and we were amazed at how great this room was. We have stayed previously at MGM and Treasure Island and the new Tropicana rooms are much better than those rooms. The beds were amazing the room was fresh and new, yet tropical and we simply loved the shutters – what a fantastic extra to the room that really makes it stand out.

Reviews.Title: “The Resurrection of TROP”
Reviews.Author: aprkontra
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Trop on June 4th, 5th & 6th… My wife and I go to Vegas 6 – 8 times a year, staying a different hotel each… The Trop’s location is excellent, bridges over to Excalibur & MGM…make for quick get away on the south side of the strip…very close to NY NY, Monte Carlo, Luxor and Mandalay Bay… The hotel is presently being remodel and it looking very good, There are a few obstacles to walk around but all in all the Trop is looking good. The hotel staff provided excellent service very attentive and always pleasant, you have a sense that they are working very hard while in the construction phase to go out there way to service their clients... The rooms in the Paradise Tower are large and comfortable, great views of the strip, Check in ran smoothly for a Friday evening; we arrive around 7 pm, the wait was only about 20 minutes. The staff offered free bottled water for the people waiting in line and we received a number coupons for free drinks upon check in. The Pool area was like staying at a resort… covered lounge chairs, with strong drinks delivered, excellent music… a lot of fun…we were told they are will be having a restaurant opening with a Miami vibe… The only draw back to the staying at the Trop is the lack of Bars… there are only two and they aren’t that special... one of the bartenders had a crappie attitude…kind of complaining about all the construction… this was only person that we dealt with that had negative attitude.. The other items I found to be of a slight concern was in the gaming area: there is limited amount of tables, but the betting minimums are low… in this economy that’s important…. Of course there are plenty of slots… and a wide variety at that…. Another area that they need to work on would be the restaurants... There is only one Buffet and it is only offered on the weekend ends. It was kind of a make shift set up, with not large selection of foods… but everything they did offer was excellent and the price was under $10 per person… the other eateries are average to say the least, the cost is affordable… I am sure that with all the upgrades the restaurants will improve in time… All in all I would stay here again, the location very good for roaming the strip… again the rooms are real nice and comfortable and the nightly rate was VERY good….

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: jgaeto
Reviews.Content: Wow! This place has really changed since the last time I was in Vegas. I stayed at the Tropicana a few weeks ago and the property has undergone some major upgrades. The rooms were awesome – completely renovated with a fresh new look that compliments the hotel nicely. The new casino floor and other sections of the hotel also look great. I must say, the investments made so far have truly paid off. Very impressed! Although I have always been a fan of the property given its central location on the strip and attractive pricing on the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience Ever, Hands Down!”
Reviews.Author: QS757
Reviews.Content: You know what... I've been writing this review for 15 minutes and its become ridiculously long, so I've decided that I'll send that version to the Tropicana. As far as this review is I'll make it really simple. They had MINIMAL staffing (2 ppl) working in the lobby at a time that you would think they would be much more heavily staffed (Friday at 11am). Waited an hour in a line that didn't move, then they gave priority to those checking out even if they got in line 45 minutes after you. Couldn't take it, went to the pool for an hour and a half, came back and waited another hour a half in line. Check in way too difficult! Took a little less than 25 minutes to get a prebooked room. One reason is because he tried to give me a cheaper room than I paid for! Then had the nerve to ask me if I wanted to still get the room I had already paid for (Paradise Tower), I managed to squeeze out a "Yes" through my clinched teeth... Finally I get MY room. I return home only to find that they have charged me twice for the room! Apparently this is normal as the lady I spoke to (who was nice) knew my problem without me even saying it... I am currently waiting on my refund. There are SO MANY MORE bogus details that infuriated me: the clueless bellhops, the warm water handed out to appease customers while waiting, deplorable way customers were spoken to, the luke warm shower etc etc etc

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful holiday!”
Reviews.Author: msfrogggy13
Reviews.Content: Even though construction had started, I found no problems in servicies. I chose this hotel because of it's local,an easy walk to several other Casinos if I wanted. The only neg. was that that the coffee shop was closed for remodeling.

Reviews.Title: “Great Changes so far, Keep going...”
Reviews.Author: MarkDC-Travel
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 1826 at the Tropicana June 2 – 5, 2010. Wanted to see how the renovations are coming along. There aren’t a lot of places on the strip where you can stay on a Friday night for under $100. My three nights, Wednesday, Thursday and Friday went for $238.50 resort fees and taxes included, not a bad deal at all. The standard room in the Paradise tower seems to be larger than the other standard rooms I have stayed in on the strip. I really loved the daybed/couch or whatever you call it. The shutters are a great idea and add a lot to the “ambiance”, and the fact that you can open the windows, priceless. My room had no noticeable noise from the strip. The orange color accent was a refreshing change from the rest of the strip. I really liked it because it was not overdone. The furniture was not cheap, but rather solidly built. The wooden ice bucket was a nice touch. The noise from the room next door was noticeable. A group of women checked in the next night and they all congregated in the room next to mine with lots of laughter and screaming as girls on vacation will do. Guys do the same, only differently, so no offense intended. This went on for a half hour at about 11:30PM. On the brighter side, I did not hear anything from the hallway. The television worked, but the remote did not. I know I could have gone and had it fixed (or perhaps the batteries replaced), but I don’t like to do things like that, so I just went and used the buttons on the TV. The selection of channels on the TV was very limited. I do watch TV when I go to Vegas and I like to purchase a movie or two as well. The remodeled bathroom was nice, but basic. However, there is a fan over the toilet that is connected to the light. It is a very loud fan and not something I expect to find in the better hotels. Subtract for the noise. I absolutely loved the Kohler sink. I do not remember turning on a water faucet so easily. I don’t know why I was so fascinated. Guess it doesn’t take much to amuse me. The hotel has a beautiful garden area that provides an escape from the outside world. I happen to think this area rivals the Flamingo’s garden area for it’s beauty, but it doesn’t have the size or animals. I know next year they are planning to rev up the place and make it exciting, but for now, it seemed to be rather quiet and stress-free. After they redo the Garden Rooms in the fall, I think it will be really nice with your own balcony overlooking the Garden and pool. The pool looks great. I would imagine when the hotel is at capacity, the pool will be really busy. I did not see the swim-up blackjack they promote, but I was only there on Thursday at 6:30 AM and 2 PM. They still have work to do, but what is open does look great and there will be more. The casino is pretty small and I don’t think you can get lost in it like some others. The one pit they have looks nice, but there’s still more to do in that casino. The Sports Book is a tiny room stuck in the back of everything. Very sad. But, it is scheduled to be moved to new digs in the front in about 6 months, at least that’s what the guy working there said. He was very much looking forward to the move. Drink service was very good. I know that not many use the hotel laundry, but I always do since I only bring carry-on and bypass all the lines at the airport. Here’s an example of the attention to detail I think they are trying to achieve; I had written a note on the laundry ticket that a shirt put in the bag was missing a button for the collar. The Tropicana’s service actually found a button similar to the one that was missing and sewed it onto my shirt. Give ‘em extra points for that. That shirt still has one more season left in it. I did get my haircut here. Barber was nice and small talk was enjoyable. Good job with all the usual amenities. Cut was $40, no shampoo. I only ate at the Tropicana once, for breakfast. Had three eggs over easy. It was quick. Nothing special, nothing bad. Pretty underwhelming. Very pleased with the improvements. Glad I stayed and will definitely stay here in the future. Really looking forward to the Island Tower Spa rooms and Garden rooms being completed in the fall. I definitely recommend this hotel and with each completed renovation, the recombination is stronger. Looking forward to more!

Reviews.Title: “Good and getting even better!”
Reviews.Author: CMCarpenter
Reviews.Content: Just completed my Vegas trip for the summer and stayed at several different hotels due to comps. The last on my list was the Tropicana. My wife and I had stayed there several years ago and felt it was a good value.. not the glitziest hotel on the strip but nice for the price. Since I've seen the ads for the remodel decided I'd like to stay there again since the price is still the best for a true Strip Hotel. Wow... The pictures don't show the depth of change the place is going through. They aren't just throwing a new coat of paint on the walls and calling it a remodel like a few other hotels have done. The Paradise tower room we stayed in was clean, roomy and had a very nice view up the strip. However what set the place apart was the staff. Everyone was genuinely concerned about our experience and what we thought of the renovations so far. We had stayed in one of the newer hotels on the strip that runs 4 x the price and we couldn't even get an ashtray sent to our smoking room in a timely manner (after 3 requests over an 8 hour period finally gave up). At the Trop we had a problem with the AC and within 30 min of contacting the front desk someone was there to work on it. Additionally, my mother went on the trip with us. She had a problem getting around as Vegas has changed considerably from when she traveled there in the 70s. Kimberlee, the front desk clerk who had checked her in, was leaving for the day when she saw my mother having difficulty, instead of doing like most people who are no longer on the clock and ignoring the situation, she stopped, discovered the problem and offered solutions. There are currently some inconveniences caused by the remodel but overall you won't find a better value near the strip much less in such a nice location as the Trop. My only recommendation is that if you plan on sleeping in after a long night and light bothers you bring an eye mask. The windows are shuttered but a lot of early morning light still comes through. One other thing I need to say concerning the difference between the Tropicana and other hotels.. at the Trop you feel more like a guest vs feeling like one ant trying to navigate the kicked over ant hill at the "Mega-Resorts."

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana did fantastic reno's”
Reviews.Author: jimbow1961
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tropicana from May 29 to June 5 and it was a better than expected experience. Originally I was going to stay at the Hilton Grand Vacations on the Strip but switched to the Tropicana about 4 days before leaving after finding a great deal on Expedia(40 % off room rates). I stayed in the newly renovated Paradise Tower(room 1225) and it was very well done and smelled new also. Initially I wasn't too happy with the layout of the bathroom but I got used to it. The rest of the room was very nice, shutters on the windows instead of drapes was a nice and unique touch and I had a nice strip view looking toward the MGM. About the only fault I could find and it was hard to find one, was that there may not have been too much soundproofing around the room as I could hear the couple in the next room(they were loud, though) and I could also hear music playing from some outdoor party going on nearby on my first night there. The 24 hour South Beach Deli had a good selection on the menu and seemed reasonably priced. It came in handy after some very late night poker sessions across the street at the MGM Poker room. Very friendly staff right from the front desk to the housekeeping crew. I didn't spend time in the somewhat small casino because I'm not a regular blackjack or craps player anymore. In the Las Vegas magazine for May 2010 that was in the room, a daily poker tourney was advertised. After a few trips around the casino I couldn't find the poker room. I finally asked the front desk about it and was informed that the poker room was closed due to layoffs but that they hoped it would open again soon. I had dinner at both the italion restaurant and the steakhouse and both were excellent and well priced. Just watch which days you go because there's 2 nights where the steakhouse is closed and then there are 2 nights where the itallion restaurant is closed. The itallion restaurant did offer a steak dinner special on the 2 nights where the steakhouse was closed. They are still doing further reno's to the Tropicana although I'm not quite sure when they will be completed. Tropicana is very well located and near the MGM(across the street) and it's across the street the other way from Excalibur and kitty corner to New York New York. Walgreens and CVS pharmacy are not too far away either for any personal needs. Overall I had most pleasant experience staying at the Tropicana and I would definantly stay there again on my next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION GOOD VIEW”
Reviews.Author: noidakaran
Reviews.Content: I stayed in hotel alongwith my colleagues and friend during Visit To Bauma trade fair,hotel is centrally located and all around good view . Los vegas in true sense is a real entertaiment capital

Reviews.Title: “Great Tropicana experience and fun!”
Reviews.Author: ScottyL27
Reviews.Content: I recently went to Las Vegas in the last month and I found myself at the Tropicana more then a few times and I have to say that it was amazing. I had an excellent time each time I was there, from gambling to the service of the employees. Within a 15 minutes of entering the casino I had a welcoming greeting from one of the floor managers and he signed my up for the Tropicana members point card! I played craps and roulette with my brothers and family and we had a great time and there was lots of energy and excitement in the casino. I never got a chance to see any of the rooms but I imagined them to be very nice as the hotel was going through renovations!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: mrsdouglas
Reviews.Content: I was aware of the resort fee of $7.99 I was told upon check in that it was $8.95;because I was in tears they waived that but I was told I had to pay $100security deposit. and that if there was no damge they would release the hold on the funds within a couple of hours on check out.My bank told me they ran a purchase and that they did not put a hold on the funds like they were suppose to that they actually ran it as a purchase.I had a receipt to show that they credited it to my account so I had proof that they were suppose to credit it to my account I had to file a claim thru my bank which could take 30days thank god I had the receipt so I had the funds in 24 hours because of the security deposit I had to be careful what I ate because I planned on having that security deposit as my play money and to just have money in my pocket. I took $180 so you do the math how much money did I have if I spent $78.75 on food.It was 110 degrees and The a/c was not working in the room I had to wait 1hour when they told me there was a 30min window.I was suppose to get 2 free magic show and 2 free show tickets with a king size room that was listed on there website they told me I had to purchase the tickets.I had to take a bus to the workshop I was attending and they told me the bus ran every 5 mins. I was late because I had to wait 35 mins for the bus.For room service it was a $5 delivery charge and18% added charge to the meal. I would not stay at that hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “One of my best hotel experiences”
Reviews.Author: amyde1201
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very polite and courteous, beginning with our reservations via the phone. They were so helpful. When checking in, the staff went above and beyond in their welcoming. Some could be seen directing guests to the correct elevator, while others were handing out bottled water since it was so hot that day. Our room was awesome! The beds were soooo comfortable and my husband was happy with the 42" plasma TV. We had a great view of the strip. The casino staff was also helpful (my first time!). The restaurant served large portions of delicious food. I can't say anything bad about my stay. I would return again and again!!

Reviews.Title: “A rare experience”
Reviews.Author: Hastonl
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I've been to the Trop in a couple of years and usually you walk in a casino and the employees don't even look at you, but everyone was very friendly and one of the drivers was even nice enough to walk me back to show me where the Press Conference was held. Keep up the good work!!!

Reviews.Title: “So glad I chose the Tropicana - a fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jimoftheshire
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I'll set the scene.....I'm 28 and my girlfriend is 27. we're both from england and are not big gamblers or super rich. we're also not big into partying.....we like a good time, but we're not all night ravers or anything. why would we want to go to vegas you ask?? Because our friends were getting married of course! :D we needed to do the trip on a budget and so when looking online at the various hotels along the strip, the Tropicana seemed like the best option in terms of price, location and quality of rooms. I emailed Nicole directly and she was very very helpful. Got a great rate on one of the newly rennovated Paradise Tower rooms....Thanks Nicole! :) Got to the hotel and checked in nice and quick....no queues! awesome! the casino and bar areas were busy and everyone was having a good time and there was a great buzzing vibe! got up to the room and my girlfriend was very impressed.....and so was i! for the money, it definitely is best-in-class without a doubt. friends of ours who stayed in the MGM Grand said our room was bigger and nicer than theirs and they paid a lot more!! On the second night, we went out with all our friends around the various hotels along the strip. The Bellagio, Vencian, Ceasers Palace etc were all fantastic and very grand......but after a while, all our friends wanted to go back with us to the Tropicana even though some were staying right at the other end of the strip!! So we all went back, had a gamble, had some drinks and generally had a good time. All the staff we dealt with were very helpful and friendly (bar staff, casino dealers etc). In terms of location, you can't get better for the money. Only a short 5min walk over a bridge and you're in the MGM Grand. A further 15min walk through the hotel's maze of a casino and you're at the monorail which for $12 get's you an all-day ticket and you can go up and down the strip as many times as you like. Perfect! Our hotel room was cleaned thoroughly everyday....my compliments to the maids! we ordered room service one morning which took a little while to arrive (45mins) but was lovely food. the expedia local travel experts in the main lobby area were very helpful with helping us book tickets for various things. they gave us lots of info and helped us book tickets for cirque du soleil at the whynn hotel (which was amazing!) and also managed to get us on a helicopter tour of the grand canyon at very short notice. we rang them at 8am and they got us picked up in a limo at 1pm. very efficient!! gambling at the trop was brilliant.....all the dealers at the tables were very professional and friendly and the waitresses were always on hand to bring complimentary drinks. on the first night, 3 of my friends won over $200 each and i even i managed to win $100 and I don't gamble! if you're a non-smoker and new to vegas, then be warned.....smoking is allowed in ALL casinos in vegas. dont be put off at the tropicana if it smells smokey as you walk through the casino....it's like that in every hotel! me and my girlfriend hit the pool a few times during our stay and found it to be very nice indeed. not too big, not too small. cocktail bar with waitress service which was great. there were some private cabannas which could be hired at a cost. my only recommendation would be that the jacuzzi/spa be made to look a little nicer and maybe be upgraded. it was warm and relaxing, but their wasn't much in the surrounding area around the jacuzzi. a few palm trees, plants etc would make it feel a bit more luxurious. so to conclude....our stay at the tropicana was excellent. staff were great, gambling was good, the room was spacious and tastefully decorated with all new modern fittings, the location of the hotel is great. what more can I say? If you're looking for an intimate feel hotel, on a budget...but getting a lot of bang for your buck, then stay at the tropicana and you won't be dissapointed. Cheers Jim

Reviews.Title: “really wished we had all stayed some where else”
Reviews.Author: lauleebon
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews on here and Nicole responses so I contacted her direct and booked 4 rooms, We got an OK deal nothing special. When we got to the hotel the check in lines were about 45 minutes long, the staff at the check in desk were about as nice as the employees at the dmv. I called 3 times before arriving to be sure our rooms were together all 3 times the person at the tropicana said no problem i will link them now ( wondering why they were not linked the other 2 times i called and linked them) When I arrived they put one of the rooms on the 16th floor another on the 7th and we were told we would be on the 12th floor so they were never linked. Also after all my calls making sure everything was set to go never once did anyone mention the 100 deposit that must be put on a credit card. The rooms were nice, we were in the new paradise tower. The casino has blinding white walls with no real decor and not enough tables to play. There are no refrigerators in the rooms and we had to argue to get one. All in all i would stay some where else unless they lowered their prices to reflect the actual service you receive.

Reviews.Title: “We'll definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: Helena_Poe
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Tropicana. The renovated rooms are fantastic quality and quiet. The hotel/casino is one of the smaller ones on The Strip but this gives it an intimate feel and you have less chance of getting lost whilst you navigate your way around. Within a 5-10 minute walk you're in the thick of the action on The Strip. If you don't want to walk, the monorail is nearby, we used the station in MGM Grand across the road. We stayed in the Paradise Tower which had been renovated, it was fantastic. The staff were lovely, the food was first-rate and priced well. The Tropicana is still undergoing renovations, but this didn't affect our stay at all. Give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Old school feel with a modern touch of class”
Reviews.Author: debsteve22
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been staying at the Trop for many years. We've stayed at many of the larger resorts as well and found oursleves bouncing from one to another. Always comming back to the classic Trop because of its feel and location. Our last visit we stayed in one of the newly renovated rooms which we truely enjoyed. With the resent upgrades to the rooms and facilities, will be sure to continue to enjoy this classic resort.

Reviews.Title: “Pre travel service”
Reviews.Author: Mark_Shotton
Reviews.Content: I am heading to Las Vegas at the end of the month. I found the Tropiccana face book site and asked all my questions via Facebook. The reponse from Nicole was fantastic and my questions answered straight away. We have been given a great rate and been put in the new rooms. I will post a follow up after our stay, but if the customer service is any indication of the rest of the hotel I can't wait to get there.

Reviews.Title: “A Weekend to remember at the Trop”
Reviews.Author: robnickles
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana is my favorite place to stay at in Las Vegas. They are located at my favorite intersection on the strip with such other resorts as New York New York and MGM Grand. They reward loyalty with very friendly concierge service and comps. They are currently under renovation, but doing everything they can to make you feel comfortable and relaxed. I enjoyed a room in the newly renovated Paradise Tower. The room was great, the only things that would have made it perfect would be free internet and a bigger bathtub! The staff is extremely friendly and helpful and I would recommend this hotel to anyone! I look forward to staying in an Island Tower Jacuzzi Suite when they debut in September!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful anniversary trip”
Reviews.Author: Num1yankeefan
Reviews.Content: We recently traveled to Vegas for our 25th wedding anniversary and chose the Trop as we've always had fun there. I had heard they were renovating and didn't know quite what to expect but all I can say is we were completely blown away. They've taken a nice comfortable Strip hotel and made it a hip, classy elegant (yet still comfortable), Strip resort. The new Paradise Tower rooms are just beautiful, the beds remarkable, the bathrooms gorgeous, obviously I just can't say enough, (and trust me, we've stayed at just about every hotel on the Strip over the years). Highlighting our stay, though, was the customer service. From check in to check out I have never been treated better and by every single staff member we came in contact with. Front desk, pit boss, cocktail servers, dealers you name it, all acted as if our comfort and satisfaction was their personal responsibility and they took it very seriously. If there was even the slightest problem (which there wasn't), they wanted to personally solve it. If you're staying here, do yourself a favor and check out Legends Steak House for dinner. There aren't a lot of fairly priced top end restaurants left in Vegas with this high level of quality and service. All in all a perfect stay and kudos to Nicole Marshall for organizing a great on line presence and taking care of her customers as if we were her own.

Reviews.Title: “amazing value for money”
Reviews.Author: mattworrall
Reviews.Content: not sure why this place has got any negative comments... this is one of the cheapest priced hotels i could find, a cost of about £30 a night between 2!! thats £15 each a night!!!! for that price DO NOT expect everything to be like the bellagio! but the hotel is more than adequate, we stayed in 2 rooms, the first being 'ok', clean a bit dated, but we got upgraded for free when we asked for wifi, and the 2nd room was pretty good, bit more up to date, better air con, bit more spacious... the hotel has a nice pool area and plenty of sun loungers... room service was everyday replacing sheets and towels... plenty of slots, and a few blackjack tables... the restaurants were not great but fine for a quick bite... mentioned our flight wasnt until 5pm and they offered to give us late check out free which was nice... the only thing that was a dissappointment was the check inn, there was only 5 people in the queue but somehow took an hour to get served... but thats really the only negative i have to say about it... it is literally a 1 minute walk to MGM, i think its a great location on the strip, if your looking for a budget hotel i dont think you will be dissappointed with tropicana, happy holidaying!!

Reviews.Title: “The last time I stayed there the service...”
Reviews.Author: Finalevent41
Reviews.Content: The last time I stayed there the service was great and the room wa kind of old. Came back this week service is even better and the rooms were amazing, and the pool rocks!

Reviews.Title: “Must Have Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Jason49
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana hotel is now fully renovated, the rooms and main casino have a great beach feel. The rooms are full upgrades with great new beds, flat screens the works. The pool is awesome and all of the staff is really friendly. I had a way better hotel experience at the Trop then other hotels I have stayed at. Fully recommend it to anyone for any purpose, young couples and old.

Reviews.Title: “A VEGAS MUST STAY”
Reviews.Author: jeffrey014
Reviews.Content: I was blown away by the friendliest of the staff and the amazing renovations. I loved the new south beach theme, and especially the pool!!!! The casino staff were very accommodating, whether it was a dealer explaining specific rules at a craps table or quick drink service by the waitress - often times at casinos it takes a while to get a drink while gambling. I would fully recommend anyone visiting Vegas to stay here!!! GREAT WORK TROPICANA

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: lasvegasfan_10
Reviews.Content: I booked the Topicana for three nights in May, at check-in i was upgraded to from a garden room to the island tower, the staff were very friendly yes the room was dated, but I had a fantastic view of the strip, the price was great, and the pool was wonderful too. I checked out to moved to the hard rock where i had 5 nights booked, at the end of my stay i found out i would be delayed leaving las vegas for a few days so moved back to the trop as i preferred the service and location to the hard rock. Upon checking back in i was given a Spa suite in the Island tower, fantastic corner spa, one bedroom suite and a view of almost the entire strip.
