I was travelling stand by so stayed three nights, but had to book each one seperately on the day, and the front desk staff were incredibly accommodating, allowing me to stay in the suite each day with no problems. This was my third trip to vegas, and the 4th hotel i had stayed in and i found the staff to be the friendliest by far., and they all seemed very excited by the ongoing renovations which look great. The pool area and service was great, and i enjoyed dinner at Bacio. Planning on going back again in October, and the Trop is currently my first choice, especially given the renovations. Looking forward to trying the paradise rooms on my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Tropican Paradise Tower Suites are great”
Reviews.Author: TIALAURA
Reviews.Content: Signed up for players club- no line at all and the man who helped me was funny and very smart. When to check in around 10 am, and I was told by a wonderfull lady that my room was ready and it is a suite. I went to the room and opened the door and was met by a long hallway and a huge livingroom. The living room had a very comfortatable day bed and a table with 2 chairs and a chair and foot rest. I had a mini fridge and 2 long counters to put stuff on. The room had shutters on the windows and when I opened them I had a great view of the strip all the way down past Montecarlo. The bedroom had a nice comfortable bed, plenty of draw space and a large LG digital tv on the dresser. There were 2 night stand with the Ihome docking and alarm clock, the safe was behind the first door of the dresser. It was a nice size safe definatly bigger than the Wynns Tower suites safe. The bathroom is kind of small but the sink is a Kohler and the facets were cute. The tub/shower combo had a showerhead with different settings on it. All the staff I encountered were very polite and they show they truely want tio help you . The CW's at the pool and the casion floor were energetic and sweet, also the drink service was good. I was there over a holiday so I think a non holiday it would be great. I will return again as of June 19th to stay at the Tropicana. For people who like a lively and super clean hotel, this is for you. The prices are also good.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value, but not as glamorous as the others”
Reviews.Author: shadowsjc
Reviews.Content: Tropicana Las Vegas I stayed at the Tropicana this past week during my first trip to Las Vegas. I found a very good rate online, and a 3 night stay at the newly upgraded Paradise Tower came out to the same price at a “standard” room at other casinos, so I figured the decision was a no-brainer. Arrival: We took a cab in from the airport. Since this is a southern strip hotel, you should ask the cabbie not to take “the tunnel” to the hotel, since this way is longer and more expensive. We checked in with no problem; no major lines. The lobby was somewhat small but the process went by pretty quickly. Rooms: We stayed in the recently renovated Paradise Tower on the 18th floor; the room had great views of the Strip (Mandalay Bay, Luxor, NY NY, Excalibur). Bathroom was large w/ a tub; ample closet space; flat screen LG television. No fridge though, which was only a minor drawback. Overall the room was great, although not as luxurious as some of the Harrahs property rooms I’ve stayed at in Atlantic City (Caesars and Harrahs). Still, for the price paid, this was a great value. Casino: The casino was definitely a lot smaller than some of the other casinos I visited in Las Vegas. I’m not a big slot player so I don’t know how loose or tight they are. I found the casino to be adequate, with mostly $5 and up tables. Food: I only ate at the casino once, very late at night. There is a deli that’s open 24 hours which had $7 sandwiches; pretty filling and convenient. I believe this was the only late night option inside the casino. Pool: The pool appears to have been renovated recently. The outdoor area is very nice, and is filled with flowers and trees that provide a nice atmosphere. The pool itself is fairly large, and there were definitely plenty of seats available by the pool (contrasted with some other pools I visited in LV, which had almost no seats available). Water was kind of cold, though. Also the hot tub was separated from the main area, so it wasn’t as appealing to jump in. There was music blasting from the speakers, so if you’re expecting a nice dip or lounge by the pool, this wouldn’t be a good fit. Servers walked by regularly so you could order drinks without having to get up. There was an entire section walled off where more renovations were (I think) taking place. They didn’t affect the quality of our stay, however. Final thoughts: I’m not sure what the Trop was like before, although from some of the older reviews, it appears it was a pretty beaten up place. The Paradise Tower rooms are a huge step up, then, but no one will confuse these rooms with high end rooms at other locations. Similarly, the Trop itself pales in comparison to other LV casinos. However, at the right price, the Trop has a good option for large, clean and recently remodeled rooms. The remaining will be renovated by the end of the summer, giving you more options to stay at the Trop.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: saintWoodstock_MD
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana has gone through a great many renovations in the past year. The ownership has definitly infused a lot of money in upgrading the lobby and the Paradise Tower. The rooms are much more luxurious with a lot more upgrades than your standard room. Everything in the rooms have been completely redone. The pool area is definitely gives you the feel of a spa. I am looking forward to the additional changes in the pool area for next year 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly managed dump”
Reviews.Author: luandtom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old and in an advanced state of disrepair (the facade is crumbling, wall paper peels from the walls of the rooms and the bathrooms are moldy). However, its location on the strip might justify the hefty room cost if it was not so poorly managed. The pool area is attractive (nicely landscaped with a large pool) and might be a nice place to relax on a warm afternoon, except that the management’s policy is to blast jackhammer music in the outdoor area from 10AM to 6PM. How loud is it? Sufficiently loud so that I could not hear my wife banging on the door of our room when she inadvertently locked herself out. We had a room on a non-smoking floor, but the policy is lightly enforced (the people in the room next to ours smoked). Housekeeping is indifferent and it is difficult to find staff when you need a missing towel, glasses or ice bucket. Forget about calling the front desk to complain, they have minimal staff on duty and the telephone in the room doesn’t work anyway. We checked out a day early (we paid for three nights and stayed two) and changed our airline reservations (at an additional cost) to escape.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Returning!”
Reviews.Author: burnstad87
Reviews.Content: First off - When they say they are changing everything - They are! This resort is undergoing a major face lift and it will be amazing when it is done. Construction wise...There was NO noise at all while we were there Sun through Fri. We were lucky enough to stay in the new Paradise tower room, spend the money and get one of those rooms, you will not regret it! The pool - AMAZING, great drink service, sunlight at every corner. Casino staff was fast and friendly. From the moment you have the bell men opening the doors for you to the room attendant the staff is there to make sure you have a great stay! Trop has won over my business for all future trips to Vegas. Thanks for a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “best weekend ever !”
Reviews.Author: AllsmilesLA
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a weekend in Las Vegas and my experience at the Tropicana hotel was excellent ! We stayed in the newly renovated paradise tower and our room was amazing.... not to mention the halls smelled wonderful... like vanilla, which is nice compared to most other hotels in Vegas. The bed was heavenly ... I've never slept better. I was there with a friend and we both had a great time. We will definitively be staying at the Tropicana next time we're in Vegas !

Reviews.Title: “Come stay at the CSI suites”
Reviews.Author: DJWinVegas
Reviews.Content: I'm a Las Vegas resident. When friends and I attended a concert recently we thought to stay downtown rather than drive home after some fun. Splitting the cost of this room was the same as a cab home. We arrive and I was shocked to see that there was a renovation in progress. We'd heard rumors for years of the Trop struggling and that they were due for a Vegas-sized implosion. That could only benefit this property. We were issued a suite in the Garden Tower. Evidently no work has been done there. The room was dingy, and had a smell of mold or mildew. All furnishings were worn. The second bathroom was not clean and had a handprint stain (of some variety of DNA) on the rear of the door. The patio had pigeon droppings on it, and the cobwebs abound. We went off to the concert. On our return I walked past my vehicle in the lot. I didn't feel good after seeing the kooky teeners doing drugs parked next to me. Forget security, we were able to let ourselves in through the pool area with impedence. The elevator now sported two broken coctail glasses. On our return to the room we found out that the air conditioning did not work. The moth circling the lamps was just too much. Since we were both sober, it was time to cut our losses and we drove home to sleep in our own beds.

Reviews.Title: “A Major Player on the Strip!!!!”
Reviews.Author: johnalex5
Reviews.Content: Tropicana's motto right now is "We're Changing Everything." And they are. And they have. My wife and I stayed in a brand new refurbished and renovated room and wow, what an experience! Not only was the room extremely sexy and fun, but the hotel staff was incredibly friendly and generous. As the construction continues at the Tropicana, I can tell you that even now you will have a great experience (and cheaper rates) at this hotel! Furthermore, it is centrally located on Tropicana and LV Blvd. I highly recommend staying at the Tropicana (oh, and eating at Legends Restaurant!!!).

Reviews.Title: “Full Of Unpleasant Surprises!”
Reviews.Author: jba531
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just returned from one of our frequent trips to Las Vegas and were expecting to experience the Tropicana with its new facelift...we were very dissapointed and regret having to tell anyone considering a stay to wait until the renovations are completely done and management has had a chance to staff up and train its employees. Pulling into the construction zone, the bell staff waived us through and "around the corner" to park. Just exactly where that corner was, and how to get from there back to the check-in desk was left for us to figure out. No one was on hand to direct exactly where the entry was from their self park lots. Since we elected to reserve a new suite to experience the newly renovated rooms, we were under the impression they would be finished. While the suite was very large, clean, and new - it lacked the amenites the reservationist spoke of. The minibar was an empty refrigerator, and there was no local information of any kind in the room including a map or phonebook. Other unpleasant surprises: The construction trucks backing up each morning at 6am-we could only laugh because they managed to quit at 8am...doesn't anyone manage these sites? The swimming pool was pretty bad-filled with sand from their construction site just adjacent. No one mentioned this when we asked about their pool facilities. When we called down to the Front Desk and Concierege staff for general information how to gain internet access, and basic directions, both departments were rude and obnoxious. One male concierge actually hung up on us in the middle of a question. (Guess they were tired of being asked similar questions as the information wasn't available in the guestrooms.) The room service menu was extremely limited-folded in half piece of paper, and honestly, the living room furniture appeared to be missing cushions-no back on the sofa. We received a nice note under our door letting us know they were having "challanges" with their telephone systems and other areas of their overall operations but in general, we wish we had stayed somewhere-anywhere else. We will not return to the Tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service...will NEVER stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Rayzor99
Reviews.Content: I live in Michigan and visit Vegas frequently... just this year alone I have been there 10 times already this year. Anyways, I don't normally take the time to write reviews like this because I am a very busy person and usually nothing ever comes from writing them. I felt compelled to writing because the customer service was absolutely horrendous from my recent experence with Tropicana. Here is the long story short... I tried ordering room service and it took probably close to 20-25 minutes just for someone to pick up the phone and when someone FINALLY answered...was hung up on! I tried calling back a few more times but to no avail and gave up. I tried calling the front desk to make a complaint and that in itself took another 20-25 minutes before a manager answered. At that point, I told the manager to check me out of the hotel. I had two night complimentary there for the nights of 5/8 and 5/9. I've stayed at many of the hotels along the Strip and am tolerant to simple mistakes and/or misunderstandings, but my experience with them was completely unacceptable! Even though my room in their new tower was "free" I checked out after the first night because of this experience and ended up staying at the Palazzo hotel for the duration of my trip. I have standards and expectations in how I expect to be treated and their level of customer service was so far below standards. The only position thing that I can say is their new rooms are very nice and comfortable. It's just too bad that their customer is completely the opposite.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the new rooms, so clean and inviting.”
Reviews.Author: CaliladySD
Reviews.Content: We attempted to stay at your hotel in April of 2009 and were sent to Hooters because your hotel was completely booked. I was very dissapointed because it was my 30th birthday. I assumed we would have been transfered to a more comparable hotel. I wrote to you and explained out situation. I was quickly responded to and was offered a complimentary two night stay by Nicole Marshall. She has great customer service skills and has renewed my faith in corporate people. We decided to try out my birthday again and this time we were completely satisfied. Thanks you for giving us a new room to stay in and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Stay - May 9th thru May 15th, 2010”
Reviews.Author: DONSDTSTX
Reviews.Content: I had some resevations about staying at the Tropicana, but Nicole Marshall assured me that I need not worry about the renovations going on. She was right !! We stayed in the newly re-done Paradise Tower and it was well worth it. In fact we extended our stay another day. The only 2 negative things I have to say is that they need more casino floor room (kinda of small) I guess that will change though when the renovations are complete and there is not a coffee maker in the room. I can't say I liked having to get up and get dressed then go down 19 floors to pay $6.38 for 2 cups of coffee everyday, then go back up to the room !! Other than that i would recommend that anyone stay here. Hopefully we can make it back soon depending on how much the rooms and packages are going for in the future. One thing is for sure "VEGAS IS NOT CHEAP"..... if you stay for a full week. Thank You Nicole. Sorry, that i did not get a chance to meet you while there.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana is Awsome!”
Reviews.Author: JayneMarie86
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stay at the Tropicana twice a year. We were there May 9-13. Was so happy with the changes. Our rooms were beautiful! Clean! Modern! Totally brand new!!!! We played a lot of table games during our stay & just love the dealers (win or loss!) The pool renovations are terrific. Everything we had hoped for. We happend to be there right at the pool when they announced the new Nikki Beach coming next year. I can't wait. I highly recommend booking and enjoying what Tropicana has to offer. It's only getting better. We will be back in October, I am sure we will see a lot more changes. Thank you to the staff for a wonderful stay! PS We only left the casino one time during our stay! We simply didn't need to go any where else!

Reviews.Title: “Freaking Awesome”
Reviews.Author: jenniferrank
Reviews.Content: We are big Trop people and love the service that we get when we go to the Trop. From the person checking you in to the bartenders to even management, everyone just seems so nice and helpful. The hotel is under construction, but they still try to go above and beyond to make you feel comfortable while the changes are happening. You can tell that this is going to be the up and coming hotel. Make sure to get on to Facebook or Twitter if you can because Nicole who runs the site is amazing and she is a gem. I HIGHLY doubt you will find someone else like her at any of the other Large Vegas Hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Life is great at the "new" Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: nuzzja
Reviews.Content: Buddy and I met friends[ married couple] for a short but sweet stay at the Paradise Tower from 5/9-5/12. What a positive experiece in all respects beginning with a hassle free check in at noon. Rooms were brand new and impeccably clean and bright using burnt orange and cream color accents.Bathroom will meet any woman's expectations including decent water pressure. We were on the 9th floor. There was no evidence of current casino construction other than workers finishing polishing a small brand new section of the floor. Sports book has no racing options but a new SB will start construction very soon. Casino was plenty big and bright with many machines but only two craps tables but at least they had a $5 minimum as were their BJ and other table games. Their Deli is modest but excellent as is their coffee shop 'which serves Starbucks. Pool is fantastic and on 5/11 there was a big promo todoo announcing a partnership with Nikki Beach.It is part of the South Beach theme. You can use google for more info about them. Got real lucky playing Lucky Lemmings and Favorite Party[ sic] especially the latter as their bonus' were very profitable.If you play it do the max bet if possible. Parking was easy and convenient. Kudos to Nicole Marshall for making this trip happen.If you plan on staying at the Trop you should contact her to insure getting the best deal etc.I don't think that you you can get such great conditions at such an affordable rate.I hope that they will remain so in the future. We are already planning our next trip there. Feel free to contact me for additional info/questions. I agree with previous reviews that ALL staff were extremely pleasant and helpful.It appears that management has made customer satisfaction one of their top priorities.

Reviews.Title: “The return of a Las Vegas Gem”
Reviews.Author: villahills3
Reviews.Content: If u have not been to the Tropicana in awhile or even if u have never been there...IT IS now time to try it out. As someone who has seen the Trop from before the bad times to the BAD time and now it's rebirth, she is coming back strong. It does not even seem like the same place as the last time we were there....friendly casino cocktail waitress, there and ready to take care of your every request, excellent front desk service, and the most important part...NOT one person complained about working there...it is a friendly and enjoyable place to go and stay and play. Excellent location, wonderful food. And this is with most of the resort under some kind of remodel and reconstruction...come and check this Grand Lady of Vegas out....she is well worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay very much - thank you Tropicana!!!”
Reviews.Author: lisette_10
Reviews.Content: When I was searching for hotels in Vegas, we were on a very limited budget as we were visiting four different places in total over 3 weeks for our honeymoon. I went crazy looking at reviews for where would be a cheap but clean and safe place to stay. Well I was very pleased that on arriving at the Tropicana I was not dissapointed. When we arrived we were given a room that wasnt really what we had in mind (they are in the process of fixing up some of the rooms etc) so we called the front desk and with no problem at all they were understanding and upgraded us to a jacuzzi suite. They could have just turned around and said thats the room you paid for - but they didnt! The service they provided was really amazing, everyone who worked there is very polite and helpful. We did not encounter 1 person who was rude or unhelpful. I would like to point out we didnt pay much at all for the 3 nights we were in Vegas - so really we were not expecting much - but the Tropicana really did more than I ever expected, their hotel is clean (apart from what I assume is the old building which does smell of smoke - but like I said it is all being re-done - so next time I go it will look even better). When we booked it did say that they were doing works on the hotel and that the swimming pool would not be in use. But I believe it will be or probably is already because when we left the pool area looked amazing. And apart from this it just has a nice atmosphere - from the front desk to the ladies who clean the rooms are so helpful, polite and just really friendly - what more could you want from a hotel? This hotel is very close to the aiport - we paid about $10 for the cab. And it is right next to the MGM Grand, a few mins walk away from Luxor etc where you could go and have buffets. My advice is if you are on a budget you will need to bring some good walking shoes because the strip is really long, and theres so much to see and do. Catch a bus to Fremont if you want to see the light show- definetly worth it! So to conclude - Tropicana Resort - Hotel is well worth it in my view if you dont have ridiculous amounts of money to spend. We would go back there next time.

Reviews.Title: “New rooms are great!”
Reviews.Author: billystout
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days and I loved the new room. It was also the grand opening of the new pool, which was unbelievable. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Average rooms and ideal location for Las Vegas sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: HannahGotobed
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana is ideally situated for sightseeing on the Strip in Las Vegas, only a short walk away from all the other major hotels and casinos. The ground floor of the hotel is a Casino. Room service and taxis are very expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana has once again moved to the top of the Class in Vegas!!!”
Reviews.Author: Brady012
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed with the Trop 5/2 - 5/5. We had a blast! The hotel's remodel is amazing! From the marble floors, to the new carpets, to the new Paradise Tower rooms... We slept like a king and queen for 3 nights on that pillowtop mattress!! Honestly, the best night's sleep in a long time for us. The hotel is very classy and beautiful and the staff are very professional and go out of their way to open the door for you! The staff all seem upbeat and positive and all want to serve you as best they can. Well-done, Tropicana! And thank you to Nicole for all of your help with our reservation!! The only kicker was that on our last night there, we really wanted to play blackjack but all 3 $5 blackjack tables were all full. We were busy doing so many other things throughout the week that we didn't really have time to play on any other night. There was another couple also looking to play $5 blackjack that night, and a man from the pit declined their request to open another table for all of us to play. There were a few stragglers wandering around asking if anybody knew where there were more tables to play at. Maybe the dealers were short-staffed, who knows? We all thought that the hotel would want to open another table and let us all play, but oh well. My wife and I stood and waited at one table for more than an hour (it was fun to watch the particular table we were watching win as much as they were) but we finally had to call it a night. We were tempted to go next door to Hooter's for $3 blackjack, but were just too exhausted! Overall, this hotel is well-worth the trip! They have some of the closest rooms to the strip in the Paradise Tower. The day we left is when they were just putting the Tropicana sign up strip-side, as well as remodeling where the valet parking check-in area is. It looks like some of the glass and artwork (outdated) is being pulled from the ceiling. We can't express enough how much we love and always will enjoy the Tropicana hotel. Maybe it was a good thing we didn't gamble when we wanted to, but we both definitely felt that energy that the tables were "hot" that night. Nice touch playing the selection of music as well- upbeat, positive, makes you want to have a good time while gambling! We look forward to visiting the Trop again, especially when the entire remodel has been completed!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: gray49
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana Las Vegas was the venue for a recent conference that we held. The Tropicna treated us well. They are currently renovating all of the rooms and common areas. When it is finished it will be one of the nicest facilities on the Las Vegas Strip. The Tropicana Staff worked very hard to see that our experience was a good one. The conference facility was wonderful. I would recommend the facility for any group requiring space for a conference or meeting.

Reviews.Title: “never been a better hotel”
Reviews.Author: beenye
Reviews.Content: we stayed in Jan 2010 the hotel was being renovated.We didnt like our room and we wers movede immedeiatly.Fantastic offers service was second to none.We go twice a year and while trop is still standing we wont stay anywhere else.very good value for money.only hitch there was no kettle in room other than that cant fault it

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: Robyncicle
Reviews.Content: Recently had the pleasure of staying in the newly remodeled rooms of the Tropicana Las Vegas, with my sister. This was our first trip down to Las Vegas and we found the Tropicana amazing even with the renos going on. Honestly we didn't even notice that there was work being done during the day. Other than a little bit of construction noise when were coming out of the front entrance. The rooms was amazing! Good view of the strip, really clean and comfortable. The beds were awesome and I feel asleep as soon as my head hit the pillow. We really enjoyed the South Beach Deli! The food was teriffic and very resonalbly priced. Fast service too. I would totally recommend this hotel to a friend and I will definitely stay there again. I can't wait to see the Tropicana once all the renos are done!

Reviews.Title: “Would like to come IF we get a remodeled room!!!”
Reviews.Author: espressoSalem
Reviews.Content: Visited the Tropicana last month for 3 nights...This was my 10th time in Vegas having never stayed at this resort before. My friend and I were a bit apprehensive because of the age of the hotel but heard good things about the renovations. Well....we are planning another trip back to "Sin City" in September (hopefully with a larger group). Overall, our experience wasn't GREAT but it wasn't BAD either...somewhere in between. We were put in an old room and moved twice...the first one was filthy....the second one clean but very very outdated. We called the front desk asking for another switch to possibly a newly renovated room but were told none were available. Oh well, not in the room much when in Vegas anyhow...The hotel itself is very 'classic" Vegas and that why we booked it in the first place, kind of vintage. We will inquire to see if the pool is renovated and up and running by September and hopefully be guaranteed a new room before we make our decision as to whether to stay at the Tropicana in September or not. Overall....fairly decent for the $$$ and hopefully will be better was remodeling is complete.

Reviews.Title: “Tiffany of the Strip Gets an Update!”
Reviews.Author: cmsteffen
Reviews.Content: Recently had the pleasure of staying in the newly remodeled rooms of the Tropicana Las Vegas. I have always loved the Trop, and have been fearing for years that it was going to be on the demolition block. New ownership has steered the ship in the right direction, remodeling and renovating one of the oldest and nicest resorts on the Strip. The new rooms were great - South Beach style and colors. Great beds and fixtures. The bathroom upgrades were a huge improvement (some of the rooms had their original fixtures and were desperate for an upgrade). We also had a chance to dine at the newly remodeled Deli. The food was reasonably priced, and outstanding in quality. Added bonus: The room service prices were the same as the prices in the deli, which might make the Trop the best bang for your buck room service in all of Las Vegas! The Tropicana is undergoing a very significant remodel, and you should expect some construction noise and issues that you would expect while everything around you is in the process of changing (literally, signage, paint, and carpets changed in the three days that we were there). But keep in mind that these are temporary issues, and that the Trop will be one of the nicest and most affordable resorts on the Strip. If you are one that had been turned off by the disrepair or the cut cost attitude of the previous management, I would highly recommend giving the Trop a chance. If you are new to Vegas and are looking for a affordable resort that is in the middle of everything, the Trop is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, renovated and a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ButteryBiscuitBase
Reviews.Content: A bit improvement on new york new york. I also spent a night at south point which was equally as nice. Make sure you stay at the new rooms in the paradise tower and book through an online booking agency and you will get a deal for less then $50. Brand spanking new room, very clean, great decor, fantastic view of luxor and mandalay bay. Massive wide screen lcd tv. Friendly staff, pool being renovated so only small one open but it was fine for what we wanted. I think the main point about this place seems to be, stay at old cheapo rooms and you get what you pay for, spend a few quid more and book through an agency and get the new ones and you will be delighted!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Love This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tochance
Reviews.Content: The first time I stayed at the Tropicana was May 2006, I was in love with it. The Trop gave you the feeling of old Vegas and how things used to be. The price was great and the rooms to me were just perfect. I loved going down to play the slots and always seemed to win a little bit of money. The best part of the trip was that I got engaged, it was the best!! The whole time we were there we would hang out at the pool or in the casino. The location of the hotel in the perfect spot, you can take a walkway to the MGM or Excalibur. I have stayed there other times since then and have never had a problem. The stay was great every time as well. I have never felt more relaxed then when I stayed at the Tropicana! We have a group returning in May and I really want to stay at the Tropicana as we do have a reservation for a new room, I really hope that the pool will be open by then. I can't wait to hopefully stay again and come home to write all about the Fabulous Tropicana LV!

Reviews.Title: “Many better choices out there!”
Reviews.Author: Mommy2Tris
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Vegas a day earlier than expected so we decided to check out a different hotel before arriving at the Signature MGM. I did a quick search on-line while driving to Vegas and the Tropicana was one that was reasonably priced and showed it was recently renovated. The woman on the phone told me that we could get a room for 2 adults & 1 child for $50, which seemed very inexpensive. Now we know why! We arrived and found a nice lobby, still under renovations and were told that the room would be $70. I had just hung up w/them not 10 minutes before so they honored the quote of $50 which was nice. We drove around trying to find our entrance for a good 15 mins. The signs were not posted, possibly because of the renovations? Finally found our room located on the ground floor. It smelled musty & it looked like it had not been redecorated since 1950. It certainly was not the room the advertised in the picture on-line, not even close! But we figured for $50 we couldn't complain. So we changed clothes & headed out for dinner. When arriving back in our room we found a cockroach on the wall. I called the front desk & was told they would send someone over to kill the bug! NO thanks - if there is one there are probably many more so they offered to upgrade our room to a "suite" in the new building at no charge. So we packed up & headed to the newer building. This was not a suite however, just a typical hotel room. It still smelled like paint so we were hoping that the cockroaches had not found this building yet. This room was definitely much nicer but still not nearly as nice as other places in Vegas. Their was hair in the bathroom, both on the floor and in the shower when we first arrived. The decor was a step up from our basement room but still not very modernized. The bed was comfortable however and that was all we really needed. Just a decent place to rest for the night & then head over to the Signature MGM which was exactly what we were looking for. I would not recommend the Tropicana with all the other choices you have in Vegas. It does have a good location for walking around to see all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest Policy”
Reviews.Author: redhand
Reviews.Content: We booked here through Travelzoo which promised a room in the remodeled Paradise Tower, "subject to availability". At check in we were offered a Paradise Tower room at a supplement of 30 dollars per night. We advised the receptionist of the terms of our booking and were then told that no Paradise Tower rooms were available!! The room we were allocated had filthy windows, a badly stained sofa and a TV with very few channels and so old it might have been proudly displayed in the nearby Titanic Exhibition. We checked out after one night and were then asked to pay a resort fee even though the pool area is completely closed. Please don't give these dishonest people your hard earned money.

Reviews.Title: “Things are REALLY changing- Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: shila16
Reviews.Content: We checked in Friday, 4/16 for a two night stay. Nicole was FABULOUS and took great care of us. The new Paradise Tower rooms are awesome. Extremely clean, and comfortable. The in room safe and ipod dock (which works with an i-phone!) were great touches. The whole staff is peppy and in high spirits. I had great bar tenders, front desk staff, housekeeping etc. Renovations are obviously still underway and I can't wait til its all done. Special thank you again to Nicole who took great care of us and Fritz who assisted my brother in resolving an issue swiftly. If you're staying here you MUST upgrade to the new tower, must, must, must!

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing and pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: gregor1
Reviews.Content: I read some of the reviews after I booked with the Tropicana and I was somewhat concerned with my choice when I read the negative comments, however I was very pleased with the hotel - sure it is under renovations and needs some work, but I enjoyed the Garden Room as I could walk out to the small pool and had birds and trees outside my sliding door. The service was excellent- at no time in any of my 8 prior trips to Las Vegas did a doorman open the door for me, but it was a regular occurrence at the Tropicana. At check in, Maria was pleasant and accomodating, and the cleaning staff were friendly as well. Even the security guards directing traffic were pleasant and talkative. I am looking forward to staying at the Trop again when renos are complete

Reviews.Title: “i recommend it”
Reviews.Author: elula63
Reviews.Content: Even if there was a big rennovation going on in the hotel it didn't bother our hours of rest/ The hotel is in a very convenient location ,only some minutes walk from the most famous hotels in the Strip/ the room was clean and comfortable/ It's worth the price we paid/ The people at the reception were very helpful/ The show they give for free wasn't interesting at all /good luck

Reviews.Title: “1st trip to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ALLIGATOR9
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Vegas! Just a 2 night visit with my friend from Phoenix. We drove down to Vegas to reach in the night. Though Tropicana was almost at one end of the strip but nothing mattered. Ofcourse it was great to be near other fun hotels and Tropicana became a convenient place to sleep. The room was comfortable & big enough. Did not really use any of the services but for the price, it is a great place. After all who sleeps in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “No breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jurizzo
Reviews.Content: When me and my husband had been there the breakfast service had stopped. Just a few things were made in the restaurant, so we went to MGM mostly of the days. But the rooms were good, big and clean. The Cassino is not the best, mas ok. The location is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Not a chance I'll stay here ever”
Reviews.Author: MAR317
Reviews.Content: First thing with this hotel, when we were walking to the room it smelled musty. Next the room we got into hadn't even been cleaned. There was still dirty towels in the tub and the vanity in the bathroom hadn't been cleaned. Next the phone did not work. Then the TV and finallt the sliding door to the patio, did not lock. We see this pamphlet on the table saying "upgraded rooms coming in spring of 2010". We complained and they moved us rooms. Not to the "upgraded rooms" because they said they were full, just 1 room down. This was no better. The TV and phone did not work in this one as well. And the decor...yuck. But we were only going to be there for one night so we sucked it up and hit the strip. When we came back approximately 5 hours later we could not get into the room. The keys didn't work. Back down to the check in. They gave us 2 new keys...they didn't work....back downstairs to complain again. Finally they told us we'll give you a new upgraded room....this is now 2 am. The manager had to come and let us into our room so we could move to this new room. Upstairs we go. The securtiy officer took us to the wrong "tower" so he got us lost. We finally found where the correct "tower" was, which was not marked on any signs of how to get there. But we finally arrived in this new room....I honestly thought we were on some stupid TV show the way we were getting jerked around.

Reviews.Title: “Trop feels like home!!!”
Reviews.Author: bucky55987
Reviews.Content: The Trop is home to us. This is about the 20th year we have stayed there and we are so glad that it is being refurbished rather than being razed like the Frontier! Give it a chance---it is a phoenix rising from the grave! Glad that it is being given new life.

Reviews.Title: “Staff were fantastic”
Reviews.Author: shep19
Reviews.Content: We went to check into the hotel but they couldn't find our reservation. Jan the reservation clerk went out of her way to help us, excellent customer service. We had a garden view, they are in the middle of renovations, but it was still great. Rooms were clean & quiet. All the staff were helpful. Not a glitzy hotel, but very comfortable. Quiet elegance. Food in the snack bar was very good and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! What a Pleasant Surprise!"”
Reviews.Author: jgregBayArea
Reviews.Content: I have to say I came to the Tropicana only because my friends had booked there. It would not have been on my radar otherwise. I have stayed at several of the casinos, in fact I have stayed at all of them on your corner. I was shocked at how great the service was. We walked to many properties and you were the only ones that had someone actually open the door for us. Though the rooms were clean, I am definitely looking forward to seeing the new rooms, Cant wait to see what you do with the pool - I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovesvegasinwinter
Reviews.Content: The Trop is my preferred hotel. Its a value. Older hotel but the value offsets the age. Great staff. Been there about 4 times and am waiting in the airport for my flight today (March 30) and will be there around 3pm today and will write a new review after the stay is over. I have stayed at Hooters which I will only recommend to my enemies, Bellagio which is what it is...went there because I brought a date and Marriott which I have enough points to stay free for about a year but I still opt for the Trop. Maybe i am in a rut. Will let you know how it goes this stay. Only time to stay 2 nights. Never a bad stay there. Plus they are sprucing up the place. It will updated. Doing an Expedia stay this time which discounted the room to about 22 bucks. Now how can that be? Robert F.... South Carolina

Reviews.Title: “Needs work”
Reviews.Author: EGAD34
Reviews.Content: The staff was great. They were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is being remodeled and is a mess. The rooms need a great deal of work and were overpriced for how old and dirty they were. There was black mold in the bathroom tile grout in both of the rooms (I moved once). The casino seemed dirty and smoke filled. I would ask if the renoivations are complete if you are thinking of staying here. Compare the cost with Excalibur. Excalibur is on the same street corner and about the same price. Hooters now has a hotel which was basically next door and a better buy.

Reviews.Title: “i'd do it again”
Reviews.Author: msluv2vacation
Reviews.Content: it was a nice hotel...the attractions were great...although we did not get to stay very long...wanted to stay longer to see the Wynn, and shows, night life in Vegas....nice to visit...would not want to live there

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay and will like to return .”
Reviews.Author: happi2Toronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in Garden View standard room For price under $ 30 was worth it Some reviews said it was a long walk, but not far really .. good exercise . Save money and use it for fun..Extended stay and was upgraded to island Tower with a strip view. 18th flr What a difference!!! beautiful night time view. For a few dollars more it is better value Being south off the center strip area it was less crowded, but still good location for walking to busy strip Ceasar"s Palace area. We rented a car . Parking[convenient] is free there and in all casinos we visited. Car helped us to navigate the area which gave us a good overview. If you are on a budget and have a car you can drive west on Tropicana Ave for Smiths grocery.[24hrs] and pick up food. BBQ chicken $4.99 etc. If driving be careful... Police are everywhere and vigilant. Everyone at Tropicana was helpful and friendly Hotel is undergoing renovations , so be understanding . Good location. take the offers to attend presentation You might decide to commit , if not you get great gifts[ eg shows, dinner] to enjoy just by attending .

Reviews.Title: “So much fun”
Reviews.Author: AdammReilly
Reviews.Content: We had so much fun. When we registered, we were given discounted tickets to the Tropicana's Hypnosis Unleashed show, and had so much fun, we had to do it again the next night! Being right on the strip, we did a lot of walking and sight seeing. We couldn't even fit in every thing we wanted to see in our short time there. Would love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff, but the room left a bit to be desired”
Reviews.Author: DianefromPomona
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Island Tower area of the hotel. The 8th floor is suppose to have been a non-smoking floor, but room 882 just reeked of smoke. The maid said she would spray, and she did, but it did not last. We stayed there 3 nights and it was almost unbearable. The pillows were flat and hard as rocks. That being said, the hotel staff, especially at the front desk could not have been nicer. They were very professional and IF we had requested a different room, they probably would have complied, but we figured we were rarely in it, so why bother. By the third day, however, I really wish we had. My three star rating is due to them and the fact that I thought their "first time player's club" was quite generous, though I used it for the slots and did not understand that we should have gotten another card for my husband as we did not get any credit for all the money he spent on the tables..... My husband was not happy as one of the two exercise machines was out of order and the other was in use each time he went. It is a long walk to other sites as this is way at the end of the strip. If you like Hooters, its right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Suite”
Reviews.Author: hkeel
Reviews.Content: We chose the Tropical gardens for our wedding.It featured a waterfall and a tropical atmosphere. The chapel was nestled about the plants above the pool area with great background scenes for our pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap rates, but you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: TravisJ
Reviews.Content: When making me reservation I had a pretty good idea of what I was getting myself into after reading other reviews on Trip Advisor. I was able to book for $59.00 a night for a three night stay-so far so good. Upon check in the front desk lady was extremely helpful and fun, she needs a raise. We told her it was my father in law's 50th birthday and she gave us a few free drink tickets which was a nice touch. All of the staff I came into contact with was by far some of the friendliest most helpful people I have ever met. Now the bad. The room was exactly how most descrive on here, on it's last leg. The air didn't work, the tub did not drain, the tile was pretty gross with mold. The room smelled and just was over all unpleasant. With that said, with the price I got what do you expect. The casino only had maybe seven or so table games open at a time, so finding a seat was tough. We ended up gambling elsewhere for this reason so the Trop definitely lost out on some easy cash. So to summarize, if you are not going to be in your room for long (only to sleep and shower) and want to be on the strip I would say go for it. However, I will never stay again because I feel the extra money would be worth it to have a room that functions better. If the Trop comped me a room after the renovation was complete, I would probably give it another shot. I want a chance to win my $500 back I lost at three card poker anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Worst place I've ever been in!”
Reviews.Author: tyrissTHEoriginal
Reviews.Content: The room was NASTY to say the least. We asked for non-smoking and the room smelled strongly of smoke. There were NASTY NASTY stains on the bedspread...it looked like it had never been washed. I wouldnt even let my son down on the floor because it was so incredibly nasty. The carpet looked like it hadnt been swept let alone ever cleaned. I was appauled! We walked in, called the front desk, asked for a differnt room, which still WAS NOT up to any standard and then called for the bell hop to take our luggage down to the taxi that drove us across the street to the MGM Grand! I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND A DEAD PERSON STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana review”
Reviews.Author: goldwingltd85
Reviews.Content: we got put in the old part of the hotel,, and it was so crappy,, stains every where,, good thing we only used it to sleep,, Never go to Vegas on a holiday..

Reviews.Title: “Business Convention”
Reviews.Author: Cod3elf
Reviews.Content: Price was good as the convention was across the street. Room was okay; drink prices were way up from last visit to Vegas altho that seemed to be across the board at all casinos. Will stay again, just not quite as magical as before....

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: BruceT4
Reviews.Content: I had a nice relaxing stay and lost a minimal sum at the games.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SpringF
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many places in Vegas and this hotel is my favorite. It's on the strip but far enough down that you can sleep without being woke up by all the noise. It is also very reasonable in price with just as much to offer as the other places that are in the mist of the chaos.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JackL12
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really great. It had excellent service and the pool was really nice and would be a great place for children to play. However it is quite a walk to the rest of the strip because it is on the end of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly, old shabby”
Reviews.Author: Emma H
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at the tropicana! I'm not a snob I stay in hostals and very cheap motels all the time! This place is just horrid! It's smells stale and toilet like! Our room was big, but not nice got there and our shower didn't work it was hanging off the wall! The bath was sick and rusty! The hotel was under construction! But we were not told this when we booked! The staff don't give look enthusiastic about there jobs in the slightest and it shows! Basicaly don't stay here! and believe wats all these other reviews say because it's all true there awful rooms! Me and my boyfriend stayed here for the weekend(we had to) then moved to treasure island which is amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled when they offer a discount because of renovation.”
Reviews.Author: facs50
Reviews.Content: The rate wasn't low enough for the terrible conditions of this part of the hotel. They should completely close these rooms while the renovation is ongoing. I wouldn't stay there again if the room was free. The restaurant wasn't worth the price and the slots weren't paying out either. Overall experience: Bottom of the barrel and wouldn't consider the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “I'm sorry, but this place is a dump”
Reviews.Author: chickonamission
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for in Vegas I guess. There were no good deals this past weekend because it was Valentine's Day/President's Day weekend. We got our rooms for $103 a night. Pretty cheap, yes. Had I realized the hotel would be so shabby, we would have dug a bit deeper into our pockets, whether we could afford it or not. I'm no snob. I enjoy rustic. Don't need a pillow top mattress. What I do like is a shower that works properly and a bed that is comfortable. I got neither at the Tropicana. But the worse was the smell. The place smells. My husband titled the odor "1978" as in the last time the carpets were replaced. The good point about this place is that it is very centrally located. But save your money, go to Vegas on off weekends and splurge on a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice...”
Reviews.Author: SandyP2
Reviews.Content: Front desk was exceptionally nice. Was upgraded upon arrive to the "honeymoon suite". Older casino/hotel but still nice and right on the strip. Excellent views. Nice pools. Shows/ dinning/ entertainment/ casino all within steps from your room. Rooms were clean. Will stay again if ever back in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Love the ambiance!”
Reviews.Author: thefinest1970
Reviews.Content: I've always wanted to stay at the south end of the strip. Last year March 2009 for my birthday, I was really impressed with the courtesy the staff showed! I stayed at the Paradise Towers and I have to admit, it was a bit of a walk! I was given tickets to a magic show and the burlesque show. Very interesting! One of the staff members, Mr. Marion made my stay very enjoyable and I look forward to seeing the Tropicana in March! I'm staying there again in March 2010 for my birthday and I'm hoping to see some renovations!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: noircorvette
Reviews.Content: We were interested in going to Tropicana because it was historical, however, I did not expect that it would have curtains torn from the rings and the walls were so thin we could hear everything in the next room. The TV did not work, the carpets were stained, and the shower did not have enough pressure because it was broken. I know that there is a newer tower, but they need to work on the quality of their older rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Meh it was ok!”
Reviews.Author: CameronG2
Reviews.Content: I expected more. The pool was down and it was spring break it was a fun time but everything in Las Vegas is already overexpensive, and the pool being closed did not make me happy luckily i was in Hunington Beach days later.. Was very relived!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience I've ever had..!”
Reviews.Author: Rhea1983
Reviews.Content: I've decided to wait until I got back to Sydney to write this review because I was assured that I would recieve a response about my multiple complaints. It's been three weeks and still haven't recieved anything. I was travelling with my family (mum, dad, teenage brother, and older brother) and booked two rooms for three nights. We chose the Tropicana for the location and the price. We were checked in my Gerard and advised that there were no adjoining rooms; but were given room next door to each other. Made our way to our rooms and found them to be outdated and tired. The bathroom looked very old and had mould around the tub/shower. However, the linen and towels were clean. We decided to have lunch at the buffet (which for the price was very disappointing and had very little selection). On the way through, we realised that the place was being renovated which meant that the pool; business centre; and outdoor courtyard area was not available (so why am I paying the "resort fee?", I thought). We were later to find out that there WiFi was only available from the courtyard (which was closed for renovations) and the tower rooms; that the poker room was closed; that I had to pay to use the computer and for printing at the "business centre" (which was a computer in the VIP room as the original business centre was closed); and that the concierge is outsourced and knows not much about Las Vegas. We were also sent on a wild goose chase for a Bank of America. Gerard at the reception desk informed us that it was one mile away, by the time we had walked to the airport we realised that he might be wrong...in fact the bank was about four miles away. All this on the first day. To add to our woes, we were unable to make local or long-distance phone calls without going through the front desk because Gerard had not entered my credit card details into the computer despite the card being swiped twice when we checked in, and it being already charged the "resort fee". I found out late on the second day that three x 3-minute phone calls that we had made to LA, had cost us more than USD$30. By this stage, my patience had worn thin and I approached the front desk and spoke with the supervisor, Richard. I explained all the problems to Richard and the "best he could do" was to refund the "resort fee" on both rooms; he also used his computer to print out our boarding passes for our flights. With regards to the phone calls; not being made aware of renovations; and not being able to use the business centre he could only apologise. Furthermore, he suggested that I go and buy a phone card from the casino gift store if I "didn't want to incur excessive phone charges". Not suprisingly, the gift store hadn't sold phone cards for the past year. On our departure, we had to use the elevator to get all our bags to the car, and as luck would have it, the elevator was not working. We had to haul our bags down two flights of stairs at 5:30am. I was going to opt for an express check out but instead I went to the front desk to once again speak with a manager about her unsatisfactory stay at the Tropicana. I was told that a manager was unavailable until 7am, however Rose at the front desk was very understanding; wrote down all my complaints and assured me that a manager would contact me; or a letter would be sent to me with a response regarding my complaints. I'm still waiting. We were on a six week holiday through Canada and the USA; and I had been to Las Vegas and visited about 35 states in the USA and I can say without hesitation, that this is the WORST hotel experience I've ever had. I will never stay at the Tropicana again and I will never recommend the Tropicana to friends, families, colleagues or aquaintences. In fact, when I hear that someone is going to Las Vegas, I always warn them to stay away from the Tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “Love-Hate relationship”
Reviews.Author: recondo1019
Reviews.Content: To the new owners, When we stay at the Tropicana it's like coming home. We love the hotel and casino. I particularly like the balcony in the garden rooms. Our last visit, March 2009 was not as pleasant as usual. We were practically overrun with cockroaches during our stay. We shall be visiting you again this March and hope that the rooms are cleaner and bug-free. If not, I shall have to say goodbye to the Trop for good! Sincerely, David Flater david_flater@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Never again, no amenities and dirty”
Reviews.Author: Beachy50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tropicana in an Island Tower room for 4 nights. Room rate was great and customer front desk was great. We were only staying 2 nights but had to extend for 2 more due to weather. They were great about it. Not much else was too great about the Tropicana. They need more casual restaurants at a decent price. I know we haven't been to Vegas in a long time, but gone are the days of inexpensive food! A lot of construction going on, wish we had known about that. The room was "basic". Windows filthy, carpet filthy (yet they were always cleaning the walkway carpets), furniture was also very dirty. The bed was comfortable, but who knows when the bedspread was cleaned last! It was cold and rainy while we were there, but the heat worked very well. Maybe all the casino motels are the same in Vegas, but there was no coffee pot, fridge or microwave in the room. At least put a coffee maker in the room! To buy a cup of coffee is very expensive! Don't expect anything on the floor of the casino! There was one waitress having to work the entire casino one evening. So you don't have a chance to get anything to drink unless you go buy it. We did not eat in the buffet because we wondered what happens to ALL that food when they were not busy. We did eat Italian at that restaurant one night, it was good and expensive. My biggest problem was the lack of amenities and the filth of the room, there is no reason for that even if the place is remodeling.

Reviews.Title: “Always more than happy with the Trop, for many reasons!”
Reviews.Author: RReynofam
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the trop every summer for 10+ years, and have always been very happy there. Only once were we rather disappointed in the cleanliness. Every time we go, we are so glad we chose to stay there again, mostly because of the awesome adult pool where we can relax for hours on end. Love the location, close to the monorail and so much more. Staff is always very familiar to us and very friendly, in particular Fred, our favorite bartender of all time! However... we have reservations for July of 2010, and are somewhat concerned that the Island Towers will not be complete and the adult pool will be gone. Also taking the family vacation to Vegas this year in June unfortunately can't book the Trop right now, because of the lack of public information on the renovations. So sad.... More information is NEEDED!!!! Someone sneak in some photos while you are there... please. Post soon! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “To the new owners of the Tropicana”
Reviews.Author: RosamondRosamondguy
Reviews.Content: My last stay at the Tropicana was in 2007. I have stayed at the Tropicana on four occasions. All of my stays there have been enjoyable. I have always liked the Tropicana because of its tropical motif and its pleasant atmosphere, and of course, it has the nicest pool area in Vegas. I am looking forward to the new rooms and renovations. I plan on staying there again when the renovations are completed. Also, the Trop is located on the best corner of the Strip. See you soon.

Reviews.Title: “UNLV”
Reviews.Author: LinwoodH
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana is a good price but a little dated. The downstairs rooms are remniscent of a Days Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Trompe_Le_Monde
Reviews.Content: No, it is not fancy but the price and location can not be beat. Yes, the furnishings are dated but you didn't come to Vegas to sit in your room. For the price don't expect 1000 thread count sheets and designer chic. But the drinks are cheap (lots of comp drinks in the casino), the slots are loose and $5 minimum bet black jack tables. Plus, MGM, NY NY, Luxor and Mandalay Bay are a short walk away. Prefer the Paradise Tower as the Island Tower is a bit of schlep. The pool is fun, but again not the fanciest. Usually the place I stay if not a special occasion or work. Tends to be a long line at check in and expect to pay a small resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “decent value - great location”
Reviews.Author: marieatta_pman
Reviews.Content: this hotel is great for the right person. It is older, and the rooms are very definitely dated and worn. THe one i was in had a flyer with renovation plans upcoming. They were clean. You can get the rooms for a GREAT price - so the value is high if you are just looking for a place to crash. Location is a big plus at one of the best intersections in vegas, wtih MGM-excalibur-NYNY all across the street. very nice location to start a walk down the strip to many other properties. Very close to airport - only 10-15$ or so for cab ride

Reviews.Title: “Fun times in vegas”
Reviews.Author: robig17
Reviews.Content: great value for money hotel, clean big rooms, good service, good position, nothing bad to say!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a Bargain... Great Location.... Will be top notch real soon...”
Reviews.Author: 1coloradodude
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 5 lovely nights at the Trop . For $30 bucks a night it can't be beat. We had a real nice room in the Island Tower. The Buffet was fine, but not one of the top ones in Las Vegas. Having good coffee every morning at the coffee shop was a plus. We worked out at the Fitness center everyday. It is small but served our purpose. Our room was in the iland tower and was real nice. No complaints. Only complaints were Wireless Internet service was a little slow and didn't work 10% of the time. It may have just been our room location. It would of been nice if Pool area would have been open, but it was flagged off as a construction area. They have one of the top 5 pools in Las Vegas. Go in the summer, what a place. There is lots of construction going on and the Trop will be one of the top hotels again when all is complete. All rooms are being remodeled now.Their location on the strip can't be beat, The staff is super friendly and helpful. Nicole was a real gem and treated us really special. The Magic show was Great since it came free with the room. We are looking forward to our next trip to Las Vegas to stay at the Tropicana. If they don't raise the room rates much, It is going to be the best deal on the strip for the dollar. P.S. For what it is worth, I like the Miami theme that they are remodeling to. With that pool area it is going to be a hit, Hopefully the construction will be done by next winter and they can keep the pool area open year around. Wayne

Reviews.Title: “OMG-[--]”
Reviews.Author: DavidArroyo10
Reviews.Content: Staff is super friendly but the hotel is crap compared to other rooms on the strip. AC did not work [--]! Decent sized casino but got pissed when some chump dealer was throwing cards on the table and was screwing up the order he was supposed to deal cards. Whatever!

Reviews.Title: “spend the extra $50 and stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: pabstlover
Reviews.Content: Tip number one do not stay here if you are under the age of 70.Tip number two unless you a huge Miami vice fan you will not enjoy this hotel.Tip number three do not stay at the tropicana.I do not want to relive my trip to this hotel its old,it smells,and it is noisy all night long.Many people say it does not matter where you stay when you are in Las Vegas because you are never in the room but trust me spend the extra $50 and stay at new york new york or the mgm grand.

Reviews.Title: “Sure wish we had read reviews before staying here”
Reviews.Author: Myra44
Reviews.Content: Sure wish we had read reviews before booking here. Stayed one night on way to Laughlin and one night on way back from Laughlin 8 nighs later. I agree with all the negative reports, the place is a dump. The Garden Rooms are disgusting, including the halls and building, which we refused to stay in after booking on internet. Paid extra to stay in main hotel, handier and somewhat better, but would never stay in this place again. Read reviews before you book somewhere, I sure will. Don't care if they are remodelling or not,this is no excuse for dirt, and these type of reviews will surely have an effect on the place. Buffet was poor as well!

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana lost booking”
Reviews.Author: Alla_Bog
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, casino is oldschool and they couldn't find our booking when we arrived. They made it up to us by upgrading us to a better room and free show tickets. Book them as last minute deal as it works out super cheap

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and good”
Reviews.Author: Suzzli
Reviews.Content: The location is very good - just at the beginning of the strip ! Big bathrooms The rooms are very quiet - you can't hear other people

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on a perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: Veets54
Reviews.Content: We called in for a room during the 2009 Las Vegas Marathon and got a good deal as I was running it. When we checked in, the very friendly lady gave us a room in the Paradise Tower which was very close to the entrance. Coming back from the Marathon, this was very convenient. The room was clean and nicely decorated. You have your own safety locker, which is big enough to store your laptop too. We thought it was great value for the money and they are going to redo the rooms. I don't know why, to us they are just GREAT right now. Thanks for your good service and kindness during this great event which made our stay more satisfying.

Reviews.Title: “The Trop keeps the Old Vegas feel alive on the Strip...until next year.”
Reviews.Author: PortlandCB
Reviews.Content: We visited Vegas during the week of Thanksgiving '09 and overall found it to be a quality stay. The building is undergoing some renovations, and it should be looking quite different next year, which is a shame. Aside from the Sahara, there are few Strip resorts with the Old Vegas vibe. The ones that are still kickin' (Riviera, Circus Circus) don't strike me as anyplace I want to stay anytime soon due to some pretty bad reviews. The moment we checked in, we were treated wonderfully by Trop staff, most notably a front desk staff member by the name of Kimberlee who had been with the resort for several years. She was a great conversationalist and saw to it that we enjoyed our stay. The buffet was quite good, our Island Tower room was great, and I found the casino staff to be friendly. If you've never played at the Trop, the casino itself is rather small (generally only one open dice table at a time), but the table minimums are very reasonable, and besides, you're at the end of the Strip within walking distance of Excalibur, New York New York, MGM Grand, Luxor, and even the Hooters casino. Chances are you'll find a place you like. The only problem we experienced at the Trop was the morning the elevators decided to stop working- we ended up using the freight elevator with security, but it's a high-volume hotel. These things happen, and it really didn't bother us as much as it apparently did other people. One word of advice: go during spring-summer when the pool is open. It's still got one of the best pools in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jocelynnicole
Reviews.Content: The Tropicana was a great hotel to stay at. It is located on the northern end of the Strip across from the Excalibur, New York new York and the MGM. I enjoyed the fact that it wasn't right in the middle of the Strip amid all of the craziness, but still on the Strip. Parts of the hotel were under renovation while we were there, and the signs showing what the rooms would look like beginning Spring of 2010 showed rooms that were very modern and appealing. I'd definitely stay at the Tropicana again!

Reviews.Title: “Worse hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: KubiakAtlanta_GA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Trop in October. Room was called a "garden room". Checked in and took the elevator down! Room was on ground floor. Sliding glass door led to parking lot. Questioned my safety staying in this room. Oldest hotel room I have ever stayed in (and I have stayed in some seedy places). Beds were disgusting, slept with my clothes on. Bed was so old it sunk in the middle. Stains on mattresses. Mold in bathroom. Was upgraded the next day after I told them I would be checking out (was staying 2 nights in Vegas). Magic show at Trop is circa 1984. Buffet is good. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Simple & Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaSnow
Reviews.Content: The hotel is undergoing renovations which are sorely needed. My room was old & tired but clean and comfortable. I found the staff to be very friendly and accomodating, which is worth more to me than having a dozen restaurants. Really, you can only eat at one at a time anyway. Nobody goes to Vegas to stay put in their own hotel anyway. You can find foods, shopping, parties, clubs and entertainment just a short walk for anywhere The magic show with Dirk Arthur was great, the shops were nice. Overall the hotel was simple & pleasant, a nice place to go back to after the flash & hustle of everywhere else on the strip. The only thing I didn't like was no coffee maker in the room, but that seems to be a common thing in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “We had a blast for our 25th wedding anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: TheSopranos
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Island Tower, which had a big room with a great view of the strip. The shows were excellent. Extreme Magic, Hypnosis Unleashed and the incredibly fun and entertaining Soprano's Dinner were all right there! My husband even got to be the new Mob Boss! We had an easy walk to the MGM and NY NY. The gardens and pool were beautiful and it was fun to lay out in the sun in the relaxed, easy going atmosphere. The buffet was good, and the Lobster dinner deal was delicious. Great sandwiches at the Player's Deli. Enjoyed shopping at the Trop Shops, lots of variety! The staff was friendly and ready to help. Room service wasn't so good. Otherwise it was a great deal if you like a relaxed atmosphere and some old time Vegas charm!

Reviews.Title: “The Tropi-ghetto”
Reviews.Author: sawii
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Tropicana because of the great price for the location and because the pictures online didn't look too bad. I purposely didn't check here for reviews because I didn't want to know why it was so cheap. I'm giving the Tropighetto 3-stars because the staff was helpful (our big group all got moved together to the nicest tower at no cost), the price is awesome for the location, and the pool was pretty good (not crowded and easy to bring in friends not staying at the hotel). It wasn't too dirty, but everything you read about the need for an update is true. I just hope the update doesn't take away the kitch, just cleans/fixes the place up.

Reviews.Title: “Better Off Sleeping On A Park Bench”
Reviews.Author: BOJOWILLIAM
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were Staying at the Monte Carlo and booked a room at the Tropicana for our Daughter & Son-In-Law and 2 children to stay for just 1 night so they can visit us during our stay in Las Vegas.When they arrived they were given a Garden room which looked great on the website photos (Which were probably taken when they were first constructed).The rooms were dirty and the garden view was an alley way behind the hotel.I immediately contacted the hotel and they were moved to the Tower rooms which were not too much better.This casino hotel needs to be updated and given a complete makeover before the Board of Health shuts them down.My wife and I felt so bad that we didn't get them a room in the Monte Carlo or any other casino hotel on the strip.If your looking for a good stay at a good price go somewhere else and stay away from this dump....yes dump......

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: bratty477
Reviews.Content: The nice thing about this casino was that it was in a good location. They also had a nice pool and an arcade area fun for kids and adults. However, I felt the facility was not as well ventilated and "smoke free" in smoke free areas like some of the other casinos. Also, the tiles in the bathroom were practically falling apart on one part of the tub.

Reviews.Title: “Oldie but goodie”
Reviews.Author: yonk0015
Reviews.Content: If you are simply looking for a place to sleep this is a great hotel. Cozy, comfortable and quiet!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Waligirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an older one that really needs some updates but the room was clean and everyone at the hotel were friendly and helpful, good service too. The pool was great, lots of tropical ambiance...I would go back there if I was looking for a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Pool, Nice Staff, New Owners!”
Reviews.Author: gailslist
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the price here compared to the others, the pool is fabulous and open all night, nice jacuzzi inside a cave too, 24 hr buffet but it needs to be revamped, new owners are in process of updating entire hotel! The bell mgr and staff are so so nice and will do whatever it takes to make your stay enjoyable, stay in tower room elevator is near bell desk, across from elevator is a bar where a nice lady serves coffee early in the morning, my room was very nice with a view of the strip stay on 22nd floor, they found me an electric chair to rent due to walking problem, it was great! and just outside hotel is the bus stop $7 for 24 hour pass goes up and down the strip, also free shuttle outside to Orleans and other hotels, plus free monorail outside to 3 hotels, wayne brady is filming the price is right there and it's free to go and be a contestant, it was a very enjoyable stay because of the great bell manager and staff, thanks you guys!!

Reviews.Title: “WOW What a view, Great Pool, Staff and more.......Xtreme Magic What more do you want in vacation!”
Reviews.Author: CajunKing
Reviews.Content: I want to start off by saying: We are not special people and just researched more than our last trip 8 years ago to Vegas in the Summer. It was so hot we could have boiled crawfish in a pot outside the hotel with no fire under it......we timed this trip for the real fun of vegas and Tropicana. We just return from a great trip to the Tropicana...Get a fantastic deal during the construction peroid and speical times.. Call Gloria and Get the Ultimate Cool Deal while it last. They are starting a renovation and the pictures are in the VIP Lounge. My wife and I stayed in an Island room to have easy access to the pool area they gave us tickets to the Best Majic I have ever seen. Great Moments in Magic” Xtreme Magic starring Dirk Arthur"hen we went outside and they were trying out a new Salsa Band and Dance Group. They were fanstastic. The coupon book from the player club has great things for the hotel. We also took in two more shows Fab 4 and V the Varity Show for 1/2 off. This was just like an all inclusive in Cancun. All the Staff are great! They help you and more. My wife left her sweater jacket on a chair one morning. Security had it wrapped and tagged. We knew the server in the area and gaming clerk and tipped them both. I never went thirsty- Cold water and juice for my wife and cold beer plus premium liquor form me. Everyone is so friendly to help. Got to see all the contestant for Let Make a Deal.. We did get an invitation to be in the audiance as a non contestant but had to much to see in three days. We would go in from the pool area to the restrooms and enjoy watching the contestants getting pumped up>>>>>>>>>>I thought it was Mardi Gras in Houma/New Orleans I did not get the same treatment in the other mega casinos. In a day the staff all around knew our faces and helped us always. Take the taxi it is easier and less than the shuttles...plus you can leave and go back to the Airport on your schedule. Thanks to Jake we knew just what to do....the 7 dollar a day ride anywhere ticket is great. Jake can tell you where to catch and how to pay. We were early they checked our bags at the door and we came back once then our room was ready. Gloria said we would be happy with our view and WOW. We could have had a room when we arrived but were told just wait a liitle while and enjoy. They were right and waiting was enjoyable! Guess what! This our second time to Vegas and we won at the slots with the free startup monies. I also learned how to play Blackjack at $1 days at Shara and won there also. I should buy a lotto ticket quick in Texas and Louisiana. I View: The view from 1683 was fantastic.. WIW all night long Pool: Five acre tropical island with waterfalls, adult area, birds, flowers, spas and much more. Music was great and the pool staff was very helpful. Plenty of lounge chairs and towels. Just ask and you recieve. Buffet: Eat for 24 hours for 24 bucks not per day as other places. Arrive early got buffet and then joined Tropicana club. Great Prme Rib, Different fish every meal, Shrimp etc. All kind of desserts-Sugar Free. The best pies and good cold milk. The tea is fanstastic. The chefs are friendly and all the buffet (The 3 Joses are great) They evern made a special Big Cajun Omlette for us and brought to our table with our fantastic pool view! How is this for personal service. Treat people well and you will recieve in life! Room: Very Clean and cooooooold. They put extra towels and bath mats. Big corner Shower and real bamboo furniture. ( Not the Laminate stuff) Gaming: Had a blast and got the see all the fun of the Lets Make a Deal. Just like Mardi Gras... Shows: Fantastic I travel all the time for business and like to go someplace for holiday where the staff makes it enjoyable . Remember my wifes and I glass is always half full due to good planning and no surprises.

Reviews.Title: “Good deals and pleasant staff, but old and stinking rooms”
Reviews.Author: Toldnaes
Reviews.Content: Tropicana is old and should have been closed for renovation long time ago. You might be kept awake at night by tellys and guests. The staff did their best to make our stay comfortable, but I hope that most people avoid this hotel, so they can close for renovation. They were due in the late 80's.

HotelInfo.Name: Tropicana Las Vegas
HotelInfo.Address: 3801 Las Vegas Blvd South, Las Vegas, NV 89109
